reviews.author: Monjan M.
reviews.description: Drake is the gfbtoat or the "greatest fucking bartender of all time"  makes great drinks,  good conversation and makes the devils river that much better.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Remarkable whiskey; however, the server was quite hostile. I enjoyed the 1920s era vibe and the distillery architecture is quite fascinating. If you see my photos, you will notice a lipstick stain or an unknown stain which was quite alarming, on the rim of the glass.. Not sure if it was put there to add some color to the glass or if my glass was not entirely washed throughly. With Covid still around this was absolutely absurd.

reviews.author: Tenecqua D.
reviews.description: I happened upon this gem by chance. I headed downtown with another destination in mind but while parking my car I heard a jazz band playing. At that moment I decided to give Devils River Distillery a try. There is outdoor seating but I decided to sit inside, in a spot where I could still hear the music but where it wasn't loud too loud to have a conversation. You had to go to the bar to order drinks. They had a menu of mixed drinks using Devils River of course. There is also the option to do whiskey flights or tastings. I decided on the Rasmanian Devil. A drink with whiskey, raspberry and lemon. This drink was very refreshing. Next time I'll be game to do a tasting. The ambiance was cool and I met a cool couple while chillin. I'll definitely be back and bring some friends.

reviews.author: Robert M.
reviews.description: Gotta Say... this place is a must go to. Clayton was super chill and the vibe here is great. Had several drinks and each was better than the next. If your in town please stop in and show your appreciation for a local spot.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: I've walked past this place many times and I never walked inside. I was missing out on a gem. They serve whiskey and cocktails. The coffee whiskey was delicious and the bar tender was very friendly. The decor of the place is super nice and you must check out the basement when you are there. This is a hidden gem and more people need to stop by for a drink.

reviews.author: Marne D.
reviews.description: So excited!! Acoustic 57 is playing hope they are inside tonight. Heading down there soon. looking forward to hearing this group again, awesome. Good to have some family joining us on this Thanksgiving weekend

reviews.author: Jill S.
reviews.description: Great whiskey, so smooth and the bartender was super friendly and knowledgeable.  Try the boulevard flight! Nice relaxing atmosphere.

reviews.author: Tara R.
reviews.description: Shout out to John and Adrian who hooked me up with a coffee flavored whiskey that was delicious.  They are fantastic bartenders! SUPER nice and friendly!  Great atmosphere.  Great whiskey flights and all around great place to chill and relax!

reviews.author: Ron F.
reviews.description: While visiting San Antonio , Riverwalk, we came across Devils River . WOW what a fun find. That night they had Nathan Bibano a electric violin player who was fantastic. He played so many fun tunes people were stopping and listening as they walked by.   As we walked into Devils River we were greeted by Adrian. He talked to us at length about the Distillery and its process. It was different from the ones we had seen and visited at the Kentucky Bourbon Festival. So it intrigued us.   We decided to try the tastings and started off with The Devils Alley which was Devils River Bourbon, Devils River Rye, and Devils River Coffee Bourbon which my wife really enjoyed too. Next we tried the Devils Boulevard which included Devils River Barrel Strength, Devils River Single Barrel, Devils River Distillers Select.  My wife also had a mixed bourbon coffee drink and loved it along with tasting some of my smooth milder Devils Bourbons.   All had its own flavors, from mild to okay that got our attention and YES we have some favorites.. but will leave that to you as everyone has different likes and dislikes for various reasons.. and YES we have well over 2 dozen Bourbons and Scotches in our home bar.    Kudos to JON, Adrian and Muldin for a great night and properly humidified cigar!  Also one of the owners and his wife stopped in to check on what was happening.. great to meet them too!  You now have a fan of your Devils Bourbon as told to you that night.. I already passed it on to our bourbon group.. in Florida and Georgia!     Please do not sell out to the big guys or China Corps as others have and ruin a good thing!

reviews.author: Andrea U.
reviews.description: We stopped by on a Sunday afternoon and were greeted by Adrian. He was very friendly and knowledgeable about the whiskey and distillation process. He made sure we got a tour of the facility and explained each whiskey and drinks of our choice. Overall, Adrian made us feel welcome and gave us a great whiskey experience. Make sure to check it out if you are visiting San Antonio or are a local! Beautiful building, great ambiance, awesome drinks.

reviews.author: Sergio M.
reviews.description: I came here during the first weeks of opening and was one of the few Hispanic people here with my buddy and manager was very rude to non-whites.  I've had multiple people already have the same story. no one is in line and he's having conversations with other employees right in front of us and doesn't even greet us or acknowledge us until he felt like it. Oh this place has very little variety of drinks and really is never busy doesn't seem like they can get their foot off the ground

reviews.author: Paul G.
reviews.description: This place is AWESOME!! Great variety of drinks. Adrian and John are absolutely amazing and knowledgeable. Ask for them, you won't be sorry!!

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: All around best distillery in town. Whiskey itself is still second to Ranger Creek, but Devils River is still great and has an awesome location, with a cool inside, great patio and advertised rooftop patio that I didn't check out.  They off mixed drinks and had a frozen slushy coffee whiskey as well.  I did a flight of the high proof and it was fantastic!  We sat outside and it is on Houston St but has more privacy than some spots and is totally out of the sun.  This isn't a sports bar type place or dance club but has a comfortable laid back vibe.  I definitely plan to return.

reviews.author: Jose V.
reviews.description: This place is pretty good. But we ordered a sandwich and it took for ever.  Drinks are great. But if you want food be ready to wait.

reviews.author: Margie D.
reviews.description: This was such a great afternoon!! John gave us an amazing tour and Adrian was the master of the old fashion!! Best I have ever had!! Enjoyed and will be back soon!!

reviews.author: Justin S.
reviews.description: Amazing whiskeys and bourbons.  Do yourself a favor and come check out an amazing texas distillery.

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: VERY BEST service!!! The bar tender was extremely knowledgeable, kind, hospitable, he is a great rep for your company. The whiskey was outstanding, his talent in mixology was phenomenal! Best experience thus far in our visit to San Antonio!!!

reviews.author: Tim G.
reviews.description: Great cigar whiskey bar. Awesome workers. Great whiskey. Absolutely no questions asked will spend my nights smoking cigars and drinking their whiskey on the rocks. But they have mixed whiskey drinks

reviews.author: E L.
reviews.description: Just in SA for the weekend and stumbled upon this place. Fantastic place! Such a classy, but all welcoming environment. Adrian is a great bartender! Fabulous whiskey and definitely one of my favorite old fashioneds. Also, the distillers reserve is one of the best I've had in a long time! If you like good whiskey come here!

reviews.author: Sarah D.
reviews.description: They opened for us specially because we could only come on a Saturday. Noel is very nice and knowledgeable. We enjoyed talking with him. Their products are excellent!  The gin doesn't even need to be mixed with anything it has such a good flavor. I never would have thought I would have said that about gin.

reviews.author: ken r.
reviews.description: This is the first time I have had a chance to taste " the black label" and it was delicious. Not sweet but a real bourbon flavor. It is a fair replacement for the " balcones red label" at half the price.

reviews.author: Walt N.
reviews.description: Made reservations for a Saturday night dinner during the Christmas rush.  We had never been and had never heard anything about it - we decided based on their menu.  We are very glad we chose to eat here - we split the Tomahawk and was very pleased with the cut and preparation of the meat.  It could have used a bit more seasoning for my taste, but overall it was excellent.  The Old Fashions were some of the best tasting I ever had.  Top notch dinner!!

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: Don't freak out. It's only 4 stars because I didn't have the time or chance to really explore this distillery.   But the staff was super bubbly when we walked in and gave us their attention immediately. They gave us a quick background on the distillery and escorted us upstairs to the bar/tasting room.   We sat at the bar and enjoyed a smoked bourbon old fashioned and a bourbon straight. We also had some fries, wings, and the charcuterie plate. I'd probably skip on the charcuterie plate next time unless you really need some quick bar snack bites. The wings were amazing though.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: While furloughed during the summer of 2020 I would walk around the downtown area of San Antonio. I had passed Maverick Whiskey multiple times when they were only selling hand sanitizer. The place looked cool.   I was downtown for The Monkees show. I wanted to stop by for a drink. The bartenders were very friendly and talented. They had a few unique drink options. The got one of both old fashioned cocktails they had on their drink menu. They were both great. The guys to the right of me were raving about the food especially the fries.   I had to order the fries and they were $11. They had a nice cheese sauce,bacon and a runny egg on top. The fries were super tasty. I will recommend them to everyone. I am looking forward to trying more menu items in the future. I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Krissi L.
reviews.description: The ribeye and potatoes were both amazing. The "Draw me like your French girls" drink was very good, and the bar manager and bartenders were super friendly and nice! People sitting at the bar struck up conversation with each other, it was such a nice vibe. Definitely would recommend and will come back if I'm ever back this way for work.  (Wasn't very crowded when I went in on a Thursday evening)

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Cool little spot to grab a drink or learn some things about whiskey. The kitchen didn't open till 530 so we were stuck with some appetizers, menu it's not real expansive so basic meat which is fine. Dining space is a little tight and can get loud depending on the crowd but overall a cool spot

reviews.author: Russell F.
reviews.description: Amazing drinks and the food was good too. Enjoyed the Old Fashioned and it was on of the best I've had. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I tried such perfectly cooked steak here and a delicious Old-fashioned. I will definitely return for their whiskey flight, which is an amazing deal.   The staff is amazing! I forgot my debit card and they had already turned it in downstairs with the hostess, before I even made it back. I will most definitely be back.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: We celebrated a birthday here with dinner and drinks. We reserved a table and were seated immediately when we arrived. The dining area is upstairs. It's small, but the tables are spaced nicely. It wasn't too busy when we went.   We had tastings for their spirits and beer. Both excellent. $10 spirit flights are the way to go. We did try cocktails. Their old fashioned was on point. I love their little extras like the ice cube with their symbol.    Food was good too. We shared a pretzel, fried goat cheese, deviled eggs and cauliflower. For my main meal I had the smoked salmon nachos. They were delicious. The majority of the table got the bone in rib eye and were all happy with it.   Staff was friendly.   They don't have parking, but you can find nearby parking garages.

reviews.author: Will D.
reviews.description: Awesome atmosphere, cool story. Local whiskey distillery and restaurant near the Riverwalk. All whiskey is distilled in the old bank building with restaurant upstairs. The food was quite good - I got the mesquite pork Ribs. They were not traditional ribs, but they were smoked well and were tender. I thought the fries were excellent. The whiskey flight was a cheap and fun experience. Only $10 for a 4 drink flight. Probably equaled about 2 drinks.   I'll go back to try it again and maybe get an actual tour.   The women at the front door were fun and had a great attitude. Service was a little slow, but I had good company so it wasn't as big a deal.

reviews.author: Nghi T.
reviews.description: We thoroughly enjoyed our experience here. We did the tour which lasted about an hour and a half and had dinner at the restaurant as well. The service was exceptional and everyone were very friendly and welcoming.  Our tour guide, Nicole, was fun, engaging and knowledgeable. The uniqueness of Maverick lies within its rich history and dyanmic cultural narratives surrounding the family and the area, so the tour is a must if you want to fully appreciate the experience! At the end of the tour, we tasted a few of their spirits and their straight bourbon whiskey. This whiskey has a lighter note to it and very smooth. My friend prefered the Alamo whiskey which has a bolder taste.   We also got a chance to hear some spooky ghost stories from Dan, the manager. "Spirits and spirits" ;)   The restaurant is upstairs with an elegant atmosphere and a view of the distillery on the side. The deviled eggs were okay but did not leave a strong impression. But their baby back ribs totally made up for it. The tender, juicy BBQ ribs combined with cripsy fries offered an amazingly satisfying taste. Their shrimp scampi is just as delicious, flavorful and cooked just right. The whiskey ice cream sweetly concluded our delightful evening there. We'll definitely recommend Maverick to everyone!

reviews.author: Paul S.
reviews.description: This is a cool place, almost hipster/ATX like.  Enjoyed the food and the whiskey sampler.  Ended up buying a bottle to bring home.  The atmosphere is made even better with the nice materials they used to finish they place out in.  We enjoyed it so much and I just can't wait to go back!

reviews.author: Kristen S.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! We stopped in today with family visiting from out of town just to check it out, as it was one of few distilleries in the area open at 2pm. The bartender (I missed his name) was AMAZING! He was super helpful and knowledgeable about all the whiskeys, brandys, gins, etc. The tasting flight was reasonably priced and decent pours. Great low key atmosphere and nice laid back environment. Highly recommend and definitely will be back!

reviews.author: Michelle T.
reviews.description: Great service, food and drinks!  Cute place with history. The salmon nachos are full of flavor. Fried goat cheese is a must!

reviews.author: Brad B.
reviews.description: Went here for drinks and the tour and had an awesome time.  Their craft cocktails are fantastic.  We tried all their in house hooch on the tour and it was all great the whiskey is very flavorful with just a little burn.  The white rum was smooth as hell.  This isn't an especially cheap place for drinks and they are made to order so not super fast but it was a special occasion and I wasn't looking for frosty marg at chili's.   The tour was super fun.  They tell you from the get go it is more about the history of Sam Maverick than the process of making whiskey and I love Texas history so it was a lot of fun.    Pay attention because the more you remember the bigger the tasting samples!

reviews.author: Martin N.
reviews.description: Ambiance is stale, brightly lit, and awkwardly quiet without even background music. The waitress pretended they were out of the sirloin to try and upswell us on the $125 bone-in steak when we saw the table after us order several.  Also what genius decided to put a table right in between doors of the male and female bathrooms and seat costumers there when there are plenty of other open tables. The butter they eventually served us was delicious, it came with a side of poor quality steak.

reviews.author: Yulia Z.
reviews.description: Maverick charcuterie was great, but salmon nachos were exceptional. The rib eye steak came with no sides, but was cooked to perfection and so flavorful. The whiskey tasting flight is poured very generously. Absolutely loved this place and would recommend to anyone.

reviews.author: chris d.
reviews.description: Very cool unique whiskey / tapas type establishment with a very cool staff and delicious plates of deviled-eggs, salmon nachos and cauliflower nuggets. Dude made 2 awesome Old-Fashioned cocktails. I wasn't stuffed so a great way to start the evening for date night

reviews.author: Sergio T.
reviews.description: Great service and appetizers were amazing.. salmon nachos are a must..  also tried their dirty martini and "light" whiskey which is my new favorite.

reviews.author: Christian M.
reviews.description: If you are looking for good drinks, a whiskey distillery, with an old historic feel, this is a great little hideaway that is worth ducking into.  There is some small food plates too.  After eating way too much the past couple days along the Riverwalk, I just wanted something different.  I ordered a whiskey flight and a salad, and it was perfect.  I stopped at the front and bought my favorite whiskey from the flight.  Great night!

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: Came here on a Friday night with my partner. We were greeted immediately and went up to the dining room. We sat at the bar - which only had two chairs due to social distancing protocol - and it felt so nice to feel normal for a few hours!   The flights were great and I think a great price at $10 each. The tequila is so interesting and doesn't really taste like tequila - I really recommend it. We also had two cocktails, he had the old fashioned and I had the maverick margarita. Hands down one of the best, if not the best, margaritas I've ever had. No cloying sweetness, super fresh tasting.   Onto the food: it was all fantastic. The cauliflower was perfectly cooked and the Mac and cheese really hit the spot. My partner had the burger and he really enjoyed it. I snuck some of his fries and they were incredible.   Definitely give this place a shot, the bartender was very personable and the food is so delicious. I was also pleasantly surprised at the prices. I was a little sad that they didn't seem crowded on a Friday, though it may be because of covid and restrictions on number of people.

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: DorÄ‡ol Distilling is by far my favorite distillery in San Antonio! They are known for their award winning Rakia, which is a handcrafted apricot brandy. With this exquisite spirit, they create amazing and very refreshing cocktails perfect for our crazy Texas weather. If you are more of a beer drinker, they also brew HighWheel beer. My two favorite are HighWheel SA Hefe and HighWheel Betty.  During COVID-19, they have remained closed to the public but they offer curbside pick-up on all of their products; Rakia and beer. If you don't know how to prepare cocktails with Rakia, don't you worry! They have the recipes for all of their cocktails online. They also have a few cocktail making videos on their social channels, which are super helpful.   If you love beer and brandy, make sure to support local and check out this amazing distillery/brewery!

reviews.author: Raechel T.
reviews.description: It's been easy to tell that the crew at DorÄ‡ol has been working their butts off.  Dealing with COVID hasn't been easy, but they've been creative and been able to keep their staff.  I prefer to make a stop here instead of buying at HEB.  Nothing wrong with HEB, but it's nice to also buy some Rakia or something else they've been working on. Their outdoor area is nice so you won't have to worry about being close to others.  If you're bar hopping, you should definitely stop here.

reviews.author: Bryan B.
reviews.description: Very cool bar, the apricot liquor is pretty interesting to see, and their artistic spin on classic cocktails, aren't too bad either. I enjoyed an Ole' Fashioned; and it was made particularly well. A small quaint place off Flores, it's tight on the inside, but they have a decent amount of patio space. Parking isn't too bad either if you don't mind parallel.

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: Sigh. SIGH. SIIIIIIIIGH. What an amazing spot.  Our wonderful, fantastic, stupendous Yelp CM's open fare-thee-well was hosted here, and there was SoFlo Pizza to be had, drink tickets for Elite Yelpers, and overall just a fantastic night to rub elbows with the coolest Elites in SA.  This was my first time at DorÄ‡ol and I can guarantee you it will not be my last. This is a super hip distilling co with some ultra smooth drinks. Yeah, I'm used to paying $10 for an Old Fashioned, but the $12 Old Fashioned here totally rocked my socks off. It was smooth, it was subtle, and it had a giant branded ice cube. BRANDED. ICE. CUBE. SO DOPE. Those of you who know me know I always judge a bar by their OF. This one takes not just the cake, but the whole bakery, y'all.  The mixologists/bartenders were witty and fun, and made excellent recommendations. I had the porter, which wasn't as malty as I had hoped, but still hearty. Then I had that memorable Old Fashioned. Not gonna lie, I think it beats out the one at Eddie V's. Then I had the Mother of Pearl which had Absinthe, and that had me seeing fairies for about an hour.  I took a couple of minutes to write a Thank You card to our wonderful CM Tomas, and schmoozed with fellow Elites. (this review is also their notice that I got home safely. I see you Adam, Brent, Aurin, Raven, and Joey.) I had an amazing time watching people dance, play with the giant selfie light, and enjoy some top notch drinks.  Now that I know where this place is, and how incredibly smooth their cocktails are, I definitely want to come back. Especially for that Old Fashioned. Holy yum, y'all.

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: It's a favorite!   They make their own brandy and then build an array of cocktails from that single brandy. Their cocktail menu changes slightly over time, but the favorites seem to stick around. While I enjoy their variety, I always go back to their Ups and Downs. It's the best. It has slight coffee and chocolate flavor and just a tinge of sweetness (which is perfect for me). And it finishes extra nice as it has a maraschino cherry waiting at the bottom for you. They also brew beer there, but that's not what I'm there for! I hear its good, though.  It's relatively small bar. The front section is extremely small, but there is a back area next to their distillery pieces. And when the weather is nice, there is a bunch of seating outside, where they occasionally have live music at. It's generally not busy, which I enjoy, as well. Overall, it has a nice intimate feel.   The only complaint I have about this place is that they only open Thursday - Saturday, and they close early. :'(   The artwork is enjoyable and rotates occasionally. The jams are good, the servers are friendly, and the cocktails are the best. It's a great after-dinner drinks spot.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Excellent location with good beer and spirits.  Beautiful scenery and is a must try for the area.

reviews.author: Karin P.
reviews.description: A friend invited us to join her for their icecream challenge.   When your GPS says you are getting close, be sure to slow down, we missed the turn the first time. Then we had to turn around and then we got stuck on the other side of a long train...   The place is rather small but it is lovely. Great outdoor seating, some covered and some not. Our friend said they recently added the cinder block wall between the patio and the train tracks. Maybe for noise, maybe for safety? Unfortunately it cuts down on the breeze.  The bartenders are fast. Staff members are constantly walking around picking up empty glasses for you.  The menu is small but potent. The Bee's Knees was surprisingly small but effective. I loved the flavor and the color. It was very pretty... I also had their version of a Pimm's Cup and it was also very pretty and tasty. My husband enjoyed his beer and it came in a pretty glass.   This is a pretty place to have some craft beverages. I highly recommend you go to the icecream challange next year if you can. It was delicious and we had a great time chatting with the other attendees.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: They're known for their rakia.  Rakia is Serbian/Croatian for brandy, it's made from apricots, and they distill it right here on location.  All the cocktails are based on rakia, the only other liquor I saw here was absinthe.    My friend had the Strawberry Port Cake (rakia, sugar, rhubarb bitters, some sort of strawberry liqueur, and other ingredients) and let me take a sip.  It was very fruity and refreshing.    Second cocktail up was the Mother of Pearl (it was the only cocktail I saw that was not based on rakia).  This was a coconut flavored drink with absinthe as a base.  Again, I just took a sip, but it was very good.  And I was informed that the absinthe was astounding - but what do I know?  All I can tell you is the drink tasted good.  If you know me, you know liquor and mixed drinks are not my thing.  I'm strictly a beer dude, so luckily for me, in addition to their famous rakia, they also brew a handful of their own beers.  I checked their online drink list before I went and saw a list of 5 or 6 brews.  I tried the Betty, a Kolsch that was light, crispy and tasty, but kind of watery and too much on the light side.  Not the best Kolsch I've ever had.  The bummer was, that after I finished my last beer, I was informed that there were taps on the left side of the bar that I hadn't seen.  Supposedly, they have a red ale that beats the pants off the Kolsch.  I'm going to have to make another trip down there for that one.  Cocktails are $10-$12, so yeah, it's a bit pricey.  BUT the bartenders do make an awesome and *consistent* drink.  Each subsequent drink tasted exactly like the previous drink. Cocktails aren't a science, it's an art.    The inside bar area is a bit cramped, but they have a patio area with tables and chairs to chillax on.    The night I was there, it started raining and they let us drag the tables and chairs into the distillery area, so we could take shelter from the elements.  Final verdict? YES, I would hit this place up again.  A very unique place technically not in Southtown, but close enough.

reviews.author: Adam H.
reviews.description: "Dorchal" is a beautiful oasis for well crafted drinks. They have beer in addition to their own Rakia (brandy) - Kinsman. Alas I sampled the mixed drinks and then went on to their beer without having tried the Rakia neat. Their 'Mary Pickford' also features their home made grenadine. I also went with more bitter drinks like the Negroni Bianco, and their Paper Airplane. I think I liked the smoothness of the Negroni the best.     Had their IPA, not bad. And their Irish red ale.. twice. It was good.    With it raining we took to moving tables and chairs inside the distillery half. This allowed plenty of room and easy convo.    It appears since they are a drinking place that you can BYOF - bring your own food (or order delivery).  I "sampled" quite a bit more than I normally would. But 1) Tomas was a Tomastic enabler... Many thanks! 2)  I staved off a complete hang over with the assistance of Drinkwel before and after so I thankfully only woke up with only slight brain fog. I'm still testing them out, But they've worked rather well for casual drinking.      Again Tomas was most Tomastic presence throughout the evening. And again thanks and to the Dorcol crew for such a great evening and chill venue.

reviews.author: Porsche C.
reviews.description: REVIEWER # 45  Dorcol has this sexy spice to it that I'm LOVIN'!   I walked in with a couple friends on May 5th, 2017 and totally thought it was just a "brewery" until I seen their menu!    Dorcol is known for making a bomb Serbian apricot brandy (A brandy made of nothing but apricots imported from a family friends orchard), which I didn't get a chance to try; however, let's just say that they definitely don't disappoint when it comes to making a delicious drink! This place was lively on a Friday night and best of all; they had a DJ that was playin' all the jam!!! Yes, that was me swinging my hair and dancing THE.WHOLE.NIGHT!   The Friday I came, it was packed house! Many people surrounding the bar trying to order a drink. I can't blame them because I had front row seats at the bar and trust-and-believe I was not leaving until I had my drink in my hand. HA! Chris Mobley, one of the owners of the bar, was able to take my order as I ordered over 5 drinks for me and my crew. Chris was so patient with me and didn't seem frustrated, I totally appreciated that.   Chris also works with co-founder Boyan Kalusevic on this beautiful Dorcol creation! Kalusevic was born in Dorcol (hint the name of the business) and comes from a family that has a huge background in distilling.   They recently introduced craft beers and a mix of cocktails to the menu and I have to say, it's been a BIG hit! They have over 20+ drinks that are offered here.   They are only open on Thursday, Friday and Saturday nights! Although I wish they were open more days out of the week, I will take what I can get! P.S- They have a good reason on why they are closed during most of the week. My understanding of it is that they spend the days they are closed to produce Rakia, a Serbian Apricot Liquor, which is what they are well-known for making!   This place is a MUST-DO on your bucket list of things to do when visiting San Antonio. It has such a wonderful hip vibe and friendly bartenders. I have to admit that this place can be great for private events: Birthday parties, Bachelorette party, College graduation? You name it, I am sure the owners can make something happen!

reviews.author: Michelangelo S.
reviews.description: The Best Cocktails I Had While In San Antonio  SITREP  Little did I know that when I came with my friends to visit Dorcol In this modest little neighborhood South of Downtown San Antonio (SA), that would be blown away by this wonderful distilling company that makes the most amazing cocktails in this lovely city.  THE SETUP  My buddy Savanna M. and I pulled the trigger on a couple of their specialties:  the Apricot Daiquiri and the Jack Rose.  * The bartender knew his stuff and it was fun to watch him in action https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dor%C4%87ol-distilling-company-san-antonio-2?select=NJNUUOgjOeWachlC_R3cjQanduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w  * And the drinks were AMAZEBALLZ, and that doesn't even fully do these hand-crafted cocktails justice.   https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dor%C4%87ol-distilling-company-san-antonio-2?select=MVENc2vf5knDycdeI5kEeganduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w  And out in the courtyard where the DJ was laying down some jiggy mixed beats,  https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/dor%C4%87ol-distilling-company-san-antonio-2?select_video=m72rGVYwjmkPkY2xA5ezzwanduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w  HOT DOGS  The associated vendor was selling the most amazing goat-meat hotdogs.  Superb.and tasty.  THE LOWDOWN  If you're looking for the best cocktails in SA, you will find them here at Dorcal Distillery.

reviews.author: Giselle C.
reviews.description: I finally made it to DorÄ‡ol!  Sadly (sort of), it was to say goodbye to our wonderful Yelp CM, Tomas as he ventures off on new adventures.  I immediately loved this place because it reminded me of the super-cool bars in Wynwood (Miami).  Industrial decor with painting by local artists sealed the deal, but what really got me were the drinks!  Their paper plane (one of my all-time favorite drinks) were amazing!  Warning:  they are tasty, but man, are they strong in a sneaks-up-on-you kind of way.  Most of the cocktails at DorÄ‡ol are made with the own apricot brandy.  I will definitely try the old-fashioned there next time!  I can't wait to return to DorÄ‡ol and work my way down their awesome drink menu!!

reviews.author: Desiree V.
reviews.description: Chill environment, great drink selection and abundant seating inside and outside. Last time I went it was hailing and we took shelter in their distilling area with their garage door open.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: It's worth going out of your way to enjoy a drink and the laid back atmosphere. They have a variety of signature cocktails to choose from and they all sounded interesting. I tried the mother of Pearl and the tea-kini. Both were great. Perfect flavor. Not too sweet and with the right amount of alcohol.   The outside bar has beer. On a Saturday night, they had a band in the patio. If you prefer to watch football while enjoying your drink, you can do that too. They have a TV in what seems to be the distilling room. Definitely a little of everything for Everyone.

reviews.author: Phillip M.
reviews.description: Great like spot just south of downtown. Unique drinks and distilled spirits. The staff was great, very polite and knowledgeable. I would recommend this spot as a kick off or last spot. The atmosphere is calming. Great way to end the evening. Plus the flavored water is awesome!

reviews.author: Kimberly S.
reviews.description: Visited Dorcol while in town to see a friend who has lived in San Antonio less than a year. We couldn't believe such a fun, chill place wasn't packed on a Friday afternoon. The cocktails were delicious and very varied - pretty much guaranteed to find something for everyone here. The bartender was polite, and the woman who greeted us gave us a little overview of rakia and some history of the distillery. It was a great experience and would love to go back if I get to visit again.

reviews.author: Del C.
reviews.description: After tasting their Betty Kolsch at the Brews and Blooms event held at the Botanical Gardens we were hooked on their Highwheel Beerworks brews but hadn't experienced either the distillery or their Kinsman brandy. We had made many unsuccessful attempts at a visit and finally hit them when they were open. It worth the repeated efforts because this place is really cool.  Lots of attention to architectural details and art making it a very comfortable place to hang out. The cocktails they concoct using their products are outstanding.    In one word WOW for the whole experience and can't wait to go back when the outdoor seating area is complete.  Job well done

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: Oh bless thee DorÄ‡ol for making your place my go to hidden gem in town. I'm sad I have to let the city know about you but I feel it's town to disclose your location and have everyone else enjoy you like I do.  This is not your standard bar nor is this a place that holds itself to the uppity up fru fru spectrum that can be known around town. Nope they're genuine and stay true to themselves.  Located near the train tracks (which you honestly can't even really hear unless you're located outside in the patio) you'll see a beautiful lit patio available for you to sit at.  Once you enter the doors you'll see an impressive menu focused around the rakia that is made in house.  If you'd like don't forget to ask the owners for a tour as they'll be more than happy to give you one in the back!  I love this place and how low key it is. You'll have such an appreciation for craft cocktails once you come here.  Their interpretation of iconic and innovative drinks is simply impressive!

reviews.author: Liz P.
reviews.description: I'm betting that if I had come to this place on a normal night, this review would be five out of five stars. However, we had our after party here after the I love SA YSB party, and I'm pretty sure no one told the poor bartenders that we were going to show up, since they were then deluged with yelpers.  It took me about 15 minutes to get a drink, but I tried the Brandy Alexander $10), which was delicious. It was fun to watch the bartenders make the drinks as well. The Spurs were playing that night so seating was kind of hard to find as well, they have a large interior section and exterior but between sports fans and the Yelpers, there were not a lot of places to sit.  There's a small tent that sells sausages as well, in case you get hungry. They also had charred artichokes that you could buy.  Overall, a nice craft cocktail and beer bar, I just wish that it didn't take so long to get my drink. However, you could tell that the bartenders were slammed and that they weren't expecting so many people.

reviews.author: T Z.
reviews.description: I have to compliment the owners of this Brewery..they are very friendly,  approachable and give 100% every night. Im very impressed with their High Wheel beer selections. Every chance I get I take friends and family to enjoy drinks and the food truck. Love the outdoor area ..add heaters for winter and it would be perfect place on cold night

reviews.author: Dylan M.
reviews.description: Really cool bar with happy hour from 5-8 everyday! Even Saturday! Martini selection is top notch. All drinks made with their own craft liquor. Regular prices are really good compared to nearby bars.   Events every weekend. Comedy show every Saturday at 8pm. Welcoming to every group, right to left.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Stopped in for the Tamale Festival on Sunday, December 5, 2021.  Nice to see the area's new bars and restaurants that you can walk to from Alamo Beer.  We got a couple dozen tamales and order Gin drinks for the ladies and guys got the straight whiskey.  The gin drinks were priced at the craft drink price of $9.50, while the straight whiskey was $14.  Thought the whiskey was a little high in price, so next time I'll stick with a craft cocktail.  Liked the outside patio area as we sipped our drinks and ate spicy pork and been and cheese tamales.

reviews.author: Beth G.
reviews.description: Came for their sip and shop on Sunday. They had an amazing cucumber watermelon lemonade. The venue is very cute and they have indoor and outdoor seating. Very nice bartenders. They have tabletop games you can play which you sip on your cocktail.

reviews.author: Dara R.
reviews.description: A few weeks ago my friends at Variety's Brunch on wheels had a teacher appreciation brunch. As per usual we enjoyed some bar favorites. I bought a bottle of whisky to go. Cheers

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great place to catch up with friends over drinks. They have whiskey and vodka. You can shoot them straight or grab yourself a cocktail. They have a good range of martinis to choose from. They also have beer available.   I had the old fashioned. It decided to keep it simple and do the traditional. It was not bad. It didn't come with the orange peel like I'm used to, but you could definitely taste the citrus.   They have inside and outside seating.   The night we went, they only had one bartender, so it did take a while to order and receive drinks.

reviews.author: Rob P.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I both lived in Las Vegas and have a special connection to a hotel called The Artisan. She also loves chandeliers, so when I saw there was a place called Artisan Distillery with chandeliers, I knew we would have to go on our vacation to San Antonio.  Because we were there midweek and it was Covid times, we were the only ones there except for the owner Nick. That was fine with me as I wasn't trying to pick up this stupid disease. Nick was very welcoming to us and our dog, and we promptly ordered happy hour drinks for herself and a dog cocktail. Yes, they have dog cocktails!  Nick was very hands-on in explaining his process and we end up getting two cocktails each because the first round were so good. Actually, my girlfriend wanted to have a third! But we hadn't even eaten dinner so we pay our bill after two rounds.  Nick said they're on the move soon so I imagine the space will be even better after that. But he was a great host and I would love to go back if I was ever in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Diem L.
reviews.description: Last review I wrote, we were visiting San Antonio.. now that we live in San Antonio, my boyfriend and I came back and we're so glad the drinks taste the same, maybe even better! Everything is fresh and as much as I hate strong drinks, these martinis are dangerous because they're so smooth.. be careful because they'll catch up to you! They have a new venue with lots of seating and a stage, we enjoyed the drag show that was put on that Friday night. Nick was there working the bar and he's just a great host as ever. So glad we're locals now and we get a chance to visit anytime we want!

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: New, larger location. Big outdoor patio area with stage and live music. Indoor bar and seating are with awesome. Drinks made using locally distilled flavored vodka, gin and whiskey. There's a room behind the bar with a stage and seating area that has live comedy shows on Saturday

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: The good:  Decent downtown location and parking isn't too tough in this area.    The vibe inside is chill, and it's a clean joint.  Comfy chairs and couches to lounge on, and they have a nice little patio.    The tour of the distillery is very informative.  The owner explains all the magic that goes into making the perfect vodka.  Unfortunately, the good ends there.  I'm not a liquor aficionado by any means, but every time drink "A" or drink "B" was ordered, it was an entirely different taste and even a different color (it just depends on who you order it from).  At one point, I ordered the Hillbilly Moonshine, and the bartender asked me where I saw that one.  I had to show the menu and the ingredients to him.  What???  The "consistent inconsistency" with the drinks causes them to lose 3 full stars.

reviews.author: Brian F.
reviews.description: Fantastic gem.  Came in right at opening and eavesdropped on a tour wrapping up.   Fantastic spirits.  Had the bourbon neat, wow!!!  Got a quick tour and bottle out own vodka bottles with a custom signature.  Awesome experience!!   Looking forward to going back.

reviews.author: Jewelisa B.
reviews.description: Came for a tour and was absolutely blown away by what I learned! We got to meet the owner Nick and he was such a nice guy and knows his stuff.  I won't lie I was a hard corn fan of Tito's Vodka till I got to try Texas Pride Vodka, no comparison at all! You can just taste the smoothies of Texas pride.  Also got to try the white chocolate martini  loved! Husband had the Spicy cucumber Martini he enjoyed it also. But what blew me away was the Chamoy shot  I will definitely eat coming back for that and the cherry bombs   Nice spot to enjoy some fantastic drinks and listen to music. Or just come here to pregame before heading out to the clubs.  Thank you so much Nick for the very informal tour! I can really tell you put you heart and soul into making that Vodka.

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: Such a fun spot added to the Broadway/Downtown area!   It might not look like it on the outside but you'll be whisked into a place that takes pride on their drinks as they are not only a bar but a full distillery.  The happy hour prices can't be beat and their drinks are so so good. You really have to take advantage of the back room for a fun mixer or event for friends/family. We did a white elephant exchange and the room was perfect.  You have to come check this place out. If you're heading there right now, have an extra martini for me please.

reviews.author: TarynAshleigh M.
reviews.description: BEST SURPRISE DATE NIGHT EVER! I cannot day enough fantastic things about this place! Excellent quality drinks, SUPURB spirits, great service; Nick, the owner, is so knowledge and passionate about his craft which makes the experience that much better! If still available, do the distillery tour through Groupon, it will not disappoint!! We are so glad we stumble upon this gem, count on us to be regulars!

reviews.author: Jerry J.
reviews.description: We had a great time on the "tour" which is really just a chance to sit down with the owner and distiller and talk about how vodka and other spirits are made.  It was entertaining and informative.  At the end you get to sample some product and see how it is made.  Finally you can bottle and label your own bottle to take home for $12 which the master distiller will autograph for you.  Then you can hang out at the bar and drink.  They seem to have a local following at have delicious mixed drinks made with fresh fruit.  A very fun thing to do on an afternoon in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Donna D.
reviews.description: I came here for an event (Drink and Click) and it was during Happy Hour. The place was full of photographers, models and equipment so of course no tours were given. However, it was nice to sit back and enjoy the scenery, the photographers at work, bartenders at work and models at work.  I found it kind of weird there were kids there but whatever. There is also a patio area where you can sit outside and it was a beautiful night.  I had a lemon drop martini and because it was happy hour it was only $5.00. It was the bartenders first day and he did a fantastic job!!! I like this place and would definitely come back if I were in the mood for some vodka.

reviews.author: Seher B.
reviews.description: Super cool concept of an artisan distillery! We took the your and learned a few great things about distilling vodka. The tour included tasters and we had the opportunity to bottle and label our own vodka bottle we purchased which was super neat! We tried 3 of the artisan vodka drinks and loved them! The interior design of the bar is super contemporary and we loved the look. Nick the owner and master distiller did a great job with the place. He is definitely a one man show, although a little extra help would've been good when there are large groups at the venue.  A couple cons: The group prior to our group tour was running behind so they were still around and very loud during our tour which made it difficult for Nick to talk over them and also for some of us to hear. The AC unit was out so it was pretty stuffy inside both the distilling area and the tasting room. Regardless we will be back!

reviews.author: Julie Ann I.
reviews.description: I just realized I failed to leave a review when we did a tour back in July 2017 for my birthday weekend. The tour with Nick was really fun, learned a lot about vodka. It's a small distillery but the atmosphere is good for cocktails and they have a section to have a private party with a crystal chandelier. They make unique cocktails made with their vodka made in-house a Texas vodka and a Spike one made with a cactus. The vodka's are smooth! You can buy bottles directly there and what's cool is that you can fill your bottle!   So happy we toured Artisan and will come back when we visit back.

reviews.author: Jamie S.
reviews.description: This was amazing! Nick gave a fantastic tour! I learned a few things and tasted some delicious spirits. The spirits were absolutely amazing. A definite must for locals or out of towners.

reviews.author: Dan H.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a 6pm tour and Taste.  The owner/distiller gave us a good history and tour of the distillery.  Very informative and explained the process in a way that made it easy to understand.  Good taste samples.   Large menu of drinks and all day Happy Hour in Thursday with $5 drinks.   Very friendly and personable. Nice location in a good easy to find area.

reviews.author: Vero U.
reviews.description: Was in the area with friends and we stumbled upon this place.  Stopped in for one drink, pickle martini and a twist on an old fashion.  We sat outside and ended up making new friends while playing Jenga, it turned out to be a pretty cool spot to have a drink.

reviews.author: Bridget C.
reviews.description: This is a super chill spot to hang out at. We started our night with a tour. The tour was guided by a very knowledgeable tour guide and showed the distillery, best part is you end the tour with 9 samples of their whisky and vodka. The tour it's self is $5.00 but well worth it to try all 9 samples.  The location has darts, jinga and other table/bar games. The bar only serves Rebecca Creek products but all drinks are all made with high quality juice and syrups.  After grabbing a drink we headed to a cute picnic table and enjoyed live music followed by karaoke.  This place is dog friendly and also has a bbq food truck/shack. The bbq smells amazing and tasty.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: We have been to Rebecca Creek on multiple occasions, and we've loved it every time we've been. The staff are always very welcoming and accommodating, and they're very knowledgeable on the drinks served there. We enjoyed the tour of their facilities when they were open pre-COVID, and we also enjoyed the outside tastings they're doing during COVID! They have many different flavors of whiskey to choose from, and we love every single one. Our all-time favorite has to be the Texas Ranger.

reviews.author: Nadia D.
reviews.description: It was a nice trip up 281 from SA! But when we arrived we had to pay a cover and then a few locals weren't wearing masks and it wasn't enforced for them to put them on once inside the bar. One of the employees wasn't wearing one either. While there were signs none of the employees behind the bar asked them to put one on.   I get that you have the option, but all bartenders, restaurant owners and places of business should make their employees wear a mask. Other than that the drinks were fantastic even w the $10 cover.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Event review: Bingo Brad is the best Texas bingo caller around! Wednesday night bingo is a blast, as far as luck-oriented pastimes go. I love when you don't have to be good at anything except drinking, eating, and stamping! Prizes, real bingo cards and dabbers, discounted drinks, discounted food truck BBQ, and the great Texas outdoors! You really can't go wrong for a Wednesday night! Plus, it's over by 9:30 PM, which is great because... Come on out!

reviews.author: A E.
reviews.description: This place is gross. Has major attitude. Just because my husband was wearing a mask. Wasn't greeted with anything but "You don't have to wear a mask in here sir." Eww. It's covid you idiot, I mean HELLO. Parking situation sucks. No children as per TABC law sounds like a load of crap. Didn't stay, just left after 2 minutes. Taking our money somewhere else away from the country bumpkins.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: Always a pleasure dealing with the staff at Rebecca Creek. I just dropped in to purchase a couple bottle of TX Ranger so that I can use as gifts when I am visiting other states. It's not only a great whiskey but also a great conversation starter talking about the distillery just down the road from my house. Due to some restrictions though, I can only purchase 4 small bottles a month   but I can live with this, I guess I have to â€  Covid has definitely affected the hours of operations but the gift store is still open and they have some GREAT TX spirits as well as gifts.   Oh and let's not forget, they are definitely Military friendly offering Military discounts   Thanks Rebecca Creek for your spirits and hospitality

reviews.author: Brandy G.
reviews.description: Love love LOVE to stop in to this place for a lazy Saturday trip. My most recent trip was my third visit to Rebecca Creek to do a distillery tour and tasting and it was as much fun on the third trip as it was the very first.   You can't beat a FREE 20 minute tour and tasting of the five different liquor offerings they offer at this Texas gem. Every time I come I learn something new about the brand and their process and the tour guides provide their own unique flair to the tour. This time I had the pleasure of "Nitro Nick" as my guide and he was AWESOME! A perfect blend of humor, intelligence, and sarcasm :)  When you're done with your tour be sure to stick around and enjoy a cocktail outside on the patio or at one of the many picnic tables scattered around outside. With lots of games (jenga, darts, corn hole), live music on Saturdays and a man named Tommy serving up some of the best bbq in Texas there really is no better way to spend your day.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: I was kind of meh about going here. The Enchanted Rock Vodka and Rebecca Creek Whiskey I have had before and they are veryyy enjoyable. However, not being a huge mixed drink person I was apprehensive, also seeing that they only had mixed drinks- no beer or wine.  We chose a beautiful day to go! All of the seating is outside, with plenty of room for small or large groups. The drinks you can choose on the rocks or mixed- their mixes are delish! I stuck to the vodka with blueberry lemonades and other choices. All blended very well! I was surprised- I expected them to be too strong to enjoy.  We enjoyed a free tour of the distillery and got to sample the vodkas and whiskeys- all very good and learned why their liquors don't burn when you drink them (hint: they do it right). It was all started from a Texas State alumni and there is some history behind the name Rebecca Creek, which I never knew, and thoroughly enjoyed!  There is a lot to do- a good stand (not truck) on site, a live band (the All Nighters were preforming there- which btw are amazing and play everything from Pink Floyd to Foo Fighters), games such as darts, horseshoes and more. They even have a fenced-in dog park!  It's a cute place to hangout. Don't wait forever to stop in like I did. Drink local!

reviews.author: F P.
reviews.description: We finally visited Rebecca Creek and will be back. We enjoyed the Saturday night karaoke. Although the options for beverages are based around whiskey - obviously, there are also other refreshing options. We ordered from the food truck and the brisket was delicious, but the customer service was just horrible. The younger gentleman taking the order was completely rude - absolutely zero customer service. We end up with an incorrect order, but couldn't tolerate his rudeness to go back and have it corrected.

reviews.author: Matthew R.
reviews.description: If you believe the virus is a complete hoax then this your place. Complete disregard for distance, masks or any protocols.   No one preparing food or serving was wearing masks or sanitized hands.  Gave two stars only because they were really hospitable.

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and great area to hang out,  and nice live music. I have a hard time understanding why you guys don't put more thought and energy into your drinks. A monkey could make an old fashioned equal to what y'all did. Put some effort and flair into it and I guarantee people will appreciate it.

reviews.author: Angelica H.
reviews.description: I really enjoyed my time here.  Everything was great.  Enjoyed the liquor tasting of vodka and whiskey.  I wasn't expecting it to be so good.

reviews.author: Rose B.
reviews.description: I've never been to a distillery before so this was a lot of fun! I don't even drink whiskey but boy oh boy the caramel one, was just smooooth! We bought a huge bottle for our whiskey bourbon colleague who unfortunately couldn't make it.  So we hope it helps takes away her bronchitis. :)  Our tour guide Miranda hopefully had a lot of fun too because when you're dealing with a lot of marketing people, oh and one chemist, we have a lot of "suggestions" and plenty of questions. She was so nice and quite informative but more importantly was a great sport and smiled a whole lot. The tour wasn't long because you're right in the heart of it all, but it was worth it, especially when you get to the tasting part.   They have an outdoor area for games and we were all in as we continued to drink.  Luckily we had some food that we brought along to snack on. All in all, great place to visit, have a party, and more importantly have a drink! Stop by if your in San Antonio!

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: I went with a group of friends, apparently if you have 10 people, and you email for reservation? You get a tour, tasting and a cocktail for each person.   I had originally been to Rebecca Creek Distillery back in 2011, and boy has it changed for the better!   I unfortunately cannot remember the name of the gentleman that gave us our tour, he was in charge of marketing, I do remember that. He was so kind, energetic, passionate about Rebecca Creek Distillery and knowledgeable about the distilling and bottling process. The tour was very informative, you actually go inside the workings and distilling of their spirits. This is where you get to taste their Enchanted Rock Vodka, Enchanted Rock Peach Vodka made with Fredericksburg peaches, Rebecca Creek Whiskey, and their Canadian style Texas Ranger Whiskey, which was sweet and had nodes of caramel and vanilla.   We had our cocktails made by Helena. She was great! So friendly, on top of crowd control and making cocktails FAST! I had the peach vodka mixed with lemonade.. that went down too fast! We purchased a few more cocktails (and if you check in on Yelp! you get $2 off your cocktail purchase! Woo!) We gathered outside on their covered patio, played darts and smoked cigars that a friend had brought. Apparently there is usually food trucks on Saturdays, but the rainy weather had scared them away..   Super cool - they have a dog park on premises!!   On Thursday, its steak and open mic night, Friday, it's happy hour, food trucks and karaoke, Saturdays is live music and food trucks and Sundays is whiskey and wag Sundays.   Dog park is open Thursday-Sunday.   Also - they have their own radio station!! You can listen online, or at Rebecca Creek Distillery.   Do yourself a favor and go check it out, be sure to tell Helena I said heyyy!

reviews.author: Mike T.
reviews.description: Had a good time at this place. Took the Distillery tour which was pretty interesting about 10 or 15 minutes worth. Ended up tasting two vodkas and two whiskeys that were a very good. Went back afterward and had a few drinks while listening to a Duo playing some country music. There was karaoke that started later and that was fun too. There was a food truck we had already eaten though, but it looked good. All in all it was a fun time!

reviews.author: Mary S.
reviews.description: Rebecca creek is a charming hangout with your family, friends or significant other. I ordered the refreshing enchanted peach drink with peach vodka and blueberry lemonade. My friend ordered the  Texas cream soda with whiskey and sprite. They were both perfect for a hot summer day. Bring your friends and play cornhole, horseshoes or darts! They have live music, live trivia, and food trucks on various nights of the week.

reviews.author: Al P.
reviews.description: We did the private 25 minute tour on a Saturday. They had a live band with a big outdoor picnic area. VERY laid back vibe with everyone drinking a Vodka or Whiskey drink. The bartenders do a great job of getting your order to you. A very well kept secret in the San Antonio area.

reviews.author: Ryan B.
reviews.description: Pretty good for a Texas whiskey distillery. I'm originally from Kentucky so I'm a bit spoiled in my distillery tour experiences, but this one is pretty decent. Gabe administered our tour today and did a good job - he was engaging, informative and knowledgeable as he easily answered guests questions. Pretty cool little hangout spot outside with live music and Tommy's Zmoke BQQ, and it was a pretty cool atmosphere. Only major bummer to me was that the Old Fashioned was subpar. Call me high maintenance, but I had higher hopes for an Old Fashioned from a whiskey distillery. Otherwise this is a pretty cool place and they seem to be doing some good things to get the community interested and make them informed about one of Texas' few whiskey distilleries.   Cheers!

reviews.author: Graziella B.
reviews.description: If you want to know how they make their Vodka and Whisky, this is the place to get a first hand educational tour! The guide was very knowledgeable and you can even get a taste of their flavored vodka, they have a new peach flavor and it does smell real peachy. I'm not a drinker but I did get a taste on my tongue, it's the smoothest and real peach flavored drink. It does have a kick when the taste gets back to your throat. I don't see how people can drink it, but like most things it's an acquired taste. Their whisky flavored is that of a cream soda and I dipped my finger in a tasting cup, it smelled like a vanilla Carmel cream soda.  The taste to me was real strong. I can see why I'm not a drinker. I will stick to my sweet tea and virgin piÃ±a colada's. My next venture will be to go to a winery to see and taste real French wine!

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: Wow, lots going on here that I didn't know about.  Excellent live music, great drinks and they had a food vendor from New Braunfels.  Coming back

reviews.author: Peggy E.
reviews.description: Fantastic intimate wine tour with awesome host, Matthew! Highly recommend to everyone.

reviews.author: Kai C.
reviews.description: Brandy was the best tour guide! My husband and I booked a tour/tasting for my birthday. Masks are worn and there is a plastic divider inside of the van.  The gentleman at Sister Creek who served our wine did great. Brandy was very knowledgeable, personable, professional and kind. She is a walking wealth of wine/vineyard information. If you're looking to book a tour, short or long, I highly recommend this company! We were given the option for her to provide a little info and just let us vibe or provide us with everything. I love all things wine so I went for it all! I wasn't disappointed. (Btw she took magnificent pictures for us as well).

reviews.author: Monica A.
reviews.description: What a great wine tour. Our guide Matt is personable, knowledgeable, funny, friendly and professional. Our group was small. The wineries were great! All cute , the fun one was last; FAT ASS !!! Matt chose wineries based on our taste and personalities. Yes yes you have to do yourself a favor and book a tour. No regrets. They also pick you up at your hotel !

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: First wine tour of the Texas Hill Country and Cottonwood did not disappoint. Our driver/guide Diane was AMAZING! She was super friendly, knowledgeable, and gave great insight into the wines and even hooked us up with a great BBQ joint in Fredericksburg. This was a wonderful experience and we are looking forward to exploring more wines with Cottonwood.

reviews.author: Jen O.
reviews.description: Matt and Brandy were so wonderful! Brandy helped guide us to the best wineries! Matt was our driver and he was very kind, a wealth of knowledge, and a great guide. I would highly recommend working with them for your next wine tour. The pick up and drop off at home were well worth it. Thank you guys for a great time!

reviews.author: Teresa W.
reviews.description: Such a great tour... We did the Guadalupe River Wine tour. It was a surprise for the husbands of the group! Matt was our guide and he was so knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. A group member left something in the bus and Matt was kind enough to bring it back on his day off. We will definitely tour again!

reviews.author: Manuela F.
reviews.description: A few of us from Houston wanted to do a wine tour birthday party for a friend.  Brandy was super accommodating in the reservation process and her husband Matt picked us up the day of at the hotel we were staying at in San Antonio.  He assured us it would be a very different tour from what we're accustomed do and he was right!  He was so knowledgeable that we really enjoyed the tour.    We had shopping time in Fredericksburg and we never felt rushed.  Excellent recovery on their part too when there was a slight hiccup in our reservation and with what was available to tour, he didn't skip a beat.  He  made other arrangements and we continued our tour.  Additionally, I left my iPhone charger in the van and they had it delivered the same day.  One of my girlfriend's left her sunglasses at the Sisters Creek Vineyards and Matt was able to recover the sunglasses and had them mailed the same day.  That's true service!  We would most definitely enjoy doing another tour with Cottonwood Wine Tours in the future and we plan to do so soon.

reviews.author: Kristie W.
reviews.description: What a great tour!  Diane picked our group of six up at our hotel and the adventure began!  We had our first stop at the Saint Tryphon winery, which was the cutest place with an amazingly knowledgeable and friendly staff!! Tres  presented our tastings and was great to talk and listen to.  Our group of six bought several bottles of wine.  We then journeyed to another gorgeous winery with a little less on the customer service.  We gave our feedback immediately to Diane, who said that she would have a discussion with that winery and I believe she will!  Diane then took us into Fredericksburg and pointed out many local establishments.  Throughout the day, Diane provided many facts and tons of information about the area.  She even managed a quick detour to drive by Luckenbach for us!  We chose this company because it is a small business and were very pleased with the personal touches, snack bags, and intimacy of this tour.  We would highly recommend this company for your wine tour adventures!

reviews.author: James O.
reviews.description: I met my mom and sister in San Antonio for my mom's 65th birthday.  They came by way of Chicago and I came in from Portland, Oregon.  My sister did all of the research for the trip and found Cottonwood wine tours so we could get out of the city and into the hill country of Texas.  It was a Friday and my mom's actual birthday when Matthew picked us up at the hotel.  Right off the bat he was really cool and laid back.  He had a lot of fun facts about San Antonio as he is from there and the drive out to Sister Creek winery seemed like we were just hanging out with a friend.  Coming from the Willamette valley I have seen plenty of winery's but nothing like this one. It is an old cotton mill turned into a small winery that produces some great Bordeaux varietal blends and even a Pinot Noir!  Matthew was very knowledgeable on the topic of wine and wine making.  After the wine tasting we headed to Luckenbach for some beer and a little live country music. There is a lot of history to this place and we had been there 33 years prior when my sister and I were toddlers.  He told us no rush and let us enjoy this little country music Mecca, he even had the famous song loaded up on his phone when we got back to the car.  We had him take a picture of us that emulated the one that had been taken so many years before.  Next stop was some Texas bbq, like real bbq, he said we couldn't expect any city bbq to be better and I would say he was right!  All in all this tour was awesome, I would have loved to take other tours with Matthew, like the Alamo or some of the other missions but I don't think he offers those yet, maybe an idea?  He was very personable, knowledgeable and friendly.  The type of person you want to be around and I know my mom had a very special birthday because of this tour/guide.  I highly recommend Cottonwood wine tours for any tour they offer in San Antonio, it is run by Matthew, his wife and his mother in-law and I look forward to returning here to see their success!

reviews.author: Tam T.
reviews.description: A group of us did the Taste of Fredericksburg tour. We had a great time with Mrs. Diane! She was  friendly, knowledgeable, and had great energy! We visited two wine vineyards and were able to spend the last hour of the tour walking around Fredericksburg. Overall, the tour was amazing! It was put together well and worth the price! I highly recommend doing this tour if you're in town visiting or live in San Antonio. They also give military discounts

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: Great day. Matt was very knowledgeable in history and wine making! He designed tour to group's taste.  Thoroughly enjoyed the hill country and Fredericksburg.

reviews.author: Kat O.
reviews.description: Matt was an amazing tour guide!!  I was down in San Antonio for a work trip and happily stumbled upon this tour company in an ad--they even pick you up from your hotel!  Great opportunity to visit beautiful Fredericksburg!

reviews.author: Isabella P.
reviews.description: I found Cottonwood Wine Tours while looking for things to do in San Antonio. We had a great time with our driver Diana. We did the 4 winery tour plus free time in Fredricksburg tour, and we had a fun time. Diana is very friendly, and gave us many good suggestions to places to eat in Fredricksburg and San Antonio. I am so glad we found this wine tour company. They are a small operation with Diana, her daughter and son in law.

reviews.author: Charles C.
reviews.description: My wife and I decided to take a trip to the Texas Hill country and do some wine tasting.  We noticed there were over 40 wineries listed and did not know which ones to choose.  So, we looked on the internet and chose Cottonwood Wine Tours.  Our guide was amazing. We learned so much and he chose some wonderful site.  We recommend them highly.

reviews.author: Ryan P.
reviews.description: I'm visiting my friend in San Antonio who's here for work and she booked this wine tour for us. Matt picked us up and was super friendly and gave us a lot of information about San Antonio, the winery we were headed to, and was just overall really nice and friendly.  At the first winery at Sister Creek, we switched out with Brandy because she was doing the actual tour we booked, Matt was just doing our pick up. Brandy was super fun and every bit as good as Matt. She took us to another winery, let us walk around Fredericksburg (after some great advice on where to eat), then at the end decided she'd take us by a small local liquor distillery that makes some really cool stuff like jalapeno moonshine!  From start to finish, it was amazing. These two are friendly as can be, very knowledgeable, and nothing felt cookie cutter. They make it feel like a personal experience. I definitely recommend giving Cottonwood Wine Tours a try!

reviews.author: Nicole B.
reviews.description: I took 5 ladies today and couldn't have asked for better. Relaxed and fun. Educational and joyful. Perfect.  Wouldnt use anyone else. I cant recommend enough.

reviews.author: Andreea G.
reviews.description: My husband and I went on the A taste of Fredericksburg tour and we had a great time. When they say that you get a knowledgeable tour guide on hand they really mean it. The experience was great and although I am 8 months pregnant we still had a good time and got to purchase some wine to try for after the baby comes. Also they didn't charge me for the wine fee so that was a plus since I didn't get to do any of the wine tastings.

reviews.author: Shirley F.
reviews.description: One word: love. My group took a Sunday tour, and since we were the only ones signed up that day, Matt came to my apartment to pick us all up. He was so polite and interesting, genuinely knowledgeable when it came to wine and the Hill Country. After our first winery, we got back into the car to find goody bags with water and snacks waiting for us. He had extra chocolate if we needed it!    I really liked having time to eat and shop in Fredericksburg between drinking. He pointed out suggestions for places to eat or to drink more on Main Street before dropping us off. He even took us to a bonus winery not on the schedule since we were doing so well on time.   I highly recommend Cottonwood. Matt was easy to contact and professional throughout, even when we were all a bit tipsy. He was a very safe driver. Great job.

reviews.author: Gabrielle M.
reviews.description: I did a private tour of the Guadalupe River Valley area and it was INCREDIBLE. We did a private tour with just 3 and it was completely affordable, which was my biggest concern off the bat. Communication was impeccable from the get-go and our tour guide Matt was such a blast. We hit up 3 wineries and a distillery that made moonshine. Each one was small and unique where we were really able to  converse with the staff and talk about the wines. Due to us having a small group we never felt rushed and when we asked for an extra few minutes, Matt easily obliged. I will definitely be going back for another tour!!

reviews.author: Sarah K.
reviews.description: If you are living in or visiting in the San Antonio area, you should definitely go on this wine tour!   We did the tour that consisted of two wineries and lunch in Fredricksburg. It was great!  Brandy and Matt think of everything! We were picked up in a clean van right at our hotel, so don't worry if you don't have a car! Matt even bring out a step stool so you don't have strain to get into the car. I didn't need it necessarily, but I did enjoy that extra touch. They gave us goodie bags while we drove to the country side. Matt is very knowledgeable and is a great guide of the area. He is full of little facts about the area!   The wineries we went to were very cool! Sister Creek was in an old cotton gin and more personal. Becker's was more upscale and large. we ended up getting 6 bottles of wine altogether. I was so surprised by the amount of good wine grown in Texas! Who knew?!!  Pros:  Brandy and Matt think of everything!  Don't worry about paying anything at the wineries- they take care of that! Transportation Good wine Great tour of the area Brandy and Matt are friendly and great at conversation They really know their stuff and love to explain anything about wine!  Cons:  I had a hankering for some cheese! But that's all I can think of!

reviews.author: Babatunde A.
reviews.description: Completely unprofessional arrived and the business had a trump flag being waved right at the parking entrance which is a business as a black man felt completely uncomfortable attending this establishment. As a business they should be present themselves as professional.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Such a fan of Seersucker Southern Style gin! If you don't like gin, you will like Seersucker Gin! Trust me.   It is an adorable place to hang out any day of the week! The grounds are beautiful, ample amount of parking. There are rocking chairs on the covered porch, picnic tables, plush chairs and ottomons, bean bag toss and bocce ball set up outside with fans.   There are a few tables inside the tasting room, along with the bar, restrooms, merchandise for sale and the distillery. The tasting room is right in the middle of the distillery, so you see all the working parts that go into making the gin and Cinco vodka.  They offer free tours on Saturday's at 3 PM, and request that you RSVP on their website. Trey, the owner, was the one who gave the tour. He is a fun and interactive guy, so you definitely will not be bored. We were able to taste their Cinco Vodka, Gin, Lemon Flavored Gin and Limeaide Gin. Then we each purchased a cocktail to take on the tour with us.   Fun fact - Seersucker was the first gin to be made with real fruit juice, not just flavored. They also have trademarked the "Southern Style Gin." Who knew this little hidden gem was in San Antonio!   Seersucker is pet friendly, as long as your pet is leashed.  They also pop fresh popcorn daily.

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: What an adorable spot to hang out for an afternoon! The employees were friendly and  informative.  Plenty of seating on the patio and picnic benches under trees. Also, plenty of parking. The property is well kept.  Tasted the vodka,  gin, lemon gin, and lime gin.  All of which were very good, but the lemon and lime were my favorites.   The owner was very friendly and knowledgeable. He conducted the tour, which was very interesting and informative.    Would be a fun place for a group event.  Will definitely return.

reviews.author: Monica D.
reviews.description: Wow, LOVED this place!   Delicious gin - not a typo, this stuff is the real deal. They specialize in their original creation of southern style gin which is naturally "flavored" with citrus varieties.   When you visit this place, you'll feel like you just arrived at someone's chic farm. The design and decor of this distillery are a dream. Charming from the moment you pull in, you'll notice outdoor games, relaxing seating options, and an adorable porch. Perfection is in the details and this placed nailed it. Can't wait to go back!   It's a drive from the city-center but well worth it for the serenity this space has to offer. You don't want to miss it!!!

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: This is such a great day trip to experience with your friends and family. I prefer to park my car at the Pearl and simply take a Lyft so I don't have to worry about drinking and driving.   Seersucker Gin currently has three different flavors and they're deemed as a Southern Style Gin. The current flavors are lime, lemon, and neat. They distill everything on-site and they're super passionate about their product.  If you're a newb to gin, Seersucker is a great introduction to the gin world. It's very clean and is a great base for signature cocktails. You gotta try the bees knees. Literally one of the best drinks to have in the Summer.  They have plenty of outdoor seating and the patio is gorgeous. Have a Seersucker drink during the sunset and you'll be set.

reviews.author: Anthony P.
reviews.description: I love this hidden gem!  My first visit was as a guest of a yelp elite member, and this gin quickly became my spirit of choice.  My favorite is the limeade which goes great with topochico.  I made my second visit when they let me host my birthday party.  The bartender was awesome and provided a tasting for all of my guests.    The distillery is a cool place to stop in for a bit, and the outdoor area is nice as well.  There are games and tables set up outside to hang out while you enjoy one of their many different drinks.  Make sure to check out their new grapefruit gin.  I think I have a new favorite!

reviews.author: Heather M.
reviews.description: If you're a fan of gin, bocce ball, and rocking chairs on shaded front porches, then Seersucker Distillery is the place for you. We have visited the distillery three times now, and have been pleased with the atmosphere, the service, and the gin!
