reviews.author: Theresa C.
reviews.description: Wow the place is really nice and relaxing plus live music today with Trisha Lynn. Karen the owner is really welcoming and warm. I will definitely be back for more jazzy razzy

reviews.author: Arianna D.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Wine is super delicious! We enjoyed a flight while the kids jumped at House of Air. What a good pairing! Ha!

reviews.author: Vero U.
reviews.description: We had enjoyed some wine with a group of friends. The staff is friendly and were able to accommodate a large group. We all enjoyed a glass of good wines. I did see another have food, good to know. Overall cute place to have a glass with friends.

reviews.author: V G.
reviews.description: The environment was quiet and private, there was a crowd when we walked in at the bar but there was enough seats for us at the end. We were able to take some snacks and opted out for purchasing an entire bottle vs wine tasting ($10 for 7 tastings I believe). I found that I'd take my chances w/the sweet blueberry wine and it'll be cheaper and more rewarding ($15+ per bottle).  The only thing I didn't like too much was that the wine wasn't cold. I know red wine is good room temperature but I like sweet wine cold.

reviews.author: Mi'Cheal P.
reviews.description: Deffinitely recommend this winery.  My first time trying wine, did the flight wine tasting. Karen and the other staff were great, very welcoming. Karen was very informative about the wine, she knows what to ask first timers and the regular wine drinkers. Ill be back when I am in town again.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: We were looking for something to do and stumbled across this place. The yelp reviews were good so we decided to check it out. This is the only winery in the city of San Antonio which I thought was pretty cool. Stray Grape has an extensive selection of wines. I was very impressed by the selection and the taste of these wines.   We went to Stray Grape on a Saturday. It was the day of the Kentucky Derby and it was packed. When me and my fiancÃ© first walked in we thought we may have walked in on someone's private event. As soon as we walked in we were greeted by one of the employees and they were very friendly. We instantly felt welcomed by the employees and the regulars.   I recommend others try some of their Port Wines, they are to die for. For being the only winery San Antonio and having the market cornered they still treat you like there's competition in the city. People are friendly, prices are reasonable and the wine well, it tastes fantastic.   If you're looking for something to do and want some free wine tasting, this is the place to visit. Me and my fiancÃ© will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Sylvia P.
reviews.description: Love, Love, Love this place! The wine, atmosphere, and people make this a Cheers for wine.  You can just walk in for a glass of wine and leave with so many new friends. I really didn't think that places like this existed anymore. This is a true neighborhood hidden gem; plus No Sulfides in the wine.

reviews.author: Che S.
reviews.description: We love going to the Stray Grape. Wonderful staff / owners at every visit and they make you feel so welcomed. The Wine Club is well worth it!!!

reviews.author: Kate M.
reviews.description: This is the place to be! Barbie was AMAZING and so kind. This was the perfect place for a girls weekend! The wine was incredible!

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: What an amazing place to spend your first Friday.  Great food from Good to Go Grillerz and what fun with Stray Grape Bingo

reviews.author: Ari R.
reviews.description: First, I'll make it clear that I've never been to a wine tasting of any kind before. However, after trying this place, it's totally something I want to try more often! It doesn't look like much from the outside; it's part of a small shopping center. But you walk in, and it's comfy and nice. There weren't that many people there, we went pretty early during the day, so I'm sure it gets more crowded in the evenings. There are multiple TVs and plenty of tables. Our server was knowledgeable, fast, and friendly.  For a mere $10 you get to taste 7 wines AND keep your glass! They give you little paper menus to keep. This was helpful as I underline each wine I tried so I could keep track, and even make a plan for the next time I go. My sister and I enjoyed tasting the wine, then writing how many stars we gave each out of 5. They have a pretty solid variety to choose from. Cabernet, Merlot, Moscato, all very different with varying depths of flavors. Ask your server for recommendations! They are super helpful. I definitely want to go back soon.

reviews.author: Pat G.
reviews.description: What a pleasant surprise to find the Stray Grape "open" for our impromptu visit.  Glorious wines and our host, Karen was the best.  I encourage everyone to stop in if you are in the San Antonio area!  The Chicago Connection!!!

reviews.author: Shaina B.
reviews.description: Barbie is absolutely amazing! They were short staffed and she was the only one serving 3-5 different parties. She was fast but professional and very polite. She made us feel so welcomed!

reviews.author: Dominique M.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! $10 for a four wine tasting. The bottles are reasonably priced. The owners are so helpful if you're undecided about what you'd like to try/buy. This is a great place to pop in for a casual glass or a tasting with a friend. I only wish they sold to stores!

reviews.author: Jonathan R.
reviews.description: I recently attended a wine education class at Re:Rooted 210 and it was the experience I needed to make me confident in understanding wine. I am an avid wine drinker and have done the whole--look at the wine in the glass, smell, taste and savor. However, that was all for show. I can't be the only one who does this at the dinner table after the Somm pours a first "taste". What am I really tasting though?   Jennifer shared her extensive knowledge in her inaugural Tasting Deconstructed: Understanding Your Palate class. I learned how to look and taste through a Sommelier's eyes and mouth. I learned how to distinguish the color and age of the wine. I learned how to properly smell and identify scent characteristics that sparked core memories. Yes--wine can do that. I learned how to taste and differentiate if the wine was high acidity, high minerality, or full bodied. I learned all the things!  Going back to that table side pour. I was always going to enjoy the wine--let's be honest. However, now I feel confident to have a discussion about the complexity, the bouquet, or what memory was sparked. Instead of the typical head nod and "It's good".

reviews.author: Susie G.
reviews.description: Such a nice hidden gem downtown!  Visited with a group of friends.  We did the tasting for $10 and the staff are very friendly and knowledgeable.  They have wine on tap and I love that they have refillable growlers.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: After a nice dinner at the Chart House we took a short walk over to ReRooted and was pleasantly surprised and delighted with our decision.  There were a couple of regulators sitting there and the vibe was super friendly when we walked in.  The modern decor is amazing and the story behind it...... well you'll have to stop in and ask for yourself.  This is a really neat concept as you buy your wine in a growler bottle that can be used again and you get a small discount when you bring it back.  I will not spoil the experience for you, I will merely suggest that if you like wine and enjoy urban wineries, try it out, you will really like it and probably go back and more than likely join their wine club too.

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: Cute new spot in hemisphere park! It's a little hidden, tucked into a corner of a building, away from the playground. There's a few outdoor tables, but the majority of the space is inside. It's nice and open inside with glass walls that fill the room with natural light.  The owner was very friendly and offered us a full complimentary tasting. She bestowed us with knowledgeable about the wine, telling us about the grapes and how their flavors incorporated into each final product. Their wine is made locally in Fredericksburg, and many of them hold the honor of a having a San Antonio name. It was very enjoyable learning about the drinks. And they were delicious!!  We ordered a charcuterie board and the cheese was perfect! Each cheese had a complimentary dipping sauce. Ah, they were all great combos. Next time I'll ask about a meatless option.   You can purchase either a glass or growler. And they're reasonably priced. The menu includes the tasting notes of each wine, which I greatly appreciated. They're still relatively new and said they'll be adding more options in the future. We had a great time here, and we look forward to coming back and enjoying more local wine.

reviews.author: Rebecca W.
reviews.description: Eh. The wine was okay. Nothing off the charts - I must say I consider myself a professional wine taster or connoisseur so I wasn't over impressed but I must say the service was good. The prices were a bit over the top (and I don't have cheap taste). Overall, it was an okay experience. You have to pay $15 to park in the garage to come here no matter how long you stay. We had a cheese and meat platter and each had a tasting, took 1 bottle and it was well over $100

reviews.author: Pdizzle F.
reviews.description: LOVE the place!! The owner, Jennifer, is a wine connoisseur  I would identify myself as an intermediate wine drinker. Was a bit apprehensive about urban wineries. However, from the initial meet, I can tell that Jenn is knowledgeable! She knows and understands regional wine and will give you recommendations based on your experience with wine and drinking preferences!  Awesome vibe with industrial elements, in a relaxed and non-pretentious setting. Stop by!

reviews.author: Tricia W.
reviews.description: We had been eagerly awaiting their opening, that, like so many other businesses, got delayed in the past year. It's a bit difficult to nail down an all-encompassing descrition of what's going on here, but here goes:  -custom crush urban winery featuring ALL TEXAS wines. If you're new in town and considering a US 290 wine trail trip, START HERE! An amazing amount of knowledge to be had regarding, varietals, production techniques, and personalities in the Texas Hill Country wine scene. Can't think of too many other folks bringing Jennifer's years of experience and general wine knowledge to the community in a way thats approachable/informative regardless of your prior background as a wine consumer.  -neighborhood wine bar with a selection that, while not in the dozens in terms of selection, has something that should be pleasing for just about every palate, regardless of your "usual favorite".  The cheese/charcuterie plate available makes for a great addition also!  -retail wine outlet featuring eco-friendly reusable growlers for everyday use as well as kegged wines for larger gatherings/events. At some point in the future, they're planning to have offerings from other Texas wineries on hand as well.  -winery tasting bar with a couple different "wine club" experiences available. Wine education seminars are also on the longer term horizon.

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: ReRooted is located in a new building on the Hemisfair site.  Parking can be a bit tricky. Don't use the adjacent surface parking lot, like I did, but instead use the parking garage that is part of the building that ReRooted is located in. Much cheaper and I understand that ReRooted may validate your parking.  ReRooted 210 represents something of a new concept. I have watched owner/solemner/wine maker Jennifer Beckmann's career over the past ten years. She has been involved in setting up several fine wineries in the Hill Country (among her many accomplishments).  Now she and her husband are setting out on a new and, I think, relatively new concept. Recently opened, ReRooted features wines that Jennifer has blended and produced from Texas grapes. As such, these wines are only available at this location. Instead of bottling the wine, it is stored in recyclable casks and dispensed much like draft beer. Much friendlier for the environment. In addition to dispensing wine by the glass you can purchase the wine in reusable bottles much like growlers for beer. When finished, bring the bottles back for a credit on your next purchase.  The space consist of a bar for dispensing wine, an airy modern seating area and some adjacent outdoor seating.  Wine: We tried the sampler of I think six different wines and I was very impressed. The wines were well crafted and I think very similar to European style wines that I have had in the past.  Food: Food is limited to a very nice cheese and charcuterie plate and I believe one other selection that we did not try.   A great place to meet with friends and enjoy some very nice Texas wine.

reviews.author: Shawn G.
reviews.description: Great wine. Great staff. Wine is on tap! That means less waste. Highly recommend.   Yelp is trying to make me post more words so here are more words.

reviews.author: Laura B.
reviews.description: Great friendly atmosphere. Very knowledgeable owners. Loved the education about the grapes.

reviews.author: Patrick H.
reviews.description: Stopped in here with my wife before dinner and we fell in love with the place. Jennifer and her husband have built an incredible space and we're incredibly helpful in explaining all of the complexities of each wine. This is a great addition to the neighborhood.

reviews.author: Danielle J.
reviews.description: ***Update: The company did reach out and refund the extra hour which I appreciate. Although I was asked to delete my review, which I will not be doing.   First off, let me start by saying our driver Nate, was an absolute doll. He was the only good part about the experience with this company.  The company is called San Antonio Wine Tours, their website says they are based out of SA and pickup in SA. When booking a half day tour, their website says there is only enough time to go to dripping springs. So I booked dripping springs and requested and additional hour to have lunch. Upon calling to update my reservation I was told the extra hour I purchased would go towards travel time. TBF dripping springs is 1.5 hours from my home and they said ppl usually spend 45min-1hr at the wineries. That being said, why does the basic half day package say there's enough time to go to dripping springs only, which I chose, yet my additional hour has to be used for travel. It didn't quite add up.  So I explained this to them and was given the response "oh, I guess the website needs to be corrected". Also, they just asked "do you want to cancel?"  No attempting to right their wrong. I soon realized it's probably bc the deposit I put down was non refundable so they probably didn't care bc they already had some of my money. I was told that apparently they have been pulling this since they started 2 years ago and the website was supposed to have been "corrected" many times before this.  So buyer beware, this company practices dishonest and what I feel is shady  business. They also seem to not care about if the customer is upset and only about the money that can get.

reviews.author: Mindy K.
reviews.description: Excellent experience! We all haD such a great time! They gave me many options to choose  from and everything ran pretty smoothly! It was a greaT wAy tO spend my birthday with my friends!   The drive Lance was very nice and accommodating and we didn't feel rushed, which was great! He allowed us to have the freedom to truly experience all the wines the 3 wineries had to offer and the food was absolutely aMazing! I will definitely recommend them and hopefully soon be able to reserve another tour!

reviews.author: Ivona S.
reviews.description: Had an awesome time on our trip to Fredericksburg, they picked us up at our home in San Antonio and made all the reservations for us. Bryon was a great driver and very accommodating when it came to adding time. I would definitely recommend booking with them if you are looking to take a trip to Fredericksburg stress free

reviews.author: Angela O.
reviews.description: I booked a tour for 7 people to 3 wineries in the Fredericksburgâ€‹ area for a dual 30th party.  Sara made recommendations, and those wineries turned out to be excellent choices...we all really enjoyed them.  Clearly, she knew something we didn't.  However, the reason I can't give a better review is the limo.  We paid an upcharge for a limo, and the one that was sent was old and the AC/heat did not work properly.  We were pretty uncomfortable for the long drives to and from San Antonio.  Sara did get right on it when I called, but we shouldn't have had to deal with it at all.  Edit: The company worked with us after on a refund and we are very satisfied.

reviews.author: Tasha L.
reviews.description: I booked a private wine tasting tour for myself and 10 of my friends. We upgraded to a party bus and we had the best time. Every detail was planned out. We had nothing to worry about but to have a great time. I will definitely  use this company again and again!!

reviews.author: Veronica L.
reviews.description: Had a great wine tour in San Antonio. My friends and I are from Arizona. We loved are trip. Our driver Bryan was really friendly and helpful. Would recommend San Antonio wine tour to everyone.

reviews.author: Marc T.
reviews.description: Person on the phone = really rude.  Don't answer the phone if you don't want to answer customers questions.  You lost business. Sad cuz it's right down the street from us.  What a shame.     If you answer the phone this way. How do you treat your customers when they arrive??

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: What a great afternoon! This place is top notch. We found it randomly online and didn't know we needed a reservation. The owner welcome us is, no problem. He listened to what I  said about the kind of wines I like and don't like, and even though I'm not a red girl, he gave me a reddish wine that was exactly what I wanted. I've never had anyone pair a wine to my pallet before. Five stars. We bought the bottle to have on the patio. Such a relaxing escape from the outside world. I heard they sold it today. A little bummed because the owner is so personable, but hopeful the new owners will offer the same great personal touch.

reviews.author: Jordan S.
reviews.description: Wow what an experience! My bf and I wanted to try this winery but could not get in on the days we were available. They are only open the first weekend of each month. Michael, the owner was so sweet and humble. We tried the flights of wine and loved them all. Ended up getting a nice strawberry white wine. It's so quaint and comfortable. Weather was perfect, all screened in and they provide amazing pizza as well. Definitely going back and would definitely recommend Lara's!!

reviews.author: Darlene R.
reviews.description: I've been to Lara Vineyard a couple of times during COVID. They space everyone out and take excellent precautions. The owners are very engaged and personable. They schedule by reservation to make sure not overbooked and everyone stays safe. I'm not a wine connoisseur but it is fun to try the wine flight. The pizza is very good as well as charcuterie. Always fun for a small group.

reviews.author: Danielle R.
reviews.description: Drove over two hours to try this place and there's a gate to get in. Says reservations are required but doesn't explain that on the website. Called multiple times and no one answered. Never trying to come here again. Waste of time.

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: This is the best vineyard in San Antonio. The owners are very outgoing and treat guest like family. We love all their wines, especially the season ones like Fall and Winter Merlot. The cucumber chardonnay is also amazing. I am not a fan of cucumbers but this wine is very refreshing. They also have tasty pizzas and cheese and meat platters. Unfortunately they are only open one weekend a month. I believe it is the second weekend. This is a must visit place.

reviews.author: Sherry M.
reviews.description: Wry good food, wine and ambiance! Inside and outside accommodations. Family owned and they are lovely people. Very clean. Parking a little rocky.

reviews.author: Danielle E.
reviews.description: Owner made us feel like we were right at home. He was very friendly and talkative. We will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Abby M.
reviews.description: We had a great time at Lara Vineyard last weekend! They were very accommodating and fit all 10 of us inside for our tasting. The owner is very personable and knowledgable. The wine tasting was perfect because it allowed us to try wine flavors we may not have otherwise. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Katie L.
reviews.description: This place is so cute and quaint! We went here for a bachelorette party and it was so intimate and great wine!! Food was amazing!! Owners were very nice! Lots of very cute little areas to just enjoy some wine and talk!

reviews.author: Lo M.
reviews.description: It was ok. Not much variety in their own wines, they seemed to be out if a lot. I came here because it was highly recommended and it was a let down. They do also have wines from a different winery but I'd rather just go directly to the source. They do have food which is also ok, pizza is nothing special. They also limit your time inside at table to like an hour if I remem correctly.

reviews.author: Julie S.
reviews.description: Our group of fifty plus friends gathered here yesterday. We bought two meat trays and a few glasses of wine and at least one wine tasting among six ladies. The meat and cheese trays are big enough for three people. We don't actually eat that much but, anyway, the peach wine and the Cabernet are definitely worth the trip. We were seated at the pavilion, and it was a record hot day for Oct. Also, finding this can be a challenge because their sign is not a stand out. I'd recommend this to any group but not on record hot day. They offered Brie but we're all in agreement to go again another day when it's COOL and getting the Brie.

reviews.author: Shelly R.
reviews.description: A beautiful location for private events  with wonderful wine and delicious brick oven pizza. Make reservations for special events. Great owners!

reviews.author: Hailey W.
reviews.description: LOVE this vineyard. Gorgeous view, the best service and great wine! The owners are so kind and passionate about what they do. Also the food is amazing! We will definitely be back, and will recommend this vineyard to anyone visiting San Antonio.

reviews.author: Chris W.
reviews.description: Awesome winery! The tasting is $15 and includes a glass and 6 samples (our samples were closer to a half glass than a "tasting" portion!). Every wine was wonderful, but our favorites were the Zinpom and cucumber sauvignon blanc. The facilities are amazing and offer plenty of seating with great views of the surrounding hills. The owner, Mike Lara, and his staff were all incredibly friendly and accommodating. We bought a bottle of the Zinpom, and will definitely be returning!

reviews.author: Shawnston F.
reviews.description: Great small place to have some wine with your significant other or your friends. Their wine is Awesome and the couple that owns it are very knowledgeable and fun. 6 tasting for $15 is a great price and we even got a chance to try their wine made from a hibiscus flower (no grapes) it was really good.

reviews.author: Valerie F.
reviews.description: This was our first wine tasting ever and we had no idea what to expect but this experience far exceeded our expectation thanks to Michael Lara, his wife, and their wonderful staff. The wine was excellent, we did a wine tasting for an affordable 12 dollars a person and Michael Lara came over and introduced himself and gave us complimentary pairings (strawberries and olives) so we'd have a better tasting experience. The vineyard was beautiful, the wine and the conversation with the friendly and personable staff (specifically Tara) was amazing. Overall a really fun experience with great people, I bought a bottle of their seasonal Strawberry blush wine, and we will be back next month!

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: Winery on the Gruene is the perfect little spot to grab a glass of wine and relax.   If you've been to Gruene you know parking can be a little bit of a nightmare, that is why we love to come to this place since they have their own parking and is also located near the entrance to the town. They have both indoor and outdoor seating, with a cute little garden which is great for photos during spring. They have a decent selection of wines, which you can purchase by the glass or a bottle. If you are hungry, they also have a BBQ food truck but is not always open. Last but no least, if you are parent searching for a changing table, this is not the place for you. We had to change our baby inside our car, which was a little annoying since it was 90+ degrees outside.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: I'm hesitant to call this a winery because they don't grow their grapes however all of these stars are location location location. They're right on the Guadalupe River in downtown historic Gruene TX. If you're having a bridal party, etc. this is an ideal spot with great social distancing and a recently added BBQ Food Truck. I'm not giving it more stars because 1) they're not growing grapes and 2) I'm really not impressed with their products BUT I don't like sweet wines which they specialize in from the looks of their menu. Their service was impeccable and quick and attentive even though it was a busy Saturday. Dog and kid friendly. Cheese and crackers available.

reviews.author: Melissa L.
reviews.description: Love this place.  Great wine and great place to relax. The employees are very friendly. We have a ball every time we come out here.

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: I love Winery On The Gruene.  I served tastings here as an employee back in 2014 when I first moved to New Braunfels.  This little gem makes delicious wine and the staff make you feel like family.  I always visit Winery On The Gruene when I return to Texas.  I love the Malbec that they make.

reviews.author: Cheyenne L.
reviews.description: Ughhh. Betsey was the worst. She was so rude. The Chardonnay was awful. Seriously, it's so bad and does not taste like Chardonnay. I gave her a $5 tip on a $5 glass of wine. She poured it in a plastic cup and I asked for a glass. She told me a wine glass would be $2 additional. OK! I just gave you a $100% tip, not happening.  Only reason this place is getting an additional star is bc the hostess was sweet. Don't waste your time on this place, it's crap. Also, be prepared to wear a mask and not get good service.

reviews.author: Courtney B.
reviews.description: Recall when I said I had reviews in my drafts? Ughs, this one is from 2018 (don't judge me).   Winery on the Gruene is a small 'boutique' style winery that makes vino on the premise. There are a variety of vino's to sample at a reasonable price (4 tastings for only $4.00). If you know what you want and are a true vino drinker like me, you can 'go for it' and just order a glass (Vino Blanco in my case, $5.00 per glass; see my receipt).  The vino selection here is decent and the customer service is even better. The only facet about this location that is not great is the lack of room inside when you go for a tasting. However, if you have time to come here and have a glass of vino while you sit outside and enjoy a nice spring day, you will not be sorry.   Happy Drinking!

reviews.author: Lindsey R.
reviews.description: This has quickly become my go-to spot. The tastings here are 4 for $6 and then $1 each after that-- and you keep the cute glass, what a deal! Pictured is the wine-a-rita, mix your favorite wine with a frozen margarita mix. These wines are seriously delicious. I'm usually not into fruity wines, but these are done right and are amazing. The employees are super friendly and it's a good time every time we go. There's even a bbq food truck in the parking lot if you get hungry!  Dog friendly patio, with some more secluded picnic benches if you'd like. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Melissa C.
reviews.description: What a cute little winery at the end of the street on the corner. They have outside seating and a nice area to sit and hang out. Unfortunately this was not the wine for me. They were sweet and a lot of fruit wines. If this your thing it's great. Otherwise nice staff and great help.

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: Wow, how have I not written a review about Winery on the Gruene?! It's like my best friend's favorite place to go in Gruene so I've actually been so many times... We've been visiting since they were at the original location down the street like ten years ago in one of the new strip centers on the outskirts of the little village of Gruene! Winery on the Gruene got lucky when this location became available, right in the center of Gruene!  Winery on the Gruene is located just up the hill from Guadalupe River about a block west of Gruene Hall. Great location, easy to find. Lots of room to sit inside or out. There is even space upstairs to sit or rent out for private parties.  All the staff have always been amazing... Thank you! That is always one of the reasons to go back to any business.   Winery on the Gruene is not a vineyard. Most grapes are not from Texas. Maybe not even any. That is my only complaint as I like to keep my wines local, although that is what works for these guys. They are not limited in their creations. They purchase grapes from all across the country to make their wines. They have a large selection on their menu, so you will find something you like. Winery on Gruene specializes in these sweet fruity wines, which is one of the reasons why my bestie LOVE them!  My favorite is Blackberrry Merlot. On my last visit for Tami C.'s birthday surprise, that is all I had... no need to sample, just give me a big full glass and I'll be a happy camper!   Yeah, you  know I'll be back for some of that Blackberry Merlot!

reviews.author: Taylor L.
reviews.description: Great romantic place with decent tasting prices.  The wine was great and fruity.. my husband and I didn't feel the alcohol until later  but it was a great time.   Staff was very personable and fun to talk to.

reviews.author: Max G.
reviews.description: Wine, Food , and atmosphere was good! Social distancing, masks, and friendly people. The BBQ was great and the staff is so sweet! We had the BBQ Mac and Cheese was awesome!

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: Love this area and the wine was delish too!   Beautiful outdoor space tucked right in the corner of town.    Super friendly staff - my lady did not ask about my wine taste. The menu is pretty detailed and you could ask questions. Large selection about 30+ wines.   You purchase 4 wines for $4 and they have cute souvenir wine glasses. And other cute merchandise.   Merlot was my favorite. I didn't buy bc I wasn't sure about getting it home!   Check this place out if you are in the area!

reviews.author: Timothy W.
reviews.description: One and done.  First time visit yesterday day will be our last.  Wine was decent.  Server was lousy with zero personality and no desire to do anything more than ring you up for your purchase.  Told her we were first timers and her response was do you want to do a wine tasting, a glass or a bottle.  Told her 2 glasses.  Which  kind?  How about showing me the menu?  All with a frown and no smile or welcome.  The covered patio was not comfortable or aesthetically pleasing either.  Better places to spend my money in Gruene.

reviews.author: Martie E.
reviews.description: Very friendly and knowledgeable, being very careful about social distancing, and tasting prices very reasonable. We purchased the Sweet Red Memories. We will definitely stop again the next time we are in the Hill Country!

reviews.author: Tamara C.
reviews.description: So my experience was around wine grown on property not this type of  winery where the grapes are imported from other growers then produces different flavors of wine. Very charming staff and was helpful on wine tasting. We choose four wines to taste from their menu and have different emo fave on what we thought of the wine. I must say the tasting serving are healthy pour and provide the opportunity to enjoy a little more of each wine.  For me most of the wine was somewhat sweet and berry tasting as the Merlot wine has a hint of sweet berry. Reminded me of when I was had my first drink of Boonesfarm wine but not that sweet...lol.  Charming with that modern industrial farm decor.  I would come back to just sit on the porch with glass of vino. Cheers.

reviews.author: Melanie U.
reviews.description: Yes to finally finding wine that I like! My best friend comes here frequently and was excited to bring me when I visited for the weekend. I'm not a wine drinker at all, so I only go for the sweet tasting liquids. These fruit wines are so fun and delightful, and they had a great deal on flights ($4/4 samples, $1 for each additional sample). They have indoor and outdoor seating, and service was attentive and helpful. I definitely plan on ordering some wine online!

reviews.author: Alysha M.
reviews.description: What yummy fruit infused wines!!! We all took home bottles after our tasting bc they were so good AND so cheap! Plus, the service was amazing.  I do wish they had a bit more space- the tasting area can feel cramped. Feels like they need a bit of an upgrade/refurbish!

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: Super friendly staff. They offer a wide variety of wine. While this place is cute, quaint, and has awesome customer service, the wine we sampled was too sweet for my taste. We did a sampling and I chose a variety and was not impressed. This is just my palette though. If you're a sweet wine drinker, you will love this place. They do offer cheap tastings and a free glass which is also cool. I say go and see for yourself. Like I said the staff makes it a great experience.

reviews.author: Gage J.
reviews.description: The wine-arita was really good. I recommend the blackberry infused wine for it. I am rating this 3 stars due to the sarcastic worker inside. After witnessing multiple people walking in and out of the place, I followed suit and upon entering the establishment, I was greeted to a yell of, "Go to the window! There is a big sign outside!" Be respectful. I was just following suit trying to do the right thing during this "pandemic".

reviews.author: Crystal H.
reviews.description: Cheap wine!!! $4 wine tastings, great place to sample wine and they serve you well. Friendly staff and tasty wines. Always a great stop while in Gruene.

reviews.author: Jeff U.
reviews.description: Loved the wines we tasted  Great place  Taking 4 bottles home with us  Recommend you stop by  And take a bottle home  With you

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: I have heard nothing but good things about this place so I was pretty stoked to check it out. The long line of people waiting BEFORE it even opened and the hundreds of preorders waiting outside had me excited to try their wine.   I was genuinely disappointed. The staff was friendly, incredibly thankful for the support and were moving fast so everyone wasn't waiting to long in the Texas heat. The disappointment was sadly the wine.   We ordered 3 different types: cranberry, blueberry, and the Malbec. The fruit ones were all watered down tasting. If you handed me the cranberry or blueberry flavored one and told me to guess, I'd honestly have no idea what I was even drinking. $15 a bottle and it tastes worse than the $5 ones you can get at Hâ€‘Eâ€‘B. I'm still crossing my fingers that the Malbec one is good.   Overall I do want to try them again just based on service because maybe I didn't order the best flavors or wine they have there BUT if the wine I got today is any indication on their products then I'm not sure why they're so popular.

reviews.author: Charlene P.
reviews.description: We had a great time here today. Wine tastings are back. I loved that you get 6 with a glass for just $10. The owner was very nice and informative. The outdoor area was relaxing as well. Definitely a fun and safe way to spend a Saturday afternoon.

reviews.author: Elaine W.
reviews.description: Great award winning wines! Cute place, good atmosphere, friendly owner.  You have to try a Wine slushy.  I always take my family and friends here when they come to visit and whenever I go visit them I have to bring them a couple of bottles. You can't go wrong here!

reviews.author: Jessica B.
reviews.description: Great, unique wine for a good price. Great outside atmosphere with live bands. Definitely perfect for good weather day or night, highly recommend making a trip here

reviews.author: Emily T.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place to buy bottles of wine. My favorite red wine they have is called the Black Forest Port--it tastes like chocolate covered cherries. Another sweet wine they have is the Strawberry Riesling, which is another favorite. My husband likes the Brunello, which is a much drier wine.  The location is beautiful, and the staff is very friendly and let us try different wines to see what we liked best. They also offer a military discount.   I highly recommend this winery. You can pop in just to buy a bottle or you can relax with friends and family and enjoy a glass of wine. There is indoor and outdoor seating available.

reviews.author: Mariana V.
reviews.description: Everything about Helotes Creek winery says southern charm. From the people to the ambiance. It is located in the old Bandera area and is surrounded by little cute antique shops/ bakeries/ and boutiques! There's are tons of tables and chairs outside on the patio under huge oak trees!   When walking inside you are greeted by all the workers at the desk. Once there you are handed a menu with the all the wines and the price for a glass/bottle.  At the bottom of the menu there is an option for wine tasting which includes trying which ever wine you would like and keeping a free wine glass for just $8! I did this option to get a chance to try all the yummy wine! They do offer discounts for teachers and military!   The majority of the wines they hand craft in house are sweet, and a few dry wines.  They get their grapes from California to Texas and Italy for some of their specialty wines! Aside from all the wines on the menu that they have all year around they also make seasonal wines, ports and frozen wine!   After trying majority of the wine. I picked my favorite, the Strawberry Riesling which was absolutely delicious. The strawberry wasn't over powering at all, I highly recommended you trying it and taking home a bottle. Or even drinking it at the winery outside or inside for a relaxing evening! My favorite part besides trying all the different wines was taking my frozen strawberry/watermelon wine outside and sitting on a patio chair in the shade while listening to Frank Sinatra playing over the speakers. I was truly in my own little heaven! I will be back on Wednesday for ladies night!

reviews.author: Patty O.
reviews.description: This was my favorite place to get wine until this weekend.  Very crowded and owner thinks it's a joke to wear a face mask.  Shameful

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: This place was nice and quiet for a Saturday night. Yummy wine! I liked that we could pick the wine we wanted to taste for our tasting. The ladies working there were super nice. I wish I lived closer. They said they have  discounts for teachers on Thursdays and there's a market surrounding their winery here in Helotes every first weekend of the month. You can walk around with your wine and shop.

reviews.author: Ruben S.
reviews.description: This small winery in Old Town Helotes is a priceless jem. Colleen and Gloria operate the winery like your part of the family. Their known for making a variety of sweet wines, Reds, Whites and their delicious Port wines. The hit this summer is thier frozen wine slushies. They always have two rotating flavors and you can get them as a swirl if you like. On weekends you can get Sangria pitchers with fruit chunks added. If you get hungry order some cheese food trays to pair along with the wines. The place has plenty of seating inside and outside with oak trees providing plenty of shade. Make sure you check out thier merchandise, koozies and mini tumblers as well. You'll be happy you came and you'll definitely be back for more.

reviews.author: Jo B.
reviews.description: Great people who treat you like family(we love Esteban!), good wine,and an adorable, sweet bulldog, Bella, as your welcoming committee, make HCW the perfect stop! My husband and I like very different wines,and we found a chilled glass of both our favorites here. Step out to enjoy the weather and comfort of the porch, or stay inside and enjoy a fun conversation with the owners and employees, locals, and other visitors; whatever type of experience you want, you will find here. We look forward to stopping by for a visit and a glass of wine, any time we are in the area. Go and enjoy!

reviews.author: Kristine M.
reviews.description: miserable owner. every business is trying a little harder during this difficult time. made 2 trips there because the hours changed. she didn't appreciate us coming back, and blamed the governor cause she isn't creative enough to attract business. not worth it!!!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: This winery is quaint. And it's close to where we live. Happy that I can go here instead of driving all the way to Hill Country. We came here for my bday so I guess it was a perfect time to come!   It wasn't busy at all. We got service right away, soon as we walked in. I had the wine tasting and the glass came with the price. I tasted 2 dry reds and 3 sweets. I ended up ordering a glass of Brunello and ordered my husband their Peach Chardonnay since he loves peaches.  I bought 3 of their wines and 4 of their summer size wine (similar to a beer bottle that's equivalent to 2.5 glasses of wine). Highly recommend this winery. The only con is they don't have that much wine selections and most of their wines are semi sweet- sweet. We will come here again in the future.

reviews.author: Yasi H.
reviews.description: Super sweet little winery... its perfect because its close to home. Host told me area has  festivals first Saturday of every month this fall. Cant wait to come again. Very cute and calm atmosphere

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: Great wine slushies! We went today and sat outside and enjoyed the weather. I picked the swirl, mixed blueberry and peach, slushy. It was a great choice and recommend it!

reviews.author: Frank L.
reviews.description: If your ever in these parts be sure to visit Helotes Creek Winery this place is top notch, Glorida is the bomb, thank you for making our first wine tasting a great one, Cheers!

reviews.author: Beth G.
reviews.description: Oh my goodness I love this wine. Reasonably priced too.  The Blueberry Shiraz is my favorite. No added sugar makes this fruity wine excellent. Great friendly owners. And I was not ashamed I know little about wines- but I know what I like!  My snooty wine friend liked it too. Can't say enough about this place. Got some samples, bought a few bottles, and now I regret not having purchased more to take home to Florida!  Will be back. Soon I hope! Gotta get Christmas presents.

reviews.author: Chris D.
reviews.description: We did the wine tasting, which was a very reasonably priced $10, that included a take home wine glass.  The pomegranate wine was our favorite!  All the wines we sampled were sweet and delicious!  If you like sweet wines, this is a great little place to stop!

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: Awesome place. Great customer service!  Absolutely LOVED this port!!!   Definitely pick up a couple bottles of the Blackberry Merlot, and Blueberry Shiraz!!  Thank you Gloria for the great customer service.

reviews.author: Sydney L.
reviews.description: Wine selection is awesome! The strawberry wine is amazing. The shop is small but they have a great selection. The workers will let you sample the wines and they are very nice and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Stacy T.
reviews.description: What an amazing, hidden gem near Canyon Lake! First, all the wines are made by natural fermentation (aka natural wine) with organic grapes- this winery is even featured in a Natural Wines book. The owner is so friendly and also has the sweetest dog. The decor is unique, interesting, and definitely sets a mood. The wine is delicious- we had a bottle of the "on-site-only" Lambrusco Pet-Nat, and we bought a couple others to-go. All the local websites were advertising Dry Comal Creek as the only local winery (and I'm sure it's great), but we stumbled upon La Cruz de Comal because Dry Comal closed at 5 and La Cruz was still open until 6pm. We will DEFINITELY be back for more organic, natural wine!

reviews.author: Cici P.
reviews.description: We stopped by on our road trip. Bought 2 bottle to give to family member as a gift. Cost us almost $140 for 2 bottles. So mad when our family members open the paper wrap. The corks on both bottle are soaking wet and cracked. The wines tasted nasty. 1 bottle (supposed to be sweet) taste like nasty medicine. The other one is red wine,  taste like someone opened it for a long time and then put the cork back, we didn't want to drink it anymore even it cost us money. Because it was so nasty. I can't believe it.

reviews.author: Lin N.
reviews.description: They were friendly and have a very sweet dog to hang out with customers. Social distancing was enforced and since there were no other customers when we visited (at the beginning) they allowed us to tour the vineyard. Their wines are amazing.

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Charming owner who educated us on his background and special grapes.  We loved the sparkling black Spanish wine and enjoyed the atmosphere.  The wine was very expensive compared to wineries we've frequented on the west and east coastal areas.

reviews.author: Tracy B.
reviews.description: Great place! Lovely winery. You don't need reservations, fun to try different wines and very reasonable price to do so. Love the owner! So personable and interesting.

reviews.author: Mike K.
reviews.description: Great hidden spot in the area.  The tasting room is small but perfectly set up.  They grow their own grapes for the majority of the wine they have available. The sommelier was very knowledgeable but not too stuffy. Great stories about the wine. We brought two young kids and didn't feel out of place. No food available, but able to bring your own.

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Heaven, I'm in Heaven!  Can't say enough good things about this little winery. All wines are "natural". No additives.   The tasting room looks like a little cottage nestled in the French countryside.   The owner/winemaker, Lewis, is a piece of work. One of the most intelligent and yet one of the most obscure and eclectic people I have ever met. A true pleasure to meet and chat with.   Do yourself a favor. Check out the hours and plan to visit this little piece of heaven. You will be thrilled and so glad you did.   I highly recommend!!

reviews.author: Deeah K.
reviews.description: On our hunt to visit a unique winery in the hill country of Texas, we found La Cruz de Comal. When we drove in, right away we noticed the winery's main building and it felt like we were in France. It is an authentic European building, small and cozy and welcoming!  The owner was there to serve his 100% estate grown grapes which boast of no additional acid, sugar or sulfites to his wine. The owner, who is a retired lawyer, Mr. Dickson, calls his wine, "real wine." We tasted four wines and our favorite was the port, it had a smooth and delightful finish. There also is a sweet winery dog who loves to visit with the customers...we had a relaxing time there and would recommend it to anyone who wants to taste "Real wine."

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Such a surprise! Never been a wine connoisseur but you can definitely taste the difference between his wines and others, and worth the extra price tag by comparison to wineries in the area. The place is beautiful and the owner is full of information.

reviews.author: Keyshia J.
reviews.description: I decided to take a trip and visit this place. I researched all the vineyards nearby but this place not only had the highest reviews, it seemed to have a nice scenery. The interior and exterior has french touches to it and you can tell each piece was well thought out.   Now the wine.... my husband and I FELL IN LOVE. At first the prices seemed to be pricey but once you do the wine tasting, you'll know why. The wine is so pure and has so much grace you have to walk out with at least a bottle (we bought three). I like wine but I'll only drink one glass because I get dizzy but when I went hope my husband and I both finished a bottle. The wine here has no sulfites and you can just taste the purity of the grapes.   Pricing: When you buy three wines the tasting fee is waived for one person ($15). The owner gave us a discount so after one wine tasting fee and 3 bottles of wine we paid around $160.   The interior is just lovely here you can just tell each piece in the room was placed there for a reason. The bathroom outside looked very old so I was very hesitant to use it but one you go in it is so cute and was not uncomfortable at all.   So, overall this place was an excellent experience!

reviews.author: Tripp D.
reviews.description: The winery is very nice but the wine is terrible. I have had some wonderful wines all over the states and in other countries. It is very obvious the owner should have stuck to being a lawyer. I understand the all natural thing. But it was awful. I tried to like even one of them or even find something interesting about at least one. With all of the time spent in Napa Valley and in France you would have thought the wines would at least be palatable. The only thing I can figure out is most of the reviewers don't drink wine. And if your thinking about going to see for yourself...I'm being nice in my descriptions.

reviews.author: Rob G.
reviews.description: How often those the owner of a great wine pore You a glass ... This the best sweet wine I have ever tasted I will be back.. With my grill, to hang out longer..

reviews.author: Calily B.
reviews.description: I love everything about this place! It's a hidden gem tucked away in the hills just south of Canyon Lake.  Lewis, the owner, is a former big-time defense attorney in Houston who found his calling to be one with the grapes and wine. Listening to him wax poetically about what he's doing differently at his vineyard gives you insight into what you're about to experience. He's also a hoot!   Instead of using commercial yeast, the wines ferment from wild yeast/bacteria on the grapes and whatever bacteria is in the HillCo air. This gives the wines an obvious farmhouse character (mild funk/horsey, slightly sour). He doesn't filter so the wines are a bit hazy and have some sediment/yeast on the bottom.   Grapes are either grown on-site or purchased from farms in the Hill Country and they don't add sulfites.  If you like traditional wines, you might not enjoy the wines that much but I still think it's worth a visit.  Tasting: $15 for 6 samples Bottles: Range from $25-$60 Times: Tasting room is open on Sat and Sun from 12p-6pm. What we bought: a bottle of Rose.  The tasting room is an adorable limestone building and the vineyard can be seen from the windows.   If you can't make it to the vineyard, Jester King Brewery just started carrying their wines in its taproom! It's a match made in heaven! Wild yeast for everyone!

reviews.author: Suzanne M.
reviews.description: So sad! A beautiful intimate winery however the owner is unapproachable and down right rude. The server was knowable about wine however the wine was awful almost undrinkable. Wine tasting cost as much or more than a tasting in Napa. So don't bother making this trip!

reviews.author: Christian M.
reviews.description: This place has the BEST wine I've tasted....period.  The tasting pours were generous and we enjoyed learning about the differences between their preparation methods versus the larger, more commercial vineyards.  I have to assume it's those differences that led to such pleasant flavors.  I've always been a red guy but found the first white I've enjoyed here.  Another first, I could really discern the various ingredients/flavors in each glass of wine, and the reds didn't have that strong bite to them.  I've been to Napa and Senoma, as well as France and Italy, and I just haven't ever enjoyed the taste of wine as much as I did during our trip to this little winery.

reviews.author: Christopher A.
reviews.description: I absolutely loved this place. The owner was such a nice man and you could tell how much pride he took in his work.   The wine was fantastic!!!!! I just left here and I can't wait to get back. I'd give this quaint little place 10 stars if I could.

reviews.author: Ashley S.
reviews.description: We just left and I'm SO confused... I don't know how our experience can be so different from all the other Yelp reviews. We just parked, shared a tasting and left in about 15 minutes because we felt kind of unwelcome and found the wines to be awful. And we wanted desperately to love this place, because it is GORGEOUS. I'd have been very easy to please to be able to spend time in this beautiful place. But the owner was kind of frosty, barely spoke to us (but was more vocal with others), didn't tell us anything (not even the names) about any of the wines. I complimented him effusively on the place when we first got there and tried to get him to chat during the tasting, but he didn't thaw. I don't know if we made him mad because we chose to share a tasting?? We would've gotten a glass or two once we found a wine we liked. We felt like we weren't wanted, which when you're sitting at the little wine counter right in front of the guy, is really uncomfortable. I could've ignored all that if one of the wines worked for us, but I hate to say it, we thought all 4 were terrible. We drink a lot of wine, not cheap or sweet ones, and none of these tasted like anything we've ever had before. I'm confused that every other reviewer LOVED them and we had such an opposite reaction. We are at a loss for the experience we just had. The winery is so so beautiful though, it rivals CA wineries. So bummed. :(

reviews.author: Marty C.
reviews.description: Go here. The wines are mostly made from grapes grown on the property by a gentleman who has studied wine making in California and France. Tasting is a good value, and the property and tasting room are gorgeous. If you like to taste and talk about fine wine, you will feel right at home. If you don't know much about wine, but want a nice country drive and wines that appeal to a variety of tastes, check it out, too.

reviews.author: Brett B.
reviews.description: One of the most beautiful wineries you will find in Texas! Very well done, it is a must see if you are anywhere close! The owner is a hoot, and the wines are very unique. This is the kind of place you could just sit at all day.

reviews.author: Sandra D.
reviews.description: This is a delicious winery!!  All natural with no sulfites, preservatives, pesticide or added yeast. The wine felt fresh and was a delight!!  We left with three bottles and will be back next time we are in the area. Ryan was there to help out and we found him to be extremely helpful!!

reviews.author: Hilary F.
reviews.description: Held a small get together here, they were wonderful hosts, really took care of our party. Good selection and variety of wines definitely something for everyone, a great addition to our community out here. Would love to go back! Definitely go for a tasting, you won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: Cathy V.
reviews.description: I googled wine tasting near me and stumbled upon this hidden gem. We are no strangers to "blink and you will miss it" type of venues and we had the pleasure of finding this one. Thanks to Google, and an adventures mind set. Much like any other wine tasting, we knew we were in for a variety of wines, but like in a safari, we were fortunate to have a exceptional guide like Alex who had the passion for the business like a matador. He prepared the line up like a narrator in a Broadway play making sure that every bottle had the proper presentation utilizing decanters, air aerators and precise attention to serving temperatures. But that aside, the attention to detail that is given to the wines before they even become a staple for us to enjoy that matured into voyage that complimented the experience.

reviews.author: Anna V.
reviews.description: Beautiful views! We got there at about 7:00 pm and I just could not believe the gorgeous views as the sun was going down. We stood there for about a good 15 minutes just admiring the beauty of the scenery. Once we made our way over to the tasting room we were promptly greeted by the staff and offered samples of a couple of their summer favorites as they were not offering tasting on that day due to a special 4th of July event. We decided to go with a bottle of "Banana Split" which was a very affordable $16 and great tasting selection (probably not for those of you who prefer sweet wines). Once we purchased our bottle we were able to go outside and continue to enjoy the beautiful scenery, live band,  very laid back patio. Like I mentioned, on the day we visited the winery was hosting a 4th of July event so there was a live band; I'm not sure that this is always an option. We had a great time and can not wait to visit again as it is only about a 30 minute drive from our home.

reviews.author: Ronnie  L.
reviews.description: This winery DID NOT disappoint. Great people with great stories. We will definitely be back again!

reviews.author: Claudiana C.
reviews.description: I had a fantastic experience with Kelly and Ken. Both were extremely personable and frequently. Ken took his time during the sampling to explain every wine and it was a great experience. Kelly provided some wonderful conversation and I will definitely be back. Come and check it out, you won't be disappointed!

reviews.author: Christine J.
reviews.description: Got two wines from here about a year ago. Both were skunked when we opened them. Very disappointed with this winery!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: I have nothing but good things to say about this small, privately owned winery. I was pleasantly surprised by how good their wines were. The tasting room is small, but this is not a very busy winery. The owners are knowledgeable and friendly. I especially enjoyed their dry Riesling. I will definitely return in the future

reviews.author: Julie V.
reviews.description: We were pleasantly welcomed by Dr. Matt, one of the co-owners, and did a wine tasting. He doesn't usually hang behind the counter, but it was perfect to hear about all the wines in detail and sit out with him. Beautiful winery and heartwarming company. Would highly recommend. We'll be back again!

reviews.author: Cristina R.
reviews.description: Loved, loved, loved this place! Wine and people were lovely. Ken took us through our wine tasting like a pro and, I can't say I've ever enjoyed one more. We will be returning with as many people as we can drum up for our next visit to this quaint, pleasant surprise tucked away in our not too distant vicinity.

reviews.author: Krystal H.
reviews.description: A true gem of the quaint city of Castroville! Matt has perfected the Blanc Du Bois with notes of pear and lemongrass. He explained each of his wines extensively and made us feel like we had been friends of his for years. The tastings included wine glasses to take home, and we ended up purchasing 4 bottles of wine, enjoying one right there in the tasting room while getting to know the owner.  We plan on visiting here at least once a year to see how it's grown and to stock up on fantastic wine! This winery is a must for anyone traveling through Castroville!

reviews.author: Serena M.
reviews.description: These guys care about their craft. The wine is serious. Adult conversation in a fun atmosphere is hard to find. We will be back. A lot. They are about to open an outdoor area to take advantage of their spectacular view. Go here. Have fun. Buy wine. You won't regret it.

reviews.author: Gypsy R.
reviews.description: Great place for some wine! These guys know what they're doing! Ask for a chemistry lesson in wine while you're there. A wealth of fun knowledge about wine and very personable. Will definitely go here again!

reviews.author: Pam F.
reviews.description: Fun afternoon experience. The owners are knowledgeable and very personable. Willing to share descriptions of the different types of wines that were available. Definitely worth a visit. Although we do not normally like the dry reds theirs are a bit milder and more enjoyable

reviews.author: Christopher F.
reviews.description: My entire experience with Craft Cruiser was top shelf.  I booked this tour for my buddy's bachelor party, and Dan was super helpful throughout the entire planning experience (Covid caused some changes in group size and tour time.)  Mike was a super knowledgeable tour guide, and his choice in music for the van was fantastic. Mike was also super personable and answered the entire groups questions (Even if they'd been asked earlier in the trip )  The breweries and staff (Especially Dos Sirenos) that we went to were great, and the beer was even better.   The whole experience was fantastic, and If I am ever back in San Antonio I will definitely re-book.   P.S. Make sure to eat at least once on the tour so you can enjoy more beer

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: We booked craft cruiser for a bachelorette party in Fredericksburg and it was amazing! Everything was taken care of for us- we were picked up from our air bnb and driven to 3 wineries, then driven home. Dan did a lot of legwork making sure that wineries were open due to CV19, and letting us know what to expect. He even made reservations for us at two of the wineries we visited. In a very uncertain time, he took care of everything for us and everything went smoothly so we were able to have a good time and not stress about planning the wine tours! He made recommendations for places we could go and customized our tour for us. Our driver John was awesome! He was very friendly and took great care of our group (including opening the van door for us). He was very responsive via text inbetween each stop and always had the van pulled up and ready for us when we were ready to go. He also was our stand in photographer for our group at each location and was a TOTAL trooper. All around an amazing experience whether you're wanting a wine tour or brewery tour in the San Antonio or hill country area. And to make things EVEN better they cost about 1/3 of the price of other tours. Check them out!

reviews.author: Melissa R.
reviews.description: We heard about this through a mutual friend of ours and wanted to do something different since my fiancee Steve was turning 40, so a big milestone birthday!  Dan was so helpful through the whole process from start to finish.  He provided a private link for me to send to our guests so they can each pay separately and choose an all inclusive for us beer connoisseurs or a pay as you go option.  We wanted to thank our guests and provide lunch we opted for Smoke Shack which delicious!  They were there right on time, plenty of food and even packed up our leftovers for us.  They picked us up and dropped us off so we didn't have to worry about driving which made the experience better as we all were able to mingle and chat.  We had an array of ages fro 21 to 65 and everyone commented on what a fantastic time they had they never knew San Antonio had something like this to offer.  Our drivers were laid back which is what we wanted but also professional and courteous.  We have some bachelor/bachelorette parties to plan in the future and will definitely keep Craft Cruisers in mind for our future celebrations.  Also a guest of mine already asked for contact info to start planning a tour of their own so what does that tell you! Thanks so much for making Steve's 40th birthday one to remember!

reviews.author: Julia H.
reviews.description: We had a fantastic day with Mike! We ended up being the only people on our tour, Mike brought an  awesome board game for us to  play and had a lot of fun! Everything from pick up  to drop off was seamless and it was a great way to get  off the Riverwalk and see some other parts of the city!

reviews.author: Callen M.
reviews.description: Craft Cruiser was amazing! I scheduled a private wine tour in Fredericksburg for a bachelorette party and everyone loved it! Our driver Matthew was absolutely fantastic and super professional. With other transportation services I have felt rushed and the driver is distant, but that was not my experience with Craft Cruiser! Matthew was super friendly and very knowledgeable of the area. He suggested wineries and told us what their best wines to try were. He never rushed us. He would drop us off and go in and make sure that we were set up with a tasting before he would hang back and wait for us. There was never a time that we had to wait for him, all we had to do was shoot a text and say we were heading out, and he would be there right out front for us. And if we were taking extra long, he would come in and check up on us to make sure that all was well. I will definitely be using Craft Cruiser again and recommend it to all my friends. Their private tour made our bachelorette party one to never forget!! Thank you Craft Crusier!

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: I was super excited when I came across the SA Craft Cruiser on Instagram! I mean what better way to spend a gorgeous San Antonio day than with beer and pizza?! I had never been to ANY of the stops on the tour, so I was looking forward to knocking some things off my to do list! Tours are always the best way to fulfill that list! I did the ALL-Inclusive tour. The ALL Inclusive tour includes:  *Safe transportation to each brewery *Brewery tours *Souvenir *Unlimited tastings *A meal on Saturday and Sunday tours  Saturday Tour: *Alamo Beer Co *Freetail Brewing Co.  *Busted Sandal Brewing Co.  Start time: 11am  The tour met up at Pizza Italia (a local pizzeria) located at 3023 Thousand Oaks Rd. Upon arrival the group was greeted warmly by Dan our host with most! We walked into Pizza Italia and were led to the bar where we were given a few samples chosen by Dan from the 30+ beers on tap. Dan offered samples on anything we wanted to try after that.  While we sat at the bar, pizzas were being ordered and waivers were signed for tour permissions. The pizzas came out pretty fast and we were directed to our table where pitchers of water were waiting along with cups. Tea and sodas were offered as well. A variety of pizzas were ordered for our group, from pepperoni and sausage to veggie! I loooove ranch with my pizza, so Dan must have read my mind, he came and placed cups of ranch on the tables. The ranch was so good!  I had the pep/sausage and it was delicious! Dan made sure we had everything we needed during our lunch! We had plenty of time to eat and converse with the people on the tour. After a great lunch it was time to jump into the Craft Cruiser.  I must admit when I saw the Craft Cruiser I wondered how we were all going to fit in there but we did and VERY comfortably! The Craft Cruiser was very clean and airconditioned well.  Dan had great tunes playing and took requests as well for our drive to the breweries.  Second stop was Alamo Beer Co. located at 202 Lamar.  While I've had their beer (Golden Ale is my fave) I had never been to Alamo.  I ordered a beer flight and each of the beers I tried were really good! Alamo Beer Co. is super cool and I enjoyed it.  (Sidenote: I had a massive headache that started before the tour and once Dan knew I had a headache he found some tylenol for me while we were at Alamo which was super nice!) Again we had plenty of time to enjoy the atmosphere and enjoy more beer!   Third stop had us at Freetail Brewing Co. located at 2000 S. Presa St. Freetail was very spacious! I loved the day of the dead themed art on the walls! It was very bright and super cool. I ordered a flight to start off with and all the pours were good! Dan made sure we were taken care and asked us if we needed more beer. Freetail has free popcorn, which was delicious and perfect with our beers!   Last but surely not least our final stop was the Veteran owned Busted Sandal Brewing Co. located at 7114 Oaklawn Drive. I honestly was not aware of this brand of craft beer until my tour. The tasting room was very small BUT they are working on expanding so you need not worry! We were totally comfy and the guests at the bar who were already there welcomed our group.   Mike DiCicco, founder, brewer and USAF Veteran greeted us in the back for the brewery tour. We learned alot about Busted Sandal, the process and future plans. We were able to see the canning process up close and personal which was super exciting! I never realized how much goes into the process of canning! I had a chance to weigh a few cans as well. Dan worked the canning line while we were there to help out. I learned that he volunteers at Busted Sandal to help support local which is truly amazing! After the tour we had more beer and were able to keep our pint glass! (If you bring your glass on Wednesdays pints are $3) Sadly, it was time to depart from our final stop and head back to our starting point Pizza Italia.    End Time: 5pm  Dan handed out koozies before we said goodbye! I totally enjoyed the tour! It was absolutely fantastic! I had the opportunity to visit places I've never been to, I met really cool people, and had a plethora of beer! I highly recommend the tour to people who live here or who are visiting! From couples, to friends, birthdays, bachelor/bachelorette parties, just because, and Sunday Funday it is the perfect outing! Dan was AMAZING and made the tour fantastic, he made sure we were all happy! I look forward to future tours!

reviews.author: Alex S.
reviews.description: What an enjoyable experience! If you're looking for a legit brewery tour where you'll get to barhop at all your favorite local brewery's, start off with some legit pizza , and end with a great tour and souvenir glass, this is your tour to hit up!   I was very impressed with the smoothness of the tour and how it flowed throughout the day. It began at 11:00 am. and ended at 5:00 pm. Every Brewery we went to, we got to sample the drinks, and drink as much as we wanted all while having our DD ( craft cruiser shuttle us around town ). It was absolutely wonderful. I would definitely go on this with several buddies of mine who are beer drinkers. They also have wine tours as well! It was a clean, organized, and efficient tour with a knowledgeable operator.

reviews.author: D T.
reviews.description: So much fun!! I picked this tour for my birthday, and loved it all! James was our driver, he was great and knowledgeable. Pizza Italia was delicious, we even ordered to go when we got back. All the breweries were fantastic and I'll definitely be returning.

reviews.author: Ninfa M.
reviews.description: What we liked: got to meet a great group of total strangers who also booked the tour and we had a blast. We did the non all-inclusive which was good for me because I'm not much of a beer drinker but I had booked this for my boyfriend's birthday. Dan was super cool and made us all feel comfortable and safe as we made our way to the different micro breweries.  Everything was timely and we didn't feel rushed. We used groupon to get a rate discount. Even if we had paid full price it would have a been good deal to not have to worry about driving everywhere. The meet up place Pizza  Italia was also great - great pizza and it had a big variety micro beers.  I would have liked more upfront information about the beers each bar offers and how to get the most at each bar. For example you can order a flight if you want to sample different beers or you don't know what you like. At the first bar we each ordered a full glass only to not really like it. So we ended up switching glasses! Ha!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Still amazing as ever. I love their wines and I love sharing them with friends and family. They are always so kind and accommodating and I just love supporting local. A few years ago, my husband and I bottled our own wine wand added labels for our wedding party- it was so fun since we had some bottles of wine with our parents while bottling and were also allowed to bring in snacks and sandwiches.  They have updated their back outside area and allow doggos- yay!

reviews.author: Andres S.
reviews.description: Stopped by for wine tasting for the first time with my wife and Travis helped us out. He made the experience very enjoyable and made us feel very comfortable.. would definitely recommend. Cost/quality was pretty reasonable and just want to praise the service that was provided.. we will definitely make our way back :)

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Very quaint, several seats and small tables. Service very friendly and knowledgeable  Wine and you can bottle and label your own for gifts  Couple things to eat Only one restroom for both genders  Very loud and echoey if you are sensitive.

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Very nice staff.  They know the wine very well and are very helpful.  Honestly, the wine is "ok" but, the rest of the experience makes it worthwhile!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: What a gem.   All the wines we tasted were amazing.  And staff (Spring) was super kind and attentive.  Thinking about joining their wine club this was such a chill place.

reviews.author: Ursula F.
reviews.description: This was a great place to try a flight of wines. They make them themselves but with grapes from other places than TX since TX grapes are not so consistent. Our server was Spring and she was very knowledgeable and fun. She helped us have an excellent time there.

reviews.author: Debi L.
reviews.description: This was an awesome place to relax and have a glass of wine after a day traveling the TX backroads.  Would make it a point to stop in whenever I'm in town.

reviews.author: Keyana S.
reviews.description: This was a very nice setting! The people are warm and welcoming. John was our server I believe and he was super knowledgeable and had him pick a few wine flavors for my flight, which were amazing! Got introduced to this lovely place by someone and will definitely be returning soon with my friends!

reviews.author: Hope C.
reviews.description: Love Love Love Water 2 Wine, New Braunfels.  The wines are yummy, but the staff is what really makes this a favorite.  Brandy, Johnny, and Marty are The Best!  This little wine bar is the perfect spot for friends to gather.   Easy parking in front or in the back.  Wonderful selection of tasty wines.  Fast and friendly service!

reviews.author: Jessica N.
reviews.description: This is a small little winery, but I love it! Super cute and quiet. The wine selection was great. I loved that you could make your own wine labels for special Occasions. I thought that was super cute. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable.

reviews.author: Bethany W.
reviews.description: This is my favorite local wine place. People there are so nice and personable and the wine is always amazing.

reviews.author: Melissa H.
reviews.description: always a great time here, my happy place! Brandi and Johnny makes you feel at home always!

reviews.author: Justin B.
reviews.description: Free tastings-- need I say more. Good ambiance, knowledgeable and friendly staff, good selection of wine and decent prices. You can create your own wine and customs labels.  No food available, other than the standard chips and crackers; but you can bring in food with you. Definitely worth a stop and taste.

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Amazing service. Three free samples. An amazing selection of wines. Adorable gifts to purchase. Very relaxing cozy and comfortable. Downtown location.  I can't add more to what has already been said by previous Yelpers. The staff is still knowledgeable and answers all of your questions with ease. The staff was extremely accommodating.  The server kept moving back and forth, checking on us, pouring wines at other tables, and had a smile on his face.   I had one of his award winning wines.  And, my friend tried a different award winner.  They did not disappoint.  This cute lil gem accommodates the vino aficionado as well as the novice.

reviews.author: Monique L.
reviews.description: We have been going to W2W for years. We love the wine with no sulfates, no nitrates because they make their wines on site. They have all different kinds of wine so you will be able to find something you enjoy, especially since you get some free tasting. We go a least once a month for a date night. Some Saturday nights they have live music. They have a wine club you can join to get bottles at a discount and many more benefits. You should visit if you like wine.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: Thanks for sharing the twin river red with me. My new favorite.  This is the funnest place in to for some great vino, friends and laughs! Love you all, Steve

reviews.author: Greg Z.
reviews.description: Disappointing after trying to go to water 2 wine two other times. We finally made it a day they were open only to be disappointed in the wine. No one in our party of 4 liked any of the samples enough to want a glass.. So we just moved on

reviews.author: Donna S.
reviews.description: Another fun place to try wine. As a bonus, you can make your own batch and come back in 45 days with friends for a bottling party! What a cool concept!! Great wine and super nice people.

reviews.author: Shani S.
reviews.description: After I'd stopped in to ensure I had the necessary items for a trip (ie: a few bottles of really awesome wine) at the Water2Wine in Austin... I forgot them at home.  Yep.  That's me.   However, Water 2 Wine in Seguin came to my rescue!   Not only are the folks here really friendly, they go out of their way to make you feel welcome and make sure you leave happy.   The place is very welcoming and warm, as well.   If we ever take a road trip, I have to admit, this might be stop on the way.  :)

reviews.author: Ruben I.
reviews.description: What a great hole in the wall I. The middle of downtown New Braunfels! Came wine tasting for my mother in laws birthday and enjoyed each wine we tried!
