There was 5 of us and the first 3 wines we tried were free and let me say, we were smart about it and ended up tasting 15 wines between us 5, each getting a different wine and passing it around each try. I highly recommend the diablo wine! It's a dry red but super super smooth! The whites were all amazing! But the sangria's? #givemeabarrel they both were excellent! I will definitely have to bring my grandma back to wine taste!

reviews.author: Darla W.
reviews.description: We had an awesome Missions Tour with Perry today!  We love history and were so impressed with his knowledge and enthusiastic way of sharing stories of San Antonio. Do not pass up the opportunity to learn about this fascinating city from this amazing guide.

reviews.author: Dan R.
reviews.description: We had a very enjoyable day yesterday, thanks to our memorable driver Lindy, the beautiful Texas Hill Country, the historic LBJ Ranch and National Park, the bustling town of Fredericksburg, the tiny but charming town of Luchenback, and the hospitality and great wines of Sister Creek Vineyards in Sisterdale. All this for $109.  We had 8 folks on the bus, so it was a very informal day where you got to know everyone. There were some issues getting a few of the tourists and the bus to the same rendez-vous point, but Lindy patiently made the phone calls and figured out where the parties were.  The mini van gave us a very comfortable ride and Lindy was an absolute joy and delight to hang out with for a day.  The only quibbles I have about the tour was a) the AC could have been better, and 2) I wish the seats would have had headrests for a snooze on the way back.  Well done, Gray Line and thanks for a memorable day.

reviews.author: Rumit P.
reviews.description: My friend and I bought the San Antonio Explorer Pass from Groupon at $84, which included one premium attraction and two nonpremium attractions; one of the premium attractions was the LBJ Ranch tour. The tour is operated by Gray Line Tours bus service so this review is for that only, not of the Explorer Pass and not of Groupon.  We really enjoyed the tour! I wouldn't say it's worth $109, but a Google search will yield you lots of partners selling the tour tickets at a discounted rate.   Regarding booking, we tried to call the toll-free number on a Sunday for a Monday tour (need to reserve at least 24 hours ahead), but the office was closed. However, the automated message directed us to a cell phone number to call to reach someone directly for booking. My friend texted that number--omitted here for privacy but obtainable by calling the Gray Lines Tours number--and received a response within 5 minutes, if that.   I also called a different number and left a voicemail message just in case, and I was called back within an hour or so and also texted. I really appreciate the effort on the booking agent's part!   Once we were in touch, we provided our San Antonio Explorer Pass voucher numbers over the phone and were told that pickup from our hotel would be at 8:30-8:45 am.   We made sure to be downstairs, ready, and visible from the street. The bus arrive within that allocated time. The bus driver called out my friend's name and we boarded. There were a bunch of others already picked up, and we picked up a few others along the way.  We made a pit stop for bathroom and food about an hour in. The bus driver was super friendly, passionate about his job, and accommodating of passengers' requests. He gave us a lengthy and useful history of the major landmarks, the towns we passed, the important people and what made them significant, and of course much information about LBJ and his wife, Lady Bird.  We stopped by the Boyhood Home of LBJ, the Texas White House on the LBJ Ranch, and saw many animals including longhorns up close and personal. We also got to check out the Air Force One-Half, the plane in which LBJ flew.   We stopped by Fredericksburg TX for 2 hours to enjoy Main Street and have lunch. The pickup spot was easy to find. It's a huge bus after all!  We also stopped by Luckenbach, a small centralized area of land in a town with a history of music and German migrants.   We opted not to stop at the optional winery based on another majority vote.   We were driven back right near where we were picked up and were back to our hotel around 6pm.

reviews.author: Sheree D.
reviews.description: My husband and I loved our super-knowledgeable and fun tour guide Perry! We explored the LBJ ranch and Texas hill country all day, and it was a blast! It was amazing and we highly recommend this guide/tour/and company.

reviews.author: Rocio S.
reviews.description: We just got back from our tour and we LOVED IT!!! Our driver was Jim and he was really funny and made it so special. He was early and very funny. It's a great tour, LOVED the stops and LOVED having lunch in Fredericksburg! The bus was clean and spacious. Overall it was the best tour experience for a first timer like me, I strongly recommend it to anyone in San Antonio who is looking to Explore the Texas Wine Country!!

reviews.author: Chelsea S.
reviews.description: My family and I booked this tour through an offer with Costco travel... it was not what I expected. In fact, the description was very vague and slightly misleading. Nevertheless, we toured Texas Hill Country and it was a good time. Definitely oriented more towards adults (my 15 year old brother was BORED). The day got a late start which put us behind schedule the entire tour. The driver appeared the be in training and the communication between him and his trainer was poor. But other than that, it was enjoyable! Great way to see LBJ Ranch, Fredericksburg, and Luckenbach all in a day.

reviews.author: Renee R.
reviews.description: My husband and I took the LBJ tour. This tour could be 5 stars, but the one we took today was barely a 3-star.  Enjoyable things - the trip itself - there were only three of us and the scenery was nice.  The van stoped at the childhood home as well as the "Texas Whitehouse" home of LBJ with tours of both.  It also stopped in Fredericksburg for lunch.    The issues:  1. The driver isn't trained to know anything about the trip.  There are canned recordings that often don't line up with where we are.  Questions to the driver are answered with "I am not sure but maybe..."    2. For some reason, we had to switch vans midway.  The second van was very noisy (the engine as well as the rattling of the door) and you could not hear the recording at all.  Also the cover for the air conditioner on the top of the car flew off.  We retrieved it, but it was broken and the air conditioner stopped working.  It was up to almost 100 degrees in the van by the time we got back to San Antonio.  If GrayLine took the time to train their drivers to do the commentary (with a speaker system that could be heard) AND ensured their vans worked well, this tour would be a 5 star.  Apparently, the van the day before (a different one from both of the ones we were in) also lost its air conditioning too.    Definitely better than the hot, and crowded amusement parks!

reviews.author: Minh G.
reviews.description: Our family spent the day with Mr. Ray touring the Hill Country area of Texas.  It was a really fun, informative, and relaxing experience.  Mr. Ray was patient, entertaining, professional and knowledgeable, definitely worth the time and money spent.  Strongly recommend this tour to everyone.

reviews.author: Chelsea T.
reviews.description: I had never been on a day-tour like this so I wasn't sure what to expect, but it was a fun day! It was great to sit back, relax, and be toted around the Texas Hill Country. Each stop was somewhere I wouldn't have thought to stop at on my own, but I'm so glad for each stop! The only reason I didn't leave 5 stars is because we had a late start, and somewhat poor communication about the delay. Once we got rolling though, it was a great experience! I would definitely do something like this again.

reviews.author: Liz E.
reviews.description: My husband and I were in town for a wedding and decided to arrive a day early to take the Texas Hill Country and LBJ Ranch Tour from San Antonio.  Our driver and tour guide was Ray.  He was friendly and knowledgeable.  He was fun and quick witted, which we enjoyed.  Ray was great and overall we give him five stars.  There were a total of ten of us on the tour, which was a nice size. I do think it was too much to pack into one tour.  There could easily be an LBJ tour on its's own and another tour of Frederick and Luchenback.  I don't think we had enough time to spend at the LBJ Museum and probably could have used more time at the LBJ Ranch.  In Fredericksburg there are two museums, shopping, and Das Peach Haus.  Das Peach Haus is own for wine tasting, gourmet sampling, and peach cobbler.  It is in a wonderful location.  Outside has nice sitting areas.  We bought some delicious sauce and peach cobbler to go but had to race if we wanted to get through the Pioneer Museum.    Our group was given the choice of how much time to spend at each location but I wish this tour we would have provided specific times.  There is too much to do on this tour and in reality it is two tours in one.  My husband and I returned on Sunday to visit the National Museum of the Pacific War (it takes about five hours to complete).  I would suggest to Gray Line Tours to split these tours.

reviews.author: Mike N.
reviews.description: This place is solid. I came in today looking for a solid bottle of juice, and spoke with Charlotte (sp?) After asking a small handful of questions, she guided me to a rockstar bottle of beaujolais.  Their spirits selection is solid too. Don't get me wrong, this is not the place to find a handle of jack, but cocktail geeks will walk around like a pig in shit here. Springbank 18, St George, Batavia Arack, Creole Shrubb and a hundred others dot the walls. I can't wait to blow a pay check here.

reviews.author: Sandra M.
reviews.description: First things first: JS is about quality not quantity!  I cannot believe I only recently discovered this store, it is truly a diamond in the rough. You will find this gem of a wine store nestled within a warehouse/industrial area. Even though they've been in business for decades they do very little advertising as they prefer the "if you're in the know, you're in the know" type of clientele and, yet, they have the kindest and most attentive staff waiting to greet you when you walk in.   This is the mecca for San Antonio oenophiles. I was wary of even writing a review as I want to keep this place a protected institution but I decided that if I did the review any justice then the right people who truly appreciate wine would be as thrilled as I was when I discovered this store.   If you are looking for cheap, mass produced wine then this is not the place for you. This is a boutique wine store with down to earth employees who have a passion, love, and (most importantly) expert knowledge of wine. Here you will find an unassuming building and space that has a "home-y" feel to it. Different staff have different areas of expertise just let them know what you are looking for - French, California, etc. What I personally appreciate is their flexibility to accommodate the needs of each patron including budget, grape, region, drinking now vs storing, building a collection,  etc.   Every wine that is on their shelf is there for a reason they are all hand picked and oftentimes from lesser known but "well kept secret" types of wineries throughout the world. Even more impressive is their willingness to educate and share their knowledge of the wine, winemaker, wine making process, etc. This is not a place where you run in, grab a bottle, and go home. When come here you can expect an experience - you'll be here for quite some time walking through different options, discussing and being educated on wine!   It would be remiss of me not to mention that they also have liquor and specialty cordials on hand as well, in fact, they have an entire room dedicated to them. I tend to focus on the wines  and their impressive collection which transition from region to region - Italian, French, Austrian, German, California, a handful of Texas wines, and then a hodge podge of miscellaneous "must try" unique wines (I'm sure I missed a few key regions my apologies in advance). I've never had a wine I didn't like from JS but more importantly I've been introduced to wines that I normally would have never tried or considered. Thank you, JS, for broadening my experiences of wines and challenging my palate in all the right ways.  A special thank you to Chelsea, who made our first visit such a wonderful experience that we are now becoming "regulars". We always look forward to engaging with her as she shares her love, excitement, and knowledge for French wines!

reviews.author: A C.
reviews.description: I cannot explain how nice it is to have a local neighborhood business like this. I am a big proponent on supporting small businesses and this is why. My mother in laws birthday was coming up, and she lives in San Antonio. I live in Miami. I googled and found this liquor store by her house hoping they can deliver (of course assuming the recipient can show ID). And they agreed! Delma was so amazing and even texted me pictures of the different offerings they had. We chose a nice bottle for her, and they wrapped it up and delivered it. It truly made her day special and my life a lot easier as you can imagine the difficulties of finding something special to give to an amazing mother in law. Thank you Delma and JS!

reviews.author: Eric And Jennifer R.
reviews.description: My favorite spirits and wine boutique shop in central Texas.  It's an experience shopping for wine or spirits.  They had a sommelier and he gave us one on one time.  We bought 6 bottles of wine, two hard to find gin, cognac, fine tequila and the tastiest margarita mix. They have sampling every Saturday so go check them out.  They have great gift ideas too!

reviews.author: Cassie Y.
reviews.description: This is our Saturday afternoon must-do. Kiddo and puppy friendly, delicious wine and fabulously friendly staff, Joe's is San Antonio's best kept secret

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: Absolutely love it here. It's fun to just browse their selection of fine wine and find something new to try. There's also an area for wine tasting when you do select your bottle. The store is laid out well and it's always easy to find assistance from a friendly and knowledgable associate. I love Turley Zinfandel and this is the only store near me that carries it. I also pick up some delicious olive oil from this location that I'm not able to find anywhere else. If you like your wine, I highly recommend you stop by.

reviews.author: Tina R.
reviews.description: Another Saturday came and went so I did the usual which meant a trip to Saglimbeni's for their weekly wine (and sometime fine spirit) tasting.   Here's the thing, they have an unrivaled selection of wines and a hearty selection of high-end spirits. The tastings are always attended by a person "in the know"-- who can explain the experience in terms of source, what you should expect on the palate, and what you might team each selection with.   This time, I came away with a light, crisp South African Sauvignon Blanc I'll enjoy with the Springtime weather, and a subtle fruit old vine zinfandel. The latter is not the sweet stuff the kids drink, the flavor is more sophisticated to be sure.  The creators of Mar Azul tequila were also on hand with a full complement of their renderings. They produce a fine, peppery silver tequila along with a delightful reposado and anejo. Additionally, they have a host of what I'll call infused tequilas. Not flavored artificially or colored. These are distilled spirits. I tried them all, each very good.   I settled on banana and almond. Yes, banana tequila. It's wonderful and will be drizzled over each serving of my homemade banana pudding. I'll use the almond in my flan and in a cranberry yellow cake I've perfected over time.   I also picked up some of the fine balsamics and olive oils made, and distributed by a local vendor who shares space there. I've been cooking with these a couple years now. The new balsamic is key lime, I'll be serving it drizzled over tangelos, fresh mozzarella and basil for a light summer salad.   Although I didn't make time for the food truck, it was there. JS's is the perfect place to spend a couple hours, discover some great finds, enjoy a lunch outside at the picnic tables maybe over a newly-acquired bottle of goodness. Great place to meet friends who might enjoy the same. And to wrap this package up nicely are the employees--all friendly and professional. This is a regular go. Find time to treat yourself.

reviews.author: Shane J.
reviews.description: Great find if you enjoy great wine...from Europe especially.   Staff is friendly and you can drink your bottle at their little bar.

reviews.author: Christopher L.
reviews.description: I loved this place.....stopped going years ago bc of perv like allegations.  Don't want to perpetrate  if they weren't true....anyone know?

reviews.author: Aubrey E.
reviews.description: I'm my way home from work  I need to stopping get a  Bottle of vodka for a gift looking up liquor stories this place was about half a mile away and 5  Stars So I figured what the heck. I pulled into a very cool little  Parking lot and was immediately greeted by  2 very nice women.  They offered me a  Champagne try As they helped me look for the perfect bottle. Perfect being inexpensive. This did bot bother them at all. Take in can you to treat me as Well as any of the other customers  Who were all better dressed than I.  Those who might feel uncomfortable in nicer liquor stores will feel  Quite comfortable because while they are extremely knowledgeable they are also not  Pretentious in  any way. It is hard to find such a good combination of quality and down-to-earth atmosphere especially in the world of liquor and wine.  I will definitely be returning to one the Saturday wine tastings they have every week

reviews.author: Jasmen H.
reviews.description: I really like this place! It was my first time going today. Every Saturday they have a wine tasting which is great because you can try out different wines before you actually buy it. All of the people there were really nice, knowledgeable, and ready to assist you. If you're looking for high-quality wine in San Antonio this is definitely a place to check out!

reviews.author: Amber L.
reviews.description: Finally checked this place out and I was impressed! A very large selection to pick from. I was greeted right away and they directed me to the Sardinia, Italy collection in the back. I was looking for a birthday gift for my husband who studied abroad there 20 years ago. Sardinia is a very small island off of Italy, (I was thinking maybe they had one or two choices) and the store surprisingly had a collection of about 10 wines from the region varying in prices. Will def try again!

reviews.author: Cathy K.
reviews.description: if you want THE BEST selection of wine, beer, liquor, or anything in that arena, there is NO OTHER OPTION. You have got to check this place out if just to be in awe of their wine selection.  Are you a Scotch drinker?  Look no further.  You can get a $40 single-malt or a $600 50 year old Islay.  The staff is very nice and all of them are very educated.    Check out their wine tastings on Saturdays, for an extra special treat!   This is my favorite liquor store, EVER and I have lived all over the US and visited stores in many places and this is still THE standard that I hold other wine stores to.  Needless to say,  this is the HANDS DOWN best wine store, EVER.  Enjoy!

reviews.author: Kelvin P.
reviews.description: Warning: this is going to be a rant.  I've been here twice now on Saturday for the wine tasting.  The first time was very enjoyable and it was just as Aliyah described in her review.  Everyone is nice, the atmosphere is very social, and  I even went home with a bottle of saki.  This weekend I went again and discovered half the crowd was the same (they must be wino's :).    My girl and I visited the front bar for a while, tried all the wines, then the back and did those as well.  I wanted to return to the front room/bar to check out some bottles on the shelves.  As I was reading a label, the employee behind the bar (different than the one from earlier) loudly said "Hey, hey YOU! Come over here."  At which point he pointedly asked for my identification.  Reacting to the puzzled look I had, he offered that even he "gets carded at the airport." huh?!  I have no trouble being carded in liquor/wine stores.  However, a logical policy would be to card people when they enter the store, before they are served a sample, or at checkout.  I had already been in the store for almost an hour trying the wines and I didn't see anyone else getting carded.  Also, I was in the middle of browsing!  Totally unprofessional, -3 stars from an otherwise 5 star review.

reviews.author: Aliyah K.
reviews.description: I adore this place, it is very often part of my Saturday.  Stop by for wine tastings from 11am-5pm, most often up to ten wines can be tasted.  All items are 20% every Friday and Saturday.   That includes wines, pastas, spices etc.  Their overall selection is pretty satisfying and IF it is not, they may be able to order what you are looking for on your behalf.   Grappa, an older black lab that is an animal companion of the Saglimbeni family, can be seen begging for treats - don't feed him but do give him a pet on the head.  By treats I mean the yummy bread and olive oil or pate that is complimentary at each tasting.  In addition Joe's has cute napkins, gift baskets and greeting cards for sale.  Standing space can be limited and the place can get packed, but Joe's draws a nice crowd so enjoy.

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: Why go anywhere else for wine and spirits?  This eclectic place has a huge assortment of wines ranging in price from $7 to $700 per bottle and everything in between.  Every major growing region and varietal is well represented.  The staff are extremely knowledgeable and friendly.  My wife and I have attended their FREE Saturday afternoon wine tasting 3 or 4 times.  Each time, we've enjoyed several tastes of whites, roses, and reds and naturally took home a few bottles.  In addition to wine, they have a crazy selection of spirits, many of which I'm sure you've never heard of or tasted.  The building is an odd maze of connected rooms, each with a different theme or feel.  This is wine heaven.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

reviews.author: Glenn V.
reviews.description: For the best selection of great wines from all over the world this is the place to shop. If you need to learn about wine this is the place to go. Joe has been recommending different wines to us for years now and i have never had a bad bottle. The Saturday tasting and events that they have are always  informative and a great way to find new wines.

reviews.author: Daniel S.
reviews.description: Is there a way to rate 10 stars instead of just 5?? Joe's is the kind of place that makes me heart San Antonio: they've got the best-curated selection of wines and spirits in town, the entire staff is genuinely friendly and passionate about wine, and the tastings on Saturdays always include great deals, a good food truck, a farm stand, and a colorful cast of characters. 10 stars!

reviews.author: Yezenia C.
reviews.description: Great service. I was looking for a wine and they were the only ones who had it. (I looked at 4 different wine shops). I also found they had hard to find food items. They had fresh foie gras and these wonderful young walnuts in syrup that I have only been able to find in small villages in Lebanon.  I also bought nice acrylic plates and wine glasses along with snacks for a beach trip.  If you are looking for something special this is your place for food and wine.

reviews.author: Allison S.
reviews.description: My favorite place in San Antonio! Free wine tasting every Saturday, my boyfriend and I try to go every week. All the employees remember us and they are all so nice!! It's a pleasant experience every time. On Saturdays they always have a food truck outside as well which is great food. The wines are amazing here. They have a huge selection and even though it's not a chain it has great deals! So glad we found this gem!

reviews.author: K. S.
reviews.description: We had an awesome time today not only because of their outside seating but the service was outstanding! We ordered an appetizer of the tender savory meatballs with crunchy French bread, Really hit the spot. Wonderful options for winds and an outdoor pizza oven. Live music and very laid-back atmosphere, lots of room for parking. We will be back soon!

reviews.author: Carmina D.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I just went on our Texas Wino tour to Fredericksburg from San Antonio!  We had an amazing time!  Our guide Kris was fabulous!  He was funny and informative. He was very personable and made it a point to meet with everyone.   We had so much fun and will definitely do it again!

reviews.author: maria T.
reviews.description: Can't say enough great things about the people who run this event, Richard was so accommodating to my party and I would highly recommend this company!

reviews.author: Richard C.
reviews.description: Big fan of the bus to Wurstfest and would recommend to everybody. It was super convenient for my group of friends to ride up together and not have to worry about getting home safely. We wound up making friends with the other people on the trip and grabbed more drinks together at the dropoff point after returning from Wurstfest. Absolutely doing this every year from now on!

reviews.author: Nora G.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to do a Fredericksburg wine tour but didn't want to drive ( in case i have too many tastings)  However, I found the opportunity with Texas Winos from Facebook, my daughter drove in from San Marcos and we had my husband drop us off at the designated area , (and he also picked us up at conclusion ).  It was great to visit 3 different wineries and the Italian meal was awesome!   The stop in Luckenbach was a unexpected treat!  We are definitely doing this again.  Great way to unwind and have a good time and visit great wineries that Fredericksburg has to offer .

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: 3.5 Stars  When I think of the fine art of wine drinking I always defer to Alexander Payne's film, "Sideways." While I did like that movie it has never really inspired me to partake in the vino. Not in the way it has inspired that industry. Nonetheless I never discount the passion of that specific community. As a craft beer enthusiast I try to keep an open mind and an open palate.   So I was invited to attend this event with my partner in crime. Both of us are novice wine drinkers. Did this bias my review? I tend to think any experience can supersede or dash our expectations by its own weight. Typically Texas Winos does a bus tour where you visit different wineries. This particular festival was held in of all places a civic center meant for wedding receptions, birthday parties and quinceaÃ±eras. Personally I have no qualms attending an event at a muddy field, a dive bar or at a boujee affair. I'm wondering if attendees were disappointed by the not so upscale provisions?  You purchase tickets online. It's slightly cheaper the earlier you buy them. You pick a time slot, which are in two hour increments. This is mainly to control the size of the wine demos, but I'll come back to this point later. When you check in you are given a sheet with all the wineries participating. You go to each table with accompanying wines and each label does their spiel. The manner in which sample tastings were handled confused me.   Basically couples of two, a group of friends  and a few stragglers at a time would go through a demo rotation. Some stations had multiple wines, thus you would have to wait awhile before you got to any tastings. Once you went through each offering: chardonnay, pinot grigio, merlot, white, red, rosÃ¨, etc. you would be done. Which in hindsight probably did keep the lines at a minimum. However you would be in one line and a group of twenty friends would camp out, with little regard that others were there for the same reason.   In addition I felt there was little time to process each pour. You couldn't move on to the next style of wine without first finishing your sample. Which felt like a class moving sometimes in rhythm but most times at a snail's pace. For the most part demos were very informative. Surprisingly the wines I liked best were done by presenters who served as gracious hosts. But there were a few who were so snooty, to serve me was to undermine their vineyard.  Speaking as a craft beer enthusiast I understand every drinking community has its own set of implied manners. At this event what subtracted from my experience was having ultra pushy festivalgoers. For example I was in one line in the midst of a tasting and some arbitrary dude tapped me on my shoulder to move. In another whilst an owner was presenting her wines "homeboy" asserted himself, completely ruining my experience. You would be waiting in one line and people from nowhere would impolitely cut in. Is this typical behavior at a wine festival?  As a beer drinker my credo is to "To drink and to let drink." Not to say there is complete civility and organization within the craft beer community. It's just that I left feeling a bit hollow. Yes, lines were kept to a minimum but after the rotation the experience felt anticlimactic. I will say one bright spot was a festivalgoer, named Lauren who was having way too much fun. She offered her suggestions on which wines to try. I wish her friendly spirit would've been sprinkled on the crowd that day.   I think if you like wine and want to get sauced for a reasonable price I say this event is for you. It's interesting that a grape, a peach or a strawberry for that matter when fermented can make you tipsy. With alcohol beverage volumes at 12 percent and up I don't expect you to be doing the, "Achy Breaky Heart" perfectly. I'm trying hard to be open minded about wine and maybe I will find one that suits me. But a scene where people are too egocentric, classy gals drop sample glasses and there's no variation in flavors between samples. Well I guess I'm doomed to be a beer guy. Tear.

reviews.author: Phillip R.
reviews.description: We have taken 3 trips with this company and every trip has been an amazing experience! Give them a try, I promise you will have a great time.

reviews.author: Daubin R.
reviews.description: Previously went on a tour in 2018/2019 timeframe and we loved it! Went again last month and it was a COMPLETELY different experience. We had about 20 minutes at each place. Felt extremely rushed. Not once were we told what type of wine we were drinking or how to drink it (like you expect at a tasting). At two of the stops we didn't even have time to buy a bottle because the line was too large and the bus would leave us. The driver/host got lost on the way to the wineries twice which added 2 hours to our drive time. We calculated it later and we were on the bus for 6.5 hours and we only had 1.25 hour(s) between all the places. We ended up getting off the bus at 8pm just exhausted from all the driving. We would have been better just getting a bus ticket to a neighboring state and just bringing wine on that drive lol. It's sad because this tour used to be fun and informative with a good sit down tasting at each venue. Now it is just poorly run and communicated. I would not recommend this tour anymore. Also we met three other couples on this tour. They all had been on previous ones with this company and they all were saying the same things we were. They honestly should have just refunded this tour. Maybe we were just a one off bad tour, but I wouldn't give this place another try unless they guaranteed a better experience. It was just awful all around.

reviews.author: Rachel H.
reviews.description: If you ever want to go on a beer tour or wine tour, this is the way to go! The owner always reaches out to you personally before the event and if you ever have any questions. The tour buses allow alcohol on them and take you to 3-4 places with the flights / wine tasting covered plus a free meal! Highly recommend!! Thank you Richard!!

reviews.author: Nicolette M.
reviews.description: Justin was a amazing host and we had a great time!  What a relaxing way to drink some delicious wines and not have to worry about having to drive.  Will be looking into other tours!

reviews.author: BL A.
reviews.description: We celebrated my mom's 60th birthday with a Texas Winos tour to Fredericksburg and had a great time! The bus was a bit old looking, but comfortable and great, cold AC! Our tour guide Kris was fun, prompt, friendly, and informative - he really made the day great along with our driver. I would definitely book another tour with this group. The communication and  experience before, during and after our event was top notch. Thanks, Texas Winos!

reviews.author: Joselene F.
reviews.description: We purchased the Groupon for Texas Winos and we had a great time. We arrived at the restaurant @ La Cantera and had a little delay with our departure waiting on a few. No biggie but it did reduce our time at the wineries. We visited 3 wineries. FAT ASS was probably the best one. Their watermelon wine was a hit with our group. 290 Vinery had some great dessert wines. Purchased a strawberry riesling here which was delicious.  We had a great tour guide. The music was dated and not much of a mix but he was able to change some of the music as the day went on. There were a couple of us who were celebrating birthdays. Do bring snacks with you to eat. The BBQ at Vino was just ok. Nothing to write home about. I would purchase a groupon again for this but int feel full price is worth it.

reviews.author: Melanie B.
reviews.description: Sunday Funday on Lake Travis on a boat with friends and family!! The best time ever! Thank you to Texas Winos for making this event so much fun! We are definitely booking again!

reviews.author: Jesus H.
reviews.description: So let me tell you, I thought I was happy and satisfied as a customer of Texas Winos, but I am not. So let's start at the beginning.  My wife's friend was having a birthday and wanted to do a wine tasting tour with a bunch of friends. So we all decided to get a groupon and go with Texas Winos. When you buy the groupon, you still have to go to their website and register and pay a fee ($72 for both my wife and myself). Everything went smooth until we received an email that there was an issue with processing the payment and that we were most likely affected. The issue was that the processor for their credit card had mistakenly changed the decimal point, so we were charged $720 instead of $72. That's a HUUUUGE difference.  So after I emailed Richard Wino, he said the problem was being taken care of and that they will be processing the correct amount. 1 day later, we get ANOTHER charge for $720 on our credit card, so now our credit card shows that we paid $1440 to Texas Winos.  I emailed Richard Wino again and told him the situation. He responded quickly and stated that he is going to cancel all of the transactions and they weren't going to charge us for the $72 either. Richard Wino even offered to give us complimentary tickets to another even because of the errors. My wife and I were delighted and told him we would love to go to the Wino Fest in November and he said he would take care of it. Well, he didn't.  It took about 1 month to get the refund on my credit card. Really slow compared to how fast they took $720 from my credit card TWICE. And even after going through all that, I thought it was ok since they were being nice and apologetic and offered us complimentary tickets to another event. BUT, we never received our complimentary tickets to another event! I know they're free, but what bothers me is that they went back on their word, and THEY STOPPED RESPONDING TO MY EMAILS after the amounts were corrected. I tried emailing Richard Wino a few times since the end of October when we were told that the WINO FEST HAD BEEN RESCHEDULED AND THEY FORGOT TO NOTIFY US (But we never received tickets or anything to begin with). I know that they were free tickets offered and shouldn't be petty, but when someone goes back on their word and stops responding to emails, it bothers me. What if I had been charged the $1440 and he never responded or even attempted to correct the situation? I am attaching emails which have time stamps of the conversations   PS. The tour bus driver and guide were awesome. That's the only reason I'm giving them a 2 star instead of a 1 Star

reviews.author: Letitia F.
reviews.description: We had an amazing time and I will be sure to spread this company to so many. We had a blast and it started from the transportation driver who did an amazing job making sure we got to each point safely. The Wino representatives Richard and David customer service was impeccable and have an A in my book. This is the way to decompress and just enjoy life to the fullest especially during these trying times. You will not be disappointed and we are looking forward to more tours with them.

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: Wr had a fabulous time! Full day of entertainment. I was concerned that it might be too strenuous but you had the freedom to walk as much as you wanted or simply hang out in some really beautiful vineyards. The wine offered was really diverse and I would definitely visit each winery on its own. Coby was a great guide, he kept everyone on an even keel, even as the winner flowed. He was fun and engaging during trips aaaaand catered to a wide variety of tastes. Bella was also awesome as a driver, I felt safe the whole time. Would definitely recommend! Would also recommend getting the groupon deal to save a bit of money so you can pick up a few bottles on the way. Being a little more water than you think you'll need, and dress comfortably. Great time!

reviews.author: Fiona X.
reviews.description: We booked a wine tour to Fredericksburg and Luckenbach for my birthday. And I'm SO glad we did.   The tour felt very family-run - our guide Jordan (who is a hoot) and our driver David were so genuinely friendly and we felt like we got to know them as friends, not just workers.  It's about an hour shuttle ride and Jordan made sure we were entertained with some funny videos, good music, and some jokes.  We had the perfect amount of guidance at each winery and some autonomy so we could wander or relax without feeling like we were on a tour the entire time. It is a full day after all. Jordan was always around to chat or answer questions. You spend about an hour or more at each stop and it was the perfect amount of time.   At the last stop, Jordan made sure to get me a birthday sangria shot from Fat Ass winery which was delicious. I really felt like we celebrated my birthday without being obnoxious/taking over the entire tour.   The busses are really comfortable. On the way back, we played a trivia game and the winner won a bottle of wine!

reviews.author: Angie M.
reviews.description: So I have mixed feeling about our experience. First off it felt like some wineries were not prepared and decided to take us on last minute especially Mendelbaum and the second one in town. Mendelbaum were so rude. I would have rather done 2 wineries and spent an hour downtown enjoying the shops. Tour guide was fun I don't know how much control he had over the day but he tried. The last winery was the best one with friendly staff that were so cool laughing and joking with us. I think they were called Tejas winery. Overall the bus ride was so fun bc we had fun people on there ! Everyone was ready for a small escape and we enjoyed each others company!

reviews.author: Analisa D.
reviews.description: I first have to start out by saying that we had a really great time on our winery tour. We ended up meeting a great group of people and we all made it fun.   We purchased vouchers through Groupon to redeem through the Winos website. Groupon does not state anywhere that there is an additional fee of $31 per person for the wine tastings - so be aware of that when you book. We booked a winery tour with a private 3 course brunch at a winery with a surprise bonus stop.   Starting our tour, our first visit was to a brewery. We purchased the winery tour so we figured maybe this was our surprise bonus stop. We ended up having lunch here with only sandwich and chips options or a salad option. This was not the brunch we intended on.   Our 3 winery visits were great. Fat Ass was definitely our favorite as to how lively and fun loving the owner was for our group! Texas Hills was great as well because the owner gave great explanations and stories behind his wines and winery. 290 Vinery was less interactive but had great wine options.   Phillip tried to be a good host. He talked himself in circles, could not command the group's attention ever and maybe drank a little too much while on the job.  We will consider other companies before booking another wine tour with this company.

reviews.author: Phillip M.
reviews.description: Great time and event. Phill was fun and entertaining. The stops were different and balanced on wines.  Dry to sweet. Never felt rushed and enjoyed every minute. Would go again.

reviews.author: Yin H.
reviews.description: I'm a bit conflicted about the experience. First of all, our guide Taylor was amazing!! He was entertaining and definitely laid down some ground rules that made everyone on the bus feel welcome, comfortable and most importantly, ready to have fun! He set a great tone for the rest of the trip.  The tour itself was just ok. It felt like we wasted a lot of time just getting to the 1st winery, Messina Hof, which was also the best winery of the 3 in terms of service, ambiance and wine quality! We wasted about 10-15 min waiting for someone, got a bit lost in a parking lot for a while trying to pick up the second group, then hit some traffic, etc. The 2nd winery was a bit strange as we were ushered into a dance hall serving Italian food. The wines were not great (food was decent) but we also received such small pours that it was hard to tell. Definitely felt like a tourist trap. The last winery was an Israeli winery. They definitely didn't seem prepared for large groups and the people working there weren't very pleasant or friendly, mostly overwhelmed. It wasn't a fun experience. Given the long lines, you almost had to get a tasting and get back in line while drinking.   Some suggestions 1. The same tours from Austin were also visiting the same wineries. Are there really not more than 3 wineries in the area so you could spread out some of the crowd? Places like the Israeli winery definitely weren't prepared or staffed appropriately. 2. Better winery selection. I would almost rather have stayed and just hung out at Messina Hof with a bottle and a boxed lunch than visit the other 2 wineries.  3. I felt like we had time to fit in a 4th winery but we ended up leaving pretty early and headed back.  4. With a Groupon deal, we ended up paying $75-80 per person. It's nice to not have to worry about drinking and driving but I definitely expected higher qualities wineries.

reviews.author: Douglas B.
reviews.description: I just opened a jar of their Red Pepper and Tomato Soupah!  There was no plastic seal and no reassuring "pop" when I unscrewed the jar. Thus I was reluctant to consume it. I poured the soup down the disposal.    I called their number but the number has been changed and is now "unknown." It is clear they have shuttered their business.

reviews.author: Rose R.
reviews.description: This pace was great! Too bad they closed their shop in Castroville as it was fun to try new wines and other goodies there. I understand they have an online business now? Anyway, I hope they return soon to a shop in the Castroville/San Antonio area.

reviews.author: Linda S.
reviews.description: Very cute place with super friendly staff and awesome salsa need I say more. The place is very clean. They have great wine also.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: This store is right off of HWY 90, right in Castroville. The parking situation can be a little anxiety-inducing... but I like to park around the park (take a right at the light before the store) and walk over.  This is such a little gem! They carry a LOT of different types and flavors of olive oil, cheese, wine, and spreads! I come over here and seem to find things I hadn't noticed before, all the time.   I love experimenting with different types of cooking, so having a gourmet store like this near me is really convenient.   The people who work here are also very helpful. I'm not very educated in the ways of wine and cheese (something to strive for?), and they were able to help me find a bottle (or two... don't judge!) and cheese to pair with it.   There's more! They DO have an educated wine professional come in and give tastings, EVERY Saturday! I went to one of these events, and it was a lot of fun!! The store was filled with local people, and some from around the hill country. Because of the small family feeling of the store, everyone was happy and socializing together... which can be a hard thing to accomplish these days   Lastly, (I swear!) I love that this store carries local goods. The honey alone is enough to get me in and spending money.   Check it out sometime!

reviews.author: Christine C.
reviews.description: I was able to enjoy hospitable wine tasting during my recent visit and I'll be sure to go back. The staff was friendly, the prices were reasonable and the product at this store was wide. A must place to visit in Castroville to taste food from throughout the state, country and world!

reviews.author: C B.
reviews.description: Last year when we visited it was fun to participate in the wine tasting. We always bought something while there. Would have given a 4 or 5 ratting, but...This year, AFTER the wine tasting they tell us it's $3 pp. and even though we purchased a bottle of wine they still charged us for the tasting. This is pretty cheap of them. Won't go back now.

reviews.author: Laura M.
reviews.description: I went in there without my husband looking to get him some good beer, I know nothing about beer-- at all. Just the type he likes.   I got the 6 pack (and got a % off for buying a pack) and brought them home. My husband LOVED the nitro beer I got him. I also got my mother in law a coffee ale. She said it was the best beer she had ever had and she doesn't even like beer. My father in law drank the White Stout. He said it was phenomenal.   Hats off to the owner, for helping me pick out the best beer. And hats off to this store for carrying such a great variety and quality of product! It was amazing!

reviews.author: Brandy B.
reviews.description: I am new to the area and wanted to check this place out and grab a dry cappuccino after pizza yesterday, Monday October 18th around 7pm. I was unenthusiastically greeted by a girl who acted as if I was bothering her by coming into get coffee. I was asking her questions about the place and what they had and she was incredibly rude and continue to answer my questions with one word answers. No smile ever came across her face and she really made me feel uncomfortable as I was just trying to get some information about the store. My family is really big on cigars /coffee/ whiskey and I was very disappointed in the customer service or lack of customer service. I decided to push through and continue with ordering a coffee and when I asked her for a dry cappuccino she proceeded to roll her eyes and told me she didn't know how to make it and asked me what a dry cappuccino was. When I asked her "isn't this a coffee place?" she said "I don't know how to make the coffee I just push the buttons". As somebody that has been a barista and worked at a coffee shop I tried to explain to her how to make it and she just increasingly became annoyed with me. I decided to scratch the dry cappuccino just ordered a double shot of espresso which was awful by the way. As I continued to try to make small talk it was very apparent that I was not welcome there. I even asked her if she wasn't having a good day because of the way I was being treated. As I was paying, I asked her if there was a place that I could leave a review for the store she looked me dead in my eyes and said no. I confusingly asked her, " oh you don't have a Yelp?" She straight up told me no. As somebody that has worked in customer service I have got to say this is the worst customer service I've ever experienced and I would never treat a customer the way that I was treated. I just hope that the owners can see this and know what goes on in their store when they're not there because if I was the owner of the store I would want to know about one of my employees making people feel very uncomfortable And not being helpful at all. I made several attempts to try to turn this experience around and give her the opportunity to create a pleasant experience for me but she just acted like I was interrupting her day of sitting on the stool behind the counter. Customer service was awful coffee was awful she didn't even know how to make a dry cappuccino. If I were you I would steer clear of this place it's not worth it.

reviews.author: Houston R.
reviews.description: WOW!  SO much to choose from!!!  Steve is amazing at helping choose something if you are new or even a novice of cigars, wine, beer and coffee.     Clean, well stocked and excellent customer service. Floor to ceiling stocked with variety!  Something for everyone!  Get your gifts done here!  Cheers!

reviews.author: Dan A.
reviews.description: They have about a billion craft beer brands and types. The carry an assortment of cigars. (I don't smoke though). The gentleman behind the counter, Steve, is super knowledgeable about his beers and stogies. If you enjoy the nicer things, here is your place.  Better pricing than other places on both beer and cigars.   This place intentionally protects it beers and cigars from harmful UV light by putting reflective tint on the front windows and the right amount of illumination inside. That shows seriousness in what they do.

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: Great customer service. I came for a wedding and was able to find a nice selection of wine from Texas wineries as well as California wineries. Thebseems to have a lot of great cigars everywhere, and the humidors were in great condition. I would definitly come back!

reviews.author: Adrian H.
reviews.description: Loved this place! Great for picking cigars and beers, coffee is really good too. Look forward to going back for more supplies

reviews.author: Alison K.
reviews.description: Great espresso!   Very nice place. Easy stop for great coffee and an excellent beer selection.

reviews.author: Wesley F.
reviews.description: Stopped in after my haircut next door, because I got 10% off after showing my receipt as a promotion, since it just opened. The staff was very courteous and professional; additionally, the store was well stocked with everything, especially different types of sodas from Texas. I would highly recommend this location to anyone looking for a variety of beers, cigars, coffees, wines, and sodas. I am definitely going back soon to get more of the soda!

reviews.author: Chris B.
reviews.description: Great craft beer selection and love the idea that I can pick and choose what beers make up my 6pk. Nothing worse than buying a whole 6pk of a beer that you don't like and then stare at the next 5 cans.

name: Water 2 Wine
address: 2007 W Martin StLift Fund Launch Center

reviews.author: M H.
reviews.description: Passed this store many times and wondered how serious could a store named "lol" be. Finally stopped and was I wrong! This place super surprised me, it is decked out with liquor from top to bottom, pretty much anything you could ask for. And if they don't have it, they'll get it, just for you. I was looking for a bottle of a special Asian wine, this location didn't have it but another did... and the owner, Paras, delivered it himself within an hour to the store. Owner, Paras, great person, super knowledgable, and way cool. It was Friday night and he had about 6-8 bottles out for samples and gave recommendations on best ways to drink and mix. Gotta try this place. And if you want "high-end" bottles, Paras is the man to talk to.

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: I would just be echoing what most have already written. The other reviews are very accurate.   My big issues included that when I reached out for more information via email I got no response. Also, they offered a pizza meal and it turned out to be Dominos. No offense to them but I was expecting a sit down inside with something more local. Not even paper plates and napkins.   If you are expecting a tour of a winery,  this not that kind of trip. It is a tour of wine places.

reviews.author: Raven H.
reviews.description: So the bus was clean, wifi equipped (though weak), and outlets on the back of each seat to stay charged. Weirdly had no music playing for the majority of the trip, guide blamed it as being unfamiliar with SA radio stations since she had just driven in from Houston.   The tours are supposed to consist of three brewery/winery/distillery visits, I'd assumed it would be all of the same category i.e. all brewery or all winery but we had a two for one perk visiting Ranger Creek Brewing and Distillery in that we were getting to try their beers and whiskeys. We'd anticipated a bit of a story and a tour of the facility but honestly this one went on waY too long. Still, this visit was the high point once we realized we weren't limited in our samples and they were pouring full pints.   Back on the bus to New Braunfels Brewing Co., a brewery known for its sour beers, many made with fruity elements and one spiced pickle beer. These were honestly a trip, we were presented two drink tickets and I sampled a pink beer, sour, and a splash of the pickle beer, spicy and sour. I didn't hate it but I didn't love it, one of the homies running the establishment sounded like Seth Rogen so that was a treat. The majority of the bus seemed to really dislike the visit though and I saw a few people tossing beers into sinks or nearby plants.   Our last stop was the Grapevine, something I was super looking forward to but wound up being the most disappointed.  I was anticipating a couple sweet glasses of wine to wind up the trip but after fighting downtown traffic down a narrow road, we were told we'd get 45 minutes to wander around since that's how long our host figured it'd take the bus to circle back. It was so disorganized, we literally just walked in to what felt like a super crowded gift shop where five or six people poured samples down a long bar. The wine samples offered, while delicious, were barely enough for a SIP. I asked our guide if we were supposed to tell them something to get actual glasses of wine and she told us we had to purchase the drinks, only the samples were free and only three samples at that. Okay, so what was all the money we spent on the tickets actually going towards? We got our tickets at a convention where they were offering a special price, 2 for $100 I think,  then the day of the tour we were told to bring $20 cash for a tasting fee. What the what?  Even after alllllll that, during the drive back to the drop-off point, our guide announces both she and the bus driver work for tips. $70+ at the end of the day and barely caught a buzz.

reviews.author: Ashley W.
reviews.description: I booked the San Antonio beer bus as a last-minute activity with my husband to celebrate our wedding anniversary.  The owner, Neil, took my reservation over the phone and was awesome about squeezing us in.    We had a blast! We went to three different places - Ranger Creek brewery/distillery, Weathered souls brewery, and Artisan on Alamo (vodka distillery).    Ranger Creek - hands down our favorite.  The guys working there were amazing, they really went above and beyond to make everyone feel welcome and made sure everyone had a good time.  We got three full pint pours plus multiple samples of bourbon.  Lots of variety in the beer options.  We opted to purchase a bottle of bourbon and some bourbon filled chocolates to take home with us.  The brewery seemed to only be open for tours at the time and were able to focus their entire attention on our tour group.  The next top, Weathered souls brewery was very busy.  They were hosting a party at the time, and about 3/4 of the seating area was reserved for the party, forcing our tour group to the patio.  At this brewery, we received two tokens good for a half-pour of 4 pre-selected beers they had on tap.  I chose the only one that wasn't an IPA (IPA isn't my thing), and it tasted like a very strong IPA.  My husband was sweet enough to purchase me one of the non-tour options that the staff insisted was not an IPA, but it tasted identical to what was already in my glass.  Not a lot of variety in the options here, and the options for purchase were very overpriced (growlers, etc).    Artisan on Alamo was our least favorite stop.  The owner came off as rude and bothered when asked questions.  Our guide boasted about mixed drinks, but we discovered when we got there that mixed drinks were only available to purchase, not as part of our samples included in the tour.  They did, however, have a big selection of cocktails available for a  reduced "tour price" of $5.  The vodka samples we received were small, and the whole place was a little underwhelming.    Overall, we loved the whole beer bus experience.  Our beer bus guide (who I cannot remember his name, oops) was also amazing.  Snacks and bottled water were offered between stops, and the bus played classic rock on the radio which produced many drunken sing-a-longs.  When we arrived back at our starting point at the Lion and Rose pub, we received a voucher for a free appetizer.  We decided to eat there after checking the Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed.  The food was amazing, the staff was excellent and had our appetizer in our hungry hands within minutes.    Tips:  -Get either an Uber or a Lyft to and from your meeting point. -Bring a bag for your swag! We got a pint glass from each of the places we visited, so we left with 6 total, plus items we purchased. -Eat something before you board the bus - our tour started at 11:30 and ended around 4:30.  Even with the snacks, we were starving by the time we got back to the pub -Wear sunscreen! Two of the three places we went had a patio with limited shade, I was very grateful that I lathered up in sunscreen before we left.    We definitely will be doing a beer bus again!  Would love to do an Austin tour or Dallas if ya'll come up north!

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: We got tickets to the Texas Beer Bus not knowing exactly what was involved. All we knew was that we got the tickets for $50, and we were promised a day of breweries. We showed up at the appointed spot, the parking lot of The Lion and the Rose. They didn't have any water waiting for us, and had us stand around in the heat of the parking lot while we waited for a MegaBus that was about 20 minutes late. While we stood around waiting for the late bus, we were told that if we actually wanted to drink beer on this Beer Bus tour, we'd have to chip in another $20. I felt ripped off. Why not include that in the fee? When we finally got going, there was no beer on the bus. They said that was illegal (it's not.)  We drove around in circles for about 20 minutes trying to find the first brewery. They didn't know where it was. Apparently, they hadn't been there before.  When we finally arrived, Ranger Creek did a great job of explaining the beer, the whiskey, and the brewing process.  Blue Star didn't seem to be expecting us. They hurriedly poured us a few ounces of beer while we stood around waiting for something. I don't know what. Nobody told us about the place, and we got rushed out of there almost as soon as we got there.  The third brewery cut my brother off for being loud and obnoxious. I don't blame them.  In all, we went to three breweries. Ranger Creek, Blue Star, and Freetail.  I felt ripped off that the beer tasting charge wasn't explained until we were already $50 into it. Plus, they made us fill out these liability waiver forms after they had our money. Don't like the terms of the form? No refunds. What a ripoff. Who's going to take a beer tour and not drink beer?  The tour was poorly planned, terribly executed, and felt like a rip off. Our guide didn't know the first thing about the breweries (didn't even know where they were).   I'm never taking this tour again, and I discourage you from doing it too. There's other brewery tours in town. Better yet, just go on your own.

reviews.author: Tom P.
reviews.description: Had to pass on these free tickets to the Austin Triple Brewery tour.   The Austin meeting place is by the Domain rather than somewhere downtown. (They helpfully suggested that we take a $25 Uber ride to get up to their bus. Yeah, thanks.)   Beer tasting is not included in this beer tour! (It's an extra $20 to actually drink beer, paid day of.)   The breweries on the itinerary were Oskar Blues and Austin Beerworks. Both are walking distance from the meeting point.   I am genuinely confused why anyone would pay $125+ pp for this.

reviews.author: Steve H.
reviews.description: Scammers! We repurchased 2 vouchers from them at a comicon that they said were good indefinitely. A year later they refused to honor them.

reviews.author: Chase C.
reviews.description: Would not recommend this tour. Poor organization. Guide does not guide, expected more engagement and education like I have experienced on other tours. Serving dominos pizza at a location where signs are posted everywhere, "No Outside Food", with not plates etc made me feel like an elementary student on a field trip. Would not recommend at all.

reviews.author: Mary Y.
reviews.description: We have purchased tickets for the Texas Beer Bus four times!  We enjoy the atmosphere and the easy way we are able to tour the breweries, wineries and distilleries in Texas. We have been to North Houston, Dallas and Austin. Our fourth tour will hopefully be in south Houston. We are able to uber to our meeting site and they provide unlimited chips and water on the bus. We eat a good breakfast before we go and they provide pizza at the second or third stop.  There have been food trucks at each stop to purchase food to absorb the alcohol!  We enjoy visiting a new city with someone else driving!

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: Don't do it!! Let me lay it out there for you.  I've been on other beer bus tours in other cities so was super excited when my sister in law bought us all tickets last christmas. I don't mean to sound rude but our host needs a new occupation, her monotone voice portrayed the excitement of a funeral or a 0-0 exhibition soccer game. The music on the bus didn't work for over half the ride and it reeked of exhaust the first half of the trip.  The stops were cool but they're independent of the tour co so that makes sense. For the last third of the trip,  we took a 45 min ride through traffic back into town for our host to notify us,  after multiple updates and delays that our third stop wasn't possible. During all this,  we pass a bad wreck which the hosts comments on the intercom and tells us how many people die in car accidents every year. Honestly I cannot convey the level of frustration or dissatisfaction I have with our purchase and this company. #fail

reviews.author: Bonnelle M.
reviews.description: We're currently on our tour... that's how bad this is. We drove to the Domaine to meet the bus. The original bus driver no-showed, when the bus finally showed it was almost two hours late. The first stop was 23 MILES away near Austin Bergstrom-Hi Sign Brewery-decent beer, but nothing special. The second stop was another 17 MILES east To Cedar Creek to a START-UP "whiskey" distillery-Armadillo Whiskey Distillery-the whiskey is only "whiskey" thanks to a loophole in Texas liquor laws, its moonshine and it's terrible. The owner Matthew Wells spent so much time on the tour that he delayed the bus getting to our third stop. At the third stop-Adelbert's Brewery-we had less than 40 minutes to consume four beers.

reviews.author: Mark L.
reviews.description: Please don't waste your money. All you pay for is the bus to drive you around. You have to pay for every stop you make. The places they take you too are downtown Austin (que the fuck that ) and a distillery where again you pay for your drink. So y be like me and pay over a $100 dollars for a bus do it yourself and have a better time.

reviews.author: Katherine L.
reviews.description: I started the process of booking a private event through TBB 4 months before the date. We had a great experience with them on a public tour the prior year so figured it would be great for a birthday event. Unfortunately, this was not the case for the private tour. It was $99/person (which does not include tax OR a payment fee) which includes a bus that takes you to 3 different locations (these will not be confirmed until the week prior...) from 12-5, pizza lunch, and a voucher for every attendee to get a free visit at a later date. When making the payments- which can only be made by 1 person, they continued to keep forgetting to include my original deposit towards the payment.. and when I asked if I could pay in person (cash or check) to avoid the payment fee they simply said no. So all in all, I ended up paying close to $200 in JUST this fee alone.  The day of the event, we arrived at our first location and they had no idea that we were coming. So our group of 38 waited for near 10 minutes before knowing what we were doing. Not off to the best start. At our last event, the tour guide told me it was time to leave at 4 pm... which was 1 hour before the agreed end time. After convincing him to try and call his contact from TBB, he finally said we could stay until 4:40.  They never had any of the vouchers to give the guests. The following week I called to speak to someone about my experience. The woman basically said it was the brewery and the guide's fault and took absolutely no responsibility. She ended the conversation with "we will try harder next time". She agreed to send emails to each of my guests with the voucher by the end of the week. Well, that week came and when I contacted them they said it was too difficult and asked me do it instead which involved gathering 38 of my guest's emails and emailing each person an individual voucher (they emailed me the 38 different attachments......) In exchange for my trouble they sent me a few extra vouchers. I responded telling them how ridiculous this was for me to spend my time having to do all this. No response.  Long story short, for each person to pay $99 and all the different fees that I had to pay - they were incredibly unorganized, poor customer service, and just flat out not worth it. Definitely NOT recommending them to anyone. I felt like I had to spend WAY too much time trying to help organize and figure out the details of the event which in my opinion, is not my responsibility. There are plenty of other tours out there who will provide a smoother and more enjoyable time.

reviews.author: Tyler R.
reviews.description: I wish I didn't have to give one star but I do in order to leave a review. We saw a tent for this company at a festival so we purchased four tickets because we thought this would be a fun thing to do for a bachelor party. We were not told it was a public tour or that we had to register online so we thought we had seats on our private tour. We were told we could have the other groomsmen call and pay for a ticket at a later date once we got all the info for the tour which we were supposed to get the next day. After one week of no response to my email, I called two different numbers, both of which had a voicemail that said email, do not leave a voicemail. I've never heard of a company not having a phone you can call and talk to a human being. I sent an email and got no reply. So I tried again two days later, I sent two and after the second one, I got a phone call. I was told at that time, almost two weeks after I was supposed to get the details, that it was a public tour, now there are not enough seats for everyone who wants to go, we had to register online, the ticket is just a reminder you paid for a tour. I explained that we were not told any of that when we purchased the tickets, the woman told me it's all on the receipt, which, we also weren't told when we purchased the tickets on a Square card reader and the receipt gets sent to junk mail, we knew what the cost was so why read the receipt? The woman on the phone agreed to give me a refund for the trouble and not being clear about logistics and having such a hard time dealing with the company. I sent her the receipt, no response. I emailed two more times, I finally got "it will be processed." Nearly two weeks and 7 emails later, still no refund. DO NOT SPEND ANY MONEY WITH THIS "COMPANY". You are made to feel like a nuisance once you've paid for the service they are supposed to provide. They have your money, why should they deal with you now?? I do hair and the biggest part of providing a great experience for my clients is customer service. If I ran my business the way these people do, I would have no business! WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED! DO NOT THROW AWAY YOUR HARD EARNED MONEY!!

reviews.author: William S.
reviews.description: What a day! We talked about doing a wine tour for years. Finally a friend got a hold of Alicia and she did the rest.   I've been to a couple of wineries but never a tour. You never know how things will go, but this was a great trip. Alicia was very knowledgable and got us to a great variety of wineries. I learned a lot and had some great wine. She even got me the cheese I had been craving all day. Wine can do that to a brother, you know.  I'm looking forward to another tour next year.

reviews.author: Patty T.
reviews.description: I wish I read the previous reviews before making this phone call.  Today I called the main number for information and spoke to Alicia (sp?) for information.  Extremely rude and unprofessional.  I thought we were disconnected, but when I called a second time, she said, "You called this number already. WHY ARE YOU CALLING?" ARC just lost business for 400 people.  That's why I was calling...

reviews.author: Rachel D.
reviews.description: We had Alicia as our guide for a bachelorette party and had a wonderful time! In the planning stages she will work with you to set up a payment options for a group, that way none of us had to put down our card to cover for the whole group! We all agreed that we will definitely use this service in the future :)

reviews.author: Jasmin D.
reviews.description: My friends and I bought the ARC Hill Country Wine Tour from Living Social for about $30. Trying to schedule the tour was really confusing, because the system they have on their main website is not the same system/website that you book with if you have a Living Social deal (it was a bookeo.com site). My first recommendation is to include, somewhere on your website, a link to your bookeo.com site for people who have Living Social/Groupon deals. I also submitted multiple emails from the website's "contact us" page without any response. When I did call Alicia to check if she received my emails, she claimed that she had not, but she had yet to even ask me my name....Weird. Anyway, this could have gone alot smoother.   The actual tour was okay. My friend read reviews about Alicia showing up late, and she did. We were all on the bus for the most part and she showed up maybe 4-5 minutes late. I completely agree that she, as the business owner and tour guide, should be the first person there with the driver. Second recommendation - show up early and take care of checking people in as they arrive, not 10-15 minutes after the tour was supposed to start.   Alicia talked to us the entire way telling us the history of wine making in the Texas Hill Country, and that was really nice. We were sitting in the very back, so it was hard to hear her. I would get a small microphone to help with that, because the stuff she was saying was very informative. We went to 3 different wineries. All were excellent, and we learned alot. My favorite was Singing Water.   After the 2nd winery, Alicia put on this wine tasting dvd while we were on the bus, which was basically a "Master of Wine" talking about how much she knows about wine. It was insanely comical. We were all thinking "omg is this chic serious?" I do like that Alicia tried to give us a break from hearing her talk, and she probably needed it to, but there HAS to be some better material to show us. Please, get another dvd that is not so obnoxious. I did a quick youtube search on "Wine 101" and a handful of much better options popped up.   All in all, we had a fun time. I feel bad for giving only two stars, but the truth is, there is alot of room for improvement. Had I paid the full $100+ dollars for this wine tour I would be outraged. It was fine for $30 bucks though.

reviews.author: Shirley F.
reviews.description: I realized this would not be a professionally run operation when we got on the bus. The tour guide stood up, gave us all a big smile, and immediately said, "I'm not going to talk much to y'all this time because I'm tired and I don't feel like it."   It all went downhill from there. She then told us she was not a wine expert and explained her business at length, asking us to please tip her and telling us about her money issues. Despite her first statement, she never once paused for breath the entire ride to Fredericksburg, alternatively talking about her personal taste in wine, sharing a random, vague tidbits of information about wine and Texas, and telling us more about her personal thoughts about wine and how she treated her friends who didn't appreciate it  properly. She occasionally asked questions about the groups' tastes in wine and was condescending to those who answered 'wrong.'  My seatmate and I were looking out the window during the bus ride and we occasionally whispered to each about the sites we saw on the way there since this was our first trip out to Fredericksburg. The tour guide heard our whispering and chided us like naughty schoolgirls. She then told us about another customer who asked her to stop talking so much and how she told him off as well. We were astonished.   I look younger than my age, which occasionally gets me treated in a very condescending manner, and this was one of these occasions. I was the only one she carded, which I could understand, but then she made non-stop cracks about my relative youth and taste in wine. She asked who liked sweet wines, and since I was one of the ones who raised my hand, she repeatedly told me I would someday "grow into my big girl pants," assuming I was completely ignorant of good wine, that familiar creature, due to my youthful appearance.  She was also rude and/or condescending to the rest of my party and some of our fellow wine tourists. I could see why she found it necessary to repeatedly remind all of us about tipping her.   Lunch was very small and disappointing: a small turkey sandwich on dry bread, a small bag of chips, and a cookie.    The wine tastings themselves were fabulous! We really, really enjoyed the wineries when the tour guide left us to ourselves and we were allowed to chat and taste. To quote Jefferson, "Wine brightens the life and thinking of anyone!" We also appreciated the bathroom breaks the bus made there and back. Though we will avoid ARC like the plague, we intend to attempt a proper wine tour in that area. There are many other similarly priced wine tour options in the area that I recommend trying before this company. For a few dollars more, you can actually do three wineries in a limo with Fredericksburg Wine and Limo. Fredericksburg is lovely and the wines are fabulous!

reviews.author: Bailey S.
reviews.description: We were on the tour on 01/13. The bus was nice, Alicia was pleasant and knowledgeable.The tour is definitely worth it. She didn't talk about tipping or making fun at others offensively at all. We went to 3 wineries in Federickberg. A lot of relaxing time. Lunch was satisfying. It was chicken salad sandwich with chip and cookies. The wine testing was great. I read the reviews in the past and I think Alicia has listened to all the critics and has improved the services. The only reason I gave 4 stars because before the tour took off, Alicia was late 7 min. while about 25 customers was waiting on the bus. The guide should be the first one there.  Anyway, take the tour...it was fun and nice scenery.

reviews.author: Wanda W.
reviews.description: My husband and I did theTexas Hill Country Wine Tour.  It  was GREAT!   Alicia was very nice and informative.  Since we are pretty new to San Antonio, She told us about all of her favorite places in the Hill Country and more.  I could not write them down fast enough.  Can not wait to try some of her other tours.I highly recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Ben C.
reviews.description: Great tour and excellent value!  Very funny guide.

reviews.author: Lori R.
reviews.description: Great tour.  Alicia is a  wonderful tour guide.  A group from work did the wine tour on Friday.  Fun way to spend the day.  We loved it so much we plan to do a beer tour in Dec.   Highly recommend this tour.

reviews.author: Pablo V.
reviews.description: The best wine and liquor store in San Antonio. WOW!   I would like to keep this store to myself. The staff was outstanding, friendly, and offered a tasting of Garrison Bros. If you are new to scotch or bourbon, it might be worth checking this place out during a tasting session. Also, pricing was excellent. Purchased a bottle of Oban 14 and paid $69 vs. Costco $71 and my local Fiesta Liquor $89.

reviews.author: Artists W.
reviews.description: Honestly I want to give a big shout to Mike. I walked in the store he greeted me then assisted me what I was looking for. He walked me over the aisle the item was out of stock. I asked him should I try something else but he advised he never tried the drink I was referring to within a seconds into the convo he noticed the original drink I came for was at the top of the shelf, grabbed a ladder and proceeded to give me the bottle. That really made me happy bc I've been looking for this bottle or Rose for a while. Thanks Mike

reviews.author: Nick W.
reviews.description: If you are buying in bulk, read:  Staff was great at helping us out but beware that you may not be informed that the store will only refund you $500 cash for returns. The rest will go on a Total Wine gift card.  We shopped here for our wedding at the beginning of November 2021 and found out about this local, store policy at the time we were returning the product.
