It especially impacted us since we were encouraged to buy more alcohol than necessary even after we disclosed our wedding guest count had decreased significantly.  Further, the manager reluctantly refunded us in full and hung up the phone on us after we thanked her and were polite.  I've always shopped here but may go elsewhere in the future.

reviews.author: Dale M.
reviews.description: The last two times I've gone in I can never get any help in this location.  All the employees are standing around talking to each other or they ignore you.  I've always been a good customer but have started going to Specs in Leon Springs where there is much better customer service.

reviews.author: Kassie O.
reviews.description: You can Almost Always find what You are looking for! Or the Awesome Employees are Happy to look into whatever it is they are out of stock of get you an answer as to when it will be restocked!

reviews.author: Janie F.
reviews.description: Love Total Wine, I just wish they carried Sauza 100% Agave white Tequila at Memorial Location. Also deceiving that they deliver free if you purchase $99 but only if you purchase wine! Otherwise I love it, my place to shop for my booze!

reviews.author: Kara S.
reviews.description: Can't say enough good things about my recent visit to Total Wine. Jose G. was extremely helpful not only to me but to other customers as well. He knew the store very well and helped customers find exactly what they were looking for. He went out of his way to answer any questions I had while also recommending great things to try right now that I bought and in the future. I love learning about wine and spirits and learned more in the few minutes I was speaking with him than at any distillery. He not only made great suggestions but gave me options at multiple price points and told me how many different drinks I could use them with. I have always loved total wine but this experience really cemented that I will be purchasing all my wine liquor and beer from here going forward.

reviews.author: Grace T.
reviews.description: This is my family's go to when we need alcohol. They have an awesome selection of wine, beer, cider, and liquor ranging from the cheap of the cheap to the best of the best. Something for everyone. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable. They have classes you can sign up for too. My parents have taken a few classes with the staff and they've loved them. Everything from pairing for wine to whisky tasting.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: This is my favorite store to pick up wine and liquor. It's definitely more customer friendly than specs and has a bigger variety than a grocery store. If you need help picking your wine Clay is your guy to go to he gives great recommendations and he keeps you within your price point last time we went he recommended all six wines for me and we loved them all. We just went today and he recommended some Pinot noir some reds and even some French wine.

reviews.author: Hailey Q.
reviews.description: Great selection, young lady at the register was rude and had a terrible attitude. Although the other employees helped me find what I needed and asked me if I needed help, the cashier ruined the whole experience.

reviews.author: Muriel S.
reviews.description: My brain was on overdrive. I knew just what I wanted and they got it for me. The variety is vast and the selections are to die for. They had a great local wine to sample and before I left I had a few bottles to drink and share. A lovely surprise that brought smiles to many faces. I think they are one of the best at allowing you to try many things without breaking The bank.,

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: Raymond was the most high quality employee that has ever helped me out at Total Wine. He gave me a tour of every isle, pinpointing the specific preference I had about wines and specific alcohols!

reviews.author: Paulina M.
reviews.description: They make u fall in love with a product and then they take it out my husband went to get mar azul tequila and now they don't have it anymore thanks to the internet  we found it at Alamo city liquor store

reviews.author: Trice P.
reviews.description: We get everything from everywhere here! If you can't get it they find it for you. The staff is amazing and always helping everyone. Even when I'm not sure what I want they lead me to things from past assignments overseas that I thought we would never enjoy agin. I honestly love the atmosphere of this store.  The only bad rating I see is from some joker who lives in Florida. Thanks for complaining about carts Corey C. Like the rest of the free world use hand sanitizer and stop complaining about petty things when our stores are amazing!!!!

reviews.author: Darren R.
reviews.description: I love the variety wines and spirits I have a better selection specs and that's surprising

reviews.author: Melody M.
reviews.description: I walked up to a group of staff, about 4 of them, I asked for assistance looking for a particular wine. They all starred at me with a 30 second awkward silence. Pablo wasn't interested in helping me but the manager Katie was willing to help.

reviews.author: Patty R.
reviews.description: Do not come to this store!!!! People are extremely rude!!!!!! Not willing to be courteous whatsoever!!!! I refuse to ever shop here again!!!! I'd post zero stars if I could

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: They have it all and then some. The place is so well organized and it's huge,the staff know their stuff and are professional. They have huge selection of wine and they have all kinds of Bourbon,Rye,Tequila,Gin,Whiskey and much more from low prices to very expensive like I saw a bottle of Tequila behind a glass cabinet for like $2500!  I went there recently to buy Luxardo Cherries for my Old Fashions and I found that they have Humidor with nice selection of premium cigars so it eliminates two stops in case I am in the mood for a nice cigar with my old fashion I don't have to stop at Cigar shop and traffic in this area can get little crazy so less stops the more better. I am not a frequent shopper here but I might stop by more cause they have a nice Humidor now and I think their prices are little cheaper than most places or competitive. Like to mention that all ready Jell-O shots,Buttery Nipple shots and few more I can't remember the name but have some funny names like for example Twisted Shots and Miami Vice Shots in a 15 count package which come in different flavors and  Wine and More has all your party accessories for your New Years Eve Party!! I am coming back for some party shots!! Oh I just found a bottle Cognac for $3999. Look up there Web Site you can type in whatever your looking for and it will show a pic and description but I recommend you go there instead oh and they have on line pickup too. I have no pics for this review but if you go there you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Cory C.
reviews.description: Weren't wiling down carts during the pandemic. Could be spreading infection to everyone that uses certain carts. Unfortunate because it's a good store.

reviews.author: Sam S.
reviews.description: Total wine is my favorite Wine store in San Antonio. The assortment is great and they have good service. They offer wine tastings throughout the month and have a good liquor and spirits selection.   The price range is good for the majority of consumers and the aisles are easily to navigate.

name: Ranger Creek Brewing and Distilling
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: We just moved back to SA and are happy to be able to go hang out at Ranger Creek again. My husband joined the bottle club, so we've been able yo enjoy some of the member only events. Their drink options never disappoint!

reviews.author: Shirley G.
reviews.description: Made a stop here on our way back to Houston.  Jim was great!  We did the tasting and Jim was extremely knowledgeable on each of products we tasted.  He has a wonderful sense of humor and really made the stop super fantastic!  One of the best parts Of our trip!!!   Thank you Jim

reviews.author: Erica R.
reviews.description: Cute place. Great outdoor venue. I was pregnant when I visited so couldn't partake in anything. You can bring dogs and kids. May update when I decide to bring my baby. This place is in my neighborhood

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: I left SA in 2015 and haven't been back to this Distillery since then. I was lucky that I'm still part of their bi-weekly volunteering list for bottling and labeling, but I wasn't able to make it to the last few trips, until last week.   It was still a great experience and I enjoyed their expanded selection of beer and whiskey. And I even bought distillery-only bottles for my trip back.   Looking forward to next time!

reviews.author: John H.
reviews.description: I celebrated my military retirement here earlier this week, and wish to extend my appreciation to Dennis and the rest of the team and R.C. for their hospitality during the event.  We started with a tour of their brewing and distilling facility, which is very unassuming to people who are simply walking or driving by the building. The tour was just the right amount of time, and offered us a good look into how their production works. And then, samples! We tried three or four of the whiskies being sold regularly, and got a look at their upcoming seasonal/promotional products. Kudos to our tour guide!  The food was catered, with R.C. taking care of everything, from setup to cleanup.  The products these guys have available are all very good, so make a stop out the next time you're driving south on IH-35.

reviews.author: Sarah R.
reviews.description: I booked a virtual whiskey tasting here for our leadership team at work and boy was it worth every (very reasonably priced) penny.   Dennis - Helped me set everything up, was super helpful and tolerated my constant check-ins to make sure everything was going well.   The samples - All came on time, despite the freak weather in Texas. And the presentation of said samples was very impressive. Not just a few samples thrown in a cardboard box, but individually labeled bottles in a branded  wooden box with a tasting card, lovingly packaged to ensure no wasted whiskey.  Mike - Our host, was friendly, knowledgeable, and pretty dang funny. He was great at involving everyone in the tasting convo, even those who opted out of having whiskey.   Overall, great virtual tasting that I will 100% be doing again even outside of the covid times. 10/10 would recommend.

reviews.author: MaryNell W.
reviews.description: Ranger Creek tour was lots of fun for me and my friends. TJ knows what he is talking about and he made the education and tour interesting for us common folks. I have toured the facility a couple of times before because they do a great job and I like supporting local businesses.  I do wish Col. Mc had been there, but hopefully he will come back to lead tours again soon : ) The price is very affordable and you can even hang out at the bar and food truck with your new found friends from the tour.

reviews.author: David L.
reviews.description: Bottom Line: One of the better breweries I've been to around the US. First time at a distillery and definitely first brew-stillery I've been to. Very impressive and delicious assortment of beers and a great variety of spirits makes Ranger Creek one of my favorite places in Texas for sure. The $10 tour is the absolute best I've ever been to, learning about beer making and whiskey distilling! The Even bought a souvenir glass!  This place is an experience for their tour. You MUST do it! But you should sign up at least 3-4 days in advance if not a week ahead because the spots do sell out. For $10, you will get TWO beer tickets which you can drink during the tour. Then at the distilling part of the tour, we were given 3 .5 ounce tastings of three different whiskeys. That alone is like a $8 value on top of two beers. And when it says 45 minute tour, it's more like 1:30-2 hours long because Big Mike, our tour guide, is so damn passionate about what they do there. Expect to stay longer...you'll want to.   The beers on top are excellent. Lots of variety. Not the best spot if you're an IPA fan but they have lots of other options. My favorite was their Belgian White Ale and their Hefeveizen. They also have super cheap 6 packs to go, ranging from $5-8 or so. Totally worth it! You can do beer and whiskey flight tastings so you'll have to chance to try it all!   Amazing brewery and distillery. Totally recommend. Especially on nice sunny day where you can sit outside.

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: This place holds a special place in my husbands heart. Him and his friends are huge fans of their whiskey and always get a bottle for special occasions. Their brewery/distillery has tons of seating some inside, some outside with a bar to order by each one. Outside seating has shade and fans so even while it's still the end of summer you can enjoy wherever you're able to find a spot.

reviews.author: Ron S.
reviews.description: It's been a year since I've been back to the brewery- it was nice to see the changes and growth and soon expansion.  Stopped in for a beer- not disappointed in the love struck Hefe and Laguna Madre  - excellent choices

reviews.author: Curtis H.
reviews.description: I still really love their bourbon , but their female bartender tonight really has no business speaking to people. Had such a crappy attitude  should have just left. Purchased 3 bottle of their bourbon and a flight, but just don't personally care for the rye and she threw such a fit when I asked if I could substitute it for anything else. Really a turn off when she then presented me with the bill expecting at least an 18% tip when she crammed 2 of the bottles into one bag even after I said they where gifts. Geez I really should have used the curbside. That guy at least is friendly. Where is the Colonel? He never treated us this way?

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: Man this place is awesome!   We did a tour while COVID-19 was going on and I felt completely safe. There was plenty of hand sanitizer and they encouraged social distancing. Everyone was required to wear a mask, as well as the employees.  We did a tour and it came with two free beer tickets. The person leading the tour was funny and was very knowledgeable. Tour lasted for about an hour and we ended up getting a few more drinks in their back space behind the building.    I did feel a little unsafe in the back space, the tables are spread out but I didn't see anyone actively disinfecting the tables in between groups. They were actively serving cocktails, beer, beer flights, whiskey and whiskey flights.

reviews.author: Rosamaria E.
reviews.description: We were there for Beer Und Brats at Ranger Creek.  I had the chicken brat with marinara and my friend had the Texan from Bubbas Brat House that a yummy food truck there.  Unfortunately I did not take a picture of it before I ate it.  Lol.  Just know it was the perfect combination with a 4x4oz.  Atmosphere was very relaxed and staff was great.  We met some really great people as well.  We will definitely become some regulars.  Update: The owner reached out to me via Yelp and thanked me for my review..  I really appreciate her not for only reading my review but also taking the time to thank me for my review..  Now that is Texan hospitality.

reviews.author: Amber P.
reviews.description: I attended the day tour with my husband September 18th of this year. We enjoyed ourselves the whole time. They supplied Good beer and very informative and funny throughout the tour. Definitely recommend this to friends and family.

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Great for military members. Great for everyone.  Take advantage of the ONLY brewstillery in the state.  Great gift ideas, great customer service.  They need to make a beer after a NAVY corpsman.

reviews.author: David H.
reviews.description: Today Ranger Creek debuted their San Antonio Hatch Chili Lager.   They offered the beer, a hatch chili margarita, and a hatch chili beer Michelada!!!  Beer was a spicy with an earthy undertone... great with any taco, chalupa, or Gordita... also curious to cook with this beer.   The Michelada was spicy, tangy, and herbed with a smooth finish... would have been better dressed with tajin and chamoy...  The margarita was a very good, made with the chili beer and white whiskey... very tasty, earthy, and sweet with an exotic taste!   They held a raffle and I won a six pack of the hatch

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: This place has come a long way. They now have a nice back patio making it easier to get together with people. The day we went, they had a live jazz band. The beer, whiskey and cocktails never disappoint. I love that they often have special events.   You can buy small batch liquor bottles to go if any Of theirs whiskeys Interest you. I had been there before and they had whiskey flights. This particular time they did not.   One more thing that makes this place awesome is that they are dog friendly. It is nice to have a place that lets yours furry friend hang out.

reviews.author: Jacqui M.
reviews.description: Being a very seasoned beer drinker, I was very pleased with the Love Struck Hefe at this SA drinking spot.  The staff was pleasant and provided an in depth description of the whiskey and beer selections.  I attended an event, so breakfast tacos and bloody Mary fixins were available.  The Whiskey flight offers the opportunity to sample small portions of 3 whiskeys, including distillery only options.  Next event will involve Beer Brats, yum!

reviews.author: Ashley P.
reviews.description: I booked the VIP tour for our 10 year anniversary trip to San Antonio based off a suggestion from a friend who lives in the area and we weren't disappointed.  The tour was very informative and we really enjoyed learning so much.  My husband loved the choices of whiskey and bourbon chosen for us during the tour.  The price was very reasonable and I will definitely suggest it to anyone else visiting the area!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: WHAT WHAT?  A distillery AND a brewery all in one place?  I didn't think this was possible!    Whiskey flights and beer flights are both available here folks.  You can truly sample it all here.  It's a cool, laid back place, but the tables do fill up quick on weekend afternoons.    There's 10 or 12 picnic tables inside and more outside under an awning (in the back). Yes, I scoped it out for y'all - you're welcome.  The line to get beer or whiskey refills isn't bad at all.  There's usually a food truck out front and they also allow you to bring your own food inside, so I'll give them a star for that!

reviews.author: Dominic K.
reviews.description: Beer 7-9 pretty good . But bartender is unknowable, let alone sensitive as hell. Maybe a place to bring a Mormon family, but otherwise it's decent.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were in San Antonio for a long weekend and we had just landed on a Wednesday and they opened at 3. We walked in at 3:01 and they had some food out for the team members, which I thought was pretty cool. They were brewing as well, since I could smell the hops boiling away!  I ordered an IPA, that was great and two pulled pork tacos.  The server behind the counter was super nice and she brought out the tacos. They were pretty large and the pulled pork was especially juicy and the toppings were perfect. These were so good. I tried 6 places for BBQ and this was number 3 by far, plus they make their own beer, score sone for the Gipper. There was true smokiness to the tacos and just delicious.  I got one more beer and I would highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: MidWest B.
reviews.description: I'm a native Texan that owns a Midwest brewery so I'm researching:  - props to the German pils and Helles - those are hard beers to make because they depend on being really clean and faithful to the fermentation process and they knocked it out of the park.  That may be the best Helles I've ever had - EVER - The Belgian quad was many things but a Belgian style quad it was not - grant it, the only Belgian style quads I've had were in Belgium - stouts we're hyper sweet, but that may be a market thing, but Irish or English stouts they were not. - IPAs - they were fine but everyone is doing IPAs - so if you are into IPAs - their triple is the jam!!!  - Tacos came in a bit cold the brisket was great but the pulled pork left a lot to be desired ...  Had I come in for brisket tacos (and had they been served hot), and a full pour of Helles, this place would have received a 6 out of five!

reviews.author: Rod C.
reviews.description: Very disappointing. First visit. Brought my boss for lunch, and had high hopes. Ordered burgers to go and had a mango slush (very tasty!) while waiting. Rather slow, even with a largely empty dining roomSadly, upon return to the office, we discovered both our burgers were burnt to a crisp. I'll give Weathered Souls another chance, but won't bring a guest until I'm confident the food will be acceptable. [UPDATE] Note 1:  The kitchen is operated by South BBQ and Kitchen, not Weathered Souls Brewery.  Note 2: Weathered Souls owner, Mike Holt, very graciously reached out to make accommodation for today's unfortunate occurrence. None is required, and I look forward to a better experience at a future visit.

reviews.author: Alden C.
reviews.description: Another fabulous brewery! I have been wanting to try Weathered Souls for a little while now and the opportunity finally arose  where it became a possibility.  Rise and Shine was the beer I had from this brewery and I was very impressed by it! This beer had a nice roasty,  coffee flavor to it which was amazing! Once again another brewery where I am eager to explore their other beer options. If they are as awe inspiring as Rise and Grind I will become a very, very avid fan. Not that I'm not heading in that direction right now.

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: What a find on the Northside!   The Northside is full of chain restaurants and cookie-cutter feeling sports, but this place is a winner.  Several QUALITY beers to chose from depending on your taste and good food too.   Get a flight of beers to start off. The wait staff knows their stuff and can help guide selections.   Once you have had a sampling, hone in on one try enjoy and get your food order in. You'll be enjoying a top-notch beer and tasty food in no time!   No complaints here. Everyone we talked to was cool and very helpful with beer selections. We'll be back for sure!  Check them out and then hit me up on Instagram @CheadDay_SA and let me know what you thought!

reviews.author: Drew M.
reviews.description: I don't think I've ever knew there was a brewstillery with a bar/restaurant until I came here. It was a Saturday evening and my party was waiting for another restaurant. Like I mentioned earlier, I didn't know this brewstillery served food and drink. So we decided to go for a couple of drinks before dinner. My wife and our two friends got the hard seltzer's and I went for the ginger bread stout. My wife's seltzer was really fruity and bubbly (I'm going to buy a case at a wine store later). I couldn't really taste the gingerbread in my stout, but it wasn't super hoppy, it was sweet, and it went down pretty smooth. I need to come back sometime soon to taste their bar food and try some other of their offerings.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: Love this brewery! It's super spacious, lots of beer selections and they even do guided tours of the facility where they brew their beer. Definitely a fun place to bring a large group and hangout. Service is fast and friendly.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: Atmosphere, Food, and Beer...All exceptional!  If you are a fellow lover of dark beers (stouts specifically) then this place is for you! This man knows how to make stouts and gets very creative with the flavors.   I ordered a burger and honestly felt the price was too high for what I received, but I understand the price is high because I'm helping to pay for the rent of this place. This establishment is big! So...burger price was a little high, but the beers were so delicious...I was in stout heaven.   Check it out for yourself!

reviews.author: Aurora F.
reviews.description: Since this place has opened it has continually raised the standard for San Antonio Craft Breweries! The ambience is relaxed, with a simplistic decor giving you the feeling to come as you are.   They have many different styles to choose from, and I personally recommend the fan favorites Material Girl, West Coast IPA, and Dale Shine!   They also serve food, complimentary of South BBQ, the Sweet Heat Brussels are beyond delish, lightly fried with a sweet and spicy peanut sauce.   They do not serve food on Mondays, but have a food truck on site!

reviews.author: Briana C.
reviews.description: First off, shoutout to Weathered Souls Brewing for starting the BLACK IS BEAUTIFUL initiative! The recipe is delicious and for such a great cause!   Check it out at https://blackisbeautiful.beer/  I had the pleasure of visiting the brewery back in December killing time before my flight! All the beers I tried were delicious! If you are a fan of dark beers this is the place for you! They offer a great variety of dark beers! Be sure to check out the menu because they have lighter beers also. It's not a very large brewery but a decent size and they have a few games you can play if your with a group! Definitely check out this brewery if you are in the area!  Also, be sure to check the COVID restrictions because I am not sure how they are handling that currently since I visited last year.

reviews.author: Jarvis N.
reviews.description: I was interested in visiting this place ever since they started the Black Is Beautiful initiative and I can say that they did not disappoint. So many wonderful beers that I highly recommend starting with a flight. Only ate some tasty brussel sprouts as I was already full from earlier. Even grabbed some beer to bring home.  Now, if only I could get them to distribute where i live now....

reviews.author: Joseph E.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time to meet a friend and support our local breweries and I'm glad I did. As we walk in you notice the place is very clean, has a nice dÃ©cor and a relaxed vibe. As we walk up to the counter to order we are greeted by one of the servers who goes over the draft menu with us, provides a few samples then takes our order: one Prestidigitator Doppelbock and one Habitual Line Stepper Imperial Stout. I start of trying the Habitual Line Stepper and found it not too heavy with notes of coffee towards the end. It was smooth and had an overall pleasant taste. Next, I tried the Prestidigitator Doppelbock and really liked it. It had a light taste for a dark beer with strong hints of malt which I prefer over hops (not an IPA guy).  Overall, considering I only tried two of their offerings I'm be happy to come back and try the rest sometime soon. If you're in the neighborhood be sure to come by and try this local gem. Cheers!

reviews.author: Gabriela R.
reviews.description: I was excited to try this place out because they serve a partial menu with South BBQ, which is far away from me on the south side of San Antonio. We went on a week day evening for dinner and drinks. The location is really nice! I love the ascetics. When we walked in the place was a little on the dead side, so it was odd that we weren't greeted by the bartender. It was our first time, so we had no idea how or where to order and there were no signs displayed. I know this is a brewery, so I didn't expect they would have servers. We eventually had to wave down the bartender so we could place our order. I ordered a very delicious and flavorful cider! YUMMY! For dinner I ordered chips and brisket queso and two brisket taco! All of it was a hit! I really hope they bring back side though. I notice that fellow yelpers have pictures with sides, so I was a little disappointed when those were not available. I would definitely recommend this place for a hearty snack and a solid adult beverage. Just remember, no sides at the moment so order accordingly.

reviews.author: Kevin B.
reviews.description: We stopped in here a few years ago while visiting San Antonio and we really liked the venue; it was a very nice place to relax with a few beers and enjoy life. We got a flight of IPAs that were decent, but I know I would like them more now as I love IPAs in general more than I did then. I'm really glad to see that they're doing well and I would recommend coming here to anyone who loves craft beer and who likes to support their local breweries. We'll definitely be giving them another chance the next time we're in the area.

reviews.author: Sejal L.
reviews.description: Weathered Souls is one of those places where your soul always feels more rejuvenated contrary to their name. It is probably one of- if not my favorite- brewery in San Antonio.   I was introduced to this place by a friend, and my friends and I have been back many times ever since. With COVID aside, they have really cool events are have a great vibe. They have a small outdoor section and indoor area. Their quality/variety of beer, the incredible service, and just the wonderful family feel really makes this place great. They are constantly coming out with incredible flavors with my favorite being a Vietnamese French Press they had some time ago. They also do flights, which makes it fun to try different flavors. They recently reopened, and it is a place you should definitely check out.  Also something notable about this brewery is they dropped a beer called Black is Beautiful. This beer is to support the injustice a lot of African Americans have faced and to raise funds to combat police brutality. You can learn about it more here: https://blackisbeautiful.beer/. This beer is also incredible. This is just further evidence to show you the quality of people behind Weathered Souls.   Could not recommend this brewery anymore!

reviews.author: Darshan J.
reviews.description: I don't drink so I can't comment on the quality of that but just came here to hang out with friends and it's Very nice laid back atmosphere with nice outdoor seating.   What I really like about this place is their Brisket and BBQ Sauce. Some of the best I've had in San Antonio so far, definitely way better than Bill Millers BBQ that I see littered everywhere in San Antonio. The BBQ Sauce they have is unique I've never had anything like it until I ate brisket here.   While they're primarily a Bar if they had more BBQ options I'm sure they'd do great.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: My family and I visited Weathered Souls while passing through San Antonio. Their beer was good not great. I had their double west coast IPA and it was nice but nothing to write home about.  Now on to the service, our bartender was stingy and rude. He gave us half his attention and only allowed one sample per person, which based on  the prices you would think they included at least a dozen samples per beer. Our bartender gave us our beers and left and refused to check on us again for the 45 minutes we were there. We finally had to get the attention of someone else to check us out. I will say that she was much friendlier and even gave us a very generous sample of a beer we wanted to try that the other bartender refused to give us.   All in all if you are looking for pretty good overpriced  beer with not great service is might be worth a stop

reviews.author: Kai H.
reviews.description: Brewery is in a fairly large shopping center. There were limited options when I went; however, all the beer there was very good, especially their stouts.   Service was marginal, bartender was just chatting with two people at another table for over 10 mins without greeting or order being placed.  Since I was only going to be able to try them that day due to work I decided to wait, but I would have walked out otherwise.

reviews.author: Linda L.
reviews.description: We have been going to Weathered Souls for years. We always go when our son and his wife are in town. Five of us went yesterday and it was rave reviews all around for the beer and the food.  I had the pulled pork in a lettuce wrap and it was so fresh and delicious. Pulled pork, coleslaw and a yummy sauce. I recommend it highly. The rest of the group also loved their food - hamburger, brisket sandwich, brisket taco and hummus with veggies. The guys loved the Breakfast in Zambia imperial stout and my daughter- in-law loved the Brown Bag Lunches beer which was a sour. There was a peanut butter after taste that everyone really liked.  (Of course, we all had to taste it!). You can sit in or out and the folks running it are very nice. Good place to hang out!

reviews.author: Nicholas W.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! Beer is really good, and it's nice to have something brewed in home. The vibe here is really relaxing, great for a good get-together with friends or just enjoying some time out of the house!

reviews.author: YunnÃ¡n C.
reviews.description: Came here on Friday after work with a buddy after seeing they had just opened the previous week. Went ahead and tried the flight, minus the coffee porter. I really liked the tangerine wheat and the IPA. Overall a great set of people running this place. Friendly and attentive! The interior is large with a few picnic tables for large groups and four person tables.   There's plenty of parking under the bridge. I've heard there's a food truck during the busier times.  There's also plans to expand in the future to have more outdoor seating as currently there's a few spots to sit outside.   Come check it out, definitely wortha try!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Gene Simmons of Kiss said of his father who was a salesman at the end of the day it is ultimately you who sells something. I wish businesses were more attuned to this. At the end of the day it is a place's owners and staff that makes us go back or keeps us away. I came to "Man Overboard Brewing Co." for a soft opening. It is nearby an underpass that opens up with more parking. When I arrived staff were already outside greeting you. Although this doesn't cost a business a penny it is priceless.  The brewery is really, really small but big on charm. Inside there are picnic style benches for seating. There is finite seating for large and small groups. Once inside the owner greeted me and simply said, "Welcome, thank you for coming here!" As I have said before when a place is not bumping this is the most optimal time to make a connection to a patron. The tapmasters, who happened to be owners were absolutely friendly which transferred to all the their products. Basically you go to the counter and order. They serve beer, wine, seltzers and ciders. It is a very limited taplist right now but the owner assured me they are adding more items next week.   Soft openings are meant as an opportunity for a business to see what needs to tweaked. Lucky for me the place was functioning like a well-oiled machine. My only critique from me is for them to consider adding outdoor seating. Other than that I like that it is small but intimate. My understanding is that they are former veterans who decided to open a brewery. I can sense those experiences have lead them to this moment. They offered a flight so I went with that. I had their blonde, their coffee porter, tangerine wit and ipa. They all had really good flavors. I will say the ipa seemed more boozier than its 6.5% abv. As I was leaving I definitely felt like a man in fact overboard.    To me as I travel from both regional and local breweries it's not the beers that sell a place but rather the people. Product can and should develop over time but the staff is really who sells any business. Consistency in beers is one thing but consistency in service supersedes even that. At that capacity Man Overboard Brewing Co. will be here for awhile. The place and ambiance are charming. The beers are solid but the service is stellar.  If you happen to be in this area check it out.   ps. If your GPS is not working don't worry! Just look for the two dudes with the epic viking beards and you're good!

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: We were driving home and my boyfriend said, " wait stop! There's a brewery!" I thought he was delusional and lying lol but yes there is a brewery here now. Today is 12/15/21 and the guy behind the counter said that they have been open for about 2 weeks. They of course have beers but also make their own seltzer in house. I got the blood orange one and it has a very light taste to it. My boyfriend got the 1st beer on the menu list and says it did not disappoint. Both were very easy to drink.

reviews.author: Kat W.
reviews.description: Amazing brews and helpful kind staff. Y'all are doing great things over here, I'm glad I found you. CHEERS!!!

reviews.author: Marilyn H.
reviews.description: Such a fun spot, plenty of seating, and a wide variety of options for all!! Of course come for the beers, they are all hits, but a good spot to bring others who may not be beer lovers as they have their own flavored seltzers and wine as well. Must visit brewery!!!

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: Awesome space, easy to park, and great beer! I tried the flight with their tangerine wheat beer, IPA, blonde, and coffee porter. I really liked all of them and look forward to trying the Belgian beers they're brewing. The food at the food truck outside was also really good!

reviews.author: C B.
reviews.description: Great beer and a relaxed vibe. We enjoyed our visit and we are looking forward to coming back soon.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were in San Antonio for a long weekend and we had some BBQ at Bandit's, right near this tap room. (Amazing BBQ)  My wife and I saddled up to the bar and I ordered an IPA. Delish. The most fun was talking to the couple next to us. We spent about 30 minutes introducing ourselves and talking about travel and the like.  The bartender was super nice and it was a great stop after an amazing BBQ meal.  I don't know how my wife finds all these cool places, but she does, and it is wonderful!

reviews.author: Bruno S.
reviews.description: I'm a big supporter of local business and decided to try Kunstler after seeing it featured on the local channel 4 "Elder Eats".   Positives up front: The service was excellent and zero wait time on seating.    The negative? The huge disappointment in their craft beer selection.  Mostly all of their featured beer were not on the current menu.  I had a flight of four and left with slight headache (I've been hydrating all day).   The food menu varies from day to day, and today's selection was just not for me.  If I would've known this ahead of time I would've selected a different day to try this place out.    Their appetizers were good though, we had their Pretzel charcuterie board and loved it.  I was a little surprised when I heard there was an up-charge to get fries with the meal, as apparently the standard offering  are patati chips.    Would I return? No. Would I recommend it to family and friends? No. I wouldn't discourage anyone from trying it for themselves though.

reviews.author: Andres N.
reviews.description: I first heard of KÃ¼nstler when I ended up with a growler from them. I always told myself I'd go give it a try. I never got the chance to go until just the other day. This place is a lot bigger than expected. But not overly huge. Still a nice intimate setting and laid back as you would expect from a brewery. They have a patio out front and a separate room for games and watching sports. I really enjoyed that they were separated. It kept the room that we were in nice for some conversation and trying out the brews and food. This is a really nice brewery with some delicious takes on German food. I got the Sichuan beer, which was very tasty and unlike any beer I have had before. It also tasted super fresh since they brew it right there. My partner got their sangria which I also tried and it was very good! We opted for the charcuterie pretzel to share with our drinks. The pretzel was warm, soft and really tasty. The cheese that came with this board was amazing! We loved it. No idea what it was or anything but before we knew it the entire plate was gone. Absolutely wondeful experience. Will definitely be back with my growler and try some other items!

reviews.author: Chris F.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a beer and either German food or a sandwich. After multiple visits the standard has not deviated. We have only sat at the bar and front patio. Have not had the fortune with the weather on the other outdoor area.

reviews.author: Dorie B.
reviews.description: My only regret is that I didn't try this place sooner!!! Came here on Labor Day since we had the day off and extra time. I don't even know where to start... the beer is great, I started with a flight to see which one I preferred and then followed up with a couple of pints . We shared the pretzel  which we upgraded to the fancy version of a charcuterie board. The pickles, Brie and cured meats aren't to be missed. The pretzel and mustard are also excellent! I had the bratwurst  with sauerkraut and it checked all the right boxes! The staff was super friendly and would hang out and chat us up when they had time. Danny (I think) gave us a long history of the place and events that were in the works. Since then, we've been back 5 or 6 times with plenty of friends. The beer garden has picnic tables so you can get a nice sized group of people together. The schnitzel (which is only a special on certain nights) is not to be missed! They are also dog friendly!  Love this place!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Really neat brewing spot! It looks like they do special events and beer releases which is pretty dope. I ordered a cashmere and it was actually really solid. I ordered the pretzel charcuterie and it was good as well I recommend it if you are a fan of charcuterie. The pickled stuff that came with it was not as good as I was hoping though. It was a little pricey for the amount of food but the beer was priced very fairly so I would say it evened out for the most part. Definitely a pace I recommend if you're looking for a nice brewery in the area!   Overall: 4.4 stars

reviews.author: Alaina S.
reviews.description: We came here on a Saturday afternoon and were so impressed! The building is beautiful and has multiple outdoor seating options. Our server was very friendly and helpful, she even gave us some souvenir stickers after hearing we were first time visitors from out of town.  We ordered the prickly pina, hop train, and an order of pretzel bites with pimento. The hop train was a standard hazy ipa, but the prickly pina really took it up a notch! I loved the little bit of heat that I've never tasted before in an ipa, I would absolutely recommend if you're a fan of this style. As good as the beer was, the pretzel bites and pimento were the stars of the show. These pretzel bites tasted as good as they looked, and the pimento was the best I've ever had. This is the perfect dish to pair with a couple of beers.

reviews.author: Tamarra M.
reviews.description: KÃ¼nstler never disappoints. The beer is always delicious and the food is always tasty. Today we tried the Hawaiian Fog, Pineapple Fog, and McSteamy (pictured) brews. All excellent selections. The Brussels sprouts (pictured) can be made vegan (sans bacon and aioli). We always enjoy the vegan bratwurst with sauerkraut and fries. We also love bringing our dog when we sit outside. Thanks for being so inclusive KÃ¼nstler! Love, your friendly neighbors from the other side of the tracks.

reviews.author: MidWest B.
reviews.description: We did two flights of all their German-style beers.  If you are looking for beers that embody craft, style, and history, look no further.  Every one of the German-style beers were on point.  They all seemed to meet the cicerone specifics.  We know first hand these beers can be difficult to brew due to the finesse they require - they did it!

reviews.author: Mallorie T.
reviews.description: Great place!! The service was fantastic and our waiter gave us some samples just because he though we would like them. Cute place and everyone was very friendly! Charcuterie pretzel is a must, get the large!

reviews.author: Jessie A.
reviews.description: It's tucked back in an older neighborhood and parking is challenging. There is outdoor seating and indoor. Masks are encouraged but not required for fully vaccinated folks (but it's not like they are checking). The brats are awesome, none of that over boiled blandness. My husband got the currywurst and I got the onion brats. Both came on pretzel buns with fries. Everything was fresh. Pretzels looked good, but choices had to be made! The flight is pricey ($45), but it's not only includes the four pours but when you decide what you like, you get a Stein of that one and the Stein is yours to keep. It's not a huge food menu but the service is great and very friendly.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: So my party of 5 orders brunch--two with the same German pancake order.  4 of the orders are delivered, including one of the German pancakes.  The waitress indignantly delivers it with "the other one is late because the kitchen got backed up."  Seriously?!  How did the kitchen get backed up in the middle of the order?  And how did they deliver one of the two identical orders?  Did they suddenly forget how to make the pancakes halfway through?     This frustration was compounded by parties arriving AFTER our first 4 dishes coming out having their meals arrive BEFORE our 5th meal finally came out.    The restaurant did nothing to remedy this--other than "sorry, the kitchen was backed up."  Seriously?!  Who wants to be eating alone after the rest of your party finished.   Such a poor, poor experience.     The owner needs to work a hek of a lot in ensuring this doesn't happen again and, more importantly, be sure to step in to make a customer's experience right after they screw up.   Will not return, but will sure to persuade folks to find a better place that isn't so mismanaged.

reviews.author: Julee T.
reviews.description: Great beer. Good food! Quick service, love the quirky vibe!  Have the dessert and the pretzel both!

reviews.author: Bea C.
reviews.description: I accidentally posted the wrong review here. Fail.  Anywho! We got here and we were received by friendly staff. We had a gentleman recommending various beers to my husband. Who honestly, just enjoys beer in general.  He was extremely patient and very attentive.  Place is super chill. Bathrooms super clean. Men and women.  We didn't eat here since it was our first stop to "Brewery Day".

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Second trip back here, we got a flight to decide which pint to get. All four were undrinkable and we opted for a Texas Keeper Cider. What happened?

reviews.author: David L.
reviews.description: Bottom Line: AMAZING BEERS!!! Huge Variety that all taste buds will approve of. From IPAs to stouts/porters and everything in between. However, the food is par and the service wasn't great. Long waits at times for drinks and forgot parts of orders. Highly recommend for just a drinking and snacks occasion!!  Drinks: Huge menu of many different types of beers. They do a 4 beer flight that you can get to try a few kinds. Some of our favorites were: - Blackberry Streusel: A really flavorful, sour type of ale that isn't too sour or too hoppy. It's a house favorite for sure! - Matcha Milkshake IPA: Not something you'd expect but I've had milkshake IPAs in the past. This one was tasty, minimal green tea taste though, but very easy to drink IPA - Wolfie Vienna Lager: Very easy and drinkable beer. Can't go wrong here with the good lager flavor.  - Austin Bier Oyster Stout: Made with oysters, you have no shellfish taste, but you have the salinity of the oyster. Really tasty but prepare for it to be like salted chocolate!  - Confident Bitch: This was some of the favorites of our crew. Didn't try it but people enjoyed it. Gotta order it with confidence!!  Food: Not my favorite food but it was okay to counter the beer.  - Pretzel: Soft and salty, exactly what you want! The mustard was also pretty mild and tasty. There are three cheeses to choose from as well to come with it.  - Shrimp roll: Decent, nothing extravagant. Not bad, but nothing memorable.  - Kraut salad: I thought this would taste good but all it tasted was like red cabbage lightly soaked in vinegar... tasteless and bland. Really recommend to choose any other side dish!!   Final Thoughts: Kunstler brewing has amazing beers. Lots of choices. Will definitely return for a day or night of beers and pretzels, but will happily leave it at that without ordering any of the food. Spend the $12 on two more beers!

reviews.author: Laura S.
reviews.description: Stopped here for the first time over the weekend. I had the flight and deep fried Brussels sprouts. Cashmere and JoJo were my favorite from the flight.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: Lobster rolls are on special, Tuesdays at Kunstler brewing.  Lobsters don't share because they are shellfish. Neither do I. I have been wanting to try this lobster roll for a while now. I was not let down. The food at Kunstler is delicious and not to mention all the amazing beers on tap.

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: Man, even during a pandemic, you know you can rely on KÃ¼nstler to keep cranking out delicious beers AND still make them available to you.   Recently ordered a few beers online for pick up and it was pretty painless. Got there and in no time I was greeted, called to let them know I was there to pick up my order, they came and got my growlers, filled them and I was back on my way.   Appreciate all the care they're taking to ensure that it's as contactless as possible. Their staff and ppe and kept their distance.   Thanks for keeping us going KÃ¼nstler!

reviews.author: Dean D.
reviews.description: The cod cakes were excellent along with bier! Had the Czech Pils and the Hawaiian Fog, both were tasty. Would go again next time I'm in San Antonio

reviews.author: Linda B.
reviews.description: Fabulous! What a precious treasure. Our first time and we will return soon. Lovely atmosphere. Incredible beer selection. Loved seeing all the beer brewing equipment too Friendly service.  Old school craft beer at its best.  Super clean bathroom. A must to visit to support the local craft beer community!!

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: On Sunday (9/12/21), friend and I went to Hounds and Hops for some food and drinks since the weather was cooling down with his kid.  Enjoyed, but the bartender let us try some local beers; including Second Pitch Beer.  Finding out it was right down the street, we decided to give it a try.  So glad to have found this gem of a brewery nearby!  Came into the place and the pourer behind the counter was nice in answering some questions.  Went with A Man and His Dog Irish Stout.  This was a quality beer.  They had a few games to play at the table, so we played a competitive game of Uno.  On the board, they had a number of Running and Mountain Biking clubs meet up and on Thursday's they have 3 growler fill ups for $30.  Hell of a deal!  I will be back to this place multiple times.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Great little brewery cranking out delicious beer. The brews are great with several styles that are made very well and taste great. Even better though is the sense of community you feel sipping the suds at Second Pitch. Cozy ambiance that feels like Texas and the TV show cheers had a baby and it grew up to be SPB. Tables set up to capitalize on good weather. Lovely place to hang. Drink local!

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: Totally loving this brewery! There really isn't a beer they have that not solid - and there's pretty much one for every taste.     Sitting unassumingly in this business park off Starcrest,this small brewery has tons to offer. Service has always been fast and everyone working has been super cool. I'm just going to say it, it's the KÃ¼nstler of the NE side! I don't think I've been this excited about a brewery and their beers since KÃ¼nstler and Islla.  The inside is small but they've converted their parking lot into seating area-all tables socially distanced.  They have various nightly events (including movie night) and I can't wait for BYOV (bring your own vinyl) night!  I ABSOLUTELY love that you can bring your let's, it's a sure +!  As far as food goes, they'll have a rotating list of food trucks so you'll never go hungry.  My favorite beer right now is their Black is Beautiful variant which is made with HEB's Taste of San Antonio coffee. It's a must try before they run out!

reviews.author: Annabelle L.
reviews.description: Jim has come a long way and really made amends in huge ways.  This is our second visit and man.. the brews are flowing!  Everything we've had is amazing, staff is super cool and WE GOT TO TALK BEER!   There's so many events we're looking forward to attending and participating in, and of course we'll be drinking a ton of beer.

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: This place is adorable! Good selection of in house made beers. Board games available, which to me is always a sign of a good brewery! Your allowed to bring in your own snacks and even your dog! If your in the area definitely check this place out! Get a flight so you can try as many beers as possible. They have a great IPA which I loved and my husband liked the honey beer I forget what it was called but when you get there you'll see it on the board. Easy ordering, great menu, cool staff, and there's even a great Greek food truck outside!

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: Solid new brewery in SA! All the beers we tried were really good. I also tried their root beer which was delicious! I typically don't think lighter beers are anything to write about, but Second Pitch had a fantastic ale/light beer that is definitely worth trying (I think it was the Summer Lightning Ale). It's one of the better beers I've tried in awhile.  When we stopped by on a Saturday afternoon, they had a few picnic tables set up outside and a couple of tables inside. There isn't much shade, and while we were there they didn't have umbrellas over the tables, although they did set one up at the request of someone. I'd bring sunscreen. :)   While they don't serve food, there was a food truck on site. The service was friendly and attentive, at least inside where we were one of two tables. They also have beer to go if you want to take some home!

reviews.author: Kenzie S.
reviews.description: We ordered the two lagers on the menu and loved them. The space is intimate with some picnic tables out front, parking is easy, and there was a Jamaican food truck on site. It is very close to the airport!

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Always excited to see a new craft brewery open up in town. I went here a couple of weeks ago and am glad I did. It is in an industrial area which gives the place a cool vibe. They have a food truck outside from those that want a tasty morsel, I did not partake in the food this time but will next time. The staff is very welcoming and friendly. I spoke to a few of them including the brewmaster. Their beer knowledge is excellent as are their brews. I tried all they had to offer and they were all very good. One of them had an odd flavor and after speaking with the brewer he agreed and will make some tweaks. This is how you know a good beer man! I will be back anytime I get to that side of town. I encourage everyone who wants good beer, music and an overall great time to check them out.

reviews.author: Pam W.
reviews.description: Great selection of craft beers! I always get a flight when I come here. Too many to choose from! And we love the food trucks they bring in. All have been on point each time we come!

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Yes, go check this place out.  They converted the parking lot to a picnic area with a musician.  The bar is unique in the point of how they have their menu.  Keep up the good work.  Loved coming here.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Great little brewery with excellent service. They aim to make the experience fun with events like "vinyl night" and hosting movie nights. They almost always have a food truck out there. The owner takes the brew making process seriously and is proud about turning out a quality product. He is also down to earth and real. I visit as often as I can and enjoy it every time.

reviews.author: Marilyn H.
reviews.description: Such a cool new spot with great beer! Very safe, all the staff had their mask on properly the whole time and they had outside seating if you preferred. The summer ale was delicious, flavorful yet light. Hefeweizen was amazing as well. Super cute brewery!

reviews.author: Autumn M.
reviews.description: Amazing place to sit outside and have a pint while you enjoy the beautiful fall weather.  No where I'd rather study/work on a Sunday afternoon!  Great beer with something for everyone, especially when you consider their fantastic home made root beer!

reviews.author: Sarah P.
reviews.description: Walked in to a very friendly staff and a really cozy, welcoming atmosphere.  The people behind the bar seemed to make quick friends with whoever sat at the counter and the staff were able to answer all my questions about their beers!

reviews.author: Tawnya V.
reviews.description: My husband stopped into this brewery because the traffic was bad downtown SA.  We had never heard of it before so he purchased a growler of beer.  It was an IPA,  he put it on ice to chill it before we tried it.  It was delicious,  you could taste the different flavor profiles as it warmed up in the glass.  We drank the whole growler that evening.  It tasted like a session IPA,  we will definitely be going back.  If you ever get caught in bad traffic in SA,  stop into some of the local establishments.  You will find some of the best kept secrets in the San Antonio Texas or anywhere in Texas.  We kind of keep to ourselves sometimes and everybody is family/familia in Texas.

reviews.author: Ryan R.
reviews.description: Good beer friendly people. Friendly staff, friendly other patrons, and also dogs-allowed which is key.  Solid place will visit again.

reviews.author: Bre V.
reviews.description: The beer here is so unbelievably good! I'm so excited to have a legit independent brewery close by. I recommend everything they offer, but Not my first rodeo IPA is my favorite.

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: Great new place in an area of town that needed a brewery! I had the Hot Wells Hefeweizen and my husband had the Hometown Lager--we both really enjoyed them! The small taproom is nicely done and very clean, plus it's dog friendly which is a plus for us. Their brewer, Lou, was very welcoming and personable and made for a fun visit. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Walt N.
reviews.description: We found the gem a couple of months ago and have become regulars here.  This is a GREAT addition to the San Antonio beer scene.  It is a self-serve tap house.  You open a tab at the register and are given a card to use at the tap.  There are 30 taps on the wall that are constantly rotating with both local and national craft beers.  You are charged by the ounce and each beer has a different price per ounce (generally ranging from $0.45 to $0.65 / ounce.  There are beer menu's posted that have a description of each beer.  The staff is super friendly and helpful.    They do have numerous events during the week with some pup-up food trucks.  My only issue is my own fault - it is amazing how quick the tab adds up!  In transparency, the screen displays the cost of the most recent pour and it also shows the total for your visit.

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: This is a great addition to the SA beer scene and I love that you can serve yourself!   I've been twice now, and they had some variation in the beer selection between visits. It leans pretty heavy in the IPA/pale ale direction, along with some sours, pilsners, and cider options. There's also a lot of local and Texas selections. The best part about serving yourself is you don't have to commit to a full pour...you can feel free to try as many as you want without a huge amount.   While the food options are limited, we were able to find some good snacks to eat while we were there! We got the pretzel, which is a given with beer...and delicious, as well as some of the other snack and sandwich options. The food isn't the best (the beer is def the focus), I still was pleasantly surprised at the options and quality.   When you enter, they are happy to explain the process fully so you won't feel like you don't know what's going on. Now we just need more of these places in SA!

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: They had a lovely start but stop wiping the tables, never served the tables, and stopped liking the clientele. What was I really overpaying for?

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Look, this is a great place to go and have a couple of drinks and enjoy the company of your friends and family.  If you are expecting to go for dinner and have a meal, go somewhere else that has a menu and a host or hostess to seat you.  That being said, the food we had for brunch was very good and the portions were good for the price.If you really just want to go and have the ability to sample a bunch of beer and have some light food to go along with your brew, then the Dooryard is definitely the place to be.  I walked in and obviously I was a newbie because they guided me through the process to get started, BUT they were very helpful and happy to assist.  The staff is wonderful and explained everything I needed to know from loading my card to pouring the beer and paying for food on a separate app.    The beer, oh the beer, I consider myself a beer snob and I love dark beers such as porters and stouts.  Believe it or not, they had a great selection of beer that made me happy and what was even better, I was able to try what I wanted and not feel any guilt or buyers remorse in getting  a pour that is disappointingly small.  Here, you get any size of what you want and as much as you want in any glass that you want it in (providing you know what glass you should pour it in).   Anyway, bottom line is, you will be excited to come back just as I am and what is even better, Jason (the owner) is there and very chill and approachable when you are visiting.  He thanked us as we were closing out our tab and I assured him that he would definitely get a great review from me.  Hurry up and get there so that you can enjoy your experience and be as excited as I am to go back.

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: This is a great addition to the neighborhood! Even if you're not a beer lover, feel free to come here and ask for a white claw, wine or get some cider from the tap (that's what I did)  I came here with my husband and a few friends and, even though it was really cold outside, we sat on the patio because COVID and not vaccinated yet.  If you get a food item, get the pretzel. It was delicious! I'm glad we ordered two (one for each couple). My friend ended up ordering extra cheese dip because one container wasn't enough so keep that in mind.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: I. Love. This. Place!  If you love beer then this place if for you!  Plenty of parking available along with Indoor AND outdoor seating.   You enter the establishment and are greeted by a worker. Show ID. Run your credit/debit card and you're given a Dooryard card. Grab your dooryard card and head over to the beers. Grab the glass of your choosing and a napkin. Once you've decided on your beer, put the card in the black slot, napkin on the nozzle, tilt your glass to 45 degrees and pour! You get charged by the oz so drink as little or as much as you like! DO NOT FORGET YOUR CARD! Or you may be buying beers for others haha   What I REALLY loved about this place is a lot of the beers on tap were Texas Breweries. A local business supporting local business! Love it!  I loved the open area. The guys I went with felt it looked too much like a Jamba Juice / froyo place. I guess they wanted a more "masculine" feel to it? Less orange and more...brown? Idk lol I came for the beers and succeeded!  As for the food - ehhhhh. I'd say eat before you come here and then you can snack on the food here. My friend ordered the rueben. The photo shows a pickle but I guess they ran out so they gave him sliced cucumber that tasted like they threw pickle juice over it haha we laughed about that for a little.   Come here for the brews and bring some company! I don't recommend coming alone unless you're gonna take a rideshare or taxi. You can EASILY go from drinking 1 beer to 12 lol not kidding.   Come check out Dooryard! So far it's my favorite beer establishment in SA!!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: I recently read an article on NPR about the relatively new phenomenon of "self serve taprooms." It argues that overhead caused by labor and an unpredictable market will inevitably force businesses to reconsider their strategies. Necessity is the mother of invention as they say and the pandemic is facilitating a "think outside the box" approach. The Dooryard, the city's first self serve taproom of its kind is hastening that notion. As I came here for a sneak preview a few questions did come to mind? Are patrons ready to forgo the experience of going to a taproom only to have to serve themselves? What about the interaction between customer and server? Will that be replaced by machines?  For every glass that I have a question for there is an empty one that needs to be filled; presumably with answers. Firstly it is everything you might be looking for in a taproom. It's sleek, simply decorated and spacious. There is patio seating with heating lamps. I'm wondering how it will look in the summer. So you probably want to know how this place works don't you? Well you go to the front counter where you start a tab. You are given an e-card that tracks everything you drink. You choose a clean glass from a rack of different styles: stout, pint, pilsner or a snifter. It's much like the soda dispensaries at a theater in theory but with craft beer instead. You use a paper cup to cover tap handles, thus limiting contact.  One thing that is really helpful is that they post their taplist via online. My suggestion is that you survey it beforehand. Selections are separated and displayed by number. You place your card on the slot and you pour to your liver's content. The owner, I presume was really friendly. He came around from the counter and graciously showed me how the process worked. This is where your skills as a tapmaster or lack thereof are going to shine through. I must reiterate you are charged by the ounce. As you serve yourself there is a display that tells you the dollar amount of each pour. It's like pumping gas but instead it's beer. In the NPR article it said the benefits of utilizing this method is the consistency of pours. This is to stave off waste. Therein lies the dilemma or the trade off.  If this is an alternative to saving taprooms/breweries will tapmasters be a thing of the past?  Everytime you go to get another round you must use a clean glass and a fresh handle cup. In that sense it is like the Golden Corral but with hops. Sitting and surveying the space I wondered how this concept will fare with patrons. Which did bring up scenarios. How will the process be explained to newcomers? Will people complain if pours have too much head? Are people going to try to haggle over a miscalculated pour? Again some beers are priced from 50 cents and up an ounce. Make sure to have a calculator handy. Before you know it you might leave with a healthy tab. I must add that I enjoyed my experience here. The owner was extremely friendly, helpful and explained the process in simplest terms.   The Dooryard is a concept that people  will either embrace or forgo. Isn't the point of going to a taproom to let someone serve you? It surely can't be waiting in a line for someone to decide on a beer! It must be somewhere in between. Whether we like it or not there is a new paradigm shift. Adapt or fade away. I say give this place a try. At least the machine won't ignore you when you got to have your ipa fix.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: I have been here three times since they open a couple of weeks ago. The concept is something completely new to San Antonio but I have been to a number of these over the years. I have to say that they are handling it better than any others I have seen. The way that their system ties into untappd makes things all the better for a beer connoisseur. I've spent a lot of time speaking with the owners about the concept and what their plans are and I have to tell you I am very excited about the future of this place. I consider myself a regular already even though I live on the other side of town. I will be sure to make this a weekly if not biweekly start from now on. Already since I've been there they have changed out more than Half a dozen beers to something new. That is key in any kind of good beer establishment.  I encourage anyone in the area who enjoys craft beer to come and have some at the door yard. The owner has already told me they're looking at possibly doing another one so let's make sure this one's a success.

reviews.author: Emilio G.
reviews.description: Different. Clean. Nice live music. Dogs allowed outside. Friendly atmosphere. Self serve beer garden.

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: I read about the Ooryard in the paper when it opened and wanted to try it.  My wife and I asked another couple if they were interested in trying it and the instantly said yes.  We all liked the selection of beers and hard ciders, oh and they do have a small selection of wine behind the bar.  For my drinks I tried the Fiesty Redhead and the Big Spoon.  For food we ordered the Charcuterie plate, I had the Banh Mi sandwich and my wife ordered the Ruben sandwich.  For dessert I had one of the pretzels.  Everything was delicious and like most places you order on your phone.  All 4 of us really enjoyed the Dooryard and will be back

reviews.author: Megan V.
reviews.description: I've been anticipating the opening for about a month now and I finally got to try it today. I certainly love the concept and they had a very diverse food menu. To start, there's a bit of a learning curve with trying to figure out how to order food and getting the card for the drinks. Once you get the hang of it, then it's pretty easy!   For the food, I was excited to see so many different Asian options, and I was hopeful about how it would turn out. All the pieces were right, but somehow they didn't come together for me.   Banh Mi: the bread was super soft and fluffy, the pork belly was so tender and well marinated. THEY ADDED PATE! But I would say it's pretty pate heavy. It's not your traditional banh mi, but you could tell they tried.   Ribs: they were more soy than anything so don't worry if you're not a ginger fan. I wish it was a little sweeter, but the ribs were tasty.   Pork Buns: the buns were soft. It was a very fresh tasting bun, you could taste the mint and pickled onion. I would like a little more sauce on the pulled pork, maybe some hoisin?   For the beers, it was really fun getting to pour your own glass. The selection rotates often, so you'll always have something new to try. I would come back for the self serve drinks, and maybe bring some friends once this pandemic is over

reviews.author: Donna O.
reviews.description: Has lots of potential but needs more umph visually and service wise. Rooting for this place!!

reviews.author: Elizabeth K.
reviews.description: Great beer selection.   I probably wouldn't order the meat and cheese board again but the pretzel was fresh and the dipping sauces were tasty!   Highly recommend checking this place out!

reviews.author: Maria N.
reviews.description: Love this place and the concept. Help yourself to a great selection on draft, as much or as little as you want. Great for tasting. I particularly loved the sour #4.  Post COVID this would be a great place to mingle with the big tables. For now, super safe and clean.

reviews.author: Teofila R.
reviews.description: Our club had a happy hour yesterday and we had a good time. I had the Cabernet. It comes in a bottle and gives you about two glasses of wine. No wine list. Limited selection. They have a wall where you go help yourself to specialized beer.of all kinds. Seltzer included. They give you a card to scan your purchases. Our group congregated outside in the patio. They brought out a heater at customer's request. My friend was going to show me her new Jeep and the bartender rushed out to see if we were skipping the bill. We just laughed and assured him we were not. Unfortunately, I didn't try any of the menu items. I had two bottles of Cabernet fir a total of $53.00

reviews.author: Rick R.
reviews.description: Here are my thoughts for the Dooryard, a new neighborhood find for that afternoon brew on a casual afternoon. Marjan had actually been here twice before, so this review is a distillation of her experiences and my recent visit.  Nestled within an oak tree rich strip center, this beer lovers paradise is a relatively new concept in our world.  Enter, plop down your credit card, and you are each given a "charge card" that you use to self serve from a tap of two dozen brews.  Above the line of taps is a changeable board that describes their different offerings;  the fare tends to regional craft beers, so do not expect to find a Miller Lite or a Modelo.  We are talking the language of small craft, esoterically known brews.  And herein lies the beauty of the concept:  read the lists, and serve yourself as little or as much of the brew as you choose.  Remember that "charge card"  you are given upon entry?  Slip it above your choice, and the card reader bills you for the amount you might serve yourself. It is kind of like filling your BMW with gas!  So, yes, there is the "unknown" of the brews offered, but the descriptions tend to be reasonably accurate of those on tap.  For our particular visit, the brews tended to more of the flavored varieties:  we favored a tangerine tinged wheat brew from New Orleans, and a chocolate flavored ale from Boulder.  Talking with the staff, more "traditional" beers like a weinstephaner or a pilsner can be available, but alas, not for our visit today.  There is a limited wine list, and some of the ferments seemed of good quality, and reasonably priced.  A 375 ml bottle of Meiomi for example, can be had for about $17.00.  This is about $8.00 for a glass:  not too bad in our opinion.  There are comestibles on the menu, but we did not order.  During Marjan's previous visit, she did order their version of a charcuterie board, and it was...adequate.  We would defer to other reviewers for their opinions.  As this is a self serve venue, you must use a new, clean glass, of varying size, each time you sidle up to the taps.  The spacing of tables indoor is pandemic appropriate, and there is seating on picnic tables outside on their deck.  And lest we forget, the venue is pet friendly, so your furry friends can sit at your table...but they do not get a charge card....joking!  The staff is uber friendly, welcoming and helpful.  This is going to be one of our favorite places, and we can heartily recommend the friendly, casual neighborhood vibe of the place.  Hope to see you there!!  Enjoy!

reviews.author: Jim K.
reviews.description: Sub-par food, confusing system and process, and all way way way overppriced - at least double per ounce what what you'd pay at an average-priced taproom around town. I don't recommend.   Samples cost you as well!

reviews.author: Lauren S.
reviews.description: Pretty good selection and nice atmosphere. The self serve tap wall is a fun concept but kinda makes one miss small talk with a bartender and that human touch. It makes it hard to know how much money you're spending also, haha!

reviews.author: John P.
reviews.description: Friends and I have gone here a couple times.  The staff has been great.  I really like the "serve yourself" system they have here.  It's fun.  They have great selection of beers.  There are limited menu options but the items we had were good.  It seems they are lacking a little in the way of decorations which effects the "atmosphere" a little.  Maybe as time goes buy they can adjust.  I will go back.

reviews.author: Tony A.
reviews.description: The menu is beyond limited. The food is average quality. We had the ribs, which were an incredibly small portion and seasoned very bland. We also had the meat and cheese board, which was ultra basic and made with low quality meats and cheeses. Lastly the lamb wraps with mint sauce were uninspired and basic.  The overall indoor decor is basic and plain. The outdoor setting is nice and does have heating with gas lamps.  The beer selection is the win. But if you are hungry don't bother.   P.S. no bearing on my rating but the staff lacks people skills and isn't worth tipping. To be expected when you pay and tip before you even receive the food.

name: Freetail Brewing Co
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kai H.
reviews.description: Came here after work last week, was greeted by host immediately and we sat outside on their patio area. Perfect weather for a good beer and pizza.    Service was great. Price point was awesome. Pizza was really good and surprised about the BBQ Brisket pizza which my guest and I thought was perfect.   Lot of beer options, stouts, ipas, session ipas, "Berliners", lagers, etc. only reason I gave Freetail 4 out of 5 stars was that out of the three beers I tried none of them were really, really good or anything to really write home about. Pretty basic flavor profiles and the berliner wasn't really a berliner. Wish the beers had a stronger flavor profile - if you say Mango but some mango it in so you can taste it, not just a hint of one. Other than that, it was a good experience.

reviews.author: Michael W.
reviews.description: Beer is pretty good, the service is friendly and at a good pace if they aren't busy.  Not a fan of small portions or higher prices, but then who is?

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: First time here, we went to the original location up north. The service was great and plenty of parking. They even have an outdoor patio which was really spacious.  Lots of people with their kids and the no wonder the pizza was great.  Next time we know we can just bring the kids and enjoy a cold one as well. The medium pizza was enough for 2 people. We had the wit beer and the American IPA both were very tasty.  We plan on returning and trying different beers.

reviews.author: Jasmine W.
