reviews.description: Their selection of beer is amazing . The atmosphere is pretty cool and the service is great. Tons of tvs and plenty of seating even for large group. They even have a military discount! The pizzas look to be the best choice. The cheese dip was thick and honestly not that great . The salsa was watery and not to flavorful. I wouldn't order any appetizers again but next time around I would order a pizza . Our waiter was very attentive to our needs and a wonderful host. Thanks Decarlos for being awesome! We will sit in your section again next time see you soon!

reviews.author: Rachel J.
reviews.description: I lived in San Antonio back in 2012 and moved away in 2013.. I came back to visit for the weekend in 2021 and remembered this one singular restaurant solely for the goat cheese artichoke dip.. of course I had to return during my short weekend trip.. almost 10 years later and it was just as good as I remembered it

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: I love the patio area for me and my dog. Always a wide selection of beers. Food is good. Definitely a go to spot after hiking around Eisenhower park.

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: Another good visit at the FREETAIL. The pizza and beer was fantastic as per usual. The only cons I have for this visit was my waitress "Andrea".  For the most part she did her job but she wasn't very friendly or personable.  Idk if it's because I was a party of 1 or what.  I was there to watch USA vs. MEX Women's match.  She didn't know whether or not they could show it and it took 3 staff to find out after I told them what station.  I guess they don't know how to search cable lol.  When they found it, they choose the "spanish channel" lol. My favorite hostess wasn't there either.  However the "Vader Saber" was amaze-ballz as was the pizza.  I can't wait till I go back.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: I HATE IPAS...or should I say...hated...  Until I had an IPA from Freetail and they ruined my life. My palate is changing, but these beers were seriously good. I really enjoy their IPAs which I have never been able to say before about any breweries. I am a stout girl all the way, until Freetail.  I had my first Freetail beer at Streetfare and HAD to come to the brewery. So glad we did!  Great view from the outside patio. Plenty of parking. They offer lots of food. Great place to hang out and enjoy a beautiful afternoon. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Amanda G.
reviews.description: Cool ambiance to watch the games, service is pretty good post CoVID. Every is wearing masks and I feel safe her for sure.  Just came for some beer and appetizers and they have a good draft beer selection. I ordered a cherry sour which was pretty good, I didn't get tired of it after a couple of drinks.  For the food we got the red pepper hummus and I would NOT recommend this. It was missing the "hummus" taste, can't explain it but it was a no for me. And last we ordered the brisket nachos for 75 ppl! Haha! Just kidding but this is a meal for 2 people, it was plenty!! The only thing I would say is the beans taste like from a can, I would have loved a little more Mexican tasting beans.  I wish I would have tried the pizza, next time!!!

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: The Cobb Salad is the best I've ever had. Great portion size, super fresh. I would recommend the Honey Balsamic dressing.

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: We really enjoyed our 1st visit to Freetail Brewing Co.  It was a cold Tuesday night, so we got a table inside. When its warmer, we'd love to go out on the patio!   Tried a few beers, and ordered some. Nothing as tasty as draft beer! We split an order of the pretzels too!

reviews.author: Jon P.
reviews.description: This place has REALLY gone downhill! We used to watch Spurs games here for years with the sound. Now they will not turn on that sound for the Spurs game. They stopped making Rye Whit beer. The manager and wait staff are rude and don't care if you like your experience or not. Freetail's motto now seems to be "Do it our way (or not at all)." I do not like paying money to anyone that does not respect me (at all) as a customer. It is too bad. But I will not be going back - after years of me and my family being really good customers.

reviews.author: Michelle K.
reviews.description: Empty restaurant,but still horrible service. Pizza took 45 min to get and was not prepared to order. Had to wait for refire for another 30 minutes. Will not return.

reviews.author: Michael D.
reviews.description: The food and drink is some of the best in San Antonio. The staff can be a little curt and when busy can get snippy. I still leave a five star review because the food and drink are phenomenal. Just ignore everyone that works there and you will be fine

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Freetail has always had great beer, good pizza and exceptional service. I'm just disappointed to see it so dirty in here today. The tables, bathroom, floor, literally everything was dirty in here. The smell behind the kitchen and bar was the finishing touch. This wasn't the first time we've seen it like this lately. This has always been one of our favorite places the past six years or so but lately it looks like they've lost focus.

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: Honestly never leave reviews but felt compelled too! Not a huge beer person but I had a flight of 4 beers and LOVED them all, and their chicken bacon ranch pizza was so so good for food not being their primary attraction! Highly recommend! Service of course was great too!  Thanks Freetail!

reviews.author: Jonathan M.
reviews.description: This place was great! Edward was a great host.  There is plenty of space and the atmosphere is relaxing. I had the Philly sandwich and a few IPAs. Food and beer were both amazing! We will be back!

reviews.author: Monica A.
reviews.description: Went to Freetail between the years 2013-2016 several times.  Namely to watch Spurs games and have great beer and pizza!  The place is dog-friendly and has bowls for puppers outside on the deck.  Great beer menu mostly local and great on-tap options.  Absolutely recommend visiting and checking it out for yourself. They usually have a great playlist too! At least during the point in time when I'd visit.  Here's where I watched the Spurs championship in 2014 and it was a huge blast!!! Enjoy!!

reviews.author: Taylor T.
reviews.description: Never felt the need for a yelp account or the need to write my own review but I had to after this experience. The beer was decent and the pizza was good but the service was downright AWFUL. Our server, Andrea, was so unbelievably rude to our entire table and was even rude to other servers! She rolled her eyes multiple times when my mother asked her questions about the beer and wine selection. Another server came by and asked her a question and she was very rude to her as well! One of the other servers walked by our table and my wife asked to speak to a manager because our pizza was taking a while... we were informed that our server, Andrea, was in fact a manager. Never going back to this place. We'll stick to the taproom downtown if we want Freetail beer.

reviews.author: Al P.
reviews.description: They have great selection of local brews and food. We had the "Bat out of Hellas" and the local Lager to drink. We decided to try the Artichoke and Goat Cheese dip which was light and tasty. I took the seasonal "La Muerta" to go which was $16 a bottle but in my opinion, worth it.

reviews.author: YunnÃ¡n C.
reviews.description: Roadmap is a great place to checkout after work or really whenever you want! They have a great selection of beers, they're really quick(will give you your pour right as you're paying), there's lot of large tables for groups, and if you're hungry there's Project Pollo's food truck parked outside of it.  I'm an IPA drinker so I've dipped into every IPA they have on their beer list and they're all great. The table next to us had a chess match going. A great place for dog lovers, plenty of doggos here enjoying pets.  Have came here a handful of times and have always had a great experience. The staff is top notch, cheers!

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: I heard on one of my first trips that Roadmap brewing was a good place to check out, if I was into local beers. I finally got around to going with a friend and her BF.  He was into beer and she was okay with it as well.  The space was a nice converted storefront and staff was friendly even as it got busier. The beers I had were pretty good, I'm into sours and their one was good.   I appreciated that they had a food truck permanently attached to their space but it was a vegan chicken spot, which was not really what I'm looking for when I'm drinking a beer.

reviews.author: Dorie B.
reviews.description: Been here a couple times. Super chill spot! No food unless there's a food truck but plenty of beer to choose from. I went for the seasonal "Cousin Eddy" and it did not disappoint but it was strong. I switched to something lighter after that, liked everything I tried that night. Very dog friendly and nice staff.

reviews.author: Daniel L.
reviews.description: This is an Awesome brewery with a great food truck and a bonus is that it's pet friendly! Great local beer selection year round

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Great brewery. Very casual and relaxed atmosphere. Great beers. Food truck outside. Highly recommend. 9/10 for me.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Good beer. Great atmosphere. Dog friendly.  What more can you ask for?  They have a good selection of beers. Their beer on tap is not expensive. You can also buy canned.   They have a good a amount of inside seating. They also have a few benches outside, but shade is limited.   There's a vegan food truck on site.   Parking is across the street, but limited. You can find street parking or you can pay $5 to park across from Bentley's.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Roadtripping to South Texas and Roadmap seemed an ideal to stop for a beer and to check out a new brewery. Great spot! Highlight of the stop was the excellent beer, with styles for everyone and everything I tasted was really well done. Setup is awesome, with a ton of space and great vibes. Both a brewery dog AND brewery cat lounging around and added to the chill, welcoming, community brew vibes. Just a great place to hang, would be really great for a group outing, or a date night. Lots to like at Roadmap! Anytime I am passing through I will make it a point to swing in. Drink local!

reviews.author: Christopher W.
reviews.description: Stopped into Roadmap for a much needed cool-off while riding our bikes in downtown San Antonio. I ordered the gose which is often my choice for summer beers. The beer true to reviews was excellent. There is also a great food truck that rolls up daily. Nice spot.

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: Cool atmosphere and knowledgeable staff.  Nice for hanging out with friends either indoor or outdoor.  Has a decent selection of beers.  If you'd like wine they have red or white wine seltzers

reviews.author: Gerald H.
reviews.description: Decent brewery in San Antonio a few miles away from the riverwalk. A nice selection of IPAs with a small outdoor area. Beers are unlike California IPAs with a little more bitterness to it. Cute tanks! Like it's a home brew place. :) If you're tired of the riverwalk and chain beers take a scooter and come here. The riverwalk don't have taps from some of these smaller breweries.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Large indoor seating area, with 3 or more rooms. I was surprised, but happy to see that dogs are allowed inside (I guess since they don't serve food?). There is also a smaller outdoor seating area by the food truck. Hand sanitizer is provided. Large offering of beers, so should be something for every taste. We enjoyed our sampler and will come back for something larger of our favorites another time.

reviews.author: Kylie B.
reviews.description: RoadMap was a unique spot with some delicious (and creatively named) beers. I tried the plum sour and it was a mouthful of happiness. The guys behind the bar were helpful when it came to suggestions of places to see I'm San Antonio.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Whoop whoop! Here's to RMBC and their ever evolving taps that always hit the spot.  Owners Dustin and Hanna have made such a success of the great place, they have broken through a wall for expansion and have a great space very soon for private events. Super nice people, locally owned, what more could you want in a neighborhood brew pub.

reviews.author: Patrick T.
reviews.description: Great beer, friendly staff, lots of indoor/outdoor seating Had a lot of fun here and I'll definitely come back!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I love this brewery. They have such a wide variety of beer styles, you are sure to find something everyone enjoys.  Everyone who works there is very knowledgeable about beer. They are pet friendly and even have a resident cat who lives there. There are also dog treats by the cash register.  They don't have food inside but the food truck outside is delicious and you can bring your food inside.  They also have a really large space so distancing is not a problem. Also, try the popcorn from the Alamo City Popcorn Company by the register, I recommend the Spicy Buffalo.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Love the names of the beers and the spacious setup. I had tried a few beers and nothing was to die for, but I'm sure they're always changing. I will just have to go back! Love that they're dog-friendly inside and out.

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: Roadmap is a neighborhood favorite of mine. They always come with great attitudes, smiling faces and over all good vibes.   I'm not a huge beer drinker but they seem to have a beer for everyone. They welcome you to stay and enjoy with board games, corn hole, giant jenga, and even encourage you to bring food or order food to eat while you're there. They have some TV's to watch the games that are on and also see some snacks as well. They usually always have food trucks outside which always have great food!   COVID procedures: I feel that they are taking great precautions to continue great service while also keeping patrons and employees safe. Hand sanitizer everywhere, roped off lines to make it one-way to order food or snacks and one-way entrance and exits. They have tables outside as well, about 4-5 tables that seat about 4 people each.

reviews.author: Janelle W.
reviews.description: This was my first time I went to a brewing company. I never found a beer that I enjoyed. This was until I came to Roadmap Brewing. Their selection is amazing. Their skill is evident with every sip.

reviews.author: Monica H.
reviews.description: First time coming here and I am thrilled with their beer selections and names - very creative. They don't have food, but there is a food truck in the outside seating area. I enjoyed the atmosphere here!

reviews.author: Tiffany J.
reviews.description: Beers not only have great names, but great flavors. Such a welcoming group and community. Would love to San Antonio just for this!

reviews.author: Dylan M.
reviews.description: Great beer selection that rotates frequently. Happy hour is mon-Thur 4-6 with discounts on draft beer. Many options for food with pizza being a highlight. Can't go wrong with the prosciutto mushroom pizza!   Overall it is one of the better breweries in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Walt N.
reviews.description: Was very impressed with the beer and the beer selection.     We tried the Lager, Stout, Boctoberfest and several others.      All of the beers were good.    The atmosphere and the service left a lot to be desired.   The service wasn't bad, it just wasn't friendly.    The bartender was busier canning than she was waiting on customers.    Although we didn't eat, the pizza looked and smelled amazing!

reviews.author: Eric S.
reviews.description: Fantastic atmosphere. Great service. Brad was our server and was so kind, left us with a list of recommendations as we are new to the area.  Great beer and good food!

reviews.author: Joel G.
reviews.description: First off let me give credit where credit is due, back unturned has phenomenal pizza and beer, seriously some of the best pizza I've had in awhile, the restaurant is a cool hangout spot near downtown, but they're not without their problems.  First time I came here I was beyond disappointed; I set up for a weekend date with my wife to try this spot out before catching a movie. Parking was a pain, we had to pay a meter or pay for the parking they offered in their lot. Unfortunately, they were hosting an event in the back lot with a $25 dollar cover charge! We just wanted to grab some pizza and  beer in which their normal dining room wasn't available, only the special event! If you want to have special events fine, but don't  strong arm all your customer who go out of their way just to grab a bite! So we payed for parking and had to spend our money elsewhere.  I gave them another shot this past week and my overall experience had highs and lows.  First of the negatives, they're pricing is high, probably not worth it for one person tab, you can't get out of here without paying $25-30bucks for a pizza, and a couple beers. Two people would be a better value but still they don't have hot and ready prices if that's what you're expecting. The wait staff wasn't very attentive and didn't check on us much, kinda just had a "MEH" attitude.   Despite all this, their pizza and beer it's pretty freaking awesome. Their crust is perfect, crispy and thin with just the perfect amount of pull when you bite into it. Their toppings are all above average soooooo good, probably reflecting the higher than average prices. The spicy Hawaiian had the typical controversial pineapple but more I've a sweet and tangy sauce with loads of bacon and jalapeÃ±o, really an awesome reinvention of the sweet and salty play on pizza!  I do wish their pizzas we're a bit larger, even if the amount of toppings stay the same just give us more of that beautiful crust, sauce and cheese!  Also I will say they were a little light on sauce fore me personally.   Their wings were not my favorite, I'm not big on baked wings, they were lest crispy and more chewy. Baked or grilled can be just as good as fried but think they needed longer or turn the temp up to get those crispy edges!  Their beer gets an A plus, you can't go bad with any options especially when paired with a good pizza.

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Decided it was time to try the brunch menu today.  At first I decided to order off the small sides just to try a few plates. However, the honeyed goat cheese toast was on the menu but no longer offered :(   So I went with blueberry French toast and a side of bacon. The bacon was not really cooked enough for my taste, but it had a good flavor. The French toast is made from sour dough which means it does not soak up a custard and it gets crusty on the sides. I liked the flavors but was not as expected.  Loved the mimosa. Good size for only $6.

reviews.author: Sara C.
reviews.description: came here with my boyfriend after a friend recommended me to try it.  My boyfriend really enjoys trying different breweries and different kinds of beers. He said "i enjoyed it but wouldn't be back if i was back in town"   We loved our experience here though our waiter was really good at explaining to us the different beers they had and gave us great recommendations.   We got one pepperoni pizza to eat with the beer and it was really good! its very very thin so if you're not about that then don't get pizza haha  You can also buy their beer as a 6 pack in cans which i thought was really cool.   I agree.. I don't know if I would be back but I would recommend to those who haven't been.  from the outside it may seem abandoned and even a restaurant so don't think your gps took you to the wrong place like we though.

reviews.author: Nick G.
reviews.description: Second time stopping in this place because the beer and food is amazing. We had the pizza and Cesar salad; both were amazing. Also, had the Rio De Leche Stout and the Traditional Bock; both were awesome.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were in San Antonio for a long weekend and we just had a nice BBQ dinner at Augie's BBQ and my wife noticed there was a tap room nearby. It is very near the Riverwalk, so we decided to come in and have a beer. Good choice.  We sat at the bar and the bartender was a younger guy and I ordered an IPA, it was solid.  The bartender was nice and gave me some free stickers and everyone was having a great time.  Great little tap room, especially after a great BBQ dinner at Augie's.

reviews.author: Jessie A.
reviews.description: We have tickets at the Tobin Center and wanted to eat close by beer our show. We are always interested in local breweries and my husband loves pizza, plus this was a quick walk on the Riverwalk. I like that you can get your pizza in the six inch size. We ordered two different ones (pepperoni Gorgonzola and the Formaggio e Bacon). Both were delicious, but we preferred the Gorgonzola one, which also had a balsamic glaze. The service was excellent. I'm sure this place is really busy on the weekend. Not too bad for a Wednesday, either. We'll definitely be back. This is a thin crust pizza, so if that's not your jam, you should know that. It's hard to find a Porter or stout at the micro breweries around here, so we were pleased with the milk stout tonight. Anyone that can point me to more local dark beers? We look forward to trying the Rio De Leeches and the double chocolate coconut when they get it on tap.

reviews.author: Elizabeth M.
reviews.description: The pizza was perfect.. Pepperoni and Mushroom  ..ordered a large , but was perfect for two. We started with salad.. the combination of strawberries , spicy walnuts and mozzarella were delightful with just a slight kick.. nothing a cold delectable craft beer can't smother..The Dank (my favorite if you like a hoppy taste it) was amazing!! My husband had the Marzen, which he loved! Service was great! A  nice way to end a night of Christmas shopping.  Great atmosphere for a casual dinner or date night or time to unwind with friends .. give it a try!

reviews.author: Tamara B.
reviews.description: At first we thought this place was closed. I'm glad we dinned in. The food was very tasty I enjoyed the cold coffee brewed. Yum! The pizza was good in portion and they k ew how to arrange the toppings to get the full pizza in every bite. We will be back. Great customer service!

reviews.author: Brenda L.
reviews.description: This pizza was absolutely delicious! I almost finished a whole pizza myself! Starting from the flavor of the sauce, the cheese and the spices of the pizza. The variety of beers is what puts the cherry on top to this masterpiece. Customer Service was also a huge plus. They were all very attentive and welcoming.  10/10000000 Recommend   P.S. My friends face says it all on how good it is ;)

reviews.author: Richard S.
reviews.description: Had a tremendous time today with the crew at Back Unturned! I only wish I could have celebrated with them yesterday for their anniversary.  I don't remember the selection of beer but all were delightful. I must say I've had my share of Brussel Sprouts and these were amazing.   You've got to try this place.

reviews.author: Anais A.
reviews.description: This place is super cool! The pizza was delicious, the beer is good! What more could you want? We tried their wings as well and they were tasty. I don't recall all of the pizzas we ordered, since we ordered 3 but I like that they have white pies and red pies. Definitely need to come back and try some new pies!

reviews.author: Marta D.
reviews.description: We'll definitely return. But not for the service.  Our waiter, a guy with a calf tattoo wasn't unfriendly, but he wasn't welcoming either. Kind of aloof if I'm being honest.    We order the Rio de Leche and a cold brew with vanilla sweet cream.  The former is a sweet stout, much like you'd expect a dulce de leche stout to taste. The cold brew was properly bold and very refreshing for today's heat.   To eat,  the prosciutto, mushroom, and arugula (an upcharge) pizza. The pizzas are 6-inches at the biggest, it seems, and this particular pie was topped with shaved parm and mozzarella. We'd definitely get this again. I ordered the strawberry stuffed French toast, which wasn't a prominently strawberry dish. Instead, it was only topped with one berry, thinly sliced. Very disappointed with this as I feel it was a bait and switch. The "stuffing" was a thin custard which was tasty.  The bread was a sourdough that complimented the sweetness of the filling very well.  They offer a 10% military discount and that's always a nice gesture. Parking may be iffy on busy nights, but we were able to find a spot right outside with no issues. The interior, also, looks like it can get packed on busy weekends. The one downside to the meals is that there's no heat lamps on the pass (which is just a metal rack) so unless you're waitstaff is on it, food may get cold as it waits for pick up.

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: Myself and friends were downtown and stumbled upon this cool brewery and it had amazing beer and really good lemonade for the kids as well as some fire wings. The hospitality was top notch. I also noticed on Yelp if you check in you can receive 10% off your visit.

reviews.author: Sarah P.
reviews.description: TL;DR: Fun. Busy. Clean. Delicious. Not much social distancing.   This place was busy! They attempted to social distance by having tables in between blocked off, but since it's a small place in general it didn't really work. The service was great! Legit all the workers there were so attentive; they weren't even our waiter and they still asked if we needed anything! The food came out HOT and relatively quick with the number of people there. We got the Spicy Hawaiian and Formagio Bacon. They were both sooooo goooood. They were piping hot, so be careful! And they have a good selection of beers too! Will most definitely be back!!!!!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a quick drink while we were waiting for our table at Pete's tako house and my goodness this place looked awesome! The food smelled amazing even though we didn't try any it did look really good especially the brunch menu. We tried the lemonade of the day which was the orange pineapple and it was great! Great staff as well super nice. We'll definitely try to make it back if we can.   Overall: 4.6 stars

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: I can only review the beer.....amazing! I love Belgians and have the Tussel in the Hay. My husband loves IPA's and they have a few to choose from, so her rotates. They have their beers ready to go in 16 oz cans and you can mix and match a 4 pack. Our beer choices come in 4 oz and 10 oz pours and you can get the 16 oz can for a little more, I noticed. So you might want to try buying the can and just asking for a glass, which would save $$. I wish their outdoor seating was a little nicer and bigger, but after that first taste of ice cold beer...it really doesn't matter. Their menus are all on-line and easily accessible.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Stopped by on a Saturday night for food and drinks. It happened to be their anniversary weekend.  They had live music.   Of course, I had to try a beer flight. It's definitely the best way to try a few of their beers at once with getting inebriated. I loved them all.  The food here is pretty good too. We shared the puttanesca pizza, wings and black bean hummus.  The pizza was just as I like it. The crust was thin and crispy. It had enough sauce, cheese and toppings.  The hummus came with warm pita bread. It did taste a lot like black beans, so keep that in mind when ordering. It was also a small portion. I would say it is enough for two people only.   The wings- mango habanero.  They weren't too spicy. They are twice baked. Good flavor. Not too sweet. Good portion for sharing.  They have inside and outside seating. Both are limited and with social isolation practices, it makes the seating even more limited. We were able to get seated pretty quickly. Parking is street parking. Staff was great.

reviews.author: Celeste M.
reviews.description: The employees were so friendly, the food was great, the DJ was playing fun music, and the dogs were adorable. Would definitely go back!

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: oh my god so many dogs automatic 5 stars.  Ok, for real, my friend and I wanted a place near our friends' house to chat and have a drink and this was the first place to pop up. I am so glad it did, because in the words of Belinda Carlisle, "Who knew heaven was a place on earth?"  Ordering the beers was fast and simple, and you can easily spend a lot of time sitting, chatting, and admiring all the dogs. All of them. So many snoots I want to boop.  It wasn't crowded or anything, either so that was also much appreciated. Whoever came up with the concept to make this a great place for people of all ages AND for dogs is a genius.

reviews.author: Priscilla H.
reviews.description: Came to have a Sunday funday  Had the margarita flight and then a michelada  Great company!

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: Great for adults. Great for pets. Great for kids.   They have outdoor bench seating, two doggie play pens (large breed and small breed) and a playground for the kids.   The prices are extremely reasonable for the amount of food you get. I started realizing some prices in San Antonio were a little high and I'm thinking it's because of the tourism. Not this place, this place seemed extremely fair! Can you believe I forgot to take a photo of my burger? It was delicious!   If you don't have pets don't let it stop you from visiting this place. Indoor and outdoor seating available with their own parking lot. Come on down and enjoy yourself!

reviews.author: Beth G.
reviews.description: Super cute place to bring your dog and grab a drink. The dog play area has chairs to sit and hang around other dogs or you can grab a picnic table outside of the dog area and leave your dog in the play area. Tons of dogs on a Friday night but for the most part all playing well together.

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: We've walked at the nearby McAllister Park several different times and have known that Hops 'n Hounds was just a stone's throw away. Saturday, we finally decided to check it out even though we don't have a fido. It was surely a busy time!  My husband decided to try the bone-in chicken wings and got the 12 piece with BBQ sauce and the Korean Pepper sauce. I decided to get the kid's meal with 6 boneless wings, tots and apple juice. We did get a Bark-arita to share too with 2 mango, 2 prickly pear, 1 strawberry and 1 lime. Great flavor with the chicken wings! The tater tots were awesome. They originally gave me the fries instead of the tots and then I got a bonus portion of tots! The Bark-arita was actually a lot to share between the 2 of us. Maybe a draft beer next time!  Love the outdoor space, the fan with misters and seeing people with their pooches. Definitely will be back for the wings again and try other foods.

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: Food was good! Got a bbq burger and the sweet potato fries were not cooked al the way, very chewy. The service is horrible tho, got a burger and the bartender literally rolled her eyes at me. The guy who brought our food to the table was talking on the phone, dropped it and left even tho my friend was calling for him. I know the industry and hate to get a bad service!

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Great spot to be with your dogs while enjoying drinks and food.  Unique to have patios and dog parks combined with bar and food.  They also have live music here to enjoy on the weekends.  The weekend we stopped by with our two dogs, there was a dog spa service as well.  They have bars located by the dog park areas so you can watch your dogs while enjoying alcoholic beverages.  Make sure to start a tab at the main building to be able to order drinks at the dog park. I haven't tried the food menu yet, but I did see that they serve food for dogs!  My dogs enjoyed being off leash inside the large dog park, where they can play with other dogs.  Make sure to hold on to your drinks when dogs get rowdy and body slam your table.  The floors are astro turf with rocks around the fencing area so you don't have to worry about your dogs getting dirty.  I'm excited to come back to have fun with the dogs!

reviews.author: elisa g.
reviews.description: Neat place and concept. The food is ok, nothing to brag about. I had a burger and mango margarita. The bartenders dressed it carelessly and made it difficult to hold without getting dirty. There are 2 dog areas one for small dogs and one for large. There should be a limit on number of dogs in each area as the big dog section was very crowded. There was a patio for a performer /band but no live music on a Saturday night. The obstacle courses seemed interesting

reviews.author: Halle B.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to take your pups and grab a drink while you are there. The prickly pear is so good and highly recommend. The outdoor area is pretty and a very chill environment. Will be coming back!

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Been to this place during it's run as other burger joints.  Like how they made it revolve around dawgs.  There is 2 areas for dawgs (small and large) in a separate area than the sitting area.  There are games to play out there and we went to it out with a puppy.  Got the bacon cheeseburger that was alright, not the best.  The bartender rocked and got us into some other local beers.  It was slow when we got there around noon on Sunday (9/12/21), but started to pick up around 1PM.  If you are looking to enjoy the nicer SA weather outside with your dawg, this place is it.  They had some happy hour deals during the week.

reviews.author: Alisha R.
reviews.description: Just found out about this place and had to take my pup for an outing! A friend and I went to eat and take our pups to play. I ordered the loaded tots and a shrimp salad. I ordered a side of chicken and bacon for my pup. The tots are so amazing! I could go back for those any day. The salad was pretty good. My pup loved interacting with other dogs and munching on the pup food although it looked a little greasy to be made specifically for the pups. Overall loved the atmosphere and all of the adorable pups and food. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars are for the over abundance of water spraying fans that they wouldn't consider turning off, not even one and the fact you have to pretty much get up before a server gets back to your table but they may have a lack of staff so it's understandable too.

reviews.author: Haley H.
reviews.description: If you happen to be on this side of town, it's a great spot to stop and enjoy a margarita or some appetizers when the weather is nice. Simple ordering station with easy to read menu (though we needed to ask the host for some specifics regarding toppings on the loaded tots and nachos.) The bar area was long and provided several beer options as well as frozen 'ritas. It was a ladies night out, so we each ordered a margarita flight and headed outside. Note: seating inside was limited, making this a hard pass on a rainy or super hot day. We were welcomed by tons of outdoor picnic tables and relaxed while we waited for them to bring out our appetizers. Although we didn't bring our furry friends, there seems to be a decent spot for them to run around and play- and a wooden playscape for the kiddos. The margarita flight presentation was on point, but some of the flavors were less than stellar. After ordering, we noticed several other patrons come out with flights that looked different than ours. Perhaps there's a secret menu that only the cool kids know? I'll definitely ask next time! Nachos were delicious.... And the potential is there. One downfall was we were apparently sitting near the "smoking section" without realizing. While I appreciate the effort- I wish it had been a smoke free environment all together. Check it out!

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: Our friend Bill Stidham is an amazing artist who was debuting some art here, invited us to his Facebook live show here and we were so glad as we discovered a cool, fun place that we have already shared with others.  Love the beer garden, lots of tables. - and yes they are spaced out , as well as a play area for kids and another for dogs! Basic but good pub food : loaded nachos, fries, tater tots - I am a workout addict vegetarian but hell, after a long week pub food and beer done well is all I need to feel better and this place does the trick!  Great drink selection - this IPA addict was happy - weathered souls , modern times ; and I even deviated from my go to and tried their margarita which was awesome .  Cool crowd, great food and drinks! Will be back for sure

reviews.author: Maitina M.
reviews.description: This is a must go to playground and dog park that happens to serve food and drinks.  Just kidding!  Seriously, this is such a cool neighborhood restaurant that's worth a visit. It's very kid and dog friendly. I absolutely enjoyed their outdoor sitting that had fans with misters throughout the area.   Diners have to place their orders near the entrance of the restaurant and then wait for the food to be delivered to them. We went with the garlic Parmesan wings, bacon burger, loaded fries and browned brussel sprouts. Personally not a fan of the wings since I like mine served dry. Wings were way too saucy. Will go with burger options next time I'm back.  Margarita flight was good. Always nice having the option to try out different flavors.  All together, this place has such a fun atmosphere. They had live music just as we were leaving. I can see why this has become a hot spot in our neighborhood in the short amount of time it's been open.

reviews.author: Joseph D.
reviews.description: Wow!! This place is fantastic!! Such a well executed idea and concept!! Usually pictures don't do a place justice but go flip through all the pictures and ask yourself why you have been here yet!?!? It truly is as good as it looks!! I looooove being able to order my food/drinks etc right of the patio. Also being able to have my furry friend hanging out with us at the same time is sooooo fun!!     The food was fantastic, the service was quick and friendly, all the staff across the board was on point and best of all..... IT WAS VERY CLEAN!!! Not like most dog parks you go to lol    We went around 6pm on a Friday. The crowd was nice and didn't feel cramped or overwhelmed by dogs/people. However when we left around 8pm (while the sun was almost completely set) it was really starting to get packed. (So go at 6 lol)    I'm telling you, get your family and your favorite 4 legged friend and get over there!!!

reviews.author: Zachary S.
reviews.description: Nice place right next to McAllister Park that is good to take your doggo friend to run around and have a beverage. Customer Service and the wait for food can be delayed at times, but in general it is a nice place for dogs to run around

reviews.author: Giselle C.
reviews.description: I loved loved loved Hops N Hounds....and so does our pup!  We went on a Friday night...there was a decent, but socially distanced crowd.  Lots of pups to ooh and ahh over, too!!  Service was friendly, the food was reasonably priced and the drink selection was varied, with everything from craft beers to margarita flights (the owners are the same folks who run Burleson Beer Garden, so if you like their margaritas, you're in luck).  My favorite part (of course) was the dog park, where you can hang out with your friends while your furbaby plays with his or her friends!  There are water bowls, toys and even a ball-throwing machine!  My dog had a blast and slept all the way home!  When we went, there wasn't any shade in the picnic table area, but there are umbrellas all over the place now.  We can't wait to return!

reviews.author: Meagan S.
reviews.description: I love the atmosphere where we can both get out of the house and chill. It is an enter at your own risk with your dog bur rarely ever are there any issues. Drinks are good food is good I love it here

reviews.author: Adam R.
reviews.description: IF YOUR DOG DOES NOT PLAY WELL WITH OTHER DOGS AND YOU STILL SHOW UP AT A DOG "friendly" RESTAURANT, YOU ARE A BAD DOG OWNER.   This place is a big NO go. I do NOT recommend bringing your dog here. It is not regulated at all.   Our big goofy puppy boxer was being repeatedly attacked by a Boston Terrier and then some other idiot brings in 2 pit bulls one of which was nice but the other one was definitely a fighting pit bull as it was foaming out the mouth wanting to eat our boxer. I do not care if you have your aggressive blood thirsty pit bull on a leash while in the play area. HE SHOULD NOT EVEN BE IN THE PLAY AREA or ANYWHERE NEAR A DOG "friendly" RESTAURANT TO BEGIN WITH. And the idiot owner should already know this.

reviews.author: Gil G.
reviews.description: We went on a Saturday night, first time going. No line and we sat outside and there was Covid spaced tables. We tasted the many draft beers available, hard to pick just 1! I ordered the Mahi- Mahi fish tacos and they were fantastic! The sauce that goes over the taco was excellent. Fish was freshly grilled. Prices were fair and service was good.

reviews.author: Chuck F.
reviews.description: We've been trying for the last 2 or so years to visit these guys when in San Antonio. The two previous try's they were closed, Covid.. I'm so glad we tried again. Man was this place worth the wait!! The beer was absolutely fantastic and the food was as well. The only problem I have with this place is that it's too far from Pittsburgh! Thanks to everyone at Longtab brewing for a great time!

reviews.author: Howie S.
reviews.description: Planned this trip for a few month's like 4. Anyway It was my birthday so the wife saidkool lets do it. Mine you this is a super testosterone rush brewery micro heaven.  The porter was to die for. Now they have a stout!!!! I had a triple cheesy sandwich which made me thirsty. Mind you I ubered there and back to my hotel. All in all great trip.4 stars for sure.

reviews.author: Joel G.
reviews.description: Longtab Brewery is a welcomed addition to this area of San Antonio's culinary scene, they have excellent micro brewed beer crafted in house, and only beer crafted in their house, beer lover or not you have to appreciate the love they show to it.    All in all this is an excellent place to hang and grab a couple of  beers, with excellent snacks and sandwiches once that buzzed hunger monster strikes. I will say though not to treat this as a gastro pub, their focus is much more on the beer and less on the food.  Not to say the food isn't good, my grilled ham and cheese was excellent! But It was simple, most people could've made it at home in about ten min.  That's not a jab to the restaurant, it's simple and makes sense and I enjoyed it thoroughly!   My dad had the brat and same theme, it's was very good but very simple, just something to tie you over with your brews.   As far as negatives I did notice a few things but honestly they're more of observations. I would say a appreciate the small fresh menu but it's a little overly simple for my taste, at the very least give an option for fries as opposed to chips or some kinda interesting sides! Maybe some German themed beers ones to compliment the beer types even and entrÃ©es.  A couple more menu items sure would be nice, especially something that wasn't hand held, I think that would really get them closer to a 5 start spot.  Also pricing for the portion size I would say price if is flirting the line of being high, beer seems to be pretty average cost wise.   Also service wasn't bad or anything but it was very laid back, almost a little too laid back if you know what I mean. And as much as I love the view of the awesome brewery vats and equipment without a glass dividing wall like most places similar to this place have, you get all those  strong smells associated with it, it could be a little off-putting for some but not unbearable.   All in all a great place to hangout and grab a few beers and maybe a snack or two, it's nice to see more places like this making their way to SA and sticking to their guns, this is not your sub par bar or ice house by far.

reviews.author: John G.
reviews.description: Great service, and the selection was delicious! It's a real mellow environment which makes it a nice spot to have a few drinks, get some food and even coffee.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: This is probably the best kept secret in town. I seriously wasn't aware this place was open. Located in an area full of car repair shops, you could easily pass it up.   This place is for everyone. It's a coffee shop, brewery and they have food. They also serve wine for those that don't want beer or coffee.  The most surprising thing is that their food is legit. It's delicious and they serve large portions. I didn't expect much from their food, but I was wrong. They also sell canned beer and coffee to go.   We started by sharing the soft pretzel. It's a perfect appetizer for beer.   For my meal, I had the Blackened shrimp hoagie. it came with large pieces of shrimp. It was perfectly seasoned. The side was house seasoned chips. I can't complain. It was a good meal.   For beer, you can always as for half pours so you can try most than one. This place sells typical beer. Nothing too crazy.   The wine served is from Messina Hof. It seems like they support local Texas businesses. They also have cake thieves bakery items for sale.   There's plenty of options for seating. Parking is available on site.

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: Longtab started off as a 4 star place. We had come about 3-4 times before our last visit. When we had so much attitude from the front blond staff.   Food- curry mussels, pretzel - yes Eh- shrimp sandwich, choriiqueso , chips aren't very good chips.   The experience completely ruined by a staff member- didn't have to be this way.  Good luck to the business and I hope you have a better experience that what happened to us for a freaking 25 cent sticker that was marked up to $7 and not Included in the Yelp checkin sticker deal.

reviews.author: Joseph E.
reviews.description: What started out as a Yelp search for pizza ended up bringing me to a new brew pub in my own backyard. Who woulda thunk! I was pleasantly surprised to find this place opened up in my old stomping grounds and I was none the wiser, shame on me. So, here I go to check it out and soon find Longtab in a commercial business park that I have driven by hundreds of times before.  As I walk up, you'll notice the outside is painted in Army green and this is for a purpose. Come to find, this establishment is owned and operated by former Special Forces members and Green Berets. To all, thank you for your service! Upon entry, I was greeted with a friendly, "hello and you can sit wherever you like". The inside is super clean and neat. There is a front area with tables and a separate back area with sofa and more tables.   After looking the menu over, I start of with the pulled pork sandwich and the Stilleto. The Stilleto is a Belgian brown that is dark but not super heavy and had notes of coffee and chocolate. Good bold taste.  Next, the pulled pork sandwich came out and I was ready to sink my teeth into this bad boy. The meat was super tender, juicy and season well. The challah bread was soft and soaked up all the juicy goodness from the meat. The side of black pepper kettle chips paired well with the sandwich and completed the meal.  I asked one of the managers about there selection of beers and he told me that they do rotate the offerings and will have seasonal offerings as they become available so I'll be sure to keep up to date on that.  Overall, I really like this place and the fact it is so close to me and that it support those that have supported us makes me definitely want to come back.

reviews.author: Mitch E.
reviews.description: Epic establishment!! The food was absolutely delicious. We ordered the massive pretzel which was cooked perfectly. They need to give you more beer cheese dip because the one cup won't remotely take care of how big the pretzel is. The currywurst and bratwursts were so delicious. The beers were so smooth and we tried a variety. I did end up spending more money than I expected because the environment lended itself to a fun time. The servers and bartenders were so fun and friendly. They were attentive, talked to patrons and made the atmosphere lively. The crowd is diverse but primarily veterans since it's a veteran owned small business. They are only open till 10 pm during the week which was a bummer because I could have enjoyed that atmosphere much longer. Looks like I'll need to come back soon. Hidden off of Bandera road; it's close to our home at the border of Leon Valley/San Antonio. They also have a wide variety of glassware you can purchase as well as apparel with their logo. Great times and I'll see you soon!

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: We came to enjoy some beer and snacks. It was a small cute place with TVs and a good amount of indoor seating. The staff was really nice and fast!   Got the pretzel since we got there late and they were out of a few things already but the pretzel is all I really wanted so we were happy! It came out warm and huge portion.   Try the Oatmeal Beer for a coffee/cream taste, their lager and pale ale were also really good! $10 for snacks and $8-10 a beer.

reviews.author: Monica G.
reviews.description: We frequent this place often. Beer selection and food are great! Hands down, the best brewery in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Michael T.
reviews.description: Delicious, food beer brewed locally. Stop in and see the special forces inspired decor.

reviews.author: Jason B.
reviews.description: Family Friendly Brewery with great beer and food.  Also very friendly staff!  Will be going back! Get the Belgian Beer very good!

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I cannot believe I waited so long to try this place. They have a wide selection of Belgian beers and the corresponding glassware. The beers are great! I had the Devil's Brigade and I have found a new favorite. The food is also delicious and don't forget about their coffee. The staff is very courteous and very helpful, they even ground my coffee. I love this place!

reviews.author: Colby B.
reviews.description: Not sure where to start this review ....  -Best food I've ever had @ a Brewery!  -Loaded Pretzel and Pulled Pork Nacho Apps ... 10/10  -Lamb and Cabbage Empanadas ... 10/10  -Yaraborough on Tap named after the gentleman known as the "Father of the Modern Green Berets." Is a @and$#ing GREAT Beer 10/10   Service was great, staff and fellow patrons were a blast to talk too, this place is worth a visit. Shame on you if you live in San Antonio, love beer, the people that have served this country and haven't made your way here yet!   Thanks for a great meal and conversation, Well Done

reviews.author: Danielle T.
reviews.description: Love love love the beer. The tripel and v42 are my favorite, but their limited releases are also a win. Make sure you try the nachos, because that pulled pork is amazing. They are kid friendly with games and crayons, and great for fur babies too.

reviews.author: Lourdes A.
reviews.description: Shared a very good dinner and excellent drinks with friends last night. All the food was served hot and tasted great, really enjoyed the pairings for the sausage plate. Loved the music played and overall atmosphere as well. Our server was not good though; she was slow with the orders and of course forgot an item ordered because she negated to write anything down. However, the service recovery was immaculate from the gentleman who came over to apologize about the missing dish and had it quickly sent out. Did not do dessert but did bring the peaches and cream cheese pop pastry to my niece. She said it reminded her of an empanada and she liked it a lot.

reviews.author: Samuel P.
reviews.description: 1st time here and it DEFINITELY won't be our last.  The attention to the making of each beer is obvious to the pallet. Nick, the manager, was hospitable and very knowledgeable of both the food, beer, coffee AND wine!!! Read that again!!!! Yes.  Coffee is from WA state and is very smooth.  Guatemalan single origin is amazing!!!!!Wine selection is all TX.....GSM is the perfect choice!!!!! The food is flavorful and addicting!!  Pork nachos were soooo delicious.  And we wanted to order a pretzel and a sandwich but were more focused on the beer!!  Bathroom was clean AND had an awesome speaker to enjoy tunes as you go!!!  Veteran owned from SA!!!!   This is an amazing establishment with regulars that make you feel at home.  Staff is so friendly and kind.  Oh and they have weekend specials!!! Will have to do another post for that!!!  Your next date or new place experience IS HERE!!!  See you here soon!!!

reviews.author: Gary C.
reviews.description: Pineland Oppression is a decent IPA. I really liked the Breacherbock, a wheat Doppelbock. Didn't have any food.   Curious as to why the prices for a pint are so high, here and at Busted Sandal. I'm from the Boise area, and 99% of the pours are $5, even 10oz premiums like bourbon barrel stouts.  One last note, Doppelbock is spelled dopplebock on the can.

reviews.author: Shae M.
reviews.description: Heard this place has been open a few yrs already but I just went there with my sister-in-law pretty recent ! We had such a blast ! The food is excellent! And the staff is so sweet helpful and very very accommodating. Definitely gonna become a regular here!

reviews.author: Beatrice M.
reviews.description: Talk about unexpected find... this place was the best discovery ever! We went for something close by not expecting much since location wise it is not the SA hot spot. We were so happy we went.  All I know is I don't want too many people to find it because we love going when it's not too busy because their servers have time to hang out and give insight to the food and beers. So far we have not found anything we do not like about Longtab Brewing Co.  What will keep taking us back is the Loaded Bavarian Pretzel and the cool playlist.  As for wine I am in awe of their Admiral Nimitz Foundation Admiral's Reserve (Dessert).  Also they are a coffee house and I've yet to try one but I will be soon.

name: Alamo Beer Company
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Great spot to hang out, enjoy different beers on tap, and get food at.  First off, they have spacious parking lot, despite the location being close to downtown.  This makes everything easier and better! There's a great variety of beers on tap available to try.  Live music and karaoke night is also a feature to check out while enjoying beer. For food, there's a variety of sandwiches and snacks in case you're hungry.  They have optional spacious indoor and outdoor seating ready.  Also, sometimes there are events being hosted by the brewery.  A must try spot!

reviews.author: Janelle F.
reviews.description: I have always liked this place.  Hadn't been in a while , and it's fantastic .   I love supporting local businesses , especially when they are dog friendly.   Great atmosphere,  delicious food  and beer/wine !!!   Friendly staff .   Can't wait to come back !!

reviews.author: Allen U.
reviews.description: Hankering a hang out spot within the Alamo City so decided to give Alamo Beer Company a try. Tried out a couple of their beers and even their seasonal mango chamoy beer which was very good highly recommend! Ordered a Jumbo Bavarian Pretzel with a queso which is a great portion for the price. Overall the place is pretty relaxing to grab a beer and enjoy the day especially on a fall afternoon.

reviews.author: Marisa G.
reviews.description: Great food, drinks and environment. Highly recommend for families who want to get out of the house.

reviews.author: Todd M.
reviews.description: Nice place. Probably not the best idea to walk to from the riverwalk. Huge patio. Not a huge selection of beer, but what they have is good. Limited food menu compared to the pics you scroll through. I see a connect four and some weed beer.  Not bad. Will return.

reviews.author: David L.
reviews.description: Bottom Line: HUGE venue, lots of space, decent beer selection, and minimal food options but a good spot to just go hang out, grab some beers and basic meals. They smoke their own pork and turkey, which was delicious.  Food: Pulled pork nachos were pretty damn good. Would definitely get again.   Drinks: They have a pretty decent list of beers. Not the greatest variety but they have their focuses and they do a great job.   We would for sure return and maybe bring a football to play on their 50 year field in front of the tables.

reviews.author: Troy L.
reviews.description: My wife and I decided to swing by for a couple of drinks on a gorgeous day!! There is plenty of outdoor seating and they are now offering table service to ensure social distancing. We started off with a few of the beers (both of which were delicious) and a giant pretzel! The pretzel was hot and very soft, and served with a very tasty mustard. The staff was very friendly and gave us a few recommendations as we tried another couple of beers during our visit. Overall a wonderful place to spend a few hours and grab a drink, especially on a nice day! We will definitely be coming back again soon.

reviews.author: Priscilla T.
reviews.description: Loved the beer! Service wasn't as friendly as I would think but overall this is a cute hang out spot!

reviews.author: Alicia V.
reviews.description: I definitely believe this is a Must-Go-To Brewery in San Antonio, the views are just fantastic! They have an indoor and outdoor patio, and the patio outdoor is just amazing! They have great beer and are giving samples. Would have been 5 stars but the guy behind the counter seemed a little annoyed and rushed us into picking out a beer.

reviews.author: Amy K.
reviews.description: Great, spacious brewery that is located about 5 minutes away from The Alamo. I stopped by here on a Monday afternoon shortly after they opened for the day. I had a little trouble finding it because there is construction going on in surrounding area, but I did not give up! I knew it was going to be worth finding!   I was right. They have a massive parking lot, so no worries on finding a spot. The brewery is more than just a line of taps. There is a large biergarten area with benches and plenty of games to play. Large bathrooms in a separate building as well which are super clean. While there is not a ton of seating at the main bar, you can easily find a spot to sit or stand just about anywhere else. This brewery hosts a ton a big events that draw large crowds such as Oktoberfest, a wing festival and even a weekly bacon and bingo night.   My visit was extra pleasant thanks to the awesome staff. Big shoutout to Stephanie who was the best beertender I have come across in a LONG time! Super friendly, very helpful and just a genuinely awesome person who made my visit to Alamo Beer a five star experience. She helped me pick an awesome beer to enjoy and I will definitely return next time I am in the area. Bring your family and friends!

reviews.author: Roxy G.
reviews.description: Awesome place. Came to see a band we knew of and fell for the place. Good and drinks and staff are great and of course in these post covid days was great to see some live music.

reviews.author: Casan S.
reviews.description: Pros: Very cool location, friendly staff  Cons: food took well over an hour to receive, and was wrong order. Food quality: 2/10  If you want to hang out outside, and drink, it's probably a fine place. Don't count on a decent meal though.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: Omg you have to get here quick if you like dark beers!!!!!  They have 3 dark beers right on tap.  Horchata porter, bourbon Barrel Russian imperial stout, bourbon barrel pecan porter.    For the fair weather drinker, there is a La Villita lite, and a listo light.

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: I've heard a lot about this place and finally I stumbled upon it. Literally I think that's the only way to find it. Came on a date night and decided to go for a flight to have a variety. Flights come in 4s.  My memory is too bad to remember the names but I mostly go for the light beers. I truly enjoyed everything I sampled and the beer was so fresh from the tap.   Great environment to hang out with friends, kids, and your dog. I saw a lot people with dogs and kids. On the website it says they host tours on Thursdays and Saturdays for free and you do not have to make reservations, but must wear closed toe shoes. They also have a corn hole league for the competitive sports fans.    Also, ladies the restrooms are amazing. Plenty of stalls and they are roomy. They kept the restroom very clean and stocked with the essentials.

reviews.author: Melly H.
reviews.description: Ãlamo Shandy was awesome tasting on this hot day. Pulled pork nachos were amazing- pork is bbq'd to perfection and has homemade beans! Music being played on patio speakers however, drove us out sooner than later. Live music will start at 6pm but couldn't stand what was being played- some kind of mix of jazz/folk music.

reviews.author: Shannon V.
reviews.description: Beers were pretty awful.... like undrinkably awful.... from my husband  and I who work in/run breweries...... but that's not why I'm leaving this review. Leaving a bad review in a pandemic of a local business is generally poor taste in my opinion but since this place clearly doesn't care about the pandemic why should I???  Place had a huge, crowded line inside with NO MASK OR SOCIAL DISTANCING REENFORCEMENT WHATSOEVER. And the lady behind the counter was wearing an ineffective glittery mesh mask that I could see through! There were signs up for it but everyone in this industry knows damn well no one reads signs and you're gonna have to tell people to put their freaking mask on and follow the rules.  On another note the guys working the counter were lovely and I'm sorry they have to work somewhere with such little regard to their health well being. Do better!

reviews.author: C S.
reviews.description: This place is awesome. They have a TON of outdoor seating. They smoke their own meats and the pulled pork sandwich was delicious. It paired well with their golden ale which was refreshing. They are taking all Covid 19 precautions seriously. The outdoor setting is a great place to chill and have a few drinks

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Came here to grab a beer and do some studying.  Great location, a little hard to figure out if using Google maps.    There was some folk band playing and people were having a great time.  The 3 bartenders were on top of stuff.    Didn't know bingo was going on and then all the sudden, some guy comes out with 4 trays of bacon.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Leena T.
reviews.description: My husband and I became obsessed with Alamo Beer during our two day trip to San Antonio. We even ended up watching the Superbowl here- it was quiet but that just meant a prime viewing area for us.  The layout is of a beer hall and the beer is quality.  Very chill spot, excellent bartender, enough space for a heck of a lot of people both in and outdoors, and an overall fun place.  Our bartender allowed us to try the beer before we bought, was knowledgeable and easy to carry a convo with.  Even though during the two times we went, there was a food truck parked outdoors, I do wish Alamo served some sort of food inside (hot pretzels or popcorn snacks would be a nice addition).  I also wish the bathrooms weren't located outside. A very safe place but it was still somewhat sketchy going at night.  Everything else is excellent and the points mentioned above become easy to forgive otherwise!

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: This beer has converted me from a non-beer drinker to a beer lover! The beer is so smooth and full of flavor, and every one has a different taste. We had the Golden Ale (my personal favorite) and the Amber Lager (my boyfriend's favorite). The atmosphere was very chill, and the bar is open air with indoor and outdoor seating. The staff are very friendly, and they're quick to get you a refill. This is definitely our new go-to for TX craft beer.

reviews.author: Vanessa P.
reviews.description: I loved this place. I absolutely loved the Jeffeweizen. It was a nice place to go off the beaten track. I would definitely come back and highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Mia C.
reviews.description: Had a great time at this little unexpected spot. This is one of 2 locations, a little smaller, and completely indoor. There's a couple of tables available, spaced out well for groups, and some bar seating available. The bartender was super helpful and got us set up with some flights and charcuterie board! Got to try every beer on tap and really found something for everyone in our group. The charcuterie board was a nice snack, and when we ran out of bread it was replenished so we could finish of the hummus and cheese!

reviews.author: Meilinn T.
reviews.description: We came here on a whim last week and it turned out they JUST got to reopen since covid started and we were their FIRST customers since covid! The way it is now is that you can not only buy a pint anymore. To meet the covid requirement, you buy a commemorative covid cup that comes with tokens to redeem 2 drinks and one snack. I hate the waste of plastic, but I get it. The cup is funny too.   It seemed like there is quite a following of the brewery though. We were only there for an hour and there were two groups of guys that came in with their pints. I guess there was a discount if they brought in their own pint(?) I'm probably wrong. But everyone seemed to know each other and it seemed wholesome.

reviews.author: Martha Cecilia J.
reviews.description: Amazing great service, great beer unique beer, great . Owner greeted us. Looooooved it. Will be back

reviews.author: Bob H.
reviews.description: Ok, Let's Review... First time here and for  "Porterpalooza"... Beer selection was good using El Robusto as the base. .  DJ, inside seating, food truck and an alley for a beer garden..( Eh, not great). Bar staff was quick and friendly. They blew out of two selections the first hour in.  Limited ticket sales was a good idea, with limited hours. Steady turn over of patrons and two unisex bathrooms. Not bad.   Even though this was a prepaid event with limited ticket sales, it wasn't organized or well thought out. Several walk-ins were confused and not handled properly outside. Also the times we went to the bar we observed nobody tipping. My partner and I being from the entertainment and service industry,  we found this to be very sad, but expected at a pre paid event.  That doesn't make it right, Millennials.. "Pay up for service ya cheap bastards!"  I dunno, we like the products, although not sold in our stores other than a couple of selections in cans and not porters or stouts. Not many on tap at the brewery on Nitro that we experienced or appeared to us when served  They are looking for investors. What they need is a manager to run the tasting rooms and make them enjoyable with the space they have and selections they offer.  Room for improvement, but we like the products.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This brewery makes some good brews and deserves some attention!  As others have mentioned, it's on the smallish side, but the good news is, they've busted down the walls and have expanded into the space next door. It's not finished out yet, so it's not the purdiest, but you can still hang out on that side of the joint if you need more room.  They currently have nine brews on tap - IPA's, porters, and even a couple of the standard lagers and wheats for boring guys such as myself.  Six of the beers are available year round, but they have several other seasonal types that are rotated in and out.  Check their web site and look for the "La Chancla" series of beers for availability.    Purchase a pint glass for $5 and get $3 refills on Wednesday nights - this is a good deal that you DO NOT WANT TO PASS UP!  Parking is kind of tough and Google Maps takes you to the shopping strip but it's hard to find your way to the front entrance - not the fault of Busted Sandal - totally a Google Maps issue.  Ask for a tour of the brewing room - it's VERY cool, and you get to hear about the entire process and how passionate they are about their brews and the brewing process.  Bonus - there's a really chill and laid back dog that wanders around the place and lounges about.  I don't remember what his name is, but I shall call thee "Jake" as it seems to be a fitting name - unless it's a female dog.  :)  The two brews I tried (and thoroughly enjoyed) were:   Finding Friday Mexican Lager  Jeff-E-Weizen (no, I didn't spell it wrong - it's their twist on a traditional Hefeweizen)  Thanks to the Busted Sandal for keeping boring guys (such as myself) who aren't on the latest quest for IPAs or sours in mind.  Love your brews bro!!!

reviews.author: Rosamaria E.
reviews.description: From top left to right: El Despierto, Jeffweizen, Blueberry Wheat,  Pank Drank Raspberry,  Fire Pit Wit,  Tropic Rot Pineapple Coconut,  Mexican Lager,  Pomegranate Wit,  Tangerine Wit

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: $3 dollar beers on friday's, ugly sweater parties, small room. Dedicated to making its patrons happy with specials all the time. Bring a pint glass, as they sometimes have specials for just bringing your own pint glass. Lively anniversary parties with food trucks and special glasses for anniversaries. I highly recommend getting their early on weekends as their is parking, but far if the main spots are filled. The bathroom is always cleaning and the tour is quick as it is a small but fun packing location.  I like when people are on beer tours from outside the city and provide a varied insight on the drinks. The beers are often on specials on the wall so be sure to stop by and check out the board. They take cash or card.

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: I'm constantly on the hunt for new beers.  So while down in San Antonio for work, I did a drive-by on the beer aisle at the nearby HEB.  One of the beers that caught my eye was Busted Sandal Slippery Rock IPA.  I wish I'd kept walking.  While it tasted like an IPA, it was flat as a pancake.  The cans felt firm when I bought the beer, but lost pressure when I chilled them.  Even a rough pour into a pint glass resulted in no significant head.   What a disappointment...  Too many microbreweries may have great beer inhouse, but they will fail if they can't keep the quality control in their canning operations.

reviews.author: Vanessa V.
reviews.description: This place was legit amazing! Small but super fun and informative staff! We ordered the flight and clicked the check in and even got 1$ off one pint ! Really impressed and will definitely be coming back for another Sunday funday !

reviews.author: Stacy G.
reviews.description: Love this brewery. It was my second time visiting! They were out of one of the beers I wanted to try but all the other ones were great! One recommendation is I wish they had food or snacks to munch on while you're enjoying their pretty large flights of beer. All the employees I've met there have been more than helpful! Will be returning for my next beer flight soon!

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: I'm a brewery connoisseur, I love all things brewed. Busted Sandal was a spot I stumbled upon miraculously, by the help of the beer gods I'm sure. It's a little hidden gem off of  Fredicksberg and 410, like many in that area. It's a small brewery but very unique indeed. I love the vibes and of course the beer options on tap. Their IPA's are off the chain but the Mexican lager is not too bad it self. The hospitality is top notch and I had a good time with the regulars and bartender. It was a great way to spend a Sunday afternoon.   My first sample was Finding Friday Mexican Lager their most popular according to Mandy. It's a smooth lighter option but with a nice finish in taste.   Next was the Slippery Rock IPA, which I'm a IPA lover hands down and it was not too hoppy just the right amount of hops and flavor was good for me.   After my fav was the Wine Barre, so unique and different definitely a brine taste that wine has with a beer finish. You have to try it to understand.   Lastly was the Hop Dong IPA, a good way to end the brew adventure and left me wanting more.   I will be returning for the rest of the beers on tap and to visit my new friends. Awesome brewing experience I highly recommend for a cozy low key spot.

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: Kind of hidden. Kind of hard to find the first time. Very small location. Excellent customer service and bartender was great. I liked how they also offered wine as a drink option. Looks like they are building a 2nd part. We sat in the 2nd part, in the dark, with a fan pointed at us. The chairs aren't too comfortable, as some were falling apart. Prices were great. Need to add more restrooms once they expand.

reviews.author: Lee O.
reviews.description: Currently at time of this review: they're doing impromptu beer tours. Nice clean facilities and they can their own and distribute the beer from here! They just started serving beer flights 7/7/18 -9 beers for $15, what a steal! Also they have pint glasses $5 with $3pint refills on Thursdays (hint hint). They serve half pints too and barefoot wine for the winos. Momo and the Staff was so super friendly, homey and even got to meet the brewers who took care to explain each beer! Great selection of beers-I am partial to the porter, Mexican lager, and fire pit wit. Their 210 ale is akin to miller but heftier, aromatic and zillion times better! Can't comment on the IPAs since I'm not an IPA drinker. Watermelon ale was very aromatic, fruity yet light since they use real watermelon and there is high turnover so try it while you can. It's easy to drink if you like fruity beers.   Getting there: when you turn on Oaklawn and see the busted sandal sign it shows a right arrow, but really it's an IMMEDIATE RIGHT AND RIGHT hook around to it.   What a cute little place that is expanding! I never knew it existed so close to me until now as I am leaving SA! They're going to expand the bar area to eventually 20taps and a hang out area. Look out for their anniversary brew in August using a special TX plant!! I really hope they keep their homey feel. Lots of room to grow -looking forward to seeing them the next time I'm in TX! Loved it! (Check out my pix of the place!)

reviews.author: Sandra T.
reviews.description: First time here, wasn't THAT hard to find smh. Immediately greeted by one of the nicest gal ever-Ruby.  Wanted to get a good variety, so we went for the flight, which imh was a deal! They are expanding their digs and am looking forward to many more visits. My faves were Slippery Rock, Hop Dong and Finding Friday Mexican Lager. The hubster enjoyed El Gourdo, El Robusto and La Fittes.

reviews.author: Joe P.
reviews.description: Small tap room but good beer and friendly ambiance. Meaghan did a great job of connecting and although she is new to beer she made a big effort to speak of how she's learned to appreciate it. Mario showed up later and filled in the gaps. The Robusto Porter is the best option but the IPAs and the Mexican Lager were pretty good as well.

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: This place is great. We just happened to drive past the sign and decided to check it out. The door doesn't say what their Sunday hours are but they were open and the bartender, Moses, invited us right in. We ordered a flight of 9 beers for $15 to begin with. The bartender was very informative in explaining each brew to us. We even got to try a new one that they didn't have on the menu yet. Both owners showed up during our visit. One had a good conversation with us about the beers and the other gave us a tour. This brewery is small but they are expanding and renovating. I'm pretty sure we just became regulars.

reviews.author: Ann D.
reviews.description: Great beer and great people! Love the El Robusto porter, Finding Friday Mexican lager, Jeffeweizen Hefeweizen, 210 Ale and especially Vigo the Carpathian imperial stout. Great food trucks and fun crowd! Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Marcus P.
reviews.description: This is a great location for a cold beer hanging out with friends an making it your new bar if you like the great tasting  beer of busted sandal then this is gonna be your go to spot a brewery with great staff incredibly low prices on the drinks  Don't think twice go it's a great place you won't regret it plus yelpers you will love checking in here you get a discount on first check in

reviews.author: Payal P.
reviews.description: This was a difficult place to find. It looks a bit sketchy when you park, but the inside is nice and intimate.  It's a small place but welcoming. They have a variety options that are reasonably priced and good.  Worth a check out for a flight experience if you are in the area.

name: Southerleigh Fine Food and Brewery
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Matthew H.
reviews.description: I love this place. Great location at the pearl. The wait staff are friendly and the food is amazing. When they found out I was military they gave a 15% discount. I didn't even ask, they asked me which is cool. I would recommend this place to anyone and will def. be coming back.

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
reviews.description: Everything about this dinner was lovely other than them running out I'd the snapper cheeks and frozen rose.   Came here with girlfriends after enjoying the holiday shopping festival ...which was beautiful scenery and atmosphere. You got to love this location to people watch or even inside where the industrial architecture gives a heat vibe to dine.  I loved that I was able to make reservation on my app and we were seated right away and I get points!!  The girls ordered the pineapple cocktail which I'm told was crispy, fruity and delicious on a warmer night. I just can't eat pineapple like that. I settled for a red wine since they were out of the watermelon frozen rose or any of the frozen drinks that night. I must say the Quest (?) red blend was an excellent choice and I'm glad the waiter offered to let me sample a couple wines to get one I liked.
