We all ordered the half chicken which came with tiger spice and a white bbq sauce. This was my first time experiencing a white bbq sauce and must say it was a flop. None of us like it as we couldn't get past the look of ranch but the taste for me didn't hit the mark for bbq sauce. However, the he tiger spicy sauce is . My only feedback is I wish it had a fresh out the grease hot fried temperature which it didn't. Very good though.  Sides: cornbread, green beans, grits and I tried the watermelon salad. All were worth it but the watermelon salad could have used some kind of acid or vinaigrette on the dry lettuce in the bowl. It really was just like eating 5 cook slices of watermelon and not sure if I'd get this again for the price.   Overall, perfect location, beautiful scenery inside and out, prime spot for people watching out to courtyard and moderate prices, solid portions. I like this location better than the Rim and the menu. I do think gumbo should be offered in both locations.

reviews.author: MatouÅ¡ P.
reviews.description: We have always enjoyed this establishment. Made a reservation for 230pm on a Tuesday. This is during their all day menu time, yet all they were offering was the very limited brunch menu that is an disappointment compared to the regular menu.  We triple checked the website and it still says the all day menu during this time.   I guess they are short staffed and cannot manage the whole menu. We were they decide to do this for a few days. Huh?

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: We have always gone to Southerleigh the Saturday before Christmas - last year we almost walked out due to the attitude of the host - this year  we did .  Granted we booked for 6 but added one more - but as they were  already trying to squeeze 6 of us at a small table designed for 5 or less which is never comfortable and always too cramped , they refused however not in a polite or acceptable way.  I coupe have dealt with the inability to accommodate us and I get they have policies and we added one more BUT what I could nor deal with was the rude, condescending attitude of the host! She is one of that rudest people I have met on my life! Honey - you are a host - not a CEO!! Kindness and manners have are an asset that will get you far in life ! Within a seconds of us arriving she fired back with a rude, aggressive demeanor and even went after my kids! She did offer to sit us outside - in a storm.  Everyone should be treated equally and nicely and certainly not talked to like that by an hourly employee that thinks way too highly of herself.  She ruined a tradition that we have had for many years and as my husband and I both have taken many business associates here over the years and hosted corporate events - I highly doubt if I will be back as the customer service has been declining the last few years !  Even if they had a table - that's enough for me to walk!  So we went to the Boiler House that has table and people with a smile!

reviews.author: Melissa I.
reviews.description: My visit to The Southerleigh could quite possibly be the best experience for me thus far in San Antonio!! Touring the hotel, seeing the beautiful decor, and then followed by some of the most delicious food and drink...you can't go wrong spending some time here for lunch, dinner, or even just drinks!   The pineapple mimosas were hands down the most delicious thing.

reviews.author: Gustavo R.
reviews.description: Southerleigh's Famous Pressure Fried Chicken | Ok... Ok... I have to start with this one dish because it was absolutely AMAZING! As I exclaimed to everyone around me at my table, THIS is the greatest dish of fried chicken I've ever had.. and I've had a LOT of chicken! I'd go back to San Antonio (and I'm currently trying to find an excuse to do so) just to take my girlfriend and try this chicken again. Fried to perfection, a light crisp around the brim of the chicken encapsulates the flavorfully juicy inner meat. PLUS - that combo sauce (tiger sauce) added on adds a nice n light kick to the already champion-of-a-dish. Highest recommendations - this is what made my night. A must-get.   Fried Frog Legs | Now, this appetizer stands out from the rest! It was my first time trying frog legs - and let me tell you... I'd try them again! Absolutely fantastic preparation for a unique dish. Thinking of trying them for the first time too? It's like perfectly-fried pieces of gator. The aioli included really adds another dimension to the flavor as well. Check this one out!   Wood Fired Pretzel | This app is to be as expected - a great wood fired Bavarian pretzel. Not my cup of tea, but if you're wanting some "bread for the table," this can make do. I'd say go for some of the more unique flavors Southerleigh has instead - like the Frog Legs or Oysters!   East Coast Oysters | Wonderfully prepared - Southerleigh's Oyster prep goes a long way - long enough for me to actually forget my initially bad experience at another restaurant trying oysters for the first time. Love of oysters didn't happen to me at first sight - so this second encounter really had a positive impact. Highly recommend for oyster advocates and first time samplers!   Classic Meatloaf | A companion at my table ordered this dish - let me tell you, it's quite large.. be hungry and beware! He says it was rather good - but was jealous of my fried chicken.   Cracker Crusted Gulf Redfish | If you don't end up choosing the fried chicken I keep advocating for, then go with this dish right here. Southerleigh does a masterful job in frying their foods to perfection. With a light outer layer entry, you are taken on a deep-sea dive into the gulf of mexico with a flavor explosion from the adventure that is the Gold Redfish. Fantastic second place entrÃ©e in my opinion!   Beer | A majority of the brews they have to offer are brewed in-house which is pretty cool. They have a variety of quite unique flavors! Looking to try something different? The "It's Just Red" has a very unique flavor that I've never tried before. Let me tell you thought - half my table enjoyed it, half enjoyed just tasting it - but couldn't finish it. It has a fruity kick - almost sour if I recall correctly. I enjoyed the Gold Export Lager! It was very balanced and smooth and has that home-brew essence you may just be looking for.   With great and quick customer service for out large party, fun rustic ambience, delicious apps, historic foundations, and a brewery / top-notch bar, it should make sense as to why Southerleigh is an experience not to be missed. It's also located in the coolest part of town - the historic Pearl District! Fun tip: checkout the attached Pearl hotel - the rustic architecture and speak-easy steampunk vibe make it one of a kind. Check, check, check it out!

reviews.author: Eunice C.
reviews.description: Walked into Hotel Emma and to the left is Southerleigh. My friend took us here as out of town visitors. Sat down as per our reservation and ordered deviled eggs to start and our drinks. Since we were at a brewery, I ordered beer. If you like sours, I recommend the "Gimme Some Mora". Tastes light for early drinking. Deviled eggs complement well with the sweet bacon jam.   One of us rarely has seafood so we made the bold move of ordering oysters and scallops to share, to expand her taste horizons! Scallops were a bit on the well-seasoned side for me but in small quantities, it was divine. Not overcooked so it was very plump. Oysters were also fresh and well shucked. Though not a seafood exactly, we also went for the southern delicacy of frog legs. I'm not familiar with the baseline of frog leg texture but we felt it tasted like a cross between chicken and fish, so an amphibian. We added a house salad to balance our meal.   The end but also the highlight of this lovely lunch is the fried chicken. The fried chicken was so juicy and deliciously amazing that I wish I could bring it back home. The skin is perfection! The provided sauces highlighted the foods rather than covering it's flavor.

reviews.author: Antonia M.
reviews.description: Southerleigh's will go down as one of my favorite stops in San Antonio. The waitstaff was excellent as well as the food. I had the chicken sandwich, it was made grilled. It was the best grilled chicken sandwich ever. EVER. Since my fries came out a wee bit later, they brought me the complimentary best macaroni and cheese ever. Ever. My little party of foodies and I enjoyed every bit of our stop here for a late lunch. Oh, the portions were ginormous btw.

reviews.author: Kimberly G.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times for brunch and it's definitely not a bad spot to hit up while at The Pearl. I got the Carolina Gold Rice Grits because I'm always tempted by browned butter and fried sage, but I will have to say that this particular dish didn't necessarily hit the flavor marks. The browned butter was more clarified, and the few bits of sage didn't have any standout flavor. The rice grits were truly rice and the entire dish lacked flavor: Crystal's hot sauce and salt and pepper to save the day. Egg was poached perfectly. I'm not bashing the dish in any sense, because I had high hopes for it, but it could've used some major flavoring. Maybe back to the drawing board with this one. Other than that, lovely restaurant, pleasant service.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: I have never had a bad meal  at Southerleigh. The cornbread is so good that you will think about slapping your whole family. It's my mum's favorite cornbread to eat. The service has always be great. The 1/2 pound burger was cooked perfectly and it was delicious. It comes with a bacon jam that is fabulous. It makes the burger better.   The beer selection is very good. There is something for everyone. The beer selection changes often. If you are at Southerleigh's and they have Godzilla Go Juice available you must get it. It's a sake beer. The Eggnostic beer is excellent as well. Both are worth the money. This place is a must if you have not tried them.

reviews.author: Rawad M.
reviews.description: UPDATE: I went there again and had a Very very bad experience with this restaurant.   1- we waited about an hour to get a table outside, then they sat us inside. When we asked to be seated outside we had to wait extra 5-10 mins  2- After we sat outside, and ordered we waited for like an hour for our food then the manager comes in and tell us our food will need an extra 15 mins to get out.  3- When the food came in, it was terrible. Cold food, dry. Very bad experience.   Unfortunately, I had a bad experience with this restaurant. I've been here few times but this time was just the worst. The manager Scott tried his best to make it up for us, I definitely appreciate his help and effort

reviews.author: Jackie K.
reviews.description: Southerleight Fine Food and Brewery offers great very upscale bar-type of food.  I loved the deviled eggs, and the fried chicken was super juicy and crispy at the same time, delicious!  The only item I didn't like was the "smothered" green beans (smothered in a tomato sauce)--maybe that's just not my thing.  We got a table on the patio overlooking the Pearl brewery complex main green space, and it's a good spot for people watching entertainment!

reviews.author: Rachel B.
reviews.description: We had a reservation and were seated immediately. Service was good. Food was outstanding! We had the scallops with spinach. Very rich with flavor. I even ate the rice and I am not typically a rice fan. We also had the fried chicken. Very hot and cooked to perfection. Not too greasy. The mac and cheese was good, tasted like velveeta. The only thing we didn't care for were the green beans. Just not a tomato fan and that's what's used with them. The highlight was the fresh, raw oysters. Delightful! They were fresh and offered a variety to choose from.

reviews.author: Lisa H.
reviews.description: 3.5 stars  Service was a bit uneven. The building is beautifully restored - this restaurant is in an historic building which share space with the elegant Hotel Emma.  They didn't have much variety for fresh oysters at 5pm so we decided to skip those and did try the seafood salad...which is decent - a bit underdressed - so we asked for a side in addition...it really needed something else to perk it up. Perhaps more salt/acid/anchovy? Something not there...  For fun we ordered the antelope tartare which was oddly pretty satisfying. Very lean chopped meat on bottom with a drier version of chopped egg salad on top with a very nice complement of thin seedless pickled jaleopeno slices on top. Served with crackers. Definitely worth trying.   The fried chicken coming out of the kitchen looked delish but we didn't try it.  The Pearl Historic District where this is located is fun to wander around...there is a good farmer's market here on Sundays as well.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Follow me on FB and IG: GoodEatsInSA   @southerleigh at @historicpearl serves some of the best #deviledeggs and #friedoysters in SA!  The deviled eggs are so addicting and I had to remind myself to slow down and leave some for the others at the table haha  The fried oysters were served in a ToGo container so the steam softened the crust (which is expected) but they were still really flavorful and delicious.   #GoodEatsInSA #GoodDrinksInSA #SAFoodPics #SanAntonio #SATX #PowerLunch #PowerDinner #Food #Meal #YelpElite #SAYelp #SANightLife #Yelp #SABestFoodPics

reviews.author: Jessie C.
reviews.description: I can't wait to go back to San Antonio soon just so I can come back to Southerleigh's. Especially for a landlocked city, their seafood selection was fantastic.  The decor is this beautiful steampunk-industrial style. Our group was seated in one of the booths overlooking the Pearl lawn - great view and very comfy seating! Our server was great - I don't remember his name, but he was extremely tall and gave us honest feedback about all the dishes and his personal recommendations, and he definitely didn't steer us wrong. I got the Peach Perfect to drink - the Tajin rim was the perfect contrast to the sweetness of the frozen peach. For my entree, I had the cracker crusted redfish - it was cooked to flaky perfection, and the generous pile of blue crab meat and lemon butter sauce added incredible flavor.   I have to give a special shout out to the HOUSE SALAD though - I normally have little to no expectations for starter salads when I eat out, but this one has completely elevated the bar for me forever. No joke, this is the best salad I've ever had - The black garlic ranch, crispy croutons, and sweet pickles are literally the best flavor combination of all time. It was so good, we ordered a second salad for the table. I've literally dreamt of eating this salad again and if/when I come back to Southerleighs, I'll probably just order two for myself and call it a day.

reviews.author: M. Spencer H.
reviews.description: We came here for brunch after funeral services. The staff was amazing and handled our large party so well. The food was fantastic and so good that I forgot to take photos before I dove in to the deliciousness. I had the crispy chicken sandwich and loved it. I highly recommend the Mac and cheese it has this amazing flavor and seasoning that truly sets it apart from any other Mac and cheese I've ever had.

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Southerleigh is a great place for brunch vibes! It is located downtown at the heart of The Pearl. They have indoor and outdoor seating but I love sitting outside because I love seeing all the dogs that walk by especially on days with the farmer market going on.   I ordered the steak rancheros and my girlfriend got the waffle. For me, my eggs were cooked perfectly but my steak was just a bit over. The steak was seasoned well, the salsa had the right amount of acidity to go along with the eggs, steak, and potatoes to create the perfect bite.  They also have a wide selection of beers and you can get a full bottle order of champagne for your Sunday afternoon mimosas.   Their brunch menu is a bit limited for brunch and I am not sure if it changes seasonally but it is a great place to enjoy some brunch while taking in the vibes of The Pearl.

reviews.author: Emily M.
reviews.description: This place was awesome, really good customer service! The food was so so good fresh and tasty. They serve you like sharing portions. We ate outside and it was really nice. Definitely recommend me to go. Will be going back

reviews.author: Corey L.
reviews.description: Went here for lunch, a great spot in the Pearl. The waiter was very kind and funny. The wife and I had a great day date. The food was very filling and defined worth the price.  The building is very cool and you can see all the brewery equipment. We will go back again.

name: The Hoppy Monk
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Amanda G.
reviews.description: My son loved his burger and said it was the best ever. The gastropub aps are on point. We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Johanna O.
reviews.description: I've been coming to this restaurant/bar for five years now. they have a unique menu, outstanding cocktails and an extensive beer menu.  It has one of the best patios on the north side and they often had music on the weekends, although I can't be sure as of recent times because I have not been here on a weekend lately.  I absolutely love the wings, burgers and fries. They do offer some very unique items on the menu but I'm sad to say that I was disappointed when trying something different recently; namely the drunken mussels pasta. The description sounds amazing but in my humble opinion, it is spaghetti with mussels (still in their shells) in a very watery/brothy sauce with spices.  It seems like they are going for a Ramen type dish, but it was a big miss for me.  They were kind enough to exchange it for a burger though.  Highly recommend this place for ambiance, drinks and staple menu items.

reviews.author: Ct M.
reviews.description: My family and I had dinner and drinks here. All was good - food and drinks. I thoroughly enjoyed their classic margarita with tajin on the rim. Only issue we were overcharged for items we didn't order.   This seems to be happening more and more with places that have the pay pads at the table verses letting you see an actual receipt and then making payment.   They made it right but good thing I looked at the receipt once home. *receipt is not emailed until about an hour after payment was made at venue.

reviews.author: Jamie W.
reviews.description: Hoppy Monk visit...  After a hiatus,  we thought Hoppy Monk would be a great spot for a small family gathering.  What a pleasant surprise to find a major improvement to the parking situation with a new under-cover structure, and probably double the parking the last time we visited.   That was big on our visit during Happy Hour on a Friday,  as their parking lot was packed!  We took our two Pups with us and immediately found a table on their spacious and well-appointed patio.   What a great feel Hoppy Monk has with all the groups, friends and families enjoying the great fall weather and Hoppy Monk's great craft food and drinks.  There were plenty of pleasant servers who looked like they were happy to be there.... in stark contrast to so many places these days.    Their drink menu is amazing with pages of craft beers and handcrafted cocktail options.  The Spirits section is several pages long. They have an actual drink and food menu just for "Hoppy Hour"! Their overall menu has continued to evolve and while we ended up just ordering a bunch of appetizers on our visit, I found 5 or 6 new menu items I've got to try.  Put it on my Holiday checklist.  Great to see Hoppy Monk doing well!  5+ Stars

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: Favorites were the gochujang cauliflower wings. My husband declared that this in the best cauliflower he's ever eaten. Brussels sprouts were also delicious. I couldn't get enough of that gochujang sauce so I ordered the actual chicken wings. I think I liked the cauliflower better because there was a lightness to it. Regardless, their gochujang is very concentrated, spicier and not as sweet as most places.  Rabbit tacos were cumin-y and tasty. I didn't expect to get that earthiness. The whole taco was just delightful. The elote fritters were also quite tasty according to our friend.  Wasn't a huge fan of the mushrooms, but the sauces (red pepper and walnut) definitely added some needed flair.  We had an awesome server and we also had leftovers!  Can't wait to dig in then come back for more  Se ate the leftovers and came back the next day.  The cheeseboard was delicious.

reviews.author: Tom C.
reviews.description: Having visited their location in El Paso, I was very excited to be staying close to this location.  I still have daydreams of the Gochu wings and seemingly endless beer selection that I encountered previously. This location didn't let me down either: excellent personal service, good food and so much beer to choose from that if you set the glasses end to end they would circle the Earth 7 times. I might be exaggerating that last one. Yelp needs more hyperbole. Let's just say you have plenty to choose from.    This time I really branched out and went with the Gochu chicken sandwich. That sauce is as good as I remember, and I really like how they used whole boneless chicken thighs. Very good. Also good were the side of   Macha brussel sprouts. The light honey and almond touches really made these dynamite.    I won't go too much into the beer choices. Let's just say you're good. Get a flight and try a few. Your mom isn't watching. Unless you are having lunch with your mom. Just make sure she has a beer too so she won't give you that judgmental look and tell you again how you are drinking too much and why is it that you never finished college, and shouldn't you have children by now? God mom, just let me live my life!    I'm sorry, where was I? Oh, this is a good place. Go enjoy it.

reviews.author: Cristian T.
reviews.description: I brought my girlfriend here for her birthday. This is a great place to have some good burgers and drinks. They have a huge drink menu. The waiters are very attentive.

reviews.author: Sara H.
reviews.description: I was pleasantly surprised when the GM Joseph personally reached out to apologize and welcome us back. Its nice to see management that cares about our experience and their business...I look forward to a second try and will leave an update when I do...

reviews.author: Jessie A.
reviews.description: We have been here before, once before the pandemic for St. Patrick and live music, once earlier this year just for drinks and apps. The beer list is decent for San Antonio. We ordered the fish and chips, the Trappist mushrooms and Mac and cheese. The cheese sauce looked watery but I liked it. It's not a huge plate, so if you have an appetite get something with it. The batter on the mushrooms was excellent, very flavorful. This is a huge portion, definitely shareable. You get a choice of aioli: I got citrus and umami. I loved the umami, didn't care for the citrus.  If you like fish and chips, I would skip it here. The batter was bland. Even Tartar sauce wouldn't help. The fries might have been good, but they were cold by the time we got ketchup. Maybe they should use the batter from the mushrooms for the fish. As is the case at most places, they seemed short handed. The server was nice enough but over extended. And the folks running out his drinks kept taking them to the wrong tables. They may need to rethink their process there. I would have liked to try their duck tacos, but I guess they don't do this anymore. Parking is kind of wonky and the lot is kind of chewed up. It was seat yourself and there is outdoor as well as indoor seating. The outdoor tables can be pretty worn, but the inside is opened up, sitting nice weather, so that is a nice option.

reviews.author: Norm L.
reviews.description: I found this place near the hotel I was staying and decided to come here and try the food.  There is an outside sitting area you pass through to get to one of the entries. It was relaxed, people were conversing, and the music wasn't too loud.  I took a seat inside and the architecture looked reminded of an old church house.  I ordered the Duchesse burger with fries.  The bun was soft and nothing like a burger bun. The meat was flavorful and juicy.  I would highly recommend getting a burger.  There was lots of beer selections as whiskey too if you are looking for a good craft beer selection.

reviews.author: Nels N.
reviews.description: Outstanding selection of beers and hard liquor. Brussels sprouts were excellent. Entrees are a bit of a hit or miss. Overall food was also good and service great. Bit pricey though, butI would go back.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: Hoppy Monk. - I love you - I really do! Love your food, Iove the beer, love the atmosphere!!   We have made multiple visits in the last few weeks, we have even introduced friends to you as it's just a fun place to go.  Today we enjoyed the Guacamole - this is freshly made and delicious ! We also had Shrimp Po Boy ( husband said it was one of the best he has ever had ) and Shrimp Aguachile with some IPAs . They have a great rotating beer list with beers you often cannot find on tap anywhere else on this city!  We sat inside as the doors were open to the patio so you get the best of both world  - but patio is also always great  and loved the music !!  Will be back again soon!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Nice patio area. Our waiter was excellent. Beer flights, good food and a place that's dog friendly outside. I ordered the blue fox burger and fries, absolutely delicious  Will definitely go again if I'm on the Northside.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: Listen up folks, if you haven't gone here. This is your sign to come thru. I am impressed by the selection of drinks this bar can make and the beer they serve. They literally have like 5 pages on their drink menu because they have everything! And don't forget they also have really good food. Like delectable food, something when you go to a bar like setting the food is average, but this place - food is immaculate. Highly recommend the elite, they put the corn in a ball with cheese and some batter and somehow fry is so it comes out has a hushpuppy-like appetizer. Presentation is great! The other appetizer to try is the brussel sprouts. It's sweet, tangy, crunchy, and has a little kick. It's also topped with thinly sliced apples. It's really good, so be sure to order the full size for the table. They also have plenty of seating inside and outside. I went during lunch and there were lots of people. I also like the music they play here, super mellow easy going, and radiates positive vibes. Come one, come all - this place is a treat!

reviews.author: Ben F.
reviews.description: There was an hour long line at the chain gift card place we were originally going to, so we walked off the beaten path and found a monk with some great food, service, and environment! We had the Trappist mushrooms with citrus and red pepper aioli, the chickwich, a bacon cheeseburger, and Brussels spouts. Everything was amazing! And the fries come in a chicken beak (see picture). Chicken purse agreed with us that this place rocks!

reviews.author: Nanda K.
reviews.description: Me, my friend and his father in law stopped by at this place after we played tennis. The place had outdoor and indoor seating.  We liked the outdoor seating. Nice place to hang out with friends.  I believe Joshua was our server and he was good. Guacamole with bean nachos I believe - 5/5 Cauliflower wings - 4/5 ( it was a bit sweet but was ok to share) Beer flight sampler - 3/5 ( I am not a fan of beer and didn't feel anything great about it) French Fries - 5/5 Long Island ice tea - 4/5 ( it was different from other Long Island teas it had a strong essence on a herb in it, not sure what it was) Coconut and raspberry Ice cream - 5/5 ( it was nice and tasty)  Will definitely visit this place for again. Nice hanging spot which was very pleasant. Staff was very friendly.

reviews.author: FerrisTheBulldog O.
reviews.description: I haven't been here since Covid, but so glad we came back. Drinks and food are better than I remember. Service was outstanding, the restaurant was clean and ambiance is lovely.   Highly recommend the Paloma and the chicken wings!

reviews.author: Esther H.
reviews.description: I typically don't eat burgers at restaurant and decided to try this one and it was delicious it was Duchess burger ..service as well was very welcoming

reviews.author: Rachel M.
reviews.description: Been going since it opened and this place is still our #1. Tonight we had amazing service from Jovanna. One of the other female servers even gave our kids stickers which was so appreciated, as we've worked hard on their behavior to be able to take them places like this instead of your louder family restaurants. Loved the rabbit tacos and brunch menu. Truly a gem of a restaurant.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: First time in and thought it was decent. Drinks were made well and everything came out quickly. The Fish and Chips were fantastic and the Wings were amazing. My only issue was with the Ribeye sandwich. It was well put together but the steak had no flavor at all.. No seasoning and just a taste of oil. Couldn't even taste the aioli. Steak was tender and cooked medium rare though. Just disappointed about the lack of seasoning and flavor for the price.. I mean the sandwich came with no side and was $30 with the option for extra meat. Even if the sandwich was spot on that would be still on the very high side for a sandwich. I will definitely come back and give it another go. I do like most of what I had and the place is very nice and dog friendly as well.. Just that damn sandwich lol.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Very cool place. Kind of weird location but this center is awesome! Has a pizzeria, meat market, and a Korean restaurant (reservation only).  Had a few of their beers, the pickle one and the ipa...and a pretzel.  BEST PRETZEL IN MY LIFE!!  Go there and order a pretzel and a beer at a minimum, you won't regret it. They also have beer that reaches 12% alcohol.  I'm coming back!!

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: Add another great brewery to the Alamo City.   This one, located on the near East Side, has a wide selection of solid beers that are surely to please any taste.  Been several times and been super impressed with their beers, even bought several of their limited releases (if you didn't get their version of Bourbon Barrel Aged Black is Beautiful or their Puro San Antonio, you MISSED OUT).  They also have panini for sale in case you get the beer munchies.  If a panino, is not your thing, there's other several businesses next door that also sell food  This brewery is located in such a nice spot that it's on my regular rotation of places to have a some good suds.  You can drink indoors or outdoors, at pease and just chill with or without your significant other, friends, or dog.    Also worth noting, this brewery participated in proving, clean, safe, drinking water during Snowmaggedon, even outside of their normal taproom hours.  The community appreciates it!

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: It is refreshing to have another craft brewery in San Antonio to not only compete with the other breweries in the area.  This place though is one of the best. Small, personable and fun.  The employees do a really good job suggesting beers that they have on tap.    I think I have mentioned a couple of times that I like dark beers, they have a number of stouts on tap and the Mint stout by far was the best.  I also had a pint of their copper and it was refreshing to end the evening with a finishing beer.    Thanks Black lab for such a great evening.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: I hope when this reaches you Covid-19 would've been a fleeting memory. We all would be maskless carrying on with our lives as if nothing ever happened. However we don't live in Disneyland and instability is our new reality. Consistency is King, a currency few businesses  carry. Not only is this exhibited through its product but also by its service. As the pandemic wears on us the need to find meaningful experiences in the midst of chaos is increasing.  I will say I feel for the Black Laboratory Brewing  opening in the same year as the coronavirus continues to disrupt our lives. A lesser brewery would've surely folded. Instead they continue to consistently put out the city's finest craft products with service to match. Seeing their transition moving their sample beers from local businesses to flowing taps speaks volumes of their resiliency.  Before I write any further turning this into a  barrel aged review I should state what I liked about this brewery to include a few minor critiques. The taproom itself is in a small business co-op. Depending on the time of day you go parking can be limited. I've already gone on numerous occasions and their beers alongside their service is what keeps me coming back. Each time I have gone brewmasters are always willing to explain what's on tap with accompanying samples. The whole Black Lab team are extremely friendly, passionate and this reflects in every beer made.  For example I've tried their "Black is Beautiful" imperial stout up to my most recent visit with their "Updog", a triple ipa so potent it could take down an Imperial Snow-walker. If you're into lighter fare I've had their "Grapefruit and Chill" a  beer you need to drink with Jimmy Buffet blaring whilst rocking a Hawaiian tshirt. The diversity in their styles means there is something for everyone. Again consistency across the board seems to be the call of the day.    If I may add a few critiques it would be in available space and onsite taplists. Firstly it is a very small brewpub. As a result of the pandemic patrons are opting more to sit outdoors. This can be problematic. Since seating is shared with other businesses tables can fill up quickly. I've already had owners in adjoining spots give me the ojo. In addition on the each patio table is an online menu. Upon scanning it it takes you to their taplist via their website. In the future I hope they make a menu exclusively for when you visit as they rotate their list readily. While these are small critiques that are not dealbreakers, at least not to me. In the end consistent product and great service are really any place's calling card in these precarious times.   As a craft beer enthusiast, a patron of the world I know we have been on this long manic ride since March. We've seen iconic businesses that we would've never imagined closing are now leaving for good. The simple act of leaving our homes has new implications. The question that seems to not have a real answer: How do we support local businesses and still maintain best practices? I don't know. All I can tell you if you're looking for an oasis from these claustrophobic, home cocoon, anxiety-ridden and Zoom fatigue times please head out to the Black Lab for some liquid therapy.  ps. Don't forget to get a pizza from Truth Pizzeria next door to go with your beer! That way you get in your cardio workout.

reviews.author: Eileen R.
reviews.description: Super creative, super delicious beers. Good number of styles to choose from, each very unique.  Stopped in on a whim, will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Absolutely love This spot, nice pizza location next door, friendly staff, outdoor and in door dining with other food options and fantastic regular beers on tap PLUS special brews throughout the year

reviews.author: Roxanne K.
reviews.description: I adore local brew! I'd been meaning to stop here it's been so hot! I got off work early and slid into this little Hackberry mall. I got the Mox IPA and it was very smooth so I ordered a 6 pack to go. I ordered a pizza next door and then sat down for a beer while I waited. The people here are super chill and great customer service! Support local

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: East side nanobrewin'!  These guys are running a pretty tight operation. They have storefront in a newly opened strip shopping center. It looks like the old building was a big service garage or something that they've turned into a strip shopping center. With a pizza shop next door, it's the perfect combination! You can get your beer here, a pizza from next door, and bazinga! The pizza seems a better option that the paninis that these guys are offering. They share a patio, which is dog friendly.  My only complaint about this brewery is that they didn't have a menu that you could take back to the table and pour over. They sent me to the one on the phone (mine was dead and needed charging) or go to the one pasted on the door. I opted for the one on the outside door, but had the hardest time reading it since people kept coming and going through the door while I was blocking it trying to read the menu. Derp.  They don't serve beer in glass here. Apparently they don't have the right kind of stuff yet to do so, so it's all in plastic cups, which seems kinda wasteful. The flights are served up in a bunch of tiny disposable plastic cups.  The beers I had were decent- especially the core beers that they seem to sell all the time. Bindi Blonde Ale was my fav, it's a good beer for drinking on their hot patio in the shade. I like that they also do some crazier, far out beers as well, such as minty or fruited milkshake IPAs. The service was fast and friendly, and you could tell that the ones pouring up the beer knew their stuff and were able to talk about what they were pouring articulately! I liked everything I had on the flight!

reviews.author: Raechel T.
reviews.description: A++ I could not have been more impressed with how they're handling the Covid Crisis. They have signs and tape up so you aren't close to anyone.  It's completely touch free.  I can't wait until this craziness is over and I can sit and enjoy their beer with some pizza from a place that's in the same strip center.  My favorite beer so far is Jeff Jams v1.  So much flavor!

reviews.author: Sarah V.
reviews.description: It was good the beer. I had the puro San Antonio beer with chamoy pickle juice and cherry koolaid. It was a sweet pale ale   Tjeu also have stouts and other ales as well

reviews.author: Kris W.
reviews.description: Enjoyed the special release "Love is in the Ale" and my hubby had the blonde. Had a really big selection to choose from as well as paninis if you are hungry. We had already eaten, so didn't try.

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Pros: great location, friendly staff, good beer, definitely get a burger next door to go with your great beer, military discount Cons: the people next to us have pizza that looks a amazing, and I do not.  (No real cons)  Put it on your list. Go check this place out.

reviews.author: Scott G.
reviews.description: Since this whole Covid apocalypse had happened I have been wanting to try black laboratory brewing for the longest time. Now that they are all allowing people into the taproom I decided to go down today to check them out. It is a very tiny place but there is an indoor and outdoor seating area which accommodates everybody who was there. The beer is fantastic! I am very critical of new places in San Antonio that brew beer at this place got it right. I had three beers and took an additional two 4packs home as well as two crowlers. I cannot recommend this place enough.

reviews.author: Chris S.
reviews.description: :)  Supporting local businesses during the quarantine.   We got a three pack and their brews are EXCELLENT.

reviews.author: Mike V.
reviews.description: If you like craft beer, this brewery should be on your list if you are in the area. The four beers I had (Black Is Beautiful, Hot Chancla, Mox's IPA, and Plumberry Soft Serve) were all very good. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable. I learned they opened right before COVID hit, and they have endured. Please, stop here and have a pint or two. Spend lots of money so they can expand and distribute!  Thank you, Black Laboratory Brewing, ai will be back next time I am in the area!

reviews.author: Peter C.
reviews.description: Black Lab Brewing has rapidly become one of my wife and I's favorite breweries in San Antonio. Their "and Chill" series are amazing, their IPAs are great, and their Vanilla Joe is out of this world. The staff is always super friendly, and they have a great location, sandwiched between several great food options with a nice breezy patio. Highly recommend regularly visiting here!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: I found another good brewery in town. They have some interesting craft beers. I'm not an IPA fan, but their tangerine soft serve IPA was delicious. They do let you sample before buying. We ordered to go, but they do have a few tables were you can enjoy their beer onsite.

reviews.author: Paulo D.
reviews.description: Loved the place and ambiance. Good beer selection and couldn't ask for more for a Saturday afternoon.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Large taproom. The GM was there and very knowledgeable about the beers. He gave us samples until we decided on our favorite. Very low key for a Thursday night, which is fine by us. You can order food (pizza, pretzels, etc), but we didn't, so no review there. Hopefully, the pizzas are just like the one at their other location, which are yummy.

reviews.author: Melissa J.
reviews.description: The beer is good, which I suppose is the most important thing about a brewery, and the only reason I didn't give them one star. But the overall experience was not good. The service was unfriendly. And the ambiance was awful. Uninviting warehouse in derelict area between railroad and freeway overpass. Outdoor space is surrounded by barbed wire fence and you have to scream to be heard over the noise of the trains and traffic.  I just can't figure out why this place got so many 5 star reviews. Are San Antonian's standards that low? Are the other breweries so much worse than this one that this one seems nice by comparison?  I guess I'll never know

reviews.author: David S.
reviews.description: Reggie is the man.  Like the professional that he is, he vectored me into a fine brew based on what I was looking for. Boom! Place is a little out of the way but safe, chill, plenty of seating and space.   Beers are damn good.  Will return for sure!

reviews.author: Bridget S.
reviews.description: Go for the beer and perfect San Antonio ambiance, stay for Reggie. Our first visit so he asked us what kind of beer we liked. After an embarrassingly detailed description, Reggie hooked us up with the newly released Buffalo Hump IPA and it was exactly what we were looking for. Sat outside and watched trains go by, listening to a perfectly curated play list. Reggie checked on us just enough while also suggesting some San Antonio sites we might enjoy. Love this place!!

reviews.author: Laura C.
reviews.description: COVID precautions are in place, which is a huge bonus. The beer is amazing, definitely the kind of place for having a couple while keeping your wits about you. Reggie was super helpful on beer selection and DAMN does he have a good playlist.

reviews.author: Stephanie J.
reviews.description: One of my favorite breweries that we visited on this trip. It is spacious, the painted murals are neat, board games are available to play and the beer selection is good. I started off with a flight followed by a pint of the cherry bexarliner. Freetail Brewing is a must if you are in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This review is for the BREWERY near SouthTown, NOT the restaurant on 1604.    The seating area is spacious but still gets packed by early afternoon on weekends.   Not only can you get the regular Freetail brews here, but they're also serving a handful of Ghost Pixel brews.  Ghost Pixel is a collaboration between Chaos By Design and Weathered Souls Brewing Company.  I'm not sure how they ended up in the Freetail Brewery, but hey, it'll give you a reason to head down there, enjoy some cold suds, and find the answer for yourself.  Brewery tours at 3p and 5p on Saturdays. You can purchase beer to go in 4 packs, 6 packs, and 22 oz bottles. Growler refills are $9 for the Freetail brands, $14 for the Ghost Pixel brands.  They offer some merchandise for sale, t-shirts, pint glasses, glass growlers, and river safe metal growlers.  Every 1st Saturday is comedy night and they usually have other events going on the other Saturdays of each month.   Another cool thing they do is bring in local businesses for events called "pop-ups."  They brought in a local gourmet popcorn place called Pink's Popcorn a while back.  You could purchase a "flight" of various popcorn flavors and they were also giving away $5 gift cards to their stores.  There's a locally owned cupcake company scheduled for an upcoming pop-up, so get out there and check them out.  Check Freetail's website for their calendar of events for details on the Saturday events as well as the pop-ups.  TIP:  Drive slow if you have to park in the side parking lot.  It's gravel and there are a lot of potholes and ruts.

reviews.author: Todd C.
reviews.description: My favorite brewery in San Antonio.  The people are friendly and I love the tap room.  This is the only place in San Antonio that I visit every single trip.  Great beer, wonderful people, awesome atmosphere.

reviews.author: Kris U.
reviews.description: The taproom had a fun, casual vibe.  It is spacious with plenty of seating, including shared bench seating and bar stools.  I loved the hand painted wall murals and there are board games available to play.  There's also a food menu available, but on this visit I just tried did a beer tasting.  The have a wide variety of beer styles, so should be something on the menu to please everyone.  Their our taproom available-only beers and seasonable beers on draft, and they have specialty beers for sale by the bottle as well.  I enjoyed their IPAs and especially the Imperial IPA.  The La Muerta stout was also tasty.

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Came to Freetail for the second time. It's a very cool chill place. Been here before and couldn't wait to come back. I was happy with the needle and service, Jenny liked the selection of beers. Definitely come by this hipster spot!!!

reviews.author: Stacie M.
reviews.description: In town for a work retreat, and stopped off here after dinner.  We were only able to stay for an hour or so, but from what I saw, this place is super cool.  You can order a flight of any 6 beers on tap, I recommend the dark saison, it was delicious, and different than anything I've had before.  The space itself had a warehouse type feel, picnic benches setup for seating, and games like a giant connect 4.  Overall pretty similar to a lot of the breweries I hang out at in San Diego.

reviews.author: Michelangelo S.
reviews.description: Awesome $4 Flights!  SITREP  With beer flights easily going for twice as much elsewhere, including my home turf in Sacramento, this was a welcome surprise to enjoy a variety of four (4) delicious, refreshing craft beers basically $1 a pop! https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/freetail-brewing-san-antonio-2?select=mIJWirF3nDr4Lp1yk6QGyQanduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w  THE SETUP  Located inside a warehouse, the facility is spacious - plenty of room for brewing and retail storage and distribution needs.  The dÃ©cor inside is almost festive, giving you the impression you are celebrating Halloween and Dia De Los Muertos, with wall art and mural art going from the floor all the way to the ceiling.  THE BREWS  Again, they have a flight of FOUR 4-ounce glasses for only $4!  The beers I pulled the trigger on included:  1. Soul Doubt IPA https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/freetail-brewing-san-antonio-2?select=t1qYWf8PsXQK_YjXOAdNPQanduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w  2. Apotheosis   https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/freetail-brewing-san-antonio-2?select=QG6CdIK7AbrUhug6MNed5wanduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w  3. Belgian Hostel Style Stout;  https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/freetail-brewing-san-antonio-2?select=avzOodKMLifNrfMLldlYewanduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w      and,   4. San Antonio Pale Ale https://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/freetail-brewing-san-antonio-2?select=ro01q7VvBQNfbS4petZbPQanduserid=3mNz5nQFTIBQm0oU5mBR0w   All were tasty, and not bitter.  PARKING  Such a breeze!  The brewery has it's own large parking lot.  I don't think even a large party would push it over maximum lot-capacity.  THE LOWDOWN  If you find yourself in San Antonio, and enjoy innovative brews, definitely make Freetail Brewing one of your planned stops.

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: What a great venue!  Love this place! Great selection of beer. Ridiculously cheap prices...um $4 for a tasting flight!!! FTW?! even better...the beer is actually good!   Large, spacious. A couple of TV's for watching events. Lots of cool artwork and murals inside on the walls. Picnic table set up with board games and cards for your entertainment.   The only downside, there is no food nearby as the brewery is in the middle of nowhere...

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Freetail brewing is a staple in the SA brew scene. They have a variety of different beers including tried and true ones as well as seasonal flavors. They also offer the conserveza beer which part of the proceeds goes towards the SA zoos conservation efforts. They also offer topi Chico, sodas, (I think wine?!) for people who aren't big drinkers, they also offer chips and snacks. They usually have a food truck outside when we have gone. We usually come to Freetail when they're hosting an event. Our current favorite is "hoppy endings" comedy show which they host I believe every 3rd Saturday. They usually have a few comedians and it's FOR FREE. Be sure to check out Freetail for some good beer and events!

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed this brewery.  Came with a group of Yelpers on Sunday afternoon of Yelp Spring Break on a trek of several breweries that day and we spent the most time here.  The beers were good, the atmosphere is fun with a graffiti/dia de los muertos theme running through the building.  We did not tour, but just drank.  They did not have food, but they did have some comp popcorn which was MUCH appreciated!  I need just a little bite to go with my beer!  Its kind of out in the toolies, not much around there, so eat first!  Overall, liked it.  Would return.  Recommended!

reviews.author: Sarah E.
reviews.description: LOVE THIS PLACE. Highly recommend. Great place to bring friends from out of town when visiting. We live by the 1604 restaurant, but the brewery can't be beat. Awesome flight, great bartenders, and friendly atmosphere. Give it a try!

reviews.author: Anna V.
reviews.description: Very cool brewery! Love the art and atmosphere. Facilities are very clean and the AC feels amazing. No outside area which is great with the TX heat.  Great drink specials; $4 flights and pints. We ordered the flight and unfortunately did not find a favorite within the flight of 4. Don't know that we will be back.  Some pluses: they had cool t-shirts and if you're a fan of the beer you are able to fill your growlers.

reviews.author: Mimi W.
reviews.description: Very cute place. Super San Antonio vibe. There is parking and it is indoors with A/C. They are clean, clean restrooms, water fountains, have a yoga class in the next room over, games, a huge screen playing the office at the time, and cute glasses with color on them.   The Original (amber) and the Soul Doubt (IPA) were tasty. Would highly recommend it for local and out of towner beer drinkers.

reviews.author: Alexandria H.
reviews.description: Visited Freetail yesterday for the annual 5K Beer Run. This place is great!  All their note worthy store available beer plus all their other delicious ones are available on tap here. Clean restrooms and a/c available too (big plus for anyone really, right?). Inside they have a list of events for the month posted on the hand written board at the bar. Glasses and pints of beer range from $4-5/serving. Growlers and commemorative glasses/growlers available for purchase. No food made here which could be really great. Food trucks available outside so I'd bring a snack or eat before. Tables are long picnic style that make community style seating preferred. Bartenders are super friendly and are literally always smiling. Makes you feel really welcome.  Come and try Freetail and see where the magic happens!

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: What happened here? Is this event still going on? I haven't heard of much happening with this program in a while, but it was fun while it lasted. It was part of Downtown Tuesdays, where you could check out downtown with free parking, and discounted happy hours. But this event started getting sponsored by the big breweries, and the little guys were getting pushed out, in favor of something made by the big guys.  It's free! Just be 21+

reviews.author: Gem H.
reviews.description: Basically, you can't go wrong hanging out at the Third Brewsday. Free parking all over downtown, free beer samples (if you get there in time), free music, food trucks, and more beer. It is a good time within walking distance of a few other places to hop to after by either venturing into downtown proper or branching off toward Southtown. It is a free event, so really, what is there to lose?

name: Flying Saucer Draught Emporium
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Cayla Dee P.
reviews.description: GET the fresh pretzel! You will 100% be satisfied just with that.  Besides the pretzels, they have a huge beer list, overwhelming, but the servers are pretty good in helping you.  Trivia on Thursday!  You cannot go wrong with any of the food, I tried a lot of different things.  The German Plate is where it is at! The potato salad alone makes this dish.

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: Update to the update:   Flying Saucer is still one of my favorite spots in San Antonio for good beer, surprisingly good pub food, and excellent service.  I stopped in on a whim on a Friday afternoon. It's pretty dead but the regulars are here. Read my other reviews for more detail but I'll just sum it up.  Flying Saucer has good food. Their Rueben is probably the best version you're likely to get in San Antonio. It's seriously good (for San Antonio). Flying Saucer fries are ridiculously good. They're always crisp, never soggy. (Mine were on the edge of being too crisp today).  THEY STILL HAVE BELL'S OBERON ON TAP IN DECEMBER!!!!!!   For those who may not know. Bell's is a brewery in Michigan that has tentatively branched out to other areas. Flying Saucer (and similar places) sometimes gets it in the summer. It's a seasonal beer (spring/summer). Every Michigander knows the unofficial Spring kickoff is when Meijer's have stacks of Oberon on the shelves. So to find it still on tap in December is amazing. It's my favorite beer all time hands down. But don't y'all drink that ish cuz I'm coming back to kill it.  I sat at the bar and Ashely--the woman behind the bar--was great. Attentive but not over bearing. Perfect service.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: Stopped in yesterday over the lunch hours and had a fantastic lunch. Ordered their Smash Burger lunch special which in-essence was a burger on a wheat bun with two patties and fresh jalapeÃ±o.  It was served with a pesto mayo. The burger was better than I expected.   The waitress Rachel was fabulous and when she asked me which side I told her to pick her favorite. Arrived were seasoned waffle fries that were super hot and tasty.   This was one of the better lunches I had in awhile. I will definitely have to make it a priority to come back.

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: The beer selection here is honestly impressive. As an IPA lover, their selection is massive but also diverse. Tripels, Quads, Porters, Stouts, Lagers, etc. They have it all and more. There pretzel with beer cheese (which may be seasonal) is to die for, and they have some pretty awesome trivia nights as well!

reviews.author: Carly B.
reviews.description: Great selection of beers! Very dog friendly and the waitstaff is always pleasant. I love the salad with goat cheese, always fresh and flavorful. The bathrooms have also always been clean every time we stop in. It's such a great location, the shopping center is really fun. I highly recommend!

reviews.author: Eve S.
reviews.description: I'm not sure what's worse... the service or the food. My friend and I were so excited to try this spot, there's always people on the patio and the vibe looked cool and welcoming. Unfortunately what we experienced was far from that. Our server seemed very annoyed with us right off the bat, they didn't have any of their specials... no happy hour... our drinks took forever and we were met with rolling eyes any time we asked for another one. The wings were foul... soggy... tasteless... and or course it came to the table with the wrong sauce but At this point we were just ready to leave. The rueben sandwich my friend had was salty, dry... gas station quality. Needless to say I have no strong urge to subject myself to that again, decide for yourself.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I've been coming here for years. If you like beer definitely stop by, their Beer menu is impressive.  Their food is also really good. I recommend their pretzel. They have plenty of seating and an outdoor seating area as well. Also, on Tuesdays they have Trivia which is a lot of fun.

reviews.author: Jen C.
reviews.description: Unfriendly staff, food is eh. Walked in after just moving to area and staff acted as if we should've known their menu already. We aren't beer drinkers and thought they might've been a regular pub. Wait staff was rude and acted like she didn't want to be there.

reviews.author: Roger C.
reviews.description: Best beer selection in San Antonio.  Regular crowd is friendly.  Environment is clean; there is no staunchly beer odor that some tap rooms get.  Bartender wash's down the tap and tap rail which keeps things fresh.  Food is good quality bar fare (rueben, soups, salads, burgers,  specials are worth trying (grilled cheese adult versions, fire chicken sandwich, shrimp).

reviews.author: Jade M.
reviews.description: We have been coming here for years and tonight's service was unfortunately subpar. This was our first trip back since before the pandemic and we were looking forward to catching up with friends at one of our favorite spots. Throughout the evening our server seemed short with us and couldn't wait for us to finish ordering before attempting to walk away. Waters were only half filled which was strange. They seemed  flustered with our group whenever we attempted to flag them down. They had a few other tables so perhaps they were overwhelmed. Only towards the end of our meal did the server ask if we needed anything else. On top of this my food came out late like they had forgotten about it (everyone else in my group got their food), and my burger was burnt. It took a long time for our server to return for me to tell her about it and I was hungry, so I cut the burger in half and ate around the burnt part. The fries were good. I asked the server about it being late and burnt and asked for a different burger that wasn't burnt. They said the manager already discounted it and that since I ate some of it, they couldn't discount it more than that nor did they offer to replace it. I appreciate the discount, however we wouldn't have known at all since a manager nor the server came over to tell us, and honestly I would have preferred a non burnt burger to a discounted one. We still tipped 20% on our bill because we know that service here is typically better than this. Perhaps this server was just having an off day. Hoping that our next visit is better!

reviews.author: Twin F.
reviews.description: My wife actually has a plate on the wall here from before we made an account on Yelp. Now that I have been here as well this place lives up to the hype. The beer selection is one of the best I've seen anywhere and the food is top notch. 11/10 definitely going to be coming back!

reviews.author: Fox E.
reviews.description: I practice magic here whenever I'm in San Antonio, you know, wizardry and saucery. My career with saucery is flying actually.  These things are all over the country now and they're very very popular with drinkers and pub food and pub quiz lovers. Basically they're sports bars with pretty decent food, notably much, much better than Buffalo Wild Wings - which isn't saying much.  They show a lot of sport and have some very challenging quizzes, and they all have very elaborate and extensive and interesting decor. For this reason I give it a high rating, and Barbie enjoyed our short stay here as did I.  Definitely one of the better sports bars and quiz/trivia pubs that we've been to lately.

reviews.author: Cynthia C.
reviews.description: Knowing that I'm a trivia buff, my friend brought me to Flying Saucer Draught Emporium to enjoy their trivia night.  Not only did we have a blast that would have made Alex Trebek proud, but we enjoyed some truly awesome brews with some decent food to keep them company :-)  Having spent a very enjoyable evening here, I'd come back again just for the trivia night, but even if I didn't like trivia their extensive selection of beers would bring me back for sure!  The prices were surprisingly reasonable, and the bartender was exceptionally friendly and very helpful assisting us decide on what to order.  Tip: While they offer a plethora of beers here, the food menu is fairly limited.  That said, I've tried both their Reuben and one of their burgers and enjoyed both very much.  My friend praised their pizza and their grilled cheese as well.  Flying Saucer is without question the best trivia pub/sports bar I've been to thus far in San Antonio and I look forward to returning!

reviews.author: Liz T.
reviews.description: Great craft beers on the menu!  Various food and drink specials on different nights of the week.  Has both inside and patio dining available.  Fried shrimp, hush puppies, and sweet potato fries was a Monday meal special.

reviews.author: Artists W.
reviews.description: I've never been to the flying saucer but coworkers always told me about it! I had taste for hot wings yesterday so I called in a order. The lady over the phone was polite she advised my order would be ready within 10 minutes. Picked up my wings I believe there were 10 wings for $14 although the online menu stated 12.99 but I'm assuming that's with the tax.   Before I ordered I looked at yelp reviews and my wings looked exactly how other reviews were. The wings were good and I can't wait to dine in here during the summer!

reviews.author: Gary R.
reviews.description: Great little Drafthouse and the ambiance is amazing. They have many cool beers on tap. What I love most about the place is there lunch specials.  the Marcellus Wallace is definitely top on my list and very similar to a Philly cheese steak sandwich. The place is very well lit and has an authentic feel. I love the design of the interior with all of the plates and the very open spacing.

reviews.author: Devon P.
reviews.description: Great beer selection! The daily specials were great ($4 draft on Wednesdays). They were also very good with allowing you to try samples of the beer before you commit to one. You could also do flights which are great stepping points for you to figure out which beer you like. They have one for every palate! The soft pretzels with queso and spicy mustard were delicious! The spicy mustard was quite horseradish-forward, but if you dipped in both the queso and mustard, it was well-balanced. I definitely would come here again! There's plenty of indoor and outdoor seating (although outdoor is benches that aren't padded so if you want padding, sit indoors).

reviews.author: Diego M.
reviews.description: I really like this place. I like so much that I bought the T-shirt and start adding my beers in the app and everything. I actually unlocked a nice marriage achievement and convince my wife to start trying beers instead wine all the time. Unfortunately today was a very bad day. The food was not as good as always. But what really surprised me was the service.  My mother in law order a sprite and it took 25 minutes to arrive to the table. My father in law asked for some information regarding his beer and the waitress was so rude "explaining" that he didn't order anything else. In the end we're gonna go back because the beer offer it's really good but men the service

reviews.author: Manuel P.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a drink. The outside seating is comfortable and inviting. Plenty of space. The staff is really nice. They have a nice $4 mystery beer special during lunch which is nice if you are feeling up to it early in the day.  The inside is gigantic! It can get a little loud but there are a few board games to play with if you're into that kind of thing.

reviews.author: Janet P.
reviews.description: Good food and good beer selection. However, service has gone extremely downhill. Every time we have gone, every server has been very inattentive. I understand it can get busy, but just let us know or acknowledge us  This time (7/9/2021) we were never served. Waited 20 minutes, not one person came to check on us. Went inside and informed a server we were waiting for awhile, she let us know she would inform a server. We never had one server or managers come out. We ended up ordering from the bar and just taking it to our table. There was a server who came out and was serving all her coworkers who were getting off their shift. Not once, did she come and ask or talk to us. We were just one table away.   We have been coming here since 2019 and this was the first time we received extremely poor service. We are also UFO members, we definitely wanted that plate on the wall, but doesn't seem worth it anymore.

reviews.author: Travis O.
reviews.description: As a stout beer fan, this is one of my go to places. I have love to watch them expand from a single room and 10 foot wide porch to the multiple building compound they have now. The beers are always delicious, the staff is always extremely friendly, and the addition of the new pizza kitchen is a huge plus.  Last time we were in, we ordered a build your own pizza that included a plethora of delicious meats and even topped it with truffle oil. If you are looking for a fun place to grab a delicious beer, listen to some live music, and eat some phenomenal food, this place that has it all.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: This is a bring a group type of place. Tons of seating and a great atmosphere. We sat inside by the bar but it was still really hot. We were hoping it would be a little cooler since it was by the bar inside the building but this is Texas after all.   We really enjoyed it and the burgers were so good. We did a flight of beer so we can taste a multitude of what they have to offer. The Peanut butter stout was amazing. The only complaint was the copious amount of flies swarming us, lol. We tried not to let them bother us but they were drawn to our food.   We probably would have stayed longer but the heat and flies got the best of us. We ended up going to a different place to day drink. I think it would be even better during the fall, winter, or the spring.

reviews.author: Sadiya A.
reviews.description: This open patio brewery has a fun and great atmosphere! It's super spacious with the seating area options and one area dedicated to smoking cigars. The beers taste fantastic, especially the bourbon infused one! The brewery also has live music and the band we listened to the night we were there was awesome! There is a second tasting room where you can get flights instead of full tapped beer-that area houses the main brewery area. There is also food at the Guadeloupe Pizza Kitchen which is off to the side of the brewery...the pizza we got that night was the Detroit style pizza, one was veggies and the other pepperoni and it was very tasty! This is a great spot to hangout with family and friends!

reviews.author: Joel G.
reviews.description: After a long day on the river we went in on a Friday being and I'll admit we were a little hangry. Everyplace in NB was packed out and GBC was no exception but it was for good reason, thankfully we didn't let our hunger or the crowd deter us because we would've missed our big time!   So they have two separate building you can order beer at, and a pizza building, pub fare building and taco shack all surroundings common outdoor seating area.  I will say the beer selection and quality was amazing, They had so many unique flavors full of body, light to dark and low ABVs all the way up to 15%! Im so thankfully they weren't 90% IPA which seems like the trend nowadays but truly had a large variety as selection to please everyone.  Their cider was perfect my tart and not sickly sweet like every cider is, super refreshing.  The food was no second fiddle either, and held its own not just against the beer but other rival restaurants with similar fare.  First of pricing is really good so you're not gonna break the bank. Also you get a ton of food for what you pay.  But the icing on top is that the food flavors are soooo good, we had the cheese curds, blue cheese burger from the pub food building at it was honestly one of the best burger ive ever had.  The pizzas were equally as wonderful and had some awesome combinations you don't normally scene but they have them down. We got the one with corrizo and it I think is one of my favorite pizzas now!   This place should be a regular watering hole for everyone! although it's outdoor seating the trees, canvas overhang and mister make it bearable and they really have an ambiance that make you wanna stay and hangout, especially with the live music in the garden patio setting.   As a suggestion/request I will as the business owners to blessed put up some fans! Not just for the heat but the stupid flies especially in the smoking section were super annoying!

reviews.author: Josh P.
reviews.description: If you happen to drive through New Braunfels, I highly recommend taking a 10 minute detour away from i35 and traffic to checkout Guadalupe brewing.  It was our first visit since they expanded and it's even better than before. Same great expansive beer options with a lot of new outside space. They also have a separate small batch only bar and overall, their prices are very good. It's also dog and kid friendly and all the people that work there are very friendly.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Guadalupe brewing is one of our absolute favorites, and they keep expanding and somehogetting better and better. Amazing flavors and unique beers for every taste ranging from light pilsners to heavy stouts, hoppy IPAs or sour berlinerweiss. They have unique flavors such as dreamsicle, and If they advertise a flavor in a beer it'll definitely be a leading flavor and not slight hints! They have an outdoor seating area that is gorgeous, and an inside area as well. They also have two different bar areas to order from- and some beers are only at one bar and not the other, so check both before you choose! You can get reservations for a week in advance, so they're great for groups/special events. They also serve pizza which is so good! They offer normal or Detroit style, and is an absolute must!

reviews.author: Matt S.
reviews.description: As a native Detroiter and lover of Detroit style pizza, I can honestly say that the Detroit Style pizza here is the best I've had in Texas and possibly Detroit. I had a simple pepperoni pizza and it was absolute perfection 10/10. Better than Via 313 in Austin, which I hold as the standard by which Detroit Style pizza should be measured. One pizza was enough for one person, and I really wanted to order and second but I resisted.

reviews.author: Paige L.
reviews.description: One of my favorite brewery places to enjoy music and friends.  The s'mores brew will always be my favorite but there is a long list of others I enjoy.

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: Live music and beer on the weekends, what more do you need!? The band they had when we went for the 1st time on a Sunday was amazing.   Lots of seating all around, perfect for dogs and outside hangs. Overall I really enjoyed the beers and the food truck food was really yummy. The food truck will run out of some things so get in line ASAP' if you're hungry. I'd recommend the truffle fries and rib sandwich.

reviews.author: Christine P.
reviews.description: We attended an outdoor ceremony for my BIL at this location. Excellent facility. Great outdoor spaces. Beer was definitely good. I had the kolsch and it was very tasty.  Pizza place right on property so that was great especially for the kids. Pizza was also very good.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Good beer selection. Nice patio area. They also have inside seating. They do have beer flights if you're undecided. The staff is nice and gives good recommendations. Parking is available on site. Dog friendly

reviews.author: Bob H.
reviews.description: We've been with GBC since the beginning.. watching the transformation from small brewery in a tiny industrial building to the sprawling destination venue they are today. We've even slung beer for them on occasion to help out with events and goodwill.  From a "closet" with an outdoor grill on Friday nights, to a full dining and entertaining establishment,  Anna and Keith have never lost focus of their dream even all through Covid they have persevered.  The latest additions of a awning over the beer garden and customer laser engraved new tables to sit, three food choices including a new boffo pizza kitchen, you can't go wrong to stop in, relax and enjoy their hospitality.    Parents... there is a posting on the GBC website, please leave your minor children at home after 7pm. We don't see a lot of adherence to this request and this insults your hosts by being rude and reflects badly on you as a guest.  "Prosit"

reviews.author: Coral U.
reviews.description: This is the great mix between, people, dogs, and beer! The ownership takes so much pride in their work and soon to be legacy. The beer selection is one of the top tier places. I appreciate the live music and crisp cold beer. They have live Texas country music for MULTIPLE times a week. Along with an amazing food as well. I have attached a opening, videos and photos for Sunday morning, and food menus, hours (for food) and more. Hours for the brewery is open tue-thu 5-9 fri-sat 12-9 sun 12-6. The pizza is made with their fresh garden vegetables that you can see them picking tue-thu 5-9 and fri-sat 12-9 (peep my tik-tok, which isn't my thing but it's cute)

reviews.author: Stephanie G.
reviews.description: Everything is great about this place.  The location is perfect, lots to do in the surrounding area.  There is a farmers market on the weekends, the food is delicious, beer menu is very large and diverse and the staff members are awesome!  The seating is very open and there is lots of room.  The price isn't too shabby as well.  Recommend recommend ! If you are in New Braunfels check this place out !

reviews.author: Erica C.
reviews.description: This place is so cool and you can find something for everyone to do! They have many options for food. We ordered a pizza and it was delicious. So many different places to sit and many beer options. The ladies at the bar did an excellent job explaining the beers they had on tap.

reviews.author: Law L.
reviews.description: Really great stuff all around. Fantastic pizza. Some great representations of classic styles and some really cool creative funky brews. Enjoyed this immensely

reviews.author: Sheri L.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere and good selection of craft beer.  Good live music as well.  I'll go back.

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: The place is cute and clean. The outdoor seating was nice with picnic tables and lounge chairs. You can reserve a table in advance. There was guy playing live acoustic music on stage for a short bit. I got 16oz pour for $7 with nice, friendly bartenders. The low rating is for the food. It was not good. Not the burger or fries nor the service from the lady that look the order. The food was cold, salty, and the burger was all toppings and little patty. I'd definitely return for some drinks and the atmosphere though.

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Have been a few times.  Have to say they have really good beers (rate them extremely high on Untappd).   My overall experience at the brewery though is mixed.   First, a bit pricey on flights ($20 for 5 beers).  What really annoyed me today was we sat in the nonsmoking section and a worker (owner?) kept coming through with a really pungent cigar.  Multiple trips through and even lingered by us as he smoked.   Totally nullified my ability to taste the beers.  On the bright side, as well as awesome beers, the young man seating guests was super nice and attentive.  He even suggested we move to a cooler spot (the non smoking section haha).   Anyway, mixed experience.  Hence the 3 star rating.

reviews.author: Paula S.
reviews.description: The brewed beer ate all excellent, after a few have a yummy Pizza Margarita, so awesome and tasty, also other Pizza choses, good sandwiches as well. Get over there on the weekend, very enjoyable and relaxing with awesome live music! Come on y'all don't miss out!

reviews.author: Cheryl L.
reviews.description: Great variety of beers on tap that rotate periodically, super friendly and knowledgeable staff and relaxing atmosphere where you can bring your dogs or kids and just chill.

reviews.author: Jenner B.
reviews.description: I had the privilege of attending Barrel Man Brewing's Grand Opening. There were a lot of people out supporting this brewery. It was pretty much busy the whole time I was there. The vibe was great. People laughing and having a good time enjoying their cold beers. It was a party.  The Head Brewer and Owner Fred was serving beers. Very attentive to every one. He was a machine. Serving the endless lines but still managing to engage people in friendly conversations with a smile on his face. I had several of his beers. All delicious in its own way, but my favorite was his "SerenDIPAty". At an ABV of 9.2  I think it drank more like a session IPA. It wasn't bitter or harsh like other double IPA's. It was smooth and very drinkable. I'm in no way a beer geek. But I felt like his beers were very good. I also tried their "Islander Brat". Let me say this brat really caught me off guard. The papaya slaw is everything. The garlic up front is really strong (in a good way). You'll definitely keep vampires at bay. It has a spicy kick to it and a nice texture. Combined with the brat and pretzel bun, that is brought in from a local bakery. This brat is the perfect pairing with their beer. I also liked that it came with chicharron instead of chips.
