To tie in their Filipino theme. Sorry no pic of the brat. I wasn't happy with the shot I took  Overall I love this brewery. Great beers, great staff, great food and a chill vibe to enjoy a nice cold beer.   I wish them all the success!

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Have been wanting to check out barrelman for a while, but wanted to give them some time to build up their own beer inventory before checking it out. They now have 4 of their own beers including two IPAs, a brown ale, and a golden ale, and guest taps to fill in the gaps including a cider. They offer a 12oz or 16oz pour for a very reasonable price. ($6 for 16oz IPA- amazing!). We tried both IPAs and they were both solid with a smooth finish. The bartender was friendly and quick getting our beers out. We already had dinner plans but we saw a few of the pretzels around the taproom and they look DELICIOUS. They're huge and you can tell they're buttered and salted. The taproom had lots of tables available and the back opened up to a back parking lot area for room to move around. This place is definitely pet and kid friendly. They had a really cool vibe with some 90s Rock playing (including tom petty). Definitely looking forward to watching this brewery grow and can't wait to come back to try more of their food/drink!

reviews.author: Lauren J.
reviews.description: Such a fun spot to hang out and relax!! They have amazing original brews and the owners are super cool and fun! Fred, Alex, and Andrea are extremely welcoming and will not hesitate to get to know you and share their passion for brewing.   Definitely will be making this our regular spot. Especially as a Filipino myself, it hits especially close to home. and if you come and don't know the Barrelman from the Philippines, make sure you lift up his barrel when you come visit!!

reviews.author: Edward J.
reviews.description: Awesome new brewery in Boerne run by Filipino-Americans! Been here 3 times already and it's a great atmosphere with awesome service by the owners. They're going to start serving more of their beers soon, but they've got a great IPA and awesome guest beers on tap. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.author: Kassie S.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time with some friends and the owners were extremely friendly and welcoming! The atmosphere was super laid-back, relaxing, and a great space to hang out and catch up with friends. Would definitely recommend!! Support local business

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Great indoor/outdoor brewery out in the hill country. Rotating crafts from the region and beers they've made themselves. The food truck rotates the food menu with various street foods. I enjoy the pretzels. Cheryl was very knowledgeable in the beer offerings and gave us great suggestions on what to try.   Suggestions- Follow on Facebook for events we went for the seafood boil and it was fantastic.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Maghee D.
reviews.description: Great beer and bites, kid friendly and lots of social events. Was particularly impressed by the games, cornhole, etc. available to play. Even live music! Favorite beers were the blonde ale and hazy IPA.

name: Hidden Tavern
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This place is a keeper y'all!  They have been around for 15 years now and 15 years in my book = perfection.  Why have I never heard of this place before???  We went on a Saturday night (I think, lol) and it just happened to be their 15th anniversary party.  Beer and drinks were cheap, and I heard a rumor that the drinks were pretty stiff.  They had Karaoke (of which I did not partake) and a side area with 3 or 4 pool tables.  There were 8-10 of us (I might have been seeing double, so don't quote me on that) and we were able to all sit together.  It did get busier as the night wore on, but it was not crowded at all.  It's a dive bar and I respect it for that, the only thing keeping them from five stars as a dive bar is that they only had two bartenders and only one bar back that occasionally showed up.  This meant we were standing in line for refills for a bit longer than we wanted.  They really were busy.

reviews.author: Json L.
reviews.description: Karaoke is lit as heck! Got great people working who know how to have a good time! Hella fun and clean environment. Excellent service compared to  that other bar across the street... don't go there.. come on in and party any night of the week at Hidden Tavern!

reviews.author: Kimberly K.
reviews.description: I love dive bars and karaoke and this place has both. Hidden Tavern has karaoke 6 nights a week starting at 10pm. The Monday night host, Dave, is my favorite. He is very friendly and has a wide variety of songs to choose from. If he doesn't have it he'll get it for you. Quinn on Wednesday and Saturday nights is also tops. They have a huge dance floor and stage so you can get your rockstar on. There is also pool tables and darts if karaoke isn't your thing. The bartenders here are awesome and know how to pour a drink. Especially Jess and Maggie. Also a shout out to the bar security, Ray. Best of all the drinks are cheap and they don't skimp on the booze.

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: This is one of my favorite spots to chill with good people and feel like a rockstar.  So the drinks are always made with just the right balance of liquor to mixer ratio. The people here bond over karaoke like no other crowd I've seen.  Ask for Jess when looking for a bartendar who knows how to take care of her clients. Also both Eddie and Quinn are very professional and some of the best KJ'S I've met that know how to balance your vocals and make you look like the next American idol. This place has gone above and beyond my expectations everytime.

reviews.author: Kristen F.
reviews.description: It's never a bad night for karaoke. The drinks are always decent and fair priced. The karaoke djs do not play favorites. Ever time I go, even on a weekend, I get to at least 2 or 3 songs. They let me throw my husbands 30th bday there just because I asked. The staff has been incredibly friendly from day 1. This is the best karaoke bar in San Antonio in my opinion

reviews.author: T B.
reviews.description: We stopped in the bar .It's kind of set up strange. One big room and the bar is up against the back wall. I had a hard time staying here, I don't like my back to the door. It does have tables and chairs that you can move around.When we walked in people were smoking right at front door. I had to walk through smoke to get into the bar. It is centrally located.which is very convenient if you're picking up food or going shopping and just need a break. I did not stay long because of my own personal preferences. No one did anything wrong. Check it out .

reviews.author: Chanty E.
reviews.description: First bar I have ever been in my life and honestly I love coming here for Karaoke night. Super fun and I'm not much of a drinker well I don't know what alcohol I like yet and the bartenders were all so nice in helping me find my preference. It's a pretty dope place.

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.description: Very sad time last night. I am a frequenting customer and I decided this one time to take one of my girlfriends out to my "drinking spot". We got there at 1am, ordered our drinks and received the WORST customer service of my life. Not going to lie, most of the time it seems like the bartenders were hired from a "wanted ad" on craigslist but this particular girl just took the cake.   She was asian, wore heavy eyeliner and a Tshirt that said PINK on it. Rolled her eyes everytime my friend ordered a drink because she was busy talking to the same group of people. at 1:45 she pointed at her from over the bar with a disgusted face and said "You better finish that, were closing at 2" im sure there is a much better way to say that and a lot nicer. My friend, playfully goes, "aw we just got here." Smile on her face, bartender scoffs and goes, "Not my problem you got here too late." Seriously what is that girls problem!?   My friend stood up at one point to fix her dress, again the bartender yells "Hey you cant take that outside, you have to finish that here now." My friend replies, still pleasantly despite this girls attitude, "I know I will."   SHE ROLLS HER EYES and says "Or whatever, just act like im stupid" Im at this point inclined to agree that you did in fact hire a stupid bartender.  These are just a couple of aggressive comments that your bartender shot my friends way unprovoked. And now im sad to say I will NOT be returning to your establishment. I will NOT recommend this place to anyone, in fact I will be avidly turning people away from it.   I honestly have no idea what that girls problem with my friend was, and this is not a drunk post. I was the Designated Driver and didnt drink anything, so I know what im talking about.  All in all, you hire terrible bartenders that drive away customers because of there own personal issues. You just lost a lot of business within an hour, congrats.  PS: I want the manager to contact me. I want to know why you hire someone like that.

reviews.author: Martin V.
reviews.description: Cool karaoke bar with some pool tables, electronic darts, and a foosball table. A good mix of people, everyone having a good time. Service was a little slow but not annoying, I believe the owner was one of the bartenders, not sure though. Had good drinks and a good time.

reviews.author: Leandra R.
reviews.description: What happened to Jess? The bartenders here rather gossip with each other than make a decent drink

reviews.author: Joseph K.
reviews.description: I have been going to this place for over two years, it is like a second home. It's a drive bar, but a dive bar with heart. If you want to make friends come out and talk to people- best bartender in San Antonio goes out to Ollie- One of the owners Debbie is very approachable. Come out and join the regulars

reviews.author: Matthew B.
reviews.description: Fantastic dive bar!  Just what you would expect: young, old, pretty, not so pretty, swinger couple with date in tow, karaoke that is constantly malfunctioning.  Alison and I stumbled across this place toward the end of a date night after having visited some other bars in the general area of town.  This one took the prize and we wish we would've just started out here to begin with.  Cheap drinks, TV's with sports and SNL. And, we were there on a Saturday, the aforementioned karaoke.  Get your name in early as the crowd really likes to sing here. I recommend just taking cash as they had some difficulty, for whatever reason, with their credit card processing.

reviews.author: Jenn G.
reviews.description: Best karaoke bar in town! Jess is a fantastic bartender! Great atmosphere and friendly people! I love this place!!

reviews.author: Edgar S.
reviews.description: Best lil dive bar I have been into in a long time.. Knocks the socks off big chain bars full of hipsters in Austin.. Only visit this place every couple mos cuz I am not local but it's best bar in San Antonio.  .. I love this place.. update.. 1st Saturday of the month customer appreciation!! Free snacky snacks?? Winning

reviews.author: Davian A.
reviews.description: Fuck the bartenders their bitches and the bouncer I should of punched his scrawny ass it the fucking teeth so he shallow them. I love the manager she's so nice she stood up for me, fuck the works but I do like bar just not the workers

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: Cool spot but small and the food is typical bar food quality. Good HH specials. Good for a chill and relaxed night.

reviews.author: Justin F.
reviews.description: Inexpensive liquor, but the place was pretty bland. I would spend my money elsewhere for a better experience.

reviews.author: Edward N Stephanie P.
reviews.description: Came here to check out karaoke. Great selection and sound. Cool setup as well. Problem is that there were a ton of singers waiting yet the KJ continued to play long bit of music in between singers. I would say it was around 10 minutes between each singer bar tender was cool and took care of me. Sings good too. If I have to wait this long every time, not really my type of place. Still waiting almost 2 hours to sing 1 song

reviews.author: Jd R.
reviews.description: Been going here for years... A very chill spot to get some drinks with friends. Always good drinks with good prices. They have karaoke and spurs games are always on. Location is easy to find and easy parking.

reviews.author: Eric V.
reviews.description: Hidden tavern is awesome!! Tori is the greatest bartender that works happy hour sat and Sunday.  U must see jelly and drew on Sunday, Sarah on Tuesday and drew on Thursday! .  Great bar to watch a game and kick back with great friends... Pool, jukebox, karaoke, etc.

reviews.author: Kristen M.
reviews.description: Quick and efficient. Don't be overwhelmed if the line is long , line moves super fast .  We ordered the big red beer and had friends who ordered as well who we were picking up for and had 0 issues . Just go in knowing or have your order numbers written down for smooth sailing .  Would definitely order from them again .

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: 2.5 Stars  I have to be very cautious as I write this review not to venture into Beer Advocate or Untappd territory. I assure you that I don't have an account for either. I have gone to their brewpub a couple of times. I've tried several of their beers at various places(Gooberverse series- Kanye Zest etc.). And I recently utilized toast tab to score their highly publicized beer, "Rojo." So why am I going against popular opinion? Am I being a contrarian? Difficult? I will tell you there will be times on Yelp when you're on the fence about a place but cumulative experiences always tips the scales.  I remember before Islla even opened trying their Pineapple Empanada IPA at a local festival. It was hands down the best beer I had at that event. I really appreciated their ethos of blending cultural roots with creative takes on craft standards. Unfortunately for me that is where my affinity for them ends. Firstly I went to what was supposedly to be a soft opening. But a misprint by a local zine turned this event into a full out grand opening. Needless to say it was a perfect storm of circumstances: crazy crowds, unavailable styles, lukewarm beer to include service.  To be fair to them I understand they must of been taken by surprise. Which I assume included going back to the drawing board to regroup. I decided to reserve my review contingent on a future visit.  So I waited a few months to allow the crowds to dissipate. The next time I went the place was empty. When it is not crowded this is the most optimal time for a brewery to make a connection with the patron via tapmaster. Instead the dude seemed like, "Whatever." No, "Is this this your first time here?" Or "Are you looking for a specific style?" I ordered the Suavecito 37 dressed with cajeta on the glass's rim. In all honesty I was a bit confused. The only time I have any one dressed is with a Corona and I try not to resort to that. Subsiding the beer this experience was less desirable than the first. The vibe was very unwelcoming. A brewery should create the feeling of being at a second home. No one traverses across town only to chug a beer wanting to leave.  Again I have to tread lightly not to go into Ratebeerland. The pivotal experience for me was an online purchase made on their toasttab account.  I was hoping to score the second batch of the Rojo made with Big Red soda. So an order was placed. I got a Saturday pick up time and date. I was ecstatic as it sold out in minutes. A few days later they posted a letter online saying that a glitch in the computer sold inventory meant for future release dates. The only recourse according to them was to divvy  pick up times into three waves. Surely my given Saturday date( first day of the relaunch) meant I would still get a late pickup or at the least be included in the second wave. Wrong.  Much to my chagrin I was not even given a second wave spot but relegated to third. Which meant an almost three week wait. I began to wonder how did they determine cutoffs? If the amount sold was in the hundreds why didn't they just do purchases in a first come first serve format? My conspiracy theorist brain went into overdrive. Did they pull the names of favorite regulars and place them in the first two slots? Was inventory even ready for pickup? If it was why didn't they just distribute orders throughout the week? Computer error on your part is still your part. It's best business practice to at least attempt to fix a mistake.    My experiences at Islla Street Brewing Co. have thus far been a series of unfortunate events. Even as a professed misanthrope I try to remain optimistic. However one of my biggest Yelp pet peeves is a business that doesn't attempt to make things right. To me this should be included in a business's mission statement. It shouldn't be, " Too bad so sad."  Now I will segue into my craft beer enthusiast mode. Ok so here's what I think of their, nevermind. When you get past the chest thumping, gimmicky, inconsistent beers to include poor customer service all you really have is hype. And that's helpful to sell a beer but that alone can't sustain a brewery.  ps. In the Immortal Words of the Greek Philopsopher Flavor Flav- "Don't Believe The HYPE!"

reviews.author: Dawn H.
reviews.description: What a gem! Recommended by a fellow Yeeper [Yelp Elite], I am so happy to have found Islla Street Brewing. :D Such a chill spot and friendly folks. Smallish space with several tables and streaming music.   They're producing some of the very best micro craft beers; nothing like you will find anywhere else. Just check out the menu [see pic]. Islla's mission is to create beers that reflect their heritage and culture. They bring in ingredients that elevate and highlight each batch. Where else are you going to get Strawberry or Pineapple Empanada DIPAs or one brewed with real pink Concha pan dulce? Off the charts! And they use garnishes with some that really stimulate the palate.  Islla's interesting brews might seem a bit kitchy to some; however, as a certified beer nerd who has visited well over 100 breweries I can tell you there is a LOT of skill involved in their processes and the results are outstanding IMHO. Simply put: well-balanced, none to sweet, tart, or bitter...scarily crushable suds.   On your first visit I suggest sharing a couple of flights. Be sure to try the Suavecito '37 (grandpa's nickname) if it's available - a super tasty brown ale with toasted coconut, coriander, and Mexican caramel. Mmm. Cheers!  Note: During my visit, their was a Taco Truck on-site that was bomb!

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: This place is dangerous. Their beers are easily drank and supper smooth.  Unique in taste (seeing at the ingredients they use to brew their beers i.e. nopalitos and guava), their beers are true South Texas and nothing but solid.   You just can't beat their vibe. Their space is really unassuming but comfortable.  It's like walking into your friend's garage during a barbecue with Selena jamming on the boom box.  This is a San Antonio institution that you should take your friend's, family and out of towners to.

reviews.author: Eugene L.
reviews.description: Considering that we're still in the midst of a pandemic and many small businesses have been struggling as of late, I like to give them my support the best I can.  Islla St. Brewing ,however, just had to make that a huge and really difficult challenge.  I drove here at the spur of a moment just to try that much talked about Big Rojo beer.  Then some girl asked me for an order number.  I had no clue what she was talking about.  I just wanted to buy some damn beer.  Then she told me I had to place an order online.  I was immediately disappointed, said to myself "Fuck this!" and quickly drove away.  Never again.  Not a good way of developing good customer relations...tsk...tsk.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: New kid on the San Antonio beer block is killing it right out of the gate!  Islla Street may be new, but they've already become my favorite San Antonio beer... soooo freakin' GOOD!!  The beers are all awesome twists on standard styles - IPAs made with fruit empanadas. Stouts brewed with conchas or horchata and flan - and *consistently* delicious. The family ties just make them even better.  They do have flights (YAY!!), but currently don't have any to-go options like growlers or crowlers - on-site only.  Dog friendly. *Awesome* music (sometimes just a smidge louder than I'd like though) - my favorite is when the playlist (from the iJukebox) is filled with mariachi-meets-pop/rock/metal mashups haha). Usually a fantastic food truck posted up waiting to provide the snack action.  Don't hesitate - go visit! Cheers!

reviews.author: Rick O.
reviews.description: Probably the most overrated Brewery in Texas.  Customer service was terrible, was unable to buy beer in person was told I needed to order online.  Finally got my hands on their Rojo beer and let me tell you.  The beer tasted like big red and Lonestar light had a child out of wedlock and named it diabetes.  I poured most of it out, for it to be so hyped doesn't surprise me, San Antonio has bad taste I mean joes volcano stayed open 20 years and that shit sucked too.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great brewery with a great atmosphere. I am sure they will need to expand in the future.   The beers are very good. I love that they add extra touches like caramel or tamarindo on the rim. My favorite was the suavecito. The coconut flavor stood out. They also have sangria. Sangria is good, but give their beers a try first. You may just be surprised. Even if you don't like beer, you may just enjoy one of theirs. Definitely get a flight.   The area is small with only a handful of tables and the bar area,  but we didn't have trouble finding a seat even with the place full.  The night we went, they had a DJ playing tejano music. They also had a food truck parked outside.   I will definitely return..... I only wish they were closer to home, but they are worth the drive

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Came through for a baby reveal. It was a cool little spot to try out some cool brews. There were several interesting beers like a green sour beer with a lemon drop on the bottom. I'll definitely be back, stop by and support this family run business.

reviews.author: Jordan S.
reviews.description: This little bar is super cool. I love how they only have like 7 different beers. They brew their own very different beers. All the staff have been welcoming whenever I am there. They also have a little food truck right out front with some good munchies. Place is only open Friday Saturday and Sunday. Plenty of seating, fast, not expensive and the staff at very attentive!

reviews.author: Rogelio G.
reviews.description: This place makes you feel like your chilling with friends in their backyard. Great atmosphere, people there are super friendly and ready to accommodate.  I cant say enough about the beers. Great flavors and combinations. The only knock I would say is other than the food truck there isn't any food but other than that great little hidden spot you have to try!

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: This place is freaking awesome.  Beer is fantastic and J.D. believes in dark beers.  Try some of the interesting creations that they have which includes finishing off the rim of the glass with marshmallow spread and graham cracker or PBandJ.

reviews.author: Jesse L.
reviews.description: Very cool brewery with a great selection and great service.  I tried a couple flights and really liked everything.  My favorite was the Suavecito 37' w/carmel drizzle.   John got our beers and was super cool and helpful as it was our first time here.

reviews.author: Alan E.
reviews.description: This is a small craft brewery hidden in an industrial park on SA's northeast side. Nothing fancy. It's like sitting in the neighbors garage drinking their home brewing hobby beer.   Wait. That's not entirely fair. This beer oozes SA culture. Beers made with empanadas or pan dulce in the mix. Chamoy and chile on the rim of the glass. Sangria available for non-beer drinkers. Food trucks on weekends.   Give them a shot. It's a fun way to spend a weekend afternoon.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Great, chill, local brewery. A must visit if you love stout beers, a ton of delicious stout beers come out of Islla. Atmosphere is great, as is the service. Unique offering. The beers have a ton of character and taste great. Seltzer on tap. Something for everyone here. Drink local!

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: The beer is amazing but the atmosphere is out of this world. Happy owners = happy drinkers. Great food truck tacos and music made us happy! This is our new fo to joint! Thanks for the good times.

reviews.author: Annabelle L.
reviews.description: The vibe here was dope. After a not so great first impression, my fiance and I decided to give it a second try and we sure are glad we did. Friday night was poppin', tap list was impressive, the welcoming was warm and the drinks were flowing.   We had a flight of all 3 IPAs on the tap list. HeMango being our fave, and I ended up preferring their Chola blonde by the time our visit was over.  One other random thing I liked was the restroom..  ik it's silly but they had chongos and Bobby pins to pick up my hair (it's hot out here y'all) super dope of them. We even met a few people and chatted, super chill environment, everyone was just drinking good beer and relaxing. All in all an enjoyable experience. We'll be back.

reviews.author: Elena V.
reviews.description: Amazing flavors , cutest venue and great hosts .  Loved it .  It's always packed so be sure to show up early . Beers were super creative and extremely tasty . Must see for any beer lover in SA

reviews.author: Monica V.
reviews.description: Stopped by today for the first time . The Vibe was awesome , Great beers on tap . Really enjoyed the Peach Mango Ale and the Pos Melon IPA . Food truck outside and very Dog friendly.

reviews.author: Melia R.
reviews.description: Cute names for tasty craft beers in a surprising location (off o'Connor near 35?!? huh!)  The people are frinedly; the 'ambience' is cool backyard hangout. It got more festive as the night progressed.  I can dig the scene.  Oh and the bathroom and empanada eats get Overachiever Awards.

name: Big Hops Huebner
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: One of my Lyft drivers recommended Big Hops as beer destination while I was visiting. Unfortunately, I didn't have a lot of time left so I bookmarked it for next time. However,  I was fortunate enough to have a recently transplanted friend come pick me up for a quick catch up.  Big Hops is one of those spots where there's not just a lot of beers on tap but they're well (and I hate to use this term) curated. I'd been to more than a few spots in my first short stay in Texas and there was a BUNCH of good beers on hand. I had already had had a few earlier in the day and the beers here were not only one I hadn't come across but damn tasty.  Now, a lot of beer nerd type places can be condescending, especially if you're not up on regional breweries or what's pouring. Our bartender, David was super laid back and let us try a bunch of beers but also was someone you could talk to about beers.  We showed up pretty close to closing time but he let us stay-it was his birthday and his gf showed up with food and he was in no rush to leave/throw anyone out. We ended up buying him some birthday beers. I need to head back on my next trip.

reviews.author: Jando S.
reviews.description: I don't consider myself a beer enthusiast, which makes my 5 star review even more profound. Big Hops has such good stuff on craft front that it makes me wish I loved beer more. This is a beer bar without pretension, a fun place to hang out with friends, and an even better spot to enjoy a quality pint.  They have something like 30 taps that rotate with seasonal stuff happening throughout the year. Their happy hours (typically 3-7pm on the latter half of the week). Sample as many beers as you can and definitely take the bartender's suggestions if any. The last time I was here, the bartender was celebrating a birthday and we ended up staying past closing time.  The vibe is laid back and there's decent seating for various groups from bench style seating and small'ish tables. I prefer sitting at the bar and bantering with the bartender. I particularly enjoy their sours, flavored IPAs (peach and/or grapefruit especially), saison. It's one of those places where I'll try anything the bartender is willing to give.  Prices are solid and they accept credit cards. Given how hot San Antonio's weather has been as of late, the thought of drinking a nice cold brew suddenly sounds really great.

reviews.author: M G.
reviews.description: I normally don't drink beer but I found this place and ever since I have been hooked. Customer service is amazing I just love the positive vibes they give! It's so welcoming and a great place if you just wanna grab a drink and have great conversations.  They do not serve food though but you're more than welcome to bring some. I love the fact that this place is more intimate than the bigger places around the area so it's not so overwhelming. Definitely recommend for anyone to try they will give you samples to try and they are very knowledgeable about the beer they sell.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: I was going to give this place 3 stars, but decided to bump it up because of the manager.  Super cheap prices on the menu, however, they charge for the glass. So what seems to be a $3 beer Is actually $7-$8 with the glass included. IF you miss this - you will be VERY surprised by your bill at the end of the night.  Storytime:  I got charged an extra beer I didn't order. I talked to the server about it and he was not seeming to understand what I was talking about. Got a little impatient with me and could tell he was getting frustrated. Thankfully he put me with the manager and we got everything squared away. Instead of taking it off of my bill he offered me a free beer on my next visit. Eventually I'll cash in my beer.  The manager handled the situation with such poise and understanding.   This place has a private lot with indoor and outdoor seating. Check it out and be mindful of the prices!

reviews.author: Robert R.
reviews.description: Great beer selection and staff. The beer tenders are knowledgeable and the property is clean. L

reviews.author: Theresa W.
reviews.description: Our go to local hangout for craft beer. They are a "growler"  station, so they don't brew their own beer. They frequently rotate out their tap selection so you can normally find some thing new and to your liking. Good selection of all types of beer, some from local breweries and some from across Texas. We enjoy the outside patio as there are  a couple of picnic benches with umbrellas. The shopping  center itself has music playing and it's always soothing. The inside is just a few picnic benches and a little to dark inside for my tastes, so we normally sit outside. This girl is solar powered!  They don't serve, food, but there are several restaurants In the same center and you can order and they will bring it over to you.

reviews.author: Hanna D.
reviews.description: Big Hops is now our favorite date night. Sometimes it's planned, sometimes it's "Let's go to Big Hops" and the other person's eyes light up.  We've been here multiple times. With friends and without friends. Their service is great, we always love the rotational beers, and it's extremely clean. If you order 1000 Degrees pizza next door, they'll even come by and bring it to your table.  What's not to like about beer, pizza, sports on tv, and a chill environment? Whether it be a random weekday, a Friday night, or a weekend. This place is hands down my favorite brewery in SA!

reviews.author: Gabrielle L.
reviews.description: Great spot, great selection. Cozy pub feel with a blend of high class taste. I really enjoy going here and always find something I want to have again. Will continue to go, and recommend to anyone who likes beer.

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: The quintessential after work bar. I've spent time here after brutal Mondays, stressful Wednesdays when I thought the week would never end, and celebratory Fridays.   Don't get too attached to a beer on their menu. They rotate frequently, which is cool, because it forces you to try something new with almost every visit. The staff is friendly and works hard to get you served in a timely manner.  The tables are graffitied to hell and back, which gives the space interesting character, and this is the only bar in town that I know of that plays The Growlers and The Allah-Las without a patron using an internet jukebox. That alone makes this spot worth coming back to. (That and it's walking distance from work and right next to a pizza shop)  Stick around on Wednesday nights for pub trivia, and swing by during a holiday or special event--you might score a free glass to take home.

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: I'm not a beer drinker but the apple pineapple cider by Bishop is amazing. Like the chill atmosphere. They have a free bingo game you can play to win tickets for the San Antonio beer festival and other prizes. Prices range from $5.50 to $18 depending on what size you get. I heard you can order food from next door and they will deliver it to you. They have reverse happy hour from 10p to close. Nice bartender.

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: When everyone's at 3 dollar sunday at flying saucer, pay a few more bucks and head over to big hops huebner where the crowd is smaller, but the bartenders are more attentive. I truly enjoy grabbing a copy of the SA Current by the door, ordering a 9% IPA and sitting down with my love while sipping some of SA's finest craft beer. There's TV's overhead for sports games and next door there's a jimmy john's if you are feeling hungry afterwards and the newest build-your-own pizza place 1000 degrees. The restrooms are very clean and probably the cleanest I've seen at any bar honestly, because they are SPOTLESS. If you want to feel some of SA's rare wind take a seat outside on the back tables in the patio area. Cheers!

reviews.author: Jeff R.
reviews.description: Amazingly friendly bar tenders and great daily specials. I can here after hiking Guadalupe Peak and was greeted with a variety of perfect celebratory craft beers. The locals are quite welcoming. Shout out to the obnoxious lady who love boxing more than anything and swore more than a sailor.

reviews.author: Steven M.
reviews.description: Have been trying to find more IPA and craft beer focused places around town, getting into beer tasting as of lately so I thought I would start here; When I arrived, the Huebner location was very cozy and small, just my kinda bar! The vibe was very chill and laid back, the lighting was very relaxing, not too bright but enough to see the entire bar. The bartender I dealt with was very friendly and attentive, at first I was picking random things from the menu, but then I requested his recommendations since I know very little about IPA's; he was very informative and looked like he enjoyed his job (big points).   The place was very clean and tidy, the layout to sit was unique, I chose to sit by the window on a bar stool as to not take up a table that could sit people with more than one guest. The place does fill up very quickly on a busy night such as watching the game, or the night I went was apparently trivia night so people came in and the seats filled up fast. It's a shoe box size kind of location with good size tv's and a sound system, they even have a deck out back to enjoy the weather which I loved.   The beer selection was very diverse and it's something to periodically come back and check was new beers are on the rotation, the price wasn't bad at all either for the kind of beers they were serving.   Took one star away due to the trivia night people turning off the television while I was watching it, and proceeded to act like I didn't even exist, I was watching the Spurs game and having a good time; then they proceeded to set up their equipment around me where I was sitting as if I didn't even exist. I found it completely rude and even tried acknowledging them since the game was only in the 2nd quarter, but they completely blew me off. So just a fair warning about the trivia night people.   Other than that, I would def come back again but NOT on trivia night.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: BIG UPS TO BIG HOPS.Â  Rookies beware, there could be an awkward moment when the bartender asks you what you'd like and you're just staring like a zombie at the flashing screen of rotating beer selections. If this kind of moment is something you'd like to avoid, I've found the website is up-to-date, that way you can make your decision before leaving home, and be cool and confident when you walk in. This is a small bar serving beer-only with about a zillion options to choose from everyday. The place is simple enough: L shaped bar, 6 or 7 tables around that, and a few TVs with one showing everything on tap that day. There's a patio somewhere past the rest rooms, but I haven't ever made it back there. And that's about it. If you're into beer what else could you ask for? The vibe is grungy. Corrugated metal, stickers on the walls, and scruffy beards are everywhere.Â Â Your flannel jacket and your stained t-shirt are equally appropriate. It's casual. Bring food if you're hungry. You can also stumble down the sidewalk and bring something back. There is a lot to choose from nearby.

reviews.author: Shane J.
reviews.description: Great beer but if I had a bartender sitting out back smoking cigarettes while customers are waiting I'd fire them and hire some quality staff.    Unbelievable....maybe think about setting some guidelines for your employees.

reviews.author: Zoila G.
reviews.description: Big hops is a great place to chill after work, catch a game and catch up with friends. There's a great selection of brews and the staff is always great. I've attended a few pint nights here and it does it a bit busy if glassware is given with purchase of that breweries beer.   Bring your growler and enjoy! If you forget your growler don't worry, there's Crowlers!!!!

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Came in to meet some friends for a drink. Big Hops is a small joint that is always chill. Had a Shackbury, Ace, Rhapsody, and Cigar City along with a few others I can't name. Staff was friendly and the place wasn't too busy. Good spot to hang with your friends.

reviews.author: Apryl C.
reviews.description: Honestly, any place with good beer and a soccer game is a winner in my book! This place carries a great variety of beers on tap. Find one you like and want to take home? They've got growlers for that!   I recommend gulping down an Brash Abide  white Russian Milk Stout. This beer goes down smooth and leaves you wanting more. It is the White Russian of beers, and I seriously can't get enough! I also tried the Pineapple Thai Basil by Collective Brewing Company. The name in itself made me curious and I just had to try it. I mean, basil, in a beer! It's a sour beer, which I normally steer clear of, but the flavor in this brew intrigued my tastebuds.  If you like something, get it before it's gone! The greats don't last long!

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: I like Big Hops a lot. It's a small, friendly bar with cool music, screens for Spurs games, and friendly beertenders. What more do you need?  First, the BH is located in some random shopping center off huebner in the back. Kind of out of the way but not really. It's a really small space with limited seating--several benches, bar seating, and a small outdoor area in the back.   It's a cool first date type place because it's usually not too loud and, depending on when you go, not usually too crowded. I went on May 4th and they were tapping a special keg w/ glass and it got super packed--like uncomfortably so--but I think that was just because it was a special occasion.   They have a variety of beers on a rotating tap--plenty of Texas beers--and others from around the way. This season they have Bells on tap so I have been spending some time there. I love all Bells beer, especially Oberon, their spring/summer beer.  Um prices are on par with other craft beer places. That's about it I guess. Check them out if you're in the area.

reviews.author: Jenn N.
reviews.description: One of my favorite goandto spots to grab a cold one. Walking in, the atmosphere is dimly lit with it's namesake boasting in neon lights behind the bar. The draft list is digital so it's always updated and you can even find recent Untappd check-ins displayed as well. Although no food, Big Hops let's you bring in pizza from next door! The staff is wonderful and very inclusive even when they are providing no more than five minutes of service.

reviews.author: James B.
reviews.description: Lots of good beers, good goat burger. Heated outdoor seating. Music was a bit eclectic. My plan was to try a couple breweries. But I ended up just enjoying a few different beers from here. Best place in Boerne for food or beer.  I forgot. Tipping is Not allowed here.

reviews.author: MatouÅ¡ P.
reviews.description: We have enjoyed coming here for quite some time, always giving it a five star. This visit was average at best.  Nobody wiped down our really dirty table. After asking twice, I went and got the cleaning supplies myself to clean the food and spilled drinks off the table. Really, it should have been done right after bussing it.  Our pretzels came out luke warm but edible. We were not given any utinsels / napkins at the check out or when the food was brought. It seemed like the beers and ciders were much more limited than a couple months ago.  As for food, I ordered the fish tacos, which I have had before. This time they were mainly slaw with a few tiny pieces of fish.   We also ordered the pork chop but after ordering and paying we were advised that they were out. We subbed in the burger which was okay but nothing special.  Getting flimsy plastic fork and knife instead of real silverware (or decent quality plastic) was a bit of a challenge for cutting the burger, I can only imagine how it would have been with the pork chop.   We will be back, but are in no hurry.   We appreciate that they are dog friendly, so an extra point for that.

reviews.author: Kerri B.
reviews.description: Great spot! Was in town for a wedding and had to check out a local brewery...highly recommend!   Wicked cute front porch area with picnic tables and outside back patio has a small stage for live music. Food is tasty and beer is delicious!

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: Great spot in town to grab a bite and local brewed beer. There's live music outside with heaters to keep warm during colder days and nights. There's parking along the street and the side street plus in the back. You can also buy beer cans to take home.

reviews.author: Caitlin O.
reviews.description: Not disappointed to say the least! The Boerne Blonde was amazing! The Wurst Puppies were better than any "hush puppies" I've ever eaten, anywhere and the Main Street tacos were  Really good chill, hang out spot! Had been wanting to come here since we moved from SA to Boerne, needless to say we will definitely be regulars here!!

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: Stopped in unexpectedly for a quick lunch and will need to get back by. Very cool place with some great looking beers to choose from.  I had the burger and my son had the brisket cheese fries. The burger was very tasty, zero complaints! Nice serving of fries comes with it.  The brisket cheese fries stole the show though! Big mound of fries, really good brisket (and I normally won't try brisket if the places isn't smoking it on-site), and the cheese sauce is quite good, although you need to know it isn't Tex-Mex style queso.  Because of the situation, I had ice tea...I wanted a beer! I'll definitely be back to try one!  Follow me on Instagram @CheatDay_SA

reviews.author: stacie k.
reviews.description: We love this place! We always stop by whenever we are in town! Cute and spacious outdoors patio that wraps around the building. They have swings and a large connect four game. Pet and kid friendly (changing station in restroom). The food is delicious! Their goat burger, fish tacos, and chicken sliders are yummy! Friendly staff and on their menu it says no tipping necessary since they pay their staff well. Also great location to check out Main Street and enjoy the river as well!

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: I want to preface this with saying that we did attend Cibolo during the local Boerne Christmas parade, so they were SWAMPED. For that reason I am giving their food a complete pass on this review. It took awhile and came out cold, BUT I could tell it was high quality and I will be trying it again on a much less festive occasion. Their beer is quality stuff. I tried their seasonal Pumpkin Spice IPA along with another of their usual IPA's and I came away impressed. The one thing is, and again it was very busy, their beer menu chalkboard was a little chaotic and hard to follow. I would highly recommend Cibolo, and I am looking forward to trying it again. A good experience with the food and a little more time to read the menu could easily change this review to a 5 star spot.

reviews.author: Kyle E.
reviews.description: This place is the cutest place, with amazing food, fantastic beer and clean restrooms (an important thing during this crazy pandemic). Highly recommend the goat cheese burger (the fries that come with are damn near perfect in crunch and flavor) and the grapefruit shandy ... both were so good. We just moved here from Dallas and this might be my new favorite place. Five stars, for sure!

reviews.author: Braxton G.
reviews.description: Possibly best burger I've ever had. Stopped in after seeing goat burger reviews. It was better than a review can express. The house brewed cow was also really good as well. In fact everything we had from "nachos" to meal was on point. If you're passing through this is a must stop.

reviews.author: Linda B.
reviews.description: The sandwiches are both generous in taste and size! Would recommend a stop for lunch to everyone!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: AH-mazing!!! My husband and I were hiking Guadalupe State Park and decided to venture over to Boerne before it got too crowded. We stopped at Cibolo Creek Brewing. It's seat yourself and order at the bar. We sat out back (quiet without traffic) with our pup. The beers are SO delicious and made so well!! The Blonde has a German spin to it. We had the pretzels for an appetizer and wow the flavors of the cheese dip and mustard (kinda spicy mustard and I hate mustard but it was good). My husband ordered the friend chicken biscuits and gravy. Amazing!! More like a chipotle gravy and thick and sooo filling and rich! We was in Heaven!   I had the Chicken Fried Chicken on a potato bun- I am not a friend chicken person (maybe 1x a year), and I got it with the jalapeÃ±o lime wing sauce. Holy hell! Just spicy enough (not too much) but perfect! So filling and amazing and the fries had a homemade vinegary ketchup with them. Get this! Awesome! It started getting crowded with a lot of kids, but deff go early if that's not your thing. Awesome service and no tipping allowed!

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: I need you to focus for just a few minutes.....  This place is off the charts! I live in Houston and anytime I'm even remotely close to Boerne I make it a point to stop here for a beverage and a meal. There is plenty of seating inside in the AC but also outside,    for the beverages  I chose  the  Boerne Blonde  and then an October Fest , the entree I ate was chicken fried chicken sandwich it was amazing, obviously hand breaded and fried on a homemade bun with fresh cut fries, one additional tasty treat was the house ketchup with a touch of star anise. The chicken was moist, the bun extra flavorful..... the homemade fries are on point too, my wife ate the Meze plate, it consisted of the best hummus,  marinated feta, tomato carrots, and cucumbers, olives and pita bread with a drizzle of a balsamic glaze..... everything was perfect if you are looking for a destination date spot to make a great impression this is the place  Look I'm telling you to try this place and you will be hooked like the rest of us dont forget to tell them jimmy sent you!

reviews.author: Melva S.
reviews.description: The brewery offers flavorful beer the best in Boerne without a doubt. The food is exquisite I love that they have a variety to chose from and suggest pairing a brew with your food locally owned  family oriented and pet friendly in door outdoor did I mention that they have live music and Ice Cream

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Parking: this is a small town with all the kindness of a small town. Park on the side streets or behind an establishment and walk around.   This is our second time here but our first time eating dinner. We loved every bite I don't know what's in the ketchup but I really liked it too. The chicken sandwich was great and tasty and you get plenty of fries. My wife ordered the chicken salad sliders and she said those were some of the best she's tasted. I gave them a try too and I agree. They have plenty of beer and wine to choose from too.   Seating outside front and in the back!! Pick your favorite spot and throw your feet up and relax. We love coming here and also grabbing a loaf of bread at the bear moon bakery down the street!!   Social distancing enforced so don't worry!!

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: Not a bad place to try some "home brew" tasting beer and burgers on rolls. The place is clean, the people are very friendly. It's a kid friendly family environment, not a place to act up and cut loose for sure. Limited parallel parking along a busy street. 85.00 for 3 burgers and 4 beers. No tipping allowed because the staff is paid a living wage, a plus for sure.  Tried 4 beers, Blonde, October fest, whisky sour and the IPA and all have the home brew unfiltered thick grainy after taste but they are decent, as good as my home brew at least.   Major draw back is the food and drink ordering is at the bar so getting another beer is a long wait.  As patrons take their time studying the menu while others stand in line for a refill time can be passed by conversation with the locals or admiring art for sale on the wall, it doesn't seem to bother anyone and I didn't mind but I wouldn't make this my regular place for this reason, I recommend a dedicated bartender for alcohol only and food orders could do both.   FYI everyone is nice here

reviews.author: Mechila B.
reviews.description: I have no desire to come to this restaurant again.  1. The person who took our order was snippy with us. Whatever.  2. My friends got the blueberry lemonade and it tasted weird and not sweet enough.  3. My friend got the chicken sandwich and it had absolutely no flavoring and seemed to be more batter and crust than actual chicken.  4. I got the wings and fries. My fries came 10 min before my food... so I had to send them back when my food came.  5. The wings were so tiny  it was actually funny how small they were lol.  6. The ranch was the most redeeming thing about this place!! ABSOLUTELY AMAZING RANCH YUM YUM YUM!  7. Our server was also very very nice and helpful.  Overall this place was disappointing :(((

reviews.author: Amy R.
reviews.description: **don't get fish taco***** Love coming here . And love their burger better than anywhere else! BUT today I had fish taco and it was horrible. Just horrible. No flavor , it's just boring.  And when I got my plate the tortilla was so soft already that it was breaking half already. Totally waste.

reviews.author: Erin C.
reviews.description: One of the best burgers I've ever had. I said,"wow" at least three times out loud. The fries were perfect and I like their special take on ketchup

reviews.author: Candice H.
reviews.description: A lot of the dishes posted online were not on the menu. Pretzels they were out of , which was on the special bd. Got the enchiladas,  flavor of meat was good but tortillas were hard and there was a solid cup of sour cream drizzled on top. Rice beans very bland but cooked correctly. Husband got the chicken sandwich , was tender but needed a sauce with flavor fries needed salt but none to be found. Service , it's walk up ordering at the bar area. Tips are included in the price of food which is cool but unusual. We asked for silver ware and got one setting. We told the bartender we wanted to pay cash , but he still asked for a card and ran the tab as credit. Super odd. Seems like the locals get the concept. I went for pretzels and brisket fries. Both were not available. A lot of the reviews are pre covid. All the servers were polite and food came quickly. Average at best .....

name: Burleson Yard Beer Garden
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I have been coming to this place for a few months at least once a month for a book club.  The place has a menu that changes regularly and old favorites to keep you coming back. My favorite are the deluxe tots with the over easy egg on top.  They also have a great Happy Hour that you can check out on Facebook.  I highly recommend their frozen Margaritas too.    The place has ample parking and there are a lot of cool local shops in the same area, like a plant shop. There is also great indoor/outdoor seating.  You place your food and drink orders at the bar and pickup your food outside when your buzzer goes off. Also, huge plus is that it is pet friendly.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Came here with some friends and this place was awesome! Lots of open seating for good social distancing. Dog and kid friendly. Areas for games and even a playground. There is a stage for live music and when we visited the one man band was great.

reviews.author: Ana S.
reviews.description: We came here for St. Patrick's day with family.  It's hidden but very nicely decorated. The atmosphere was relaxed, I particularly loved their food. Margaritas are not my first pick but my nephew recommended them, they were too strong to enjoy the taste.  It was a busy night and our first time there as well, we walked up to a long line to place our orders. When we finally reached the front the bartender looked and sounded a little frustrated. Her customer service can use a little refreshing.  Be careful when placing your order there is a tree root sticking out which tripped many people including myself. Overall I would return solely for the food not so much their drinks

reviews.author: Melanie O.
reviews.description: Came here on a Saturday when they had a vegan market going on and really enjoyed ourselves! They have plenty of seating inside and outside and a good selection of beers on tap. We stayed inside and felt like it was quiet enough to have a conversation despite how busy it was and if you like the louder atmosphere, they had a DJ outside.

reviews.author: Christopher W.
reviews.description: Great beer garden perfectly located for bike social rides. This was the place where I had my first real michelada. They also feature a menu full of frozen margaritas in many different flavors. The perfect refreshment before and after the ride.

reviews.author: Jair O.
reviews.description: Great outdoor venue for socially distanced drinks and food. My friend ordered 5 different beers, ranging from IPAs to sours, and they were all delicious! Our second round included frozen margaritas - my personal favorite was the prickly pear, though the mango was enjoyable as well.   The menu was short and sweet, but the Korean bbq wings were spicy and delicious, and the fries were exceptionally crispy and hot. I was impressed.  Great atmosphere and crowd in the evening, and a band was playing live music all throughout. It was a bit loud for my taste, but still possible to hold a conversation. Would definitely return again!

reviews.author: Justine S.
reviews.description: Great place! It's a very large outdoor space with lots of tables so even when it feels busy it's still socially distanced. Big selection of beer, great margaritas, and the hamburger is SO good and the fries are even better. Wings are great too. I've only been during the daytime when it's very family friendly, with a playground and trains periodically running by which the kids seem to love staring at. I've been there on both Saturday and Sunday afternoons and we've never had an issue getting a table (although as the weather gets hotter, finding a table in the shade might get tougher!)

reviews.author: Bea C.
reviews.description: Visited Monday, after a long walk from the Pearl To Alamo. It was closed. So we were disappointed. We saw Burleson, which somehow I thought it was so much further out.  It's across the street!!  When we got there, we were welcomed with a friendly smile.  I got a chamoy margarita which was delicious. It hit the spot after walking in the sun.  We ate there and I got the burger, it was great! My husband got the chicken sandwich and he said it was the best!  Great place to hang out at. I enjoyed my time there. I almost catnapped a grey kitty that was roaming around.  It was such a nice find! Glad we finally got to visit!

reviews.author: Adriana S.
reviews.description: Where fun meets trains. When you're at a crossroads. Do you have some fun or a lot of fun or none train sty

reviews.author: JG W.
reviews.description: Bro... been here three times and got kicked out twice. After like two shots. Fuck this place and the soft ass bartenders  they pay to much attention to your business instead of pouring drinks like they're paid to do. They're bartenders not security, they should stop trying to intervene in shit they're not supposed to do. My brother in law said she looked like an ex and she cut us off because of that. Sorry that you're insecure and ugly but don't take that out on us

reviews.author: Desiree B.
reviews.description: I loved this place! The margaritas are strong and it's very spacious. Staff wears masks, there's hand sanitizer and a food truck outside. This is a fun safe place to hang out with while still being safe.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Live music outside and plenty of seating. Very dive bar feel. The burgers are actually not bad and the tater tots are crispy.   Suggestions- Covered outdoor seating available if its raining  Moose Out

reviews.author: Kelli J.
reviews.description: Such a cute place - great for when the weathers nice and you wanna relax and grab a drink outside. They also have indoor seating. Like the name suggests they have an extensive beer list. They also have wine but no liquor. The frozen margs are wine based and seemed too be a hit amongst the crowd. I tried the canned rosÃ¨ - $12 enough for 2 glasses. Nothing fancy about the place but overall a good time. Also good for kids!

reviews.author: Fernando V.
reviews.description: Love Burleson. IF Mother Nature is bring fear this is the perfect place to sit out hanging out with friends enjoying a few drinks is and playing Somme games. I think how it's also a family friendly place with a fenced in outdoor area and play scape for kids

reviews.author: Bridgette R.
reviews.description: This is my updated review of Burleson. My husband and I went there on Friday night and the vibe was awesome. There was a great DJ playing excellent music. I had 2 Sky Trooper IPAs and I loved it. And I had my first burger there and it was FREAKING DELISH. It was char-grilled perfection. The bun was also char-grilled to perfection. It is a thin patty and the fixings are simple, lettuce, tomato, onion I think, mustard, and maybe pickles. It was a classic American burger. No frills, just thrills.   Then I thought about this burger every day since and we decided to go there today and bring the whole family. It was a Monday and I have been told to never go out to eat on a Monday b/c the regular chef/kitchen staff are not on duty. But who knows if that is even true or not.  Anyway.....I ordered 2 BURGERS for myself. That is how good I thought they were. And before I forget, the FRIES are the BOMB!!!!  I had my first bite of this Monday afternoon burger and I have to say I was disappointed. The bun was barely toasted and the char-grilled flavor was not as significant. The bun I could tell was a wee bit old and a wee bit dry. I was sad. The burger wasn't bad but it wasn't the burger I had on Friday night which was SUPER CRAZY AWESOME. What happened Burleson?   I still love your vibe and I will still make this my happy place for sure and I am hoping this was a fluke.   And another really cool thing I have to share from our Monday visit is that their coke was running a bit weak so the bartender brought us bottled cokes instead and didn't charge us extra. We didn't even ask for this nor did we complain about the soda he just noticed and brought them to us of his own volition. The staff is so nice here and I LOVE the place.  People are always having a great time here. You can bring the dog, the fam, or friends and just chillax yourself.  Please take care of that burger.

reviews.author: Samantha K.
reviews.description: First visit... the wings were delicious and the margaritas strong. This is a great happy hour spot.

reviews.author: Stephanie M.
reviews.description: Came to this location and I'm from Houston so It's obviously me and my husbands first time. We ordered margaritas which were fine and we ordered  one order of deluxe fries and deluxe tots and let me say they ain't nothing deluxe about em! It's fries or tots with basically pick de Gallo on it and jalapeÃ±os. I read it had bacon and melted cheese! Which it did have melted cheese but just the shredded cheese. They give you a side of ranch or ketchup â€ those are not sides to go with this chilli would have been better. The cashier was sweet but failed to tell me that we pick up our food outside not inside at the bar and that a number for our order was on our receipt. We waited for a little while before I had to ask and when I did I mentioned I didn't know that. That should've been the first thing she mentioned to me. Other than the mis communication it's an ok place. Kinda small for a beer garden. Seating isn't bad and parking isn't bad either.

reviews.author: Lindsi P.
reviews.description: I just found this place to be mediocre at best. There are better beer gardens in SA with a lot more beer/food options.  The nachos we ordered were nothing special in my opinion, they did load on the toppings but this caused the chips to get soggy fast.  My favorite part was petting all the dogs...

reviews.author: Cindy C.
reviews.description: Tonight is my second time here. The first time was on a Saturday and what a wonderful experience it was!  There is indoor seating with plenty of televisions to enjoy sports and the bar opens up to the patio area. It was definitely an enjoyable experience the FIRST time. Tonight, however, different!  When we decided to come here we hadn't looked at the hours and got here about 11:20 pm. They close at midnight. No big deal. The ALCS game is in extra innings tonight and the one bartender couldn't be more upset that this is interfering with his close time. The entire time we have been here he has been complaining about the people in here and how this game and people walking in are interfering with him going home. I definitely get it, but it is not good for business.   This is definitely worth a try, but don't you dare come in close to closing!

reviews.author: Mary G.
reviews.description: Considering the restrictions due to Covid-19 we had a great time just like before. Glad this place was open to enjoy great drinks and great conversations with friends  until next time  stay safe

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: The unintended effect of transplants coming to San Antonio cannot be discounted. Areas a generation that seemed overlooked are coming alive. Thus the same warehouse in the Westside that houses "Shotgun Coffee Roasters"  becomes an intermediary. A coffeehouse, a brewery in the Westside? Say it isn't so but at least for now our city is experiencing a renaissance of sorts . As a result more unique businesses are hedging their bets, opening up  in our city. Which brings me to the Vista Brewing Company.   I could go on, using flowery verbage to describe my experience here but why. So I will give you the rundown. Parking is very problematic. You can park in residential areas but be careful. Vehicles come down the street and like Sammy Hagar "They can't drive 55!" It's housed in the same building as "Shotgun Coffee Roasters" an excellent coffeehouse by the way. It is really small with some indoor seating with more outdoors. So basically you go to the counter and order your pour. The taplist while a bit limited has something for everyone. I settled on their "Middle Trinity" a Belgian Tripel. I would remiss if I didn't comment on the tapmasters as they are friendly.  My understanding is that this is their third location the other two being: Beecave and Driftwood. While they don't serve food in the foreseeable future they will have rotating foodtrucks. I must admit the beer I had was not too bad. It was much more sweeter, boozier than I anticpated. So sitting here I did have a critique. Since this area is close by an open ravine there appeared to be an insect issue. I was bit a few times and shooed off mosquitoes whilst drinking my beer. I hope they consider bringing in a pest controller periodically.  Still I recommend coming here. It is a unique addition to this area. A brewery in the Westside? I never thought I would imagine seeing one here in my lifetime. The Vista Brewing Company is a charming place with good beers and service to match. Will patrons  that never frequent this area venture outside their comfort zone to come here? I don't know. Time will tell. Next time I come I'm drinking inside.

reviews.author: Paulo D.
reviews.description: Cool hidden spot to get some good beers and enjoy the weather. They have the coffee roasters next door so this is a good place to work/study or just relax. Beer is also great.

reviews.author: Joseph A.
reviews.description: Visited on a Saturday afternoon and this place was super chill. Bartender was very friendly and had good suggestions. Great spot, - the converted warehouse it's in is very cool and outdoor area was nice. Beers were light and crisp. I had the American Pale Ale and  the weizen and would recommend both (nice day-drinking beers ). I do not typically like wheat beers because I find them too heavy, but theirs was light but full of flavor.  Looking forward to visiting again soon.

reviews.author: Joe V.
reviews.description: In a very cool spot next to shotgun roasters. Some really good beer, I recommend the lambic style Grato or the juicy IPA. We stayed inside and had a great time. I'm excited to try their next offerings.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: One of my favorite craft beer spots in San Antonio. The rotation of taps makes it fun to experience. You may have the same beer twice but you may not. Always something new to try in a calm chill environment. The variety of TVs keep it interesting and the patio is great during the summer.

reviews.author: gedaph d.
reviews.description: My husband and I have been to Big Hops a few times now. We were so excited to find it so close to our house! We are IPA fans and Big Hops has some delightful choices.  Their employees are super inviting and friendly plus very informed about their beers. We have gotten wonderful recommendations from them. Can't wait to go ba

reviews.author: kev c.
reviews.description: Decent rotating beer list. They also allow for half pours so you dont have to get 10oz of a 10% beer, back to back. They also allow outside food to be brought in or delivered. The only reason not 5 stars is with only one person working, the wait can get a bit long.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Stopped by for a beer while waiting for a table at a nearby restaurant. They have a good selection of beer and even have cider and mead. If you're in need of a snack, they sell pretzels and popcorn. It looks like they have happy hour and on Mondays happy hour is all day.   The place has inside and outside seating. Parking is shared with the other businesses, but there's plenty.

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! They allow you to bring in your own food. They have a large  selection of beers and a few cans of wine. The atmosphere is very relaxing, it has a feel of of a sports bar. The staff is very nice as well.

reviews.author: Al P.
reviews.description: It's located in the middle of shopping center with outside and inside seating. The bartender was very helpful in offering up suggestions and there was large selection of craft beers from many Texas breweries.

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: This is my favorite location out of all the Big Hop locations, not just because it's super close to my house but the guest service is phenomenal! Not only are the beer connoisseur knowledgeable but the have a great sense of humor and easy going. I never feel rushed and they give great descriptions of the brews.   I chose their flight which is $9 for 4 options. I chose mostly IPAs but not sure what the exact ones I tried but everything was so good and I've been several times after this they always have opportunities to grab a free glassware with purchase of beer of course!   The location is so convenient and I love their beer options. I will be going here any chance I get to get my IPA fix and to try some new options!

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: This location is fairly small. It is Located in a shopping center. Nice draft beer selection and canned beers. Want some food? you can order pizza from the place next door.  Small front patio with 4 picnic tables. We just want to check out this new location.    It's not close to home so I'll keep driving out to the Huebner location but if it's close to you and you are looking for a neighborhood bar stop by and check it out.

reviews.author: Bryan B.
reviews.description: Love their tap variety, they get some things that you can't find everywhere, and I love that! The people are friendly and knowledgeable and I appreciate their hospitably. Big Hops has my heart!!

reviews.author: Kat B.
reviews.description: Big Hops across SA are great but this one is our favorite.  Helpful staff, great beer - what could be better? Though the music tends to be a little loud to have conversation.  They have events most every day too - happy hour, trivia night, etc.  No food here but they are totally cool with bringing in food to enjoy with more than 30 seasonal taps.  Lots of TVs too and outdoor seating for those rare perfect SA days. Board games and cards too. Overall great place!

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: Quiet but great beer options if you are one of those loner beer drinkers such as I sometimes..but who isn't right..right? This is one of those places you can take an edition of the current and read it with a tall pint of beer. There beer options are endless, they have an app, they scroll across a TV, there is a TV. When I went I saw a dog competition, enjoyed my beer which was the SA Beer Weep 8 hop beer and talked to my boyfriend about how awesome this place was. Great service!

reviews.author: Monique R.
reviews.description: My friend and I decided to check out Big Hoops on Shanefield. Their location is quaint, and very welcoming. They have 4 other locations in San Antonio. I thought they been open for a while now, however this was their 3rd day of being open. As a celebratory post opening, we offer chocolate cake. Such a nice detail. We the only customers in there, but I bet once word gets out it will be very busy. Daniel and Maryla (?) were exceptional and great customer service!!! We will definitely be back because of them. I had a Austin Eastcider Blood Orange and my friend stuck to the IPA route.  Everything was reasonable priced, and in the future they are supposed weekly specials. Bring your growlers to get filled here. They also sell crowler's as well.

reviews.author: Liz M.
reviews.description: We love the selection they have. The atmosphere and concept are awesome as well. Unfortunately the female server is extremely rude and unwelcoming. I'm not really sure what her problem is but customer service is her job and she is seriously lacking. I'm not sure if it's cuz I had use my military ID (didn't have my license) or its because I am a female but wow. I've never had worse service than this in my entire life. Hopefully next time we come there is someone else because I honestly feel degraded.

reviews.author: Matt M.
reviews.description: My favorite spot to come get a craft beer. Would love if they expanded their music taste to country music though.

reviews.author: Annabelle L.
reviews.description: They never fail to serve a great IPA, customer service is always great and the atmosphere is so welcoming. We've been here a handful of times and always get a good recommendation from their tap list and ALWAYS a good time.

reviews.author: Alicia T.
reviews.description: This is a great place to fill up growlers and go OR to hang out with friends. The offer a diverse selection of local craft beers. They even have a few ciders, meads, and fruit beers. Big Hops hosts events like Trivia Night, they welcome outside food. We love to grab a pizza from Stout's Pizza next door!  They have limited seating both inside and outside. The staff is patient and welcoming. Stop by for a cold brew or two; they have something for everyone!

reviews.author: K.C. L.
reviews.description: This is the best thing on this side Of town when it comes to beer. I personally love the location because it's right behind my apartment I can walk there. The staff is super chill and very knowledgeable on what they have on tap. I always get a warm greeting when I come in. Their beer/cider selection is pretty great. You can also download the app untappd and view their beer menu on the app so that way you're not holding up the line lol. All in all I freaking love big hops. They have a valued customer here!

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: Beer choices are fantastic! The staff is very friendly and they really make you feel at home. This is our go to place to try new beer. Ultimately I'd love to see another/different sweet cider on tap!

reviews.author: Randy A.
reviews.description: What an awesome establishment! The beer selection is great. They have a good atmosphere with a few tables inside and out they also have a few games for you and your friends to enjoy well drinking some cold ones.   *** recommend this establishment ***

reviews.author: J. R. F.
reviews.description: So happy to have Big Hops on this side of town! As usual for this chain, they have a solid beer selection, friendly and knowledgeable staff, and a welcoming atmosphere. While it's probably the smallest of all the locations, there is seating available outside.

name: Yard House
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Brianna M.
reviews.description: Stephanie G at the bar was super sweet and a great server!!!! I had a issue with my steak and she took care of it right away. Everyone is very helpful and nice!

reviews.author: Jillian P.
reviews.description: Epic location, epic draft beer selection.  Come for the beer and stay for the views! They have an epic selection of local beer on tap (see photo). We came for lunch and I had to sample some San Antonio brews.  Ended up trying the Honey Blonde ale and Nitro Pecan Porter. Both are worthy of repeating. For food, we started with Miguel's Queso (creamy with a kick, definitely cheese-forward). Then we shared a plate of vampire tacos and the chicken avocado sandwich.  The sandwich was just OK, but the tacos were excellent! Soft flour tortillas coated in cheese and fried to a crisp... What's not to love??!  Would come back after dark for views of the river walk.

reviews.author: Nigel D.
reviews.description: Very disappointed with our experience here at the Yard House.   Our server was all over it one minute then she would disappear and you wouldn't see her again for ages.  I ordered a second beer half way through my meal and didn't receive it until about 5 minutes after I finished my meal.     As for the food, our cheese curds appetizer was probably the highlight of the meal.  My wife has a Caesar Kale salad with Chicken and the Chicken Tortilla Soup. The chicken was very salty and the soup came out barely warm.   I ordered the fish and chips and the fish had been fried so long I honestly thought when they put it down in front of me I was being pranked.  It was almost the color of a brownie, but no it wasn't a prank!   The fish was a thick filet so thankfully once I touched the batter and it exploded into 10,000 pieces the fish inside was still somewhat edible.    When it came to paying our bill we used the machine on the end of the table but it turned out to be out of receipt paper.  We were traveling on business so had to have a receipt for expense purposes.  We ended up having to wait about 10 minutes for our server to appear and tell her what we needed.  She disappeared for 10 minutes then came back with the wrong receipt.   It took another 5 minutes for her to return with the correct receipt.  If you are coming here for classic rock.  Unless you consider Ah Ha - Take on me and  other similar 90's pop Classic Rock then you are probably going to be disappointed.

reviews.author: Aaron R.
reviews.description: The pizza was so good. Thin and packed with delicious condiments in every bite. Eight slices were enough for just me and the crushed peppers were the finishing touch. The tea absent from this picture was as good too. Flavor wise it was what I needed and wanted.  The service was so friendly and always making sure we had enough to drink. The waiting time was around 20 minutes on a busy weekend downtown but worth the wait. They had screens all around showing a sport's game. The sitting was comfortable and the noice level very reasonable.   I would definitely come again and keep on trying their different options and enjoying either the view you can get or just watch a game. I can say I recommend it hundred percent. Provecho!

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: I was recently in San Antonio and decided to try the Yard House restaurant near my hotel. I had never dined at a Yard House before. I wasn't certain what to order, but I wanted a big healthy salad and I ordered their large Cobb salad.
