(mixed greens, baby tomatoes, edamame, carrots, radish, egg, bleu cheese, corn, bacon, avocado, ranch) I was very surprised by the size of the salad and with the variety of items it consisted of. It was so good and I know that I took more than half of it home for a second meal. I'm definitely going back to Yard House to order this big salad again!

reviews.author: Jerome M.
reviews.description: I'm a fan of Yard House as I been to a couple just to watch the games and have a few beers. This one did not disappoint. Went straight to the bar and ordered a few beers and the Korean BBQ Cheesesteak. This was perfectly made. The meat was tender and tasty, perfect amount of cheese and the bread wasn't hard. I love cheesesteaks and this Korean version was awesome. I also had the fries and they were crispy and perfectly cut as they weren't too thin or too thick. Great meal, highly recommend!

reviews.author: Jamie P.
reviews.description: While visiting San Antonio for a convention, our hotel was located across from Yard House, which made it super convenient. We visited late on our first night, around 9pm, and it was still busy. I would assume people visiting the river walk keep this location consistently busy. We ended up sitting at the bar since it was only two of us and could skip the wait.   We order the Zoodle bowl with shrimp and the Steak Bowl. Both were very good! I was surprised how much I enjoyed the zoodles since it was my first time trying them. The price was a little steep, but there were quite a few shrimp to make up for it. Service was fairly consistent and we enjoyed our dinner!

reviews.author: Cat T.
reviews.description: It was great until my boyfriend and I both saw a (maybe different) rat scurry across the floor towards the main bar. Couldn't really finish our drinks after that.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Where to begin... After walking on the River Walk mid day on Memorial Day, I was in the mood for a good chargrilled hamburger  I poked around in Yelp and found this promising looking place.  They were tucked away on an upper floor of Rivercenter Mall, a little pricey, and we had to wait a little to be seated, and a little for our food to be served. And by the way, not an exhorbitant amount of time. It was just busy.  But.... Oh. My. Gosh.  The burger was perfect, one of the best I've had in a while. The first bite had that just a bit of charred crunch and charred flavor, followed by melt in your mouth perfect burger. My wife got fries with hers that were fresh cut properly cooked.  The waiter read my mind by bringing me a two glass refill of my tea/lemonade.  Everything was great. Just a perfect experience. This is a sign of a great manager and staff. My favorite upscale burger place in the area

reviews.author: Toby S.
reviews.description: Had enjoyable dinner over Christmas holiday with excellent Service and only very brief wait.    Extensive fun cocktail menu.  the ambienceand  the friendly staff  Made us feel like VIPs. My  Brother,  a veteran, said it was the best club sandwich he'd ever had! Large portions that were so beautifully Presented.  Looking forward to coming again ! We especially enjoyed the classic rock when played.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: I'm dropping my 5 star review to now a 3 star review and this is why, my wife and I went back for lunch and my meal was good, I had the Korean BBQ, great flavor but needed sauce as it was dry but my wife ordered the tomato grilled cheese which is my favorite but the server brought her the wrong thing, no problem, people screw up but when he finally brought her the meal corrected it was still wrong as he left off the avacado as ordered and the servers comment was, " sorry, don't tip me."

reviews.author: Jess L.
reviews.description: I went to the yard house on yesterday around 2pm. It was pretty slow but omg.. the service was excellent and the food was amazing.  I had the blacken grilled chicken Cobb salad and all of the ingredients were were fresh and I was able to customize my order. I also got the grand patron margarita and it's prefect.. not too sweet.. but full of flavor and just perfect.  I would have grabbed another one but I had to go to work.. lol. The server was excellent..I forgot his name but he was very attentive and very informed on choices. I also like the fact that I didn't have to wait on him to check out..I could just pay at my table and go.. it was so convenient and fast. I just hate I couldn't go back before I left.. but next time.. I will be back!

reviews.author: Tracey F.
reviews.description: Went here for the beer. An absolutely amazing and extensive list that will have something for everyone. Tried a chocolate cherry stout and a blood orange cider. Both were great and not overly sweet. Ordered some artichoke dip and onion rings as well. Only warning is that the dip is huge, but they don't give you enough chips to dip it in.

reviews.author: Anibal O.
reviews.description: As typical as any other yard house you been to from San Diego to Orlando florida they all are about the same..  Food was okay but the drinks were much better, the services was really good and great place to sit and talk to your date or watch a game... I would recommend to check it out if ur a beer type of person

reviews.author: Brittany G.
reviews.description: This was one of the best meals I've had in a long time!! I put my party of 5 on a waitlist on a Friday night around 7:45 about 15 minutes before we arrived. We had a 15 or so minute wait once we arrived. The menu was awesome and had so many things I wanted to try. I asked the waiter for recommendations. I really wish I would have gotten his name because he was spot on and very sweet. My friend and I split the poke nachos and the lobster noodles. They were both perfect! I could not believe how much lobster (and shrimp and crab) was in it! For $24 dollars it was a lot!! We were so impressed! If you aren't wanting Mexican food and are around the River walk I would def give this place a try!! Edit: friend looked up his name from her emailed receipt - it's Michael S.

reviews.author: Karlyn K.
reviews.description: Wasn't able to dine here because of two hour wait. Was told they only had one cook kk the kitchen. Appreciated the honesty and will try again next time I'm In town.

reviews.author: Vincent C.
reviews.description: Yard house is always great. Probably one of the best chain restaurants there are out there. They're owned by Darden so if you have an Olive Garden gift card, put it to use here.   I normally would prefer to go to yard house during happy hour, but this time we came during dinner time and we paid for it, bill comes out to much much more.   I always order poke nachos as a staple food they have. My favorite item in their menu and next time, I'll just order extra and not share   They do have a large variety of food, but not as worth as poke nachos. That's why I go during happy hour since they're half off.

reviews.author: Jason E.
reviews.description: They had a 2 hour wait at our intended restaurant so ended up at Yard House.  Had fish tacos with rice and beans. Tacos were good, as were the beans. The rice looked like it had been cooked in a jello mold, which may look nice, but makes it hard on the outside - not something I like, it was also a little bland. Washed it all down with a glass of cider.   Not perfect but still came away full and happy. Would definitely go back again.

reviews.author: Emily E.
reviews.description: Food was awesome! Wait was shorter then expected and they text you when table is ready. Looks over the Riverwalk. The wings were amazing, I almost ate all 12!

reviews.author: Tiff D.
reviews.description: Zoodle bowl a was beyond delicious. Tons of shrimp and beautiful fresh green and red tomatoes.  A little heavy on the crushed red pepper but I like it!

reviews.author: Chelsea M.
reviews.description: Some of the best beer in San Antonio! We absolutely love the atmosphere and is one of our favorite places to come after work. We always love to come on Wednesday nights for the $3 beer special if you buy their refillable glass. Employees are always friendly and willing to have a conversation. We will for sure be bringing our out of town friends here. I highly recommend to anyone in the Helotes/ San Antonio area.

reviews.author: Tim B.
reviews.description: Casual outdoor beer garden with great beer in the heart of Old Town Helotes. No food at the brewery but plenty of choices steps away.

reviews.author: Meilinn T.
reviews.description: The reason why I love this location more than their original is because of the quaintness of the place. It's small and theres a large patio where you can just chill out with your friends.   The Helotes' old town is amazing because the patio is shared by multiple businesses which means you can eat and drink whatever you want from the stores. You can't bring in outside drinks or food but the atmosphere is great. The ambiance is complete with outdoor lights--- which I, as many are, am a sucker for.   On Wednesdays, there is a person who is playing live. Due to COVID, the tables are separated 6 feet apart and no one is supposed to move the seats to keep everyone apart. If you haven't tried this location, I would definitely recommend it.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: With different beers on tap and a welcoming atmosphere, this place will be a success. It shares its patio with wine 101 and some other small businesses. On opening day, they had a good crowd, but the ordering went  smoothly. The bartender served while the cashier checked people out.   I tried the wine barrel beer. It was very smooth with a hint of oak. Definitely a little different, but very good.   For now, they only serve beer. If you want a snack, wine 101 has a good selection.   They have a small area with patio tables under the patio, but the common area also has some tables under the shade of the trees.   Street parking is available. It can be limited and you may have to walk a little depending on the day.

reviews.author: Charlene P.
reviews.description: Great service and my porter was awesome! I just wish they had an option for my gluten fee husband. Outdoor seating was beautiful. Thanks for the free sticker!!

reviews.author: Rich S.
reviews.description: Nice little annex of the brewery. Lots of outside area( shared with several other places). Inside small, seats maybe 16-20 people. Outside a couple picnic tables with a chicken now and then. I'll surely check out the main brewery.

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Love drinking Jefeweizen. Cute building among the other businesses. Friendly staff. Unfortunately have to sit outside due to COVID, but honestly what's new at this point. Nice outside environment with plenty of spread out tables.

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: We love this place. So glad Busted Sandal opened up a tasting room so close to us. There's good food selections from the cracked mug and Wine 101 and gelato also. Nice atmosphere. Kid friendly even though the first page of wine 101's menu would suggest otherwise (calm down ). The staff at all of the places there are super nice and work together. And sometimes there's random chickens walking around.

reviews.author: Marsha M.
reviews.description: This is a great spot to enjoy a good beer in the time of Covid.   There is a huge tree shaded courtyard where you can sit and enjoy a Fall afternoon.   However they do not serve food and the other businesses are really missing a great opportunity.  We went on Sunday afternoon and none were open.  We saw many people come and leave when they discovered The Cracked Mug was closed all Sunday and Wine 101 does not open its kitchen until 4:00.  Seems a huge missed opportunity for these businesses, as I said, at a time when people are looking for places they can go and enjoy a nice open air space.  We enjoyed our beer, and their beer is good, but left to get food elsewhere.

reviews.author: Madeline B.
reviews.description: This place is super good and has great beer! The staff is super fun and personable, and they're great at helping you find the perfect beer for you! I will definitely be back, and I highly recommend this place to any beer lover! Eric and Rachel took great care of us!

reviews.author: Rene M.
reviews.description: I've been here several times, and this is by far my favorite speakeasy! I came in with my spouse and a friend, and we had such a great time.  Every time i come here I always try something different which makes every experience very interesting. You basically just tell the bartender what you feel like drinking as far as flavors (sweet, fruity, botanical, warm, spicy, etc..) and they make a special drink just for you. It seems like they also have signature drinks that they make, Which I have to try soon.   Austin was our bartender and he took very great care of us. Every drink he made was perfection.   The prices are very fair, they make all their cocktails with high grade ingredients and still charge a pretty average price. I love this place and would recommend everyone to come.

reviews.author: Lorena M.
reviews.description: Recently visited this place on a cold night. They provided little blankets for us when we sat outside. Also had a few fire pits that's we could gather around to stay warm.   Craft cocktails were very good. They can make everything you can think of.  Smooth jazzy music was playing throughout the night. Cool vibes.

reviews.author: James M.
reviews.description: This place is awesome! Easily my favorite cocktail bar in SA. Moved from DC in 2020 (SA is my hometown) and this place can compete with anything there, easily!  Now here is the caveat, you have to have at least some idea of what flavors and liquors you may want in your drink as there is no menu.  If you don't, the bartenders (who are freaking awesome) will try to fill in the gaps with a series of questions to gauge your taste.  A great place for cocktail lovers and those new/getting to the cocktail scene!  I've never been disappointed with a drink I've had and hope you won't either! Cheers!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: So yes, I did walk past this place three to four times before calling my friend that night. The outside was completely unexpected just as the inside and interior of the place was. I enjoyed the ambiance and the romantic setting. The Old Fashions here are made to perfection - I loved watching the process. The bartender was very diligent in his work and also quiet which was a first for me. I may visit again to get the full experience of their worthy cocktails.

reviews.author: Cassandria A.
reviews.description: This was my first time at The Modernist and honestly I have no complaints. Everything was as expected and my date and I had a lovely evening. The ambiance was just right, right along with the flow of people coming in and out. It was warm and cozy inside and the staff was friendly and attentive. Our cocktails were great, we ended up staying for about 3 or 4 each. We will return

reviews.author: Matthew W.
reviews.description: This is the speakeasy to go to in San Antonio. You can trust the bartender on their recommendations. They do a great job and provide excellent service. If you enjoy speakeasies, come check this spot out. David, the bartender will take care of you.

reviews.author: Amanda E.
reviews.description: Lovely bar in an intimate setting. I love the retro vibes and the craft cocktails! Will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Kelsey R.
reviews.description: This bar does not look like a bar from the outside, but when you walk in, you will be pleasantly surprised. It looked like we were walking into someone's house! They make some very cool cocktails.  My boyfriend and I just walked up to the bartender and told them what kind of liquor we wanted and flavor profile. They concocted something for us based off what we said! It was very cool and a must go to while in SA!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Absolutely loved this place. You will completely miss it from the outside without looking at the address. Very cozy, mood lighting, and intimate. It'd be great for a date night. There is no menu. The manager David was the bartender and made some awesome concoctions. Will definitely be going again.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: A totally unique, amazing experience in San Antonio. Speakeasy vibe in what looks like a converted house on Grayson street- you'll know you're at the right place based off the mailbox. Walk into a dimly lit, intimate vibe. Feeling adventurous? Tell them your spirit of choice, and they'll ask you some follow up questions to make you a unique cocktail. Seriously such a fun experience. Want to stick to your favorite, tried and the cocktail? They'll make that for you too! Not drinking alcohol but don't want to miss out on the fun? They'll make non alcoholic drinks also. Really an amazing vibe and experience.

reviews.author: Yvette S.
reviews.description: Came here on a Tuesday night and ordered two drinks, was told they'd bring them outside for us. Drinks never came so we decided to leave. Not sure if they cater to their regulars or something but I definitely won't be returning..

reviews.author: Brandy G.
reviews.description: This is, low-key, one of the best bars in San Antonio. Located in an unassuming, unlabeled home, you'll be greeted with dim lighting and a relaxed ambiance when you walk in. This place makes for a great date night spot to enjoy unique cocktails and cozy up on one of the couches in the space. There's also an outdoor lounge if hanging out outside surrounded by twinkling lights is more up your alley. :)  What I really love about this place are the bartenders. You won't find a drink menu at The Modernist. The bartenders are prepped and ready to make any drink or cocktail you could probably request, but what makes this place truly unique is if you tell the bartender what type of liquor or flavors you like in your drink they'll whip up a concoction on the spot for you. I've gone both routes and have never been disappointed.   Check them out during your next night out. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Kiki M.
reviews.description: First and foremost, this place has awesome bartenders who truly care about the craft of concocting quality cocktails.   Initially, I wasn't sure if I arrived at the right place because it's almost disguised as a regular house. This makes it all the more of a cozy experience.   The bartender who served me was such a delight. He made me two delicious drinks that are in my top five favorite drinks of all time. He used smoked salt to complement my spicy vodka drink (nameless) which was such a great pairing. My second drink was a pisco sour which had the right amount of egg foam and a well balanced alcoholic portion. MAGICAL!   Overall I highly recommend coming here if you want an authentic bar experience without the noise from regular bars that just want to churn out mediocre drinks. Consider this place a little secret that you're in on. Also, free parking near downtown? You can't beat that. BRAVO MODERNIST!!!!!!!! You have my heart.

reviews.author: Jeremy T.
reviews.description: Very interesting cocktail bar in an up and coming area east of downtown.  I used yelp's directions to find it.  At night, look for the lights in the backyard, and leading to the backyard.   You can enter the front door, but many enter through the back door.  This is the type of place for cocktail drinkers.  Yes, they have a couple beers on tap, but if you're ordering a cocktail, you should know what you like.  No menu, just expert mixologists that will make you exactly what you ask for.  If you don't like it, no matter how long it takes, they'll make it right or make something different for you.  That's automatic 5 star service right there.  Although they have a spanning selection of hard liquors, liqueurs, garnishes, etc... I asked the bartender for two boozy tiki drinks, which took ages to make, but tasted so great, so fresh...and just a different refreshing take than I've ever tasted before.  Kudos to the mixologist that night, I didn't get his name, but he wore glasses and was on point with everything.  A must stop in SA if you like cocktails or dimly lit places.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: Mixology done to perfection. No menu, know what you want it's not that hard. The reviews saying the bartenders are stuck up are wrong, they just want you to either know what you want or trust them completely. Great soundtrack and fun atmosphere.

reviews.author: Jaz H.
reviews.description: My friends and I (a group of 7) showed up altogether to celebrate my birthday (which has been a tradition for the past few years) We knocked and one guy came out saying they couldn't seat us. He then slammed the door shut behind him.  A few ladies were on their way out saying that a whole bunch of people were leaving. So we knocked again and asked if we could at least split the party 4 and 3, (since we'd be spending the rest of the night together, we really didn't mind), RUDELY he says No because we would still want to be sat together and that the last time they seated a group of 7 people, it ended up being a party of 15, so he wasn't going to seat us at all. Then slammed the door shut again. We would've understood had he'd been nicer about it. Guess those reviews about customer service sucking were accurate. Trying to understand what that group of 15 had to do with us. We were there altogether (knowing that sometimes places don't seat parties unless they are altogether). Shame. We ended up going to Stouts and had a fantastic time with their bartenders.

reviews.author: Nikita P.
reviews.description: I love cocktails and always in search of finding good spots. This is one of them. The bartender did such a good job at curating cocktails based on our taste. Flavors were on point. I will be coming back here again.

reviews.author: Nicholas L.
reviews.description: This bar really impressed me beyond what was said by others who have raved about this place. Their unique approach to making drinks is really what I have always looked for in a bar. It is a cozy environment that really makes you feel like your at a friends house. The bartenders are nice but knowledgeable of everything alcohol related and demonstrate this with the amount of time that they spend on the drinks which would normally be annoying but I really appreciated it here because it added to the feeling of personalization to each drink. The snacks were also a great touch and the back porch is a perfect place to relax after a long day! This is a awesome spot and if you're in San Antonio you must visit.

reviews.author: Degen H.
reviews.description: Drinks were great service was tough. Cool place though. If you got time it's a great place to hangout.

reviews.author: Preston C.
reviews.description: I love the modernist. We've been about every weekend since we discovered. I grew up in San Antonio, but just moved back after living in Austin. and have always loved the people and this place and I think cool little places like this really harbor the spirit of the true San Antonio culture.

reviews.author: Amie W.
reviews.description: This place is a must have for all craft beer lovers.  There is a very diverse beer menu and a beer for even the pickiest of beer drinkers.  Every beer is so flavorful and unique and the staff is very knowledgeable on them all.  The new owners are great and I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Dustin T.
reviews.description: Pretty neat little brewery that features sour beers. There isn't any indoor seating so it could be miserable on a hot day. Fortunately we visited in January and the weather was great.  The beers are pretty good. I would make a return trip.

reviews.author: Krysmrtn M.
reviews.description: We stumbled upon this gem waking around New Braunfels.   What a great place to visit!   The beer was great and the customer service was exceptional.  Thank you Michael for a great Sunday!  I highly recommend this place!   So charming.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Pretty decent establishment with a good variety of beers.  But as someone else mentioned, they specialize in sours.  They did have one Heffe when I was here today, but they said they are discontinuing it and only going to offer sours.  Sours are really not my taste, but to each his or her own.  I sampled a couple of the sours and they were ok, but again, just not my cup of tea, so I won't judge them on that.  Staff was very friendly, very knowledgeable about the different beer selections.  The clientele that we hung out with and spoke with were also very friendly and cool.  Bar area was kind of small but there is also a bit of seating back in the brewing area.  And yes, they do offer flights.

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: We stopped by here because our friends live here in town. We are from a micro brew and wine Mecca. And we were throughly impressed with all of the brews here!!! We tried all 8 beers they had on tap at the time of our visit! The blond one and Orono were some of our favs. But the pklfkr was different and good. I also really loved their shivas tears. In all I was throughly impressed. I would HIGHLY recommend this place!!!!!!

reviews.author: Ruby L.
reviews.description: I really liked this spot. It's small and cozy. It was super early when we went. They literally were opening their doors as we rolled in. We stayed for a good hour. The service was good. I see a lot of people complaining about their sours lol. That's literally all the serve! It is a brewery that specializes in sour beer. I personally like sours and ciders so for me it was great, but If you prefer IPAs then this might not be the spot for you.

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: We definitely hadn't planned to stop by New Braunfels Brewing Co on our last brewery tour, but while we were at Faust Brewing, the bartender let us know they were having an anniversary party. We decided to stop by and see what they had to offer.  It turned out that most of their beers leaned toward the sour end. Sours aren't necessarily my favorite, but I was intrigued by the pickle beer. (Not a fan.) However, they had some dark sours that were actually delicious! This was our third brewery of the day...so that may have influenced my taste buds, but no matter...I still enjoyed them. And the anniversary party was hopping and it seemed like a lot of people love this place.  We'd like to go back and check them out on a non-party day, just to see what they've got. Definitely on our list of places to go again!

reviews.author: Grix P.
reviews.description: Dear city of New Braunfels:  I hope you understand what you have here. New Braunfels brewing Co is in my opinion, one of the best breweries of Texas, definitely the best when it comes to sours (in my humble opinion).  I am gonna go ahead and sound like a pretentious douche, but my husband and I are huge fans of sours, and we have been to over 60 breweries around the country. This one is absolutely a keeper.  The brewery is ran by a family that lives in town, they do everything from cutting the fruit that goes into their beer, to brewing and marketing, so don't expect fanciness, a very small group of people runs the entire show. They are usually very good about updating their menu on facebook.   Remember, this brewery specializes in sours, you will not find the regular styles like Lagers, IPAs and Stouts and such. If you are looking for anything other than sours, please skip it instead of giving it a bad review.  The tap room may be tiny, but it's packed with awesomeness and flavor. The staff is super nice and knowledgeable, and they are always ready to help you and tell you all you need to know about sour beer.  This brewery is not a place to hang out for a long time with your friends, but more of a place for doing a quick tasting and take some bottles home. This is absolutely not a good place for large groups.  I recommend that you buy a flight, which is $8 for 4 small pours, that way you can taste different things. If you want to commit to just one, the prices are very reasonable.   My favorites are Saison de Nefle, Hell yeah! and PKL FKR.  We like their stuff so much that we bought a membership to their club, which is totally worth it.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: Do not do business with this company - I have no idea about their product but I leased them a piece of equipment and have had collection problems  - severe - lied to me - STAY AWAY

reviews.author: Frances M.
reviews.description: Sour sour sour. This is place to go when you are not a wimp and willing to try some fantastic beer. Expect sour. Don't come here and taste the beer and make a fuss because you don't like sour beer. My favorite is PKLFKR. YUP. Pickles.

reviews.author: Ibrahim S.
reviews.description: everything is sour.. please think twice before you get anything  we got 2 flight ,it makes 8 different kind of beer  everything was sour

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Wheats and sours, that's it.  Two beers I never drink but NB Brewery specializes in them.  A small store front brewery in the heart of historic downtown. Very friendly staff were quite informative.  Only the second time I have tried a sour, first time at Jester King and I did not like. They gave me a free taste and off I went.  We quite liked the sours actually better than some of the wheats. We tasted 5 of the 8 taps and liked all but one.   The sours are like a double fermented beer inoculated with live bacteria and can be quite puckering. Some are barrel aged up to a year.  If you're in town I highly recommend stopping in. You can even wander around the small brewery on your own.  Oh btw, they will pour you a cup to go. New Braunfels allows open containers, drink up!

reviews.author: Drew P.
reviews.description: We were just looking for a beer, but I love sours so it was a nice surprise that they specialize in sour beers. I had the Jose rosÃ© gose after sampling a couple of others. Nothing was extremely sour, so this might be a good starting point for someone new to sour beers. Very knowledgeable, friendly staff.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: Sweet little brewery tucked into the downtown brewery. Really enthusiastic and knowledgable staff! They can tell you all about their brewery and their beer. Really small inside area, but a nice little beer garden out back. No food.   Also, importantly, if you don't like sour beers - I wouldn't make the trip. That is what they specialize in, and every beer on tap is some form of sour except one.

reviews.author: Dallas P.
reviews.description: I like their beers, even the PKL FKR, but I'm not a fan of sours.   This tasting room is small, no food, but the location is good.

reviews.author: Linday C.
reviews.description: Baby Brewery of Quality and Delight  I'd like to say this is the perfect dive to spend some great relaxy escape time because this place has all the perfect elements of a comforting dive bar (cozy, welcoming, quaint nice and easy and fun as hell) but is decked out very nice and pretty so I'd call this a Posh Dive Bar Brewery.  Yes 5stars of delicious suds. All top notch quality. Impress your friends or woo some opposite sex by taking them here for good times! All the beers I tasted I would buy in a store.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: I was sooo excited to taste these guys beer. Thier website promised some adventure in a cup. Ummmm DISAPPOINTED, is all I can say.   1. They don't change the website, but to quote the guy pouring, "nothing in life is a sure thing". I'm pretty sure the "on tap now" list is supposed to be a sure thing. Thanks for not only being a Dick, but for wasting my time.   2. All of the beer follows the ode if a little spice is perfect the whole bottle must make it better. Not good. I tried 6 of the 8 beers hoping for one I could finish. NOPE   First clue I should have just turned around was the bartender asking me if I was hungover.  (Nope, but thanks for telling me I look like sÂ°~Ã—  before saying welcome to our brewery)   NEVER AGAIN

reviews.author: Chris P.
reviews.description: If you love sours, this place is for you. Six solid choices but #1 (Blondine) and # 6 (Fyre Dancer) were our favorites. Small inside but outdoor patio available. Did notice very clean bathrooms and Danielle was very friendly.  Recommended...

reviews.author: Kurtis V.
reviews.description: One staff member was awesome and pointed me to some of the best beers I've had AT OTHER BREWERIES!  The other staff member kept interrupting us with irrelevant stories about himself. It was very annoying.  The beers were terrible. All had zero taste because all 8 on tap were incredibly sour. Zero diversity at all

reviews.author: Chiqui B.
reviews.description: We had an accidental run in with this brewery. We happened to spot it as we were getting out of our vehicle on our way to another place. The open sign was calling us, and for it being past 8:00, finding a brewery open that late is unique.  The tasting room is fairly small with a few bar stools and a bench in the brewing room. They  invited me to go in the brew room to take pictures.  These brewers are some of the nicest we've met so far. Great company and conversation. They even recommended some other local businesses, which I now have bookmarked.   The beer: they specialize in wheat beer. That's not typically the style of beer I enjoy, but I did find one called the "Hot Child"- a cucumber and jalapeÃ±o infused beer. We only had time to have one beer as their tasting room closes at 9:00. Currently their tasting room is open Thursday-Friday 5-9pm. I hope to see these guys at Wurstfest someday.

name: The Esquire Tavern
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kevin R.
reviews.description: Thank god for actual good human beings that are left in this crazy world.   Long story short Leo saw me struggling with my two kids and literally stopped what he was doing to help me truly came on the other side of the bar and assisted me.   Little gestures like that will make a customers experience. With out going into detail thank you for what you did. I definitely recommend this spot simply because of my interaction with Leo

reviews.author: Rhonda A.
reviews.description: The food here is delicious and the drinks are potent.   We came here for a late lunch on New Years eve and they were out of the tenderloin and deviled eggs, which is why I removed a point. We really wanted both of those and got something that we really were not as much in the mood for. Again the flavor was delicious and the food was cooked to perfection.   We love the funky atmosphere of the place. If you like people watching, try to get a table on balcony but know that they are tiny. We love the huge old leather booths inside. The staff are friendly and just attentive enough.

reviews.author: Christii L.
reviews.description: I wouldn't recommend coming here if it weren't for the burgers, seriously.   The prices are absurd.   I ordered an appetizer and didn't realized I have 'added on' all these items. It wasn't clearly listing all these items as 'add ons', but regardless, I walked out with a $100 bill totaled up with 4 drinks, two burgers, and an appetizer that's petite size.   It may have sound as if there's a lot of content here, but trust me, I'm still hungry.   The burgers though, cooked perfectly, the buns are so good, and the perfect amount of each and every ingredient.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Beautiful 1900s rustic like bar - this is mainly a review for the cocktails. We ordered an Old Fashion and a Long Island. The presentation was clean and flavors were bold. My bartender explained how he does not use much sugar if none at all in the Old Fashion and because of that it was a hit.

reviews.author: Jillian P.
reviews.description: 10 out of 10 for ambiance, food and overall experience!  This spot was recommended by a "foodie friend," so my expectations were already high. All that said, I was BLOWN away by the whole experience. We came on Repeal Day - a celebration of the day prohibition ended- and there was a live jazz band and a burlesque style performance.   It. Was. Epic.  I am honestly considering flying back to San Antonio next December just to experience their Repeal Day celebrations again!   Beyond the show, the food and drinks are also worthy of a repeat. The drinks were strong (I would expect nothing less from a previous speakeasy) and had fun names and creative concoctions.   We ordered the plantain chips to start, the brisket sandwich and pork snitzel, topped of with the fried apple pie for dessert. Everything was well prepared and delicious.   Already looking forward to my next visit!

reviews.author: Jane M.
reviews.description: Stopped by for dinner on  Sunday. It was relatively empty and we were happy about that. The ambience at this place is nice warm and cozy.  We ordered the Bexar Hug and Fancy CVS cocktails. For appetizers, we ordered chalupitas and chili salt fries. Really liked the chalupitas but the fries were okay. For main course, we ordered the jerk shrimp wraps and bison burger. Both these were really good. For the dessert, we ordered the fried apple pie. I am so glad we ordered this inspite of being very full. This was delicious and so flavorful. Not overly sweet but deliciousness in every bite.   This place is huge so there is ample seating. Recommend stopping by this place on the river walk for good food great ambience and good service.

reviews.author: Tony A.
reviews.description: AWARENESS: Hungry walking around the River Walk in San Antonio, my wife and I happened upon The Esquire Tavern.  A nice, well maintained "old school" building with an outdoor patio area overlooking the river.  Nice!  NARRATIVE: The Esquire Tavern is an old school tavern.  They have an extensive beer, wine and spirits menu also a food menu guaranteed to satisfy the best frugal taste buds.  When I saw on the menu they offered a home made fried Bologna sandwich, I was done looking.  My sandwich came with a huge slice of fried Bologna, almost an half an inch thick.  Savory, rice and not greasy.  It was so good that before we headed back to home, I made it point to return and grab another sandwich.   SCENE: The Esquire Tavern is located on E. Commerce Street just off of S. Saint Marry's Street and the patio area of the restaurant overlooks the famous "River Walk."  RECOMMENDATION(S): San Antonio has so many great places to eat, its hard to recommended a few or just one.  I can say, the reason The Esquire Tavern stands out in my mind is that Bologna sandwich.  I will NEVER be able to think about San Antonio without thinking about it.

reviews.author: Ruby S.
reviews.description: Cool quick stop for lunch. Grabbed some happy hour cocktails - hubs loved his Moscow mule, I didn't love mine but it wasn't terrible, to be fair they said it was a strong tasting drink lol! Food wise I was so impressed with our appetizer, I wasn't too sure about it at first but it was delicious! For my entree I got the brisket sandwich with house chips and pickled veggies and it was great. I loved that it came on Texas toast. My husband on the other hand was a little disappointed that his jerk shrimp wrap was iceberg lettuce instead of a tortilla - no where did it mention that was the case. Definitely a great place for apps and cocktails!

reviews.author: Grover G.
reviews.description: Let me be frank about my experience - mediocre at best, would never recommend or return. The reviews on Yelp - well they're just not accurate, at all. The Esquire burgers were not tasty, just plain bland with an oversized dry bun. The seafood platter consisted of over cooked shrimp and fish with soggy fries. They do not care how the food tastes. 30% of the menu items were not available. Why? That's pretty bad. They're located on Riverwalk which pretty much means they get business regardless of the food they throw out - very disappointing overall. Save your time and money - instead  go to the St.Anthony hotel bar and order the smashburger for the same price - now THAT was a great burger not to mention the cocktails....I can def recommend that

reviews.author: Sergio T.
reviews.description: Great time and great bartenders! We were super pleased with the service and tasty chalupitas!!

reviews.author: Vijay R.
reviews.description: The atmosphere and ambiance was classical and woody, but the service was horrible.  This is the classical case where we have a smaller party not ordering much drinks, where we get left behind.  Our food didn't show up for 45 min, and it took a while to find and haul our server.  About 20 minutes, the food came, which makes me think they forgot.  Never come here with a small group as only big groups served well!

reviews.author: Aurora M.
reviews.description: Great place for a pre-concert drinks! Very intimate and relaxing. Drinks were a good price and great tasting. We didn't have any food, but look  Forward to returning!

reviews.author: Amy T.
reviews.description: We have been here a few times. I have ordered my fair share of old fashioned(s) and they were delightful.. a few stronger than others but great none the less.   We ordered a few apps, not the best but probably just really late night and wasn't their A game.   I always get excited when our hotel is near this spot bc it is one of the few legit places to get a craft cocktail in downtown SA.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: It was ok, that's it.  The food was pretty good.  We had a few appetizers and sandwiches.  Tasty, nothing to write home about.    The drinks were ok as well.  We had the Troy and Abed Drinking Whiskey which was undoubtedly the worst drink I have had in my natural born life (think Draino).  They did comp the drink for me.  They handled the experience well.  I washed that away with other drinks which were much better.    We had a nice experience.  The waiter did pretty well.    It was, ok....

reviews.author: shelby s.
reviews.description: One of the best places to visit if in SA.  It has an old-world vibe but with a modern "hipster" edge.  The cocktails are ALWAYS on point and are exceptionally hand-crafted.  You won't get a quick refill if you order a cocktail and that's for good reason.  Their menu of cocktails seems to always change and I've never ordered one that WASN'T ridiculously good!!!  Admittedly, we've never had the food there, but it looks amazing and I see a lot of people having dinner when we visit.  The waitstaff, while somewhat aloof, is always prompt and knowledgeable about the cocktails.  Make sure to sit in a booth.  They are so cozy and old-world feeling.  Great location if you are staying downtown.   They have a "speakeasy bar" downstairs that doesn't open until 7 and that looks very intriguing.    This place is very well-run and pays attention to details.  I just love it.   This is always a MUST-VISIT when in SA.

reviews.author: Stacey P.
reviews.description: I'm on a hunt. I am here in San Antonio on business travel and not content on being isolated to the nearby spots I wanted to see the unique flairs the city has to offer. When I read The Esquire Tavern has a 100 ft bar I simply had to check it out.   I immediately found the atmosphere befitting of a tavern. Dark wood tones, dim lighting, a bit narrow. It felt appropriate. The stage for service was immediately set when the hostesses brushed me away and told me I could sit anywhere I wanted at the bar. It was very dismissive. So I went and sat at the bar closest to the kitchen. Figured it would be a nice busy spot. I sat there for ten minutes before a waitress noticed I was there, got me a QR menu to scan, and told me she'd tell the bartender I was there.   And then I sat for another five minutes before the most unsuitable bartender came by and asked for my order. My bartender could look and act no more displeased with her lot if she wore a sign that said "I don't want to be here". Now it is a 100 ft bar and I noted only three bartenders in this 100 ft space on what was forecasted as potentially one of the busiest holiday weekends which I felt was a bit absurd. While my bartender and another bartender seemed to work the entire bar the third stayed at the far end and didn't seem to venture beyond five feet of his spot.   That said it also didn't help that every other employee was taking quick breaks right next to me. Look, I get it, people need breaks. Drink water. Hydrate. But why do it right in front of a bunch of customers who are receiving no service? As they fixed each other's collars, talked about life, and they stood their within hearing distance I tried to withhold my disappointment because I know they didn't work the bar. I knew that's where they just happened to grab water. But I swear even the kitchen staff looked exasperated as they peered through and could see this clump just jabbering.   In short the service was pitiful. I have had better service at Burger King. McDonald's absolutely has them beat. Even getting the check in the end was a hassle. There was another party sitting next to me who wanted to get their check when my meal was served, I finished my meal, and then joined them in trying to flag down the bartender to get my check. Pitiful service. Easily the worst I have had on the trip.   That said the food was great. The cheeseburger was an absolute delight. It was so juicy! Flavorful! A melody of flavors dancing in my mouth! Oooh that cheeseburger was soooo good! The fries were ok. The cheeseburger delicious. The Moscow mules were typical of the area - fairly ginger beer forward and light on the vodka.   The cheeseburger and ambiance were the only items giving them a three star rating.

reviews.author: Misty S.
reviews.description: The main reason we ended up here was because of the long wait for a restaurant along the Riverwalk.  They were out of Alamo Golden Ale when I was here and tried to order one.  The menu doesn't have much that stood out to me.  I tried the $12 Shrimp Toast that made me realized not everything deep fried is worth eating.  There wasn't much shrimp on the toast and it could have done without the extra breading.  My friends did enjoyed their bison burger and pulled pork sandwich.  .|\---/| | o_o | .\_^_/..2021

reviews.author: Guy H.
reviews.description: Oh man! I first came her back in the 1980s when it was still just an old bar with a history. It's been gussied up and gentrified now but it's charming.  I had to really want to get here this time by dodging and weaving through traffic and construction..  But,it's worth it.  Definite go. If only to get away from the cheesey River Walk places! There is a really long old antique bar,several booths and tables in back. Fairly subdued lighting. Decent drinks and some ok food.   It's definitely a safer place than the first time I was here in the 80z. Well let me think. Safer from impromptu brawls with drunken strangers. But, our friend covid is lurking so keep your distance!  Check it out

reviews.author: Rick B.
reviews.description: This is a great tavern, in every sense of the word.  The bar is fully stocked; not just w the standard categories - but with wide variety in each sector.  Kudos to the Beverage Mgr; well done.    Interesting mixed drinks started us out on our Esquirre expedition.  The Bidi Bidi was a bit smokier than my wife expected, but I chalk that up to their unusual pineapple sourcing.  All of my Double-Vodka Collins were right on point.  We had to try the Beefeater 25, and I can only say WOW.  Wow; this is the smoothest and most citrus-ey gin I've enjoyed.  Well done.   Our Chalupitas appetizer was good, although served late - with our entree's.   I ordered the Fried Seafood Sampler; tge server was immediately able to tell me they were out of seafood.  Disaster averted; I ordered the fantastic Bison Burger!  (I wish I had a $ for every time it has taken a restaurant 45+ minutes to tell me that my elected entree' was out-of-stock!)  My wife ordered the Cheeseburger MEDIUM-WELL.  It came out red and bloody, but hey - mistakes happen, and this is a TAVERN.  They recooked the burger, but sadly, they then charged us for (2) Cheesburgers.  Whoops. The manager fixed this when I called - all is well!  We ordered "To-Go" margaritas and daiquiri's; they were great.    Loved the ambiance and our waiter, although they need to work on the details.

reviews.author: Doug S.
reviews.description: Saw The Esquire Tavern on a TV show said it was one of the oldest bars on the Riverwalk. It looked cool wanted to see for ourselves. Has an entrance on the river or the street. Walking in it is a long skinny room with tables on one side and bar on other. You have to order at the bar. Had a sign on tables do not have table service. You can sit at the bar.  They have a drink menu if you want to try something different or order any drink they should be able to make it. The place was dark kind of cool looking but just a bar. They have food downstairs. Not sure maybe have food in the back seating area to order.   Was not wowed the place was a little boring. If just want a buy a drink and get out of the heat it is an option. Staff not very helpful kind of ignore you. The price is a little steep and make sure you check you bank statement after you get home we had an extra charge.

name: Bar 1919
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Christii L.
reviews.description: I can't believe I have never reviewed 1919.  It was my first bar when I turned 21, and it is still a regular bar I come to.   Their craft drinks are amazing, and they used to have a bartender works towards the left side of the bar that I love the way he makes my cocktails, but the last few times I have visited, I couldn't find him.   Their house tequila shots are amazing; hence, anything that is made with the house tequilas are amazing as well. Our favorite and one of a kind would be the 'Bloody Mary'. Ask for house tequila with blue cheese. Trust me, it won't go wrong.

reviews.author: Maryann N.
reviews.description: The sun was down, the moon was out - my husband and I embarked on our 6 stop journey for the night. First stop- Bar 1919. I've been here before with the girls and today I came with my husband - both times a flashlight was needed.   This bar gives me a little bit of gentlemen club vibes , bottle everywhere, very dim lighting, men bartenders dressed up, cigar cabinet.   Definitely a nice place for a small group of 2-3 to have amazingly crafted drinks and conversation. Not really a girls night out type of feel. It's a small place so the best seats are around the bar but I believe there are 2 couches for a more relaxed feel.   Our bartender was such a gentlemen and surprised us with our drinks because my husband and I didn't know what to order. We got the bluegrass and the righteous- both so delicately crafted with a skill - our bartender for sure had a bachelor's degree on this.  My insides exploded with each sip. So yummy. There really is a drink for everyone in this. I definitely recommend this bar.

reviews.author: Jocy C.
reviews.description: I really love having friends all over the place.  I was in San Antonio for Zumba but I found out a Yelp friend had just moved to San Antonio.  I went to meet up with him and he chose Bar 1919.  Bar 1919 is a speakeasy in the Blue Star Complex.  Parking is relatively easy to find in the plaza but the bar is hidden in the back of the plaza underground.  It took me a few minutes to find it.    I ordered 2 cocktails off their specials menu.  Both were delicious!    RUN to this place if you LOVE speakeasies and cocktails.  Definitely an experience.  LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!

reviews.author: Jando S.
reviews.description: 1919 has all the vibes that make a speakeasy great: excellent drinks, friendly bartenders, a relaxed ambiance, and in a location that is hidden just enough away from the hooplah that is reality. (#1) This is truly one of my favorite places in all of San Antonio.  First timers are more than likely going to get lost coming here. The signage is minimal at best and it's hard to see / hear anything that's going on. A key item is the illuminated "Joe's Jazz" sign above the basement level where the bar is located. Look beneath the street level railing and notice the blacked out windows. If one is lucky, they might even catch someone drinking along the limited outdoor seating, but inside is where all the action is. (#2)  The elongated bar, along with the ambient lights behind it, is magical in its own little way. It's easy to be impressed with the space and ventilation (#3), where there is seating on each end in the form of couches and tables. I personally think the bar is the best place to be.  It doesn't take a cocktail connoisseur to notice the bartenders are more like mixologists. Their crafty ways can whip up one hell of a drink and the kind that isn't just perfect for a photo op, but complex with its own liquor'y way. Whether it's a classic cocktail like a sazerac or an old fashioned, or one of their signature concoctions like the muthafuckah jones or pimm's cup, everyone is in for a treat. Personally, I like the to tell the bartender a spirit I'm feeling and just let him / her surprise me with something. It's worked quite well.  Whether it's a date night or a night cap, this is an excellent place to enjoy an adult beverage. Drinks are understandably in the $12-18 range and are certainly on the upper echelon of libations. Come alone or bring a friend and step into an oasis that only speakeasies like 1919 can provide. _____________ (#1) Or if to be taken literally, a very large parking lot. (#2) Not a poor choice of words, at all. (#3) Fancy cocktails and hot weather is not anyone's idea of a good time.

reviews.author: Cat T.
reviews.description: The bartender was very nice to me, but a complete ahole when my bf came back from the restroom. Basically looked him in the eye and refused to make his drink. Didn't say we couldn't be served, just looked, nodded, and kept taking everyone else's order. Not sure what was going on, we were both dressed nicely, and are super polite, especially post COVID since we know how hard they have it.

reviews.author: Luis A.
reviews.description: Without a trace. That's all. That drink is delicious and tasty. The ambiance in this bar is unique chic.

reviews.author: Julian G.
reviews.description: Johnny is a super bartender, extremely charismatic and knew just what to recommend. We loved him so much that we brought him a bite to eat; along with something for ourselves. Next time you're here, ask for Johnny.   - Julian and Faith

reviews.author: Ryan S.
reviews.description: This place is fantastic. Incredible drinks and I recommend challenging them to their "call your mom it's so good" cocktail. We had Jason and Spencer challenge each other to their "best drink" and it was fantastic. When visiting SA, this is a perfect place to drop in.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great place to grab a cocktail and relax on a couch with friends. It may take you a minute to figure out how to enter the establishment, but that's the fun of it. I love that it truly has a speakeasy vibe.   This time we decided to try a pour of Pappy Van Winkle  and a cocktail. First, for those that want to have a taste of pappy without breaking the bank, this is your place. They have reasonably priced options. I tried the righteous cocktail. It was perfect. Not too sweet. Great taste. They do offers plenty of cocktails and have a lot of liquor to choose from.      Right now, during the covid pandemic, they do have someone at the door checking your temperature and escorting your group to your seats.  Parking is shared and can be difficult.

reviews.author: Jane C.
reviews.description: My husband and I had a great time! Definitely recommend it. But first, read the house rules.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: The term speakeasy doesn't reallyÂ apply here. There are no illicit transactions taking place. No secrets. In fact, THE SECRET IS OUT. 1919 has over 400 reviews at the moment, which is a tad on the high side for anything [in San Antonio], and it's not hard to understand why. THIS PLACE IS EXCELLENT.  They have it all when it comes to booze. You could LITERALLY fill a moderately-priced above-ground pool with all the amber liquid they have on display. There are clear alcohols available too, but bartenders take much more pride(trust me) in the aged stuff that tends to fall on the visual spectrum somewhere between golden and brown.  Some reviews say they have over 1000 bottles. This is seeable and believable, but what'sÂ truly impressive within 1919: the bartenders have knowledge and details on all these obscure bottles AND they can steerÂ you in some tasty directions.

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: One of the best bars in the city. Speak easy with live jazz and world class bartenders, this is a MUST visit if visiting San Antonio, and a stomping ground for the natives.

reviews.author: Kevin T.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I stumbled into this place on a whim on our last day in San Antonio, just trying to find something to do before our flight. It was completely empty when we arrived (given it was a Monday at like 4 PM) so we thought it might have been closed, but thankfully it was not.  When we saw that they had $5 happy hour cocktails, the gloves were off and the Asian glows were on. Unbeknownst to us, one of the best drinks we'll ever have was about to be made, and for only $5(!?) Five bucks in Chicago gets you no more than a shot of bottom shelf tequila at best!  All the other drinks we tried were excellent as well but I honestly can't remember which ones they were. But the Waterfall is one I definitely will not forget.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: A fantastic place to relax and have a cocktail. Yes...it's open. Go down the stairs and open the doors. The bartenders are knowledgeable and attentive. We tried 4 different cocktails and they were all tasty.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Bar 1919 is a gem of a place in San Antonio's craft cocktail scene!  The Mixologist and staff here know their stuff and always provide top notch service.  With over 1,600 bottles on their reinforced shelves, there is something to satisfy anyone's taste and introduce you to something new that becomes your new favorite cocktail (example Crimson Pearl for someone that doesn't like gin) I'm a bourbon and whiskey connoisseur so Bar 1919 is simply heaven for me! Plus they normally have $4 Jameson as a daily special which is a deal I'll take all day everyday.

reviews.author: Rae H.
reviews.description: Went on the suggestion of a great Uber driver. He couldn't have been more right. Not only is it a classy experience the drinks are so well crafted. The bar staff are welcoming and entertaining. The vibe is speakeasy you can go dressed up but also under dressed. I hadn't had an old fashion in a long time its a simple drink but they make some very crafted drunk there that are enjoyable to watch being made. I suggest  1919 for a great experience on a date.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: A perfect basement cocktail establishment bar right off the river.  This place makes top-notch drinks with perfection.  We got the Hemingway Daiquiri, since our friends just got back from the Florida Keys.  It was a refreshing drink for a hot summer day.  Found a corner coach and table to enjoy our drinks and catch up on their trip.  If you are looking for a cocktail bar, then stop in the Blue Star and check this place out.

reviews.author: Amanda C.
reviews.description: A cozy place and a really nice, speakeasy-type vibe. The mixologists weren't pretentious in the slightest; in fact, I was a little nervous to ask for a suggestion because I didn't want to be that annoying patron, but he offered a few alternates for my second drink instead of having me order the same one. And, the second drink was up my alley!  The cocktails here are truly crafted, which explains the pricetag, but even then I feel like they're really reasonably priced. It reminded me a lot of Please Don't Tell, the famous NYC speakeasy, but way more casual and way friendlier. This will definitely be in our rotation!

reviews.author: Richard R.
reviews.description: Great hidden cozy bar with amazing drinks. Bar tenders were very friendly and welcoming. Great mixologists. A little difficult to find this "underground" bar but worth the venture. One of the best Moscow mules I've had.

reviews.author: Katie B.
reviews.description: What a neat place! My husband and I just moved to Texas from DC and we are used to good cocktail bars. This one definitely fits the bill. We arrived around 5:45/6PM and grabbed seats at the bar, which was fun because you could watch the bartenders make the drinks. The list of cocktails was very impressive and I was glad to see a number of gin drinks. We enjoyed the vibe and will be back!

reviews.author: Jai C.
reviews.description: Great way to find out about awesome restaurants and get some yummy eats!  Amazing how many businesses came together in order to offer different flavors and experiences under one roof.  Texas Pride, Maggianos, Magic Time Machine, Creole Kitchen, Outback Steakhouse, Drew's American Grill, and Nicha's just to name a few.  There was even a VIP section that served more of a full-on sample for those that paid the extra cash for their ticket.  They even had giveaways and a live band that kept the motion in full swing.  Everyone seemed to be very happy with the event.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: There were so many great restaurants representing!  They really thought everything out. Beer and wine were flowing from some prestigious wineries and breweries!  They had a giant big screen TV for the Cowboys game, which was really appreciated!  The live music was great, singing all kinds of Texas cover tunes. They rocked!  All kinds of great booths were present. It was awesome.

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: It was definitely a drive coming out here, but it was an easy drive, since there was not a lot of traffic. There were lots of beer options - ten of them! We got the mother board which is a sampler of all the beers. My SO and I got one mother board to share and sample all the beers. It was a lot of fun and we each had our favorites. There was lots of cute shaded outdoor space, and a patio with misters. There was a tiny table inside, as well, but it's mainly geared towards outdoor seating. There was a Mediterranean food truck on-site as well, we didn't check it out, but it's good to know there's a food option. We enjoyed coming out here and hope to be back!

reviews.author: Nicole P.
reviews.description: This is such a unique brewery that is off the beaten path but well worth the drive. There is ample dirt parking and plenty of outdoor seating. There is a covered patio but limited seating. You'll also find a small 21+ seating area. Come with your friends or bring your whole family as they have a huge play area for the kids and ample space for them to roam around. They also have games for adults such as washers and corn hole.  The entire venue is clean and well maintained. In lieu of Covid masks are required indoors when ordering your beer, and they have hand sanitizer stations setup throughout.   My beverages of choice were the Reese's Stout and Hobanero. The Reese wasn't very peanut buttery but it was still a nice light smooth stout. The Hobanero was fun with an IPA touch and not as hot/spicy as I anticipated it to be. You also have the option to have it dressed and I highly recommend it. Besides beer they have wine and soft drinks available as well as light snacks. You can bring in outside food but they do have a food truck on-site. Check their website for information on live music and what food trucks will be there for your visit.   If you're visiting or live in the San Antonio area I highly recommend adding this brewery on your places to visit. Especially while the weather is so nice!

reviews.author: Susanna S.
reviews.description: What a fun place! Great beer (the pancake beer is excellent if you like a porter), play area for the kids, yummy taco truck, and excellent service! The live music was good too! I highly recommend and will be back!

reviews.author: Viri R.
reviews.description: I was surprised to see a brewery in Adkins, Tx when looking to get a drink. My boyfriend and I decided to check it out since it had pretty good reviews.  The drive is very scenic and green which I enjoyed. We went on a Friday at 7 p.m. and it was a packed house. There was plenty of parking in the area. They had live music going when we got there and we were greeted with friendly faces all around. There was plenty of seating outside. We got to try samples and the person helping us was wonderful and made recommendations based on what our favorite beer was.  The prices were reasonable and we payed $17 dollars for a flight a 10 oz beer. I decided to go with their 10 oz snifter Salted Pilsner with Lucas in the rim. This would have to be one of best beers I have had from a brewery that I loved. My boyfriend got the flight of different beers and his favorite was the Oreo Stout that literally tasted like Oreos. It was delicious and I appreciated the fact that these are flavors you can't find anywhere else.  The environment is laid back and somewhere you can go to enjoy the sunset and hear some live music. I will totally be coming back to enjoy a beer on the weekend.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Cactus Land has been on our radar for a while but it seemed like every Time we tried to go they weren't open. Be sure to check their website before making the trek out here! I think they're usually open two weekends a month. It took us a good 45-50 minutes to get here from far west San Antonio. However! This place is awesome and you can make a day out of it and also hit up seersucker (gin/vodka) while you're in the area.   They offer beer flights and different sizes of each beer and have a good variety of beers. Our favorites were the Lucas and sienna ale. The staff was super friendly. The inside area is small with only a couple of tables. Outside area is covered and has fans. There is a large yard area and games. They have a stage for live music for the evenings. Great beer and a nice location once you get there!

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Take the drive and give this place a chance.  It is pretty busy though.  Great views and great beer.  The band or musician is pretty good too.    Pros: price, quality of beer, food truck, music, customer service One con: too many kids running around

reviews.author: Marcella M.
reviews.description: This is our local success story! The third anniversary and it is packed with people from San Antonio and surrounding areas. Cactus Land is brewing some of the best beer in the country and trust me, we've tried a lot!   Catch them the first and third weekend a month. Try their varieties of beer from Ale's to IPA's to Stout, there is something for everyone. This is another great example of a family run, family fun business that is catching the beer lovers attention! It's a true hidden gem. Hidden in the middle of nowhere for now but they are building on and I'm sure it will be noticed!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: Craft Breweries in Texas remind me of the stories of lore. Of settlers, prospectors who came here to seek their fortunes. Their only resource an entrepreneurial spirit that led them to certain success or ruin. Cactus Land Brewery in Adkins, Texas continues in that tradition with an absolutely charming place, a friendly vibe and with flavors as spacious this side of the Pecos.  Coming from San Antonio it's really not too far a drive from here. It's hidden in a labyrinth of small winding roads punctuated by tractors. I've experienced breweries in different settings: industrial areas, a college town, by the ocean. I must admit experiencing a brewery in the country is unique and a first for me. If you look across the way there is another property with horses.   I think I was initially struck by the sight of that, seeing a brewery in the middle of country land. It feels like by design the idea was to contrast the vibe of a brewery with the rugged terrain. For example their taproom is small but exquisitely decorated. The outdoor area is more vast with ample seating and tables. The balance between nature and the urban sensibilities of a brewery are simply yet beautifully stated. I can only imagine this place when the weather becomes cooler, in autumn.   Which brings me to all the important things. The aesthetics as I've alluded to are impeccable. I like that there's a visible board with all available taps: names, abv, pour sizes and prices. Above all the service was excellent. The principal owner, southern drawl and all was beyond friendly. I've been to breweries where staff motions for you to make a decision. Here the owner understands that you don't choose a beer, a beer chooses you.   As far as their offerings they have something for everyone's taste: gose's, ipa's, stouts and blondes. In addition they offer sampler sizes, flights and crowlers. I tried the "Reese" a peanut butter stout, "Texas Juice" a hazy ipa in vogue at the moment and " Eat your Breakfast" another stout with maple syrup. I think out of all of them I enjoyed the "Reese" the most. Drinking it reminded me of tearing into a package of peanut butter cups. I tend to think they understand that we attach memories to flavors. Thus beers are brewed with this in mind.  Cactus Land Brewery is a small place big on charm. The beers have flavors as big as a ten gallon hat, made better by excellent service. This taproom is a perfect escape especially from the hustle/bustle of the city. If you like trying out new breweries put this on your check off list.   ps. (Yes there's more!) I don't know why but I felt like any moment George Strait was gonna walk in and say, "Well excuse me but I think you got my chair."

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: So far my favorite IPA in the area. Loved that they had a true hazy and juicy IPA- both the Texas Juice and the Prodigal sun (think that's what it was called). The place itself is quaint, with plenty of outdoor space for kids/pets.

reviews.author: Dusten F.
reviews.description: Looking for something to do on the 1st or 3rd weekend of the month? Then head on over to CLB.   They're a small scale brewery who knows what they're doing. They are also one of the few breweries in the San Antonio area, in my opinion, that consistently puts out great beers. Whether you're in the mood for something light and calm or have a hankering for a bit of excitement for the old tastebuds...they wont't let you down. They always have a nice variety of styles on tap to choose from.  Check their website before going to see who will be playing on stage and what food truck will be serving up dishes.

reviews.author: Priscilla T.
reviews.description: My husband and I wanted to check out this place for a while now but we weren't sure if it was kid friendly! Lucky for us we checked out the reviews before hand and saw that they are definitely kid friendly!  Not only was the LUCAS beer delicious the experience and vibe was so chill and relaxing. We got a root beer drink for my daughter, a flight for me and a pint for my husband and combined our bill was about 24$. For us that was such a great price for the enjoyment of the property and live music.  The land it sits on is beautiful and when we showed up they had grouchy mamas food truck!  There is picnic tables to sit on under a large beautiful tree  Or tables and chairs to sit on under a porch like area that has a fan going for the heat.  They also offer complementary cups for water.  Towards the side of that porch is where they have a playground for the kiddos with two sings and two slides!  They also have the land gated where your kids can run and play.  If you want to bring a ball for you child to play with it probably would be a good idea while enjoying your beer.  Overall I loved the atmosphere! We will def be back!one last thing! The staff was very friendly and helpful! It was our first time so they offered samples of the beer which was perfect for picking my drinks!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: A diamond in the rough! Ha kidding this place is a diamond sitting on a diamond piece of land! Gorgeous farm views engulfing this little brewery just a hop skip and a jump out of town. If you are looking for a little date night and listen to some music check the spot out.   Suggestions- Check the schedule since they are small still they aren't open all the time.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Maricela M.
reviews.description: We LOVE Cactus Land! We've been coming since they opened and they have come a long way! We appreciate the atmosphere and the owners are so friendly. Great beer, great music, and a beautiful sunset! We are locals but the drive is worth it if you're coming from town.

reviews.author: Rebecca L.
reviews.description: Love that it is dog friendly and they have a nice grass area. They have a small stage for live music and a play ground for the kids. Loved the Grouchy Mamas food truck that was here. This was my first time so I'm not sure if that food truck is a regular or if they change them out from time to time but the grouchy mamas food truck was delicious. I'm not a beer drinker so I appreciated that they offered wine. The beers my boyfriend got were pretty good. His favorite was the lucas Pilsner. The only thing that I don't like is that they are only open rarely ever lol it has taken us a whole year and a half for us to come here when it worked with our schedules.

reviews.author: Anthony V.
reviews.description: Hidden gem  Nice little spot out in the country, plenty of seating, live music stage and a small playground for the kiddos. Had a couple of their beers and the cider. They have something for everyone including root beer.

reviews.author: Kristin T.
reviews.description: The environment, scenery, people and brew is amazing! We come here just about every chance we get. They're kid friendly, accommodating and have live music. The set-up is so perfect.   I bring friends from work (who don't mind the drive) and we all work by the airport!   ... I cant say enough. Definitely my favorite brewery in the SA area.

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Came out here with some buddies to try the craft brews. Wasn't sure what to expect because Cactus Land Brewing is basically in the middle of nowhere. The locations is small but very cool, there is a stage where two bands played while we were there. There is a covered patio and it was pet friendly. There were an assortment of beers available for purchase. As a group we had a little more than half the menu, there was a beer for every beer drinker. Give this local spot a try.

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: We love trying out new breweries, and I'd been wanting to try Cactus Land since their recent opening. Make sure to check out their open hours on their Facebook page before you make the long trek to Adkins, because I'm pretty sure they're only open the first and third weekend of the month.   The venue is nice and open with plenty of seating outside. There wasn't a lot of room inside though. Staff were super friendly and helpful, and we had a great experience.  The beer wasn't my favorite, but only because they were heavy on the sours. We opted for two flights of five, that way we could try all 10 of the beers on tap. Out of the 10, 5 or more were pretty sour, and unfortunately out of all the different varieties of beer, sour is my least fave. And the flights were a bit pricier than I expected: we paid around $26 for our two flights, but at least we got to try them all. The other beers were pretty good though! The IPA was delicious, and I'd definitely take a pint of that.   Although I was a bit disappointed in the flights, I would like to come out here again and check out some of their new brews.

reviews.author: Kiley G.
reviews.description: Saw this pop up in a Facebook event invite and decided to give it a try and we are so glad we did! First off, we have a 3yo and I was so happy to see that this place is super family friendly. There's cornhole, a playground and plenty of grass to run around in. On top of that they do offer NA drinks so it was easy to keep our kiddo happy. We tried a lot of their beers and I have to say I enjoyed the majority of them. (I may be in love with Raspberry PopPop). They had a good little acoustic set going on and a very nice food truck. The whole thing was incredibly chill and we can't wait to go again but bring friends this time. LOVE!!!

reviews.author: Danielle C.
reviews.description: Awesome beer in a beautiful spot.  Super friendly staff. Very accommodating. Will definitely be back!   Try Texas juice! It's a must!

name: The Friendly Spot Ice House
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Idelia R.
reviews.description: I have had the pleasure of visiting The Friendly Spot a number of times, as it is a local San Antonio gem.  They have a great beer selection with both draft and cans/bottles available.  The selection ranges from the big name domestics and imports to the local craft beer Texas produces.  They do a great job of keeping the selection relevant with seasonal beers as well.  The food is pretty good.  I would compare it to any good local eatery.  The brisket nachos have a subtle smokey flavor and the Friendly burger is juicy and bursts with flavor on every bite.  Since they use quality ingredients, the Friendly burger can be a tad salty with the seasoning on the burger and the amazing slices of bacon that are used.  My favorite drink though would be the Wutang frozen beverage.  It goes down so easy and can be a pretty sneaky drink, so be careful, but you really cannot go wrong ordering it.  Whether you're from San Antonio, or just visiting, you really cannot go wrong stopping by this local gem.

reviews.author: Mike B.
reviews.description: First visit was enough for a lifetime.   Service was given begrudgingly.  For was over cooked.   We ordered Steak Nachos which turned out to be a processed meat.  The place had everything going for it;  nice outdoor atmosphere, great selection of beers.  But absolutely zero customer care.

reviews.author: Diane H.
reviews.description: We loved this place for years, loved it a lot...but the last couple of years, the line to just get a beer pulled takes 30 mins no matter when you come. How hard is it to add one more beer puller? We are here on a Monday at 2. Literally 30 people in line, one bartender, back bar not open.  Bartender is now telling people not to order food. I get it's hard to find fast food employees, but there are good tips to be had here. I am quite sure they can hire bit of help at the taps. Feel bad for the bartender...not his fault. Just poor management...

reviews.author: Carmen V.
reviews.description: The game is playing on small TVs. They have the projector set up but not even running the game everyone came here to watch.
