Not to mention the guy taking orders has an attitude definitely contradicts the name. The line to order food is extremely long and once you get to the register you get attitude you didn't ask for. Also, restrooms are disgusting.

reviews.author: Edmarie L.
reviews.description: Five stars for atmosphere. A great spot with something for the entire family, including your furry friends. The kids enjoyed the park while we enjoyed drinks and some bites. The food is standard bar food, but I will give them credit for their fries. The best hand cut fries I've had in San Antonio, well seasoned and crispy. The drinks were super tasty too, highly recommend the blood orange mule. Bonus, they had bomb pops for the kids. A perfect spot to spend a beautiful afternoon.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: The perfect meeting place for people who have pets, enjoy the outside and want to share a beverage with friends.  The Friendly Spot has been around for years and is the spot for a relaxed drink and meal. They have plenty of seating to meet friends for a drink before heading to explore South Town, or just hanging out.   Although, I did not have food this last visit, I was able to enjoy a sunny Sunday with friends after breakfast. They all ordered the Sangria, which looked pretty good, while I had the Watermelon GT. It wasn't crowded at all, which is a plus in these Covid times, and there was plenty of seating.  This is a good hangout to enjoy Summer evenings, or cooler Fall days. Its location is ideal, and their prices affordable. You can't go wrong as a start to your evening, or an early morning meeting.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: This ice house has a ton of options when it comes to beer, and they have a few house drinks that looked delicious. It gets pretty busy on the weekends so the bar lines get longer, but the property is so big that you'll be able to find a seat without a problem. We'll definitely be coming back!

reviews.author: Jeff Y.
reviews.description: Good place to set outside and have a PACKAGED beer. Lot of draft beer handles, but I never seen people buying it. Bet there is a lot of old beer in those lines.   Restroom are first come first serve. Typical of what you would expect in a beer dive. Ladies...you may want to have some of your own toilet paper with you.   Kids playground adds an unexpected twist.   I would stop in again.

reviews.author: Gregory W.
reviews.description: I had to chuckle at some of the other reviewers comments about one of the bartenders.  Surly they are exaggerating or the reviewer is being a jerk.  Well, I found this bartender and it was no exaggeration.  I wouldn't call him names like some other reviewers but he was, to be polite, rough around the edges and startlingly angry.  It's ironic at a place with friendly in the name.  I avoided him the rest of the evening and had a great time.  I live the big screens for a game and love the vibe of the place.  I'm guessing Attila The Hun is harmless and there is a reason they keep him around.  The food is very limited and not very good so eat before you come.

reviews.author: Amanda J.
reviews.description: My first time here. Meeting some family friends. First time learning about and being at an ice house.  Was told it was an outdoor venue. Wasn't sure what to expect.  I was pleasantly surprised. I went on a Tuesday, nachos are 1/2 off.  Lots of seating. Old school seats that I loved! Food was okay.  I tried the ranch nachos and the fried cheese curds.  The sangria was .  That is a must!  This is a fun place to hang out and watch a game.   It is a place I'd go back to!  The atmosphere is FUN!

reviews.author: Zahkyia H.
reviews.description: Cool place to watch the game and hang out. All outdoor seating. Two bars. Cheap drinks. Cool staff. I really enjoyed the sangria. They disinfected each table after every customer.

reviews.author: Danielle S.
reviews.description: Service was bad, took too long, and the bartender kept making tasteless jokes about me and another customer in line. Also he proudly said racial slurs in an attempt to flirt with a group of women LOL couldn't believe the owners would allow such a thing. Never again.

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: A local favorite in Southtown! Mostly outdoor seating, there is a few tables in the back that are inside.   There are 2 bars, a front bar and back bar. The back bar is almost always less people in line and they have more beers on tap. Your tab runs both front and back bars and you can order food at either as well.   They have a giant blow up screen and projector for all the big games and some TV's in the back as well.   Dog friendly.

reviews.author: Jackie B.
reviews.description: Friendly atmosphere as advertised. Cute decor. Good drinks. Family friendly. Dogs allowed. Fun place to go!

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: This is a nice place to hang out and enjoy drinks and food. It is also a great spot for pet owners. Parking is available along side residential homes.

reviews.author: Steve F.
reviews.description: I went on a Friday afternoon. The front was super busy which was cool. There was a huge back space that had plenty of seating. There was a bar in front and in back. Both had excellent servers.   The thing that set this bar off from others was the fact that it had so much to do. There was a slide, multiple projector screens for movies, foozeball, giant connect 4, etc.   The name was night a lie. Everyone there was super friendly. The house cocktails were super tasty. And at a decent price. I really enjoyed this place.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: The friendly spot is OPEN!  Pick up your beer and food to go.  Plus!!!!!  THEY ARE FILLING GROWLERS!!!!!!!!  I have wanted to get growlers filled here because they are inexpensive and have a great variety of beer. If you can't find something that you like, then go pick up some ultra because they want real beer drinkers here!  You will have to buy some kind of food because they have to sell alcohol with some food.  Whatever you do, you need to visit and #supportlocalbusiness".

reviews.author: Christopher R.
reviews.description: This is delightful, and I'd be a regular if I lived in S.A. It's very relaxed, it's all outside, and the mostly local beer selection is tremendous. I sat beside a tree that must've been fifty years old before a friend joined me. The beers were all excellent, the bartenders were laid back and knowledgeable, and the people at adjacent tables were friendly and easy to strike up conversations with. I didn't try any food, but I highly recommend. The vibe is intoxicating in itself, the epitome of relaxation.  I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Aaron R.
reviews.description: The bartenders and service were great, but the manager who was walking around was incredibly rude. He did not turn on the heat because they apparently didn't have enough propane for the evening, despite it being 55 and windy in the day. Additionally the bartender gave me the wrong beer, no issue, I came back immediately after I got to my table and noticed and he said "well as an exception I will handle this for you this once, but in the future once you leave the bar it's your problem." He was just rude and unwilling to be flexible for his customers ar. Again, the bartenders were incredible nice, but he is the reason I won't be coming back.

reviews.author: Yvette A.
reviews.description: This spot was a nice place to go on a beautiful sunny winters day. If you don't like the heat and summer time I might avoid this place because there are spots outside that don't get shade. So for me this is a seasonal place I'd love to go to on cooler or cloudy days. It also looked kid friendly and pet friendly which is a plus if you can't find a sitter. I loved the chill atmosphere.

reviews.author: Raul Z.
reviews.description: I love this place. Love the outdoors time, hot or cold. Plenty of fire pits to keep warm, nice to sit in the shade in this Texas heat, but I'm used to it. Not for everyone, but they have a place indoors to chill on hot summer days. I'd fire up the pit on a summer night, if they would let me.    They do change the beer menu quite a bit, but they do have there regular beers. Staff is friendly and helpful. Sorry, no beer flights, and I see why, you don't want to get something your not happy with, plus they will give you sample.  They have a kitchen, we've eaten her before, so I can only recommend what we have tried, the pretzels, the pizza, and the bratz.    Now they are about to open a coffee bar, can't wait for that.

reviews.author: Belinda L.
reviews.description: Oh my goodness. My friend Jenn went with my Hubby and I. We arrived during an event they were having. It's so open and spacious outside. The wrought iron seats are comfortable and there's a fire pit. The BEER selection, YUM-0. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Wilma K.
reviews.description: I give them 5 starts because the beers and food are always good. But they need to bring back manmosa beer.  I had the ham and cheese warm and delicious. My husband got the croissant panini, he said it was very good.

reviews.author: Ron K.
reviews.description: So what do you do if you are off the beaten tracks outside of SA.. roaming around from New Berlin to New Braunfels and looking for a bit more  action .. Yelp actually points me me that there is an actual brewery in middle of nowhere, just drive through some windy roads to get there.  Well that seems like a fun adventure on a Saturday afternoon.    Little did I know that this little brewery would be located in the middle of a preserve.  This is where hiking trails meets beers. No masks need rules just some friendly owners ready to talk beer and God's country.   Well let me back up a bit as the hiking part is not quite is not quite available aw of 2021.  But the owners of this wonderful property own all of the acres of this incredible property so maybe this may become the next latest and greatest thing since yoga and beer drinking came to be..  I loved everything about this place.  It was spread out so you could find a spot without being disturbed.  They had picnic tables to hang out under the trees, even rocking chairs for grandma. Totally open to all age groups from the kiddos to oldies but goodies.  Normally I'd not want what could be described as chaos in a normal brewery setting but with the beauty and spaciousness everyone seems to get along and make it work.  Kids and AA/NA 'rs are drinking the hibiscus tea while the majority are enjoying a freshly brewed beer.    Beers are a nice mix here. They have nice light options for the Texas heat like a 4.8% Pilsner kolsch Hefeweizen and orange juice infused pale.  Then they get more serious going to a stout w/marshmallow graham crackers and coco nibs and get all the way to a 9% imperial stout with blackstrap molasses that comes regular or bourbon barrel aged. Those only come in a 6 oz pour which was appreciative considering we all do need to sometime and head back to civilization...  I loved all of the beers especially the Pilsner as it was so refreshing in a hot day.  But even the darker beers were super smooth.  I also loved how they gave you taste tests before committing.     They even gave a bit of entertainment going on with a guitar player on the outdoor patio.  Kids were dancing and adults hanging out with their pets. Yep i didn't see anyone not having a fun time, especially when most people have been deprived so to say over the past year, cough cough:D  This was a great find for us venturers, and I wholeheartedly recommend you bring your friends and family to this wonderful scenic treasure.  Yes Beer does exist in God'scountry. Say Amen to that ..

reviews.author: Sandra D.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a cold one, Goldenboy and Manmosa, very tasty.  There is a lot of shade, cold beer, and a kitchen too.

reviews.author: Jill B.
reviews.description: After driving past twice figures it out! And we were so pleasantly surprised.  Great beer but even better food.  That kitchen!!  Wow!! The best chicken salad croissant I have ever had. Super nice staff.   My son finally got to relax in the rocking chairs on the porch. (Been. Stressful summer).  We will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Ben L.
reviews.description: Went for the first time this past Friday and loved it.  The beers were so good.  Some really interesting flavors! My 2 favorites were the Pina JalapeÃ±o beer and the Brothers Keeper!  The pizza was nice too!  Spacious outdoor area with plenty of shade.  Definitely planning on going back.

reviews.author: Julie J.
reviews.description: Great brewery with a real good chill ambiance. Has a wonderful large outdoor area with plenty of trees and perfect for kids to run around in. Beer and food was great too and they even have live music on some days.

reviews.author: Bryan G.
reviews.description: This is a first class family friendly brewery with some very unique beers.  They just get better and better with their improvements to the grounds and sitting areas.  They also have great food trucks which really rounds out a great time.  Highly suggest you visit if you haven't already.

reviews.author: Angela A.
reviews.description: Loved this brewery! Wonderful staff! Beautiful outdoor space. Delicious pizza and great beer. We will definitely return!

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: 5 Stones Brew produces some great Brews!! The staff is very kind and professional. The outdoor atmosphere and music is excellent as well as the food.

reviews.author: Jason H.
reviews.description: Awesome family owned joint.  Fresh and delicious beer.  This place is becoming the scene for families and those that enjoy a nice outdoor atmosphere.  Highly recommend you attend on the their events, should not be at all disappointed.  Only struggle they are having is they can't seem to keep pace with all their new fans (aka customers) and they sold out of chow my last visit.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: This place is a little hidden but I think that's what I like about it. Off the beaten path of 1863, snuggled in the countryside with abundant outdoor seating and space for dogs to play and kids to run. There is shade, which is nice but an inside area for those triple-digit days. There are outdoor fire pits for when the weather is actually enjoyable in Texas.  There is usually an on-site food truck on the weekends. The beer is very crafty and creative. My first 2 visits were very excellent. Recently, my trips have still been enjoyable but a bit disappointing. While I admire the creative side of their brews, I do not care for everything to be fruit-infused. I don't mine 1 beer being fruity, but when that is all there is to choose from (other than the Kolsch) it gets old, fast. When I first was visiting this brewery I loved their porters. I haven't seen them in months. I think I would frequent this place like i used to if there were more non-fruity options.  Other than that, I love how it's family-owned, a large, open space, and just a relaxing atmosphere. Hopefully some non-fruity porters or ambers show up soon so I can head back out.

reviews.author: Lucas E.
reviews.description: 5 STONES = 5 STARS!  A bit of the beaten path, BUT YOU MUST GO! One of the coolest breweries I have ever visited. Beautiful location, both the brewery and the gorgeous outdoor seating area.  Feels quintessentially central Texan. LOVE IT. It was made all the more enjoyable by the live music being played the night of my visit. This place would be worth going to if the beer wasn't very good....but that is FAR from the case. The beers are fantastic with a wide range of both familiar and eclectic styles. You can get 5oz pours of anything, enabling you to try quite a few without getting too tipsy. The customer service was friendly as can be. I will 100% be back next time I am in the area. Drink local!

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: What a change from their previous location in Cibolo. They have a beautiful outdoor seating area that is kids friendly and a large selection of beer. I also like their brezel with the sauce.  They had a food truck on the premises when we were there. We definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Ashton M.
reviews.description: This brewery seems to just be getting started, but they're headed in the right direction.  I loved their beers! The facilities were clean and well-ventilated.  I was disappointed that they didn't have all sizes in stock of their merchandise, and they didn't have any to-do cans for sale either. Food trucks would also be a wise improvement, but perhaps they didn't have trucks on the day we came.

reviews.author: John C.
reviews.description: Amazing beers and an open atmosphere. Food looked really good as well. Keep rocking guys!!

reviews.author: Colby M.
reviews.description: Nice brewery in start up mode.   Beautiful facility that looks brand new.   Beers here are really good. When we went they had a lot of fruit forward beers (manmosa, peach beer, dry-hopped manmosa)   There is plenty of outdoor seating. They also have chairs and tables inside.  I'm not sure if the address has been corrected, this place can be tough to find so keep your eyes peeled on approach.

reviews.author: Chad J.
reviews.description: Hymns and Hops...what a fun event! Some friends brought us. Great event! 5 stones is a Christian brewery and apparently they do these live music events several times a year. This one was live Christmas music and awesome beers (and some wines) in an awesome outdoor, family friendly (including the dog) environment that caters to the ability for social distancing. What a cool experience. I was only able to try two of their beers, but both were delicious! I highly recommend both Merry Christmas and Toby G's. All of their beers and made with seasonal ingredients. The Merry Christmas is a fairly typical style Christmas Ale, but delicious. The Toby G's is a family pecan pie recipe made into a beer. Sounded strange, but I love Pecan Pie, so I tried it. So good!! I will definitely come back to this place. Hopefully I'll get to try more of the beers next time. A friend was telling me about a pineapple jalapeÃ±o beer they do in the summer time. Sign me up!!

reviews.author: Monica C.
reviews.description: Great place to try new beers, relax and social distance. They allow you to bring your own chairs since it's on a bunch of land so you can enjoy some space

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: This is a very cool place with lots of beers!! First time here and made some friends too. The staff is friendly and great and very knowledgeable. We will make this one of our go to spots. Plenty of parking which I know is a worry as some breweries but don't worry they ha e lots of local brews too and with out the parking hassle since they are located in a huge shopping center. Do your self a favor and drop in by!!!

reviews.author: Amanda V.
reviews.description: If you are one that enjoys a good craft beer at a not so crowded place, this should definitely be a place you try out. Its great for small and bigger crowds and most importantly for all walks of life. The staff is always very knowledgeable and super friendly. They have games, good music and TV's there to be able to watch your favorite team on game nights too. Its an awesome place to go just to meet up with a couple friends, lowkey date night, or even take a book or laptop to do some work/journaling while enjoying a tasteful beer of your choice. My favorite thing about Big Hops is the very calming neighborhood bar feel. Super glad this place is still up and running even during the mess of COVID.

reviews.author: Steve F.
reviews.description: Good environment. It was chill for a beer while we were running around. They have an extensive selection which I really appreciate. The service was very friendly and willing to offer samples. Happy hour 3-7 has a dollar off beer.

reviews.author: Michael H.
reviews.description: Nice place to stop in for a cold one on a hot day. Nice, but compared to a couple of other watering holes a small selection of beers, but then again larger than most. They offer a growler service which is cool.  I've never done that but I noticed a couple of folks brining empties in.  It's in a strip near Hobby Lobby on Bitters. Parking is plentiful.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: Your typical amazing Big Hops, on steroids. This is my first visit to the Bitters location and this place is super dope. I am calling it the flagship tap room.   This is one of the bigger locations, that I know of. They have a ton of craft beers on tap. The service is friendly as I come to know Big Hops to have. Not only friendly but knowledgeable.   This location has a pool table and arcade games. Lots of space to enjoy your party and the music. Big Hops does not serve food but there is plenty of food options around. They allow you to bring outside food in. If you don't want to bring food in they serve Rico's products for bar snacks.

reviews.author: John A.
reviews.description: Really happy this place survived COVID-19! Haven't been here in over a year. Still great environment and staff. I wish beer was colder but I can deal.

reviews.author: John N.
reviews.description: Love this place.  Been twice.  Customer service is on point.  A little hard to find but Google maps will not steer you wrong: follow Google maps.  Great job everybody, keep up the good work.

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: This place is the bomb.com!  Like the other three locations, they are clean, the staff is friendly, VERY knowledgeable and PASSIONATE about their beer selection.  Plenty of local and out of state micro brews available here.  Don't expect to find any Bud or Miller products.  Mike served us today and after I ordered my beer, he said "if you like that one, you might like this one.  It's a bit different but..." and then he continued to describe the flavor of the beer and gave me a free sample.  I was really impressed by the interaction and the beer knowledge he had.  It looks like they have 33 beers on tap and they also have a good selection of canned beers.    A lot of their draft beers can't be found in local stores but fear not; you can purchase a growler from them (or bring your own) and bring it back for refills of whatever they have on tap.  Support this local business and get here fast - you will thank me for it later!  If this location isn't near you, find one of the other three locations.

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: Yep. Still awesome. This is such a great place that celebrates all walks of life. My friend invited me over to enjoy the Smash Bros tournament again, and it was a lot of fun. I didn't imbibe alcohol this time around, but everyone's beers looked delish.  The bar is still kept very clean, and everyone participating in the tournament shows great sportsmanship. There's a table closer to the door who also hangs out here week after week, and they spend hours drawing and making art. There's enough space to accommodate lots of groups of folks, even an outdoor patio for more legroom (though the interior itself is definitely roomy)  I'm not sure if this is a regular thing, but a food truck parked out back and provided some Asian eats for hungry gamers and artists alike. I love that with all the BH you can bring in food, as I brought my dinner from Chipotle earlier that evening.  Perhaps my most absolute favorite thing was a visit from a customer who had the most adorable, softest, plushiest shiba inu. omg. Best doge. (yes, dogs are allowed on the patio!)

reviews.author: Wayne S.
reviews.description: Love this place selection is awesome always something new hard to beat a place that gives so many options and is always happy to see you.. gets a bit crowded when its not rona season but i do recommend this place

reviews.author: John Q.
reviews.description: My team and I had a great experience at Big Hops.  The Bar tenders were patient and willing to talk / give you samples to try and the selection is great.  I really do enjoy saying, I like this type of beer, (they may or may not have it) and they go - OH - well if you like that, then you'll love this!  - I generally do love what they offer up!  It's always fun to go to places like that and try new things.  If I had one gripe it would be that they didn't serve food, but that's OK b/c if I remember correctly there are a couple of good choices in the area.  Definitely give Big Hops a try!

reviews.author: Jesus H.
reviews.description: Pretty awesome place to just go relax and have a beer! They seem to have awesome events (went to the May the 4th be with you event and got a beer with a souvenir cup for only $7.50!).  They have a really good variety of craft beer as well as games to keep you entertained. They have a patio outside and I believe they have a food truck on certain days. If you like to try different kinds of beer, this is definitely the place for you!

reviews.author: Roy Q.
reviews.description: We made the mistake of trying to hit up Bucanero's for Mother's Day. While we shouldn't have waited for about 2.5 hours for a table to free up,  I suppose the best of things are always accidentally beget.   While we waited, we wandered into the plaza next door and jumped into Big Hops. We didn't expect much, as we knew nothing of this place, but we quickly fell in love!!  While I'm not the beer person, I was still able to enjoy their small selection of wine and cider. We absolutely loved the subtle geek culture everywhere and the inviting staff. On our next visits we were allowed to bring in the sandwiches we got at Fire Subs next door to get an alcoholic refreshment to go with it. This place offers a casual vibe that's perfect for meeting your amigos in a non-formal setting. They also have some board games you can play with on a shelf.   So if you're looking for a casual chat and beer, this place makes for a great rendezvous point!

reviews.author: Kyle S.
reviews.description: This place is farther away from my normal spot, which is Big Hops on Huebner, but not by much. What draws me to the Huebner location is the proximity to my work and the ability to hide there whilst traffic does its thing outside with me not in it, but merrily sippin' IPAs instead.  But what draws me to the Bitters location is far more innate for me. Sure, they have much of the same beer and deals, but here they have SMASH BROS. If there's one thing I love in tandem with beer, it's video games, and especially THIS video game. I've been an avid player of Smash Brothers since its inception on the Nintendo 64. Needless to say, me and my brother have found a spot to be every Wednesday night from now until the sun consumes the earth.  For those not into video games, they always have sports up on the many TVs and they have things like: darts, pool, and even a LIBRARY for nerds! (me). The latter had me the most excited, because it's one of those DIY libraries where people just contribute willy-nilly and I think that's rad.  If you like beer (good beer), you owe it to yourself to check this place out!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: If you want a quick getaway with a couple crafts and growler fills check this place out. We've been a couple times and it's nice having the  variety of crafts on tap! Check the schedule for weekday activities!   Suggestions- They don't offer food with exception of pretzels so eat beforehand.Or ask if you can bring tacos from next door.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Maitina M.
reviews.description: Difficult to not but like this joint. It gots beer and a lot of it! 80% Texas beer.   Live music on Fridays. Fun games to grab and play with a group (jenga, dominoes, boggle, etc.). Super casual. Music too loud? Step outside. Chill place to hang out.

reviews.author: Johnny B.
reviews.description: Beer-to-go 6-pack prices from the cooler is not the same as any other taproom/growler fill station I've ever been to. Whereas they usually sell them for around the same price as anywhere else, even liquor stores, I drove across town for a 6-pack after finding it on Untappd. What usually goes for $15 for the 6-pack they wanted $42. Went down the st to a liquor store and got it for $15. It was just a mass produced IPA, not some bourbon barrel aged stouts.

reviews.author: Fawn G.
reviews.description: We stumbled into Big Hops on a quiet Saturday evening after a wild shopping spree at Hobby Lobby.   The place is pretty huge actually! Wall to wall chalkboard menus displayed their beer selection and the upcoming events. There's a back smoking section past the pool table. The place had quiet a few picnic tables and ample bar seats.   You can tell this establishment makes a major name for itself selling tshirts, stickers and growlers in several different sizes. We settled on the 64 oz growler which holds 4 pints I believe.   Service was a little off to me. The server kept asking what I wanted and what was I having, so when I said "I'll just have some water", I was a little surprised when she handed me a glass and said "serve yourself over there" and pointed to the water jug. She became super friendly after I told her I was on a detox though.   This place comes prepared with a board game library. We found boggle in the mix. I love that game to pieces so we played a few rounds before settling on a beer to fill the growler and headed home.   We'll definitely be rolling through to catch up on some of the local beers in the future.

reviews.author: Mike G.
reviews.description: This place use to be New Orleans Bar. I always loved Big Hops, with their always endless selection of craft beers (not sure if that is good or bad for my liver, haha). The service is always top notch and the bartenders are knowledgeable.   They also have a outside patio which is great when weather is nice.   There are plenty tvs inside to catch a game. I was here watching the Warriors/Spurs G2 and they also had free pizza, which is great.   I can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Rob M.
reviews.description: 32 taps that change all the time!   All types of beer, coders, meads, and non alcoholic drinks.  A nice patio in the back too!  Bring food in or order from the restaurants in the same building.

reviews.author: Lily L.
reviews.description: The Station Cafe is my FAVORITE lunch spot in Southtown.   Each sandwich is a treasure, but don't sleep on the soups and salads. I'm not in love with the pizza, but there's so many options that it's a minor roadblock.   My favorite meals: - Turkey Pesto Sandwich - Soup of the Day and Pesto Pasta Salad  The staff there is quick and friendly; what more could you ask for? Side note - their website is not regularly updated so the prices at the counter may be a tid bit more than what is listed.   TIP: Order ahead for pick-up. The line to order can be pretty lengthy, but if you have a take out order, you can skip ahead!

reviews.author: D P.
reviews.description: This place is great and has so much potential.  It's a novel idea but needs a little tweaking. It's a great place to gather with friends and comfortable outside dining . The problem is the dining... where is the food?  They only have pizza and often "run out".I noticed many people bringing their own food.  It's seems like this business would be way more lucrative if they could serve the many people wanting something to eat too.

reviews.author: Matt R.
reviews.description: Got there late around 9:30pm on the night I flew into town.  Wanted to check out a local watering spot for a drink and this place seemed like the perfect fit.  A stones throw away from the BnB I was staying at it was a bit tight inside of what seemed to be a former gas station.  There is seating outside but was cold about 45 degrees so opted for the cramped interior.  Had a really good selection craft beers where I enjoyed a Belgian Triple.  The place closed down around 10pm on this early off peak weekday so had to walk a few doors down to find an open kitchen for late dinner.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: The Filling Station Tap Room is like some brew gateway before you hit the main hubs like Blue Star or The Friendly Spot. Though small, it has lots of charm. Inside it fits the brew keep and no more than 6 people at any given time. There is a chalkboard that has the brews on tap, mostly and mainly IPA's. Along the walls are the remnants of tap handles of long gone kegs for example Sierra Nevada, Guadalupe Brewing Co., Firestone etc.                   The brew keep serves you your selection. Music from a college station radio cast is piping on the stereo. It's small and on a winter night after work, extremely cozy. But above all and I would be re missed if I did not overstate this, the brews are beyond El Cheapo! Some or most of these brews go for 7 bucks just down the road.. Here the beers typically range from 2 bucks to 6. That is so cool, especially in the bourgie King William District where you are charged just for looking at anything.            I do like this place but I do have a few issues with it.    1.) I don't get the whole plastic cup thing. I know you are getting a brew at a substantial discount but some of these brews are noble and sit and drink better in glass. Bud is meant for a plastic cup but not a Brooklyn Chocolate Stout! It deserves a better place than in some arbitrary Dixie cup to showcase it's masterpiece of flavor!   2). I noticed on their Facebook that they seldom update their brew selections. They should do this weekly. The Growler and The Friendly Spot do this regularly. Just one quick pic of their brew selections on the chalkboard, put it on their page and then vamonos. I know they have a twitter account now, which is helpful. They  typically get a crowd, from the looks of it bike riders that probably goes there on a daily basis. And buys on a whim. But what about your untypical patron? You have a great selection of brews why not showcase them?  3.)   The third issue, and I believe the most important is what really sets the brewpubs from places that just tap brew for you. The server served us our beer and did not say anything instead choosing to play with his phone. Places like The Busted Sandal and The Ten Eleven are hosts by proxy, and will talk your ear out about their brews or in most cases beer in general. I like that and as a rule of thumb most brew lovers appreciate that touch. A simple, "how's it going", "if you need anything let me know" or "what brings you here today" goes a long way. We don't have to be best friends. Just fake it. But acknowledge we are there and be on with your business.       Given these things I like this place. The brews are cheap. I like the intimate vibe, cozy space. And I definitely will be coming back. If you want an alternative to The Friendly Spot, whose brews can be pricey or just want to go to a place to chill check this place out. On cold winter nights they have wood burning outside at no extra charge...

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: This place doesn't have food. All they have is beer. This is misleading and a waste of time. Stopped by on a Saturday night looking for pizza and drink. The cafe serves food but only during the week. The bartender was a dick too. 3 stars for the beer selection.

reviews.author: Shannon B.
reviews.description: A tiny little hipster place in SA TX!   This place is tiny, and they had a few seats inside, with a few outside as well.   The bartender was super friendly and welcoming. He explained what they had - mostly local or Texas-based beer, but other basics as well. AND, they did have cider.    Outside, it was a quiet area to sit and enjoy our beer and company.

reviews.author: Flying T.
reviews.description: Dog hump review on Tap Room. 10+ quality verietals on tap. FOUR bar stools, but ample shaded patio space. Food next door in co-owned Station Cafe - cheap and good, deli type place,  has hot toasted sandwiches for $6. Plastic cups cuz seating is outdoors, and it's only the inside bartender working - nobody to take care of glassware... Only 4 stars cuz SoTex is too hot to have to sit outside (I'm Denverite, so YMMV).

reviews.author: Kelvin P.
reviews.description: I love IPA's and that is what they serve.  If they only served it in a real glass, they'd have my 5 1/2 stars.  Oh well, they'll just have to get 5.     I like how they note the alcohol content and IBU of each beer.

reviews.author: Adrian M.
reviews.description: Fine place to catch a beer with several on tap. Nothing fancy here. Plastic cups, probably because most of the sitting is outside. Prices were very reasonable as two draws were under $10. We had the Kolsch and the Brown Ale. The Brown Ale was better.

reviews.author: Megan S.
reviews.description: A laid-back, beer loving and serving joint-- plenty on tap. The gas station-turned tap room has seating outside and is a true ode to old San Antonio. Good priced pints, and a decent pour to boot.  If you love hoppy beer, GO HERE.

reviews.author: Lindsey C.
reviews.description: Stopped here on New Years Eve for a beer... First words out of the bartenders mouth is "I'm closing in two minutes" Ummm ok, so can I have a beer, or should I go?  After I ordered, two of the beers we wanted weren't available, but he couldn't be bothered to tell us, just didn't serve us those beers.  Oh, and the credit card machine is through a cellphone. So if there is a crowd forget trying to pay in anything but cash.   Piss Poor Business Practices. This place has such potential, but fails hard.

reviews.author: Shawn C.
reviews.description: What's not to like. The owner has preserved a piece of history by converting an old Texaco Filling Station into draft brew house. The barkeep let me taste everything I was interested in. They have 4 or 5 seats inside, a covered patio area with tables, and a couple of tables in the old horseshoe driveway.  There's not much to say except this is a fantastic neighborhood concept blending and keeping history in the local community while invigorating the economy.  And a bigger plus... if you live nearby, you can walk or stagger instead of risking a DUI or causing injury to a pedestrian.  Also while there is technically no good at the Filling Station, the owner owns the Station Cafe next door.  Cons, you can't leave an open tab at the Filling Station and use the same credit card next door for food. Pros, you can bring your beer from the Filling Station into the Station Cafe.  Can't wait until I'm back in San Antonio... I will be back!

reviews.author: Cassio S.
reviews.description: If your north of downtown looking for a beer check out Attagirl. If you find yourself south of downtown then Filling station tap room is your best bet for dozens of beers taps on a constant rotation.   I also challenge someone to find a better price on craft beers on tap. Most beers pour for $4.50 and less. I'm not talking your old man's miller lite. I'm talking great big bold, high abv beers from some of America's best breweries.  Only reason they get 4 stars instead of 5 is because they are closed Sunday. What ever happened to Sunday funday?   Ps. Mainly outdoor seating, if the weather is not great find somewhere else.

reviews.author: Anthony C.
reviews.description: Love this little spot.  Awesome beer selection, great food from the station cafe out back, and overall a really really cool concept.  I'm so thankful to have this place within walking distance of my apartment.. Easy place to swing through for a cold one or 2... Or 5.  The two bartenders I've had so far are pretty friendly, but you have to tease the conversation out of them. Overall cool guys who seem to know what they're talking about in terms of the beer.  Another plus is that they play sports games on their tv outside.  Two suggestions:  extend your hours.  Both for the bar and for the food.  I think the demand is there to support it.  Next suggestion, maybe consider increasing the size of the TV.  The small one tucked up in the window is charming, but I feel a larger tv with better sound could attract a bigger crowd.  Very cool spot with great beers and a super chill vibe.  One of my favorite King William hang outs.  Will be a regular here for sure.  Cheers!

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Stopped here for a quick drink while walking downtown. This is a cool little service station type watering hole that should be on any beer lovers list. They have only micro brews with quite a few Texas varieties.

reviews.author: Patrick S.
reviews.description: The Filing station is great buut when combined with the little restaurant owned by the same place next door it's awesome! Very low key hipsterish, lots of bicyclist and soccer fans (outside TV) .  This place has a tiny little indoor bar with a lot of great beer. They have an extensive outdoor seating area between the bar building and their sister restaurant which has some super affordable, super delicious food. The pizza is good, the sandwiches are grand. I have never had a bad sandwich but I have regretted when I didn't get something with aoli knowing that I could have enjoyed that deliciousness. Dog friendly. Big bonus for me is that they always have my favorite local (if Blanco counts as local) beer, Devil's Backbone, I don't think there should be a bar in SA that doesn't carry this delicious, reasonably priced gem.

reviews.author: Ali V.
reviews.description: Our favorite place when in San. WOW. the place is super hipster, super awesome, the whole area around the bar is fantastic as well. Many awesome music venues around there.  old gas station turned to a bar- EXCELLENT idea. Great bar selection as well, can't complain!

reviews.author: Jala C.
reviews.description: My husband and I have been wanting to try this place for awhile now but they are only open Monday - Friday.  We finally made it there on our Friday night date night after hearing they had tapped a keg of Real Ale Sisyphus that had been sitting over a year.  Um, Yes please!!!    We were delighted to find it was true and received our pour.  The place is very tiny but there is outdoor seating.  It was pretty packed when we got there and most outdoor seating was taken.  We stood off to the side and within a minute two guys waived us over and said we could sit with them -- cool people, yes!  We enjoyed our beers and made some new friends.     We heard the restaurant side is outstanding and makes some pretty good grub.  You can take the food over to the bar side and we saw some sandwiches/pizza that did look appetizing.   However, it was all about our Sisyphus on this night.  Thank you Filling Station for surprising us with one of our favorite beers out of no where!  That is some good beer management there!   We would be back more if they were open on weekends but we will get what we can take.  We definitely return.

reviews.author: Clayton A.
reviews.description: One of the more distinct beer bars I've visited in my day, built in a converted gas station that probably had its heyday in the 50s.   The space is rather cramped, with maybe 5 seats inside pressed against the bar and a small opening for the standing crowd. It's intimate and I could tell that most people were familiar with one another.   The server was polite and friendly and didn't have a problem with allowing me to sample a few beers.   As is usually the case, I was on a stakeout for some local/Texas beer and only found a few on tap when I visited, although the tap graveyard they keep reflects that plenty of Texas craft makes its way to this establishment. The rest of the lineup was craft beer from around the country, which is normally cool, but for a New Mexican, seeing Dale's Pale Ale and Deschutes Black Butte is pretty common, so this was a slight disappointment. It's not you, Filling Station, it's me. I need new; I need variety.  Ahh, variety, that reminds me. This place definitely has a thing for hoppy beers. There were a great number of IPAs and Pale Ales on tap, which again is cool by me, but kind of works against the whole new and variety necessities I just mentioned. Again, it's not you guys, it's me.  The one thing I can say is you is the whole plastic cups thing. I'm not a fan. I noticed it's a small space and there's probably no room to wash glasses and such, but I really dislike drinking beer out of plastic cups.   Anyhow, overall a good place to grab a beer or two, so let me emphasize that.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: Beer galore in a former gas station?  Win.  So unique.  Will you be crammed in like sardines trying to get to the bar during a Friday evening right after work ? Yes.  Is the beer selection worth it? Absolutely.  Also sweet about this place is that the station cafe right next door will bring food over to you if you want to sit on the little patio area right outside the bar itself.  I had one unpleasant bartender which was kind of off-putting a while back, but other than that, the service has always been really inviting and friendly.  Prices are fair, location is awesome, and the unassuming exterior make for an excellent stop if you're in the mood for a quick and super casual beer.  Highly recommend!

name: Cured
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: I love this place! Would come back here if I ever visit San Antonio again! My brother recommended to give them a try and my oh my !  The food was great, very tasty. The jam that comes with the charcuterie plate was sooooo goos so I got a jar for $10 to go. Highly recommend to try the Sugar Cane Lamp. Not the best at describing but it is delicious lol  Got a Honey Boy with half shot of vodka  The server was very nice and professional. He checked up on us couple times and made sure everything was good.

reviews.author: Brooke N.
reviews.description: Bottom line up front: I can't believe they have the gall to charge what they do for disappointing and inedible dishes. DO NOT ORDER the charcuterie board. As a matter of fact, DO NOT waste your money here.  Probably the ugliest bunless burger you'll ever see, and it is accompanied with really weird tasting and textured American cheese. For an upscale place like Cured where we paid over $100 for LUNCH, you'd think it would come with gourmet cheeses instead of standard cheap American cheese but I wanted to trust the chef and so I (regretfully) ordered it anyway. The patty was small and overcooked. To come with no fixings and no condiments other than ketchup, is bold and confident, however unfortunately so at a major disappoinment. The confidence lacks self awareness. Just like the charcuterie board. A handful pieces of decent, not mind blowing, meats . Of the two jams was extremely bitter and inedible, to include one of the two mustard seeds, and the ginger infused pickles. So 50% of the board meh and the other 50% down right bitter and unappetizing. I couldn't believe the price they were charging for that junk. My spouse got the lamb, which was fine but the snap peas were soooo oily and way over seasoned! We couldn't even finish it. And the polenta was straight up bland. What is going on here?!  Our celebratory lunch was ruined!! I seriously still can't believe they have the audacity to charge $100. I can't believe I'm saying this but I'd much rather go to a mediocre chain restaurant and spend $100 than spend $20 at Cured.  Anyway, if I have anything positive to say it's that the service was great.

reviews.author: Swaz F.
reviews.description: We went here for the first time for Happy Hour so this review is for our Happy Hour Experience.    The drinks special were creative and delicious and only $5. We  ordered fried Quail legs from the Happy Hour menu which was crispy and well seasoned.  We also had charcuterie board as a starter and everything on the board were paired together for maximum tasting experience.  For dinner we had Sunday supper fried chicken dinner.  The chicken was moist, tender, and super tasty.  It came with grits, cornbread, and collards which made the meal a total southern comfort food experience.  Our server took great care of our party ensuring our drinks were refreshed and returned to check on us to make sure we had everything we needed.  Overall we enjoyed ourselves here while visiting from Charlotte NC.

reviews.author: Philip B.
reviews.description: Just had a terrific dining experience at Cured! I'm really not sure what they could do to not earn 5 stars! We started with the reserve charcuterie plate. Among the favorites were pork butter, smoked duck ham, jalapeÃ±o pork rillettes, and 30 day bresaola. For an entree, we shared the 30 day dry aged ribeye. We ordered it medium and it was cooked to perfection.   After dinner (and with very little room left in my stomach) we order the bread pudding. It was delicious. I've had lots of bread pudding in my lifetime and this easily ranked towards the top of the list.   The service was wonderful and we made friends at the table next to us. The manager saw us having a good time and came by to pour our combined group a round of complimentary wine. That really helped solidify a wonderful experience.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: The Pearl is one of those great places with a variety of restaurants, shops, coffee spots and wine bars. Unfortunately, they are hit or miss. I guess the feeling is the area sells itself and, it does, but the food should decidedly be a part of that sell. This was the case for Cured.  I really wanted to like Cured. It was a different concept and had some interesting looking plates. The location, as mentioned, was outstanding and the restaurant itself had plenty of seating. But that was all it had to offer. The happy hour was minute, and they only offered quail legs as a HH food. These were .50c during happy hour, so the price was not bad at all, but that was the only happy hour food offering, which is quite meager for a HH menu.  As a meal, my friends and I shared the Cheese Plate for $30. This was already too pricey for a platter with only three cheese selections. We had to add their Foie Gras and Summer Sausage for $8.00 each to have some meats in the platter. At the waiter's recommendation, we included an order of four HH quail legs and two bottles of their punch special for $20 each.  Overall, service was pretty good. The waiter was attentive and kept the drink servings going, so the issue was never the service. But, other than location, that is all that Cured had to offer. The prices were too high and the food underwhelming. The pate was tasteless, and I was not impressed with the summer sausage. I did like the quail legs, but I wish they were meatier. Even the punch got cloyingly sweet after the first glass.  I know that charcuterie plates tend to be pricey, but with only three cheese selections, more cheese was needed, at least, more charcuterie board selections. Ultimately, I felt that Cured was not worth it and, quite frankly, there are too many places in the Pearl that can give them a run for their money.

reviews.author: Frank J.
reviews.description: Disclaimer: I can only speak to the happy hour menu (which surprisingly also happens on saturdays!)  The patio punch is a rum-based drink with lemonade and blueberry flavoring and was delicious! The cost was $20 and could be shared well with 4 people. The drink wasn't overpowered with the taste of the rum and I'd definitely return for this drink again.  The quail legs were amazing. The meat was tender and the outside breading was very tasteful. The legs were topped with honey and rosemary and came at 50 cents a piece. They are an amazing light snack and I'd highly recommend you give them a try.

reviews.author: J E.
reviews.description: While visiting The Pearl on a Sunday, during the farmers market we came here for brunch. We got here right as they opened, so it wasn't busy. We were quickly greeted and seated and enjoyed the view of the curing fridge as we entered. Our server was amazing... She was VERY friendly. Additionally, the GM kept stopping by to check on us. The menu is really nicely done, especially for brunch... So many great options too!! Their burger tasted amazing... so did the fried chicken and donuts! Cocktails were nicely done too! Overall, we loved our visit and would recommend it!!!

reviews.author: Martha M.
reviews.description: I love this happy hour! I believe it's 3-6 every day. They have quail legs for .50 only during happy hour and they are absolutely delicious. The staff is always friendly, they have a variety of beers and fabulous cocktails. The spot is open, light and inviting. Never a miss!

reviews.author: China D.
reviews.description: My friends and i came to Cured as an appetizer before our dinner reservation. The inside of this restaurant is super cool, they did a great job renovating this space. Excellent vibes for small group dinner or grabbing drinks for a date. The staff is very friendly and helpful at explaining the menu. We opted for some cocktails, although they have an excellent beer list too. We decided to try the two charcuterie boards, both the meat and cheese platter. Everything was excellent and it was fun for our group to try new things. Note that you can ask for additional bread free of charge :) We absolutely loved this place and the area is cool too. I'll definitely come back.

reviews.author: Humberto A.
reviews.description: Besides this place serving excellent meals. This review will focus on one of their servers Brian who went up and beyond to make sure we had a memorable experience at Cured and while he was charming and knowledgeable about the menu and the charcuterie board pros and cons he always kept a smile on and made it feel more like we were at home not at a restaurant. Kudos for the excellent meal and please keep the customer service experience top notch because Brian sure is an asset to Cured. Cheers and let the good times roll

reviews.author: Anh N.
reviews.description: Perfect date night vibes or drinks with friends. Overall Cured has no faults but didn't hit me with any dishes that I needed to come back.  It's a very chic looking place though and you have a great area to walk around in afterwards.

reviews.author: Jose Raul P.
reviews.description: I've been here several times and I have never been disappointed. Service is great! Staff is friendly! And the food tastes phenomenal! This place is the type of place that will encourage you to try things out of your comfort zone and you'll be glad you did.   The charcuterie boards are unmatched. They are authentic and not the trends we've seen lately. Wedge salad was good, blue cheese was a bit strong for my taste, but my date enjoyed it. The fried oyster sandwich is something I've never seen before, it was however delicious! Drinks are strong, so you'll get your moneys worth.   Great place to have dinner at the pearl, perfect for a date!

reviews.author: Amanda E.
reviews.description: The beautiful building is situated in the buzzing Pearl complex. We have been here twice now. The first time, we came for happy hour and the quail legs were exceptional! This time, we came for dinner and I was underwhelmed. The meat and cheese plates were very tasty with a nice variety of selections. However, our dinners were very heavy handed on the black pepper, especially the shrimp (of the shrimp and grits) and acorn squash (paired with my filet). My other half quite enjoyed his shrimp and grits, but everything was too spicy for me unfortunately. Moving forward, I think we will stick to happy hour!

reviews.author: MC F.
reviews.description: I'd read that this is a "must-do" restaurant, not just in San Antonio, but in TEXAS. I can easily see how Cured made it on that short list and has been dubbed "the gem of the Pearl district."  Located in what was once the administrative building of the Pearl brewery, the design and finishes pay homage to the original structure, which was built in 1904. Much of the original integrity remain, and everything about the architecture, from the open beamed ceilings to the roughly painted brick feels beautifully intentional yet humbly authentic.  But the real star of cured is that charcuterie. In fact, compared to these house-made offerings, any other restaurants that offer cliched store-bought prosciutto and salami should be embarrassed to slap the "charcuterie" label on it. This is the real deal: house-made rilletes, chicken liver mousse, and smoke duck breast are divine in their own right yet are further elevated by their accoutrements, which they make and sell by the jar.  We tried the dry-aged ribeye and wedge salad as well and were too stuffed to finish it all in the end.  Bottom line: every foodie who visits San Antonio would be remiss if they didn't visit Cured. And checking out the Pearl district without visiting Cured would be a crime against all things foodie

reviews.author: Jasmine L.
reviews.description: My family and I got upset stomachs and food poisoning for 1-2 days after eating dinner here this past weekend.  The charcuterie plates were overpriced for the amount of cheese and meat received. Would not recommend. The heritage hog poutine dish was drenched in oil and made our stomachs uneasy. The braised lamb dish was not good at all, as it was compressed, too salty, and did not taste fresh.   The chicken fried livers were good, and the Cobb salad was fine. The mussels were good.   While the food was not appetizing, the service was good for the most part.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: The ambiance of this place is great! I took my wife here for a nice celebratory dinner and it was a really cute spot at the pearl. We started off with a charcuterie board and two entrees. The charcuterie board was good but it wasn't really what I was expecting. Very fancy for sure but the different spreadable meats were kind of odd. I think I prefer a more standard charcuterie board with regular meats cheeses and crackers/bread. We got the burger and the BOT. Both were terrific. The burger was a little small but very tasty and fried oysters were very good! I really did enjoy the experience it just seemed a little pricey especially the charcuterie board and the kitchen seemed under staffed or something bc it took a long time to get the food. Our waitress was terrific so it was still a terrific experience.   Overall: 4.41 stars

reviews.author: Lars K.
reviews.description: To those that say everything is over seasoned or the charcuterie is "too bitter", your palate just isn't refined enough sweetie! you just have a tongue used to the capitalist food standards with no flavor. Cured is supplied by local farms, boosting the local economy. Cured will always be my go-to!

reviews.author: Sara Z.
reviews.description: My husband and I had dinner at Cured Saturday night and it exceeded our expectations. The meal, service and ambiance of the restaurant was top notch! We can't wait for a return visit!

reviews.author: Mandy W.
reviews.description: Really cool that they cure the meats on site and have a cool display at the entrance. Food and beer was great! Really nice place but don't suggest for small toddlers.

reviews.author: Sofia P.
reviews.description: Cured was an absolutely fantastic experience. I have a very high intolerance to sulfites (which can be a complicated problem at a place specializing in cured foods), and both the chef and my waitress took excellent care of me. The chef took time to point out every single thing on the menu that I couldn't consume that day, which was truly special.   The wedge salad was phenomenal, as was the cheese plate. The staff member that took the time to describe each item on the cheese plate was very passionate about food, and was as sweet as could be. It was fun to try a bunch of combinations that I had never really considered, before.   I had the poutine for my meal, and it was honestly a culinary masterpiece. From using a small cast iron skillet to keep the fries crispy on the bottom, to using the pickled cauliflower as needed pops of acid to cut through the heavy fattiness of the pork, cheese, and gravy...it was a foodie's dream!   I would come back to Cured in a heartbeat, and the prices were honestly amazing for the experience and food that you receive. Definitely check it out!

name: Cullum's Attagirl
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Shaun S.
reviews.description: Was in the St. Mary's area to hit another place on a Sunday afternoon, but it was closed.  There are a number of places in that area, and Callum's caught my eye in my Yelp search.  I'd heard enough about them through a FB group, so we decided to give them a try.  Man, what a good decision!  My wife ordered the San Antonio hot sandwich, and I got a large order of the boneless San Antonio hot.  I also ordered the cheese fries.  The heat of the chicken is no joke, but the flavours are fanTAStic.  And the portions are filling - my wife couldn't quite finish the sandwich, and I chose to take a good amount of the boneless home, since I knew that would travel better than the fries, so I finished the fries there.  It was a little pricey, but over-sizing my boneless order didn't help.  And again, everything was so good, and I've got some to eat later at home, so it all works out.  You have a number of choices in the St Mary's area, but you should make a point of hitting this place.

reviews.author: Deborah B.
reviews.description: Wow. What a creative menu! And so many beers on tap!   We sampled the deviled eggs (super chilled and super creamy, might have been a tad improved with some salt), the OG chicken (a stunningly good sammich) and the vegan chicken (a slab of fried gold -- tofu, that is). Both sammiches were slathered with neon sauce, which was some bright green poppyseed deliciousness. We ate outside at the white picnic tables and had a lovely alfresco dinner. There are many things left to try; we will be back!

reviews.author: Nigel D.
reviews.description: Small dive restaurant with awesome atmosphere and a disco ball!  My wife had the PBandJ wings and Chicken Livers. I had the Honey Butter Chicken Biscuit with Crispy Fried Egg.   She said the wings were good and the livers were probably the best she had ever had.   My biscuit sandwich was good, the biscuit was great the, egg was great and the chicken was pretty good but not great.  We both said we would quite happily eat here again if we were in this area of town.

reviews.author: Joey M.
reviews.description: Good god! I have been here plenty times and have been blown away every single time! The flavors, the atmosphere, the tap beers and mimosas....  When coming to Cullum's take a second to breathe before eating your food, take a moment to really enjoy that first bite Bcs those flavors and all around goodness of every meal there will start getting your taste buds jumpin

reviews.author: Christi J.
reviews.description: The reason for 3 stars is mainly the pricing. I think it's a bit much to pay ~$20 for 6 wings that were good... but not that good. If they changed their pricing, then this place is pretty decent and worth checking out. It's small inside but they do offer outdoor seating which is nice. You do order your food at the front and they bring your food out to you.   We had ordered Tyme fries, San Antonio hot wings, and their chicken sandwich. The fries were crispy and full of flavor. Wings were pretty spicy in my opinion so I didn't enjoy it very much; it was also on the oily side due to the spices. Their chicken sandwich was very tasty and cooked to perfection. Their Gucci ranch is pretty good (and I would get this if you're ordering their hot wings... you'll need it).   They don't have a private parking lot so it's mainly street parking which wasn't so bad since it wasn't super busy.

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Even if parking can be challenging, everyone must make an occasional pilgrimage to Attagirl. Some of the best Chicken and Waffles in San Antonio are to be had here. They have an ever revolving beer selection, in good taste. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Angel S.
reviews.description: Lived up to the hype! Been on my list since day 1. Went with the Brown Bag Fried Chicken and the OG Chicken Sando.    No frills kind of spot. Just quirky, delicious and they do what they do very, very well.. Folks order up at the counter or order ahead and they bring the food out to you. There's a cute patio dining area and more places to sit inside.   The chicken itself is remarkable and the sandwich was perfectly done. The balance of crunch and juice was perfect. It was maybe the messiest, most crunchiest, 5 mins I've had this year. The fried egg was clutch!   We chose the Garlic and Thyme for the Brown Bag Fried Chicken and Fries   Was hoping for more chicken but what we had was actually some of THE best fried chicken we've ever had.    GET YOUR HANDS ON THIS CHICKEN!   Been here before? What did you get?

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: I love the outside patio and the colors and vibe. It's a order at the front and sit down place. They have a great selection of beers and drinks.   We got the Girls Thyme Fries, bologna sandwich, and the wings. The fries were so good and crispy, great flavor! I'd get an order for each person because the large was still a little small for 2. The wings are spicy!! Very good but prepared for spicy. Ranch sauce is a must with fries or wings. The bologna sandwich was good but wish the bread was different or toasty.   Overall, it's a good spot and a nice place for a bit to east anytime but night is the best vibe.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: This would be a 5 star review if not for the price. For 6 wings with a large side of ranch was $30+.. that a little crazy. The wings were amazing though. Definitely top 3 I've ever had.. just suck the way they price the wings or I'd be hooked and going back regularly. I get wings have gone up with the shortage and all, but damn.

reviews.author: Mari A.
reviews.description: Delicious chicken, very crispy and full of flavors.  Seating is limited indoors as well as outdoors. NO ice for beverages and NO kids menu. NO parking lot,  you have to park in front of people's houses. Service mediocre. Digital menu.

reviews.author: Bryan S.
reviews.description: Hey Cullum?! Attagirl!!! Initial thoughts when approaching this establishment was, "okay... I think we're at the wrong place." I couldn't be any more wrong. I was in fact at my destination of choice! I decided to go with a safe bet; the OG chicken. I mean, if it's not broken, don't fix it! I'm happy to report there's nothing to fix here. Besides a little too much coleslaw, the sandwich was crafted to perfection! Juice, crispy, etc. The good food along side the good beer ensures you're gonna have an immaculate time when feasting at this hidden gem!

reviews.author: Keith C.
reviews.description: Went for our first time this past Saturday afternoon.  Food was terrific!  Great weather for patio sitting. Wife stated that this was her new favorite fried chicken!  Sandwich was great and messy just like it should be. Wish we had discovered this place sooner.

reviews.author: Jordan T.
reviews.description: Loved the chicken and waffles!  So crispy! Took a bite of the Nashville chicken sandwich and it was also great!

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: Atta YES! I love this place. They are known for their chicken and have a tiny menu, but they have one veganish entree. It's called the vegan-ish job and it is AWESOME. It's fried tofu on a bun, and it is straight up delicious. I think the bun has honey on it, so it's not really vegan, hence the name. And the last time we were here, my bf added a fried egg to his veganish job, which made it even less vegan, but it was a very nice addition. I do recommend that combo. All the sides we have tried here have been winners as well - disco fries, creamed corn, and their gucci goat salad. Yummy! They also have a nice little variety of craft beers on tap. And the workers are very friendly. But the best part of this place is the veganish job. I don't often advocate for places with only one vegetarian option, but this one is too good to pass up. It's a small spot with indoor and outdoor seating, but totally worth the stop. And they know that they don't have a sign. Come in and grab a sandwich and beer and have a great food experience.

reviews.author: Dorie B.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times and have mixed reviews as a result. The first time was great but my most recent experience was not so much. I had the same thing both times, the OG chicken sandwich. The most recent time the chicken was fried so long it was tough. This made it hard to eat as a sandwich. I finally submitted and tried to use the spork they gave me but that was worse. It would bend each time I tried to stab the chicken. We wanted to sit outside because it was a nice day but the flies were literally swarming us. It was a constant struggle to keep them away. I know this is a natural consequence to sitting outside but there was also a large trash can in the immediate area that wasn't helping the situation.

reviews.author: Annette O.
reviews.description: Super small cute place overlooking a small intersection. Outdoor seating and indoor. Beer and small wine selection. But the very best Buffalo Gucci Ranch chicken sandwich I've ever had. Hands down. I would do it again

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Yum, yum. Outstanding food paired with a large craft beer selection. Don't look for a sign- they know they don't have one. This is not fast food. Sit back with a craft and enjoy the wait. It's worth it.  Nashville hot chicken is ligit and very spicy. The spice is from the frying oil and the seasoning - the true way. Most try to make it spicy with a sauce- not here. The freshly cut fries with thyme and garlic are enough to make you come here.  RIP Jim.

reviews.author: Bobby H.
reviews.description: Overall great place! The ranch is honestly the best part!!! Chicken well seasoned and fries were tasty.

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: Top notch chicken spot in the Monte Vista/Tobin Hill area. I had the Hot San Antonio Chicken Sandwich and it lit me up. Like jumping into the deep end and remembering you can't swim style...in over my head! Like I don't really remember anything 10 minutes before or after I ate it type of hot! I don't blame Cullum's or the sandwich, I blame my wimpy-ass mouth for failing me! Lots of foods say they are hot and I never even give it a second thought, but this one is pretty damn spicy...GOOD but you are gonna feel it for a bit.  The Buffalo Chicken is more for people with sensitive to extreme heat...like me, sadly. It is really good. I got a bite of one just as my tongue came back to life after the San Antonio Hot and it was about as tasty a chicken sammich as you're gonna find. Look at the pic! The damn thing is beautiful!  Get over there an check them out for anything chicken.  See more on IG @cheatday_SA

reviews.author: Gilbert G.
reviews.description: If I could use one word to describe the wings here at Cullum's Attagirl....."WOW."  The smoking of the wings definitely makes a difference, but their unique sauces are just amazingly tasty!   It didn't sound right, but I tried their PBandJ wings (yes, peanut butter and jelly), and they were nothing like I was imagining, and I was imagining something strange, but THEY ARE SOOOO WORTH IT! They blew my mind!  The Nashville Hot wings are spicy and I can swear I taste a hint of chipotle pepper, but I can't be certain. These wings are a definite repeat order.  Every wing or wing sauce I tried was really good. I've been here 3 times during my vacation here in San Antonio. It will take my broken legs to keeping me from coming back here at least one more time before I head back home!

reviews.author: Joe S.
reviews.description: Was there on a Saturday, and Nadia was probably the best bartender I've had in a while! Great beer selection, offered a wide variety of shots for us, and was very attentive to all the guests at the bar! Will definitely be back!! Thanks Nadia!! Too bad your cowboys lost yesterday!! Go Bucs!!!

reviews.author: Stephen C.
reviews.description: Nice casual hang type of atmosphere. Music not too loud, drinks taste great. They have a really nice selection of mixed drinks that are catered to ladies AND men. Excellent service from waitstaff and bar staff. Will come back many times, it's a gem.

reviews.author: Monica L.
reviews.description: This is a very casual friendly neighborhood bar type of place.  They have seating outside and plenty of seating inside.  They have 2 quarter pool tables that you can hang out and enjoy a friendly game.  The bartender was so helpful when I didn't know what I wanted to drink and her recommendation of Deep Eddy Lemon and cranberry juice is a new favorite now!  She was the only one working, but no one went without a drink and she had a friendly smile for everyone.

reviews.author: Tricia G.
reviews.description: Lele took great care of us and let me tell you the beer selection is amazing, especially if you don't drink the typical Mich Ultra and Bud Light. I mean they have it but the also have some great crafts as well. The shot selection is awesome. Lele suggested a root beer shot that surprised us! Go check it out, I loved the atmosphere!

reviews.author: Cathey O.
reviews.description: Absolutely love our neighborhood area bar!  We always have such a great time...great selection of beers, cocktails and wine.  They are taking the Covid situation very serious, and are maintaining a clean, yet still fun environment.  We had an amazing time this last visit, but had a slight computer glitch at the end of the night effecting our bill.  Tricia (the GM) contacted me back right away, and was super helpful!  Thanks to her amazing attention to customer service, we will continue being loyal customers!

reviews.author: Roger M.
reviews.description: The Stout House is one of the best bars I have ever been too off of Bandera and the 151. Great staff with minimum wait times while ordering drinks. The Stout House bar has many craft brews to choose from with an amazing selections of coctails. If you don't know what to drink ask one of the bartenders to make something that fit your sweet or sour pallet. The staff is friendly, approachable with an amazing "Bloody Marry Bar" on Sundays. It's clean, well kept, and you can play pool or darts at your leisure. They are always throwing different events throughout the weekday. If you are looking for a good time; come out and visit the Stout House in Helotes, you will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Rich H.
reviews.description: First time here. I really like craft beers. Especially stouts. The Facebook page says over 20 craft beers on tap. Little deceiving. Maybe 10 with the rest domestic. The service from Kayhla more than made up for the lack of craft beers. He vibe is chill. You can watch sports without sound if you like that. No food but a pizza joint next door and you can bring you beer over. I will be back.

reviews.author: Ellie G.
reviews.description: White big guy bartender was a super dick when trying to orde, and apparently he's the manager ??? Slow ass bartending and bad customer service

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: I have sort of followed this place off yelp since it first opened but never actually made it out because of the reviews. We were invited out so we gave it a shot.   First you walk in and the first thing that hits you is the smell of old stale beer Oh you know the smell- it's that sour, no one has cleaned the bar mats correctly kinda smell. Then your eyes adjust and you are like hmmm,  for a place that is fairly new and in the outskirts of Helotes this place is really run down. Not like shabby cool- just like cardboard boxes on top of an open area., close to the ceiling - may be a fire hazard - but more like scary walk to the restroom kinda place. I actually saw a staff member clean the wood top table with Fabuloso and the stench permeated for some time- just what  I want when trying l to enjoy a drink...... when you look around you see the obligatory beer signs but then you also note that there are a bunch of advertisements for upcoming events. Like too too many that it makes the walls look littered.   With the word "stout" in the name of the place one expects to have lots of different kinds of microbrews. Sure they have one descheutes stout and one elisyan and maybe 2-3  but other taps are your big corp, beer (bud, Miller, etc).  They do have full bar options. Moscow mules served in copper mugs though ginger beer was flat.   There is no food in the joint but I saw several patrons walk in with pizza boxes from the place next door.   The crowd was loud, obnoxiously loud. Not sure how many decibels this places hits but it must be ridiculously high- my ears were buzzing.    Crowd- A little to old to be taking shots at 6pm but hey whatever. Appeared that highs school football parents and grandparents were getting ready for the season. The cont shrieking if one patron was enough to push is out of the place.   That was our experience, so now how about sharing yours?

reviews.author: Alexandra B.
reviews.description: Went in December 15th and was greeted by a super nice bartender. He was so cool and made us super good drinks. We each had one pitcher of a peach Long Island. Loved the atmosphere. Would have given 5 stars but after the guy got off shift a girl went on shift and she had the worst attitude. Super rude to us and told us we needed to be careful how much we drank. We had only had the one drink a piece and babied it for a good while. I understand not over serving... but she was just ridiculous and barely gave us a beer. So because she had such an attitude we didn't even finish our beer we just left.

reviews.author: Ed F.
reviews.description: I've never ever In my life have a bar gm send my debit card info from one bar to the next to see if I was there or not . Then when I get ready to leave my truck is on three flats . I called the owner mr William hue to try to rectify the situation and I was talked at and not listened too . Now we are here . Here ya go . They treat you like trash and when you don't accept their treatment, this is how they treat you . I'm out 700 for the tow and tires .

reviews.author: Catherine S.
reviews.description: Good music, nice service. The beer selection is legit, and they have a full bar if beers not your thing. They also allow you to bring in your own food. BYOF.

reviews.author: Gabriella A.
reviews.description: This bar is great! Lele is one of the best and most attentive bartenders ever. She always remembers our usual drink orders. A variety of beers on tap that I rarely see elsewhere as well as great daily drink specials. Nights get pretty crazy but during happy hour it is a chill vibe at this bar. Not to mention a yummy pizza-by-the-slice restaurant next door.

reviews.author: Reby G.
reviews.description: I loveeeeeee Stout House!!!!  Although I'm not a beer drinker it is to my knowledge that their selection of stouts is very welcoming. Their quick service and kind words have always made me feel important and cherished by the crew that mans the bar. Their music is ran by a jukebox, but thank Jesus the people who attend there have stellar taste in music so you'll groove all night long. An outdoor patio greets you warmly and their specials are consistent too.
