Easy place to chill for hours.   **The girl bartender was rude once a while back without justification, but to avoid any negative feelings about Stout House I ask for drinks from the guys behind the bar.

reviews.author: Jade M.
reviews.description: Went here for Harry Potter trivia with a group of friends. They don't have any food but you can bring pizza in from next door. Trivia was fun and drinks were economically priced. A-okay neighborhood bar.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: The neighborhood bar everyone wish they had. Stout has a great selection of craft brews and daily drink specials. They typically show all the major sporting events on their many TVs. If you are looking for a drama-free environment this is the place for your. Kick back enjoy a drink and listen to good music.

reviews.author: Jen P.
reviews.description: So this was a discovery place we stopped by to wait for our movie. We ended up going right back after our movie for the mini pitcher drinks. Cool place, little pricey but decent place to chill for drinks

reviews.author: Tammie R.
reviews.description: Met up with a group of girlfriends here on a Saturday night to catch up and it was perfect. Our bartendress was awesome, the drinks were quick and the environment was chill. There were lots of open seats; I don't know how to explain it - inside setup looks like picnic-type high bar tables everywhere, Lol! Forgive me, I don't even know if that's typical. Just something I've seen for the first time. There is also a patio outside.   Location is great! There is a pizza place next door, cupcake shop close by and a Silverado movie theater within walking distance. No issues with parking. A great hangout spot to stop by before or after a movie, shoot some darts, play beer pong and get a few drinks.  Only downsides are I had a Long Island and a Pineapple Rum and didn't get a buzz (usually I'm good with just a Long Island), and they don't serve any food/appetizers (NADA). So, great hangout place, but not for strong drinks or snacking ;)

reviews.author: Eliab G.
reviews.description: It's a great little bar, but if your looking to chill in a quiet location, this is not it. It's fun during sports and they have a digital jukebox try the 8 dollar mini pitcher drinks!!

reviews.author: Angi M.
reviews.description: Good place for sports and trivia!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Drinks are cold and cheap!!!!! Service is great!!! Patrons are all pleasant!

name: Bar America
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Angelina W.
reviews.description: I love this place. Always a good time with friends or siblings. Brunch on Sunday was nice with Bucho. The outside patio and roof top area are nice. Roof top has a pretty great view. Mimosa set up is a nice price at $10-11 I believe. I've seen it change before though. Would continue to come back for the drinks. Not all customer service has been great though.

reviews.author: Vincent G.
reviews.description: I have been going to Bar America for 8 years now. Continuously having a worse and worse experience as time went on. I do love the remodel they did and how there is a ton more space, but that does not supersede the management and service you will receive.  This last visit was the last time I will be going to Bar America. I had some friends in town and I wanted them to enjoy a nice Sunday Funday while avoiding the Texas heat. Every other time except this last time, minors have been allowed. We were trying to be responsible and we brought a 20 yr old that does not/ will not drink, to hang out and drive us all home safely. Well the 'manager' came over and let us know that we will have to go because "they do not allow anyone in the bar that is 18, 19 or 20 because of they could be drinking and its a TABC violation".  I could go on and on about the other times that have been similarly awful, but I will sum it up to.... rude management/ staff and there a ton of other better places to go. [Southtown 101 is fun, clean and friendly]

reviews.author: Janelle W.
reviews.description: I love their drinks! This bar has so much to offer. There's a DJ, TVs playing sports, the pool table, and the rooftop view.

reviews.author: Masey D.
reviews.description: Amazing!! I went there for my 21st birthday and the menus were customized and the table was beautifully setup. The waiter was very professional and polite. He even brought me a slice of key lime pie for my birthday. Overall great experience

reviews.author: Chaya H.
reviews.description: Not personable at ALL, manager was horrible and was very dismissive. She attempted to take our order then walked off and we got a waiter....we ended Up leaving...the waiter wasn't bad though.

reviews.author: Anthony R.
reviews.description: Draft beer is priced fairly. Expect zero personality and/or smiles from the staff. Maybe they aren't paid or treated well?  Or maybe you just gotta do better SA.

reviews.author: Prissy J.
reviews.description: I was under the impression I was going to a bar, not NIOSA. Absolutely disgusting bathroom situation. There's enough illness going around these days without this noAside from the fact that they were PORTA POTTIES (!!!) they were porta potties that were almost filled to the brim. At least at fiesta you know what you're getting into and they keep them maintained for the most part. If a bar cannot have proper bathrooms, then it shouldn't be open to the public. Get your crap together, Bar America! No pun intended.   Chorizo tater tots were bomb tho.  Update: Bar America whined to yelp and got my photo of their DISGUSTING porta potty removed, so you'll have to use your imagination. Picture a big blood clot on top of a pile of urine saturated toilet paper surrounded by turds.

reviews.author: Alexandra M.
reviews.description: I love Bar America the food is pretty damn good for being a bar and they have brunch options in the weekends. It's a perfect spot to watch the games since they have multiple screens.   You have to stand in line to order, not like other bars where you can stand anywhere to order so just keep that in mind if you haven't been. Theres the rooftop view as well with some nice photo ops.   The music and vibe is spot on and the service is pretty good, well rounded spot you make have to wait a little longer on game days but that's everywhere.

reviews.author: John X.
reviews.description: Dj on deck, live entertainment is always a plus. Could use better parking, just saying. Great Sunday drink specials. Pool table available for those who like billiards

reviews.author: Dewayne W.
reviews.description: If I could give it zero stars would - terrible service and menu. Spent $20 on 2 appetizers and they weren't half the cost. Go anywhere else for food in SanAntonio - only come here if your want to get hammered.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Good bar to hang out with friends. They have good bar prices. I don't think anyone would feel out of place. They have inside and outside seating with a cool upstairs area where you have a good view of the tower.  The bartenders are fast. They have many drink options.  We rented an area for a birthday party and everything went as planned. FYI if you are bringing a gift, make sure it is not alcohol because they won't let you take it in.  Parking can be a pain. It is street parking.

reviews.author: Brandon I.
reviews.description: such an amazing bar! very clean and socially distanced!! this bar is a MUST when y'all come out in SATX! Christy and Erica are very prompt and soooooo genuine!! ASK FOR THEM! AMAZING JOB!!! keep up the cleanliness and fun times!!

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: I really enjoy it here! Been twice.. once on a random night of the week. Decent crowd, super friendly bar staff both times. The second visit was on a Sunday for brunch and to watch football. Again. Super friendly bar staff, and they are super quick and efficient. Probably the fastest moving bar staff I've seen in a while, considering the amount of people they're serving.   My friend got me hooked onto their pickle and chamoy shots! Holy guacamole, my mouth is watering just thinking about them!   On Sunday's they open at noon, and they do have a brunch menu which includes wings, chicken and waffles, brisket migas, breakfast sandwich and my favorite the chorizo and cheese tots! The price point is excellent. The tots are big enough to share. There was 2 of us and we shared brisket migas and the tots. And it was plenty of food. The tots were LOADED with chorizo, and it was god quality chorizo, and the tots were fried crisp! Not soggy or soft at all! It was perfect!   They offer $10 mimosa set ups, too! A bottle of champs and either cranberry, orange or pineapple juice. There are a lot of drink specials offered daily, even during Sunday brunch. There is a patio, and a rooftop bar as well. Ample amounts of tables and bar stools all over the bar, plenty of TVs. And on Sunday, after the game, there was a DJ! So it's the perfect spot for a Sunday funday.   Parking can be hard, but you can park right down, less than a 5 minute walk in the school district parking lot, behind Batallion.   Definitely going to have to come back for their brunch!!

reviews.author: Geoff D.
reviews.description: Hows business  peeps? That's what you f***3rs get for being shitty to your customers!.  Bahahshshshahahahahhahahahhahaaaaaaa!

reviews.author: Paul G.
reviews.description: Attempted to have a beer here last night. I was refused entrance due to a 3x3 Texas tattoo on my upper right elbow. Completely ridiculous. I'm moderately tattooed but that specific one didn't pass their judgment. For an establishment that sells lone star and lone star light this is completely ridiculous. Do y'all know what state y'all are located in? Take your money and beer drinking elsewhere. Skip this lame place.  Brian, you must have me confused with another patron. My wife was not with me, or has posted a review (she's not even on yelp) my mom hasn't contacted you and I do not have a 210 tattoo anywhere on my body. Y'all should try and adjust your 'dress code' y'all sell Texas beer for crying out loud.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Went here on Sunday to watch the Brazil vs. Switzerland game.  Got there just as they opened (shocked they didn't open for the earlier Mexico vs. Germany game, which would have been a better view of the TV over Francis Bogside).  We got 4 chairs at the bar and enjoyed the food selection and the $2 Modelo drafts and $3 well tequila shots.   Atmosphere - Relaxed open space that has a number of tables and benches with tons of TV's around the outside wall.  DJ Tony Phoenix (https://www.facebook.com/DJTonyPhx/) was spinning some great tunes as the crowd enjoyed their Sunday afternoon.  Place was packed and I was told it was like that most Sundays.    Food/Drinks - The drink specials are great here as I saw a number of Mimosa sets going out of the bar.  Our party got the fish tacos and the chorizo with taters that was plenty of food.  Next time I am going with the chicken and waffle option that seemed to be the most popular item ordered.    Service -All food and drinks are ordered at the bar, so they are attentive and make sure everyone has food and drinks.  Kept the bar clean and highly enjoyed our bartenders that were nice and spent time chatting with us.  They work really hard.  Overall - Check this place out.  Good food and drinks, great service, and perfect location off the River Walk.

reviews.author: Yevette H.
reviews.description: I really loved this place when they 1st reopened. I even gave it 5 stars. But in the last couple yrs it's not my tiny dive bar anymore. I mean good for them but I don't have anything in common with the new crowd. A younger "hipper" kinda place now.  The beer selection is still primo and the happy hour prices are great. I just want to sit and have a nice conversation without the little hipsters bumping into me.

reviews.author: Michelle D.
reviews.description: ***Delete if not allowed*** I know this place serves food, but we have never been there for it. After last night it is doubtful we ever will be.   We took a Lyft from the Pearl, 9 of us, to go to Bar America last night. Previously we have had a lot of fun and the DJ was good when we were there. We arrived before half our party and paid $20 for 4 of is to get in. Apparently they have a cover charge now, no big deal we are used to that in Chicago.   We go order drinks and wait for the rest to arrive. They are immediately turned away at the door, not because they are busy, but because one friend is 24. Yes, twenty four. We asked to speak with a manager and are told that just last night they started implementing a 25 and up rule. Why? Because of the shooting they had outside the bar in September? I'm sorry but you are just now implementing this????  We decided we werent staying and maybe had been there all of 10 minutes, including the time spent talking to the manager. Because of this new found rule we asked for our cover charge back. I didn't think it was too much to ask given we had just arrived. The manager refused. We paid $20 to hear a crappy DJ play one song.  Now, I get that the shooting most definitely had a negative impact on their business. But if you are going to alienate your biggest clientele (21-24) you probably shouldn't be operating as a bar. Stick to food and close at 11 like other restaurants. Don't advertise that you have a DJ and turn people away at the door. People who are of legal drinking age. As you can see the place was dead at 10:30 last night.   But good came out of it. We went right down the road to Jokesters. Never heard of the place before but after taking a Lyft across town we wanted something close. The doorman laughed when we asked if we were too young, apparently they were aware of the new rule and were getting all the clientele Bar America wouldn't let in. They were packed, service was fast and the DJ was awesome. He played current and all of the 80s and 90s favorites. We definitely will go back there.

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Bar America is back and better than ever!  Newly renovated exposed brick and finished hardwood interior and rooftop deck are classy and awesome, and a good selection of reasonably-priced spirits, beers, and cocktails to choose from.  Haven't tried the food, but I heard it's pretty good.  There was a hip DJ there last night, and they brought back the pool table thank God!  It's just about the only pool table in Southtown when you're looking to satisfy the need for a clean break, some neat clicks, and feel the gratification of a fine shot dropping into the pocket.  Back patio is currently being finished up at the time of posting (Feb '20) in conjunction with another welcomed coffee shop establishment.  Undoubtedly will be fantastic once it's fully open to everyone's enjoyment.  View from the rooftop to the downtown skyline should be spectacular!

reviews.author: William C.
reviews.description: Went there last night for the first time and loved it.  Extremely friendly staff, good selection of draft beer, and great music.  They are also doing a great job in handling the Covid restrictions which is certainly appreciated.

name: Quarry Hofbrau and Beer Garden
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Carlton B.
reviews.description: Food was amazing and the waiters was down to earth which made the experience pleasant. Plus a live singer.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: If you've had a long week, then this is the place for you. Order a Dos A Rita and go for a dip the swimming pool sized glass. By the time you find the bottom, you're problems will seem further away. The pickle chips are crisp, well battered, and savory. The pretzel was a little heavy on the salt, but the beer cheese is perfectly balanced to bring out the creaminess of the cheese and the sweet malt of the beer.   Dog friendly patio is a nice touch. The service was good and I get the prices were fair for the massive drink portion size you receive.

reviews.author: Crawfish G.
reviews.description: Stopping by.  Now I have not been into this establishment yet but I plan on it since I am new to the area and it looks super cute, I often browse Yelp to find great places to try out. I stumbled upon this place and went to read my first review. Someone made a review about this place regarding a bartender touching her hair in the bathroom, and how another waiter was talking over there food on their table. I just want to say *because I'm totally irked by those comments* if you choose to dine out at a public establishment - that is your choice. Confronting someone in the bathroom about them adjusting their features (which is definitely "an invasion of space" but lets talk about social distancing, right? LOL) These workers are working to provide a great experience for you as the customer. If you are scared of being out in public and someone coming to close of contact with your food (even though you're out in public ordering food at a public restaurant that has to be cooked by other people, assorted by other people, and served by other people) then you should order takeout! If your main goal is to go out to eat and criticize normal human beings for being themselves and trying their best to show up everyday, then hit the road, JACK!   Anyway, I can't wait to stop by this place as it looks very cool. Peace!

reviews.author: Patrick S.
reviews.description: So my wife have been eye balling this place for a while when eating at Ida Claire's so after a plane ride with no alcohol or food my wife says hay let's go get a beer and I say let's do this! We got there and the parking lot was full so naturally being social butterfly that I am I'm like shit!  So we walk in and it's dead should have taken that as a red flag. So we sat down had some pretty decent service at first my kid ordered the kids burger and she barely touched so I took a bite after while of her not touching it and figured out why it was flavorless so no more mystery there. The wife and I ordered some beers we wanted to try and everything we wanted was out which was a bummer but we settled on one and it was cold and did the trick for the time being, and then we decided to order the cheese and sausage board and when it showed up we weren't impressed it looked like the cheese had been sitting out for a few hours and the sausage was cold, and from one peace to the other it tasted all the same they just tried to present it nicely, I wished I had taken a picture but my bad. So to make a long story endless the good was the beer was cold the bad was everything else. We won't be back.

reviews.author: Kirk D.
reviews.description: First off I'm sorry I didn't get a picture of those delicious chicken diablos but they were so dang good I eat them before they cooled down. Which means they were fresh out the kitchen. The beer selection is great if you're here for that and the bartender Mitch is a pleasure to deal with. Seriously though order the chicken diablos.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Met with some friends here for dinner to catch up and we thought to order appetizers; however, when the server put the appetizer down on the table EVERYONE WAS IN SHOCK. It was like having a full meal on top of our actual meal. Nonetheless, great service! We had such a fun time!

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: The Quarry Hofbrau and Beer Garten is a great place to rendezvous with family and friends. It has a spacy outside area; the drinks and food are favorable, and the service was excellent. The location also can't be beat. It is across from the Quarry and a couple of blocks away from pretty Alamo Heights, which is definite plus. All in all, a perfect place to sit and enjoy, especially with the cooler weather upon us.  We all ordered the Wurst plate which comes with three types of sausage, a bit of sauerkraut, and two choices of sides. In my case, I ordered the sweet potato fries and grilled veggies. Everything on the plate was well-prepared and the portion was large enough for a second meal of leftovers. Our young waitress was new but handled the service like a pro and was very attentive.  This is a place that I could visit and have, over and over. It is not too pricy, comfortable atmosphere, tasty food/drinks and awesome service. It hits all marks. Really, there isn't much not to like in this place. Absolutely recommend it for an after-Quarry visit.

reviews.author: Jecca G.
reviews.description: We had our company party there and wow - we were blown away. The service was wonderful and my team had a great time. Ashley, the manager was very nice and Johnny and Julie were very attentive. I can t say enough good things about their place. We also enjoyed Austin Forrest playing that night. I would recommend for large groups. Thank you for making our holiday party memorable.

reviews.author: Bruno S.
reviews.description: It has the potential of a 5 star rating.  It really deserves a 2 star rating but here's why I gave it 3... they still have the best variety and best Dos-A-Ritas in San Antonio.  One of the best outdoor beer gardens in SA.  But, last night was our first visit since the renovation (If I remember right I had given them a 4 star review prior to their Reno).  Here is why it was a 2: Boiled down to customer service.  The hostess was not even close to being pleasant.  We were on a date night and I asked to be seated outside so we can enjoy the music and some drinks near the stage.  So she tries to sit me as a far away as possible in the corner area with a peekaboo view of life.  I did tell her [again] I would prefer to be seated near the stage and pointed out all the empty tables.    Our waiter was great, friendly, and his bright personality made up for the poor experience we had received so far.  The margaritas were still as amazing as I remembered them.  We ordered appetizers.  My wife loves the fried pickles from here and they didn't disappoint.  I normally would order their Cheese and Sausage board but I ordered the Wurtzel by mistake.  When the Wurtzel came it actually Looked really good so I kept it.  First bite in and the middle of the pretzel was cold as was the sausage (so gross).  Not to mention the lady who brought them over plopped them on the table and left (another grumpy employee).  Here's the thing, it wasn't even that busy.  Makes you wonder why... since they have one of the nicest outdoor seating areas with a stage and live music in that area.  The weather was beautiful and not as hot as it typically gets during this time of year.  Back to my point, it wasn't busy so why was the overall service so poor?   Even though the band sounded great, a couple of mosquito bites into the evening we decided to leave and try somewhere else.  Shout out to the Nathan Lugo Band! We only stayed as long as we did because y'all sounded great.  After their renovation it offers much more of a family vibe with an outdoor play area for kids, relaxed seating areas, and just gorgeous patio and beer garden.   We used to absolutely love coming here it was one of our favorite spots for a date night and to bring friends/family for large groups.  Hopefully the owners select a competent manager and take a hard look at their customer service.

reviews.author: Amy C.
reviews.description: Great food, awesome waitress! I got the burger, however this place is well known for their brisket. Their brisket nachos or brisket grilled cheese seem to be the most popular.

reviews.author: Leon W.
reviews.description: My daughter and I ate lunch today and the food was great, the service was excellent and the atmosphere superb. Even parking was convenient! The bratwurst sausage was tasty, the pretzel had great flavor. My daughter said the brisket enchiladas were good and the beer garden was very nice as well as the patio.  The grilled asparagus with butter were superb. I recommend this restaurant. Social distancing was in place and staff wore masks.

reviews.author: Ricardo B.
reviews.description: Had been a while since I came to this place.  Well to another location before but not to the original.  Joe the manager greeted us and welcomed us from the get go.  Our server Johnny was awesome taking care of business.  Also shout out to Meagan one of the bussers , she was doing her thing bussing a table but made sure we were getting taken care of.  Stopped by our table to see if we needed anything.  Afterwards met with Joe the manager and felt like a VIP.  Stop by and visit.  I highly recommend it.  We look forward to going back.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: I had a hankering for their brisket jalapeÃ±o poppers and they delivered! They are big,tasty and filling. I also had two of their $5 cocktails that were on offer. The Irish Drop Shot and the Reverse Irish Drop Shot. The Irish Drop Shot was a delicious drink with some sweetness to it. It's the perfect amount of sweetnes. The Reverse Irish Drop Shot wasn't as sweet. I will recommend the Irish Drop Shot. The service was great. I never felt neglected. I will be back again.

reviews.author: DÃ©dalo P.
reviews.description: Their Brisket Nachos are great. Some of their BBQ is solid. The potato salad was unacceptable. I don't think they make their potato salad in house. It tasted like something pre-packaged from a grocery store. We waited over an hour to get our food and the waiter wasn't very apologetic about that. Their drinks are fantastic. The staff needs to step up their game, they weren't very friendly. I would go there again based on a couple of the dishes and drinks. I felt like the staff just happened to be having a bad day the day we were there.

reviews.author: Rene M.
reviews.description: Great food! Great ambiance! I had the queso blanco and the turkey sandwich. Delicious! They had live music and out waiter was on point!  The drinks were tasty and priced fairly. Can't wait to come back!

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: This was my first post-quarantine venture into the dining world. All things considered, I think Hofbrau was a good choice. There was a good atmosphere to relax in with good company. Sure, the food took over an hour to arrive, but had I awoken from a 3 month coma when I sat out in the beer garten, the only variation on normality would be the waitstaff's masks.  I felt kinda bad for the harried servers. The joint was jumping. There were very few empty tables, but the live band appeared to have all patrons in good spirits. Speaking of spirits, they took a long time too, but the drinks were strong, so I didn't make a fuss. Food was good quality and hearty,  but a NOTE TO THE TECH-CHALLENGED: At this time you will need a smart phone that reads a QR code to get a menu.

reviews.author: Cindy P.
reviews.description: We had a group of about 30 people gather after my father's Celebration of Life. Quarry Hofbrau y Mas accommodated us outside in their beer garden. They were great about maintaining social distancing and keeping us safe. Their menu had a wonderful mix of southern, Mexican and German delicacies such as wurtzel (gorgeous large pretzel with dips), cheese and German sausage board, brisket nachos and queso blanco with brisket, salads, sandwiches, and Tex-Mex plates. They have an extensive bar, signature margaritas, good wine selection, and a great selection of local, national and Mexican beers. The patio is absolutely gorgeous, and the service professionals could not have been more helpful, warm, and kind. When we return to San Antonio, which is often, we will have to return to Quarry Hofbrau!

reviews.author: Annalisa M.
reviews.description: We've been coming here for years now, never disappoints, we love the shady outdoor seating, live music, especially Chris Lopez! Its been our go to date night spot and birthday spot to celebrate with friends. We've done apps and drinks or full dinner entrees, they have a great menu selection for either. Definitely be back soon.

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Delicious food, beer and fabulous service from Damian.  Hdjfifufuffffhhhhfgsgdhdhxhdh

reviews.author: Tony A.
reviews.description: Food is basic and service is slow. Huge portions help you feel like it's not a complete rip off.   Really this menu feels like it lacks an identity. Tex-Mex and German don't make for very logical fusions.   The mix drinks arnt even well made. Just pre-mixed.   2 stars because if you don't want to wait to have a table you are at the right

reviews.author: Margie H.
reviews.description: Love Makos for a girls brunch or a date night! Great atmosphere! They even have a green area down by the creek with seating. If you're having trouble finding a nice quite outdoor area this is the place! It overlooks the woods!

reviews.author: Parker T.
reviews.description: I'll try it again but I don't Recommend the steak . It was chewy and tasteless. Everyone else had a good meal.

reviews.author: Deanna J.
reviews.description: I chose to dine alone this evening. I used the Yelp app to help me decide, and Mako's ended up being the perfect location. I made a reservation; it wasn't needed, but I wanted to be on the safe side. I was seated quickly at a high top near the bar where I could still enjoy the peace of dining alone, with the background noise of quiet conversation from others and ESPN playing above the bar.   I'd made it just in time for the Happy Hour specials and decided on a $5 old fashioned and the $5 Gouda ranch wedge ($1 with grilled shrimp1). I added the butternut squash bisque after placing my initial order, and it was the right choice. The funny thing is I can't quite describe what made it tasty, but I cleaned the bowl! The salad was pure perfection...seriously...you canNOT go wrong. I'm not sure if it was the tangy pickled onion, the smoky lardon bacon,  or the perfectly grilled shrimp that made the salad so scrumptious, but I'm already planning my next visit for that one item alone.   Since I wasn't stuffed from my satisfying meal, I decided to indulge in dessert. I chose the poached pear with the Portofino wine reduction and a scoop of vanilla ice cream. It was delicious, but SUPER sweet. So, if you're not into that, pass on this dessert. Even though it's a small dessert, it's perfect to share because it's probably too rich for one person (except me!).   This will not be my last time enjoying happy hour here; I've already text a friend to suggest this as a new monthly get together spot! Next time I'll sit outside!   Side Note: I definitely recommend the "Smoked" old fashioned made with star of anise, juniper berry, and mesquite chips. Ask to see a demonstration to add to the overall experience. It was a pure delight. It somehow took a simple $5 cocktail to the next level.

reviews.author: William V.
reviews.description: I don't usually leave bad reviews, but unfortunately I feel compelled to in this case.  We ordered the butternut squash bisque, scallops, and paella.  Butternut squash bisque was basically flavored oil with some seeds... there was literally a layer of oil on the top when it came out... I still pressed on and gave it a chance though... it tasted ok at best... In general I'm a human vacuum cleaner so I ate the entire thing, but I would not recommend it if you're looking for an actual bisque/soup.  The scallops were tiny and it only came with 3.... The bed of risotto that the scallops were on had a very odd taste... not like an old taste, or like the food was rotten, it was just seasoned horribly. Again I stomached the entire thing, but the portion size was so small that I was done with the entire plate in literally 3-4 bites.... Total rip-off for the $34 price point.   The Paella.... my mom sent it back.. i tried it before she did though and I wouldn't have been able to stomach it. It was absolutely horrible. Terrible flavor, overcooked seafood, odd tasting sausage, and about 1/4 cup of rice... we couldn't even see the rice when the plate first came out because there was so little. Is this shrinkflation or just normal for this place? I have no idea...   I would not normally have even posted this review but.... After we told the server we'd be sending the Paella back, she stopped by the table that the owner was sitting at and let him know... He never came over to talk to us about it.... and when the server came back, she said the kitchen agreed that it was bad LOL. What?   They were nice enough to comp that dish, but again, the owner/manager/whoever never came by to talk to us about it, apologize, ask how everything else was, nothing.... On our way out we walked past the table the owner was sitting at... he said "sorry about that, have a good one." LOL  Never again

reviews.author: Katie E.
reviews.description: "delusions of grandeur" is the title of my review. Do NOT go here! Here are the reasons why...  1) There was a $100 steak on the menu and plastic picnic tables to sit on outside.  2) Service was slow with minimal customer. There was an item requested (pirouline) that was never delivered by the wait staff.  3) The kids cheeseburger was the same size as the adult cheeseburger.  4) They provided a "side salad" composed of iceberg lettuce.  5) The "vegetables" provided on the steak (of which you no explanation was provided on the menu as to identify the cut of meat other than noting that it was an "angus steak") were RAW and by my count our table (of which THREE of these dishes were ordered) had 1.5 baby's carrots on average on each plate. When I asked the waitress for more carrots... it took her 20min to let me know that the chef said it would require the chef SO much work to blanch the carrots... At this point my steak was pretty much done and I informed her we would simply NEVER RETURN.  6) The menu was limited.  We will never go back.

reviews.author: Nancy G.
reviews.description: If you're looking for fine dining , a place to celebrate something special, or just want fantastic food and feel extra special them look no further than Mako's!  We celebrated our anniversary and wanted to experience a place we hadn't been to.  Walking in we were immediately seated.  Wait staff was jovial and attentive.   Our appetizers were very good and filling (we should have only ordered one but couldn't decide between the two) fried Brussels and Levantine trio. Our entrees were equally difficult to choose but ultimately my husband ordered the 1855 beef coulotte, medium rare.  It was cooked exactly how he wanted with red on the center and juices running in every bite.  You could even taste the hint of coffee spice.  The turnips and carrots were prepared in a Marchand de vin sauce, complimented it nicely.  My entree was the chickpea crusted salmon.  I loved every bite!  It had a slight char on the outside but very moist on the inside.  The tomato and eggplant stew it came with also delicious.   Easily a five star restaurant that I'd recommend and plan on returning to.

reviews.author: Melody C.
reviews.description: We found this new trendy spot in Cibolo, Texas. The host was very accommodating when we arrived, if you wanted to wear a mask then they wore mask and if you were comfortable and not wearing a mask then they would not wear a mask.  He sat us all down as we were still waiting for three people from our party. Once our full party had arrived, we had to wait. Unfortunately the waitress took over 10 minutes to come to our table to at least offer some water.  Overall our experience was very great! Unfortunately I did not take a lot of pictures because it was my sisters birthday. But I did manage to sneak in a picture of my cheeseburger which was very light. And I don't mean light in a bad way I mean it as in a satisfying way. Must try!   Their cocktails are also very delicious. I had the cucumber margarita cocktail if I'm not mistaken, and it was very light and subtle at the same time. But boozy!   The only part that I was not super happy with was that the waitress mentioned to us that she had ordered a special surprise for my sister which was their almond cake. As a gift from her. So to me that means that the dessert is on them. But surprisingly when I received the ticket the almond cake was on there. I did not feel like I really wanted to argue over the almond cake but as I stated the way she mentioned it to me is that she was covering the cake. So for that reason I did remove one star.  Something that I really liked about this place was the bathroom. As a first time Mama i've noticed that many restaurants don't have a baby changing table. Or if they have a baby changing table it's very dirty. This place had a very awesome baby changing station. They had diapers, they had wipes, they had waste bags. You think of it and they had it!  Thanks To their management for this!   Great place to eat! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Mako's is a really nice restaurant! The staff was very friendly, the restaurant was nicely decorated and had great ambiance. The food and drinks we ordered were delicious. One of the previous reviews mentioned the Aunt Bees Knees being delicious so I decided to try it and it was really good. My wife got the salmon and I ordered the Pork Shoulder. The salmon was delicious (probably not worth $30 but it did taste very good) and the pork shoulder was also very good as well. One thing I will caution in regards to the pork shoulder is that it is very fatty. There was a lot of fat on the sides of the lean pork that added flavor for sure but wasn't very healthy. We also ordered the Brussels sprouts as an appetizer and they were delicious. A lot of good flavor.   We enjoyed our time at Mako especially since the staff was so nice. However, the price was really not worth it. I'm going to give it 5 stars bc there isn't a 4.5 star option and the experience was worth more than a 4 but I don't think I'd be coming back mainly because of the price of the food. It was good though; so if you don't mind paying extra then this is a good spot for date night or to enjoy a nice evening dinner.   Overall: 4.5 stars

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: We had a party of about 25-30 people, talk about organized chaos. The servers were on top of it as we were changing seats, walking around, it was definitely professional.  The booking and reserving was so easy too.  Everyone enjoyed their food, my paella was awesome. I also tried their steak and their fried chicken...I would order it all if I could afford it. There is no competition with flavor and quality of their ingredients.  I thank the restaurant and we all enjoyed our time.

reviews.author: Antoinette H.
reviews.description: My husband and I went here for the first time and luckily arrived before happy hour was over.  We ordered the deep fried brussel sprouts and they were the best tasting brussel sprouts I ever had! I had the salmon meal and my husband ordered the seafood paella.  Everything was fresh and delicious.  We are looking forward to coming back in the near future and luckily it's close to where we live.

reviews.author: Tyrone B.
reviews.description: This is a nice and very good restaurant a must try if your in Cibolo. The tomahawk steak was delicious and the mussels were awesome. Would recommend a try.

reviews.author: Tamara N.
reviews.description: Went here for my birthday dinner and really enjoyed the ambiance. The drinks were tasty and the food was good! Service was a bit slow considering how little people there were and the food portions were a bit small considering the price. However, it was overall very enjoyable and would recommend for a cute night out!

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: The Food and atmosphere is awesome. We have been coming here since they opened. Have never been disappointed. They have a great brunch and Happy Hour. Best old fashion in town!

reviews.author: Ofelia C.
reviews.description: My husband made a reservation here for my birthday and everything was amazing. From the service to the aesthetic and especially the food. Our waitress was very attentive and on point with everything. The food was amazing, I really enjoyed the strong yet delicious whiskey sours while waiting for our food.. The rib eye was tender and very tasty, the octopus was tender and divine! My girls (daughters) enjoyed their food as well considering they are picky. I would absolutely come back. Definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Niki T.
reviews.description: I've visited Mako's a few times not and have always been impressed! The location and aesthetic is stunning and the service never disappoints. Delicious and creative dishes are always on the menu whether for dinner, lunch, or brunch! I cannot wait for the Bloody Mary Bar to reopen for weekend brunch. If you're lucky, you will get Paul as your server and get to chat with the owner too. Highly recommend this for great dining in the Cibolo/Schertz area!!!!

reviews.author: Lee F.
reviews.description: The Food and Service is ALWAYS AWESOME. We try to do a once a week visit for Brunch! Never been disappointed with anything from Mako's, be it food or Staff.

reviews.author: Bruno S.
reviews.description: A three star review is not a bad review, it means it's okay.  This is definitely a nice restaurant and addition to Cibolo.    The customer service was excellent.  Their outdoor seating and live music makes this a great choice for a date night or night out with friends.  The owner met us at the door on our way out to get feedback of our experience.    This could be because of COVID-19 but the seating outdoors consisted mostly of picnic style benches which is not my preference.  It is nice to be able to lean back in your chair, relax and enjoy the environment and live music.    I ordered their steak and it was not what I was expecting, especially for the price.  My steak came already cut and very lightly seasoned.  I did not like it.  I saw pictures on Yelp reviews of their Tomahawk steak and that is what I was expecting.  We did enjoy their wine and craft beer selection.    I might give this another try once restrictions are lifted and will update this review.  But for now it's a 3/5.  Would I recommend it yes but would I rave about it? No.

reviews.author: Christina S.
reviews.description: Amazing Food! Mako's is named for the co-owner's call sign in the Airforce as a pilot, how cool is that?   First and foremost, let's talk about the food, it is phenomenal! Chef Kyronn Cordner knows his stuff. We started with salads...my Greek salad was prepared so beautifully and the ingredients handled so delicately, it was a perfect blend of fresh and tasty, and I couldn't eat it fast enough. The wedge salad was inspiring with its blend of ingredients with a perfect combination of savory my husband absolutely loved. For entrees we had the Easter Special of Salmon over eggplant and tomato moussaka and the 44 farms Tri-tip spiced by Ky. Each dish was a perfect blend of flavors and textures. The food here was truly some of the best we have ever been served and all in our backyard of Cibolo!  Let's talk service!   Paul was our server and we were smitten upon meeting him, he took care of us and was on top of our needs the entire night. We were lucky to meet one of the owners, Jackie Peterson. She was delightful and truly grateful for our feedback and patronage. She told us all about her family's journey through the Airforce and settling here, as well as the local resources they use for the food they serve in the restaurant.   We are delighted to have found such a culinary gem in the heart of Cibolo and will be returning very soon!

reviews.author: Jon R.
reviews.description: Absolutely love it. Try the Sampson old fashion as well. Food and service are top notch.

reviews.author: Marion M.
reviews.description: Great original food. Similar to a farm to table restaurant. Good atmosphere and great service without being too stuffy.

reviews.author: Ashley V.
reviews.description: Sunday's here are fantastic! The music and DJ Monks is great. I had the sushi truck and the Thai style truck. Both were fabulous. The bartenders are great. This is a great spot to be outdoors with a wide variety of food, drinks and music

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: iiiiiiii LOVE this place! Great selections! Everything is outdoor! The have the games on if you're interested in that. Plenty of beer options. Lots of bench seats. Only issue is parking. Parking an be a B, but we managed that's to my excellent parallel parking skills from NJ ;)  For sure a must try place! We went close to dusk and got to see how the place really glowed at night. Very beautiful.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: Always a pleasure to "pop in" at The point for a sampling of one of there many craft beers - and to experience a new food truck...Last time we were there we enjoyed the visit in the rain - as we were under there canopy roof!  One of our favs!

reviews.author: Debbie H.
reviews.description: Yummy food trucks in a comfortable outdoor setting.  Everything from a full serviced bar to barbecue, turkey legs, burgers, gyros, falafels, taquitos, and everything in between.  I got a delicious (huge) chicken gyro; my husband a burger a fries.  Food was prepared quickly and was delicious.  Loved the setting.  Plenty of food.  Not cheap.  With tip I paid $35 for two of us and we only had a can of soda with the food.  Can't wait to bring my son here when he visits me.

reviews.author: Adrian F.
reviews.description: This is a nice place to hangout. The food is great. They also have a coffee shop. Don't let me forget about the bar. If I could come every weekend I would. They also have a playground and basketball court for the kids. And it is pet friendly..

reviews.author: Lacey V.
reviews.description: This food truck park is our favorite! It's close to home and the drinks and food are top notch!   I almost always get the Sang-mosa, a sweet, bubbly mix of house made sangria and Prosecco. We also love the brisket sandwiches, although you'll need a nap after you eat one. We've only been here since Covid started so it's always been nearly empty, but I'm excited to go when it's busier too.

reviews.author: Yolie C.
reviews.description: I had never wrote a bad review, but today I'd really had to, I had a party of 10 people we had came to celebrate a birthday and we had purchased from every food truck plus drinks on the bar, we all had spent more than 200 dollars we were having a good time when this Latina that owns this place comes out talking to us unprofessional for having a meal that was gluten free for my daughter, and said that she was trying to make a LIVING!! Like really for one meal that certain people can't eat! Unprofessional Never Coming back to this place, be careful not anyone can have the same foods!! I work for customer service! That rude owner really needs to change her attitude!!

reviews.author: Andre M.
reviews.description: So today was our first time here and we met up with our family. We took a look at the food trucks and we weren't craving anything there and not to mention we literally had gyros for lunch. Not knowing you can't bring outside food or drinks we brought seafood. The manger came up to us rudely while we were eating saying "you guys can't bring outside food or drinks we're trying to make a living here but I will let y'all finish" but our family members literally spent 200$ dollars here on food and drinks from the food trucks. I understand if we all would of brought it but it was literally just 2 of us and there was 6 of us at the table.I just thought it was very unprofessional how rude the manager came off.Sorry you guys don't offer more varieties. She could of told us in a more polite way but instead ruined the good time we were having. First and last time here.

reviews.author: Gregg E.
reviews.description: The Point is a great place for food, drink, family, friends, music and fun!  Job well done to the truck and park owners!

reviews.author: Jenn K.
reviews.description: We haven't been there since lockdown. The food selection is great, whatever day you go. In normal times, it has big rocks, a playground and some outside seating (that does not work now).   We miss going, but quarantine takeout from every place has been amazing. We will go back when it's safe, but order remote until then. This spot has some of the best food trucks in town, IMHO.

reviews.author: Angel S.
reviews.description: I came for the food, but stayed for everything else (and the food)! This has been on my list since moving #SATX...should not have waited that long. Don't make the same mistake if you still haven't been here. The collection of food trucks and shops is purely awesome! @thepointpark consists of @holysmokesa @justthedripsatx @cilantromfft @nygrillexpress @thebackporchbar hosted by @beardxican (Noel Rocks). But I became a fan boy when I was able to chat with owner Denise @eclecticsatx. This boss works her butt off to build something very special on Boerne Stage Rd just minutes from @therimsa. I've been meaning to come by but it was a recent post she made that brought me here. The post has since been taken down (I hope she puts it back up) because of worries that it could offend some patrons but I applauded her for expressing herself and the message in general. See, it seems some people don't understand that this is PRIVATE PROPERTY! It's an operational business like any other establishment yet some folks stroll right in with outside food and drinks and then take a table. Like, what?People, these food trucks and businesses on premises are there to serve you, not watch you support other businesses. This should be common sense, but it's not, and Denise is trying to make sure folks know just remember this. Well, I have no problem saying it, "STOP THAT SHIT!".  Support these local businesses and come to eat, drink and enjoy what this spot has to offer. That's what what we did. I When you go you MUST try the Texas Twinkies from holysmokesa...like, holy wow! And make sure to chat with Noel when you grab your drink. You can't miss him@and won't forget him. To all my fellow #YelpElite, GET HERE ASAP!

reviews.author: Crystal P.
reviews.description: This is place is great and my family loves coming here. Our youngest enjoys the playground and ice cream. The rest of us enjoy the food trucks and beer selection. Their establishment is always clean and the workers are all very nice. I have been coming here for a few years and have yet to have a bad experience!! I am so happy this place was able to stay running despite all the craziness from COVID.

reviews.author: Jennifer S.
reviews.description: This place always has a great vibe. Their live music is always awesome. We enjoyed the barbecue truck the other day there's brisket on top of fries. My favorite truck is the lobster truck. Definitely check out their website before you go and it'll tell you what trucks are there. A huge beer selection and a couple of wine choices. It's a great neighborhood spot and the people are always nice.

reviews.author: Kayla S.
reviews.description: This is the foremost best hangout in San Antonio and the owners name it this way and what a relaxed fun atmosphere!

reviews.author: Evelyn R.
reviews.description: This is the worst place I've ever been in I don't NOT RECOMMEND TO NOOOOOO BODY !!!!! Please don't come here management is disgusting!

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Maybe you know - why is food truck food typically so expensive? There's no overheard like buildings, leases, servers, bussers, Albanian mobsters...what gives???  A few misses here this day! Patroned around 4 PM on a 95 degree Saturday. Not many folks there and that's likely due to the heat and it being between peak dining times. Lots of shady seating though and thankful that the music they play isn't ear-piercingly loud.   The first truck (Gus' Colombian Cuisine) we wanted to order from was closed. Lights were on, window was open, but no one was home. We stood there for a minute like doofuses since there wasn't a sign saying he was gone or when he'd be back. Strike 1.   So, we decided to try a shrimp and lobster roll from Curb. Informed out of brioche rolls so cannot make that item. Strike 2. Settled on a shrimp and lobster club sandwich or whatever it's called. It was good but $19 good? I don't know about that. Plus, there's no discount for paying with cash instead of cc. The other trucks offer that.  Got an order of 5 egg rolls from the Pho truck for $6. That guy gets around and never disappoints. Rolls were hot and crispy! Great value!  Checked in on Yelp and got a free non-alcoholic drink at the bar - a big glass bottle Coke! There's a cooler on the bar for free water, which was nice. Those were pluses. They have some fans blowing and skeeter spray on some of the tables. The kids liked the play structure and basketball hoop. $4 small lime snocones hurt the wallet, but the kids liked them.   Since they didn't earn a third strike, we'll probably revisit when the weather is cooler and closer to lunch or dinner when all the trucks are open and hopefully fully stocked. If it's sold out, then please indicate that on the menu with a sticker or a magnet. If you're closed, then please put out a sign and say when you'll be back. Easy fixes that keep people informed (and happy) before they try to order.

reviews.author: Donovan T.
reviews.description: A unique spot.   A local influencer recommended this spot on instagram and I thought the photos looked amazing. I was pleased when I arrived. There is an "open air bar" and a bunch of food truck options.  This is for sure a hidden gem. The bar has a wide selection of drinks with a friendly smile. If you are not sure what you want to eat today, there is a variety of food trucks to choose from. From Tex-mex to bbq. It is also a cool hangout spot for you and your friends.   I would like to point out a special shop nestled in the park. It is a coffee shop and they have some of the best teas and brews. It's a full fledged cafe so bring your laptop and get some homework done

reviews.author: Peter C.
reviews.description: This place was garbage. Two food trucks on site and only one had food to order. The second was sold out and granted it was only Saturday 7pm.

reviews.author: Michelle G.
reviews.description: Love being able to eat so many different cuisines from the different food trucks. Bar is good. I recommend

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great place to meet friends, enjoy music, drink a beer and eat good food. You will have good variety of food to choose from. This time around, I tried Curb. I had the soft shell crab BLT. The boyfriend thought it was a tad bit fishy, but enjoyed it and felt it was pretty filling.   The bar has a good selection of beers. The bartenders are fast and friendly. In the opposite direction of the bar, you will find a playground for those with children. On a Saturday night, they had live music which added to the laid back atmosphere. For those that have dogs, they are welcomed. Onsite parking is available, but it can get crowded.

reviews.author: Candice L.
reviews.description: Rich, dark, delicious coffee. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Mellow and welcoming vibes. It's the perfect hang out during the day. Those empanadas are legit delicious. Local artwork adorns the eclectic walls. It's simply a place I would love to spend time in.   Don't be fooled by the low key exterior or the industrial neighbors, this place is legit and we will be returning to see it take on its night time persona. Super excited to return to introduce the hubby to Yuengling now that it's finally available outside the Northeast. This place is exactly what we needed today.

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: Chicago's absolutely awesome Dark Matter coffee in San Antonio!! As far as I know,  Tandem is the only place in town that brews espresso with Dark Matter, or that you can find DM beans to purchase. Happy happy happy!!  In addition to just destination coffee,, Tandem is right on the Mission Reach of the Greenway, near Confluence Park. Convenient stop-off from a bike ride or hound walk for a beer (they have 12ish really nice taps, and a selection of cans too). Huge dog-friendly yard with giant beer pong set up. Across the street from an art school - awesome works for sale on Tandem's walls. Great periodic events listed on their socials.  A half-mile from South BBQ - picking up to-go lunch at South and a coffee at Tandem is my favourite Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Irma D.
reviews.description: We went right before they closed for the evening.  The batista accomodated our order despite running out of some items--understood since it was the end of the night. He still made two perfect drinks and we enjoyed the wide couch to watch films on while he prepared the drinks.  Next time going back to try rest of menu and enjoy the patio!

reviews.author: Brian F.
reviews.description: So glad a spot like this is open on the border of the Southside/South Town.    Each time I've gone, in recent time, there's been a different employee working the counter but each experience has been great!!  Coffee brand is delicious and I couldn't wait to take my wife; did so this past weekend finally.   Inside decor is cool and hip.  Outside patio and garden are spacious, various seating and colorful. There's also a few fire pits throughout the grassy area, trash can beer pong and the WiFi reaches the entire patio without an issue.    Haven't tried the food yet and the beer selection is okay. Hope the rotate the taps frequently.   Really hope this COVID doesn't claim this spot!!!

reviews.author: Mari C.
reviews.description: So glad to have a place like this on the South side. The baristas are knowledgeable, and make a great cup of coffee! Their signature coffee drinks are delicious and potent. Try the "Jefa", it's stellar! The service is great, very clean and you feel safe as cdc protocols are followed closely. Their beer selection is impressive. The patio is great, there is plenty of seating. My 4 year old loves to grab a hot chocolate and run around the outdoor seating area. Dogs are welcome! Feels like home.

reviews.author: Kevin G.
reviews.description: This place is the bomb. Open early for coffees and pastries. Stay open late and have an amazing craft beer draft list as well as craft cans and bottles. Awesome Happy Hour specials. Tons of outdoor seating.   Been going to their Saturday morning yoga with Mobile Om and staying for the live music.   My new hangout.

reviews.author: Karen A.
reviews.description: Dark matter coffee is one of the best roasters to enter the SA market. Creating delicious blends of coffee exclusively for Tandem.  Come try a cup today!  Atmosphere is great to get work done during the day, or to have a good time in the evening.  Lots of beer options from our local breweries and our staple favorites available,   Great art work from local artists.  Come see for yourself!   If our door is open, we are open!  Set hours to be posted soon.   CHECK OUT OUR FACEBOOK PAGE  https://www.facebook.com/tandemsatx/    We are located at 310 Riverside, San Antonio, TX 78210 7a-9p.  7 d a week

reviews.author: Basseema A.
reviews.description: I went here for the first time this past Saturday and loved the place a lot. There was an event going on, which I tabled at, and live music that was super enjoyable both as a vendor and a customer! The snack selection is great and the beer and wine menu is as well but I don't drink so I like that there is coffee there too a lot. The bartenders/baristas are also the best! Cant wait to be back just to hang out and to table there again!

reviews.author: Megan M.
reviews.description: We're visiting from California and found this brewery off the river walk trail. If you're local, what a great date to ride along the trail, stop for a beer and a snack or bring your kids and enjoy a Texas cola in the afternoon and warm cozy drinks in the morning.   They've spaced out their outdoor seating, offering a variety of picnic tables, chairs, and ready to-go fire pits for enjoying your beer or coffee.  We had the vegan frito pie, with a little spice, sliced avocado and queso, empanadas and a couple of local beers.  Come support this local business as capitalism allows the ingenuity of the independent business owner to give us all a unique experience.

reviews.author: Shawn D.
reviews.description: This place is legit. Massive beer selection with a lot of great Texas beers on tap and an extensive list of wines also. Conveniently located close to downtown. Worth checking out.

reviews.author: B T.
reviews.description: Great new place in the area, excellent brews from award-winning brewmasters in San Antonio.  Cool sciencey decor - haven't tried the coffee, but I'd imagine it to be a great place to study or work.  Huge outdoor patio and lawn - great place to hang out on a nice day or evening.

reviews.author: Nella G.
reviews.description: Love this place. Great location, and awesome outdoor patio. I grabbed a coffee with my parents. Coffee is bomb, and was impressed to find out they have house made syrups. I was little confused about the couches, they seemed very dirty, and one was in front of the refrigerators...The decor needs some TLC and they could have a better Mexican beer selection.

reviews.author: Noah M.
reviews.description: Stellar coffee, great vibe, very chill! The staff is awesome and knowledgeable! They carry Dark Matter Coffee, Fat Tummy Empanadas and Bread Box Kolaches which are all amazingly delicious! Plus it's right off the Mission trail, so it's a perfect place to start/finish your bike ride! Their beer list is on point as well, great Tx craft selection!

reviews.author: Jessica V.
reviews.description: Best new coffee bar in town! Delicious coffee with a chill vibe and tasty snacks. Their tap list is fire too with lots of local pours.  Plus their patio furniture is all old school Spurs colors - CANT BEAT IT!

reviews.author: Daniel D.
reviews.description: This place is a unique spot its a bar theme with a starbucks flare, it is very family oriented. I was there outside with my son and wife, me drinking a beer my wife a coffee and my son an abuelitas hot chocolate with a Tandem twist. Then played the giant beer pong game with my son which he had a blast. The outdoor lights the cool art themed interior makes you feel relaxed to slow life down just a bit to enjoy the the little things in life and watch your family smile! Especially at these not so pleasant times. Ask for Balde he is great brista/ bartender/ musician!

reviews.author: Jay R.
reviews.description: Nice vibe! Great customer service and large selection to chose from! Tons of beers and coffee in house.

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Awesome place, super chill, coffee is great! Must check out this place. They always have great customer service!

name: The General Public
accommodations: Good for Brunch, Lunch, Dinner, Dessert
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kristal C.
reviews.description: The general manager Mr. Hunter was very attentive and dedicated to the foodies crowd.; two adults and one 12 year old eating at the bar section.   First he made it confortable after the new bar tender was "uncomfortable with our TEXAS Constitution LAWS"!.... To serve food at the bar with a 12 year old kid!!!   We are ordering food and feeding happy with Mr. Hunter caring for us. Very happy experience!   Thank you!    Well it was a blessing!!!    He was an advocate to the best drinks and food for

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: After a short hike, we stopped by to get drinks. We ended up trying all the variations of the caesar salad. It was good plain and the seasoning on the shrimp and chicken was good too. Shrimp was a bit overcooked.  Our server was Tommy. He was fabulous. Really nice and had good knowledge of the menu. I normally wouldn't order a salad, but on his recommendation, I did.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: General Public seems to have been humming along since the conception of the Rim. Its corner location almost blends in too well with the high-class neutral-toned neighborhood. I myself have been guilty of passing right on by towards bigger brighter louder spots, my mistake. As I am the cheapest person I know with a taste for expensive cocktails, I'm not sure why I ever stopped anywhere else nearby.  The Happy Hour is unbeatable if you arrive at 3pm. Every hour the drinks increase by a dollar, so it pays to duck out of work before the 5pm whistle. The food is great too, if you're into that sorta thing.

reviews.author: Elizabeth L.
reviews.description: Anytime anyone wants to do happy hour, I suggest this place. Hands down, THE BEST happy hour EVER anywhere. Service is fast. The happy hour food menu is plentiful, the drinks are big, and the restaurant is just plain cool. Happy hour here is price of the hour starting at 3PM, which is an insanely good prices. We're usually the 4-5PM crowd, and it's just as good. The grilled cheese bites are the most bang for your buck, HUGE servings for the price and really gooey cheese. Loaded tots are my second go to, and easy to share with a friend. Ranch water a light, but the HH margs here are tall and strong. I have nothing but good words for this place!

reviews.author: Hluas Nraug N.
reviews.description: My group had our second brunch hear. We started at southernlieght for the frozen mimosas, then came here for the bloodmary pitcher and hush puppies.  Those two didn't disappoint, honestly everything our group got was good except for the enchilada I didn't really enjoy that so minus 1 start for that.  Our servers Johnathon and Nicole were awesome .  We will be coming back here before we go home.

reviews.author: Abi C.
reviews.description: This place is amazing. From the atmosphere, to the drinks, to staff, to the brunch. Nicole and Jonathan were very attentive and kind. All smiles, and wholesome food. We're so glad to have stumbled upon this eatery on a Sunday afternoon. Just look at the food, it says it all. Their Bloody Marys were thick and full of flavors. Well worth the $20 for 4 glass full. Perfect amount of spice. We ended up getting two pitchers to quench out thirst.

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: Really fun place for happy hour and in a good area for dinning and night life. The bar staff are continually checking up and making sure you're enjoying your drinks and food.

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: The GP is a top pick of mine if you're looking for a good vibes and a good happy hour in the rim. I've been here several times, all good experiences, yesterday being the best yet. Whether I've been with a group or just a couple of us, the service has been great. They have happy hour everyday of the week, from 3-6. We went yesterday, on. Saturday, and we were able to be seated on the patio right away. Our waiter yesterday, Tommy, was so nice, helpful, and genuine. The drinks and apps were on point, again, they have always been a favorite of mine for this reason. The sliders were delicious. Their patio heaters made it enjoyable to sit on the patio while it was chilly outside and we had a nice view of the sunset. Even the music was on point and the bathrooms were clean. I can't say that I've ever tried an entree but I'm sure they are up to par with everything else.

reviews.author: Rene M.
reviews.description: The food is good, great for mimosas at brunch time.  I've been here several time in the past two months, and the menu just doesn't jive with me. I wish there was more I could say..

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Really cute spot at the rim! The wife and I stopped in just to grab some apps for happy hour and we were really pleased. The indoor and outdoor seating was great and the staff was very nice. Our waitress was Skylar and she was awesome. We ordered two apps and they were both delicious. The hushpuppies and the grilled cheese bites. Happy hour is from 3-6 and is half priced drinks and apps and if you show up at 3 it's only $3 for each app. I recommend this spot for sure!   Overall: 4.7

reviews.author: Amy N.
reviews.description: Very poor service = slow very very slow service.  Bland chicken.  Dirty glasses first drink and second drink had dirty glasses.  Food was very bland.

reviews.author: vicky a.
reviews.description: The burger lacked seasoning.  It was big but it wasn't seasoned at all. The Brussel sprouts were amazing.   Oils have served as a meal

reviews.author: L S.
reviews.description: I brought some friends for lunch at this place at La Cantera. It's been here for a bit so I thought it might be good and the reviews were good. We did not have a good experience. The food was mediocre and the service was lacking. I think they were short staffed but it seemed that a worker or two were standing around not helping much. Our server was being used at the restaurant next door at least that is what we were told.  Anyway the shrimp and grits were a smaller than expected portion with some very skinny looking shrimp. The flavor was bland. The salads looked like a better option. Not sure I would give this place another try as I was less than impressed with the food.

reviews.author: Cassandra S.
reviews.description: Lillian, our server, was great! As always...great food, great drinks, and great atmosphere!

reviews.author: Dinorah C.
reviews.description: We visited this place on a rainy night. Cori, our waitress, was great. I truly appreciate it when employees know their product and are confident when discussing it with their clients. She made drink and food recommendations based on what we like. The pretzel is so delicious and soft. Mmmmm with the cheese. The honey fried chicken wings are also outstanding. The bacon wrapped shrimp was good, but overpriced considering you are only getting 3 whole shrimp.all food arrived at our table promptly.   Truly great service and food.

reviews.author: Bernie B.
reviews.description: Celebrated 34 trips around the sun with brunch at GP! The $1 mimosas on the weekends made this an easy YES! Started our food tour with a mimo with pineapple juice and a Bloody Mary. The Bloody Mary was ehhhh but the champs saved the brunch!   The smoked salmon and sun-dried tomato relish was AMAZING! Noshed on the chicken and frites. The frites, the F R I T E S- wow! Great flavor and crispy the chicken was moist and delish.   When you are at GP, you have to get the birthday cake! A sweet concoction that leaves an instant smile on your face!    The service was attentive and energetic for a Sunday brunch. Social distancing was observed with table settings until the end of our meal when a party was sat right next to us. We decided to have our last sip and leave!   If you are looking for a fun brunch spot, definitely check this place out and have some cake!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: We've been her before once, a few years ago (we live in Austin). We returned because we loved the atmosphere, and once again it did not disappoint.  Lulu greeted us as soon as we sat the bar, told us where to find the menu, specials, and was very accommodating throughout the meal, even with a busy turnout.  We got the Shrimp and Avocado Salad, Avocado Toast, and Crab Hushpuppies. Crab Hushpuppies are killer - crunchy on the outside, soft on the inside! A fave dish.  Ally brought us the drinks - she was quick and was very welcoming! Everyone seemed to be busy but genuinely enjoyed tending to customers and let me be honest, I'm a sucker for good service.   Will be dining here again next time we come to San Antonio.

reviews.author: A.J. A.
reviews.description: Alright so let me first start by setting up the setting. It was a breezy Saturday morning and my girlfriend and I said "damn, imagine we could find a happy hour on a Saturday?" I said. "Yeah, it sucks because no place has happy hour on weekend."  Well, low and behold, this place has happy hour at 3 pm each day and all items on the menu and $3. $4 at 4, $5 at 5 and $6 at 6!   We came at 3 like if we were Steph Curry in an NBA game!! It was raining $3 on our check like the hurricane that hit NOLA in 2005.   P.S.   Food was amazing. $3 sliders tasted like $12.

reviews.author: Tennis N.
reviews.description: Went to the Rim location Sunday after church.  12:30...the restaurant was not crowded.   It took forever to get someone to wait on us.   We ordered mimosas and bloody mary.   Both were good, but again, it took forever for the server to come back after delivering our drinks to take a food order.  We also asked for waters with our drinks, which never came.   I finally had to walk over to the bar and ask the bartender for 2 glasses of water.  We ordered appetizers and a shrimp salad.  The salad was REALLY small for the price.  Appetizers (chicken balls and stuffed mushrooms) were lukewarm when served.    Not a fan of this place.   Will not recommend and will not go back........for food........maybe for drinks.

reviews.author: Sarah N.
reviews.description: Randomly decided to stop in for a drink and it was the best decision I could have made. Came in about 1:00pm and was greeted with a smile. Decided to sit at the bar and that was the second best decision I made that day. Lulu was our bartender and honestly, one of the best I've had in San Antonio. She had great recommendations on drinks and food. Ended up getting the fish and chips and burrata on pistachio toast. Y'all, it was perfect. Don't sleep on that toast! Now for the drinks.... We had a tequila old fashion and it might be my new favorite tequila drink. So incredibly tasty! It was my birthday, so she spoiled us with some tequila shots with fresh cucumber and raspberry juice. Honestly, a solid experience and we will be back! Highly recommend!

name: The Pigpen
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Denise C.
reviews.description: Love The Pigpen!  Great food, cold beer and if you're lucky to catch some live music it completes the visit. Don't forget to catch brunch on Sunday. Also...please come back, we miss Pigpen.

reviews.author: Savannah D.
reviews.description: Getting accurate hours of operation for this place is impossible post COVID. Their phone message tells you to check the website and the website and actual availability aren't ever congruent. Called the Smoke Shack Nextdoor with the exact same issues.  Regardless, if you're lucky and make it whenever it's open the good and drinks make all the false starts and locked doors worth the struggle

reviews.author: Tom L.
reviews.description: So we're in town to celebrate or 38th anniversary and decided to stop here for some food and entertainment. OMG, you can't go wrong with this place.   I'm totally impressed!

reviews.author: Bridgette R.
reviews.description: The Pig Pen is my neighborhood joint. I have been here many times. I would make it my regular hangout but it doesn't carry any beer that my husband likes so we tend to go where he can get a good stout.   They usually have at least one or two IPA's on tap and that makes me happy.  As a hamburger lover, I have to give their hamburger just an average score. It's good but not amazing. Fries are good too.   My favorite menu item is the BBQ brisket nachos. They are OUTSTANDING and HUGE. You can share these for sure.  The BBQ Brisket grilled cheese is yummy too. The wings are pretty good. The tacos are okay. My son enjoys the hot wings and fried pickles.  We have only gone for brunch once before COVID and the brunch selection was pretty massive and everything was pretty tasty. I was pleased with the fried chicken and the brisket. I wasn't pleased with the price. It is expensive.   If you have little ones they have a great outdoor area for seating and a little playscape for the kiddos. And on Tuesday nights they have open mic nite. They have so much to offer.  Service has always been good and everyone is always friendly. I think you will be pleased if you visit The Pig-Pen. I think it is a perfect place during COVID b/c you can order everything outside and eat outside as well. Pay them a visit, please.

reviews.author: William L.
reviews.description: Food: I got the tacos (shrimp, pulled pork, and brisket) and thought they were pretty solid. They used flour tortillas and they were toasted beautifully. The tacos were large and filled with stuff so I left feeling full. I also got an IPA and that was solid too.  Experience: I went on a Friday around early evening and it wasn't too busy. They have an outdoor space that has a playground and the food truck (where the food comes from) and an inside space with lots of tables and benches. You can order everything at the bar and they'll give you a number so your food can be delivered to you. Service was fast and friendly.  Value: The tacos were $3 per, which is a bit pricey, but worth it given the size. The booze is cheap too! I highly recommend as a spot to get drinks and some good drunchies.

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: I'm a little torn with pigpen.   I love that it's a neighborhood bar.  It's that whole jungle gym  in the center of everything- well, that is just not my vibe. I want to chill at a bar and enjoy people watching and that doesn't include watching other people's children.   Food is available - brisket tends to be over smoked for my taste. The frozen margaritas are a bit too sweet. They do have a brunch buffet on sundays. Live music at times. Parking is a bit limited on site so you have to park across the streets or in the neighborhood.   Felt that the bar was a little understaffed - took a while to get our order even though we were sitting at the bar and even though it wasn't very busy.   But stop by and check it out to see what you think.

reviews.author: Leah D.
reviews.description: Ok, first of all I would have never guessed this place would have turned into what it has. It is nestled back behind the smoke shack off broadway in the Alamo heights area. It's a little neighborhood bar that has a pretty interesting souther brunch on sundays. All of their food is catered by the smoke shake and it looks like that have some pretty awesome drinks to pair.   You walk in and buy your plate (buffet at $16 per person) and I'm sure you can take it from there. They have a very southern variety of foods such as collard creams, pinto beans, biscuits and gravy and grits. They also have pancakes, eggs, bacon, brisket Mac n cheese and sausage. But not just any sausage, they have a link STUFFED WITH BLUEBERRY PRESERVES. It was very good and I loved how unique it was. The service was really great and friendly and really just had a great small community vibe to it. Definitely a local hit spot.   I would probably return. The price is high but the food really was good. The only thing I'd change is since it's buffet style, it's hard to keep the food hot or even warm. Other than that though super solid southern take on brunch!

reviews.author: Clarissa P.
reviews.description: Popped in for a beer and snack with bae. Great selection of beer for CHEAP!!! Plus frozen margs on deck B-). Tons of local beers and plenty of liquor selection as well.   We split the cheeseburger sliders and it was a great snack. Staff is super nice and there's ample seating inside as well as outside. They also offer and all you can eat Sunday brunch buffet for $16 a person!!! That's a STEAL. Will definitely be coming back next time we're in SA. Great date spot on the cheap.

reviews.author: Paul G.
