reviews.description: I have always wanted to try this place out. Well, today was the day. Bro, this is the bees knees of brunches. I brunched so hard today it was ridiculous. The only downfall I will point out is the powdered eggs. Everything else is make you want to slap your momma good. $16 buffet breakfast brunch with live acoustic on stage. Cmon man! You can't Texas an harder than that! Got there at 10:15 am and there was a line out the door. The parking lot was also just as packed. This was the perfect hangover cure. Most definitely recommended. Go on in and getchya some!

reviews.author: Juan G.
reviews.description: Brunch Hotspot! They are temporarily closed due to covid, how we be sure to go visit them when they re-open, they offer an all you can eat brunch for the low price of $16 and $8 for kids! What??? Who does that? They do! I'm talking about Smoke Shack Brisket, fried catfish, blueberry sausage, grits, pancakes, biscuits and did I mention Smoke Shack's bbq!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: This is our go to spot most Wednesdays and Sundays. Good place for kids and is a good environment. Have never been to their brunch which i hear is amazing but the line to get in is usually wrapped around the building.  Whats good?  Brisket nachos - very good. Brisket cheese sandwich - awesome. Frozen moscow mule - fiance loves them. Lots of texas beer. There really isnt anything on their food menu that is not good. Would i say this place is better tham Alamo BBQ Co on grayson?  Unfortunately, yes. Even though both places are good. I think the organization of Pig Pen/Smoke Shack is much better. I also believe the quality of the food is WAY better. Price is much better too. If you have never been. Go check them out. Guaranteed a good time.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: What a gem! Came today for the Sunday brunch and what a treat!  Primarily a bar with indoor picnic seating inside. Outdoor sports another bar, with a large play scape for the kids. More picnic tables and some smaller tables around. Food truck sits in the back and opens after the brunch closes at 2. No kiddos after 9 at night.  So, the buffet....just about any southern classic breakfast item you can imagine. Biscuits, sausage, pancakes, blueberry sausage, eggs, bacon, black eye peas, collard greens, fried catfish, fried chicken, cheesy grits, brisket, blueberry cobbler, etc etc. Everything is outstanding. Delicious well priced mimosas and bloody Mary's.   Since there are instruction signs on what to do when you walk in, here's a hint. As you enter the doors, head to the left to the end of the bar to grab your disposable plate and your choice of beverage. Coffee and juices are included in your buffet price16 pp and 8 for kids.stake out a place to sit(make friends since you will sitting with others). Buffet is to the back wall. Make sure you get a new plate each time you go back for more.   Live blues music was also such a great surprise and really could have sat there mush longer listening to the acoustic music and song. Really will be back!

reviews.author: Francisco A.
reviews.description: Had a friend visiting from out of town and all he'd eaten was Mexican or Tex-Mex since he got here on Friday. We definitely had to switch it up today. So we decided to try out Pigpen and omg we were not disappointed. The food was freaking awesome.  When we walked in they were absolutely packed, it was a little chaotic and for being my first time it was slightly overwhelming for a bit since we didn't know where to go or what to do. We stood in a line that was apparently for the food, but we needed to be in the line to pay first, so I slipped out from one line and into the other leaving my dude in the food line so we wouldn't lose our spot.  I paid the bartender, then slipped back in line for the food. It is set up buffet style on Sunday's, hence the line to get food. When we finally got to the food, it looked so good! Eggs, hash brown, silver dollar pancakes, biscuits, tortillas, breakfast sausage links, breakfast sausage patties, grits, Mac and cheese, collard greens, black eyed peas, pulled pork, bacon, brisket, blueberry cobbler, peach cobbler and then all the fixings, coffee, juice, fresh fruit... and everything was freaking amazing! Literally amazing!  The brisket was tender, and had a great flavor. It wasn't the best brisket I've ever had but it was super super good. For a quick comparison, Augie's down the street has better brisket overall. But, this being what it was, a buffet, the brisket was better than expected, so hats off to the cook on that.  The only reason I gave them 4 stars instead of 5 was because there is no direction as far as when you arrive. For someone who had never been, It was super Overwhelming and my anxiety level was through the roof. I literally started sweating. I know it sounds crazy but for someone who deals with social anxiety it was almost enough to make me walk out the door. To be fair, there was a sign, telling you "seat yourself, pay for food and order drinks at the bar" but the long lines that were literally to the door were a bit perplexing until I was able to figure out what was going on. A host or a quick explanation of the process by an employee would have been welcome. Overall this place was super good but the inside seating can be a bit snug and be prepared to be friendly because it is set up kind of picnic style. Oh and they had live music! You can't beat that. Check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Kelly M.
reviews.description: Large portions, slow service and not too friendly. I hadn't been here in over a year and feel that the quality of the food has gone down. The quantity is a bit overwhelming, but I suppose it matches the price. The brisket grilled cheese was okay, a little over salted. The fries were like grease sponges that seemed like they had been sitting out for awhile and then flash fried them again. There was very little potato and a whole lot of grease. This used to be a good spot. Will not be rushing  back anytime soon.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: I would never go here on a hot day. It wasn't terribly hot when I went and I was still sweating like a pig (in a pen) sitting outside.  The layout was a little confusing. The food was decent. I had to add salt to the onion rings.   The employees didn't talk much.

reviews.author: Jason L.
reviews.description: This review is for the Sunday brunch:  Just discovered this place has a Sunday brunch buffet and all I can say is that I wish I knew about this sooner! The brunch is about $16 and has a nice assortment of breakfast foods and barbecue. I tried a bit of everything and I have to say the mac n cheese and collard greens really stood out! The brisket and pulled pork were pretty good for a buffet. There was live music inside and the bar was open to order drinks/buckets. Overall, solid food and a great atmosphere. Looking forward to coming back for another Sunday brunch!

reviews.author: Steve L.
reviews.description: Solid food, but foodtruck-slow service.  Dropped into The Pigpen at a Monday noon start due to the Smoke Shack's being closed for a Food Network shoot.  No worries, as The Pigpen still offered the transcendental brisket grilled cheese.  Unfortunately, it's only life-changing if you can get the sandwich before your lunch hour is up.  Brisket grilled cheese was surprisingly light for a sandwich made of meat, cheese, and an unhealthy helping of fried butter.  The bread gave way with a light crunch, and the cheese must have been detuned/desalted as to not overpower the soft, juicy brisket that retained a subtle smoky punch - though not as smoke rich as the burnt ends of the artist formerly known as Oklahoma Joe's in KCMO.  Fried onion rings similarly featured a light batter, not the breaded mummification found at lesser joints.  Unfortunately, the grilled cheese took a half hour to reach the table despite my being the second table to order for lunch service.  By 12:30, quoted food times stretched to an hour, and out-of-town guests looking for Smoke Shack offerings began to trickle out the door, unsatisfied.  Next time, will visit the Smoke Shack for Smoke Shack meats.

reviews.author: Lela B.
reviews.description: I have been here a few times before today and in the past the food was better, warmer. Before the food was so good it was worth the bad setup they have for their Sunday brunch. This place can get so packed, and the way the seating and buffet is setup there's no room to enjoy the food. Today wasn't bad probably b/c we arrived early. For the $16 price I expect a better setup, seating, and the food to stay warm. The food is still good but seems to have fallen a little since the last time I was here. I have always loved these owners food since they were a food truck. I will definitely come back another time to see how things are!

reviews.author: Erica S.
reviews.description: This is an amazing brunch!   After seeing so many good reviews about this place for brunch I was finally able to come here with some out of town friends and my husband. Everyone loved it! (That includes my husband who doesn't love brunch the way that I do.) The bbq (brisket and pulled pork) was definitely the unanimous favorites by everyone.   My first round, I took a little of everything that looked good to me to try a bite of each. My favorites that I got a bigger portion of on round 2 was the pulled pork, brisket, bacon, mac and cheese and biscuit/gravy (the fresh biscuits had just come out). Even saying that, everything else I had round 1 was good (sausage, eggs, hashbrowns, fried catfish).  I'd say for first timers, if you want to try something and it's low, just wait for your 2nd time through the line. They are constantly replenishing the food.  Great food and a relaxing way to do brunch with some friends. Our friends stayed for 2+ hours, we were there for just over an hour.

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: I give their Soul Food Sunday 5 stars! They have fun live music, delicious food, tasty drinks and a playground.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: There is a wide selection of beer but I felt their food was not on par with their price point. The brisket taco my friend ordered was just some meat in a tortilla and not much else. My Blue Star nachos were also not anything worth the $14 price point.  The service was great, our server was very knowledgeable and friendly but I probably wouldn't go back there for food.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: This place could be so much better and it's really down to some things that they could totally control. Their beers are actually not that bad. I tried both of their sours and they were some of the better sours I've had in Texas so far. Unfortunately, when I asked for a taster it was brought out to me in those little paper cups that you put ketchups in at McDonald's.   What kind of brewery gives out tasters like that? I would hope that there would be a little more pride in their product than to present it like pills at a nursing home.   Similarly, service was...questionable. Our server didn't just seem new but discombobulated. He couldn't answer questions about their beers but I had to point out what I was talking about on the menu.   Their beers are good, they are but it doesn't reflect it in so many ways.

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Parking can be challenging, however their food is good! Haven't seen some of their heritage Belgian Sours in a while... Used to have two excellent sours, one with tamarind and another named after aliens; both were absolutely wonderful.  Where are those mythical duck confit nachos? 3 stars, until the good ol' days return.

reviews.author: JoAnn H.
reviews.description: Hubby had the wings. Ordered lemon pepper but got the Thai chili. 8 small wings for 15 bucks. Nope. Not worth it. I had the loaded nachos with brisket. Stale chips. Congealed cheese spread. Brisket is dry but tasted. Nope. Not worth it.   On a brighter note the IPA and sour were very good.   Come for the beers but seriously skip the food. Nope.  Not worth it!   We have had such better food at other breweries. I'm so disappointed.  If I were giving stars foe the food they would barely get a 1. The beer would get a 4. I'm being generous with a 3 for both the stuff they call food and the beer together.

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: Have you ever just wanted a change in where you eat out? Try something new? I did and spearheaded a trip to Southtown! We walked in, received a hello and water immediately! Great start! We then sat for OVER a half an hour before ANYONE acknowledged us again and that was after we went to the bar and inquired if we could order any time soon. So... 45 minutes in we were asked what we would like to order... two burgers, fries, one with garlic fries, prickly pear margarita and ice for our water.   15 minutes later we got the margarita and we again asked for ice.   15 minutes later we got our burgers.   His burger was great! The bacon was crispy and thick and the burger was tasty. I know because I took a bite (or 2!!) My burger not only had a rancid smell it tasted bad. I could not eat it. They took off the price of the burger, however, said it was fresh today. I was trained in quality control for the HEB meat plant years ago. I know this meat was not good. I don't know why- it just wasn't.   Garlic fries meant two tablespoons of minced garlic dumped on top of fries. I think my breath still stinks a day later even though I tried to scrape it off.  The margaritas were okay. No alcohol because nothing registered!!   Food was served by the same people who cleared the tables. It was just all around a crummy experience. What I do know is restaurants are now all under staffed and going out to eat is a gamble at best. I would not say not to go to Blue Star, maybe we were there on a super bad day, bad moment in time for them.   We won't go back, but if you're into beer and enjoy their atmosphere... enjoy!

reviews.author: Bret S.
reviews.description: Not a bad place if you're in the area.   I got their veggie wrap and it was okay. It just felt they had the veggie wrap just to have a vegetarian option.   There was nothing too exciting about it: tomato, lettuce, and some sort of falafel like thing. No sauce, seasoning, pickles or anything. I had to ask for ranch.   The french fries were good though! They are 4 star fries.   Service was good.   Outdoor spacing for Covid was okay... not great, but not terrible. Some tables were definitely not 6 feet apart, the guy sitting behind me was probably only about 3.5 feet away. Some tables were 6 feet though.  Take out box is styrofoam, which is really unfortunate since they never decompose and can't be recycled.

reviews.author: Bea C.
reviews.description: I got a pretzel and a margarita or two. Pretzel was great it came with cheese. The place was super nice and everyone was friendly and attentive.  My husband had beer flight and he enjoyed them.  We sat at the bar right next to a a cheese cake. It looked so good!!! We regret not trying it. Next time!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Meh.  Beer was decent.  Several were really good.  But don't come for food.   It was mediocre for price.  Service was really slow as well, but was due tim our server as other server seemed on top of things.   Just realize it's hit or miss on service if you go.   And they messed up my bill.

reviews.author: Rio V.
reviews.description: Very laid back vibe.   The set up is a bit confusing but you walk up the side and order and then can sit anywhere. I think even on the river walk. They have a variety of beers and margaritas you can drink.   As a self-claimed margarita Connoisseur,  I was a little let down by how sour they were. My colleagues were really able to enjoy it fully but it was a pretty good size. If you're a beer person, this is your spot. Next time I'll try the food, this was just a Saturday evening stop for me today.

reviews.author: Larry G.
reviews.description: Wow, what a disappointment. I guess COVID-19 really crippled this place. What used to be a source of great food and decent craft beer is sadly only a ghost of its former self. Tasted beers thst are from their standard line up thst across the board were mere suggestions of the quality ales they used to produce. The food also was really sad, US Foods Frozen Products reheated... should have noted the poor state of affairs in the kitchen on our way in... pretty shabby and disorganized - I ha e t seen a kitchen in this much disarray since the last time I watched Jon Tapper on TV. Having been a Craft Beer Connisseur for over 30 years now. This place has all the signs of a dying brewery struggling to gasp its last breath. Good Brewhouse and some great fixtures soon to be bought cheap at auction unless a miracle in the form of an investor with a great chef and a great brewer shows up soon. Save your money - San Antonio has a lot of WONDERFUL Independent Craft Beer and exceptional food out there, why waste it here. Very Sad.

reviews.author: Michael S.
reviews.description: DO BETTER! You would think with such a beautiful location, they would take more pride in their food and beverage.  The beers my wife and I got were warm...both times. The bacon cheddar burger I ordered was cold and raw in the middle, my wife's turkey BLT was bland and literally just two slices of toast with freezer cold turkey, avocado and bacon in the middle. The cup of chili soup we ordered had the look and texture of dog food.  The only good part about our food were the fries.   I went to the bathroom at one point and the floor was sticky, urinals were filthy, there was no toilet paper, and no soap to wash your hands. And this was on at Monday at about noon.. how do y'all not even have the proper standards to even clean the bathrooms?   This place has soo much potential and I really hope management sees this and decides to make some changes, until then we probably will not be back.

reviews.author: Kim F.
reviews.description: Only selling points, it is steps off the River and you can sit outside. The beer isn't to our liking or the food and the wait staff is either over burdened or inattentive. We've supported this place over the years because it is local and we would love to see them succeed, but after several unfortunate experiences we will move our business to the breweries a few blocks off the river. Still local and a much better experience...you can see a few of my other reviews for breweries close by.

reviews.author: Sejal L.
reviews.description: After we finished riding our bikes, we were looking for a good place to cool off and have some food. Blue star brewing has a lot or space and is in a great location in Southtown, so we decided to try them out.   I got the Turkey BLT and Southtown Mule. I specifically asked for no bacon and asked if I could have extra avacado, but the server forgot and he never came back after we ordered our food. Also the sandwich itself was two buttered pieces of bread with deli chicken, lettuce, avacado, and tomatoes and lacked a lot of flavor. The Southtown mule was okay, but I could mostly taste the ice and ginger beer.   Positives: great location, indoor and outdoor seating  Negatives: food lacking flavor, okay service, watered down drinks

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: Beer: Blue Star Brewing has some delicious beer, let's get that right. They are always coming up with new creations and all of them are fantastic. If you'd like to take some of their beer home, you can do so by purchasing one of their growlers. Their growlers are pretty affordable and definitely worth it.   Food: This is where things get a little 3-star ish for me. I've been coming here multiple times, and their food is never consistent. Sometimes it can be excellent and other times way below average. I also think their food prices can be a bit overpriced to what they are actually serving.  Service: If you sit in the bar, you'll definitely get a 5-star service, but outside of the bar gets a little flaky. I've had some pretty horrible service at Blue Star, but it seems that they staff is always changing and every time I come back I see someone new.

reviews.author: Ray J.
reviews.description: Think this a repeat but what the heck. When you find a great place to eat and drink, tell the world!  This place is awesome.  After biking the mission trail, this place is our go to just about every time. Sure we go to la tuna sometimes, which is right around the corner. But most of the time this is the place.  If you like home brewed ipa, try the green tractor.  Food is hard to choose as there are so many yummy things to choose from.  Now that's a problem I like to have.

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: I had such high hopes for this place. It's Wednesday around 8pm. I had no clue what to do when I got here, wasn't sure if I should seat myself or wait. Finally, I saw a server and asked. It's self seating. She said take a picture of the bar menu then sit wherever . I asked for a sample of beer but it was warm so that didn't work. I thought for sure I'd be offered some suggestions for beer/drinks since this is a "brewery" but nope. I randomly guessed (server wasn't helpful). to snack on, I ordered the garlic and parsley fries. Absolutely the worst. No flavor what so ever. I had to ask for salt. Soggy too.   The atmosphere is nice. I sat outside. If I do come back, I'll just keep my expectations low so I won't be disappointed again. The food isn't pricey at all but I guess it really shouldn't be based on my dry experience â€

reviews.author: T N.
reviews.description: A real San Antonio treasure. Right over the River Walk in Southtown without all the hype of downtown.   Good food from a varied menu that has generous portions--and the taste that will knock your socks off (even if you wear sandals).   Depending on your drink preferences and what's in season, you should try what's on tap. You have refreshing and traditional, the raspberry geyser and the King William Ale that are San Antonio's best.   Go now!

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: I am glad that they are open during this challenging time we are all in. Right now we can dine in at restaurants at only 25% capacity. They only have the outside seating area available for customers. I think that that is a big mistake. The chips and salsa was okay. The drinks never have disappointed me. The raspberry margarita was delicious. I highly recommend it. The service is slow and I hope that things improve soon because people will become less patient as things open up more. Some people left the line because it was taking so long. I enjoy the place when I'm walking downtown on the weekends. If you are in the Blue Star area you should grab a drink and/or food if you are so inclined.

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a quick bite. Such a nice area over there. You really don't feel like your in SA.   My hubby had a quinoa salad with chicken and a beer. The flavor was really good.  He had a huge plate.  I ordered the special which was pork tacos with a wheat head mojito. I really enjoyed the mojito. It was different but, good.  The taco plate,  we enjoyed.   We'll have to go back again for lunch.

reviews.author: Andrea G.
reviews.description: We stop in whenever we visit the area, which is every couple of years.  I originally loved them because they had some amazing sour beers.  The sours have disappeared over the years and have gotten less sour.  I still go back because I have good memories, but I'm not as impressed as I once was.  The food is a little on the expensive side, and they don't have great vegetarian offerings.  We skipped eating there on this trip because of that. This time they only had two sours on the menu.  One was a raspberry, which I didn't even try.  I'm not a fan of sweet and fruity beer, I want a strong sour.  I got the Southtown sour.  It was OK. It was a little weak on the sour.  My kids were with me and they got sodas.  One of them had the root beer and he loved it.  The other one got the ginger ale.  It was so strong on the ginger that it was undrinkable.  I tried it, it was awful.    This was my fourth or fifth visit to Blue Star over the past five years.  After this experience, I think I'll probably skip going there on my next trip.

reviews.author: Dani C.
reviews.description: The Texas Rangers: Facts you may not know     It's the oldest law enforcement agency in North America. Stephen F. Austin organized the 1st group of 10 Texas Rangers in 1823. They were farmers and ranchers.   They became known as "Los Diablos Tejanos," meaning Texas Devils.  In the early days, Rangers would have to dismount their horses to reload their muzzleloaders. In an effort to be more efficient, they began using the 5-shot revolver (invented by Samuel Colt).  There are honorary Texas Rangers: John Wayne, Will Rogers, President George H.W. Bush and Chuck Norris.   In honor of the department's 180th anniversary in 2004, a Texas Ranger badge was carried into space on the Endeavor Space Shuttle Mission by Col. Paul Lockhart.  The first badges came from cutting a star into a Mexican silver coin. This was a way of showing dominance over Mexico. The nickname for the Texas Ranger badge is Cinco Peso.  Ranger Frank Hamer teamed up with local law enforcement from Texas and Louisiana and is responsible for ambushing and killing Bonnie and Clyde.   Texas Rangers Have Prevented at Least One Presidential Assassination, in 1909, when US President William Howard Taft met with Mexican President Porfirio Diaz in El Paso, Texas.   In World War II, the German press mistakenly reported that the Army Rangers were Texas Rangers. This caused some panic among German civilians, due to the fearsome reputation of the Texas Rangers. Finally, the public was told the invaders were "only" Army Rangers. The average age of a Texas Ranger is 44.

reviews.author: Jason K.
reviews.description: My wife and I were on vacation for a long weekend in San Antonio and we had a pass for The Buckhorn.  There is a big bar here, but it was pretty early and we headed to the museum  right of the bat.  There are like 1,000 stuffed taxidermy animals here. It was crazy, but pretty cool I don't know if I would be happy if I paid more than $10 here, but they also have a place of circus freaks and some fun circus oddities, like ledges you can stand on, while they look like they are on diagonal planes, you can still stand straight on them.  Fun little place to spend a half hour walking through and pretty close to the Alamo.

reviews.author: Paul L.
reviews.description: I have to be honest I was only there for the museum so I feel I like I'm not giving a FULL review so take this at face value.   I can say NOTHING about the saloon. I repeat, I can say NOTHING about the saloon.   I received a free admission to the museum with my 3 day hop on hop off bus tour... that's a whole other review.....  Ok... here goes.... My two cents on the museum.....  I'm glad I didn't pay money to see it.....  While there is an amazing amount taxidermy displays... that's all it is... and while they are impressive. That's all it is. Maybe it's just me but.... Umm no thank you. It's just not what I want to see room after room of stuffed bears and lions and snakes.   As I said just my opinion, not my thing, but the taxidermy was impressive.

reviews.author: Frank C.
reviews.description: A must stop while in San Antonio, it's like stepping back in time. Try the museum In side the saloon incredibly interesting facts. Highly recommend . Bartender was very pleasant and friendly.

reviews.author: Amber H.
reviews.description: I visited April 2 with a 6 year old. We initially came and ate lunch after getting off the Hop off Hop on bus tour. You have to order food at the counter and then find a spot. The food was descent. I had BBQ Brisket which I really enjoyed and my son had a burger which he did not eat. But, it didn't look bad. The restaurant area has a ton of charm, a lot of history and a cool long bar. Bathrooms in the back with some arcade games and good old fashion shooting game.  We were not certain about doing the museum as I did not think my son would like it if it was a bunch of stuffed dead animals. I asked the guy the guy that worked at the restaurant and he said a lot of kids liked it, so why not? We were there. It was a bit pricey, but ended up being worth the cost. It was a pretty large place and doesn't even appear to be that big from the outside. We spent a ton of time inside and didn't even really see anyone else.  They do have a LOT of dead stuffed animals lol. But they also have a lot of interesting historical items such as furniture, guns, etc. It is actually two levels too. Our favorite area was this area of "show freaks" as they had shrunken heads, mermaid fish, two headed animals, fleas with clothes, etc. I'm pretty sure one of those shrunken heads looked like my ex-husband, or at least in my dreams it did.  It was really fun. They also have some interactive type exhibits that you can walk in, like tilted rooms. Interesting stuff.

reviews.author: Gary H.
reviews.description: A nice afternoon in the museum, very interesting but pricey at $25 per person. Texas Bob greets you who is a very nice man along with The Bartender however the people back by the resterant inside are not so friendly. However the food is surprisingly pretty good, I had the Chicken fried chicken which was served with gravey and 2 sides. The chicken was flavorful and very juicy and they have the sweetest fruit ever.

reviews.author: Alyssa E.
reviews.description: We are locals and have never come across this place until now. 10/10 recommend. Bartender is extremely friendly and personable.

reviews.author: Yelena J.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a drink and check out the museum. The museum was closing in 30 minutes though and cost $24 a person, so we passed. I got a tequila drink that the bartender suggested that had orange juice and burned cinnamon. The

reviews.author: Rain W.
reviews.description: Last time we only went to the restaurant so we couldn't comment on the museum. This time however we did both. The food was great and you will get a discount on the museum if you eat there. The museum has two main sections. The first part shows all the taxidermied animals, a circus show and mystery town exhibit. The lower level shows the Texas Ranger museum with a mini replica of a town. I personally liked the first part a bit more but both were good. Parking can be hard finding a paid lot so be aware.

reviews.author: Jennifer M.
reviews.description: We stopped in here while waiting for our dinner reservations across the street.  There was a blues band setting up while we were resting and the little bit we heard was quite enjoyable.  The beer was $9 but I guess that is riverwalk prices.    As hunters, it was cool to check out all the different mounts as well as all the antlers.

reviews.author: Marlon T.
reviews.description: I was staying at a hotel close by and while walking by this place, I could not help but look inside since the entrance is wide open. Stepping inside, you're immediately welcomed by a huge high-ceiling room with walls covered in taxidermy. As a hunter myself, I thought it was very awesome to see that collection. I couldn't not sit at the bar and grab a delicious local brew (lots of options) while I admired the art. I didn't go into the actually museum but it looked worthwhile.  Yes, the big elephant (which seems to be the centerpiece) is real and is from the 1960's.

reviews.author: Ta'Brechi H.
reviews.description: 2019 Yelp 120 Challenge - #100  On our Hop on Hop off tour the Buckhorn Saloon was one of the stops. It said that shortly after opening The Buckhorn Saloon, Albert learned that many folks traveling off the dusty trail didn't have much money. The owner Albert had the great idea to accept horns and antlers in exchange for a free beer or a shot of whiskey from his saloon.   Now the Buckhorn collection has grew to become one of the world's most unique and largest collections of horns and antlers. The impressive horn and antler collection lined every wall and ceiling, which is why it is known as the Buckhorn Hall of Horns. Now different antlers are hung above the entry way to different exhibits.   Cost: You will receive $3 off with a Yelp check-in.  Each ticket is roughly $20 each and you get two exhibits for the price of one.   My husband and I opted out of going into the exhibits and grabbed to cold beers from the bar. It would have been cool if they still accepted antlers or horns in exchange for a local drink from the bar.

reviews.author: Bill A.
reviews.description: At first I thought it was a flop because they have you start up stairs with all the stuffed animals which ended up being rather neat. Then one goes down stairs and sees all the history on the Texas rangers which at first looks small but was more extensive then I thought. They really did a good job with the displays so much information we really enjoyed the experience

reviews.author: Bob K.
reviews.description: Food was good. Wife had asparagus which she said was wonderful with her quesadilla. My burger was good and bun was very good but burger was to small for bun.  Staff was friendly. Museum totally overpriced and we did not go.

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: At in the restaurant.  If you are doing the tour get tickets 1st then you get 10% off food.  Bbq plate was good.  Museum is a little on the high side but really unique and interesting.  We took our time and made it through in about 80 minutes

reviews.author: Garrett O.
reviews.description: Enjoyed our first visit to Buckhorn on a recent trip to San Antonio. The staff was very friendly and accommodating with our group (we had a traveling 18-month old with us)!  Tickets to the two museums (Animal Exhibit and Texas Ranger) were ~$20/person, and we had a beer along the self-paced walking tours. Everything was kid friendly, and it was nice to bring out-of-town guests to learn a bit about Texas history and wildlife.  Lunch in the saloon was a great idea in between museums, and that ran ~$10/person for simple bar type burgers and fare. FYI- You get a discount on lunch if you've paid for tickets!

reviews.author: Sergio M.
reviews.description: I went here Bc I saw the ad on their window that says they have the best burgers downtown. Not true. They weren't that good at all. They messed up my order and my neighbors order. Also had soggy sweet potato fries. Not sure if I'd come here for burgers. Kind of over priced

reviews.author: Rachel G.
reviews.description: This was an experience... The animal heads everywhere was a bit much. All the death. I honestly had a panic attack at one point.  I did appreciate the facts and info, but it was a lot to take in.   Yes I knew what it was before going, but we mainly wanted to do the Texas Ranger Museum which was great!! Love all the history and information!   There is a yelp discount l, but the lady on the corner was cheaper and you got a discount if you ate at the cafe...   We did eat at the cafe- the burgers were good. The cookies they are are DELICIOUS!

reviews.author: Carlos O.
reviews.description: The grill cheese with brisket was outstanding. The hamburgers were also good. Great for kids and adults. Staff very friendly.

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: All the animal heads everywhere, and I mean everywhere... were disturbing to a city gal like me. Def not my thing.   Very Texas, very touristy, expected in the tourist area next to River walk. Cute little gift shop attached.   Check in with Yelp for discount off ticket for museum which I refused to go to  Just not my style but looked adequate and clean for others. Plenty of beer and food at the eatery. Large spacious room to sit and spend $   Parking is non Existent unless you do garage which one asked for $12 for first hour . We were lucky another charged $15 for rest of day , it was afternoon

name: Bowl and Barrel
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night

reviews.author: Nick K.
reviews.description: Food is good, drinks are good but if your coming here to actually bowl, spend money else where. They don't take care of the lanes like a real bowling ally so the ball catches grip which is not helpful if you bowl spin. Otherwise great environment to come and chill at an excellent location with all the surrounding restaurants and shops.

reviews.author: Michelle H.
reviews.description: Great food, cold beer, and our server Halie did a wonderful job taking care of our party of 9. Our kids had a blast and the atmosphere was fantastic! Don't forget to get the cotton candy!! Sooo yummy!!!

reviews.author: Michelle R.
reviews.description: Krista Bean is the best! She makes coming here the best experience and I love everything about this place including her. She deserves a raise or something cool . She's not just someone who works there , she knows how to make people happy and  feel welcomed, and always has a smile on her face. 10/10!

reviews.author: James P.
reviews.description: Good bowling, very cool vibe, pretty consistent service. VERY overpriced for the actual activity you're doing (bowling ) but I get it. You're paying for the atmosphere and the "experience." The problem is the experience, while good, does not live up to the hefty prices. Overall fun spot, but you'll definitely pay.

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Overall a good time with friends, but I think it is way overpriced for some bowling. It was super cold in here and the drinks were not memorable. Honestly I think I would just prefer to go to a regular bowling alley...I feel like this is upscale bowling (and I just noticed in other reviews it actually is upscale bowling-nahhhh, yall can have that). Service was slow and the food wasn't that tasty either. Just meh for me *shoulder shrug*

reviews.author: Kennedy A.
reviews.description: LIZ WAS AMAZING !!!! she checked on us multiple times to make sure we were okay and having a good time! she made the environment even better!! we will be back !!!

reviews.author: Alexis A.
reviews.description: This is a Dallas based company that also owns The Rustic and The General Republic. I loved Bowl and Barrel when I was in Dallas. This is supposed to be upscale bowling, cocktails and dinning. I'm happy that they brought bowling/an activity to The RIM. My main complaint would be it is not as upscale as other locations, and that it is not true bowling due to the strings attached to the pins.

reviews.author: Ashley Elaine S.
reviews.description: Today we stopped in to bowl and eat to celebrate my sons 14th birthday and had such a great visit and service. We were greeted at the front promptly and escorted to our lane by Sal who introduced us to our server Anthony. Anthony was very attentive and had great suggestions for food and drinks. We enjoyed the pizza I highly recommend it if you like Grimaldis this pizza is way better ! We started with spinach dip and fries that were tasty ! Burgers in a bag were a hit with the kids bacon Mayo is delish. Anthony suggested ranch water for a refreshing drink and it did not disappoint. I highly recommend Bowl And Barrel for the food and service !  Not to mention we had the managers come by twice to check on us we were very pleased. We can't wait to go back !

reviews.author: Rio N.
reviews.description: Terrible service. I placed a food order at the beginning of my 1.5h reservation with my waitress who failed to write my order down after attempting to write my order on her hand but her pen didn't work, she had a pocket full of other pens, mind you. I never received my food. I was with a group of people and instead of splitting our bill as requested, the waitress decided to split the tab however the computer did it, not giving anyone an itemized receipt after charging our cards. I had one drink at the bar prior to starting to bowl and was charged $7. I ordered 2 of the same drink while bowling and some how my bill was $27. I'm no math genius but that clearly just doesn't add up. If you want to be charged correctly and to receive good service, this isn't the place for you.

reviews.author: Rissa C.
reviews.description: Called and made a reservation for a Saturday night, when we arrived they couldn't find my reservation. I even had proof that I called but since they were all booked they couldn't accommodate us. Extremely disappointed since it looked like a fun place to bowl. It would be really helpful if y'all had some sort of confirmation system.

reviews.author: Lubby L.
reviews.description: This place has the worst service.  The service was very slow, there was only 2 groups of bowlers amd 2 lanes in used.  Pizza took 2 hours before it was serviced, missing foods from our order.  The worst part is that they bowl by the hours and does not tell you.  They lied and told me I had to pay for an addition hour with the kids bowl promo but then also told us we timed up.  At the end we didn't get to bowl our 2nd game.  What a gimmick! If you want to run a business based one lies, then so be it.  Every dog has its days.

reviews.author: Jerrel W.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere to enjoy bowling and friends. Only thing I would say that could be better is pricing for the food. For the price I expect higher quality. But overall amazing place to have fun !

reviews.author: Adam C.
reviews.description: My coworkers don't know the meaning of being on time  but the staff was very accommodating and worked with me to ensure I didn't miss out on the time I reserved the lanes for.  The fries are aight

reviews.author: Andy O.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, music was awesome, attentive staff and great service! Our party really enjoyed bowling. The pizza was delicious and to top it off the specialty drinks and shots hit just right! 10/10 will definitely visit again!

reviews.author: Savannah M.
reviews.description: Showed up at 10:15 with a party of 5 to be told no lanes were available until 11:45. We come back at 11:45 to be sat at a dirty lane and waited the entire hour without having it cleaned. Not very sanitary considering COVID-19. We weren't even waited on the entire time not even to offer us water. Do not come here late in the evening horrible service.

reviews.author: Monica T.
reviews.description: We've been here several times both before and during COVID and every time the service is terrible - it's unfortunate because there aren't very many decent places to bowl in San Antonio.   This whole place is run by high school and college kids, always running around frantically, not a single competent adult to speak to about your food/drink order which is ALWAYS incorrect. Twice they've "run out of wine" and can't tell the difference between wine and champagne/Prosecco yet they serve mimosas. Also, doesn't matter what pizza you order, you'll most definitely end up with a Margherita pizza EVERY time but you'll be too hungry and pissed to send it back because then you'll wait an additional 30 minutes for another incorrect order. It's also likely you'll wait a good 10 minutes after your food arrives  for plates and utensils.  This is not a once or twice occurrence, we have issues every time we've been to this establishment and we will not be coming back again.

reviews.author: Pat S.
reviews.description: The 1st time I went to Bowl and Barrel I had a great time. Everything from the drinks to the music that was playing to the food. Yesterday when I went the only thing I can say is the drinks were good and that's it. The music was lame. I tried to order food but the server said the kitchen was closed. Why would you close the kitchen when your open for another 2 1/2 hours? It doesn't make sense. Very disappointed!!! I don't know if I'd go back.

reviews.author: Rudolph R.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere and fantastic service. Allison and others were very attentive to our party. Will return!   Music was solid also.

reviews.author: Katherine W.
reviews.description: Service sucked they were to busy on their cell phones to take care of the customers. Not  busy enough to use the excuse short handed. need to train some servers better. Bathrooms were nasty, trash on floor , toilets look like they never get cleaned or the sinks either. Restaurant and bowling area had trash and food on the floor .

reviews.author: Karla P.
reviews.description: This was the best bowl of our lives!! The manager Hunter went above and beyond to take care of our party! The staff was amazing and the beer was cold! Thank you Bowl and Barrel!!

name: Krause's Cafe
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Ariana V.
reviews.description: This is a must stop place for us every time we're in New Braunfels! We've been for brunch, lunch, and to enjoy beers and apps. Honestly, my favorite time to come is for brunch, especially when it's nice enough to sit outside. The ambiance is amazing: brews, live music, and great brunch! Our first time here was for a Mother's Day brunch, which we were fortunate enough to enjoy wonderful weather and got to sit outside and hear some live music! Their avocado toast is delicious: kale, sprouts, and eggs however you like them. It's perfect if you like healthier fare. Some of the skillets and schnitzels are more popular, but I'd honestly get the avocado toast again as it was THAT good.   We most recently came here for my brother-in-law's birthday dinner and really enjoyed it! For starters, the service is amazing. We showed up with cakes, cupcakes, and an ice chest full of ice cream. The wait was an hour long, but they sat us quickly when they realized how much stuff we had brought. They kept the cake in the fridge for us and provided candles and a lighter, which was super nice and helpful! The service alone is reason enough to come back: they truly go above and beyond. For dinner, I ordered the grilled salmon and my husband had the TX BBQ shrimp. My salmon was cooked perfectly and I really enjoyed the potatoes! The shrimp was amazing - I wish I'd ordered it! It had a good amount of heat to it as it also has andouille sausage. It's definitely worth ordering!  As a side note, this place can get PACKED on any given weekend and doesn't take reservations. Something to keep in mind during peak hours if you're coming starving. Overall, can't recommend this place enough if you're stopping in New Braunfels. It's truly a must-do!

reviews.author: Lourna M.
reviews.description: The place is very spacious with a beautiful mural on the outside - I was surprised at how packed with people it was in spite of how large it is. Definitely very popular. The outdoor seating is ginormous! You could tell they were busy but still Emilia, the manager , who was acting as hostess and all around hands on, was very sweet accommodating all who came to her. She was very quick to meet everyone's needs.   I sat at the bar, thanks to Emilia (the first waitress I encountered at the bar was very rude and actually told me there was a wait for the bar and I needed to se Emilia... she was wrong, bar's open seating as in all places). Cynthia ended up being my server. She was wonderful and quick to take my order and check on me for drinks, etc.   They were out of the Wiener schnitzel, which was the reason I originally went, so it was very disappointing. While the ambiance and space and food were great, I was a bit disappointed at the fact that they didn't have such a signature dish so early in the day (noon). I ended up getting a jager schnitzel which felt a bit dry / over fried, but the mushroom sauce was delicious! It was tasty but I'll have to go back and see if it was just bad luck. The fingerling potatoes were well seasoned and delicious. I don't eat boiled cabbage or sauerkraut, but I tasted it and seemed pretty authentic.   They did have quite a varied menu of both food and drinks and most of the waiters and waitresses seemed to be very on top of service. I'll definitely be back in hopes of getting a Wiener schnitzel and maybe try a few other items.

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: The hubs and I started eating at Krause's Cafe a couple years ago.  It took us a decade to get there.   We're not huge fans of German food.  Mustard is NOT our favorite condiment.  One day (a couple years ago) we took the plunge and went to the German food mostly restaurant.  YUM!!   But good news turns to even better news!  Krause's is also a biergarten and boy can it be fun!  Hop onto krausescafe.com and see what I mean.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Visited again so we could listen to Monte Good and the Honky Tonk Heroes while stuffing our faces with sausages and beer on the patio. It was a nice evening and the heaters took the chill off. Food was delicious, beer was cold, and the band was great!!

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Food was good. Service was good. Outside eating area was nice and spacious. Dog friendly on the patio. Plenty of beer on tap. Would go again if in New Braunfels.

reviews.author: Stephen B.
reviews.description: We stopped in because we were hungry for bread pudding and hot cocoa.  We were served something bearing no resemblance whatsoever to bread pudding.  They brought out a cast iron pan with cubed raisin bread swimming in a puddle of butter and sugar. I'm sorry, but in my opinion bread pudding should hold together when removed from the baking pan.  This rendition seemed like cubed bread slathered in sauce.  Where is the cream or milk?  Where were the eggs?  I don't know what it was, but I can't call it bread pudding.  The hot cocoa was hot but not much else.

reviews.author: J.D. J.
reviews.description: We had to try a German restaurant in New Braunfels and everyone said this is the place to go. They have a huge outdoor Biergarten and even the "indoor" Bierhalle is essentially outdoor, with mesh walls and sky high ceilings. Dogs are not only allowed, but encouraged, both in the Biergarten and the Bierhalle. There were several there when we visited and they were all very well behaved.   We ordered a ton of food here, and liked all of it. I'm not usually a fan of shoestring fries, but the ones here were perfectly cooked and seasoned. The broccoli was also prepared perfectly, not over or under cooked. The red cabbage was pickled, making for a unique but very good dish. The Apple fritters were the highlight of the evening. More closely resembling a corn fritter than the Apple fritters you would get at a donut shop, they were crispy on the outside, soft inside and came with a delectable dipping sauce.   A couple of complaints. The live music (a Biergarten staple) was WAY too loud. We had to lean right up to each other's ears to talk to one another. Also, although our main course came surprisingly fast, we had to wait forever for the dessert.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This is my second time visiting this restaurant and the rating it has on here fits it well. It is not horrible but not overly fantastic. I can see this as a place to hang out with friends for a beer and finger foods.   The day we went there was a farmer's market so we were occupied while we waited the 45 minutes it took to get a table. I am guessing COVID restrictions play part in this, which is fine. The beers are good! I lived in Germany (Heidelberg, Ketch, and Kaiserslautern) for over 12 years and my husband is French and German, born and raised in Schweinfurt, Germany. Going to German restaurants are a treat for us because we like to compare American German restuarnt to the originals. All American German restuarnat cater to the Bavaria region of Germany and this one does a great job mixing both American and German style foods.   I had the Texas schnitel, which I did not care that much for. My husband had the German meatball which was amazing. The brussel sprouts are some of the best I've tasted since moving here.   In all, this is a fun place to hang out with friends and family. They have live music, which I would have hoped was traditional German, but hey! I do see myself visiting a third time.

reviews.author: Luis N Felicia P.
reviews.description: Food here was good. We ordered a bunch of appetizers and a burger for my picky daughter. Service was ok. Young guy serving us was focused on 2 tables with 9+ people. We had to hunt him down just for refills, which he forgot 2x. First impressions, meh. Will give it another try just to see if the service gets better.

reviews.author: Donovan S.
reviews.description: Man the food here is straight out LA-GIT!  We took my father-in-law here for his 70th birthday because he wanted some German food and this place did not disappoint! The schnitzel was fantastic and the beer cheese sauce was delicious as an appetizer! They have plenty of great German beer options and I would love to come back here again! The brown mushroom gravy was delicious and they have a cool outdoor seating area and bar as well.

reviews.author: Mcnamara D.
reviews.description: Nice venue for good beer and authentic German and other food. It was chilly and we brought dog, so we ate outside. Live music awesome. Nice beers. Had a nice meal, and  would be five stars, except for the very cold potato latke I had with my expensive and otherwise nice pork shank. I sent it back twice and waiter Porter didn't comp any of it. Unfortunate for a $30 entry.

reviews.author: Richard D.
reviews.description: Stopped by yesterday for brunch.  The Bauern Schnitzel was excellent!  Large pork Schnitzel topped with Hollandaise, two poached eggs, hash browns and a biscuit.  House potatoes and toast are other options.  Excellent service, great hot Artisan coffee and hot, fresh, light biscuits.  Everything was perfect for me. No complaints!  Give it a try!

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: To be honest I'm don't remember the food so I guess that made for a great experience lol.  Beer was cold, ambiance was great, and customer service was on point.

reviews.author: Erin F.
reviews.description: Best Sunday Brunch we have had - food was amazing but the service was poor. Our food came out before our drinks did!

reviews.author: Jessica M.
reviews.description: This place is really cute and has a large beer selection. Service was good, we were in there a hour before closing and it was not busy at all. Menu is not updated at all. All the beers I tried to order were not available. We ordered the large pretzel with the mustard sauces and cheese sauce. The cheese sauce was fantastic and I enjoyed the honey mustard as well. My son and I split the German meatball with spatzle. The meatball wasn't very hot but it was good. Nothing spectacular but it was good. Good size portions. My boyfriend ordered the Texas schnitzel and it was ok, a bit dry and over cooked. The green beans were ok and the mashed potatoes were way too salty. They would've been great with less salt. The beers we had were the liters abd they were served in a huge mug. Those were perfect.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Changing my rating from last time. Service and draft German beer selections have gotten a lot better. Still hit or miss on the table service, but overall they have it down. Being very cautious about distancing and masks.  New and updated menu which has some great items on it. Sad that they got rid of the fried cinnamon rolls but I will live.

reviews.author: Katlyn C.
reviews.description: So surprised I haven't written a review for here yet.  My favorite things to eat here: rueben with chips (so so good), soft pretzel with beer cheese, and the kartoffel poppers!  They have a ton of beers on tap, you're likely going to find something that you enjoy. They even had an Apple Pie Mimosa today and it was delicious. There is tons of space outside, and the beer garden area. (Only downside is that when they have music it is LOUD) I've never eaten on the real inside before, it's never been an option so I'm not sure how to get a seat in there?  The only reason for 4 stars is because service is consistently poor. I also tried 2 desserts today and was disappointed in both. (Bread pudding and chocolate cake, no ice cream because the machine was down)

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: We love this place! Like love it for real. Great food, service, and live music. We come here a lot and we have never been disappointed. Just a great place to come and hang out and have fun.  It can be busy on the weekends so be prepared to get on the list and wait for 30 minutes or so. They will text you when they have a table. There are tables to use while waiting so you can get some pre-meal drinks if you like.  The food is just good here. My wife had the carrot cake and she absolutely loved it. I had a pretzel and we both had some drinks. This was just a fun Saturday afternoon!

reviews.author: Philip B.
reviews.description: Rude service! Haley greets you and acts like you're doing her a favor asking for a table. After saying 30 minute for a table we were seating 8 minutes later.  We waited for 15 minutes later and had to flag down a server. For the third time in a row we were told that there's a limited menu for no good reason other than the "kitchen is slow." So no kartoffel poppers.....the best item on the menu. After bringing appetizers we waited 40 minutes and were told by server that she forgot to put in our order.  The manager (Sabrina) was unapologetic and asked if everything else was timely. What else?? No entrees came out and nobody asked if we wanted more drinks.  Don't waste your time here...and it is a waste.   Last few visits have been bad. Its a shame. This place used to be good. Lots of room to make something better in New Braunfels. Owner needs to wake up. Great spot but going down hill.

reviews.author: Kevin Z.
reviews.description: Great venue!  Food is fantastic and the servers are fast and courteous.  It's become our "go to". Dogs allowed as well!

name: Alpine Haus Restaurant
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: John S.
reviews.description: I don't have a drop of German Blood in me and I certainly haven't eaten in Germany (yet).  However, I have been to a few fairly respected German Restaurants here in Central TX and this was the best meal of that particular faire I have had.  We drove 1-1/2 hrs down to New Braunfels from Williamson County and it was worth it. I had the Sausage Plate, Weisswurst (veal) and Bratwurst (pork).  It comes with sauerkraut and the German Potato Salad.  The Potato Salad was awesome.  This potato salad is room temp and vinegary (you know if you have had German Potato Salad before).  It's not the creamy cold type you might get at a BBQ Joint.  Before the entree was served we had a cup of Cream of Mushroom Soup, very delicious. The menu is not huge but it seems to cover the range of faire you expect at a German Restaurant.  There is no children's menu or any Non-German dishes i.e. hamburgers, chicken tenders, etc. So everybody in your group needs to like German Food or be open to trying it.  We'll be back for sure.

reviews.author: Misha S.
reviews.description: Pros:  1. Service is great! Knowledgable, excited staff  2. Restaurant is adorable - love the location right by everything - super easy to walk to a bakery or around downtown   3. The food is DELICIOUS. From the rye bread, the schnitzels and sausages, and ESPECIALLY the black forest cake. Seriously, the best I've ever had.    Cons:   1. They run out of the Black Forest cake. Seriously. I went here on my birthday, and they run out of it at the beginning of the week usually. And it's REALLY the best. I hope they start making MOOOOREEE!   2. It's a little pricey, but the portions are huge and sharing is definitely easy.

reviews.author: Daniel M.
reviews.description: So far, I really like this place. Live music in this spot is on the spot ( I am Hard of hearing ).  The waiter is amazingly, I do appreciate him check on us and food is on the spot ! I am Chef ....   However,  if Chef Ramsay were here. He will said first thing out his mouth is taking away the scents. It's need to remove and allow the smell from the kitchen brew it.

reviews.author: Daniel M.
reviews.description: Wife was hungry for German food and we used to go yearly for 5 weeks stays each time to Germany!  Picked this place and really enjoyed the service and selection of items!  The rye bread was really great! Then I had garlic soup that was good. The Wife wanted to try the sausage sampler. They had the spicy mustard I like. The only problem I had is, I've never had jalapeÃ±o sausage in Germany!! Not my thing.  Then I had the Rinder Goulash that was really great, the Wife had Huhnerbrust Geschnetzeltes. Chicken breast with sautÃ©ed spinach with mushrooms that was good as well!  I really like the place. I wish Yelp allowed 3 1/2 stars. Would I go back, you bet!

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: We loved the excellent food. The rye bread is amazing and the accordion musician was such a delight. We will definitely come back

reviews.author: Amberly F.
reviews.description: First timers here. We took our daughters 9 and 7 to have some of this amazing cuisine. I will start with the things we lived and work up to what wasn't the best. Firstly the series's great. The waitress was friendly and the place very clean. Beautiful ambiance perfect for a date or a couples dinner night. The food was good both my girls and husband agree it was yummy. All of our food came correct and hot. The beer was cold and the bread was fresh. Something to note while this is not a dress up place it's easy to feel under dressed. Also, this is a great place to try new things but the price is high and the options limited. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a quiet dinner with good food. As far as the food it was a little salty but flavorful. The sausage mustard was to die for and the red cabbage was absolutely delicious. We left full and satisfied.

reviews.author: Mimi P.
reviews.description: Best German food in Texas! Loved everything we ordered and the ambient! We even enjoyed the music playing live. Absolutely recommend this restaurant.  10 out of 10 baby!

reviews.author: Phillip D.
reviews.description: Great reviews, great little restaurant.  Many of our usual favorites were on the menu. My better half got Yagerschnitzel and I tried the Zeguenerschnitzel. We both were blown away! We both got the  chicken version. We both got the potato salad and red cabbage both were good but the potato salad was not traditional. It was good. The bread was just sliced marble Rye.  Our service was great and attentive. Our guy was Callan. Made it very pleasant.

reviews.author: Michael M.
reviews.description: HOLY MERCY!  This place was awesome, and eat lots of German food.  This was truly one of the best places I have eaten German EVER.  The food and service were wonderful, and much better than many of the other local German haunts.    I HIGHLY suggest trying this one out.    Excellent food, excellent service, and the young man who was playing the accordion around the restaurant was wonderful too!  Get yourself a reservation first, preferably!

reviews.author: Evan B.
reviews.description: This is the most legit jager schnitzel I've ever had. Delicious. They forgot my side of spatzle and the potato salad was cold when I thought it was supposed to be served hot but we also came fairly late at night. The sausage sampler was great but the sausage was no different than sausage I could have bought from a grocery store and made at home. Our service was incredible though and the building is awesome and a historical site.

reviews.author: Andrew P.
reviews.description: My grandparents are from Vienna Austria. I grew up on authentic Germanic foods. The decor in the restaurant was nice and reminded me of my grandparents house when I was a young man. The service here was exceptional. Very friendly, very professional and well mannered wait staff. If you want a kind of modern take on this cultural fare then maybe it's good, but old school authentic German food it is not. First of all the Kartoffel Knoedel were more of a grainy mashed potato that was scooped into a ball form. If you've had legit potato dumplings you'd know that these are not them.  Spatzel was meh. Beef goulash with Hungarian spicy paprika. Kudos for using the Hungarian spicy paprika. But why the hell is the sauce tomato based with bell peppers? If that's what you're looking for then maybe not too bad, but again, not traditional.   Jagerschnitzel was okay. Sauce wasn't the greatest.  I didn't hate the place, it's just it didn't excite the palate.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: My wife and I went for a date night.  The food was delicious.  I usually get the schnitzel but chose the Hungarian goulash instead.   It like the schnitzel was so well prepared.   The service was very friendly and quick to replenish our glasses.

reviews.author: Tonya T.
reviews.description: Beautiful old house, fabulous food and personable waitstaff. We had a tasty roasted garlic soup and sausage sampler before our meal.  A variety. Of lunch choices. Desserts looked delicious but we were just too full

reviews.author: Brian C.
reviews.description: As close to eating in Bavaria that you will get!  Very, VERY good!   I travel around the US for a living and have tried dozens of German restaurants and this is the real deal. I was stationed in Germany in the Army and have been trying to find a decent German restaurant for a loooong time. This is it!

reviews.author: may z.
reviews.description: What a little gem! Husband and I first discovered this restaurant during the "Texas freeze" back in February while staying at the Gruene Cottages (also recommend!); and it turned what would have been a sad trip to escape our lack of utilities into a lovely memorable date night. The restaurant was full throughout the evening, patrons being entertained by an accordion player that serenaded guests table side. A limited menu showing focus pays off, everything we have tried is delicious. Overall, a great neighborhood spot that we frequently visit!

reviews.author: Chris H.
reviews.description: Two times I've tried to get food there and both times, I have been shot down. I have to get to go because my wife is paralyzed from waist down, I went one time to dine in at 7:30 and was told they were not taking customers on a Friday, call and was told they are not taking phone orders. For a industry that was in dire straits last year I find this a poor decision. I've eaten there a few time and it was fair, I miss friesen haus it was at least flavored unlike this place mushrooms gravy that elder eats raved about its bland and lack luster and small portions.

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: This little cottage restaurant has the potential to be a absolutely great German restaurant. However, it has a little house work to do to get there. No doubt it has the charming ambience and Great German food of the best restaurants in the country.   Here is a list of minor items that needs to take care of first.  1. A vase of plastic flowers on the tables needs to have real flowers. 2. The bread needs to be changed to a better hearty German bread instead of the white bread with brown swirls. 3. Do not simply dump a small pile of foil-wrap butter pads, but have a real butter server with the bread. 4. The service on a Sunday afternoon was deplorable. The young man probably was a student from TSU in nearby San Marcos, working on weekends to make a little money for college. He did not repeat the orders from the four of us and therefore our food came all mixed up. He never thought to refill any of our drinks until we finally ask him to. He was a nice of guy  but just not trained to be a true sophisticated food server like this little restaurant deserves.  By the way, having a young singer with real lederhosen amble through the dining rooms singing German songs with his accordion was brilliant. This restaurant is truly a little gem that simply needs to be polished.

reviews.author: Kristin P.
reviews.description: THE BEST GERMAN FOOD!!! If you have not been here do yourself a favor and try it. The food is incredible. Atmosphere is really charming and we love the musician playing the accordion.  Some of my favorites here are the jager schnitzel with spaetzle. At lunch the schnitzel sandwich, which I add a side of jager gravy to pour over the schnitzel and then put the bread back on top. So yummy!

reviews.author: Tracy N.
reviews.description: The Almond crusted Brie appetizer was a meal by itself. I love the Schnitzel I had. I cannot pronounce or spell it but it had a spicy paprika sauce and it was spicy and delicious. My husband had Jaeger schnitzel  with dumplings that were out of this world. They had a young man playing accordion and it was great music to hear. We chatted with him a bit. The house is cozy and beautiful.

reviews.author: Patrick T.
reviews.description: I would highly recommend this place. I was in New Braunfels for a completely different reason and this caught my attention. The staff is friendly. They are attentive. And the food is out of this world. It is wonderful to have a few delicious bites from abroad. The fried Brie was so good. I'd highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for German foods. I would also recommend it to anyone. It was a journey for the tastebuds.

name: Anchor Bar
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times and every time has been delightful.  Unfortunately, I have only one picture of a Bloody Mary to memorialize or summarize all the great food I've had here.  more pictures needed  The chips and queso are always a winner in my book. The queso pairs well with chips, pizza, tots, and wedges.   The queso isn't super spicy so we like to add more jalapenos to the mix. The wedges were super addictive. Nicely fried and seasoned. I'm sure the tots would have been the same, but I couldn't eat any more potatoes.   The habanero ranch lime wings. Those are amazing. So yummy, I'm practically drooling as I think about them. Again, not too spicy, so if you want the heat you might need to ask them to increase it for you. I also really like the garlic parmesan wings, this is actually my favorite flavor, but I'm fairly certain that the HRL has taken the top spot.   Last night we tried a roast beef sandwich. It was ok. The bread was super salty, almost to the point that I couldn't eat it. However, I noticed it was primarily on top of the bread so I just took it off the bread. I probably wouldn't order that again. I'll stick to the queso, wings, and pizza.   I had the pizza back in January. It was fabulous, especially the next day. I loved the crust and I'm not usually a fan of bready crusts.   For dessert, we took caramel churros back home for later. I can only imagine the bliss of eating them warm on site. Those were some damn good churros. Overflowing with caramel and served with vanilla ice cream and an additional drizzle of caramel. It was dreamy!  Oh yeah and so the Bloody Mary. I never knew I liked pickled green beans until last weekend. Maybe I can get a bowl of them as an appetizer next time I'm there.  Omg I'm a jerk for not mentioning the amazing service. Table service and bar service has always been on point. Everyone there is attentive and honestly they have always gotten our order right. This is important because I've been there with a picky....*ahem* specific orderer. Thank you for being patient and pleasant!

reviews.author: G M.
reviews.description: I love the food here. Unfortunately, the service is always either terrible or barely mediocre. My last visit, it it was just a group of hostesses, waiters, and waitresses talking in the wait station while the bell in the kitchen was constantly ringing. I was not surprised when my food came out cold.  PLEASE.  Get better staff and you will be one of the best options in San Antonio for sports bars.  Your waitresses are consistently terrible.

reviews.author: Patricia M.
reviews.description: Thought we would check out local food.  Actual date was Saturday was a very place.  College football was on almost every tv. You could feel the energy in the establishment. All good, very jovial vibe.    If you find yourself in the area, decide to drop in! You must try the Anchor Bar Dip! Like a mix of queso with blue cheese. Don't try to understand just eat and enjoy.    Drinks were cold and blended with the right amount of alcohol.  So good we had 2 each.     I had the lemon pepper wings. Wow! Loved the crispy lemon pepper wings. Hot and spiced perfectly.  The fries were hot right out of the fryer! I feet compelled to eat all the fries.   Spouse had the Philly Cheese Steak Sandwich. Fresh baked bread, and tasty meat with fresh bell peppers.    The only issue we had was the lack of service. May have been due to the busy night.   Waited awhile for water refills, drinks  and bill.    Overall great place. May return during a slow night.

reviews.author: David V.
reviews.description: Aleesha took great care of me and my family!  Great wings and great service!  Thank you!!!

reviews.author: Andrea A.
reviews.description: AMAZING service by Aleesha! Very attentive! Great food! Will definitely be back and will definitely be requesting her section!

reviews.author: Jando S.
reviews.description: Considering I've eaten at the original location in Buffalo (#1), it admittedly feels strange (yet exciting) to have the option to do so in San Antonio. It is a very different feel but is still a very solid choice for some serious comfort food.  First off, this place is massive. It really doesn't look that big from the outside but there is ample seating and different party rooms. The parking is also abundant and they have a playground right out front for the youngins. This is a place where I would definitely consider hosting a large gathering (#2).  I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised by the food. Everything I ate was a gut bomb, but in the best way. Everything from the burgers, mac and cheese, tater tots, loaded appetizers, and the wings were quite tasty. The portions are excellent and this would be an ideal spot for a very big eater.  The real unfortunate thing is there is a wing shortage, and as a result the prices were a bit on the high side. Nothing's cheap during the pandemic but the quality of the food doesn't necessarily always coincide with the price.  Service is ok but not phenomenal. In dining service seems to be the way to go, even if I'm not entirely sure if the staff is fully masked up. Phone manners were a little suspect in the wait for my take out was a lot longer than I anticipated. In the end, I'm still happy I found this place and look forward to trying it again.  __________ (#1) Where I learned the origin of a "buffalo wing."  (#2) Once the pandemic is over, naturally.

reviews.author: Tyler R.
reviews.description: Sunday night football manager shuts off tv won't turn it back on.  Customer is treated like crap even when the servers are not in agreement will never come back.  Don't even bother with this place.  One star was the lowest I could go.

reviews.author: Michael E.
reviews.description: Can't say anything about the food... first time there today.  Walked in and waited for the hostess to finish on her phone.  Seated by a very very very busy storeroom.   2 employees in front of storeroom on their phones. Waited  Waited Waited Counted 15 employees  Waited Finally got a  drink order 3 girls went into storeroom - close door Couple of guys tap on door and enter Waited No drink All leave storeroom giggling  Bunch of employees having grand time at counter Waited No drink Waited Waited Left... passing 3 employees on phone at entrance  No need to go back... there are 5 wing joints nearby - but I bet the storeroom is the place to be!

reviews.author: Peyton G.
reviews.description: Ordered Buffalo salad. It came without Buffalo sauce. Paid for extra blue cheese dressings and got two ranch.

reviews.author: Whitney M.
reviews.description: We LOVE Anchor Bar! The wings are always perfectly cooked and amazing. Aleesha was a fantastic server!

reviews.author: Neal S.
reviews.description: Ordered a "All Meat Pizza" and added black olives, mushrooms, and onion through Uber Eats. Receipt clearly shows all items included with the order. My "All Meat Pizza" arrived with only the add-on items; no MEAT whatsoever. Anchor Bar Kitchen Staff need to pay attention to order details! Very disappointed!

reviews.author: Rachel A.
reviews.description: Been coming here for years... best service I ever had was with Aleesha. She gave great recommendations and made sure that we were taken care of! She new the menu well, too! Great food , great atmosphere.

reviews.author: Carolina E.
reviews.description: My favorite go to for Pizza, Patty melts and Wings! The flavor choices are plentiful and I no longer have to wait forever at Pluckers for a table and the wings here are not dry!  The pizza is huge and feeds my teens and 2 adults easily!  Wings are really good especially the Ranch rub and garlic parm with blue cheese which isn't the best but the wings make up for that. If you request celery and carrots, just know you only get 2 small carrot pieces and 2 teeny celery pieces The waitress on our last visit was not real good at keeping our drinks filled, we had to ask for refills, boxes but she was very quick to bring the check and cone back to cash it out.  Also, we were asked to sit at the end of the long bar table top instead of an actual table and there were 5 of us. We enjoyed the NBA final game 4 though with 360Â° views all around! It was awesome My patty melt was perfect too.

reviews.author: Frank V.
reviews.description: I do not recommend this place! Service was horrible we went Sunday, December 26, 2021 our waitress was rude we never got our order he had an attitude from hell after the manager came to our table we told her we were dissatisfied with our waitresses services the waitress didn't return to our table with a smirk on her face and told us it's obvious you spoke to my manager is everything OK! For what we Spitz that night is there the service we got was horrible we hold a lot of gatherings there that will stop!

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: We visited tonight for our first time this year and had a great time and amazing service. We were seated right away even though it seemed pretty busy. It looked like they have added a ton of outdoor seating, but it was a bit cold tonight. I don't know how authentic this location is to the original, but we went their a few years ago and have an affinity to the brand. Get the blue cheese!  I got a single order(10) hot and my wife got a snack size(5) medium. Both had a good mix of drumettes and flats. I added wedges, she got tots. The wings and potatoes were all nice and crispy and came with carrots and celery with no up charge.   They have a full bar and the beer is either big brand or local craft, with a good selection of draft and bottles/cans. They also had a lot of specialty mixed drinks, but we like beer with wings. The beers were all around $5 or less from what I looked at.
