The booths all had extra plexiglass dividers between them, the tables had plastic sheets on plastic stands, and there was a self service temperature scanner by the door, but we didn't see that until on the way out. Each table had a placard with QR codes for the drink and food menus.

reviews.author: Selina P.
reviews.description: We've been coming here for about a year now and we have been HOOKED ever since then! We are always comparing wings everywhere we go, and no one has ANYTHING on Anchor Bar yet!    Our kids always have a blast and we absolutely LOVE their employees! Kornelia (bar tender) , Jasmine (manager) , and Ryan (server/bar tender)  are the BEST!  They NEVER disappoint! We LOVEEEE it so much it has become a family tradition!

reviews.author: Rhonda E.
reviews.description: The only restaurant in town with too many employees! Hostess was too busy on her phone to notice we walked in..another employee came by and bumped her to look up. Sat us by the office..plenty of action going on in there! No less than 8 employees walking in and out of the office, door kept opening and closing, staff knocking on the door asking if they could come in too, as we sat there with no service...finally a young man asked if we wanted a drink..ordered 2 beers..never got them...a few minutes later a different young man came up and apologized for out wait, gave us menus explained a few things and left. We watched 6 employees gather behind a counter in a high energy conversation..including the two who came to our table...they all talked for a while!! No beers were ever delivered, no order was ever taken..we watched others come in, given water and napkins..not us...so we left...on our way out the group of 6 waiters and waitresses started moving...we stopped at the hostess stand which had 3 girls behind it now and told them the service was horrible and we left. Now we sit at Buffalo Wild Wings on Dezavala..drinking a beer and waiting for our order of wings! Never again Anchor Bar...never again

reviews.author: J W.
reviews.description: Waited for order that was placed on Yelp/Grubhub.  Arrived and gave name. They checked the kitchen and said it was almost ready. After waiting for 20 minutes they asked my name again, then said they didn't have an order for me.  Then I showed them the order confirmation. They went to the back and brought me my order. My food was COLD.  Terrible experience.

reviews.author: Haydee G.
reviews.description: Second time coming to this place tried different entrees,Chicken wrap and Mac n cheese sandwich, not that impressed with neither of them.  The wings I tasted that ordered on side which were very delicious! Service takes a while to bring drinks and food.  First time was at FM3009 and 2nd time was at 1604 location both were pretty dead but same service unfortunately.

reviews.author: J. P.
reviews.description: Things have gone from mediocre to bad. I own a restaurant in San Antonio and I know it's tough right now between service and food availability/cost, but this was bad. The service was inattentive and slow, the nachos and pizza came out ice cold like there wasn't even a heat lamp and the pizza was so soggy and made incorrectly. And then I was overcharged. Asked who the manager was and the server said he didn't know. I used to order wings here, but now they're charging $18 for a 10 piece. How disappointing.

reviews.author: Evaristo R.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere to have a couple of drinks listen to some music and have some great  food  from the local food truck

reviews.author: Joey P.
reviews.description: Man, F this place. Bentley's!?! More like broke down, second-hand, non-functioning, bad paint job, busted transmission Hyundai is more like it. The parking lot is so crammed with cars and yelling, sketchy ass people so watch out or you might get run over or assaulted. The swings at the bar are a cute touch but the questionable patrons make this place a hard pass. $99 for some baby ass shots of Patron and a margarita flight? So not worth it. If you like having to flag down a bartender and like to be patted down and have your bag searched and be stared down by a wanna-be Sheriff, cowboy hat wearing, weird ass security guard, then this place will be heaven for you. Did I mention that the clientele is not the friendliest? No thanks.

reviews.author: Brandye C.
reviews.description: This place had a little of everything and everybody. Not my type of crowd but I was there for moral support after the boxing match. Someone even brought their service dog inside.

reviews.author: Brooke B.
reviews.description: SECURITY GUARD, FORAN, IS A RACIST PIG.  I have been here a couple times with my friends. It was super chill. But tonight my friend and I went. We were dancing with these random Haitian girls and this RUDE security guard, Foran, walked up and said control your friend or get out. I was trying to understand what was going on. I don't know the girls or what happened before we got there. So I asked him "what was going on" and "what are you talking about?" All he kept saying was "control your friend or leave." And he told her she had to sit down or get out. There was no explanation or anything. The more I tried to understand the meaner and more aggressive he got.  On my way out, I walked up to him and said "hey we were just having a good time dancing. I don't know those girls or what happened before I got there but you were very mean and aggressive. You don't have to be a that mean. I was just trying to figure out what was going on and why we couldn't dance" he said "I don't go to your job telling you how to work, don't come to mine to tell me." And then he told the other guys near him "don't let them back in." Referring to me and my friend I went there with.  I definitely won't return. Foran didn't say a word to the white girls that were also dancing.

reviews.author: Susie K.
reviews.description: After standing in line for 10min the bouncer came and told me that I needed to stand in another line very AGGRESSIVELY , I told him the bartender already took my order and I'm good he then proceeded to yell at me and tell me to move, the bartender J told him I was good and he went on some power trip. The owner Jesse then came and told me that I needed to leave.   Place is straight TRASH....

reviews.author: Mike T.
reviews.description: Cheap drinks and food.  There burgers are surprisingly very good.  Bartenders are always friendly.  So if you are in a budget but need some drinks and food this is the spot

reviews.author: Raquel C.
reviews.description: Enjoyed this bar. Has an inside with tables, chairs, and couches. The outside has porch swing chairs surrounding the bar. Mariachis on Friday were great!

reviews.author: Kristine V.
reviews.description: The music is good but can get a little too loud. The drinks are good; poetry on Thursday was good the one time I went. It can get crowded, depending on which day you go, which is mainly Saturday night, and that wasn't very pleasant. They do have issues with keeping the soap and paper towels stocked. They have a food truck that usually serves chicken wings, pork chops, and sometimes tacos and egg rolls and sides like green beans, mac and cheese, etc. Overall it is a good time and a nice place to go.

reviews.author: Rachael B.
reviews.description: Nice bar for a HH. I hear Thur and Sunday are nice. They only serve food on select events. I went for the crawfish and shrimp platters for $15. I'm new here so brought my 5 yo daughter . Not a place for kiddies, but now I know. It was fine enough to eat and leave. Spicy crawfish, but good. Music was nice. If you like hip hop  love the swing chairs at the bar.  I'll be back for HH, drinks, and music.

reviews.author: Daryll B.
reviews.description: This is a pretty dirty looking bar. The Crawfish boils they put on are ridiculous. There were about 80 people here last Sunday for the $15 AYCE deal. Each time you get in line there are no less than 30 people in line. This went on for 3 hrs from the open at 2. By the way they were 45 mins late from the advertised start serving time.  Anyway, they give you one little french fry tray at a time (about 1/2 a lb of actual crawfish). The average grown Louisianan or hungry Texan can eat 5 lbs. That would be 10 trips at this rate.  After 4 trips, I gave up. I actually ate about 2 lbs for the $15. No difference than going to one of the local restaurants. I heard the day before for the Saturday boil, one man ate 23 trays.  I was also mad at the size of the Crawfish they were known as field runs, the tiniest ones with absolute zero tail meat. Besides my very first tray which was hot and delicious all the rest or cold to lukewarm.   I won't be back to this place. This place just seems like an overhyped sloppily run Place with music and DJs. The restrooms were filthy.

reviews.author: Jerry E.
reviews.description: Strong drinks, good music, and Great service! Not sure what else to ask for in bar... It is a fun venue every time I've been in the past. They have an indoor and outdoor bar area.   You'll know if this is your kind of bar upon walking up to it from the parking lot. If it's not, then it's not; but if it is, then go on in! Originally I was just looking for something different, somewhere with a fun vibe and I found it here!  Lookin' forward to coming here during Crawfish Season!

reviews.author: Marie D.
reviews.description: This was my first time here. I had fun! The Mariachi was great and I appreciated the chips and salsa. We meet the owner and talked to him for a while. He was very nice. Next time we go we're gonna sit in the swings! The atmosphere it's chill and the happy hour specials were pretty good.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: This is a Crawfish Boil only review. We visited for All You Can Eat Crawfish on Sunday. We got there just before 1:30 PM and it's supposed to start at 2 PM, but it didn't get rolling until after 2:30 PM. It's $15/person (you pick up your wristband at the bar). It's supposed to include sausage, mini corn cobs, and potatoes. The sausage was in 1" pieces and the potatoes were sliced (not the little whole red potatoes you might expect). There were also bits of pineapple in it, for some reason. It can catch you off guard if you think it's an onion and you're not expecting something sweet. It was really dark inside the bar, so it was hard to tell at first, but there weren't actually any onions, so we figured it out pretty quickly. There isn't any shaded seating outside, which is why we ate inside. The owner indicated that he would be installing a shade awning, so there will be improvement there shortly.  The crawfish was very spicy, which we liked. Every portion I got came out hot, so no issues there. Each person with a wristband has to stand in line. They'll only give you 1 little tray at a time, which you can eat in about a minute, so it was a little annoying to hardly get any crawfish and then have to go stand in line again for 10 minutes to get another little dish of it. They need to get the bigger trays and hand it out in at least 1-2# portions plus the sides.  After our second tray each, they were already out of sausage and they hadn't been serving for very long. I didn't get any potatoes in trays 5-6, but I'm not sure if that's because they were out or I was just unlucky. After our 2nd ear of corn each, we were saying "no corn," so I'm not sure how long those lasted.  We stood in line for what felt like forever on our last trip - they had stopped serving at one point (presumably to take a break). I left my fiance at the front of the line and I went back to the table. I got 2 new cups of water, and I peeled the heads off a tray of crawfish. They weren't providing anything to put your trash in, so it was just piled up in the middle of the tiny table. I had to find a trash can to toss all the trash, then went to the restroom. While I was in there for a whole 2 minutes, someone decided to bus the table - trashing the 2 new cups of water, the tray of crawfish tails, and a tray of corn and potatoes. Who tf does that?? Super frustrating.  After that BS and standing in lines longer than eating crawfish, we decided to leave. We'd been there for 3 hours (half of that was waiting for the thing to start though). We only ended up eating 12 trays total, which was probably 5-6# of crawfish. I got 2 little ears of corn, and the equivalent of about 1 large potato, and maybe 0.25# of sausage. We felt like we at least got what we paid for, but we probably won't go back there. There are places that are better organized for the crowd and they don't run out of sides in the first half hour.  Note: you can also get chicken-on-a-stick for $6, but it's just frozen, breaded chicken fingers that they skewer and cook.They have remoulade for dipping (tastes ok) and Slap Ya Mama seasoning to dump on everything. The Revolver draught beer we were picking was $5 each, but it wasn't as cold as it should have been. We still got 3 of those though!

reviews.author: Trakidra G.
reviews.description: My first time coming here and I have to say it was fantastic! I almost felt like I was home eating crawfish!! Everyone was super friendly and the music was awesome! Not to mention the drinks. I'll be back for sure. Even though we came a little on the late side we were greeted and encouraged to partake in the crawfish boil! It was money well spent. I'm ready for the next once!

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, killer staff, and the best crawfish you can get on. Had a blast and can't wait to make it back down!

reviews.author: Felicila R.
reviews.description: Great place to come.drinks are good nice outside lounge.love it..great place to come after a hard day

reviews.author: Madison W.
reviews.description: Super friendly people and even better food. AYCE Crawfish for $20. This place wouldn't be the best for kids or big groups of people. But me and 3 of my friends had a wonderful time. They play great music and it's nice and cool outside on the patio. We'll be back

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Beer and Crawfish!  I've never really heard of a crawfish bar, but this place has it going on! With a name like Bentley's, it's not as fancy and pretentious as you'd think it'd be. A name like Bentley's made me picture a place covered in marble serving Grey Poupon and caviar. This place is quite the opposite.  It's a dark bar with loud music inside. Sometimes, they bring in a band to play on a little stage that they have set up. They have a bunch of craft beers, many of which are somewhat hard to find. I don't think they have a single beer on draft- only bottles and cans.  The best feature of this bar is that they are usually serving up crawfish outside on the patio. They've taken over part of the parking lot, and are building permanent shade structures with picnic tables and a crawfish cooker and a large BBQ grill. They serve up all you can eat crawfish on the weekends. I know I can eat a ton of crawfish, especially ones like the ones they serve here- they're small, but spicy. To be honest, I've never signed up for the crawfish deal, but I do enjoy coming here to watch people stuff their faces with them, and then stand in line for some more. Everything on the outdoor patio is slightly sticky and smells like old crustaceans and hot sauce. The place could use an occasional good hosing down after all that crawfish juice.  It's a nice bar, especially on the outside. It's a great place to kick back outdoors with plenty of seating, and good beers.

reviews.author: La Shon W.
reviews.description: Cool bar great service... I really enjoyed my self this past weekend with great music and drinks... I was hoping for the all you can eat crawfish

reviews.author: Daniel R.
reviews.description: Nice up and coming bar on Broadway. They are fairly new to the strip and still working on improvements to their facility. They have an indoor stage where they have live music throughout the week. Reasonable drink specials and events such as the crawfish broil on Thursdays and Sundays, and Ribeye on Wednesday's. All in all this is a pretty small local bar that has plenty of potential. Main reason I come here is because of their customer service. Jessie always welcomes his guest with open arms.

reviews.author: J H.
reviews.description: So we're heading to the caverns and wanted lunch.  We ARE NOT chic filet kinda people!!  Found this place on yelp and it was along the route we were taking.  OK yes, it is somewhat of a hole in the wall, or for that matter quaint, picturesque, salon, on the side of the road. Walked in and were greeted by Heidi (one of the owners), she told us to pick where we wanted to sit, so we saddled up to the bar.  Yes, small bar, but very adequate, plenty of tables to sit inside, and outside.   Craving a burger, but not wanting the bun, started reviewing the wraps.  My husband and I both ordered wraps and a order of onion rings.   My Santa Fe with ground beef was wonderful, the cheese was creamy, the beef tender with just a hint of spice.  My husband enjoyed the Alamo wrap and it disappeared.  OH, don't let me forget the salsa she gives you with the wrap, I don't remember what it was but it was super with kick!  The onion rings we shared (small order), was the perfect amount for two people, they were fresh and hot!  We are not dippers, so we did not take Heidi up on the sauces she offered for the rings. If ever back in this neck of the woods, we WILL be back!

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: Found this gem while treating a Veteran to a lunch on Veterans Day. It's a nice small indoor/large outdoor restaurant. Upon arrival parking was easy and they have plenty of room. You can see a lot of picnic tables and small playground set.   I'm giving 3 stars because the lady who took our order was super rude. I would ask a question and it was met with so much attitude and unwillingness to help. If it wasn't for me treating a friend to lunch I would have completely walked away from this place.   The bright side was that the food turned out really good. We split an order of sweet potato fries bc it's a huge serving. I ordered the Santa Fe wrap which is Pepper Jack, black beans, corn, rice, chipotle spread with avocado (vegetarian option). It was really pleasing, wrap done right. They also have a nice selection room of craft beers.

reviews.author: Raul Z.
reviews.description: I recommend this place, cause when it is nice outdoors, this is a great place to be. Also the food is great. To me, once they change the buns on the burgers, I want a burger now. I didn't like the buns before, so I started getting the wraps, which are delicious, now I'm hooked on the BLT. Plus this place has a friendly staff, they do get busy, so the wait for food may be awhile, but the beer selection is pretty decent.   One draw back is the bathroom, just one.

reviews.author: Mechila B.
reviews.description: If I could give half stars, I would give this place 3.5, but it just didn't deserve 4 stars.   The staff was nice. They weren't wearing masks or gloves, so keep that in mine when going.  The had a little park thing and a bunch of outside seating, so it's great if you have a family!  We didn't get to try any of the beers.  The Cali club was good, but there was nothing special about it.  The maverick was good but again, there was nothing special about it.  The loaded fries were good, but it wasn't as presentable as I could make it myself at home. It also felt like it had waited out for a while before it got to us.  There was nothing really special about this place, but the food was ok.

reviews.author: Megan J.
reviews.description: Came in for a quick lunch with the hubby. The waitress at the bar was nice. We both hd tea and it was good nothing special. My husband had the 46 burger wrap. It was ok. The sauce tasted like thousand island. Nothing made it special. The menu stated it came with fries, but he didn't get any. I ordered the Hollywood taco. The shredded chicken was GREAT. The price for what I got was high. Just a normal sized taco you would make at home. The tortilla tasted like an Hâ€‘Eâ€‘B tortilla, not bad just ok. The meat was topped with a few kernels of corn and fresh diced jalapeÃ±o. The verde sauce was mediocre. Again nothing special. I added fries to my order and they were good, Very crispy. They were out of fried pickles which was a huge let down since it was one of the reasons we chose to give this place a shot, but I'm not holding it against them with the supply shortages going on right now.  Overall everything was ok, but didn't seem worth the drive or the price.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: We had been wanting a try this place for a quite sometime and since we were in the area, we did. We had the Cali wrap and the loaded fries. Both were okay, nothing that I would go back for.  Also, there is very limited parking and inside seating. So if it's crowded and hot, cold, rainy etc., you will be sitting outside.

reviews.author: Justin M.
reviews.description: Came here with the family after doing Natural Bridge Caverns. First, be prepared to sit outside, there's not much room inside, especially during the social distancing times. However, even though it was over 90 degrees outside the shade and breeze kept it cool enough to be pleasant. Kids had a playground to okay on - though it was a bit past it's prime.   The ordering seemed a bit haphazzard, which seemed to be due to only have one employee working front of house despite it being rush hour lunch time. This caused me to have to stand at the bar for considerable amounts of time waiting to order or when I went to get a beer. Hopefully this was just someone not showing up for a shift and not a perpetual issue.   Now for the food. I had a Santa Fe wrap. Standard Mexican ingredients, but all together tasty. My wife's burger wrap with fries in the wrap looked quite good. Kids chicken strips were solid quality. The fries had good flavor and crunchy outsides. Beer selection was surprisingly good (Blood and Honey automatically  means I'm happy).   Solid, if not spectacular experience.

reviews.author: Shelia C.
reviews.description: I was excited to try this place and loved the outdoor area. My friend and I ordered the Santa Fe wrap and we were quite disappointed. The entire wrap was rice, it was so hard to eat because of the amount of rice made the wrap so dry. It hardly had any chicken, mine had maybe a 3 little pieces of chicken bits and about 6 black beans. Just a drop of sauce and no cheese or corn. I should have taken a pic but I had to open mine up to remove the big glob of rice. Same with my friends. Our sons loved their burger and grilled cheese. Next time I will try a burger but for being called wraptitude, I was expecting a good wrap.

reviews.author: Wilma K.
reviews.description: Just had a great burger. We love the Mavericks burger their fires are fantastic we'll seasoned and hot. My husband loves the beer here, McConahas.

reviews.author: Maria D.
reviews.description: Why did I wait so long to try this place? Wraptitude was on the way to the lake so we finally stopped by.  The outdoor seating is nicely shaded. This place is also dog friendly. Our waitress greeted us and introduced herself. I am horrible with names, but the receipt said Martha. She was friendly had the Rattlesnake Burger Bowl and my husband had the Greek Wrap.

reviews.author: Elise M.
reviews.description: We stopped by after spending the morning at Natural Bridge caverns. We ordered a few burger wraps, chicken strips, and the surf burger from the kids menus. The food was really tasty and fries were delicious. The main issue here was that they seemed to be understaffed and weren't set up very well for social distancing. They have a very small seating area and bar inside and several picnic tables and outdoor seating options. While you can spread out just fine outside, you have to go inside of the crowded small building to place your order. It was a very small space with too many people inside close together. Also, the fountain drinks and cups were self-serve set up right next to where everyone was standing. If they had online or outside ordering so that you could avoid going inside, it would really improve things.

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: This was the 1st meal while in Texas, and we dare say it was superb. The guy running the restaurant was super chill and energetic. The atmosphere was relaxing with the eclectic decor.  The hubs had the burger wrap while I had 3 tacos (pork, asada, and avutarian). We also shared the half-loaded fries.  The fries were amazing! Usually with these types of dishes, the fries become soggy or aren't even crispy to begin with. These had a crunch even to the last few pieces. And not to mention, it was loaded with a lot of beef and bacon pieces. What a value for the amount of meat that's in it.  His burger wrap was seriously da bomb. All the 46 sauce and ingredients stuffed inside the wrap was just oozing outwards. The wrap consisted of beef, bacon bits, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, and onions -- pretty much what a burger is. Biting into this was a wowing moment. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.  My tacos were okay. They weren't superb (standard lettuce, cheese, lime, and tomatillo salsa). I wouldn't rec it as this place isn't known for their tacos:  * Asada: The avocados were creamy. This was prob the freshest and tastiest of the 3 tacos. * Avutarian: The flavors were faint at most. There wasn't much wow or anything that made this taco look nor taste diff. * Pork: The flavors were lacking, and the pork looked super bland (see the only close-up pic worth taking).  Everything about this experience was 5 stars minus my taco choices. The loaded fries and burger wrap were just mind-blowing delicious and at a great price.  Though there were limited parking spaces in the front, the back had plenty of nooks and crannies you could squeeze your car into.

reviews.author: Tere R.
reviews.description: These folks are friendly!  I'd venture to say they have the best burgers in Texas. They also have a shaded play area for kids with climbing equipment, kids cornhole and other games. My husband and I dislike screaming kids in a restaurant. Every child in the place was relaxed and happy. Great food and happy families-a super combination!

reviews.author: Melanie R.
reviews.description: Always serving up delicious food and a great outdoor environment. So far I've had the maverick and the big kahuna burgers... both options were delicious and  were cooked just right every time (I hate when burgers are over cooked). I wish I would have taken a picture before I devoured them lol. They have some of the best onion rings out of most places we've tried and fresh crispy fries. Live music line up during spring, summer, and I think into fall on Friday's and Saturday's. The cornhole and play area keep the kiddos busy which is awesome because the kids can work up an appetite while waiting for the food to come out. We love bringing our out of state visitors here because the employees are also so darn nice! Y'all must try it!!!!

reviews.author: Max D.
reviews.description: What an awesome experience. The restaurant has a great outdoor dining set up. Large and small tables, playground for kids. Great stop after visiting Natural Bridge Caverns.   You order at the host stand and get your own fountain drinks in the bar. The burgers and wraps were enough for two and came with fries. The Greek salad was fresh and not expected from a sandwich joint. Very impressed and would go back again.

reviews.author: James H.
reviews.description: The food was pretty good, the staff was prompt and friendly. My only knock on this place is the dining in space.

reviews.author: Inga C.
reviews.description: Wraptitude offers fresh food in a relaxed, rustic environment.   At our table, we ordered some burgers and sandwiches, a wrap, some onion rings, and kids' meals. Everyone in our group was happy with the food and the generous portions. The food is handmade and has fresh ingredients. Service was intermittent but with a good attitude, so we were able to get our food in a timely manner.   In the future, we would probably choose to sit outside and enjoy the play area, live, music, etc. on this particular visit, we had been playing outside and wanted to cool down. The interior space is small and unevenly cooled by a wall AC unit.

reviews.author: Belinda L.
reviews.description: My hubby and I love frequenting local businesses. Wraptitude is one of our favorites. Service is always fast and friendly. Food is always succulent and scrumptious. They even have a Drive Thru. There's seating inside, outside and a little in between for those that choose not to decide. We love it. Stop by and see for yourselves.

reviews.author: Nathan L.
reviews.description: The scenery was perfect for family gatherings with a park for the kids and amazing hamburgers.

reviews.author: Stephanie F.
reviews.description: I had a great experience at this place. The food was absolutely delicious and I'd forgotten my wallet and the owner let me take my food and come back later to pay. Wow! I was floored at her trust in me since this was my first time there. Of course I went back later and paid and left a big tip. The friend pickles were yummy and my wrap was delicious. Can't wait to go back!

name: Down on Grayson
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Theodore C.
reviews.description: In town for business and walked to the Pearl brewery along the river walk...Grayson is set in a nice area and it's a really nice walk if you're inclined.   The atmosphere at Grayson is nice and has a trendy feel.   I ordered the crispy fish and a spicy margarita.  I will say the title of the crispy fish dish doesn't do it justice.  It was an amazing pan fried snapper that had a very unique flavor.    I didn't really enjoy the spicy margarita, and would recommend trying a different cocktail  The outdoor seating area was really neat with  plenty of seating and fire pits to sit by.  I recommend trying this place out

reviews.author: Leslie H.
reviews.description: What a lovely restaurant! The indoor seating was very nice, but the out door areas were what brought us in, as they welcome dogs Very large outdoor areas with lots of tables  Savanah was our server, she was very sweet and accommodating  It was late so we both opted for tomato soup and amazing grilled cheese...i couldn't finish mine, so filling but so good! They do offer some vegan options Very clean Slightly pricey but not crazy

reviews.author: Courtney W.
reviews.description: Came for dinner on a Sunday evening with friends. We walked in around 7:45 PM and had a party of 5 and had to wait about 45-50 minutes for a table. Once we were seated, it took a while for food to come out.   Crispy Brussels: really good! Super crispy and comes with a yummy sauce. Great savory app for sharing.  Lavender lemonade: pretty solid cocktail. It tasted more like lemonade than lavender but it's sweet and refreshing.  Chicken and kale salad: heavy on the kale. The chicken, avocado, and cashews are chopped up and mixed in and the kale is also chopped and marinated in the dressing so it's not tough to chew. The dressing is light, which I appreciate. The chicken pieces are small but kind of tough and dry. It's a pretty big salad and very filling.  Everyone agreed their food was pretty average and nothing to rave about, plus it's kind of pricey as expected of the location. The restaurant itself has a nice vibe with a cool bar and TVs. But the average food combined with such a long wait only warrants 3 stars from me.

reviews.author: marie s.
reviews.description: I love the atmosphere at this place, the drinks the food, the people, the vibe, it was all fun and festive!  The sliders are much larger than your normal sliders and the onion ring strings were perfect!

reviews.author: Walter S.
reviews.description: Such a cute place.  Such a great location.  Such incredible potential. Such a missed opportunity.  Having visited Down on Grayson several times I have always found myself feeling underwhemled when all is said and done.   There is plenty of parking to be found in the area so we've never had an issue getting to Down on Grayson.  They do have a beautiful outdoor space, which we've sat at as well as ample indoor seating, which we've also sat at.  Indoor is fine but outdoor is where ya wanna be....weather permitting.  Service has always been acceptable.  Nothing stand-out or to praise but also nothing terrible or warranting any sort of negative attention.  I guess, for me, where Down on Grayson falls short is the food.  The onion rings are good but greasy and a little goes a long way with those.  The Crispy Brussels are fine and the salads I've tried, acceptable.  The "El Moderno" Nachos claim to be an "authentic version of this south of the border favorite" but if that's autÃ©ntico then gimmie the cheap, knock-off version any day.  Meh. At. Best.    Now look-obviously, I am in the minority here and maybe where they shine is their meat-based menu offerings that this vegetarian doesn't eat, so take my opinion with a grain of salt if you're more on the carnivore end of the spectrum. For me, this isn't a place I suggest nor is it a place I must take people.  It's mostly a really pretty patio to grab a drink and then head elsewhere for dinner.  That's my ideal Down on Grayson experience.

reviews.author: Tina E.
reviews.description: Service was amazing and food was unique and prepared well with quality ingredients.  Lots of space to sit, inside and outside. You won't regret it, this place is fantastic.

reviews.author: Jen H.
reviews.description: I've passed Down on Grayson many times while at the Pearl and was finally able to dine here for a late lunch/early dinner. Covered reserved parking (for this restaurant only) is available just a few steps away from the entrance. Since it was an off hour (3:30pm), there was no wait for a table. We chose to sit inside, but there is seating outdoors as well. They are also dog-friendly (outdoor seating only).  I started off with a Ranch Water, which has dulce vida blanco tequila, fresh lime juice, and topo chico. The Topo Chico was a bit flat, but the drink aesthetics was on point. Not really worth the $12 price tag in my opinion, but I had to try it since I've never officially tried ranch water before.  The Shishito Peppers ($12) appetizer was definitely a great surprise. The portion size of the peppers was way bigger than I expected, and the peppers themselves were cooked very nicely with a slightly blistered skin. The accompanying sriracha mayo balanced the heat of the peppers.  For the main, I got Fish Tacos ($16). They were one of the best fish tacos I've ever had! The large filets of fish were perfectly cooked and juicy, and the spiciness of the seasoning paired well with the fixin's (i.e. cole slaw, avocado, tomato, red onion, salsa, lime juice, cilantro) on top. It's a must-try item!  Service was also great from beginning to end. Our waitress was prompt and very friendly but didn't overdo it with checking up on us. Even the hostess seated us with a smile, which many restaurant hosts/hostesses fail to do.  Definitely a great place to grab delicious food and drinks!  [An added bonus is the decor in the women's restroom--cute, framed paintings of dogs!]

reviews.author: Michael C.
reviews.description: Decided to stop by for an early dinner after returning some golf shorts that were SEE THROUGH at Nike. Was not expecting much even though it has pretty solid reviews but to my surprise everything was great!   I started off with the Grayhound cocktail which was basically grapefruit juice and vodka. If you like grapefruit, you have got to get this drink. Super refreshing after a nice walk from the parking lot in the 100 degree weather!   For the appetizer I decided to try out the Shishito peppers and they were pretty good. Perfectly charred and it also came with a light dipping sauce that did not take away from the natural flavors of the pepper.   The main attraction for me was the fire roasted chicken. Tuesday afternoon means we must choose healthier options so of course I had to go with a chicken breast. The chicken breast was huge and was attached to the bone with a nice fire roasted skin on top. The breast itself was nice and tender but not too tender. I'd say it was a perfectly grilled/fire roasted chicken breast. It was also lightly sauced with a honey sauce which complimented the corn well because the corn had just a little heat to it. The corn was sweet and fresh and you could tell that it comes from the cob instead of a frozen bag.   Our waitress was cool too and was very friendly and the service was great. Overall this is a great spot to hang out at because they have good food and a wide variety of drinks!

reviews.author: Luis A.
reviews.description: I love coming to Down on Grayson! The drinks are crafty and fresh and their service is immaculate. Thanks guys!

reviews.author: Celeste  A.
reviews.description: Me and a friend end up here after some exploration at the Pearl and I'm so glad we did. It was such a great environment to drink and talk!! We only had starter plates and it was enough. The drink where amazing!! You definitely get what you pay for and you don't feel like they are cheating you either.  There was a wait so we decided to sit at the bar. The bar tenders are on point when it comes to memorizing the specials of the day and making bom ass drink!!!  Definitely a 10/10 experience and I will definitely be back!!!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Down On Grayson does not disappoint! I absolutely love the ambiance, the food, the service and, and drinks here! This is definitely a date spot for me.

reviews.author: Moni M.
reviews.description: I had dinner and drinks at the bar !  I had great ,amazing    Service whit  Joey she was amazing she made my old fashion so delicious it was on point I older  The sliders and the husband had the veggie sandwich whit  Shoestring French fries f and both were delicious. Of u guys here sit at the bar and for  Joey u won't be Disappointment. I planned on coming back  to try the menu  More delicious yummy drinks for my mixologist aka Joey

reviews.author: Amanda P.
reviews.description: Went here for lunch on a weekday and was seated right away, we got our choice of indoor or outdoor seating.  Their Frozen Rita is delicious! Definitely recommend if you are someone who enjoys a good margarita. I wanted something light and refreshing and so I ordered their Veggie Sandwich and it was just what I wanted.   The staff here is also super nice, checking in on you just the right amount of times.

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: Food and service is excellent here! We were seated outside because it was a longer wait inside. There are plenty of fans and umbrellas to keep the area cool.   I had the Cobb salad and it was delicious! Be careful of the pigeons that are circling around and ready for your leftovers!   This place is dog friendly! Thank you LeAnn for your excellent service!  Will come back!

reviews.author: Sj G.
reviews.description: Loved the food and atmosphere.  I can't wait to go back with my hubs and pup.  They have a pup friendly dining on patio.  The bacon is so crisp.  Service from Cindy was stellar.  Thank you.

reviews.author: G G.
reviews.description: Meh. Food was good enough, but going to what i thought was mid scale or better, i was surprised to find being treated like it is a ghetto sports bar in a bad neighborhood.   Go there with your wife on an after church jaunt and sit at the bar. You will be greeted with the need of a credit card to "open a tab" or you cant sit and eat.   Weird policy for a non low end sports bar. Made the experience seem low scale, even though prices say they aren't .   Burger was good, salad was fine. If i sat at a table i would haven't been treated like a 'thief in waiting', but i won't be back to try that experience.  Edit: vindicated already.  Guy and wife sat next to me, they ordered and got the official ask for your card line and looked he at bartender awkwardly.  It not normal and makes high end customers off put to have it happen

reviews.author: Leslie N.
reviews.description: There were five of us here for lunch. Everybody had something negative to say about their food. The food was OK but just OK. My piece of fried fish cost $30. The chips came out so salty we had to return them because you couldn't eat them. Onion rings came out lukewarm. The french fries were not hot. The service however was excellent.

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: Anytime I come to Down on Grayson, my ride or die item is the veggie sandwich! I'm not even a vegetarian but this sandwich is so fresh and so good, I simply have to get it.  Love their outdoor patio dining- both kid and dog friendly.  The vibe here is very relaxed and there is something on the menu for everyone.  The one thing I will say is don't come here if you are in a hurry as the service and food tend to take their time...which I'm fine with but just know going into this experience it's gonna be a while.    Every plate that walks by looks more delicious than the next.  I have not tried the desserts but today I saw another table get the strawberry cake and it looked delicious- one slice was about a 1/4 of a whole cake, very shareable.    Love dining here on Sundays for lunch then walking around the Pearl Farmers Market.

reviews.author: Jan B.
reviews.description: I love dining here. The prices are quite high, but I imagine the cost to operate in the Pearl area drives that. The food is high quality and service is excellent !! A great outing and Farmers Market nearby

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: I have to say. I was torn between writing this review and just waiting to see if I could give them one more shot. Sadly tho, I went with the review for a number of reasons. The main one being the fact that I was so excited to finally try this supposed gem tucked away near the Pearl District. I have been to the the Pearl several times but always with my kiddos so I chose the food places near the water area each time. Today I was child free and it was just my oldest daughter and myself so we happily walked on over after running errands in the area.  Went inside. Greeted by a very friendly host at the stand by the door. (He gets the mandatory 1*) Good little wait, so we went to the bar to grab a cold water to cool us down before our table was ready.  Got our table quicker than they anticipated, so we were stoked. Unfortunately, it was a huge LET-DOWN. Our server seemed upset. We had to say the first hello. She never smiled. Never said a word other than to ask about drink choices, if we were ready to order, or to answer a question we may have had. Ordered our food. Food was delivered and... that's the last we saw of her. She literally set the plates down and immediately walked away.  My daughter needed a couple more things and we wanted to place a to-go order for my parents, but alas. We never saw her a single time we were eating. As I looked around I saw all these other servers going to their tables and asking how everything was, could they get them anything else, etc. and there I was wondering to myself 'why couldn't that be my server'...  We sat after finishing our food and pushed our plates aside as to kind of give an indication we were finished, but still. Nothing. Finally I made eye contact with another server and she came over. We asked for a couple boxes and the check. The manager comes a couple minutes later with them and we pay. We obviously didn't order the to-go.  I was so disappointed. Sad actually. This place gets so much business and they have wonderful food. There is zero reason anyone who comes thru their doors should receive anything close to the service we got.  I am going to have to assume most of the reviews are from regulars that frequent often and are pampered because I cannot imagine them making it the way they have and having the reputation they have based on what I experienced today. Just a big NO from me.

reviews.author: Ms. Chew B.
reviews.description: This place is a delight. We came on Halloween evening after an adventurous weekend. Charming neighborhood and SUCH a beautiful building. We got a little lost exiting after dinner, and ended up inadvertently exploring the various dining areas. It's really impressive and spacious and each room is interesting with its own style. It's startlingly cool - but do I belong here? Do you? We both do! How? It's welcoming in addition to the impressive physical environment. Really lovely staff. FANTASTIC music. Somebody's got exquisite taste in there. I was frustrated for a millisecond when a table of empty-nesters sat down nearby and their chatter drowned out the playlist, but then the eavesdropping was great too. So I'm going to go ahead and credit Liberty Bar with that portion of my experience as well: I appreciate the acoustics! - Perfect for fun conversation with your table companion OR listening in on another group of people trying not to insult their own children too much. Ach. Those children - they were so lazy... but had the biggest hearts!  So you don't care about this? What? Okay - the food: DELICIOUS. We had the fish taco appetizer, a salad with asparagus and portobello mushrooms, and a really, really fabulous lamb burger (medium: perfection). The fries were crispy-perfect. Oh yeah - some chocolate cake with ice cream for dessert. So good. I never get dessert at restaurants, but if you do or if you don't - consider getting it here.  We came to San Antonio for a little birthday / long-weekend getaway and had a blast. The Liberty Bar was one of the highlights. If I move[d] here, I'd want to find a place as close as possible to the Liberty Bar so I could become a regular. Good gawd, it's life-affirming.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: We were exploring King Williams area and the architecture of this building had drawn us in. The food here is just as unique as the building itself with a welcoming front patio. Dined in during the weekend on a cold evening. This place is much different than any restaurant I've been to in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Matt L.
reviews.description: Took the whole family for brunch. The service was friendly and the food was delicious.

reviews.author: Amy w.
reviews.description: Great sound track, music and dessert. Are at the bar on half price wine night. Really a great date night place. Can't wait to come back

reviews.author: Rebecca P.
reviews.description: Great place for a last minute brunch! We were actually in line for Guenther House, but couldn't wait two hours.  Instead, we decided to check out Liberty Bar.  There were seating availabilities and a staff to get us seated right away.  It did take a little extra time for us to get our drink orders in, but no complaints. Food came out in a timely manner compared to time to order and everything was delicious.  I recommend the eggs Benedict which comes with extra thin and crunchy fries that are my favorite!  Also, can't go wrong with the french toast that was soaked for 48 hours!  We felt like fatties, but well worth it.  I definitely recommend brunch here with the quiet ambience and great food.

reviews.author: Sheila M.
reviews.description: Nice atmosphere. Drinks were great. Food was awesome. We had excellent service   Quaint

reviews.author: P C.
reviews.description: Have been coming here for years-always a fabulous experience!  Food is always fresh-service always sharp! The cooks may very well be the hardest workers in the Convent-thank you for delighting us with your magic always! The Bloody Marys are my brunch staple always excellent-consistent! Have tried just about everything on the menu and never disappointed. Special shout out to Liberty Bar for their responsible behavior since the pandemic began-mask wearing requirements for patrons and staff. Nobody wants to wear a mask, but it's the right thing to do during a pandemic thank you. Way to keep people safe-classy operation!

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Great service and atmosphere. We went for Sunday brunch and started with perfect Bloody Marys. Loved the food as well.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Awesome Environment and very creative food. Watch the address close because it's not obvious this is the right location, as it looks like an old Convent which is exactly what it is. Painted bright pink concrete walls will greet you. Being a Sunday at late lunch only the upstairs was open but there is ample seating downstairs for busier times. Nice long bar with just about any kind of alcohol you can imagine and a very fun creative menu. Grab a book and sit down to read if you liked as there are plenty in book shelves on the walls. The only reason why I didn't rate it a perfect five was due to the service. It really wasn't very busy but we had a hard time finding our waiter when we needed him. He seemed to be tired and didn't make any suggestions about the menu or seemed excited to be there. Other than that it was a great experience and we definitely will be back.

reviews.author: Gary A.
reviews.description: Parking can be challenging, but the food here is excellent.  Steaks cooked to perfection and wonderful starter items. Great craft beers!!! The absence of their steak tartare and a ho-hum wine selection are its only pitfalls.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: Love this place. I'd make the trip even if I didn't live in the neighborhood. Consistent, great meals. Healthy salads. Decadent pastas. We even rented out the whole restaurant and hosted our wedding reception here and I'm so glad we did. The meal was fantastic. And the convent building is gorgeous!

reviews.author: Jamie S.
reviews.description: I had a great overall experience at the Liberty Bar. Currently, they are only offering outdoor dining but they have a great outdoor area with numerous tables, palm trees, and string lights which makes for a nice ambiance. While the service was a bit slow on a Saturday night, the waiters were friendly and kept us updated. We started with the bread assortment which must have had 4 or 5 different types of bread, all of which were good. I had the falafel sandwich as my main and it was a very large portion. I really enjoyed the dish and came with an option of a side salad or fries.

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: Where to eat on a busy Saturday night out during the peak in the pandemic? Outside! In the cold! We stumbled into Liberty Bar because we were specifically looking to eat in South Town and eat outside. Unfortunately for us, Liberty Bar's owner has refused to buy outdoor heating- we were told outdoor dining is only because of the pandemic. Well, we decided to eat and run- bad decision, here's why: the cost is exorbitant for the food!  My burger was small and the sourdough bun was greasy as hell. The side salad had a dressing that also tasted like oil. The good news was the plate suggested by the waiter- beef tips, was a hit. Our margaritas had tequila but were served in super small glasses. I was floored by the cost of our meal- 90 dollars. Bank robbery for the food- with the cost so high... buy a few outdoor heaters! Two stars for the amazing waitstaff but the food, atmosphere and price results in  'Stay Away!!'

reviews.author: Ashley A.
reviews.description: I have always loved the vibes at liberty bar. Such a fun spot in Southtown, picture worthy!   They are currently open during COVID with outside seating only. It seems as though they are still figuring that all out. We went over this past weekend and got on the waitlist but their systems are off as they don't seem to have a host/hostess and their waitstaff are left to figure out who gets seated, when and where. Of course, we will always be patient with wait staff these days as they are figuring out how to work in this new environment.   There drinks are phenomenal, we got the mimosas and bloody Maria's. I highly recommend the bloody Maria's!

reviews.author: Erika P.
reviews.description: I've never been here without having to wait over 40minutes, BUT I do enjoy the food and atmosphere. I've also only ever been here during brunch. Who knows what it's like in the evening. You'll have a tasty brunch, a decent coffee, and a nice environment.

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: Enjoying first Friday and we walked right up to Liberty Bar. Building is incredible. Used to be a nun's convent. Walk upstairs and hang at the bar. Kick back and chat or watch the guys knock it out in the open kitchen. Josh was our tender of the bar. He is outstanding!! Very knowledgeable and friendly. He recommended several things and was spot on. More people like Josh please, straight forward and makes it simple. Great place to stop in for a quick bite and a drink. The pizza is solid btw.

reviews.author: Rio V.
reviews.description: Went there for a few drinks and apps on a Thursday. There was a small wait.  I was kinda disappointed with the service. The sign says to sit yourself and when we did, a waiter made us get up for a couple. We ended up getting shoved into a small table for our party.   The drinks were decent price and heavy poured which was ok for the setting.  Garlic aioli was lacking flavor and the kale chips were disappointing. It was the consistency of smashed and broken up kale.   Wouldn't recommend for apps. Better places nearby to get drinks if you want food too.

reviews.author: Amber T.
reviews.description: Some out of town friends and I were going down S Alamo stopping for drinks at each place that looked interesting.  We were drawn in by the "bar" part.  Not a bar, in fact, it's a restaurant.  Took an hour to get our drinks, my guests were not impressed.  Beautiful historic building though.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: I am furious right now and deeply upset that I wasted gas to drive here and $100 on what is one of the worst dining experiences of my life!!  Years ago we visited Liberty Bar and always loved it so to celebrate my new job we decided to revisit this place but it was a poor decision!!  Service was ABYSMAL!!! 10 minutes to even get acknowledged, had to ask for silverware and never did get a glass for my beer! My husband just pounded his water and gave me his glass!  We began with the roast garlic and bread and that was good, just as I remembered it!! The kale chips were okay - a little greasy and in need of salt. The mains were bad. My daughter got a grilled cheese which was just solid chucks of unmelted cheese - if the waitress had bothered to come anywhere near our table I would have sent it back! The fries were overcooked and my husbands lamb burger was certainly not medium.  We had always liked the Geranium cream so ordered that for dessert - it was HORRIBLE!! I told my husband we should send it back but for some reason he appeared to like it! It was warm which is not good for a dairy item and just appeared to be a stodgy mass of cream cheese with a hint of flavor!!  Add lukewarm beer, warm to the touch root beer and the fact that we sat the entire  meal with empty appetizer plates on our table - we were not offered drink refills until the end when clearly she did not really want to get drinks as she already had the receipt in her hand !  I feel sick from the one bite of the nasty warm dessert right now and sick to my stomach that I wasted money and gas to drive to this meal! A quick peak at my Yelp will show that I mostly give out 4/5 stars.... so yes it was that bad!! Will not return!

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: Went for brunch on Saturday. Attentive and genial service from Alejandro.   As a matter of fact, all the employees were so friendly and welcoming.   The manager Craig replied to my yelp question about parking within minutes. That responsiveness is very rare and was a strong show of hospitality that made us decide to come.  Parking is on the side of building, and also on the gravel across the street.  I have to say there was alot that I instantly loved and that is original. The venue and vibe, for example, is uptown casual, a mixed crowd but a good helping of the smart set. The staff keeps it comfy so you can come as you are.   I had the omelette luego. It had zuchinni, onions, tomato, and gruyere. They cook the egg then fold it around the veggies. I prefer my omelette integrated but it was still good. I opted for no black beans, and requested double "ranchero" potatoes.  The sourdough toast with apricot marmelaide was a nice compliment!  The "ranchero" potatoes are sort of saucy or stewey, not roasted. I did not like. However, my companion, who ordered the "simple breakfast," eggs, sausage, potatoes, and toast, traded me. I ate his roasted taters and he ate my saucy ones. So it worked out!  We shared a thick slice of French toast for "dessert." It was delicious!  When Alejandro mentioned that all the breads and desserts were made in house, I wanted more. So I ordered a slice of apple pie and coconut pineapple cake to go.   I haven't eaten them yet but they look so delicious and based on today's experience I know they are!

reviews.author: KATE T.
reviews.description: November 2021 UPDATE: New owners and the place is great!  Happy Hour 3-7 every day - $4 beers and other drink specials.  Super clean and nice.   So glad to be able to put Claude Hoppers back into our rotation.

reviews.author: Cynthia C.
reviews.description: The place is small and intimate inside with a nice open patio outside. The atmosphere and its patrons were very chill and fun. People were laughing and enjoying each others company. There aren't servers so you have to go to the bar to order food and drinks. The menu is small for food (bar food) but there was a wealth of beers on tap. Bonus: two different types of Yuengling but no Black and Tan. Texas may have to wait a while longer for that one to get here.   The female bartender was a little (a lot) lost. Each time I said an item I wanted she said, "is that it?" which made me think that she wasn't taught the art up upselling yet but that's another story. I ordered food and my drink and then my husband ordered his food and drink. He offered a card and she said she "didn't think she needed that" but then put our order as to-go. ??? We went back to our table and realized that other tables had table tents so I went back and asked if I needed a number and they were like, oh yea! How about this number? And handed me a table tent. We waited about 40 minutes for wings and meatballs.   The Yuengling on tap - not warm but not cold. Meh.  The wine - La Crema Pinot noir. I ask the female bartender if they had Pinot Noir and she said, "oh this?" with a very confused look on her face and showed me a bottle of Chardonnay. Um, no.   Anyway, our food was finally brought out. The wings had a decent flavor but they weren't hot and they were slimy and gummy. Yuck. He asked for blue cheese and he got ranch and one empty and dirty ramekin??? The meatballs were previously frozen, in my opinion, but weren't too bad. But they weren't hot either.  In the middle of waiting on our food, the female bartender came up and tried to had us a very watered down drink I had noticed at the bar when ordering twenty minutes prior. She asked if we ordered this drink and when we said no, she continued to ask around to find the right person.   The piece de resistance was our bill. Everything was of a normal price but my glass of wine...was TEN DOLLARS. La Crema normally sells for about 12-15 for a bottle. I get a mark up to make a profit, but dude. That's just rude.    This place truly has potential but they need to step it up a notch on hot food and maybe a once around from the bartender to check on patrons and to bus some tables. I say this because a gentleman next to us very jokingly but vocally said, "pardon me while I bus my table" as he went back and forth 3 times to empty his table of empty glasses and dishes from the people at his table.   On the pulse side, everyone was very cordial and had great attitudes.  Over all, I give it a 6.1.

reviews.author: Danielle K.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere, selection of drinks (huge variety of beers on draft and many cocktail selections too) and there's really fun karaoke on Thursdays! It's such good energy and the DJ is a real treat. If I lived here, I'd go every Thursday. It's a local, small place with a great vibe. Definitely worth checking out.

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: Claude hoppers has been on our list for a long time and we finally were able to check it out! They have an extensive list of draft beers/ciders including local options. They also have a full bar/shots/liquor. They have an awesome vibe with indoor and outdoor seating. We were there in a Friday night and they had live music playing. Bartenders were friendly, great drink options, amazing vibe, we will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: The place is teetering a 3/4 star.  Nice little bar with beer and liquor options. The owners make  dumplings which is the specialty for the spot. We've had various samplings of them and they are all delicious.   Suggestions- bathrooms could use a good cleaning and freshen up. Very high-end part of town the bathroom not in high standard could be a turnoff.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Heather K.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere - wonderful place to watch football games. The drinks are great (Strong) and the staff is really friendly.  Glad that it's under new ownership they have changed this place around drastically!!

reviews.author: Karin P.
reviews.description: My all women's volunteer organization hosted a fund raiser trivia night at this bar.  When I got there, I was worried we wouldn't have enough room or tables for the group, but we ended up being fine. It's a small place for a large group, but they were attentive and accommodating. There seemed to be a limited staff working (maybe 3?) but the service was good.   Food menu is small but has some good looking options. It's not on the overhead electronic screens (drinks only) but there are laminated menus around. And pictures posted on the business' Yelp page.  They also have a water cooler (like the kind you have at football games) so you can get water whenever you want.   This is a fun little bar in a strip of other businesses. It may get looked over but if you are in the area, it would be a good place to check out.   The fun: Lots of drink choices with a wide variety of IPAs. All 4 people at our table enjoyed what they had. The Purple Haze was a hit with another at our table. I enjoyed the Crackberry cider. It was a little more tart than I usualoy like, but I thought it was a decent cider. Also some canned and bottled beverages. Max was behind the bar for our event, and he was very friendly. He also handled our large group well.   The less than ideal: The electronic menu keeps changing what is shown on the screen. There are 2 screens. There are 2 pages for the drink menu. However, the part of the menu displayed on each screen changes when the circle at the bottom fills up. It's not really enough time to read everything on one screen before it changes and you have to try to find your place again on the other screen. And some of the drink listed online aren't on the screen (specifically the 1 of 2 tap ciders I saw online). Oh, and there is only 1 women's restroom.

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: My first "beer only" type of pub, and also my introduction to Geeks Who Drink Pub trivia. Claude Hoppers is pretty far out of my way but it's still a grand time when I get to go. They have a nice selection of beer, on par with your local Big Hops, and a mix of high and low seating, as well as a nice outdoor patio.  I had a first date here and when he went to the bathroom, the bartender was eavesdropping a bit and excitedly ran up to me to squeal, "Is this a first date!? He's SO hot, where did you find him!?" So that was pretty adorable.  Pub Trivia is always a blast here, too. It's hosted by Geeks Who Drink, whose format I absolutely love. Build up a team, have a pint, and spend an evening at Claude Hoppers!

reviews.author: Amanda G.
reviews.description: Kirsten was by far the most welcoming and nicest bartender. We enjoyed talking to her and learning about Claude Hoppers. The beer selection was good, they have some craft beer and hoping to get more. They have only been open for 3 weeks, we are excited to try this place again and highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Dave C.
reviews.description: Really nice place, with a great vibe. Cool owners. Right off Blanco road. Bartenders are awesome. Nice selection of beers.

reviews.author: Saban P.
reviews.description: Perfect place for the Craft beer lover. The dumplings are amazing. Go and enjoy some good beer and amazing dumplings aka Mo:Mo.

reviews.author: Piyush S.
reviews.description: I have been coming to this friendly bar that has great choice of draft beer and variety of food. Televises various sports and it was awesome to watch Super Bowl on the big screen with family and friends. Owned by a family, they continues to take customer input and have variety of beers, wine, shots and drink! Love to visit whenever I get a chance to relax! Highly recommend this place.

reviews.author: Tara H.
reviews.description: Went here the other day to grab some drinks. Overall, walking in the place has a cool vibe. They play primarily reggae music and have about 50 beers on tap that is listed on a screen with the price and alcohol percentage.   The downside of this place is their cleanliness, service, and beer knowledge. We went there and everyone ordered the Ballast Point Grunion Pale Ale. When we drank it though, we knew it wasn't the actual beer and the bartender insisted that it was. Lucky for us, we were with a Ballast Point distributor so he looked at the tap and confirmed that it in fact wasn't the beer we had requested.   The service was highly lacking. There was one lady working and maybe 10 at most people in the place. But it was fairly calm, yet she didn't walk around to ask us if we need more after our empty glasses sat there for over 15 minutes. As for cleanliness, the toilet paper and paper towels were empty in the restroom. Also, there was a pile of looks like swept up trash just sitting on the ground near a table. Sadly, I wish this place was better, but I don't see myself coming back.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: This is a diamond in the rough!   Prices are on point, better than comparable craft beer bars/growler filling stations in town.   I just moved from San Diego, and this place is awesome. If your into craft beer, you MUST check it out!   They have a small plate menu too! Great good, great beer and great prices!!

reviews.author: Jonathan G.
reviews.description: Decided to give this place a chance with the new ownership and shouldn't have. It took 20 minutes to get out first drink and were never asked again if we needed service. We left after waiting an additional hour. Dustin cared more about socializing with his friends at the bar than trying to help anyone. There were only 6 people here and I see why. Will not be returning.

reviews.author: Valerie P.
reviews.description: Just tried this place today and let me say I love it!!! New owners and staff. They now have a small menu , mostly snacks and liquor and the staff is awesome!!!! Everyone must try

reviews.author: Brian F.
reviews.description: Before I dig into this review, I'd like to say I've been to numerous growler stations and think I've developed a pretty good basis of comparison/ expectations.   This place is super far from San Antonio.  Okay I got that out the way.  There's plenty of parking and indoor/outdoor seating.  The outdoor patio is set up kind of like a beer garden, but there's no walk-up window service.  There is wait staff though, so that's cool.  Immediately I was impressed with the selection of beers.  Not sure how often they change them, but for a first timer it was a change for sure.  The indoor area has booths, high-tops, bar seating and a little cove in the back.  Liking that.  The staff was cool too.  The food is better than bar food.  I mean they offer humus and pulled pork tacos.  Whaaaaaat?!   Some things I really didn't care for were no  1/2 pours, flights and condiment taster cups.  If I'm willing to commit to paying a little extra for craft beer, then I'm definitely not okay with plastic taster cups.  Every other craft beer spot offers glass tasters.   I understand they offer flights now, since my visit about 3 weeks ago.  Pros: Beer selection FOOD (Most growler spots don't have food) Parking Growler prices Drink growlers on premises   Cons: No Flights No  1/2 pours (must commit to full 16oz) Distance Plastic taster cups No designated tap handles

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: So, I was able to score a Groupon for this particular place awhile back and wanted to get a really good deal on a growler fill. First off could this place be any further from the city?!! It was like I could see the Eiffel Tower on the next block! Secondly I was anticipating a much bigger space, as all the pictures I saw of it gave me that impression. However, what I've learned as I Yelp is that the disparity between perception and actual experience can be great.  As you enter here a really cool iron fence with ornate lighting opens up the patio, with ample seating and tables to match. By comparison the taproom is relatively small. The interior itself is both sleek and cozy. A small bar area with a few high chairs/ tables gives me the impression the intent of the owner was to create an intimate experience. In contrast it is a refreshing departure from the noise and bustle of other tap rooms. But then again there are people that gravitate toward a busy, crowded bar.  The growler/tap station itself is a small counter space with a healthy beer selection alongside a wall. In addition a small screen displays beers by name, price and alcohol content. Since this location is in Stone Oak prices are in fitting with this area. For example a simple pour of the Real Ale's, "Mysterium Verum Kraken" a rare tap, will set you back $12. Definitely expect to pay a little more than the typical taproom you might frequent, if you choose to come here.  In terms of service the tapmaster was very professional. I like how she moved from patron to patron, able to take orders and fill pours. She knew customers on a first name basis but more importantly knew their drink of choice; which speaks volumes of this establishment. In my tattered slip-on Vans I collected my growler of Karbach's "Krunkin Pumkin" and headed on out.   My only critiques of this spot would be I wish they would post on their page the prices for their beers. And the distance. If this was in the Deco District area I would probably hit this place up more frequently. Still Claude Hopper's is a really cool tap/growler station with a sleek layout. The vibe is laid back, the beer selection is good, the patio is perfect for conversation and the service is excellent. And I think a Friday night after work is the optimal time to get "Krunkin!"

reviews.author: Bob G.
reviews.description: This is an awesome place for great beer. The staff is awesome (Zach). The beer is cold and the taps are clean   The patio area is dog friendly. We sat and vaped with our dogs for a few hours. It's kind of off the beaten path but if you want good cold micro beer head here for a couple of pints!

reviews.author: Rip P.
reviews.description: Great place with a large selection of craft brews.  Bartenders are super friendly especially Caitlin she's awesome!

name: Vine in the Village
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: This is the perfect place to relax and gather with other grownups.  To the person who complained about not being able to bring her 18 year old, there are signs everywhere that state that.  Why leave a bad review for that?  Take your 18 year old to Hooters.  This is a wonderfully run business as evidenced by all the great reviews.

reviews.author: Gary B.
reviews.description: This place just keeps getting better and better. There wine selection is fantastic The food menu  is very good and unique. It reminds you of  "Cheers" where everyone knows your name and you are warmly greeted at the door. A great place to kick back and enjoy your wonderful wine with friends.

reviews.author: Helen F.
reviews.description: Oh my, Dana has completely turned this place up twenty notches!! It's a great little "Cheers" like place.  We love going, great food, vino and music! Thank You Dana!!

reviews.author: Brandy G.
reviews.description: Cute little spot nestled in the heart of "downtown" Bulverde. It's very spacious spot with a vibe to suit everyone from a beer garden with a large screen tv, to a relaxing porch, bar seating, lounge area with couches, or a more traditional restaurant seating style area. If you happen to be there on a Friday or Saturday evening you'll be in luck for live music as well.  The wine menu is very extensive but I was little bummed to see they only offer wine flights during the week and not the weekend :( . We had several different waitresses checking on our table and unfortunately none were very well versed In wine recommendations so be advised that you may have to just choose blindly and hope for the best.   No wine drinking outing is complete without having a variety of meats and cheeses to accompany your beverage so my friend and I split the meat and cheese board. Their is a short menu of reasonably priced tapas and pizzas that you can choose from as well. The waitress delivered the meat and cheese board with no explanation of what was on the board-so again just kind of jumped in blindly and figured it out as we went.  All in all, I enjoyed a pleasant evening drinking wine on the porch of Wine 101 but I'm not sure I'd make the drive from San Antonio to Bulverde just to go this place alone. If you're already in the area it's worth stopping in for a glass or two.

reviews.author: Virginia A.
reviews.description: Great cozy atmosphere. Impressive wine list to pair with a tasteful array of tapas offerings. Had a lovely, relaxing evening listening to live music. What else could you ask for?

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: This place was amazing!  I cannot stress that enough.  I went on Tuesday and they had live music, which was great.  The musicians played amazingly well and even took requests.  Everyone was extremely friendly, even the patrons.  Our waitress recommended the Prosciutto and Tomato Pizza which was perfectly cooked.  They also had wine specials so be sure to ask.  This place was so amazing, I have definitely found a new favorite place. I did not even take pictures because I was having such a great time. Please check it out, you will not be sorry.

reviews.author: Brenda O.
reviews.description: Horrible.... son was with us, but had to leave because he wasn't even allowed on the premise under 21....18 years old, really???  Not even to sit outside!

reviews.author: Greg F.
reviews.description: Had a really nice time...simple menu but most seem to enjoy the wine/good beer on tap and the fellowship.

reviews.author: Annette L.
reviews.description: My friend and I were the first and second members of Wine 101 Bulverde.   We have seen it change hands many times over the years.  Each new owner has added to the place.  The rustic charm is addictive.  The taps have been a welcome addition for those that do not want to partake in wine.     The food is good for the small kitchen they have,but some healthy dishes would help.  Pizza is good and love the cheese trays.   Wine - love the selection for our area and the wine club.  Feels fun to belong somewhere and know a couple people.

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Vine in the Village has reopened to full (50%) service! This place has it all!!! Awesome rustic atmosphere nestled in the Village of Bulverde. Fantastic selection of food, wine, and beer. They will be bringing back the live music! They even have a wine club that you can join and become a true regular. You'll love their staff...everyone is fantastic!

reviews.author: Aja P.
reviews.description: Well if your team has to play Pieper Ranch, then I think this is a must stop before the game. :) it's 8 minutes away and it is absolutely adorable.  I wanted to sit everywhere! They have a fabulous bar, a cool chill biergarten, some covered patio tables (my choice), a living roomish area, and some nice tables in the back back that could be used for a restaurant area or a party or a tasting menu.  And lining the walls of the back room are the personalized glasses of the regular patrons.  I even saw some glasses with paper in them, which makes me think they leave each other notes (or free drinks). SO CUTE!   I ordered a fight of wine and the meat and cheese tray.  Let me start by saying that I love Cru. The flight was fine, but all tastings were the same vineyard.  None were particularly fantastic. The meat and cheese tray was HUGE, but... quantity over quality. Also, I have no idea if the selections were local or from the HEB, bc they didn't provide a card or any info about the choices.  This would be a great chance to pair with some local cheese or sausage makers (IMO) but none (except what I think may have been capicollo) were particularly amazing.  Not judging, but it seems more geared toward some "manly men" that come in with their gals, than a "wine" board.  I would definitely choose from their hot menu, when I return.  It was good. Just not fancy-pants.  (No stinky cheese! Lol). My bill was 45$ for the flight, the board and one more glass of wine.  I felt like that was a little high for the quality, but the experience (and quantity of food) made up for it. They def have some cheaper options (especially during happy hour) that I didn't take advantage of.  Everyone that worked there was super polite, I didn't ask many questions so idk if they were particularly knowledgeable, but they sure have a bunch of different wines!  Regardless of my criticisms, I really enjoyed myself, and my experience and I would absolutely return when I'm in the area again.

reviews.author: Sara C.
reviews.description: I came here with my mom for a girl's night. We each ordered a glass of wine and decided to split the cheese and meat plate. The wines were pretty good and the cheese plate was huge. It had several different types of cheese, each of which came in several chunks. While we did enjoy the amount of food, we thought slight improvements could be made. The plate came with hummus, pita, and crackers. There was a ton of pita for the hummus, but only a few crackers for a ton of cheese. It would have been better if the ratios were switched.   The staff was friendly and they have several rooms for indoor and outdoor seating. I would definitely recommend this spot of a date night or girl's night, especially when the weather is nice.

reviews.author: Matthew J.
reviews.description: The absolute best wine bar around. The owner makes sure every customer is greeted and that their needs are met. A great environment and ambiance. Been going there 2 years.  Love it!

reviews.author: Belinda C.
