reviews.description: Nice wine selection and very cozy inside.   I look forward to returning to try out more of their wine selections!  The owner was there and seemed very friendly. He knew many of patrons that were obviously regulars.

reviews.author: Helen J.
reviews.description: It has a new owner and new name. Dana is awesome and doing some really fun things with the business.  It is now Vine in the Village .. She is having different musicians throughout the week. Thursday is Jazz night!  Can't wait!

reviews.author: Terri E.
reviews.description: My friend/neighbor and I stopped in last Saturday to check out this place. It it located right in downtown Bulverde very close to where we live. What a little Gem. The wine bar is in a old house that was built sometime in the early 1900's, very rustic and quaint.   We walked into the bar area and were greeted by friendly staff. We told them it was our first time there. We were told to look around and sit anywhere we liked. My friend and I sat in the back part of the house where they had comfortable couches and tables here and there and the walls were lined with hundreds of different kinds of wine. Our waitress was awesome very knowledgeable about the wine. Lucky for us it was happy hour. Happy hour is 4pm to 6:30 daily. Choice wines are $5.00 per glass.   They also serve tapas , appetizers and their version of pizza. We tried their meat and cheese board and their chocolate truffles. Great food to drink with while sipping wine and chatting.   I will definitely be back to try other wines and bring back some of our friends and neighbors. Would highly recommend checking it out, get there early so you can get a good spot to sit, chat and drink wine.

reviews.author: Jemma A.
reviews.description: Yeah its a nice local place to hang out! Or if you wanna visit the hill country its a sweet place for a quick bite and a drink. The food is good...it goes with the wine. Order the Cheese Dip it taste great. The pizza crust are thin for you diet people. They have stuff for Vegans. There is meat and cheese boards. A HUGE selection of wine that I got tired of counting. If your driving the hill country...stop by and sit on their porch. They have live music on fridays!

reviews.author: Ernest C.
reviews.description: This place is super cool. Laid back place to hang out away from the city box hang outs. It's like your in a cozy house party with friends. Owner is cool. Food and staff are great. I think I will join the club. Oh by the way wine prices are excellent and there's beer!!!

reviews.author: Brian M.
reviews.description: If I could give more that 5 stars I would!  We love this place.  Great wine, atmosphere, food service and prices.  A true gem.  Highly recommend!!!

reviews.author: Shawn G.
reviews.description: This is a little hidden gem up in Bulverde.  The owner is amazing and always so welcoming, happy to see everyone, and always knows your name.  This type of service is nonexistent anymore.   They have an amazing wine selection, but the secret here is the Wine Club.  For $50 per month, you get your choice ow 2 white, 2 red, of 1 of each, along with a storage cubby to hold your bottles in (can't always make it out here every month), and 2 personal engraved wine glasses.  They charge your card around the 1 week of each month, put your bottles in your own personal cubby, and you walk in, grab your choice, and they open it and pour it.  It's almost like drinking for free! Not really, it's more like pre-paying for your drinking, but still...  They have a small menu, flatbread pizza, wings, etc... The food is good, but you are really here for the wine so grab your bottle and enjoy.

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: This in my opinion was one of the better meals I have had in a long time. We were a large party of 8 and all had different meals. They were all so unique and different packed full of flavor and fun. Our waitress Carson was extra sweet and seemed to make it a priority to make great small talk.   I had the Diablo burger and paid extra for a premium side. They make their own tater tots and they were filled with jalapeÃ±os, cheddar cheese and cream cheese. They had a little extra crunch to them but were like nothing I had before.   We shared the apple pie cheesecake which was also good. I would not call it great and a must have but I also think that is because I may have overeaten my meal because it was so divine.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Their website says:  "The health and safety of our customers and staff is our number one priority. That's why we are continuing to take precautionary measures to ensure proper sanitization and minimal contact for all your orders."  Given this statement it seemed odd that no one in the place (except for me) was wearing masks, and the tables weren't spaced far apart. I would be very uncomfortable dining in here. But my order was for pickup.   I ordered a Caesar salad. The online menu says there's a balsamic reduction, but it was nowhere to be found. That's unfortunate. The salad was a decent size. The dressing was good. It seemed like it was yogurt based. It needed something. Maybe more garlic, or some salt.  The Parmesan crisps were a nice touch, and weren't mentioned on the menu, so maybe they took the place of the balsamic reduction. It's a fair trade off.   I'm on a low fat diet due to some recent health issues, so I think the rest of their menu is off limits for me.

reviews.author: Jen L.
reviews.description: Just Yum. This place has it all. Great service, amazing food, wonderful ambience, the whole package!  Looking forward to my next visit. Our bartender, Fred, was the best!

reviews.author: Tracy S.
reviews.description: This is my favorite restaurant in New Braunfels! Everything I've had is amazing! The craft beers are awesome and their Mucks Cow Mule is my go to cocktail. I ordered the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and Buffalo Herd Tater Tots...so good!!! Highly recommend this restaurant.

reviews.author: Ruben R.
reviews.description: Price: 15+  Taste: amazing!  Recommend: yes try it out!  Experience: this place was really good! They definitely have different things that make you explore and try new things! I was iffy with my Diablo burger but man it was the best combination of sweet, spicy, and meaty! The chips with queso was ok, the chips were a little stale and queso was clumpy. The service was amazing, friendly, and swift. Everyone was happy to help and knew their menus pretty well. Our server was also very experienced when it came to draft and crafted beers along with spirits and fund drinks! I would most definitely come back! My mouth is watering just thinking about this place

reviews.author: Dan G.
reviews.description: Fun and Funky Restaurant we went to celebrate our anniversary. There menu was cool and creative and food was seasoned and cooked well. Wait staff was friendly and efficient.   We stopped here on our way up to Austin to celebrate our anniversary. I went with the Mexican Street Food Burger, I think that was the name? â€ Anyways it was a burger that had a bunch of things on it including Mexican Street Corn. It came with fries which I upgraded to Poutine Fries because why wouldn't I on our anniversary it's time to celebrate. Wifey got Shrimp Tacos with pickled onions on top and I believe some kind of Asian style seasoning. Her meal came with fries as well which she said were good but once she tried my poutine fries she quickly wished she upgraded. We shared my fries because hey it was our anniversary and I'm a nice guy (sometimes).   Overall a good dinning experience. Would reccomend and would return.

reviews.author: Katrice J.
reviews.description: Fabulous food...nice atmosphere.. we enjoyed our time here, relaxing and the burgers were awesome.

reviews.author: Lauren R.
reviews.description: Stopped by tonight because I saw the Spicy Juicy Lucy listed as one of the best burgers in San Antonio/New Braunfels. Arrived right at five and seated very quickly on the cute patio. Service was quick, and my mouthwatering burger arrived promptly. Definitely lived up to the hype, stuffed with creamy pimiento cheese and stacked high with all the good, non-healthy stuff. Just the right amount of spice too, more about flavor than intense heat. I devoured it quickly because the bun could barely hold it all and I just couldn't resist. So tasty.  Also, the service here was so amazing. My sweet waitress came out to tell me they were fixing my order to get me the sweet potato fries I ordered instead of regular fries. I hadn't even noticed the mistake! I ended up with both sets of fries, and then they didn't charge me for either to make up for their mistake. Superb customer service that sealed the deal for me. Going to recommend this place highly to everyone I know. Hoping to try another burger here soon!

reviews.author: Joe T.
reviews.description: We drove by on the way to floating the Comal River and the whole time on the water I was thinking about this spot. Wait was about 15 min for a table for 2. The burgers were awesome. One had pepper jelly, the other with bacon jam.  Service was great. On top of all that, they had live music by Clifton De Leon. He was solid. Played a bunch of country cover songs.

reviews.author: Jelexus M.
reviews.description: Okay so, bring that I used to work here this may be a tinsy bit bias. Nevertheless I'm sure my other reviews can vouch for it. THE BURGERS HERE ARE ABSOLUTELY FANTASTIC!! The fresh baked buns from the bakery around the corner. Everything is made in house and it's so fresh. They have a HUGE selection of beer as well.  MUST TRY: JALAPEÃ‘O CHEDDAR TATOR TOTES

reviews.author: Kortney K.
reviews.description: I ordered the Scape Goat burger with loaded fries.  Overall-it was pretty yummy! My only complaint, I feel like the patty itself should've been thicker. At one point I was just eating cheese and bun. The jelly is pretty sweet but pairs nicely with the goat cheese. My server Paige was friendly and attentive.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: Was out touring the area looking for a new home (relocating from San Antonio). All I can say is I will narrow my search to live close to this restaurant!    Fantastic place located right downtown. Walking distance from a local hotel. The beer selection would impress a cicerone (certified beer expert). The portions were huge and the staff was great. Gorgeous decor with an indoor and outdoor option.   Fred was our bartender and he was awesome. Great personality too.   I can't attach any pictures because I ate all the food!

reviews.author: Nanette R.
reviews.description: So my Husband heard about this place from a coworker. He warned us there might be a wait to be seated. It look busy but we got a table right away. The decor is nice and they have an outdoor patio area also. I opted to get one of there signature drinks the Muck cow mule and it was delightful and refreshing.  We both had burgers and I had a loaded fry. Both where fresh and flavorful. My Husband loves a good burger and can't wait to go back.

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: Excellent service and loved the vibe here! Friendly and attentive staff; large draught beer selection; happy hour on M-F from 3-6. Great outdoor space, but it was thunderstorming while we were there.   $17 for a burger and fries is pretty steep though. I got the Scape Goat and the thin beef patty didn't even come close to covering the bottom bun. Disappointing for a burger at that price point. It was flavorful though. Parmesan aioli fries were an up charge; they were pretty delicious.   Basic cheeseburger was deliciously messy and the side salad was beautiful!   We tried the Muck Mule, Peach Sangria, and I had a sample of the Flamingo Fruit beer. All were very good.   Give this New Braunfels gem a try when you're visiting or just passing through!

reviews.author: Caitlin W.
reviews.description: We came here for our anniversary and had a great time. The food was delicious! We got onion rings, the Scape Goat burger, Sweet potato fries, Road Crossing tacos, and loaded fries. We enjoyed them all! It was a neat place, too. Our server was Gus and he was the best server we have had in years.

reviews.author: Asma S.
reviews.description: Best burgers ever! I was kind of hesitant about eating out here as I'm not from the area but I would come right back here the next time I have a chance. The wait was kind of nuts but you are welcome to walk on over to the bar and find some outdoor seating while you wait for a table. It did rain all over us because they don't have a legit cover for outdoor seats but all of that was forgotten when the food came out.   Their fried green tomatoes and onion rings are phenomenal. The burgers were HUGE and they did not shy away from any toppings or condiments. One of our burgers came with an entire bowl of queso to dip or pour. I got a burg with jalapenos and it was so spicy, I had to take some off lol. Delicious meal and very kind service.

reviews.author: Heather J.
reviews.description: Fabulous!  Amazing good food that feeds the weary sun soaked soul. After a day of Schlitterbahn we headed here for supper. It was SO very good! Every burger we ate was specialized and the buns and burgers seemed handcrafted! The Buffalo was watchful. There was outdoor and indoor seating available.  The waitress Kristin was super awesome and amazing and she gave super recommendations!  The menu had different options available. This is also very close to the main circle and river in New Braunfels. The wait can be long in the tourist season. The last day Schlitterbahn was open, we walked right in and got a table at about 645 pm, so it might be slowing down a bit so locals can stop by. We live in Converse and will be back!  We were so full and could not even try the amazing desserts!  Next time...

reviews.author: Kelly B.
reviews.description: What can I say about MandF?   The ambiance is hip yet comfy.  You can dine inside or out.   The restaurant is clean. The employees are nice and they're good at their jobs. It's close to the Comal river. Now, the food!  Muck and Fuss (don't say it too fast or you'll end up throwing an f-bomb) has SUCH good food!  They have a nice variety of dishes like; appetizers and gourmet burgers, sandwiches and tacos, "boozy shakes" or not boozy shakes, and cheesecake for dessert  (unless you want a cocktail for dessert).  Speaking of cocktails, their cocktails and craft beer are SO tasty (and strong) and will get you in trouble if you're not careful. The only complaint I have is the prices.  A couple can easily develop a $50 tab for lunch.  In south Texas, that's kinda pricey. The hub's and I have eaten at MandF a number of times and the meals are consistently yummy and the employees are consistently great.  We just don't eat there as much as we'd like because of the cost. Even with the high prices, I recommend Muck and Fuss!

reviews.author: Ashley P.
reviews.description: The only unpleasant part of dining here was finding a place to park on Memorial Day weekend. We were told we would have to wait an hour for a table of 5 but ended up waiting only 30 minutes or so. We were seated on the patio but had shade and a breeze, so it was pleasant until it threatened to rain, and the host very politely let us know and set a table for us inside. After we moved, it downpoured, so that was very thoughtful!  Our server was very sweet and attentive. We never had empty drinks, and our food was all delivered timely and was hot. I ordered the Scapegoat burger with a side salad. I shared some poutine with my sister. And we got some chips and queso for the table, which was delish. All the food was really good. The Scapegoat with its gooey and melty goat cheese paired with pepper jelly was excellent, great flavor. I should have tried the Asian slaw. The side salad and dressing were good (and fresh), but there isn't much to write about it. The poutine was amazing. It has a mushroom gravy, and my sister hates mushrooms, but she actually loved the poutine.   I didn't get any alcoholic beverages, but it did look like they had a good tap list and some fun cocktails. Note they have Maine Root sodas, so if you are a die-hard Coke or Pepsi lover, the soft drinks are a little different. Two members of my party didn't really care for them. The iced tea was good.   Overall, prices are fair, service is top notch, and the food is worth whatever long wait time they may have!

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great place for food and drinks. They offer cocktail and beer flights. They have a long list of beers to choose from. We tried both. The cocktail flight was perfect. It was a margarita, a mule, sangria and the prince solms sipper.  For food, I ordered the special of the week. It was a sandwich with pimento cheese stuffed fried avocado and a side salad. It truly was perfection. I did also try their Mac and cheese and it was super good. I guess I love cheese and everything I ate had it.  On a Sunday for brunch, it was busy, but we only waited about 20 minutes. We did get seated at the bar. It can get tight, but so worth it.   They have inside and outside seating.

reviews.author: Brad M.
reviews.description: Had a great cherry beer and some delicious focaccia. Pizza looked really good but we just stopped in for a quick drink and snack. The staff was friendly and all wearing masks, inside had social distance measures in place.

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: Definitely this is a spot to come visit when you want to hangout, lounge around, or pre-game before going to the brewery next door. Either way, this is a cool, low key joint. Best part is that they serve both wine AND coffee! They are the same company as Wicked Voodoo Coffee, and its super interesting that they have a wine and coffee bar. I love it! The concept and the place is so unique. They also have legit charcuterie boards. The staff here is also extremely sweet and nice. Great customer service, amazing ambience, and a great place to bring friends. They also have a private seating area if you wanted to reserve for a large party. If wine and coffee are your jam, this is a perfect place for you!

reviews.author: Lacey G.
reviews.description: Amazing must go to place!! Wish we had this back home! We ordered 4 coffee flights and not one disappointed!!! Cute vibe place!

reviews.author: David R.
reviews.description: Loved it!  Quite Thursday night with my wife.  Great wine and cuturie board.  Excellent staff and they have this amazing nitro coffee on tap!..

reviews.author: Anna B.
reviews.description: Super cute little place, coffee, wine and beer and charcuterie boards! All my favorites in one place. The caramel breve is delicious, the staff is friendly and the atmosphere is cute too. Definitely recommend you swing in and visit, hang out!

reviews.author: Allen B.
reviews.description: Popped in for 1st time.  Nice experience thanks to attentive staff.  New manager (didn't get her name) was super sweet and gave us full background I'm the establishment.   Wife had wine that she really liked so they got high marks for options.

reviews.author: Kevin B.
reviews.description: This place was an amazing experience. The German board was perfect for the palette. I really can't explain how detail oriented they are towards picking the right blend of foods that go so well with their wine offerings.  The bartender/host Stuart was AMAZING. She helped us navigate our flight of wines and has almost perfect recommendations.  I would come here everyday if I could. Being right next to I-35 makes it a short drive for me when commuting, and there was plenty of spots to park even though it was busy.

reviews.author: Jared B.
reviews.description: Charcuterie board, love it. Nice little place, great coffee, great charcuterie boards that go beyond the cheddar cheese and regular boards. The coffee was really good and service was spectacular.

reviews.author: Mike R.
reviews.description: We absolutely cannot say enough great things about this place... Laurel, the owner, is outgoing, very friendly, funny , and knows her wine.  Sheer delight! Then there is Melinda, who was primarily taking care of us.  She was subbing in from one of their drive-thru locations due to being short-staffed, and she was flat-out nails!  Great personality, extremely helpful, and just a lot of fun to talk with. My wife did have the munchies and ordered the bacon donuts, not really reading the description...obviously missing the 'mountain' in the title.  This is enough to feed Joey Chestnut...a huge pile of freshly made rings, topped with bacon and a sticky-sweet glaze...with a side of healthy fresh berries.  My wife has breakfast for the next few days. Great wine selection...coffee smelled great, but did not have any (got a bag of beans to go), and truly outstanding people... We will go out of our way to visit again, for these experiences, even in today's climate, are rare. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Michelle A.
reviews.description: This is a favorite spot to drop in for a quick glass and delicious cheese board. Highly recommend it!

reviews.author: Jacquelyn C.
reviews.description: What a wonderful hidden gem. We had the Italian Charcuterie board and it was fantastic! The blue cheese was perfect, as was everything else on our board. Our waitress suggested a few wines and let us try them before we purchased a bottle. The staff was incredibly attentive and friendly. We will definitely be back.

name: Southerleigh Haute South
accommodations: Valet Parking, Garage Parking, Street Parking

reviews.author: J E.
reviews.description: While in town for work, I came here for dinner on a Sunday evening and sat at the bar... The bartender, Cesar was great to chat with and offered some excellent suggestions for food and drink. He makes a really good Old Fashioned too! Their spicy fried Â¼ chicken was pretty good and came with a really nice and hot hot sauce! Their side of mac and cheese that came with it was really cheesy, gooey and yummy! There was also a huge amount that came with it! They have an interesting and large menu loaded with some pretty nice southern favs. I would definitely return!

reviews.author: Katelyn W.
reviews.description: This is based on brunch only.   Overall the food was ok. We could tell the biscuits were from a can and then tossed in a fryer and yet things from the fryer weren't even hot. We had a reservation for 10:15 but you didn't really need it. There were plenty of tables for brunch which should have been a hint. The coffee was very bitter, if you're into that then you'll like it. The appetizer, sausage corn pups or something like that came out really quick and luke warm. It seemed they were sitting there for a while. I probably won't come back for brunch.

reviews.author: Siobhain M.
reviews.description: 3 stars ONLY because of the customer service. If you don't mind not having the best service BUT want great food then def. pay a visit to this place! Not sure if tonight was an off night, but it seemed that they couldn't get orders correct and there was a lack of urgency for all of the patrons eating. There was a common trend of tables requesting for items that they ordered and flagging down waitstaff to be helped. I waited 48 minutes for my rotisserie chicken and side salad because the "ticket was lost". The table next me had parts of their order missing and I overheard them ask for their missing food as well.   Over all the food that we received was great.

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
reviews.description: Came here with girlfriends to celebrate friendships and girls night out!   This location is perfect as you get to enjoy dinner, drinks and a lot of entertainment around you or just sit and people watch.  Reservations were a breeze on open table and we were seated right on time.   What I - the menu, the prices, the choices, clean restaurant. The TVs at the bar and the patio seating just makes this a restaurant with a lot of potential to be a favorite.  Our food experience however was not the best. I think the branding dish here is the fried chicken and we all hit the spicy chicken. The girls added Mac and cheese and I chose the greens as a side. The honey biscuit was of course delicious as you can't go around with fried dipped in honey ...yummy!  The chicken was  nothing special at all. I was expecting this incredible memorable bite full of crunch and flavor...meh. Max wine dive restaurant chicken left me with this response not this place. I also wasn't spicy not very hot in temp.  The greens also were luke warm and loaded with bacon. I love the southern touch but I personally would ask for a little more green than meat. I'm glad I didn't get the Mac n cheese as this was not very creamy, hot or impressive either. Pretty much it was a lackluster eating experience.  I don't now how my gumbo went to terribly wrong but it did leading to 3 failed tries. All I asked for was gumbo (super hot) with no rice. 1st cup comes out borderline cold. 2nd cup comes out thick warmed up full of sticky rice. Last cup was what I presume kitchen making a quick roux and throwing in sausages and that's what I got. I gave up after this. The manager was available, attentive and at least listened to my issue and resolved my taking off the gumbo. But Southerleigh all I needed you to do was just warm up the first cup. Throw it in a sauce pot or microwave and heat it up. I would have been a happy customer. I really wanted to experience the gumbo.  Drinks were superbly made. At least we did enjoy this and had wonderful toast to the night.   Overall there is a lot of things to try on this menu to come back but in my two visits the Luke warm food is one of the biggest opportunities.

reviews.author: Lorena M.
reviews.description: Shared the rotisserie half bird: Delicious. Biscuits: also delicious. Fries were a mistake. They were cold and weren't worth it. Try a different side, hopefully it will live up to the reputation of the chicken.  Fishbowl cocktail was also a mistake. It was an intense amount of sugar. Struggled so hard to finish it. Honestly I would have left it there after a few sips, but I'm not a quitter. It would have been a better tasting drink if I had ordered it in a smaller size. Gluttony got me that afternoon.  The restaurant itself is very large.. Seems so small from the outside. Super clean. Friendly staff. They have both indoor and outdoor patio seating. TVs surrounded the bar, so no need to skip the sports games.

reviews.author: Jay B.
reviews.description: The Good: the appearance is Great...I love the look of this place.  The Bad: the Chicken and Shrimp gumbo WASN'T...there were NO SHRIMP and we got Chicken skin...if they relabeled it Sausage and Okra Gumbo then you would have something!!! We had to request our Honey Biscuits that were included with our meals...we asked the manager if the Biscuits were made from scratch and he said they are, but they look and taste suspiciously like the were popped from a can.  We both had the 1/4 Chicken w/ Fries...the Chicken didn't standout good or bad...the fries...naw  The Ugly: We noticed the couple behind us get up and leave because they were seated and forgotten...afterwards a Server walked by their table and saluted the table to "the Customers gone forever"!!!  This isn't a bad place, but I didn't have pleasurable dining experience and nothing to compel me back...I hope they tighten up because they have potential...just too many stumbles for me...Good Luck!!!

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: Our server was John out on the patio and he was really friendly and inviting; he had a great attitude and genuinely seemed like he was happy to be at work. It was our first time so he walked through the menu with us and explained how everything went. Our drinks and food came out extremely fast and was delicious.  Our food was super flavorful and we definitely walked away feeling stuffed.   We'll definitely be back again

reviews.author: Nikki W.
reviews.description: I had the chicken and donuts. The donuts were hard and tasted stale and the chicken tasted like it had been cooked an old grease. the sausage hush puppies had literally one small sliver of sausage and each hush puppy and was way too bready.

reviews.author: Kevin L.
reviews.description: My bf and I decided to check this place out.  I've eaten at the location at the Pearl and enjoyed the food.    I must say my first impression of this place was impressive, but it kind of went south after that.  To get someone to initially greet us and even bring us water was well over 10 minutes, which kind of started me off on the wrong foot.    Lets start out with the fried biscuits.  Um...for all the Hype, I really didn't find them all that good.  They are super greasy and really not that flavorful.  I suppose I could have had a bad batch, but I sure won't order them again.    My friend ordered the chicken fried sandwich which he really didn't care for.  Again not a lot of flavor and kind of greasy.  I had the gumbo which I thought was pretty tasty, and would be worth having again.    The service did get better, but I'm leaving a 3 because of what I ordered at this visit.  I have had their shrimp at their other locations and long with their wings which are all home runs!

reviews.author: Brianna M.
reviews.description: My husband and i went for brunch on Sunday. We sat down and the server didn't come to us for about 10/15 minutes, so we were a little skeptical. A server for a different section saw us and apologized profusely for someone not having come sooner. he got us completely set up and even sent the manager our way with a free dessert. He was so amazing and totally made up for the wait at the beginning. and the food.... UNBELIEVABLE!!!!!!!! The meals we got were SO delicious and we will definitely be returning.

reviews.author: christiana e.
reviews.description: First time going to this place and was not disappointed. The frozen mimosas was only 5 dollars of delicious(not certain on amount of alcohol). Definitely get the donut of the day? Donut of the week? As pictured it was worth it. So many seasoned fries! Lastly it was a good twist on the tradition eggs Benedict.

reviews.author: Patrick S.
reviews.description: The fam and I decided to go check this place out and I guess the circumstances was probably not the best seeing how there was a game that everybody wanted to watch and home wasn't good enough , the service was sub-par as they kept switching out waiters on us and people seemed to generally care less about what was going on as they kept dropping dishes and breaking glasses around us and then would hurry up to sweep around us to get back to watching the game. The food was pretty good though my burger was juicy and had great flavor with the pimento beer cheese. The fried Mac and cheese balls had great flavor and a good crunch along with some pretty good dipping sauces. The Mac and cheese on the other hand was lacking something in flavor maybe the bread crumbs from the fried Mac and cheese balls. Not sure if we will go back but only time will tell.

reviews.author: Olga B.
reviews.description: Had some errands at the Rim so decided to give this place a try. It had great reviews and I really wanted to like it.  We had the sausage corn pups, chicken'n donuts, and sausage egg bene, as well as mimosas and coffee. Unfortunately, we did not enjoy any of it.  Everything tasted greasy, dry, and tough...like it was pre-made and sitting under a heat lamp - hence the speed at which it came out only moments after we placed our order.  The service itself was great and the decor is super cute though, but the food was just not our cup of tea I guess.

reviews.author: Toby S.
reviews.description: I had an enjoyable time Saturday  night about 630  pm sitting at the bar alone with other friendly patrons! The  apologetic hostess said there was a 30 to 40 minute wait for a table. I was a 'walk-in' and don't even know if they take reservations ; by the time I left,  lots of people were waiting in a small area.  So you Might want to come at an ' off time'   The bartenders were attentive and friendly and obviously enjoyed their what they were doing.     I had a reasonably priced cocktail, watched the game and My food arrived : I had the 1/4 fried chicken , macaroni and cheese side with that big delicious honey biscuit : talk about comfort food !  ( and Bill under $17) I used my napkin as a bib and unashamedly sucked those bones clean  I'm no connoisseur and admit I have eaten Churches fried;  but this was all soo very tasty.     No place is perfect these days with all the pandemic issues . Being a single female , I'm often   " blown off" so I appreciate their  good service.     If you've never Been to that area before: HAVE to  use the  public parking : was a short walk as I was lucky enough to find a spot there at the uncovered lot: drive down the R side of the restaurant across from the apartments.    afterwards I walked around  being so full : a Beautiful sitting area with lights!  Enjoyed my leftovers this AM for breakfast; Would like to return for brunch.

reviews.author: Dylan M.
reviews.description: Came for Sunday brunch. Busy but not terribly so. Sat at the bar. Ordered the debris Benedict and chicken sandwich. Food took about 20 minutes to come out but was luke-warm at best. Overall the food did taste really good, but we just wished it was hot and fresh.   Poached eggs were cooked perfectly. Fries have great seasoning. House beers were really good too.   Willing to try again, hoping the temperature issue is a one off.

reviews.author: Nicole R.
reviews.description: My husband and I came here during lunch time. We've not tried this place and found we were late to order from the brunch menu. We found the food to be good. I ordered a Bloody Mary which I thought was perfect flavoring! I wasn't to get the bigger one with the topping but was told they only make that one for brunch.  The service was good. We'd love to come back, hopefully for brunch next time!

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: I thought the service and food was good but it was not amazing enough that I would likely go back.   The french fries were super good and the best thing going for the meal. I had the fried chicken meal. The chicken was okay. I was expecting more pop. The sweet/chili dipping saw was a great addition to the meal. My wife liked the biscuit but it was a little too sweet for me.  My wife got the meat pie and mac'n'cheese. The meat pie was something different and all sorts of southern comfort.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: So, I wasn't expecting to love their food so much, but I did. I do have to admit, we ordered everything fried, but it was all super flavorful and the portions were humongous.   Seating was easy on a weekend night,  but I expect this is due to the weather and the pandemic.   We started with drinks. I had the punch rouge. It was like a sangria with a dry wine. I liked it. I also tried the hurricane. Tasted just like I expected.   For my meal, I ordered the gulf coast seafood basket. It came with two sides. I chose the Mac and cheese and coleslaw. It was all perfect and just so much. I was able to take half home and enjoy it the next day. The breading on all the seafood was perfect. Tasty and crispy. I love hush puppies and theirs were super yummy. The Mac and cheese was super cheesy. That's not a bad thing. I did try one of their fried biscuits. They should really be called donuts. :-) It really made for a good dessert. They weren't super sweet, but they did have a hint of it.   I didn't try the chicken, but my table companions did and were impressed.   The only issue we had was the time it took for the food to come out. It seemed like forever.   Parking is available on site, but shared with the other businesses.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: @southerleighhautesouth is a must when looking for delicious food in a sleek, modern, casual setting in @therimsa area.   Southern comfort food is the cuisine, and it's done to perfection as the fried chicken is juicy and coated in a crunchy breading and the fresh tasting seafood (fish, shrimp, and oysters) is coated in a fantastic cornbread crust.   The mac n cheese and honey coated biscuits alone are worthy of a visit!

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: What can you add to a place with awesome fried chicken and Mac n cheese?? Well..... Be certain to ask for some honey to go with your fried biscuit! The Makers Mark old fashioned was so good, I got up and complimented the Barman! The Mac n cheese was almost as good as my wife makes! Having Maddie taking care of us was  essential-ask for her! Enjoy some great Southern comfort food in a pleasant environment

name: Spoiled Palate Culinary and Craft Brewery Tours

reviews.author: Asa M.
reviews.description: I think it's hard to dislike any food tour, even if the food is OK, and not that special.  I think they have kind of a "built-in" advantage over other types of tours for that reason.   I'm speaking from experience as we've taken one now each place we travel to (if they have one) for the last 6 years, which is when it seems many good ones began to get started (US).  I noticed the reviews so far are all from people in San Antonio. Nothing wrong with that - I live here too.  However, none mention having taken other food tours they've taken so as to compare it.  When you do, I find this tour a bit pricey and not balanced. I know it's a about the food for the most part and was the main reason we took it despite the cost.  Yet, I was hoping for a true overall cultural experience like the best food tours we've done.  That way you walk away satisfied gastronomically but also feel like you'd received a real "taste" of the city's culture you're visiting while allow your palate to rest while "digesting" things other than food.  As I stated above, most food tours get good reviews, so I believe this is what helps separate the stand-outs from the average.

reviews.author: a d.
reviews.description: We had an incredible time on this culinary adventure. It is such a great idea for tourists that do not  have enough time to try all the hot spots or for locals that want to try something different. Our guide was knowledgable about the places we went and the ingredients used in our food. We had a food and beverage sampling at several popular restaurants. Every place we went had our table ready for us and hot food out within minutes. I am a vegetarian and each place had something for me. At the end of the evening  we were stuffed. The next day we made reservations to return to our favorite place on the tour (Bliss). If you are visiting San Antonio this tour should not be missed.

reviews.author: Alex B.
reviews.description: The brewery tour was a smashing success. Great choice of beers, informative brewery tours, knowledgeable and more importantly fun tour guides made it such a fun afternoon. Btw the pretzel necklaces were a nice touch and welcomed snack!!!

name: VFW Post 76
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Greg A.
reviews.description: Beautiful building and welcoming staff. Beer was cheap and had live music midweek. Large space with Plenty of outdoor tables. Support this VFW location to make sure it continues for future generations who served.

reviews.author: Justine R.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a couple drinks with a friend. Unfortunately we couldn't stay long because honestly there was a wafting sewage smell that left you gagging. I have no idea what this was about but I couldn't handle more than 30 minutes.

reviews.author: Kayla P.
reviews.description: Thank you for keeping Post 76 live and well. I met various members of the Chapter and you can tell how much pride and joy they have for their Country and what they do

reviews.author: Steven R.
reviews.description: This is a really nice place to come by and enjoy yourself. The VFW is one of the oldest standing buildings. It is close to Broadway with lots  of neighboring bars. Thry offer parking but if not available have street parking as well. They have cheap drinks along with great food. Turkey legs and street tacos, yum. They do have live bands that come and play and it is easily accessible through the river walk. The staff and people were all friendly.  Had a great time.

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Was walking on the Riverwalk and decided to stop by the VFW. Nice area where we picked up one drinks and chilled outside. Friendly staff and quick. Everyone was having fun, just a nice spot to stop at.

reviews.author: PJ C.
reviews.description: Perhaps I set my expectations too high given all of the rave reviews.  It is a divey place right on the Riverwalk north of downtown and the beer prices are cheap but it wasn't as funky or cool as I had hoped.  They were holding their Halloween party so some of the patrons were in costume which added to the "atmosphere".  The band had one of the worst sound systems I have ever heard - it makes those PA systems on subway systems sound clear.  Overall it is worth the trip out here but not sure it is the five star experience that many claim.

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: Cheap beer... Yes! ... Always cheap beer at VFWs!   Well maybe they don't have the cheapest beer here as this is a little more of a tourist stop being right on the River Walk Museum Reach... but you do get a discount if you are a VFW member, which I am a Lifetimer thanks to my mother signing me up while she was actively involved with the original VFW at Canyon Lake in Satller.  Post 76 is open to the general public and they welcome everyone with a smile... just note, many VFWs are member only posts just to serve our Veterans of Foreign Wars. Please thank them for their service. Freedom is not Free! This post host several events during the year, including Fiesta San Antonio, so keep your eyes and ears open for something in the future. It does get crowed during events tho so just a warning They have a big band stand and beer garden outside along the river. It's really cool place to just hang out. I like it a whole lot better when it's a slow regular night.   VFW Post 76 is the oldest post in Texas, chartered June 26, 1917, by veterans of the Spanish American War. In 1946, They moved their post to this beautiful Victorian house located on the banks of the San Antonio River... and just in this past decade, the River Walk was expanded to what is now known as Museum Reach which makes this such an amazing location.   According to their website: "There are rumors of two ghosts, which also adds to the houses mystic. Members attest to seeing a girl running up and down the stairs and an old man who likes to move furniture. They both share the name of "Charley"."  This is a MUST DO when seeing Puro San Antonio!

reviews.author: Jay B.
reviews.description: The sign outside says it's The Oldest VFW in Texas.  Not sure about that but it is one of the best and largest.  I think it was an old plantation house.  Multi-level with a large patio for entertainment complete with a stage.  Separate room next to the main house for ceremonies and private parties.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Oldest Post in Texas! Open to the public, and they have scheduled concerts on the property.   Suggestions-Bring cash  Moose Out

reviews.author: Jennifer L.
reviews.description: The history alone makes this a great stop in San Antonio adventures, however it's location on the Riverwalk takes this VFW to the next level. My husband and I are both lifetime members and self professed VFW experts. This-location is open to the public. We came by early on a Saturday afternoon with our kids. Drinks are SO cheap. They have karaoke and snacks but no food. Members were friendly which isn't always the case at lots of VFWs unfortunately. My husband is a seasoned combat Veteran from OIF and still has felt unwelcomed at several backwards locations which didn't seem to enjoy or welcome members under 50. I'm female so I rarely feel welcome at Veterans nonprofits. This one was different.  Texas seems to treat female Veterans pretty well. Seems to be cultural. We loved the history and canal view. The yard outside was packed with tourists. We were inside because Texas is HOT! I think they have fun events and concerts here. Too bad they didn't have food though. My kids will enjoy the big yard when weathers better. They have free concerts outside on the weekends.

reviews.author: Rosamaria E.
reviews.description: This is just a great place to come and hang out.  Located right off the Riverwalk, this VFW is one of San Antonio's historical landmarks and is the oldest in Texas!!  It's huge and has a lot of great people that are regulars.  Yes, it is for veterans but it is open to the general public.  With that said, drink prices do vary for general public vs if you are active duty or a member.  Some days there are live music which is pretty cool because they perform outside.  Some days they have food for sale..  that may be tacos or something.  I can say, there have been plenty times we have been able to come and just hang out...  for hours... sit and laugh with friends, watch a game or come and dance.  It is on our must hit spots when we are out and about in the beautiful Alamo City..

reviews.author: Jennifer H.
reviews.description: This place has become a home away from home for this veteran's girlfriend.   The Post is open to anyone, but there is a special kinship between the veterans here. The truth is veterans have lived a certain life that people outside the military simply don't understand. This is the perfect place for them to find the support and camaraderie they often need after they get out.  That being said, not being a veteran myself I love this place. It's often calm with good music on the jukebox, and friendly regulars and members. And did I mention the beer is CHEAP?  They often have events going on with live music, and they are right along a part of the Riverwalk.   If you haven't been here yet it is definitely worth checking out!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: At this point there is no part of The River walk that hasn't been touched by expansion in some way. But as you walk closer toward the area near The Ten-Eleven or The Luxury you will see one particular spot, untouched by time. The VFW Post 76 is a historic place with a lore all its own. It is a place on any given night, especially on weekends where cold beers, jukebox music is blaring and people are having a good time.        It is an old building reminiscent of the one you will find in the King William area. Outside there are chairs and depending on the event the place is either packed or lightly inhabited. There is ample space on the grounds to walk with your drinks. It serves as a good intermediary between some fancy watering hole and an icehouse.       But mainly the VFW is known when it hosts certain events like the various food truck competitions and the numerous festivals it has here. Patrons that frequent this place can run the gamut from Pearl Brewery Apartment dwellers, bicyclists, hipsters, parents, lounge lizards, professionals, seniors looking for cheap Lone star beer etc. Whenever you go you are never sure what crowd to expect.       There is a very laid back vibe intermixed with a quirkiness to it. On one end of the floor you might see a couple straight out of an Urban Outfitters Catalog and just across the way you will see seniors sporting Lite beers, like it was some dance. At night the VFW takes on a romantic quality accompanied by the lights that guide The Riverwalk way.       In addition the servers and patrons alike are usually a friendly crowd. The beers are cheap and the Selena cover bands are even louder. Contrary to what people have said finding a parking spot can be hairy since The Luxury and The Ten Eleven people park in the same area as well. The later you go the less you are inclined to find a space. It's best to car pool with friends, especially when they have events like The Taco Truck Showdown. Either way there is fun to be had by all here.      The VFW Post 76 is a unique spot. It feels like a place untouched by time but relevant to any generation that goes here. The beers are cheap but it is rich in history and charm.    ps. If you are so inclined check out a video of a local band called, "Pillow Talk ~ Slip of the Pen" It was filmed at the VFW and captures the spirit of this place.

reviews.author: Roque L.
reviews.description: A place for veterans, a place for families of veterans. Called the "White House" the Victorian architecture is a shining example of what's being lost all along the San Antonio river as new buildings begin to become common.  As a veteran I'm proud of my fellow compatriots and here we can share stories and create new memories together.   Currently VFW #76 is going under some maintenance and construction to rehabilitate this old beauty.  Come down and enjoy a few pints and meet the San Antonio veterans.

reviews.author: Tamara C.
reviews.description: The folks that make this place great to hangout along the River Walk is the employees who truly enjoy serving to the public and Veterans. Being a child of a veteran of Foreign Wars was greeted with such hospitality in this historical building. We enjoyed a couple beers sitting up stairs on the veranda listening to country tunes. They have a memorial room that was emotional for me as we celebrate soldiers life's for our rights and freedom.  Prices are reasonable for this Beer and Wine establishment. Country tunes are the groove. Totally a fun place to hang out!

reviews.author: Julie W.
reviews.description: The oldest post in San Antonio! Now, that's something to be proud of. Beautiful old building near the Alamo right on the Riverwalk.  Live band in the evenings.  Don't have to be a member to enjoy this place, but your member card gets you reduced prices. NOt that the prices are high to begin with.

reviews.author: Ryan H.
reviews.description: Thank you for serving our country!  Love your location right on the Riverwalk.  So convenient.  We just happened upon this place on a nice stroll on the River.  Had heard I needed to check it out. It was a Lazy Saturday and not many around other than a couple regulars.  Really loved the casual ambiance.  The venue looked great and next time in town will try to catch some live music at night but what a cool building with great grounds and great location and supports our troops!  5 Stars!

reviews.author: Anna J.
reviews.description: Live music?! Yes, Please! Visited with a friend. We grabbed a bucket of beer and sat outside to enjoy the live music. It was fun people watching if I'm completely honest. They offer family style seating so be prepared to cozy up to someone you may not know. There are lots of seating outside and everyone was friendly. It looked pretty full the day we visited but after asking a few tables for available seats, we found our spot. The beer is cold, music is upbeat and everyone rocks late into the night. Great place to unwind after work with friends. I'll visit again soon!!

reviews.author: Jennie K.
reviews.description: Awesome spot to stop into en route to/fro Pearl along Riverwalk. Post is oldest in Texas and full of history and charm. And the darned nicest bartenders in the business!!

reviews.author: Susan W.
reviews.description: VFW post 76 in San Antonio Texas is the oldest functioning post in our state. It's equally great regardless of if you are a veteran or not. All are welcome.  In the hustle and bustle of the Riverwalk it's a great place to stop in, relax, have a cold beverage and enjoy the conversation with any veterans that you are lucky enough to encounter. My husband happens to be a veteran and served in Vietnam. I find that it's very good for him to be around other veterans when we have the opportunity. He doesn't ever share stories about his time overseas. Sadly, it was not only unpopular because of the military aspects of war, but many in our great nation were downright disrespectful to the men and women who served there. Sometimes as they were returning home or being dispatched, drafted or not..... Anyway- This VFW post is in a very well-kept older home and reminds me of a plantation style residence. All beverages are icy cold, and it's a beautiful environment. You can sit and watch barges go by on the river and during the holidays the river is lit with thousands of lights and barges full of caroling children! They also frequently have live music.  It's definitely worth a stop.

reviews.author: Sierra S.
reviews.description: Went there for a drink after work with my coworkers last week  The wings were crispy and flavorful. The Nashville hot was my favorite.   Got a glass of wine or two and my bill was under $20 I would highly recommend this place

reviews.author: Victoria C.
reviews.description: After a morning of fall festivities at the pumpkin patch and corn maze, kiddo and I were looking for something to fill our tummies - so, while we didn't eat there, we did finally grab some Dog Haus to try at home, and the establishment is so funky and pleasant, we definitely want to come back and done in eventually.  I was planning on reviewing four stars and holding off on a rave review until we actually ate inside, but I have to bump up to five right off the bat because my little dude, who can be notoriously picky and outright refuse to eat if someplace is unfamiliar, inhaled his food from here and dipped into mine. And he ate the grilled onions on our food - I don't know if you realize how hard it is to get any vegetable into my four-year-old's mouth without a war breaking out.   We started with the corn dog sliders, and we knew we were in for a good experience because the batter was great and had a perfect crunch to the outside, and was just thick enough. And the actual dog itself? EXCELLENT. Back in California, there was a giant corn dog at a market/fair I used to attend that I loved with a passion, and this made me think of that. In and of itself, the dog really shines in the corn dog.  Moving on the to actual hot dog with toppings, the Cowboy - I have to say I barely got a nibble in of this one, because my son loved it and made sure our plans of splitting everything and making sure he, myself, and grandma got an equal taste of everything went out the window. I sometimes get nervous when I hear "bacon-wrapped" about a hot dog because I worry it will be a thick, gross, undercooked bandage of bacon around a hot dog. Not the case here! No squishy bacon here! Great texture especially with the crispy onions and my son was a huge fan of the cheese sauce.  And the Holy Aioli burger on the Hawaiian rolls? Those rolls are a staple in our house and these were nicely toasted through with a great crunch to them that kept the bread from getting soggy. I wish the meat patty were a little meatier but the toppings were so delicious, I can forgive anything. They could've forgotten the meat and served me a sandwich with just the toppings and I would have no qualms paying full price for that, it was so good.  Overall, I am really happy with this place and can't wait until kiddo and I finally make time to eat there! So good!

reviews.author: Tomas S.
reviews.description: 4.7 STARS! My favorite part of this place is the location and the beer options. It's hidden and because the restaurant is small it makes it a little hidden gem.   The dogs are great. They have many creative options so don't be shy and order a couple. I love their hot chick sandwich. I wish they gave you heat options because sometimes the sandwich is perfect in heat but sometimes it lacks heat. The burgers are good but they aren't thick n juicy yet more smashed and thin. I always go with the chicken and side it with a dog I haven't tried yet.  Add the fries! All options are great. The beer is where it's at! They have so many options and always in stock! Full liquor bar too so stay late. I wish they were open 24/7. Lol. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Matt C.
reviews.description: Decent, not great, but not bad. The value was definitely there, beer pours were solid. Our fries tasted at first of old oil, but found the employees more than willing to completely replace them with fresh ones that tasted good. We tried 1 corn dog, and 3 hot dogs in our group. We find all but one to be pretty lackluster, and lukewarm. I suppose to sum up, it was good but we wouldn't be back. For management, please note, the customer service here is excellent! Saw another customer give the cashier some lip, not her fault at all you all were busy.

reviews.author: Autum R.
reviews.description: DELICIOUS! Need I say more! Yesterday was my first time here, and let me just say I can't wait to go back. The food was amazing, the service was good, and the atmosphere was welcoming. I enjoyed the total experience. I appreciate that the menu has options for everyone. As a restricted eater, I hate going to places that only serve pork or beef. This place has pork, beef, chicken and vegetarian options. So it's great for a variety of people. Def can not wait to go back.

reviews.author: Chris C.
reviews.description: If you like beers and you like burgers and dogs, you found your spot!   This is a cool spot with plenty of TVs to watch sports, a ton of cold beer, and good food, too!   I tried the Big Kahuna Burger which seems to be a limited time offering, but I am  hoping they keep it on the menu.   Served on Hawaiian rolls with onion rings, bacon, peppers, cheese, and sauces, this is a tasty burger! The flavors and textures combine very nicely.   They have fries, tots, and (my favorite) sweet potato fries to accompany the burgers and hot dogs.   A sports bar atmosphere yet very clean and well lit located at 281 and Stone Oak is just what the area needs.   I'll definitely be back.   Check it out and then hit me up on Instagram and let me know what you thought! @CheatDay_SA

reviews.author: Celestine B.
reviews.description: Yum.  I think the bun was made with Hawaiian bread . Had the random urge for a hog and and randomly looked them up, im very glad i did.

reviews.author: Ann S.
reviews.description: Delicious corn dog! I'm glad I checked in with my trusty Yelp, this place is great. I will be bringing my spouse to this cool place, it has an extensive beer selection and a pretty interesting cocktail menu.

reviews.author: Travis M.
reviews.description: My wife and I came here after my parents raves about it, and they were dead on! All of the food we have tried (a couple of different burgers and the Nashville hot chicken sandwich) have been outstanding. The staff is helpful, the atmosphere is great and the drinks are really good. We're sad to be moving out of the area because this spot quickly became a favorite spot!

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: Finally was able to stop in and try this place out...  Such a fun atmosphere with a very friendly staff.  They have lots of beers for those beer drinkers out there.    We started with The Love Boat.  You can't go wrong with tater tots, chili and slaw! Yum!!!!  My hubby had the Reservoir Hog. He really enjoyed it.  Nice flavor, seasoned well and bread toasted just right.    My meal was delish!  The chicken was fried perfectly.  They used Hawaiian rolls for the bread and the pickles were nice and crisp   There was nothing left.  I'll definitely go back.

reviews.author: Jose Raul P.
reviews.description: Great place to hang out, have a beer, and have some good bar food.   The atmosphere really makes this place shine. They have an ample beer selection and great cocktails to try. The food is good, I don't think I can complain about it. However if you're expecting to be blown away, you will leave disappointed. They are hotdogs with cool toppings. I do think that the toppings get in the way of the quality of the meat and bread. I almost regret getting what I got because the sauces and toppings get in the way of the true quality ingredients. Next time I will try a more classic and basic hotdog.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: The food isn't bad, but it isn't spectacular either. For the price, I can make a feast at home with the same items. I was disappointed that they couldn't do a wurst corn dog using Beyond brat. I was also disappointed that they didn't have the impossible sliders.  So, we ended up trying a regular mini corn dog, The old town dog, The beyond brat, chili cheese fries, onion rings, and coleslaw.  The coleslaw was lacking flavor. Of course, you can't mess up fries or onion rings. Those were good. The beyond brat was smaller than expected, but had good flavor. The old town dog was a lot of bread and a little bit of dog.   For drinks, we had a lady in red and the blind melon. The lady in red reminded me of a sangria. The blind melon was sweet.   You order first and then sit down. Someone brings out your food and drinks.  They have inside and outside seating. The outside seating is under a covered patio. They also have a good list of beers. There's a small area where you can play corn hole. Parking is available on site and plentiful.

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Made a pretty long drive to get here and I will say it was worth it. The tots with chili are bomb. The different hotdogs each taste great and they have a nice little bar with a large selection of beers and mixed drinks. I've already come twice and will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Jenelle S.
reviews.description: Five stars for cleanliness, fast service, and friendly staff!  Went here for lunch today and can definitely say nobody there was put in the dog house!  The menu linked to Yelp is not the same menu at this location. I was surprised to find this is a franchised establishment. Several items were the same, but some items were not offered at this location. I've included a picture of this location's food menu.  There was a "special dog" poster at the register, a bahn mi type, which will be offered for a limited time. We ordered the Old Town, chili dog, a side order of mini corn dog, and a side of onion rings.  The buns are King Hawaiian mini slider buns. They leave 3 together, slice in the middle, and fill. Made it very convenient to cut into thirds and share.   The beer part of this Biergarten is well stocked. Looked close to as many as the monk's....well, maybe not as many, but darn well had a large selection to choose from. We ordered the Save the World 2 offerings- AngusDei and Fructus Bonam.  I preferred the AD to be paired with the food.   They have a nice pub type menu with a variety of foods and beers. Nice to have a great new eatery so close to home!

reviews.author: Fernanda S.
reviews.description: Update to the response from Dog Haus:  You did a great job justifying why you charge more for your meat products...to someone who does not eat meat. I buy impossible patties, and have had them at other locations. Using my previous experiences with those locations, and making them myself at home, I still stand by my review of the impossible burger served to me at your establishment in regards to taste, and pricing.

reviews.author: Sheree L.
reviews.description: The best hotdogs I have ever had! They have so many options. I highly recommend trying this place out.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: I should've known when I pulled up.Â   I should've lowered my expectations as soon as I walked in.Â   But It wasn't until I took a second sloppy bite of the 4th weiner in my order that I realized, this place just isn't worthy of 5 stars.  They nailed the vehicleÂ with a pillowy soft and subtlyÂ sweet hawaiianÂ bun.  They crushed the topping combos with all the sauces, slaws, and savory delights imaginable.  But...  The dang dogs just ain't worthy. The little meat tubes failed to assert themselves. Size queens beware: Sausages and Hotdogs alike were shamefully small in both the length and girth department. For likeÂ $6 each, this could haveÂ been forgiven, however the meat pipe's own flavors were barely perceptible.Â Even the sausage, which I personally expect to be much more robust, registered almost no spice and its texture was on par with theÂ hot dog, a huge let-down.  For those undeterredÂ by the aforementioned weiner problems:  Don't be shocked when you arrive, it looks just like a Taco Bell,Â but indeed, it is not.  When you enter, you will be confronted with a monochromatic Taco Bell-style counter. It will have the teenager, the dense menu on the wall behind him, and when he takes your order (again like theÂ Bell) don't expect enthusiasm, I didn't get any.Â   The dining area was comfortable and ultra clean. There was a full bar (which, had I gone there first and chugged a few, would have improved my experience dramatically).Â   Would I return?Â   Maybe, but not unless I was already under the influence.

reviews.author: Eric B.
reviews.description: The wife and I stopped in to check out this new restaurant.  SO glad that we did!  It's your basic bar and grill that specializes in hotdogs/Sausages/Brats, Hamburgers and Chicken.  The wife got a burger with onion rings while I tried out The Cowboy Hot dog with tots.  We both enjoyed our meal and both said that we will definitely be back. They make the simplest meals taste so good!    Kid friendly we highly recommend this place for a cold beer and some good eats

reviews.author: Keri M.
reviews.description: Food looked so good when it arrived we devoured it and forgot to take a picture. However snuck a quick photo of the bartender taking our tray away with the remnants left! It was good. The Hauscocktails look amazing so I had the Gin and Juice.... they measure the alcohol and the ingredients so everything is short poured (not to the top of the jigger) so that's a bummer and can be improved upon.   Overall I'd recommend and come back for the food, for sure...... but not the drinks.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: Finally a great place in Stone Oak for great beer and food! After World of Beer and Brewers grill closed the only option was to head down to Hoppy Monk but finally we have a great new option here locally. No fuss, no frills and just great food!!  I don't typically hunt down a hot dog place as I am vegetarian but they have two REALLY GOOD plant based - Beyond Meat - hot dogs !! So, so good !  The onion rings are also awesome, the Tots ( cheese covered - why the heck not ) . The meat eaters in our party enjoyed the  Old Town because bacon apparently makes everything better and the Downtown!   Great beer selection - enjoyed the Electric Jellyfish IPA . They also have cocktails and milkshakes for the kids.   Great outside patio, cool inside space and fast service ! Perfect way to enter the weekend! Loved it

name: Jazz TX
accommodations: Good for Dinner, Late Night, Dessert
Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: The menu was limited, but every dish we got was excellent! Great atmosphere. Enjoyed the entertainment - a really great night.

reviews.author: Amanda R.
reviews.description: My husband and I spent part of our night here for an anniversary, a very dear song to my heart by the carpenter played at the end of the night so beautiful, and memorable experience..

reviews.author: Angela I.
reviews.description: I loved this place! The food was amazing! I had the best burger I've experienced in San Antonio and the BEST pecan pie I've ever had period! And I'm not even a pecan pie fan!! The drinks were amazing! The service was outstanding! And the band was phenomenal! Doc is hilarious and a comedian for sure! Book your reservations early because they fill up pretty fast! But once you come once you'll be sure to be back for me!

reviews.author: Daniel O.
reviews.description: Really fun place for a date night. Didn't try the food so this is only the review for the ambiance and drinks. Great service and music. Definitely coming back.

reviews.author: Steve G.
reviews.description: My wife and I have been frequent guests at Jazz TX since it opened, and the experience has always been outstanding!  From the speak easy vibe of going under the Food Hall to find the club through a small door and behind the curtains, through to the music, the drinks and now an outstanding food menu.  Jazz TX doesn't disappoint. The decor, the lighting, the backdrop and the intimacy of the low stage right in front of you - it is everything I wanted for jazz. We always enjoy relaxing with music from Doc Watkins and his band.  There is a never ending parade of quality jazz artists and ensembles that come through to perform, so check the calendar and make a reservation!  My only request is a little more room between the tables - add a foot in each direction around the table for servers, patrons walking and comfort, and maybe some padded chairs?  I can't complain - its jazz music at its very best in a setting that is every bit a cool jazz bar.  Thank you Doc Watkins for a great place!!

reviews.author: Priscilla M.
reviews.description: What a great date night evening! Attended the Christmas jazz show and it was amazing! I can't recall the martini i ordered but it has a great light pear taste that wasn't overly sweet. Doc Watkins band is brilliant. Christmas show sold out within 20 minutes of tickets release but I believe any show would be just as beautiful to see.

reviews.author: Nichole S.
reviews.description: This was an amazing date night!   The drinks were fantastic, the food was amazing, the service was wonderful, and the band was spectacular!!!!   We absolutely loved every minute at this venue.  We will definitely be returning.

reviews.author: Rob S.
reviews.description: Love this place. A staple of San Antonio. Great entertainment and ambiance.   I just wish they had more vegan food choices. They used to have  impossible as an option but no longer.  If they expanded the menu, i would be there every week.

reviews.author: Travis B.
reviews.description: This place is a treasure.  The food is great, service is excellent, the drinks are the best in town (well-made and inventive), and if you can go on a night when Doc Watkins is performing, the music is absolutely incredible.

reviews.author: Jesse S.
reviews.description: Celebrated my wife's birthday here.... AMAZING! My wife loves steak and this met all of her expectations! The drinks were good, the food was good, the music was good, and the service was amazing.    We seriously could not be happier with our experience here and we've been to a lot of places in San Antonio!   We will be back soon, and can't wait to do some dancing! Yay Jazz Tx!!!

reviews.author: Rick S.
reviews.description: In this review I will cover the GOOD, THE BAD, and THE UGLY.  For my wife's birthday, I took my family (6 adults) to the show and had dinner/drinks where I spent around $500 for the show and dinner.  THE GOOD- location, food, the band, service       Located in San Antonio's  Pearl District, with free parking.  Jazz TX is located in the basement under the Pearl's Food Court.  It was a cozy little venue that holds about 60 people.  All tables had great views of the band's stage.       No complaints on the TASTE of the food.       The singer, "Doc"  and his band were very entertaining.  Doc kept the audience laughing in between songs. They put on a great show.       The service-  a constant flow of people ensuring your every needs are met.  This was great but also added to THE BAD below.  THE BAD - I guess I was expecting a Dinner and a show.  The kind of place you pay for an over priced meal for a free show.  At Jazz TX you pay to watch the show and also pay for over priced dinner options.       Food Menu - Very limited menu.  They have four large dinner items.  If the large plates are the "large" portions, the "small"  must be tiny!  I remind you their food was tasty!       Music - Having visited Jazz venues in New Orleans my family's expectations were a little different.  The music at Jazz TX was more "early Jazz," like the "Big Band Music" genre.  Not exactly what we wanted but we're willing to take in the show.  Thanks to Doc and the Band we were entertained.  THE UGLY - lack of management!  There was a patron who entered drunk, was constantly criticizing the singer and the band throughout the entire show.  He was so loud that people from three rows of tables away turned their heads.  This drunk even faced time somebody, holding his phone up over his head and yelled in order to communicate with the person he called.  I could not believe the employees totally ignored him.  This was quiet annoying and ruined a good night.  With all the servers constantly walking through the very small venue, why would they not do or say something?  So for the lack of management, and limited menu I give the venue an average score of three.  If you want to spend money and allow the management have drunks run the place, then I highly recommend Jazz TX.  Maybe in between the yelling you might be able to enjoy the show you paid to watch.

reviews.author: Alberto D.
reviews.description: Date night!!! Was so excited to take my GF out.  She loves their old fashion.  Food and drinks were great.  Except, I had to eat my tacos cold.    Faviola was our server.  She gave us time to look at the menu.  We ordered pasta, Bruschetta, shrimp tacos to start off. Later we ordered chips and queso, pecan pie and coffee.  Not to mention her three old fashions and my jack and coke.  Bruschetta came out (3 pieces of bread with shrimp).  Delicious!!!  Then my tacos came out and we waited for the pasta. And waited. And waited.  My tacos got cold as we waited for her pasta.  Finally Faviola comes around, we asked about the pasta and she said she didn't hear the order.  PAUSE: no apology or let me make this right, just I'll go place the order.  So now my tacos get colder waiting for the pasta.  Common sense  as a server is to ask to remake the other dish.    Just need to tighten up that customer service.  I even told my GF that it looked like she stereotyped us before  she came to the table.  Other than that the band was great, food tasted good minus the cold tacos. 3 stars for the food and band.

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: Great food, awesome service, and even better entertainment. This was a highlight event

reviews.author: John L.
reviews.description: Service was sub par. Sat 10 minutes before waiter approached table and another 10 minutes waiting for our drink order. Waiter never checked back after our meal was placed on table and never came back till almost the end of 90 minute set to see if we needed a refill of our drinks. Really surprised by such poor service in what appears to be such a nice club.

reviews.author: Andres Y.
reviews.description: Can't go to San Antonio without stopping here. Best part of my trip hands down. Must see place. Drinks were great service better music spectacular.

reviews.author: Kahsandra W.
reviews.description: This is truly a hidden gym in the Pearl! I never knew it existed! Not only is it an evening if live Jazz music by all talented musicians, Doc is absolutely hilarious and very entertaining! He loves his audience and gives off nothing but good vibes!

reviews.author: Rebecca E.
reviews.description: Finally got the chance to check out Jazz Tx at the Pearl! I was impressed with the atmosphere and the facilities themselves.   The music was great! Friday night is a great time to come out and enjoy the music especially since they do get crowd interaction.   The food: a few different options to wet any palette but still bar food just a little bit more fancy and overpriced. We ordered the burger and shrimp dish which came out hot and picture worthy.   The burger tasted so good and was cooked to perfection. It was bursting with flavor and the onion jam really did set it off and I don't like onions.   The shrimp dish was very good also. Nothing too complicated or special but tasted really  Save your coin and dine somewhere else and then come and enjoy the music. The food is overpriced and you can enjoy great food somewhere else first. Plus the service was not very good at all. Our server was inattentive and only came back for the check.

reviews.author: diane a.
reviews.description: We celebrated a birthday at Jazz Tx. A really nice evening out. Great food, good service, and really fantastic music! I'm so happy that they survived a very extensive shutdown due to Covid restrictions. Make a reservation and go!

reviews.author: Kaleb A.
reviews.description: Amazing downstairs basement location with a four piece band or more, Dock provides great history his music and plays some of the best of Nat King Cole. Must go see him again and again. The saxophonist is the best I've heard in a while.

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: Hidden live Jazz bar and restaurant located underneath the Bottling Depot food hall at the Pearl District  On certain days you can come early to the 5:30 showing without a coverage charge! We showed up a little past 5 on a Saturday night and were easily seated at a table ---BEST PECAN PIE EVER: did not expect to enjoy the food at this jazz lounge but this was delicious along side a hot cup of coffee  PLUS the waitress helping us was SO nice, never rushed us and always made sure we had everything we needed  NOTE: you can reserve tables online for a fee to guarantee seating

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: I've noticed every year more and more events are being planned specifically around, "Dia De Los Muertos." There are food, drink and now the city's first river parade to celebrate it. So why not an event named after a local craft beer? Well the Freetail Brewing Co. has been doing one for a decade named after you guessed it, a seasonal beer. It's called "La Muerta", a much sought after stout in the craft beer circle.  I have been wanting to do this event for years but like Pat Benatar says, "Life's what happens when you make other plans." Needless to say I bought general admission tickets for $30 bucks and some change. The price includes a sample glass, eight tickets for 8 small pours and a bottle of "La Muerta." Initially when I came I was anticipating a full house. Instead the crowd was at a manageable level, you could freely maneuver through. In keeping with the theme there were artisan's booths, mariachis and people dressed in elaborate costumes.  In the main area where the brewing tanks are stationed a sample pouring table is set up. They had different variants of "La Muerta" alongside beers pulled from their cellar. Looking at the sample glass and the size of the pours one assumes if the price merits what's served. However the samples are deceptively strong and sneak up on you. By my fifth pour I was feeling as limber as a ghost. My only critique is in the seating arrangements. There were little to no available tables once it was in full swing. Even the usage of communal  benches limits the spacing of this event. Next year they need to increase possible seating or allow you to bring your own chairs.  In addition whole pours were not being sold if you enjoyed a specific variant. I thought this was kinda lame but not a dealbreaker. I know that a limited supply of barrels are created for the festival. I hope next year they will reconsider allowing you to buy limited snifter sized pours. Having said all these things this festival is still unique. The crowd are all stout- hounds who want to taste a beer that is here from a short time, then is gone. It almost seems like a metaphor for life.
