Ok I'll stop my Waldo Emerson stylings, at least for now.  If you wanna try something different and you love local craft beer like myself go seek this event. It happens only once a year. Don't forget to leave a drink for your loved ones. Hopefully one day someone will return the sentiment back.

reviews.author: Adam W.
reviews.description: Come ON! How much fun is your own private, traveling bar? Serving only the finest of beverages, you'll have a quality time with these quality brews.

reviews.author: Rita M.
reviews.description: When you hear the word BUS one would normally think about a city bus or there like. This is not the case for the Crafty Thirst Beer Bus, no it's a VW van that is being used to serve beer. We were passing by and noticed a sign that said Grand Opening. We stopped to check out this Grand Opening. We were approached by this creepy guy smoking a cigarette as he said do you have ID, we showed our drivers licenses and instead of saying thank you, have a nice day anything he just stared at us. We were reading the list of beers that were offered. It was a little confusing as there was no direction on what the beers were are how much they were. We decided to order at the VW "BUS". We were asking what different types of beers were available and how much they were. The guy that was helping us (later found out was the one of the owners) passed us to someone else. We thought that was rude but the lady that served us made up for it. The beers were $7.00 dollars for a 9 ounce or you could get 4 -  7 ounces for $10.00 dollars to me that is extremely high. Most of the places in Canyon Lake have beers for $2.50. The beer we had, had more of a foam head on it and we were not offered to top it off. Another guy was serving mixed drinks one with Pecan Rum. The mixed drinks were $7.00 dollars, high for the area and the amount you get. I will confess that the rum was one of the best I have had. A few times I heard other people saying that the price's were too high. If you can get a beer for $2.50 then why would someone pay $7.00 dollars. The band was the only entertainment and they were amazing. There was suppose to be a raffle for the VW BUS but when I asked about it I was told that it was not going to take place. This was troubling being that I was told by the owner that it was the main giveaway.

name: Paramour
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Savannah W.
reviews.description: let me tell y'all.....this is the place to be on a weekend. the drag brunch??? ICONIC. kristi waters, kendoll, mehgan dlux, natasha capri, i would die for any of them. honestly  it was my favorite drag brunch of all time. i told kendoll i would die for her and that i'm in love with her and she said it back and gave me a peck. and on the subject of her, my god y'all she's SO GORGEOUS and her outfits... they make me drool. i need her closet. after the show, i was going to the restroom and ran into kendoll and mehgan at the elevator. we actually had an emotional conversation and i absolutely adore them.  i also went to a peep show here and they had an aerial dancer, dessany, and she is beyond beautiful and incredibly talented. so sweet, too! i spoke with her after the show and took a picture with her, and then spoke with kristi waters, also very kind, and got a picture with her as well.  the queens and other performers here are so lively and fun, the drinks are good, the atmosphere is amazing. the whole place is "instagram worthy" lol. they make you feel included and they're very interactive. hands down my favorite spot in sa and i recommend it to everyone!

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: Looove this place. Perfect for a girls brunch as they seat large groups. We had to make reservations beforehand, so there was no problem getting sat. The drinks were super strong and everyone looked to be having a swell time.   The ambiance is really "instagrammable" and I love how all the decorative pillows are mismatched. Be sure to check out the bathroom and the champagne vending machine!!!

reviews.author: Stephanie B.
reviews.description: Bought tickets for Sunday drag brunch. Got an email that said seating started at 10 when really it started at 11 - conflicting reservation / event messages. Got there and the seating process was extremely disjointed. Since we were early as a party, we expected good seating as it is "first come first serve" and they tried to sit our group of 6 on a bench along the wall without any tables. We had to ask to be seated at a table where our group could actually see one another and hang out.   Once we got settled, it was obvious the drinks were ridiculously overpriced. $14 for a mimosa. And they don't have coffee for brunch? Kinda wild. On top of that the menu was extremely limited and for a place that claims they want to emulate luxury and have a dress code, they really don't serve nice food. The avocado toast is basically packaged guac on plain un toasted bread.   The area is nice on the rooftop but honestly not really conducive to a drag show. Depending on where you get sat, you may only see half of the performance.   The queens were great, only good part about the drag brunch.

reviews.author: Jeret G.
reviews.description: The drag show is amazing! The entertainment is top notch for south Texas and you'll love Kristi Waters! Make sure to arrive early if you're planning on attending the drag brunch so you can sit inside under the industrial size fans otherwise you'll get to experience Texas hell size heat outside.  Bring your friends for an amazing time with the drag show.  Make sure to pre-eat and pre-drink because the food is by far the worst brunch food in SA (sorry not sorry) and the drinks were overpriced and ehhh (unimpressive).  I would have rated a 3 star but for the amazing time we had because of the AMAZING DRAG SHOW!   Come with a group and get there early!

reviews.author: Ashley S.
reviews.description: I came to Paramour on one of their quieter nights with a girlfriend and still had a blast. The place itself is so cute and beautiful as it overlooks the city. The drinks were just as beautiful and the cocktail servers were so friendly and fun to talk to! This place has a lot of photo ops so be super to snap some cute pics. I've heard a lot of hype about their drag brunch so will definitely be coming back soon.

reviews.author: Chad H.
reviews.description: This was such a weird experience. I showed up and there's someone outside checking ID's. Then, you go to the bar on the 4th floor and you have to take the stairs all the way up. I was waiting for the dude to say he was kidding. But no... 3 flights of stairs. I got up and then the menu drinks were all about $20 each. The outside chairs were so uncomfortable. They also sit parties together. You and your friends could be sitting on a couch in a circle with chairs and if the chairs are open, a random party will join you. It was just ... strange.  I get the vibes they were trying to give off. The place was semi-cute. But the over priced drinks were killer to me. Upscale restaurants don't even charge that much. I recommend this as a place to stop for one drink during your nightly adventure. Not to stay all night.

reviews.author: Crystal A.
reviews.description: Good drag show but several misses. 1) They don't let you use the elevator!!! In took my older aunt to see a show and they refused to let her use the elevator!! You have to climb 4 flights of stairs! She made it to the top but couldn't breathe for a bit :( :(     2) under the FAQ section, it clearly says that there is a 15% service charge included in all prices... so "tipping isn't necessary but welcomed"..... okay so that justifies the $18 price tag on drinks... WRONG!! When I settled my tab, the waitress asked for a tip?!?! Saying prices don't include tip?!?! Are you kidding me?? 3) not real brunch. There is only like 5 food items :( so get tipsy and walk down 4 flights of stairs!!!   I wish it was better!

reviews.author: Kynesha C.
reviews.description: Let me start by saying, I've been to many Drag Shows and enjoyed them all....BUT!!!!! this place was the worse experience I've had this far. And friend and I went to their BDSM show the Nighy before Halloween expecting to have a great time..NO MA'AM!. I purchased VIP tickets to the show expecting to have a memorable night only to be denied a seat in the main area. We got there, and was told there were no seat available and were offered 2 lawn type chairs and a wooden bench for a table to sit at, outside. After inquiring about the seating that was open ( mind you, this place is a FIRST COME FIRST SERVE SEATING place), those seat were reserved for larger parties. Of this place is first come first serve we should get the semi-comfortable couches in the building. No, they told us we couldn't sit in these areas. After having a somewhat heated conversation with a so-called manager our night was ruined. Upon asking about a refund since there was no "seating" available, we were told we could not get a refund but had to reschedule our visit. He were told we could not pick the night we wanted to reschedule for. WTF is that?!?!?  We asked to sit in a certain area and was told it was I safety hazard. Not 2 seconds later someone was seated exactly where we asked to sit. PLEASE DO BETTER PARAMOUR.  Those of us willing to spend our money should be treated better. Moreover, don't over book your shows and force your customers in uncomfortable positions. I will NOT be back despite the fact that I'm a Kristie Water's fan.. Please step up! To you potential customers, find another place to spend your  funds! Furthermore, spending hours to get into your best  threads to walk up 4 flights of stairs, outside,  just to sweat out your clothes, hair, makeup, lashes, brows hope and dreams to pay $18 for a watered down drink is just enough to wonder...Why Try?!?!????? Please do better.

reviews.author: Brittany H.
reviews.description: It feels so good to be able to go to bars again, especially when they're as cool and trendy as this one! Aside from the beer, the drinks are somewhat expensive, but I guess you're also paying for the view and the atmosphere. The waiters are very attentive, and the place is just as beautiful on the outside patio as it is in the inside bar/lounge area. We had some of their cocktails as well as beer, and all of it was great. This is definitely a cool place to go and splurge a bit for a date night, or a night out with friends!

reviews.author: Delaney M.
reviews.description: Super cool ambiance! The whole place gives off a super kinky/ sexual vibe. All the drinks had dirty names and the throw pillows all said things like "Girls just want to have cum", etc and the ladies bathroom comes fully equipped with eye candy (giant Tom Sellack pictures). Did I mention there is a champagne vending machine?! They also have very neat neon signs everywhere- super photo worthy if you're into that stuff. Drinks were good too. We went 9/1/21 and the bartender said they had just rolled out a new menu that day. The staff was very friendly! We're just passing through town but we would definitely make our way back here again if we could

reviews.author: Toni G.
reviews.description: So we arrived at 11am picked our seating based on the position on the umbrellas on the patio we sat there for 30 minutes my friend got up got us water . This rude waiter came turned the umbrella I said excuse me. He yelled you need to share don't be rude. Remind you he gave us no warning before turning the umbrella. After watching him serve drinks to everyone around us the group next to us would order water and give it to us. After one hour we left f the show this place sucks and he should be fired. The reviews don't lie this place is beautiful with horrible prices and bad rude service , stay away don't let the cuteness fool you

reviews.author: De JanÃ©t L.
reviews.description: This is definitely one of my favorite spots here in San Antonio. It's a place that seems inclusive. The staff members were very accommodating to members in the party with disabilities (very appreciative of that). I attended Paramour in the evening for a social event and for the drag show brunch event, which was great to see the change in ambience. The music, furniture, drinks, and staff set a relaxing atmosphere during the evening and exuberance during the drag show. They also have great customer service, so I will definitely return to Paramour in the future. Keep up the great work Paramour staff! :)

reviews.author: Angel M.
reviews.description: We went for the Drag brunch. On a Sunday. My friends ordered the Barbacoa tacos. They came out extremely cold everybody's order. A friend of mine ordered the avocado toast and the Chilaquiles. The Chilaquiles is basically HEB corn tortilla chips with an egg on top and some mediocre Ranchero sauce. Not worth as much money as it is on the menu. Also was very cold. Avocado toast wasn't even toasted and see photos. Secondly the performers parking situation is unreal they blocked us in they said it was their parking lot there's no sign that says it's there parking lot there could've been an extreme emergency and no one could get out. And lastly me at the elevator does not work so you have to climb up 5 to 6 flights of stairs just to get to the rooftop. Don't drink too much that could seriously be a traumatic situation quickly. This is supposed to be one of San Antonio's upscale places and I'm just not seeing it here and I'm not afraid to speak the truth. Beautiful atmosphere but need some work.

reviews.author: Irene M.
reviews.description: The moment I walked into this place , I instantly loved it.   The vibe from the get go, was sensational.    I love the color, the ambiance, the lighting, the whole atmosphere.   The staff were Fantastic, and the Mgr on duty, was so in tune.  I mean Brendan, was the greatest, very attentive, aimed to please.  Drinks are spot on, and  the pecan ice is the bomb.  I highly recommend having together A Old Fashion and the Pecan ice cream together.  Great combo. I'm visiting from out of town and will be back for more of this Paramour.

reviews.author: Desi N.
reviews.description: The show and atmosphere was amazing! Service wasn't that great but not cause they weren't hustling, because they definitely were..... just seemed short staffed. The servers were their own bartenders.... so they were definitely running around trying their best! Idk if that's how it always is because it was our first time. We will definitely be going back. Can't wait to take our out of town friends!

reviews.author: Tim N.
reviews.description: What a waste of time! Been here a few times in the past and was nice. They have changed there business model to cater to a younger and more 'alternative' lifestyle clientele. I have no problem with that except that either since I'm just an old straight guy no one concerns themselves if I want anything or they just don't give a damn if anyone wants anything. We were the only people there so not sure what their lack of service was all about. More concerned about the late night drag and stripper crowd coming later. I would have thought my money was just as good. Female bartenders were friendly enough as long as I went to the bar. Some little dude who wanted to impress I guess was super rude to my wife. Was not a regular obviously but will never go back again.

reviews.author: Melanie V.
reviews.description: What a wonderful rooftop place. Paramour has a prime location on the Riverwalk and after enduring 7 flights of stairs you will be rewarded with a fun, vibrant, and playful atmosphere. Five out of five stars for the atmosphere both interior and exterior. Absolutely stunning.   Taking off stars for the cocktails -- service, taste, timeliness. We were the only people there ordering at 2p on a Friday (there was another couple talking to a manager) and it took 15 minutes to get acknowledged by the other bartender. She then gave attitude when we asked about the menu and her recommendations but eventually we ordered and proceeded to wait for another 20 min to get our drinks. I understand they are specialty but this was extreme. When we finally got the drinks, I can't say they were worth the wait nor the price tag.  I also was a little disappointed in the bathroom area where you wash your hands. Not clean, soap was everywhere, there was melted wax in the sink, and lack of paper towels but the bathroom stalls were clean.   I recommend checking this place out but maybe go with a beer to speed up the process and enjoy the outdoor patio.

reviews.author: Maree B.
reviews.description: My whole crew went out to drag brunch and we had the best time. It was so entertaining and so much fun. I definitely suggest you make the reservations and go because you won't regret it!!!

reviews.author: Ryan O.
reviews.description: Beautiful, comfortable space.   BEST drag brunch (on Sundays) ever; the show, that is. The food mediocre at best, is made up of quite a bit of prepackaged foods (the first time we went there Little Debbie cosmic brownies taken out of packaging and put on a plate), and costs $25. This last time we went the food was definitely better than the first time.   But cocktails are OUTRAGEOUSLY overpriced. Simple cocktails that you'd normally pay $7-10 for elsewhere are $18. Sangria is $16. It is sort of unbelievable.   All that said, the drag show is worth it all. So organized with an amazing, talented, and witty host. She always has the best talent performing. I look forward to it every time I'm in SATX.

reviews.author: Monica S.
reviews.description: We came for the drag brunch. Disappointed. Food options were minimal. They oversell tickets and you don't get a seat inside if you're not waiting in line hours before the open the doors. It's June in Texas. You can only imagine the heat. We had to be seated outside and didn't see the show. Our waitress, Kendra was amazing but she was tending to too many tables. Drinks way overpriced. Don't waste your time and money here. Too bad. It is a great idea in a great location, but executed very poorly.

name: Hills and Dales Ice House
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Been here a few times, including when it was the original Ice House that you picked up the beer out of the fridges.  The new owners put a bar, front patio and added some flare.  Love the plates on the ceiling and the choices of draft beer.  Last time we went, it was after Paintballing for a friend's 13 year old son.  So glad to stop in for a cold beer to help the aches and pain of shooting some teenagers!  Amanda was the bartender that day and was great.  She was friendly and talked with us at the bar.  She works weenends and I will be back for her smile.    This is a great bar near us and place every San Antonioian should try at least once.

reviews.author: Dikeasha R.
reviews.description: The bouncers here are way too aggressive. Will kick you out just because they feel like it. Literally PUSHED my friend out of a back door. They have no respect for women or their customers in general if you're not their friend.

reviews.author: M M.
reviews.description: Warm beer. Terrible service. Rowdy patrons. Dirty restrooms.   There are plenty of decent watering holes in the area.... pass on this one.

reviews.author: Cassie F.
reviews.description: Visited on a Thursday night recently it had been my first time back since COVID. I already felt safer because it's more of an outdoor setting and the tables are plenty spaced out. They also have heaters for the colder nights. The hookah worker they had was beyond nice and helpful. Their bartenders were super friendly going around asking if we needed anything so that we didn't need to go up to the bar. The food truck they have is delicious, I tried their Texas size cheese sticks and they were delicious! DJ had a great mix of music going. Overall the whole night was very enjoyable.

reviews.author: Luis I.
reviews.description: I must say this place used to be my favorite bar hangout before corona. However, corona caused me to stop frequenting this place. Tonight was my first day back to this bar since corona and it was really suffering from slow service but it was fine. I must admit the place was full but the bad thing was that an individual physical shoved me out of the bar order area because he wanted to order. I bucked back at him told him I was ordering and if he could just wait until I payed he claimed that that was his bar and next thing u know the bouncers kicked me out. All while he kept claiming and screaming this is my bar. I was respectful and calm while he was aggressive and loud yet I got kicked out. If it was the owner oh well, nice bar I used to love it but I will never be back happy 4th but this vet will find another place.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: Great spot for a drink or just to hang out with friends. They have inside and outside seating. They also have a food truck in the back.  We went on a Saturday night. They had a live band.  Drinks are reasonably priced.  The bathrooms are clean (that's always a plus).  You can take your dog.  Parking is available on site  I will definitely return

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: Ghetto bar/ club. If you want to see a bar fight, bouncers jumping in, this is the place to go! Over priced drinks, music isn't bad.

reviews.author: Mr-Juan G.
reviews.description: Final update after visiting 3 different times on 3 different days. The first time I went was a good experience, the second time was terrible. The last time went well. I'm presuming that your experience will be based on how packed it is and who is in charge that night. If it's really packed, I don't recommend going. However, if it looks like you can make a straight shot to the bar or restrooms, definitely plan on staying for a few hours. The DJ plays music that makes you want to get up and move. That's pretty much all I have to say.

reviews.author: Eric H.
reviews.description: Not the best place to go even in that area. They have watered down drinks. Rough crowd too. 0/10 would not recommend

reviews.author: Jonathan W.
reviews.description: $15 cover for me to get in but not my fiancÃ© on a SUNDAY. Ghetto ass place with no parking.

reviews.author: Jon G.
reviews.description: Went there tonight after an anniversary dinner with my wife to have a few beers. Right away there's some very aggressive rent-a-cops that were being very confrontational and aggressive and  asking if you have weapons or not. I did not go there to get harassed as I'm walking in to entertain two ass clowns. I have had people ask me politely certain questions regarding weapons and and other details but not bulldogging me right as I walk in. This place is a overrated college bar anyway!!  Save your money and stay home!! #hillsanddales

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: Me and 3 of my girl friends waited in line for about 45 minutes at 11pm while other people were being let in by just walking up to the front. When we got to the front we paid $5 each for cover and was escorted to the back outdoor area where we were told to wait for our bartender to come to us... we waited another 50 minutes and no one showed up. So eventually we got tired of waiting to be served and left to find our car broken into. I know that break-in's is not necessarily something that a business can control but I parked in their parking lot where they apparently have security and it still happened. As businesses have to adjust to the new operating expectations, many companies have changed their procedures of service. But in this case we had zero service. One of the guys that cleans tables told us to wait for our bartender after we had already been waiting there for 20 minutes. That's why we kept waiting as long as we did. As long as they continue to operate this way, it's honestly not worth going.

reviews.author: Maria M.
reviews.description: I came here last weekend, and got one drink, my bill was $5 I left a $5 tip. So 10 bucks total right? Why did they charge me $45?!??! I have a picture of my receipt luckily, but every time I call it says mailbox is full. They also messed up my friends bill when we were still there. They charged her 3 extra drinks of bourbon.. when we only ordered a vodka cocktail. The waitress didn't write anything down and kept our cards the whole time. Honestly this was the worst experience.

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Sunday Funday!  That's when I've mostly visited HandD and it's the go to place!  Mostly college students and 20 something year olds, but a chill relaxed atmosphere nonetheless.   Live music is on rotation, and the DJ keeps the mood energized with a good mix of 90s to Top 40 music.   Continued improvements to the plac e as a whole keep it a fun and lively environment. New signage makes great photo ops!   "Giant" beer pong played with trash cans and volleyballs is really fun, especially when you've taken advantage of the drink specials a couple times haha  The prices are fairly inexpensive even when not on HH, which adds to the appeal. So Please drink responsibly!

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: Went on a Sunday, and it was dripping hot outside. Our group and I were celebrating a friend's Birthday. We sat outside under the canopy because inside was packed. It felt really good inside lol but it was very loud. Surprisingly all we did was socialize and hardly drank but it was still a great time, just goes to show that you dont always need booze to have fun. The gorgeous and awesome Barkeep Jordan was very nice and had great customer service skills, her and her mini-hers were working hard and looking good. Jordan made sure everyone at the bar was being tended to. They also have a BBQ Truck in the parking lot!!

reviews.author: Maxine C.
reviews.description: This place is great and the staff is friendly but the DJ is what brings this place down. How can a person who is to bring entertainment to their patrons, say F-u we don't play that shhhh here, when you request a song. You need a better DJ!!

reviews.author: Kelly K.
reviews.description: This was my first time here. I had two drinks, one shot, and ate food. I was cut off and the "manager" couldn't even come over and talk to me. I asked several employees what I did to be cut off and no one could give an answer. I could understand if I couldn't walk unassisted or had slurred speech. I will never go back.  It sucks since the service was good from the bartender Jimmy. I will make sure everyone knows of my experience.

reviews.author: Kris C.
reviews.description: The bouncer - long hair fat man. kicked me out because I cussed at my sister and said I was aggressive. TO MY SISTER! Then went back today and he drug me and my friends out by the side door in the alley and kicked me out again! I was there for 1 minute! then kept flashing his flashlight at me on purpose until my Uber came. HORRIBLE AND RUDE FAT MAN!!!

reviews.author: Jamie V.
reviews.description: women. be careful of this place date rapes girls. please be careful watch the bartender and bouncers they work together.

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: Tell the bartenders that if the money is on the floor it is NOT theirs. Got kicked out for that stupid sh*t.

reviews.author: Allegra R.
reviews.description: Nothing but fun games and good vibes!  A lot of bar availability, fast workers and clean environment

reviews.author: Taylor L.
reviews.description: It was mine and my boyfriend's first time here last night and we will definitely return! Atmosphere is amazing! Staff is super friendly, it's clean, the music is awesome and the food is great! They even have a bathroom polo in the women's restroom. Nice touch!

reviews.author: Sy B.
reviews.description: Every time I go it's the same. Atmosphere is good, cool place, but the bar tenders are ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE. The bar is not crowded and they will take 10 minutes to get you a beer. Save your money and go elsewhere

reviews.author: Hawk S.
reviews.description: The drinks seem old I hated all the mix drinks I order and on top of that the fried pickles I ordered tasted like they poured half the salt container on them. Every fried pickle I ate gave me heart burn. The crazy part is my girlfriend loves salt and the amount of salt was still too much. The drinks also sucked but I'm tired of going into detail. The only good part about this place is the music....sorry my girl wants to leave ima cut it short

reviews.author: George A.
reviews.description: Watched the fight, had a great burger and I went home. Staff was friendly and courteous, decor could use a little help but it was fine for a chew and screw!

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: I10 has been my second home for decades. Good people. Hometown feel. Kinda like cheers. Prices are great. Drama is nill. Great times always and good laughs. Support them. They are your get away from your stressful life. Embrace it!!

reviews.author: Alycia M.
reviews.description: Best drink specials around hands down. They also have a DJ on certain nights and times. They have pool tables, darts, beer pong and plenty of seating and a big outside patio. The wings are pretty good and the chicken sandwich is huge! The owner or manager can be a bit of an ass tho, overall worth checking out.

reviews.author: Cassie H.
reviews.description: I'm here visiting SA and I've been to icehouse 3 times now. The reason I have come back? There's a bartender named Hannah. The second time I came here, she remembered my drink. The third time I came here, she had the drink ready for me before I even asked for it. While I was here on my 3rd visit and sitting outside, when she noticed that my drink was low, she already brought me a new one. Hands down best customer service.

reviews.author: Rachel H.
reviews.description: This bar charges you an extra 1.25 per drink "to stay open during covid" this makes NO sense because they serve food anyway. They said you are buying a water bottle when you are charged the extra 1.25 but when I asked for the water bottle they didn't have it to give to me?? Why charge for something you cannot offer. I ordered a double vodka drink, and was charge 1.25 per shot which was 2.50 total for one drink on top of the price of the actual drink. No other bar is doing this. Just raise your prices and be honest- and I would be more than willing to pay more since I know bars have struggled from covid. But charging extra saying you'll get an item(water bottles/chips) that they don't have or won't give you?? What????

reviews.author: Mikel C.
reviews.description: It's weird that this place that has always served food is adding an extra charge to every drink order under the guise of "COVID" like really to every drink order? Why not just to the ticket not for every drink crazy. Also I'm gay and I sat down in the middle table of the seating area with my other gay friends and nobody came to serve us just the tables around us, even a freshly seated straight couple got served as soon as they sat down. Raggedy bar with bad table service. The lady bartender was very nice tho!

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: I come here often for beer and games with friends. It is a very casual vibe with a lot of different games and activities. They ID for 21+ at the door so for the rest of the night you don't have to worry about carrying your ID around. With three separate bars the service is fast and easy to order. The chili rim for beer is honestly the best I have had in San Antonio. We will always choose this place with coworkers and friends for a chill and fun night.

reviews.author: Jose C.
reviews.description: If you're LGBT+ don't even think you'll get acknowledged by any of the staff.. waited 35 mins and everyone kept walking around us and serving everyone else. Also they make you pay an extra 1.50 on top of EVERY drink you order due to COVID. So not worth it.

reviews.author: Joanie G.
reviews.description: I recommend everyone review their receipt before signing! We were charged chips and water bottlers we never got and were told that they added it because they need to make up for the beers sold to us to show they are a restaurant so they can remain open!!! My only thought was wow how can you do this to people blindly!  The manager said he would refund $10 of it and apologized stating that the bartenders should have told us that was going to happen! I'm all for bars being open but you can't just add items to someone's bill hoping we wouldn't notice! I can only imagine how many people just sign away and tip without even noticing!!!!! We will not be going back to this shady place

reviews.author: Ashley D.
reviews.description: THE BEST BLOODY MARYS AND WINGS IN SA! They have live music till 1 am and they have very afforable drinks. It's a pretty big place, 3 bars and a huge outside patio. I love it here, you will too! Very chill on the weekdays and a party on the weekends

reviews.author: Josh A.
reviews.description: I want to say thank you to I-10 Icehouse last night after my glass was knocked over by an anxious ping pong player. Although I was not too close to the bar, a server noticed what happened and since my glass was mostly full, she kindly replaced it. What great service!   I always enjoy going to I-10 Icehouse and the great drink specials throughout the week. I haven't had food there but the wings always smell delicious. I also enjoy that they have many activities people can be entertained with such as ping pong, darts, billiards, giant connect four, a basketball game, a big screen projector. Good job, y'all! This is what keeps me coming back!

reviews.author: Ari R.
reviews.description: The staff is the only reason I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one because everyone who helped me and my party were so nice. The parking area is small and there was a big dip in the spot so I almost stepped in a puddle of water while getting out. It's a moderately clean place with plenty of seating and like I said, a lot of friendly staff. The food is so sub par. I ordered the sample platter of appetizers and it was really meh. Just grease and little actual flavor, yes I understand it's basic bar fare, but the fried mushrooms were not good. I'm not sure they even cleaned them first. Chips and salsa were fine and the cheese quesadilla was actually ok. I had some beer then switched to water which I drank until I realized (as I was leaving) that the glass wasn't all that clean. Bleh!

reviews.author: Alyssa M.
reviews.description: First of all... basketball is $1. Wurzbach is 50 cents.  Second of all... they took forever to bring us our nachos after ordering them twice.  Third of all... the ladies bathroom is very unsanitary.  #truenews #wewant50centbasketball

reviews.author: Viviana G.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I frequently visit I-10 Icehouse for all the games they offer. They have darts, corn hole, pool, ping pong, large connect four, basketball, and Jenga. They offer different drink specials everyday of the week some are actually really good such as 1.75 beers. Parking is easy during the week but weekends it gets very crowded. They show most MMA matches or boxing matches but they charge covers for those nights.   Service isn't that good here or the food but we usually just come to hang out and drink.  The inside is a little drab but very spacious and plenty of seating.

reviews.author: Kiara R.
reviews.description: Really love this sports/dive bar. One of my absolute favorite people there is Jen. First, she's a great bartender. Her micheladas are truly one of my favorites in SA. Every experience I've had with her has been so nice, especially after a long day at work.   Today, Vino, the food manager really made my day. I once had a bad experience with the food and never really wanted to risk ordering food again until today. I just so happened to ask Jen if the cook was in a good mood because of said bad experience and it just so happened that Vino over heard. He made sure my Cheese Burger was hot and exactly how I wanted it. It was SO good. It was also nice how considerate and humble he was. I couldn't have had a better service after a really tiring day. I will be back for my Burger and Micheladas soon!!

reviews.author: Darrian W.
reviews.description: My kind of place! Although around 6pm the bartending could use a little more help, but I'm giving this place 5 stars bc of Veno, the cook. He made excellent food with excellent service. He acted as our waiter when he is not one. Thank you, I've been dreaming of those chicken tenders ever since. LOL!

reviews.author: Lorrisa L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and i venturing around pearls.  We came across to High street wine.   First time here.  It is a great place to sit and talk and enjoyed some wines.  Austin was great.  He was patience and asked what kinds of wine we like and looking for.  Excellent service and very attentive  Lol thank for the off the menu pumpkin pie Will be one of my to go spot now

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
reviews.description: What a beautiful Sunday to enjoy The Pearl, wine and a charcuterie board! This place is a must try. We stopped in for an afternoon glass of wine and they did not disappoint.  The menu is pretty extensive with light snacks, charcuterie boards you can mix and match and flatbreads. I would say you will get totally full eating here if you're super hungry but it's a nice spot for brunch, light afternoon meal until dinner.  Hubby and I both enjoyed the wine flight where they pick wines based on you're taste. The waiter did a superb job picking 3 delicious choices for us! Well done.  We picked 4 on the charcuterie board and I added smoked salmon which was an up charge. We will come back as this was a great day date out.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: Part of the Pearl's charm, are the many great restaurants, coffee places and wine and beer businesses located in it. High Street Wine is one of these locales.   High Street is located on the street section of the Pearl. I came after dinner to meet some friends and loved this wine bar's huge wine selection. I ordered a glass of Garnet, which was very good. Their wine by the glass ranges from $11 upward, so it's definitely not cheap. Bottles can also be purchased and they had some good wine flights.   High Street is ideal as an after dinner hangout, or for a pre-dinner drink/ snack. I did not get to sample the snacks, but I intend to when I return.   I really loved the feel of this place and atmosphere. It's an advantage that it is located at the Pearl, which tends to be very active during summer evenings, especially Saturdays. I've already added High Street to the list of places to which I will return.

reviews.author: Sam P.
reviews.description: This is honestly one of my favorite spots in San Antonio and we returned for Fathers Day weekend !  Just a great selection of wine including some unique finds and all very well priced. Comprehensive beer selection with a wide variety of great ( aka Untappd highly rated ) finds and great food  This time we tried two of their flatbreads which are a newer addition to the menu, their cheese and charcuterie plate , olives and nuts as well as as their champagne , IPAs and a wine flight !   We ended up leaving with a Portuguese bottle of red which as for hard Napa reds is new to us but was a great choice after trying on the wine flight !  Great service , cool vibe and one of my fave spots in SA

reviews.author: Erica M.
reviews.description: Awesome wine place tucked away between Cured and Merit Coffee. They have great selections of wines, but beer is also available if you're not in the "wine mood". Small eats like charcuterie boards are available as well. Staff members are very friendly and knowledgeable. We had amazing service from Matt on the day we went.  Love how the atmosphere is relaxing and away from the crowds of the yard and market areas. This is one of the very few places at the Pearl that has an  unpretentious vibe. Will definitely be back next time we're in the area!

reviews.author: Fernanda F.
reviews.description: Last week I visited High Street Wine Co. for the first time since the pandemic started and I had a fabulous experience!  High Street Wine has always been a more intimate wine bar, with only a limited number of sitting space. Due to the pandemic, they've moved most of their tables outdoors which I think is amazing, because their outdoor space is so beautiful and at night you can enjoy the new holiday lights. Another great thing about High Street is that they are located away from the madness of The Pearl's main yard, which made me feel more comfortable and safe. All of their tables have a QR code at the center which you can scan to view their wine and food menu. If you have any issues scanning the code, you can also find the menu on their website. Frankly, I was a little overwhelmed by their menu and decided to just ask our server for his recommendation. He asked us what kind of wine we were looking for and a price range, and his recommendation was on point! Never be afraid of asking for suggestions. The people working here are experts and they will be able to tell you everything you need to know about their selection.   Thank you High Street Wine Co. for a wonderful evening!

reviews.author: Kay V.
reviews.description: This is a great place to sit with some friends, talk, and enjoy a glass or two of wine.  The wines are great.  There is a wide variety.  I enjoyed a Pinot Gris from Oregon, while my friends had a New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc.  The food was great.  The charcuterie board had a variety of meats and cheeses, along with honey, a fig jam, and a great spicy mustard for accompaniments.  The flatbreads might have been a bit crispier but they had great flavor l.  I will definitely be back!

reviews.author: Irene T.
reviews.description: The last time we came here they had such excellent wine and appetizers. It was like a meal with all the meat,  cheeses and jams on the charcuterie board. The wine guide was spot on with our wine choices and recommendations!

reviews.author: Yvonne M.
reviews.description: I just had the absolute best and most informative wine tasting here, EVER! Scott introduced me to 6 new wines and explained their origins and taste  salmon flatbread was expertly made and taste was divine. highly recommend this place for a lovely saturday afternoon

reviews.author: Brittany F.
reviews.description: Excellent service. Everyone was simultaneously super laid back and very attentive. The people we interacted with were kind and knowledgeable. I loved the atmosphere and decor, especially with the Christmas lights and fires shining outside.   My date and I split a cheese board with the tam (the rind was quite earthy!), blue, and chÃ¨vre and it was amazing. Really beautiful. The mustard was delicious! So were the jam and honey. I personally love cornichons and enjoyed all of them myself. It was 3 for $15 and came with bread. We wished we would have tried the duck breast - next time! With different cheeses.   Date had an enjoyable glass of Chinon ($10) and an employee recommended a Beaujolais Nouveau to me, a Pinot Noir lover. It was surprisingly $7 a glass and I enjoyed it.   The selection is extensive as you can imagine.  I really love this gorgeous spot and can see it as the perfect spot for almost any occasion, day or night. We will be back soon for a Saturday tasting with friends!

reviews.author: Ampal K.
reviews.description: One of my favorite spots here at the pearl! the charcuterie boards are amazing!   Wanted to go to a vineyard but didn't feel like driving an hr to Fredericksburg so this place was perfect. Close to home and super cuter. You could bring your puppy and have a chill day at the pearl.

reviews.author: Kent R.
reviews.description: Where do I even begin. Wow. Welcome to the first and only non-pretentious, highly educated, relaxed environment wine bar to ever exist in San Antonio. Whether you are a suited professional, or a chef that's got a day off and needs a relaxed patio day in chanclas, get to High Street. They truly accommodate your personal wine palette

reviews.author: Rea F.
reviews.description: My husband and I love this place.  We wish we lived closer so we could visit more regularly.  It's tucked away in a corner of the Pearl right by Cured.  This past Saturday was our second visit, and we had a great time.  My husband had the red flight and I had the rose flight.  The server took his time to explain the different wines and to answer our questions.  We then shared the salmon flatbread and charcuterie board, and we had plenty of food for the two of us.  Overall, it's a great place - could not recommend it more!

reviews.author: Jennifer R.
reviews.description: The wine list here is amazing and changes regularly. The staff is extremely knowledgeable and will help you make a great selection. During COVID they have intermittently been doing online wine classes which we enjoyed immensely. I highly recommend High Street Wine Company.

reviews.author: Debbie C.
reviews.description: My favorite place to sit and enjoy wine with friends and snack on an exquisite selection of cheeses.  The staff is knowledgeable and attentive.  I'm never disappointed.

reviews.author: Laura L.
reviews.description: Kelsey was amazing! I loved her!  Her knowledge and expertise took me to another level with wine.  The board was well balanced and the wine was delicious.  I thoroughly enjoyed my evening of celebration.

reviews.author: Jennifer R.
reviews.description: This is my first time going here and I feel like I found a gem. My friend suggested this place to get a drink after work. We ordered a platter with cheese, duck, pork, and jam. It was so tasty! I definitely recommend the duck. It was the right amount of salty and just melted in my mouth.   I also ordered the 'Rose all day' flight, while my friend ordered the 'it's all about me' flight. She mostly got red wines, which she allowed me to sample. There was only 1 wine I didn't like, but I'm chalking that up to personal preference. If you're looking for a laid back place to get good wine and snacks, this is the place for you!

reviews.author: Bill G.
reviews.description: Really great service. Friendly, knowledgeable staff. Nice atmosphere. I'm not a wine expert but I've enjoyed the wines I tried. Of course like a nice wine bar they let you sample before you commit.   One thing I'll say, not as a criticism, but just so people are aware, the charcuterie boards have very small portions.   The only other thing is that a larger selection of wine by the glass would be nice, but it's by no means a small selection.

reviews.author: Bria S.
reviews.description: Extremely disappointed in our first time visit here. Met up with friends to celebrate graduating with our doctorates. We walked over after dinner at Supper at Hotel Emma where a few in our group had a few glasses of wine. We had a DD and also a pregnant woman in our group. After sitting down the waiter, Kevin, checked our IDs and then left the table without asking for our order or providing any insight on the wine offerings for the table. Instead, we were awkwardly approached again and were told that we had clearly been drinking before and they did not feel comfortable serving us any bottles of wine. No one in our group was acting belligerent or inappropriately. It was incredibly rude. We brought this to the attention of the staff on our way out and were told that they felt it was the appropriate call due to two people in our group stumbling - one of which was 8 months pregnant and had ordered a non-alcoholic beverage. A complete lie.   It is a shame that a poor judgement call was made before we were even able to give this place a chance. I have never received such terrible service.   The waiter, Kevin, needs to be taught on how to read customers and approach them in the appropriate manner if there is a serious concern for excessive alcohol consumption.

reviews.author: Keri M.
reviews.description: I love this place! It is always amazing! A low key chill spot with a huge selection on wine. The staff is always topping of your water or offering to get something.... it fabulous! Forever will be a favorite go to spot of mine!

name: Gristmill River Restaurant
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Dakota G.
reviews.description: Walked into the Gristmill about 7:55 P.M. on New Year's Eve 2021, not really expecting to be seated.  Surprisingly, the hostesses were very accommodating, and promised us the outside seating we requested "in about 20 minutes".  We were seated in five. Our server, Morgan, a lovely  young woman, a college student at a Texas University,  was impeccable in carrying out her duties, she gave us much better service one might expect on such a busy night as this was.  Everything was perfect, from the seating, to the food - onion rings, tortilla soup, the bronze catfish and the baby back ribs were all excellent. It was an amazingly wonderful experience made so by a diligent and attentive wait staff. Totally recommend the Gristmill River Restaurant

reviews.author: Tanya B.
reviews.description: We had so much fun at this restaurant! They are currently redoing the back so all of the seating was inside.. they had a nice warm fire going.. great views of the river inside.  It did get pretty toasty inside thankfully one of the waitresses came over and opened up the windows..   I ordered the steak salad and my friend ordered the chicken salad sandwich..  The steak salad was good, there was a handful of the lettuce that should have been tossed out not tossed into the salad which is why this isn't 5 stars.. The steak was good super tender!  We both loved the chicken salad sandwich.. it's not sweet which made it different and even more delicious!  I almost forgot the onion rings! I would absolutely order those again! Only able to eat one so I'd order the small but sooo good and not very oily at all!

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: Food was amazing but the service was lackluster. I will just blame covid. We ordered the onion rings as appetizers. Obviously we were forgotten. Ours appetizer finally arrived and then our meals 1-2 minutes later.   Good thing the onion rings were amazing. I had the chicken fried chicken and it was cooked perfectly and had a nice seasoning. The flat potato fries were a pleasant surprise with the perfect amount of seasoning salt.

reviews.author: Christii L.
reviews.description: If it wasn't for the view/location, I think I can totally rate it as 1, or if any.    The food was not the tastiest thing I have had. It was decent. It is as average as going to Jim's/IHOP (please don't be offended if you are a fan). But the price you have to pay for a side of onion rings (picture below), it was $11.99. Honestly, they were genuinely crazy prices for the quality and quantity.   The customer service is extremely bad. We were walked into our seated area. No one greeted us at a table until about 30-40 minutes in, and that's after we tried to get their attention. No one ever came back to check on us after the food was delivered, and we were even having a hard time to get the check. I personally wouldn't go back again.

reviews.author: Jessica R.
reviews.description: The one spot to grab a bite when you are in Gruene.  I enjoy the nice outdoor seating and view of nature. I had the margarita which was tasty and topped off with edible flowers.  The pulled pork sandwich was enough to share.  November is a great time of year to shop, eat, and enjoy the beautiful little town.

reviews.author: Keith W.
reviews.description: Must see! Everyone that comes to Gruene has been to the Gristmill. It is located right next to Gruene Hall and the water tower. This building is historic and used to be the cotton gin. I enjoy looking at the building every time I come here. I included a bunch of pictures so you can see the charm of this place.  I got seated right away but if you are coming on a weekend be prepared for a little bit of a wait. They do not do reservations so plan ahead. The good thing is that they have a ton of shaded outdoor seating if you have to wait. For an added bonus you can often hear the music from Gruene Hall.  I ordered the club with fries and it was great. Their fries are the best and I have never had a bad experience here. My wife also got the club sandwich and she loved it.   I have also done work events here and you can rent a room in the back. The service is always great which is nice being this is a tourist attraction.  If you haven't been here before then you have to put this on your itinerary while in Gruene. You won't regret it!

reviews.author: Damian P.
reviews.description: Cute aesthetic. Very big. Menu and food is fairly decent. Pricing can be a bit much. In terms of how sanitary it is, could definitely use some attention. Staff is friendly, however, many former employees have come forward to talk about how poor and cruel the management is. Not a good working environment.

reviews.author: Nina C.
reviews.description: This was probably the coolest restaurant that I went to while around San Antonio area.  This was actually previously a factory of some sort many moons ago.  It looked as if not much was changed from the original, or they just made it look that way.  I have to say, if you like AC while eating then it's best to find another restaurant.  They have fans and shade.  So when you walk in, it's right in the town of Gruene (pronounced Green), you can easily park in the little towns parking lot and just walk (if you're able).  My aunt informed me to NEVER come on the weekend or you'll be waiting a very long time because it's a hot spot.  Off to the side of the building there are countless benches that have mist oscillating fans so you don't have to pass out while waiting in the heat.  They do have live bands that come for entertainment, and an outside bar to order drinks while you wait.  I mean, if you have all that in the waiting area then it really must be worth it.  Luckily we sat right down on the week day.  We were given the option to choose inside or outside.  We went for outside. Now this restaurant has so many levels and stairs that lead you to the back of the building.   The waiter was fantastic, the food was incredible.  All-in-all it was a good experience.  I didn't talk too much about the food because you're more so going there for the atmosphere, and Gristmill definitely wins.

reviews.author: Steph B.
reviews.description: The Gristmill is an iconic restaurant for the Gruen (pronounced "green") New Braunfels (pronounced "new bronzefels") area.   I have been here many times and give the place 5 always because of location and ambiance and the he have had to -1 for food with the comment that sometimes the food is a five and other times it's a 3.   But I come back because it's a really cool place and when there's live music it's even more cool, yea more better.   I don't recommend the jalapeÃ±o margarita as it makes my lips hurt but I do recommend the jalapeÃ±o poppers because even tho they are hot the taste is so good you would eat them if they were shooting flames.   Have fun!

reviews.author: Alyssa L.
reviews.description: Ribs are tender, staff is friendly, and desserts were fantastic. What more could you want?

reviews.author: Christina T.
reviews.description: This restaurant used to be good. The amount of food you got was huge. They were known for their chicken fried steak. Well not anymore, it was tasteless.  The meat and gravy had no flavor. The green beans were good after you added the seasoned salt that was on the table.  It's a shame that the prices go up, portions go down and the quality goes down. The service was very slow. I found out the waitress was new and overwhelmed. We still gave her about a 30% tip because she was new.  I will say that the queso was good after we added pico to it.  Probably won't go back. So many other places are better for chicken fried steak.

reviews.author: Brian S.
reviews.description: Bacon wrapped filet and chicken fried steak were both fantastic. The onion rings were huge and very good. Spinach salad and mashed potato's both were very good  The service was very good - I just wish I wasn't so full

reviews.author: Danielle H.
reviews.description: Great place to meet with friends outdoors! Great food and drinks!!   Only thing that was bad about our experience was we had wasps wanting to come to our table the whole time.   I know it's hard to deter when you are drinking mimosas but just kinda downed the atmosphere some, the waiter seemed to help us though try to get rid of them, but not once did a manager come by to help even  though they walked by staring multiple times

reviews.author: Eric H.
reviews.description: We landed at this restaurant on our way home from an epic holiday weekend floating the Guadalupe River.. It's in Gruene,Tx near New Braunfels,Tx .. This restaurant is massive with nooks and crannies everywhere!! They also have an outdoor live music venue but unfortunately we weren't there foe the night life .. The food was delicious and the service was great  . If you go at night make sure to get in the wait list ASAP. We ate our food and then explored the town some to help digest all that good grub !! We stopped at a couple shops and got some ice cream as well !! I can't wait for our next trip to the river and this cool little town !!

reviews.author: Monty W.
reviews.description: We usually eat at the Gristmill every time we are in the area. It's pretty much our go-to. This last visit was on a Saturday evening that had a fairly big concert going on next door at Gruene Hall. We are anticipating a wait, but our quoted wait of 90 minutes turned into around 2 hours before being seated. Understandable as it's a busy place, but disappointing none the less.   We had come chips and Queso along with a frozen Sangria while we waited in the courtyard area for the text saying our table was ready. The snack was needed to keep us from getting hangry and the frozen Sangria was wonderful.   Once we were finally seated, we pretty much knew exactly what we wanted to order. No beating around the bush so to speak.   On this particular visit, we went with the Pasta Poblano Salad and the Beef Tenderloin Sandwich. They asked me how I would like the beef cooked. I requested "Medium" and they delivered. It's not your normal sandwich but man o man is it delicious!   It's summer time, peak tourist season. I fully expected a wait. I believe the staff was trying as hard as they could to get people through the door and to their table. I won't complain too much.  We'll definitely continue coming back to the Gristmill when we are in the area.

reviews.author: Mark M.
reviews.description: Took my wife here for her birthday today 3/1/2021. What a great old building and we felt totally safe with lots of distance. The rooms were all wonderful with the large fireplaces.   Our server was Chloe and see was very efficient and kind. My wife loved her fish but was did not love the round fries as much because she thought they were a little soggy. The crispy one were great. I ordered the chicken fried steak and it was perfect. The sauce on the side was great. The mash potatoes were very tasty but could have been hotter. I love hot food. It is a issue I have with all restaurants.   This is a beautiful building and we will definitely come back and enjoy the river once COVID is over. I bet the outdoor band areas are great in the summer. All in all much more to love about this place than minor little things.

reviews.author: Alexis S.
reviews.description: I had a pleasant visit to this restaurant. The food was delicious and yeasty. The food came in warm and pretty cook. The bathroom was clean, and the venue was well kept. Things that need improvement is on customer service. Our server, I think her name was Lexius, was sweet, but I think she was overwhelmed. We were a party of 7 people, and she rarely came and checked on us. Our drinks were not refilled, and it took us a while to receive our paycheck. As I said, everything was okay except the customer service needs improvement. I would return.

reviews.author: Kevin S.
reviews.description: My wife and I have tried the Gristmill several times but were always disappointed. The view of the river is fantastic but the food has always been bad at best. This time we stuck to appetizers and were much happier. The Spinach Quesadilla was cooked just right with a perfect blend of spinach and cheese where you could taste the spinach, not just cheese. As good as that was, the Tortilla Soup was absolutely delicious! Spice was applied to give plenty of flavor without being hot, and the chicken was delicious, tender and juicy. Even the margaritas were good! Definitely worth the stop for a quick bite to enjoy the view overlooking the river.

reviews.author: Ann G.
reviews.description: I highly recommend this place if you're in the New Braunfels area. My husband and I have been here twice already and so far they have not disappointed us. There is a wait but you can always put your name on the waitlist and walk around the Gruene area. Just a warning, they do not take reservations nor put your name on the waitlist over the phone.   We ordered the onion rings, spinach artichoke dip, and shared a medium well ahi tuna because their servings are huge. The onion rings are huge, good, and fresh out of the fryer. All of the items we ordered were delicious and recommended.   Lastly, the service was great despite it being a very busy Sunday. We sat outside - love the ambience of trees, the Guadalupe river and of course live music in the background. The small bugs are something we could not avoid due to it being summer time and the trees around so definitely bring bug spray.   Overall, I recommend this place if you're in the New Braunfels area.

reviews.author: Laney S.
reviews.description: The food was excellent. Service was exceptional. The weather was pleasant which is nice as the restaurant has no air conditioning. The ambiance makes up for that. Great experience

name: Halcyon
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Ryan Anthony H.
reviews.description: NICE SPOT FOR LOCAL COFFEE and I STRONGLY RECOMMEND ESPECIALLY TOURIST TO COME HERE I came here and really enjoyed it. The coffee was very good and I even ordered a delicious sandwich. My friend ordered a Mac n cheese and she told me it was very good.  I definitely want to come here again and try more from the menu. Also, this place isn't far from downtown so if you are either a local or a visitor you will definitely have to come check this place out.  Great for groups too!

reviews.author: Truth S.
reviews.description: I've always enjoyed the Halcyon coffee shops in Austin for years. My friend and I were visiting Sam Antonio and wanted to get brunch. Even though she said the last time she went (years ago) to the SA Halcyon, she didn't have a good experience, we decided to give the place another shot.  I called in an order (only a waffle with fruit and a latte. I was told it would be ready in 10-15 minutes. I had brought my dog to get her out and let her hang with me on the patio; but she is a rescue who sometimes gets nervous in public places, especially if I'm not right next to her. Since my friend was taking a while to arrive, I was forced to leave my dog out on the patio by herself. She started shaking as soon as I walked away. I thought, "I'm just gonna grab my food and should be back in under a couple of minutes. No biggie." WRONG.   There was a group of 3 people together ordering when I walked up and 2 other ladies behind them. I'm thinking "5 minutes tops"...Nope. The woman behind the register (though nice) was taking her sweet time and it took literally 15 minutes for her to take the first 3 people's orders. The 2 other ladies in front of me gave up and left. I didn't know if it was the customers who were so rudely slow or what was going on. Of course, I had the added stress of wanting to get back to my dog (no one's fault but my own); but the line got so long due to the slowness that it was curved almost to the side of the building by the time it was finally my turn!   After 15 minutes (and multiple people in line looking at each other annoyed and even making comments to each other about it), the 3 people finally walked away and it was my turn. I realized very quickly that the lady behind the register (a redhead with black glasses) was the issue. Again, I don't mean this as a personal attack because she was friendly; but my goodness, she does not need to be behind the register at all, let alone when the place is slammed.  There needs to be a separate place where someone is just picking up a to go order and wants to pay and bounce. By the time I finally got my food, my latte wasn't ready. So I went back to my dog and starting to eat. The waffle was totally soggy (from sitting there so long) and they put maybe 6 little slices of strawberries on the large Belgian waffle and maybe 6 thin slices of cantaloupe (I was told it would be strawberries and blueberries) when I asked and not only do I not like cantaloupe but also it's not a good fruit to put on a waffle anyway).  I was told to come back in "2 minutes" for my latte. I gave it 5 mins, walked in, nothing. Came back a few minutes later and he had finished making it (no other drinks were waiting at the bar); but somehow the latte was only lukewarm. My total for a soggy waffle with a few pieces of fruit and a latte came out to just under $19. Yowza.   I will continue to support the Austin Halcyon location but will certainly never go back to this one again. The guy behind me in line said the same thing.  I gave it 2 stars (instead of 1) simply because the two employees I interacted with were nice.

reviews.author: Rene R.
reviews.description: I came here even through it was less than 4 stars because I know sometimes people can be tough on restaurants but I should have gone with all the averages reviews and not came.  To start of the Benedict's English muffins were not cooked and they were smothered with cold butter, yuke .  Then my wife avocado toast to and out and it wasn't toasted and sent it back and waited almost 30mins and had to remind the person who brought out the food.  Lastly, my son's omelette was over cooked and smelled of it.  Listen, I'm a big foodie and appreciate quality food and don't mind paying more and in fact prefer but maybe what they need is to deliver quality food and not focus on just serving a long line.  Hopefully this doesn't fall on deaf ears, you've been warned.  Quick update my wife toast came out and still wasn't fixed and only half of it was toasted.  What the hell is going on here? Here is a pic to show proof

reviews.author: Nicole K.
reviews.description: I like the menu... but I can't even enjoy the food if I wait over 45 mins for breakfast. Yes they were busy- but there has to be a limit to the wait! As far as the food... it was not good. My sons side of sausage she ordered literally look like somebody has been taking bites of it! See pic for how it was presented to us. My daughters order was completely wrong.

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: The coffee was great! And the whole vibe of the restaurant was honestly really cool and they were playing some sweet tunes. Indoor and outdoor seating available which is nice. My only quarrel is that there were A LOT of flies inside. They were buzzing all around and even though inside was nice it didn't feel very clean at all. But my main issue was with the flies, I was kind of shocked with how many there were. It is a nice spot though and the coffee was actually really good so I think it still earns four stars in my book.   Pro tip: get the latte of the week it's usually something dope!    Overall: 3.93 stars

reviews.author: Lourna M.
reviews.description: Loved their brunch options, the skillet, the ambiance and the mimosas! Prompt service yet they don't rush you out - ample seating area, friendly service - great for brunch with the girls or lunch date.

reviews.author: Gabrielle R.
reviews.description: My family and I went to Halcyon on Christmas Eve and we had a great experience. The coffee and chorizo were great and our son really enjoyed his hot cocoa and waffle. We'll definitely be returning.

reviews.author: Aubree T.
reviews.description: I've been coming here for the past 4 years and have always loved this place.. but I'm giving it two stars because the past two times have let me down a little.  The place is hot. I work up a sweat in about 10 minutes just from sitting. I had trouble connecting my laptop to the wifi and was told to join a server (by an employee) which did not seem to work at all. I ordered an iced London Fog and a Turkey Brie sandwich. I got a hot London Fog (in August??), my sandwich and a different bag of chips from what I ordered. There are also a bunch of flies in the eating areas. This place is so cute and has the best vibe, I've just been sad my last two visits. :(

reviews.author: Grace L.
reviews.description: Super long wait and you can't make reservations. They seem to be severely understaffed so we did our best to be understanding about the crazy slowness, especially considering they had hiring positions on the front door.   They used to have $1 champagne flute mimosas and $2 wine glass mimosas. Maybe due to COVID it is now $3 and $6, which is still better than every other brunch place especially considering they give you 90+% champagne with a splash of juice, the way it should be :p i hope when the world "gets back to normal", they'll bring those back.  We got lavender mimosa and the grapefruit mimosa. The lavender one was too sweet for my taste, and the grapefruit one was alright.   I got the goat cheese arugula toast, and it was delicious. My boyfriend got the southwestern skillet because he was "suckered into ordering it because of the sweet potatoes", but sadly noted he couldn't even taste any sweet potato. The dish was too greasy and everything in it just tasted like grease.   We got the overnight french toast per a review recommendation, as a celebration for his birthday. The top half was delicious and rich, but the bottom half was literally burnt (pictured)!! I can't believe they would serve something so obviously BLACK and burnt. If i made that I'd cut it off and most definitely would not give it to a guest.

reviews.author: Amanda B.
reviews.description: Perfect place to get a cup of coffee or a specialty cocktail-either one will start your morning off right!   Stopped by to get a coffee while waiting for brunch in the area. Not busy at all, COVID measures were taken, masks required and work by staff. Social distancing was enforced as well.   Outside patio was open to sit and was a perfect spot to let the sun peak down on you while sipping your cup of joe.  Always greeted with a smile when I arrive so I am sure I will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Elizabeth G.
reviews.description: I like the ambiance and that you can sit down on the patio and drink your coffee. It was pretty slow, though.

reviews.author: Shantel S.
reviews.description: We were so excited to eat here but everything was a let down. We waited around 30 minutes to get seated. After being seated it was another 10 mins before our drink order was taken - 2 lattes, 1 hot chocolate, 1 smoothie and 1 coke. 20 mins after our drink order was taken we get our coke and smoothie, the waitress said the lattes and hot chocolate would be another 5-10 mins. She also took our food order at this time. 35 mins later our food is delivered (still haven't received our 2 lattes and 1 hot chocolate) and every dish but one was cold. Country style Benny was wrong and cold. Husband asked for sausage gravy on it but got chorizo gravy, asked for side of bacon - no bacon, asked for crispy well cooked potatoes - they were hard and way undercooked and all of his food was cold. He also ordered a plain waffle with whipped cream - it wasn't brought out with our food. My daughter ordered the s'mores pancakes, it wasn't made how it's described in the menu. There is no graham cracker crumbles - instead two graham crackers are thrown on top. There is no homemade marshmallow topping, instead a few large marshmallows thrown on top, there is no Nutella drizzled on it, instead Hershey's syrup. Her pancakes were also cold. My son ordered the French toast. Flavor was good but again it was served cold. He ate most of it with his hands because it took another 15 mins for him to get his silverware. This is when our 2 lattes were delivered (room temp, not hot but not cold)  - still waiting on 1 hot chocolate too. My burrito was the only dish that was served warm but the filling wasn't what I ordered. I asked for bacon, sausage, egg, cheese and potatoes plus avocado. It had no bacon and also had ham. Even though it was wrong, it was still good. My daughters hot chocolate finally arrives and I ask again for my husband waffle, it quickly comes out with fruit all over it (we asked for whipped cream only). The waffle was good and warm.  The bill comes and I ask the waitress to remove the extra bacon charge since my husband never got it. That took another 10 mins. She brings the iPad back so we can pay and she already had 20% tip added and asks for me to sign. Sorry, but the service we got wasn't worthy of any tip to be honest. I changed the tip to 15%, which was very generous considering my son ate almost his entire French toast with his hands because it took her that long to bring him silverware after we asked for it repeatedly. Stay away and go to IHOP instead.

reviews.author: Tiff D.
reviews.description: A few visits here and I'm indifferent.  My brunch bowl was good but the breakfast sandwich was a sad excuse for a breakfast sandwich.  1 piece of extra limp bacon and no seasoning, overcooked egg...

reviews.author: Jennifer F.
reviews.description: We were here to eat and drink on a Friday night. They were pretty busy, but it was mostly college students studying and drinking coffee. We almost felt like we were disturbing study club - haha! We had the Gouda Burger, Nacho Tots, and a couple of beers. Everything was great and came out quickly. Perhaps a different crowd on a Saturday, but Friday appears to be for the studious!

reviews.author: Julieann B.
reviews.description: Pretty good food. Cool looking spot. I had the salmon Benedict and it was decent. Husband said the chicken and waffles was pretty good. Not hot enough though on either

reviews.author: Brandon T.
reviews.description: What can you expect at halcyon?  No greetings at the door, or employees telling you what is a designated place to order (all while you and other customers are standing around not getting acknowledged or instructed).  Less then stellar customer service by the employees taking orders and getting overcharged (based on the menu prices). Ordered a  Vietnamese iced coffee ($5) and a Long Island iced coffee ($10) and my total came out to $18 and some change.  When I asked about the curious total, I was met with a shrug of the shoulder answer and not with a itemized receipt. I tipped a dollar and thought that I was maybe misinterpreting what was going on.  My wife and I then stepped to the side and waited for our drinks (all the while another couple gave us a side glance and a smirk as to say "they saw what was going on also") We waited on the side for our drink. A couple of drinks were put up on the bar top and not one time did a barista yell out a name or a order. After a few minutes my wife approached the table and saw our name written on the ticket (a iced drink that was sitting on the bar melting away). The barista then said , yes that is yours if your name is on it. We went with friends from out of town and were proud to brag and boast of our city and what the new development is bringing, but after this performance we were left with mud on our face and the "charm" of Texas to be all but a thing of the past.

reviews.author: Daniel Z.
reviews.description: I've been here a few times and loved the Latte. However I made the mistake of getting matcha this time. It was busy noon time, the barista didn't ask me whether I want my matcha to be sweetened, and just added sugar anyway. And it came out way too sweet and completely masked the bitter and savory taste matcha usually has. If anyone wants sweet matcha, why not just eat candy?!

reviews.author: Celeste  A.
reviews.description: I only have a picture of our drinks because I dug right into my pancakes!! They were absolutely delicious!!! Both the drinks and food. This was cute little place that seems to be very popular and busy so be ready to wait. The staff was very nice and tentative.  This is a great place for brunch. They have a few things on the menu that I need to go back and try.

reviews.author: Elizabeth A.
reviews.description: Today was my third visit to Halcyon and I love this place.  They've changed things up since COVID, but the food and drinks are still high quality.  I've had most of their brunch menu, and it is all amazing. Cannot go wrong with a skillet or waffles! Also--bloody Mary's, mimosas (always get a double!), and craft coffees are great for brunch snobs like myself. Today I got one of each  Definitely will be back. With cool weather rolling in, their porch is the best!!!  PSA: the line can get long--just be patient, it's worth it!

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: Service is so slow. When I got in line there was about 3 people ahead of me and that took about 15 minutes in line. Then I get to the front and I just want to order a coffee for my walk back and the girl decides to stop taking orders to bus a table when there's about 18 other open tables. Instead of grabbing a tray she decides making 5 trips with a few things at a time is better. I'm now waiting an additional 10 minutes just watching them work, granted they were doing stuff but there wasn't enough staff and the lack of efficiency was killing me. The table is clean so I think she'll come back for orders since now the line is out the door and she starts rolling silverware.  I left without any coffee and I was first in line but I figured at the pace they were moving it would be another 30 minutes. This is the second time I've come at around noon and have waited too long for coffee.

reviews.author: Dinorah C.
reviews.description: I finally got to try out this place for the first time. If I could give it 3.5 stars, I would, but 3 is too low.   Drinks- Hurricane was just right and so was the French Quarter Margarita  Food: Ordered the seafood fondue appetizer to start off. The flavor was perfect. For something that should contain seafood in it, it did not have enough to be worth $16. I also ordered the Sea Bass entree. That was also very well made, but not worth the $40 in my opinion.  Ended the night with a slice of cheesecake. It was good, but not great. The crust was too soft.   Service: our waiter was great! Checked on us quite often and ensured we were taken care of.   Will I be back? Maybe

reviews.author: Ashleey L.
reviews.description: Better than papadeux in my opinion as a person from Louisiana.  Catfish and shrimp fried is my go to with dirty rice.  Best bread oil dip.. never knew that was thing before. It's not the best but it will do.
