After ordering, I didn't expect the turnaround to be quick, so we waited about 30-40 min for our pizza, quite enjoying it a lot. The kicker is after we ordered our pizza around 7:50p we did not see our waitress until around 8:45p...even asking other employees for her to come to our table to cash out. She didn't apologize once or try to give any sort of excuse. So, it took over 3 hours to have dinner at a pizza place which is just absurd. It seemed like there were a decent amount of employees working, so I'm not sure how it took so long to just have basic service. The music was also SUPER loud, so it was hard to hear anyone talk. There are plenty of other good pizza places out here that would have better service. I would give this place 1 star if the pizza wasn't actually really good, but I will not be back.

reviews.author: Mish I.
reviews.description: Visiting from south FL n this was probably the best Caesars salad I've had in my life n the pizza was fantastic! I told my gfs I would so drive here to pick up this pizza... Vibe was FANTASTIC!!! Music was AMAZING!! Food, AMAZING!! Service, AMAZING!! My fav restaurant in my SA visit...Good job, guys!!

reviews.author: Shawnee S.
reviews.description: The most amazing Brunch $5 French 75's. Struggling with food choices and Celeste was amazing. Eggs Barbaro and Fried Chicken Zeppole was delicious. We will be back!!!

reviews.author: Martha R.
reviews.description: I sadly made the choice to order online from Barbaro last night thinking it would be easier and quicker than Grimaldi's. When my boyfriend went to pick up the pizza he was told by the restaurant that their online tickets weren't printing and he would have to wait another 30 minutes for the order. While I can understand technology snafus, not even offering a discount or a free drink while he waited is just poor customer service. In addition, once the pizza arrived at the house... It wasn't even warm. We had to put it in the toaster oven. The quality of the pizza was average, not much flavor and crust was dry. I am noting 2 stars because we did also order salads that were excellent. For 50.00 plus dollars... this meal was disappointing.

reviews.author: Proz T.
reviews.description: The first time I came to Barbaro was in 2017, I loved it. Food and service and was great. Last night I came for a late dinner with my significant other. That was my second and last time. I hate to say, but the bad reviews here are accurate and I should've heeded the warnings. I really hate picking places apart but I feel Barbaro needs more feedback and maybe I can save another innocent patron from a bad experience. So here goes....  You can't have roasted tomatoes as a $2 pizza topping and serve hot sliced tomatoes lol. Look at these pictures and then google roasted tomatoes. Shame on you Barbaro. Secondly, pizza is clearly undercooked. Why would someone want to eat slices of raw dough with slippery cheese and hot cherry tomatoes.   Our server, who's name was never given to us, came by twice during our whole 50 minute experience. Once to take our order and then once to ask if we wanted a to go box when she the raw pizza sitting on the table, no longer being touched. She was very standoffish and hardly attending to us.   I politely expressed that the pizza was not cooked and asked if we could just pay for our drinks. She said "oh sorry to hear that" and left in a flash. Lol. Didn't care to address anything, didn't offer to remedy the situation, didn't even offer to get us more drinks. So I felt maybe it's just standard for Barbaro to not care about retaining patrons and they did not want my business. Eh, so be it. After waiting another 15 minutes for the bill. Our server said thanks and dismissed us in a flash.   Sad to say, my 4 year hiatus from Barbaro should have remained permanent. That was the worst food experience I've had in a while. Good luck, hope you all can get your act together and do as well as you did back in 2017.

reviews.author: Eric P.
reviews.description: Always satisfied.   Sunday brunch.   Happy hour.  I am so happy there is gluten free pizza that is actually good and like an almost deep dish Chicago.  Almost.  Not as thick.    Great energy inside and staff to make it worth while.

reviews.author: Sandra W.
reviews.description: Well I want to and probably will with my special disabled dog which is why I order these deliverables.   However you can if you use deliiiveverbble: like uvereats

reviews.author: Jenna A.
reviews.description: FAN-Fing-TASTIC.  I know what you're thinking, amazing food...but the service tho.  Well, stop. The food is still amazing and the service has leveled WAY up.  Greeted at table:  2 Mins (w/ water) Drinks from bar to table: 5ish Mins (food order taken) Food (salad course - with our gluten free option worked in beautifully): 15ish mins? Food: Main Course - 25ish mins Another Alcohol Drink - 35 mins  Outta here check and boxes in tow... a leisurely 55 mins. (We took our time.)   Come for the first time or try it again.  It's amazing.  (P.S. Jade was outstanding.)

name: Mad Dogs British Pub River Walk
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Loneta E.
reviews.description: My BFF and I came to San Antonio for a much needed holiday de-stress.  Mad Dogs British Pub was on the list provided for Riverwalk Nightlife and - after seeing that they offered karaoke on Mondays - we put it on our ToDo list.  WE WERE NOT DISAPPOINTED!!! The karaoke DJs, LiGaya and KimBo, are the liveliest hosts I have ever encountered.  They sing, dance AND interject comedy.  Mind you, while it may not be for the faint of heart you are guaranteed to have a ton of fun!  BEST... SHOW... EVER!!!

reviews.author: Leslie H.
reviews.description: For what it was, it was great It was New Years eve afternoon and the restaurant was very busy We had our dog so we sat outside right next to the river...perfect! My husband ordered bangers and mash, he said they were great!   Drinks were excellent  Great ambiance  Very reasonably priced We will definitely return when in San Antonio!

reviews.author: Rick K.
reviews.description: Had a Great Time hanging at Mad Dog's on Riverwalk - Good Food, Live Music - Lots of Fun.   Stayed durning Christmas - ended up at MDB everyday - simply because that it was open later than most other places around that area and it was FUN to hang.  Waitresses are friendly and work super hard, they were constantly moving fill orders.   our regular waitress was Faith - Love Her !  The food is decent - we had cottage pie, cheeseburger and hot cracklings (basically warmed up pork rinds - they were really good). It's everything you would expect from a British type pub,   If you're in the area looking for decent food and a fun time head over to Mad Dogs.  Cheers

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: How to describe this experience?  We went straight in and was seated right away. Service was friendly bit slow. Food was good. They were short-staffed for Christmas Eve night which is understandable. We had run down and get our own silverware so we could eat before our food got cold. Our server did check on us periodically and was running her tail off so we didn't take it personally. Now, the price was a little high but that could be because I ordered a $40 glass of Johnnie Walker Blue. Glad I did before going out and spending $175 to try this whiskey. Definitely not worth the money for this whiskey. All and all, this was a pretty darn good restaurant.

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: We've always had good meals and service at Mad Dogs, we did skip them during covid 'cause they didn't have any scotch eggs, they do them very well here and now there back.  Wifey and I shared an order of eggs and an "Italian Job" flatbread.  We drank a nice love street lite from Karbach, an on tap pilsner that hit the spot.  We noticed a small sign on the table advertising a tuesday special 5 dollar frozen daiquiri.....yes please!  The service was as good as the grub.  The men's restroom wasn't Buc-ees but it was close.  If you haven't tried a Scotch egg, do so, you'll thank me later, seriously.  Posted some pics, check 'em out.

reviews.author: Holli A.
reviews.description: Our server was great she was very attentive. The chicken strips and spinach and artichoke dip was great. The jerk chicken dipping sauce was great.  However, the women's restroom was disgusting. The toilets and toilet seats had poop stains on them. There was no paper towels to dry our hands... only toilet paper. I just can't get the visual out of my head.  Again our server was great and so was the food.

reviews.author: Alexa S.
reviews.description: The fish and chips are were freaking amazing! Huge portion too. And the target sauce had a great tang. Would definitely go back

reviews.author: Doug S.
reviews.description: On the river walk and did not want TexMex again. It was lunch time Mad Dog opened at noon, so we waited for them to open. Mad Dog has a nice patio good shade, so we sat on the patio. Greeted by the hostess and our waitress very good service. They do have a good indoor sitting area with a large bar if want air-conditioning. When it is very hot, I would go inside.  The food is British pub fare I went with the fish and chips. The fish was fried well a very big piece of white meat fish. Not heavily battered fish very good flavor I would get it again. The chips or fries were good the coleslaw was prepped very well. I love tartar sauce with my fish and Mad Dog had some very good tater sauce. I asked for more because the fish was so large.  It was Sunday and they have drink specials we had a couple of mimosa with our meal. We had a nice time at Mad Dog great location for sitting and people watching on the river.

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Service: As soon as we stepped on the stairs, one of the staffs approached and assisted us. Get us a table and chairs and gave the menu. They even recommend good beer for one of our accompany. They were nice and prompt, which was what we need at that time.   Place: It was a good vibes, even outside or inside of the restaurant. The interior was amazing that feels like you go back to a specific time.  Food: The food was good, there's some that not much really worthy but the egg appetizer was good and fish and dips. The crusty bread with meat and egg on top and meat below, they were the same aside from the top. It's not that good for me. The spinach dip was really good but you can taste the chips was from a bag and kind of stale a little. The beer was amazing especially the one they recommended but for food, it's only few we liked.   We loved the environment and service!

reviews.author: Heather G.
reviews.description: We had the best time at Mad Dogs!! We went to listen to the live music and ended up meeting the most amazing bartender!! He made us feel like we had been friends forever! Thank you, Esteban, for making our visit wonderful! You will definitely see us again when we visit San Antonio!! KEEP BEING AWESOME!!! Can't end this review without thanking DOUG for the drinks and conversations!! We will continue to love each other and be happy!! Hope you find your life long love!! You deserve it!!

reviews.author: Stacey P.
reviews.description: I appreciate people who not only tolerate me at my worst but can either overlook it or make it seem like they overlooked it.   I came here on my last day in San Antonio. I was a little off kilter because of a variety of events that made me feel stressed. Shortly after being shown my seat for lunch I get this panicky call from work just as Helayna, my waitress, came to greet me. I feel horrid because I have to shake my head and gesture I can't talk right at that moment because panicky work call. I get that resolved and apologize for my rudeness but I feel sprawled out with the work backpack and cords and the whole nine yards.   I feel like an absolute mess.   But Helayna seemed completely unfazed. She smiled at me happily and told me not to worry. She was an excellent waitress checking in on me frequently and making sure that I had what I needed.   I ordered the fish and chips after finding out they were allergy safe. I recall being in London and I will admit this is more classically a UK fish and chips than ones we are here in the US. I can't say it was the most flavorful that I have had, but I still thought the fillet was good and those fries were very easy to eat. The cocktails, too, were very good. I am happy that this was the last place I had lunch.

reviews.author: Brian S.
reviews.description: Don't go to Mad Dogs to eat.  We ordered a burger, chicken sandwich, and Caesar salad.  All the food was very poor quality to say it kindly.   My friend said the hamburger at McDonald's was better than his burger from Mad Dogs.    Do go to Mad Dogs for the atmosphere along the River walk.  They had live music and also nice seats right on the river.    To sum up, if you are looking for a good place to eat please avoid this restaurant.  If you are looking for a pleasant place to drink and hang out along the river this might be your spot.

reviews.author: Jacqueline V.
reviews.description: Wedge okay, fish and chips per my husband we're MEH...however the nachos were yum! Love the live music, but otherwise the atmosphere wasn't for me.

reviews.author: Dominic C.
reviews.description: This was a great choice on the river walk   The fish tacos for lunch were light and tasty   Our server Naomi was extremely attentive.  Do ask for her if you come here   The view and setting wasn't pleasent and fun  I would come here agai for sure

reviews.author: Misty G.
reviews.description: This was a surprise win. We were just walking down the riverwalk, looking for something to eat. I'm a vegetarian, so we always have to scope out the menu before we pick a place. And we were surprised to see a few items I could eat, mostly since this was "pub food". I think we got one of the best tables in the house, it was outside, on the top level, and was on the river side.   We didn't see mimosas on the menu, but we asked for them, and I got one. Our server also offered a manmosa, which honestly, we weren't listening when she said the ingredients. And it was a little strange. I recommend sticking with a regular mimosa.   And then there was the food!! We got an order of buffalo cauliflower and both ordered the portobello sandwich. The cauliflower was thick and flakey and soft and covered in soft and it was soo delicious. The portobello was amazing! It popped with flavor. The grilled peppers, shroom and cheese is a winning combination.   Our server was super nice and we even got our picture taken by a rotating photographer on the river.

reviews.author: Lauren G.
reviews.description: Good food, music and service. Seated quickly and food came out fast. Waitress was super nice and attentive.

reviews.author: Lisa B.
reviews.description: This place is adorable! Cute atmosphere, cute waitresses in cute outfits! Live music! It's just the best. This is located right on the river walk. Stop by for a late night drink and enjoy the live music. The water melon margarita mixed with white claw drink is amazing FYI! I'd go again if I was in the area. Good prices, great people!

reviews.author: David C.
reviews.description: Very nice British pub.  I really liked the decor and style of the restaurant. Server was very good, friendly and helpful with the menu.  She told me about one item I've never heard of-- bubbles and squeakers. It was very good (cabbage cooked in mashed potatoes). The price was reasonable and fair.  If we lived in the area this would be one of my regular visits

reviews.author: Aaron W.
reviews.description: Food and atmosphere are fantastic; service sucked.   Had to go get out own  drinks multiple times.  Sad because the place has a cool vibe.   Too many staff members standing around looking at tik-tok.   Staff not trained no what drinks are available; asked for a Moscow Mule and she said we only have the one on the menu.  What a joke.

reviews.author: Matt F.
reviews.description: This place is ridiculous. Friends and I spent several hundred dollars here throughout the night and end up getting cut off due to a glass slipping off the table on its own and smashing. This place doesn't know what good business is. Clearly, based off their previous reviews this place is a joke. Don't come here if you're tryna have fun. Go ANYWHERE ELSE but here. This place is full of incompetents.

name: Twin Peaks
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Alexia G.
reviews.description: It was my 1st time there it was amazing. I would love to go back there as soon as possible

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Not my typical setting, but I had a fantastic time here! The food was decently good; however, what surprised me was a section on the menu called Grandpa's Stash. I ordered myself a Bulletit Rye Old Fashion.. Amazing!

reviews.author: Ellen E.
reviews.description: I'll preface this review by saying you pretty much get what you expect with twin peaks. Ifyou're coming here for happy hour, they have great food /drink deals. M-F 2-7 happy hour.  $4 mozzarella bites, queso, or fried pickles. The mozzarella bites are always solid. Good drink specials. I'm majorly disappointed in the cost cutbacks they've made regarding food. I used to be a huge fan of the chicken Cobb salad that was LOADED with blue cheese, chicken, eggs, cabbage, carrots, and bacon. This time when I got it it was majority lettuce. I didn't find any blue cheese or bacon in the salad at all. Our friends always got the appetizer platter as their meal and they cut back on the size for that as well. So if you're coming for drinks/to watch a game it's great. Otherwise it's meh.

reviews.author: Jeremy A.
reviews.description: Service was bad, took a long time to get wings and nachos, took 45 mins. Server was not attentive and the place was not crowded at 11p. Take your money to WHATABURGER instead.

reviews.author: Bryon M.
reviews.description: If you cant tell from some of my previous reviews, I am a fan of Twin Peaks. Pre-covid, I was travelling for work, and I would try to visit locations throughout the country whenever I could. San Antonio has 3 locations. I visted one SA location 3 years ago. This is visit number 2, to a different location in SA. I got seated right away, and the person who sat me was also my server. She was really nice and attentive. The place was busy. Employees were wearing masks and they had divders placed in between certain tables and I think at the bar. Started off with some chips and salsa. Peaks and Chuy's have the best chips. Maybe the same provider? My main meal was the Southern Fried Chicken Sandwich, minus tomatoes. The sandwhich came out nice and hot, same with the fries. It was cooked and prepared perfectly. I highly recommend.

reviews.author: Tess H.
reviews.description: So the food at this place is relatively good. The billionaire bacon and the burger that features this bacon happens to be one of the best burgers I've ever tasted. From the seasoning to the toppings, the burger gives you a perfect bite from beginning to end.  I decided to order wings and I feel like Dr. Nowzaradan from my 600lb life was shaking his head with disapproval. Maybe that's why they were red beneath the surface. Yep. I received wings that were undercooked and paid for it royally. Special shout-out to the Pepto Gods for the special stomach coating that shielded me from further harm or danger.   I'm hoping Yelp leaves this up because this is the absolute truth.   Case in point, don't be greedy. The food is good but don't go overboard. I'd rather order takeout because I'm not there to scantily clad women. I'm in it for a good burger and the scrumptious bacon. But for the wings this place would have 4-5 stars.

reviews.author: Jake L.
reviews.description: Okay so lets face it not many men or women to a certain extent go to places like this for the food. Beautiful women, drink specials and saturation of Sports and music coming from every corner does make a meet up or after work winddown especially inviting. So I met my buddy there looking forward to a meal I actually enjoy here The Chicken and Waffles only to find out thwy no longer serve them. Saddness and disappointment. But that's alright.  Our welcoming cute Pixie server Vida informed us they were still only using online menus. I always thought that was cool unless you didn't have a cellphone, then well therescan awkward moment of havi g to look over at other tables to see your options.  I opted for the chicken and shrimp with a side of Mac and cheese ( the best part of the plate) the chicken strips were tiny and the grilled " blackened" shrimp were light on flavor and sparce. I was a little disappointed in the portions as it looked more like it came off the kids menu. Fortunately they have a decent dessert menu. I ordered the apple turn overs. Vida informed me they were her personal favorite, she had to cut back on ( slight eye roll in the vain of absolute forbidden deliciousness) she was on point they were good, really good. I only wish the rest of my meal was at that calibre. I do enjoy going there, I don't drink and realized a long time ago that the women are beautiful but it's there job and they do it well. So I'm left with gsthering with my buds for a couple of hours of comroderery, maybe some binle study ( just kidding) and the food. As far as that goes, TP you need to bring your game back up because your slacking. If the food was as good as the service that would be fine with me.

reviews.author: Anthony M.
reviews.description: Came here for a quick meal, around 3 in the afternoon.  Somewhat busy, but was seated quickly. The server, Sabrina, however was quick to tell us she was behind on service and she had to take care of a big party first. We gave her our drink orders and she didn't bring them back for 10 minutes.  We ordered chips and salsa and the chips came out before the drinks. However, the chips were covered in oil from the fryer, but were cold.  We didn't get to order our actual meals for 15 minutes and they when they came out, it was really disappointing for my son after his game. The fries were thrown on the plate, burger looked smashed down, and didn't have any if the sides in it. He was too hungry to send it back.  Never coming back. I have been let down by this location for the last time. Get better management. I'll make the trip to the other location in town, but they're not great either.

reviews.author: EdmÃ©e C.
reviews.description: if i could give 0 stars he would . our server kayla completely forgot about our order TWICE and had us wait for our food for almos 2 hours. she wrote it down two times because she lost the paper where she wrote it and came back a third time to write it down again because she NEVER put it in. this was a very bad experience and other people were getting their food before us from her and she didn't forget about them. terrible experience.

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: We came in for a late lunch today and let me start off by talking about the management, Laura with the crazy red hair, is hands-down one of the most attentive and best restaurant managers I've come across in a long time being in the food industry service for over 10 years myself, she was amazing, I have a dairy allergy, as soon as the server put our food order and she came and stopped by our table and checked in on us to make sure that everything was perfect for me and was just overall very sweet and attentive to not only us, But to almost every other table in the building she had amazing customer service and was just an all around great person, not the normal manager you come across but all the employees seemed to really respond well to her, and that's the best thing you can ask for in any restaurant setting also our server Kiana sorry if I misspelled her name was absolutely super sweet and amazing, compared our last experience here is a complete 180 and will definitely be back and ask for her again

reviews.author: Ashley C.
reviews.description: They never have blue moon . I love the blue moon draft but they never have it . It's not even busy lol and they don't have happy hour anymore

reviews.author: YunnÃ¡n C.
reviews.description: I normally don't bother going to poorly rated places but gave this one a try. I am a chicken wing lover and had never tried these. Ordered them to-go and the girl working there was completely clueless saying things like "uhhhh I think so" when asking if we could order as many flavors as we want. Typically we get to pick 2 and didn't trust her so we picked lemon pepper and garlic Parmesan. The wings came out with no flavor. Hardly any seasoning and the garlic parmasean just tasted like garlic.   Post-stay-at-home wings were disgusting and slimy. I don't know if they are just using old inventory to make up for lost revenue but they were some of the worst, flavorless wings I've ever had plus they forgot our side order of fried pickles. They did not seem to be respecting the required 6' social distancing as the parking lot and lobby were full of people.  If I could rate 0 stars, I would. I don't care too much for going somewhere to eat for girls, at least get the food right...garbage of an establishment.

reviews.author: Kiiya V.
reviews.description: All I have to say about this place is that the waitresses are not trained to serve food and the manager there is racist and homophobic. PERIOD!!

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: This place is large, busy and cheerful during this Covid gloominess. The food is very good and priced right. There's not much to complain about overall. Oh, the service...go and judge for yourself.  Their venison chili is spicy and very good and they have good ribs with delicious mac and cheese sides. we did not like their coleslaw, it was terrible. But, heck, that is such a small part of a great place.

reviews.author: Joanna R.
reviews.description: Cold beers! Good atmosphere and good food!  Melon ball is a good shot to try! Lol It's always a good vibe there!

reviews.author: Rachell D.
reviews.description: My family and I came for dinner, we were seated and then forgotten about. A guy came in right after us and all the waitresses seemed to be all over him, (not sure why, he wasn't even cute) I had to go up to the host stand where there was about 7 waitresses and asked "Do I have a waitress ?" They all jumped up and I finally got a waitress. Food was good and I had a beer but of course our waitress wasn't attentive so I was not able to order another beer or much of anything else.

reviews.author: Rich S.
reviews.description: Stopped in for a quick bite and a beer seeing I was in the area.  Larger then the spot on I-10 north of here. Monday afternoon wasn't busy at the bar. Sat at the bar and was given a menu and ordered a beer.  Took a few minutes for the barmaid to come back to get my food order but that was ok.  Barmaid wasn't all that friendly. Food came it was ok. Got breaded wings dry rub. Very dry. Finished my beer 1/2 way through the wing. But glass at the edge of the bar. Took a while for the barmaid to come check on me I had to stop one to get another beer. Not the idea of sitting at the bar.  Probably won't return to this location. The I-10 one was much better.  Service and all.

reviews.author: Jacqueline V.
reviews.description: Went to this location with my bf on a Saturday there was no wait time. Walking up to the hostess they both looked miserable we got no greeting or anything they just looked at us until I said table for 2 please. Our server came up took our drinks and appetizer order which came out cold and right before our actual food order. Our server was not very attentive or friendly she wouldn't give me the time to actually order or ask for anything she would quickly drop off refills after a while and just walk away without asking if we needed anything. Our appetizer, food and drinks from the bar all got dropped off at the table by different workers and our server never came up to ask if we were okay till the end when I asked for a to go box and the check. If you are not a group of men giving all your attention to these women I would not recommend this place they will not give you the time of day.

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: Why this location has only 3 stars is beyond me. I must be missing something for sure.  We went for my daughters 22nd and had a really good time. The food was excellent and the young lady taking care of our fairly large group split into 2 tables (kids included) took excellent care not to forget about us. She was super friendly and paid extra attention to the kids table. In my book that's worth double the tip, which we were happy to oblige. We were able to enjoy ourselves and not have to worry if they were having a good time too in this very grown up place.  Will definitely be holding more gatherings at this location.

reviews.author: Oliver B.
reviews.description: We received excellent customer service and the burger was delicious. The atmosphere was very nice with a lot of big screens to watch sports. The beer they make is very good and reasonably priced. It's $4.99 for a 22oz beer. The burger had a lot of flavor and I'm happy that I was able to substitute the fries for tatter tots. I really enjoyed my time at Twin Peeks. It's definitely better than Hooters.

name: Brick House Tavern + Tap
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Met my parent here for dinner tonight! Loved the atmosphere and set up of the restaurant! We got mozzarella sticks for an appetizer and I will say they had some marinara sauce that had a little kick to it. The crust on the mozzarella sticks and a lot of seasoning as well, but if you are one who likes that then definitely order these! I split the lobster Mac and cheese with my mom and we both loved it! Tried some of my dad's steak as well as the green beans and I was very impressed. There were parts of the steak that weren't as tender than other parts of the steak, but I still really liked it! I am typically not a fan of green beans, but I'm assuming they were cooked differently with different seasonings and I thought they were so good! Definitely want to come back here again!

reviews.author: Mary M.
reviews.description: Service sucks, food meh. Had to ask 3-4 different servers for napkins.  Utensils ect.  Our server didn't even ask what sides we wanted. Cauliflower wings appetizer has 5 pieces at best. Burger was not worth the price. Will not be coming back

reviews.author: Krystal S.
reviews.description: Ehhh, this place was just ok. The appetizer we ordered they were out of one of the items so we substituted more wings which was fine. Nothing other than the wings on the appetizer was really good anyway so glad we got extra wings! I ordered an old fashioned and it was made with regular ice vs 1 large cube so it watered down VERY quickly which was a bummer. EntrÃ©es were so so, Nothing great but nothing terrible either. The place was pretty dead for a Saturday so I'm assuming this wasn't a fluke for the subpar food and drinks. Service was ok, again nothing outstanding but not bad either. In a large city there are so many better places to eat and grab a drink so I don't think we would return sadly.

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: This place has been very consistent in service and food. Today I tried their deviled eggs w bacon and paprika and I've had their steak on my previous visit. I had a zombie last time and it was a great treat if you like rum. Definitely consistent on flavor and made with love.  They have many options for all types of cravings and hunger levels. I tried their peanut butter old fashioned this visit and this is a delicious, unique twist on the old fashioned I will return for. The atmosphere is classy and laid back at the same time. Definitely, my type of environment. The customers were mostly dressed up with some in casual wear. I like that the bar wraps around so you have the option to sit inside or outside. I chose outside since it was a nice day in the 70's with good cloud coverage. The attentiveness of the bartender (long dark hair lady ,Taylor I believe ) was perfect. I can tell she reads her clients. She didn't forget about me, but she left me alone enough to enjoy my food and entertainment. Great spot and never disappoints.

reviews.author: Ronnie A.
reviews.description: Food is overpriced and subpar at best. Server didn't even know what came on a sandwich they sell. And e don't even think about paying with a Brick House  gift card because they'll tell you they are a "non-chain" restaurant. Trust me you're not good enough to be that.

reviews.author: Katy B.
reviews.description: We choose this restaurant because of their advertised gluten free options. Big mistake. I tried to order 3 different things off of their menu and they were out of all of them. I settled for some absolutely disgusting Brussels sprouts that had an even worse mayo type dip that went with them. My husband ordered a burger that was good except for the bacon that he paid extra for was nasty.  My two children had okish meals. We paid $100 and left disappointed and hungry. Our waitress was very nice though.  Save yourself the time, money, and energy and go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Josephine G.
reviews.description: This place has so much potential but sadly, in my opinion, falls short. They are frequently out of items on the menu, which I guess you could chalk up to Covid but watered down cocktails and old wine are inexcusable. We ordered the French onion soup and it was almost cold, the wings were on par with something you would grab at heb and heat up in the oven. If they could get the food up to standard it could be a really great place. I think like us, most folks go here because they can't get In anywhere else.

reviews.author: LaRonda G.
reviews.description: For this Saturday night takeout adventure I wanted to try a new restaurant so I decided on this place. I placed my order through GrubHub. I orderd Guiness onion soup,  druken pork chop with mac and cheese and the crispy brussel sprouts. The food was packed very well in plastic containers and still hot when it arrived. The soup had a good flavor which was perfect for a rainy day. The pork chop was a bit overcooked so it was tough to cut but it had great flavor and marinade so I powered through. The brussel sprouts were cooked well but lacked seasoning. Once I added some salt they were fine. The same for the mac and cheese,  no salt at all. Once I added salt and pepper the mac and cheese tasted much better. Overall I wouldnt be opposed to give this restaurant a try again. That pork chop sauce was really good. I am not sure if the offer bread when you dine in (didn't see it on the menu) but that would have gone great with my delivery order.

reviews.author: Gio P.
reviews.description: Service was great, our waiter was prompt and kind. The food however was a disappointment. The chicken sandwich had little to no actual chicken, it was more of a "chicken breading" sandwich. Very disappointing, and the fries were cold. The photos reflect the little to no chicken in the fillet.

reviews.author: Alex S.
reviews.description: Brick House Tavern has really stepped up their game when it comes to their food menu. I got to try several different menu items such as their pork chops, ribs, meatballs, pretzels, and deviled eggs. Everything I tried was freaking incredible.  The inside of the restaurant is nice, clean, and sleek and the service is impeccable. They have several screen TV's throughout the establishment and they are strictly enforcing social distancing rules during these Covid times.   I recommend to all of my fellow yelpers to stop by and enjoy some tasty ribs, their Mac and cheese burger or any of their other menu items. You're going to love it.

reviews.author: Joanna F.
reviews.description: Buyer beware! Not only are they barely mediocre in person, they misrepresent themselves as the "Nashville Hot Chicken Shack" on Uber Eats and Grubhub. I make it a point not to get upset about delivery in a pandemic, but the food was so over salted and inedible I had to say something (also inconsistent and missing portions of our 50 dollar order).

reviews.author: Angela G.
reviews.description: Service was great! Our waitress, Ashley was very nice. Had dinner and beer with the hubby. Enjoyed the Drunken Chicken with Fries, Deviled Eggs and Avocado Toast. For beer I had the Blood and Honey by Revolver Brewery. Very nice. Hubby had a Samuel Adam's.

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Ordered to go from this location and the chicken and waffles was delicious and I recommend that if you decide to dine here. The duck wings were pretty good but the fries to accompany weren't the freshest. Definitely would NOT order the chicken pot pie again regardless of it being a take out order, it seemed underdone and the potatoes were huge which seemed to fill most of the dish, the sauce was kind of sweet and watery with a ranch taste that just didn't leave me feeling well. The pastry that's on top just seemed like flattened raw dough and I just can't justify $17 for this dish when I could get more satisfaction from an at home Marie Callender's. To top it off we were missing our pretzel with the order so just be sure to double check everything is in the sealed bag before it goes out for delivery. This location has been here for a while so we decided to give it a try and it wasn't a total disappointment but definitely didn't hit the mark, might try to muster up the courage to dine here in the future for a second try?

reviews.author: Ashley H.
reviews.description: Ordered through doordash for delivery to my hotel while visiting. Missing the Brussels sprouts which should be on the side (as indicated on the menu), no ranch with these horrible looking Nashville cauliflower (also indicated on the menu) and no silverware to eat. Wow.

reviews.author: Natalie M.
reviews.description: Great drinks and yummy food! Little bit of something for everyone in the group! The peanut butter whiskey old fashioned was delicious!

reviews.author: Shirley C.
reviews.description: We went to brunch with a party of 11 . Made reservations but we had to move tables 3 times due to them being so unprepared. The kitchen manager was terrible. We had a great waitress but that's about all that was good. Food was cold chicken was over cooked, found a hair on one plate. Bathrooms were disgusting. Won't be going back!

reviews.author: Melissa M.
reviews.description: Service is a bit slow, maybe it was the day I came in. Ordered a steak medium rare, it came out well. Once my friends were done eating I received my steak cooked perfectly but the filet comes on a hot griddle, like a fajita plate so I removed it so I wouldn't have the same issue, again. The pretzels were amazing and I'm typically not a sweet cocktail person but once I saw a peanut butter old fashioned I had to get it (I love peanut butter). All in all I will return.

reviews.author: Josiah G.
reviews.description: Loved the buffalo chicken meatballs and the flatbreads are a solid go to dish.  Suggestions- Eat at the bar. The bartenders are nice and efficient.   Moose Out

reviews.author: Joshua H.
reviews.description: Let's start with the good. The drinks were on point. My wife and I ordered the Irish mule and peanut butter old fashion (A traditional old fashion but with Screwball Peanut whiskey). Yes, it sounds like a very strange drink but it was good. The waitress was nice and attentive to us.  The Okay:  We also ordered their sampler appetizer plate. The deviled eggs were good. Everything else on the plate was below average. The chicken meatballs were way over salted and the wings were over cooked, very dry.  Main course my wife ordered onion soup and salad. The soup was great. Plenty of perfectly cooked onions and a very nice flavor.  The Bad:  My food on the other hand was not good. I ordered the double pork chops. The green beans were cooked well; still were crispy and not soggy mush. Honestly, that was the best part of the plate. The mash potatoes were over cooked, whipped and slated. They had a glue consistency. The bone in pork chops were over cooked as well and tough. It was one of those 5 minute chews on a bite. But that wasn't the end of our not awesome experience.  The Awful:  When I got up to go to the restroom, a mouse ran out of the kitchen, across my path and under a booth by the wall. At first I thought I had one too many but seeing the reaction of the group of women seated a few booths away, I knew what I saw. When I spoke to the manager, who was very nice and apologetic, she had mentioned she was just informed there was a rodent issue. Thinking back, the booth the mouse ran under there was a couple seated there they promptly left.  The manager did comp all of our meal minus our drinks and we did leave are waitress a nice tip, as this was not her fault.  All of this to say, the food was not up to their normal quality and they currently have a rodent issue.   J

reviews.author: Sydney E.
reviews.description: I really liked this place's food. I got the salmon with mashed potatoes and broccoli and it was super good. Price was a bit steep but it always is for salmon. Would recommend! Also the appetizer Brussels sprouts are good!

reviews.author: Justin G.
reviews.description: TBA is a gem. It's a bright, shiny, diamond, thrown into the garbage line known as N. St Mary's. Oh my gosh! Coffee and Cigarettes is like the best cocktail that I've had in a while and trust me my blood is probably made of 90% cocktails.   All drinks are hand crafted, well made, and you can taste the love and care they put into these confidence boosters. Don't let the prices scare you, they put enough booze to get you buzzing through the night and into your Uber or Lyft.   Hit up this place during happy hour, which is from 4pm till 8pm. Try all the drinks you can handle, and have yourself a nice pre-game.  deuces.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: Have to say that this place is a cool little spot to hangout after work or as the start to your night out. Cocktails are great and the people even better! Much love TBA  happy we met !

reviews.author: Meg C.
reviews.description: Such a disappointing evening!  Evidently this is no longer the cool place for a nightcap!! Paige the bartender informed me that I was too intoxicated to have a second 7pz Miller Highlife pony beer!! Yep heard that fight!!  More to follow.

reviews.author: Yvonne W.
reviews.description: If you know what you are getting yourself into when you go to this bar, you'll love it. It's a very low key dive bar. Nothing fancy here at all. I met a couple of locals in San Antonio and this is their favorite place. It's small and they give out free chips. The drink were decent. It's certainly not a place you go to impress anyone. But it's a hometown bar where literally everyone knows your name.

reviews.author: Tomas R.
reviews.description: TBA is one of those spots that steers away from the hustle and bustle of St. Mary's. Keep in mind TBA has been around before the recent resurgence of hipsters and bar traffic this (once) low-key street is now getting.  Their cocktails here are great and I love the intimacy of this bar. They always have clever names and the cocktail selection is great here. It's a great spot to grab a few drinks and catch up with friends.   As a fan of Rye and Mezcal you'll see some stellar cocktails and some of them are even featured in their happy hour menu.   For those of y'all who are adamant about patio seating don't worry they got you covered. Literally since it's underneath a porch.   I'm always game for their bar food and trust me this isn't your average bar food whatsoever. They know their stuff and you'll be chomping down like the character in Mario. Whether you're hangry or have the drunchies you'll be in pure bliss.  Make sure not to blink while driving here or you'll miss it.

reviews.author: Steve A.
reviews.description: Meh. It's ok. Nothing wrong. Nothing stellar either. I guess I'm in the minority on Yelp. That's ok. I don't venture over to the St Mary's strip too often, so take this review with a grain of salt.  Went here for a date. The place is nice. They have parking in the back and lots of room to sit, although my friend says it gets crowded. It was fairly tame on a Wednesday night.  So the place has a menu of "signature" cocktails. They all seem good but a lot of them seem to be mezcal based and I just don't like mezcal. I had a South Flores which was light and refreshing. It was also pink. But I'm secure in my manhood enough to enjoy a pink cocktail--tho I didn't order a second.  I switched to scotch after my initial drink. They have my current fav Glenlivet 12. That's a plus.  My friend had a Rye N Gosling which gets bonus points for the wordplay. She seemed to enjoy the two she had.   So yeah everything was cool. I like the music. It was a mix of 90s alt rock which was perfect. The crowd was definitely on the younger side--like early to mid 20s young. I'm not sure if that's usual but I did feel my age a bit. But everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves.   Prices were fine for the area. I didn't notice what beers they had on tap but a quick survey of the crowd and PBR cans seemed to be the go to.  It's a nice place to take a tinder date for a drink or to catch up with friends. I'll likely not be back but I suspect they won't mind as I don't think I'm their target demo.

reviews.author: Ruben C.
reviews.description: First date.  Two different races having a good time.   That awkwardness of one of the first dates. "What would you like to eat? What would you like to drink?" Each look at each other with the words, "Whatever you would like."  He looks into her eyes, she looks into his. They converse about everything. EVERYTHING. They compare notes some of the difficulties of their respective occupations.  Yeah. Not my story.  Anyway . . . Back to reality.  Little bar. Dim. Good cocktails if you get right bartender. Lucky for me, the dude manning the bar remembers me from Boiler House (where he used to work at-he doesn't remember occassion or the year/occasion-it's all good since i dont remember him either).  Their recently added food offerings are good.  Their Caprese Grilled cheese stands out, especially when you combine it with the pickled cauliflower. Yes. Damn good. The Westsider - we do not know what was in there but it was good. So yes, their late night eats fill that void in your stomach but wish their drinks were slightly more consistent.  P.s. This place could use a cigarette smoker or two to make it great for some free second hand cancer and more ambiance.

reviews.author: Amy G.
reviews.description: Such a fun find. Friendly and great cocktails. The owner was kind enough to make me a brandy old fashioned in the Wisconsin style. It was delicious and the house cocktail menu was sublime, not to mention all the classic cocktails. I can't get over the great service and the friendly, warm,  inviting atmosphere. It's cute and has an outdoor patio.  Get in here.

reviews.author: Sabrina L.
reviews.description: This little gem is really good for craft cocktails.  It is right off of the St. Mary's strip and is an awesome little place if you love craft cocktails.  Plus, it is off of St. Mary's street so parking is pretty easy to find.  It can get pretty busy depending on day and time but it is definitely worth it. Last weekend I walked up to the bartender and asked him to just make me something and I told him the type of liquor I like and he made an awesome drink.  We were sitting outside and one guy was getting a little rowdy, but he calmed down.

reviews.author: Cecilia C.
reviews.description: In my top three favorite bars on the strip! I like to pick up the tacos up the street and bring them over here to have a seat and drink great cocktails!

reviews.author: Miriam B.
reviews.description: "Get that weak drink drink outta my face!" She said after ordering a drink across the street. " OK she said something to that effect and then I brought her to TBA for a real drink.   "Ahhhh yes" she said with the first sip of her much better drink. I was just thankful she found something she liked. She was thankful that they kept the doubles coming. She's got problems.   I explained to her that this is where you come when you want a good cocktail. She then proceeds to ask the bartender to make her another drink right after his first drag from his cigarette. He followed her request with a gracious sense of confusion. Now that she knows what's up, she'll come back with or without me. That bartender better be ready.

reviews.author: Yelper E.
reviews.description: 2.75 stars.  I wasn't nearly as impressed with this place as pretty much everyone else that has written about TBA so I'd take my review with at least one healthy grain of salt especially given that I've only been here one time.  That said, the cocktails weren't very interesting and weren't balanced very well to boot.  The crowd oscillated between completely barren to moderately lively during my two hour visit.  Bartenders were kind of standoffish without traversing fully into the category of rude.  The most interesting part of this bar was the artwork and the horrible movie I intermittently turned my attention to when my friend would leave for the bathroom.    What would potentially bring me back here is its close proximity to Tacos El Regio and some other above average bars and restaurants.  But standing alone, it wasn't my favorite experience.

reviews.author: Cory W.
reviews.description: Local bar, top-shelf spirits and careful craftsmanship. TBA is a star on every St Mary's pub crawl. Featuring an adventurous cocktail menu and bartenders like Danielle, I'd challenge anyone to find a request unfilled. On weekends it is packed in with locals...weekdays you can get a seat at the bar and pick the bartender's brain. Either way the quality is always top notch. Personally I like to start up at Cullum's Attagirl for great beers and chicken before hitting up TBA on a pub crawl; it never disappoints.

reviews.author: Edith Y.
reviews.description: Very friendly staff! Low key on a Friday afternoon. Sneak over. Park and walk. Very comfy seating!

reviews.author: Michelle O.
reviews.description: This is probably the best bar I've been to on N St. Mary's. The atmosphere isn't annoying, rude, or hipsterish. It's really cute inside with cool decor and everyone seemed really friendly. The bartenders were cool and the drinks are great.  No complaints. Best of all the bathroom is clean and they put effort into decorating it. There is nothing worse than having to pee in a disgusting bar bathroom.  Next time I'm in the area I'll have to stop by again.

reviews.author: Amy B.
reviews.description: We stopped in here for drinks and had some excellent cocktails. Mine, the Chef Jeff's Dilemma, was tequila's answer to the Old Fashioned. I enjoyed it greatly.  Bartender was very friendly and gave us some background on the bar and other places to try in the area. I liked that TBA was small, dark, and seemed like a local hangout rather than a tourist trap. I'd go again.

reviews.author: Melia R.
reviews.description: I like how the drinks are fancilicious (fancy + delicious) for less than $15.   I like how there were just people hanging out here.... different kinds of people; not cool kids versus everyone else.  This spot is gonna be the spark that sets the strip on fire (again).... which I hope turns out to be more blessing than curse.

reviews.author: Chloe O.
reviews.description: This is probably the most dirty and disgusting establishment I have ever been in. It smells like urine and stale beer and attracts some unsavory individuals. It is awful in every way. Only come here is you want to feel bad about your self then immediately go home and take a shower to get the filth from this place off of you

reviews.author: Rebecca R.
reviews.description: Great selection here, and the staff will help you pair up beer/shot combos. Try the Chimay Grande Reserve with Buffalo Trace, or Real Ale Witte with the Botanist Gin.

reviews.author: Abel L.
reviews.description: My friend was sick so I asked for a water. The blonde bartender on sat-sun, April 14-15, rolled her eyes at me and never served me. We had to ask a bouncer across the street at the squeezebox and he ran across the street to help us. Whoever that bartender was is absolutely disgusting as a human being. If I was a business, I would NEVER let someone represent me that way. Get your employees in check

reviews.author: Lily T.
reviews.description: Visited Austin and decided to take a drive down to San Antonio. It was about a little over an hour drive from Austin, TX. I heard good things about San Antonio, great for jobs, and a lot of fun stuff to do.  It was my first time and The River Walk was recommended by a few friends. When I got there my eyes lit up a bit because it was so many thing to look at and so many people walking around. Especially since the drive was mostly just land. So seeing buildings, shops, people, music and entertainment, I knew this place was going to be fun.   I spent a few hours here and left around 8 or 9pm.  I browsed, ate at TGIF and my friends had some fun drinks. We all also went on the little boat ride. It was not bad, I believe the price was right under $20 per adult and the ride was surprisingly long. I would say 30mins or so. It took us around to the other side of the river walk. There was a mall on the other side. I definitely need to come back because apparently we didn't get to explore all of the river walk.  The person we had that drove the boat and explained the history was really fun and entertaining.

reviews.author: Ted C.
reviews.description: River Walk, that's the big deal here and so I wanted to make sure that I visited it on my second time to San Antonio. Fortunately, I met up with my friend at the Alamo and it was an easy walk to the it.   So, after having walked it, I guess it's ok. It's a nice little walk-especially when it was so hot topside. You can tell that walk has seen some better days, it reminded me of those log flume rides at amusement parks, everything seemed wet and some of the maps clearly needed some refurbishment.  The restaurants along the section I was at was mostly very tourist heavy, lot of chain restaurants, nothing that really made me want to stop by.   I think we ended up walking it for about 20 minutes, mostly because I thought I saw someone I knew from back in the day on the other side and we had to find a crossing to double back.

reviews.author: Yvonne M.
reviews.description: It's not what I remember.  It's trendy.  I went 20 years ago and then 10 years ago to the river walk.  We tried to go as a family with two kids this evening about 5pm and that was not like I remember with the crowds.  The river walk is extremely over crowded and not good for families in the evenings.  Every place we tried to eat at had a two hour wait time minimum.  The idea is wonderful.  The reality with a family now, is a nightmare.  I don't know what I was thinking.  Not good for small/grade school age at night.  I will say the Pizzarita's restaurant above the river walk saved our asses for dinner and the long wait times.  We will attempt a carriage ride.  More to come....  Yellow rose horse rides a must!  Great for kids and helps to avoid the crowds of the river walk!  The life right above the river walk is where the real fun for families is!

reviews.author: Mallory D.
reviews.description: Without the River walk San Antonio would have been boring AF. The river walk seems to be the epicenter of SA social life-at least for us tourists! It's super cute and the town does a great job of decorating with with pretty lights and making it an all around visual spectacle. The cruise down the river is so lovely especially at night when all these lights can be seen.  It seems that there are cool places all over the river walk and I'm sure I've only taken in a small portion of them. I just wish that it wasn't like 98% food and drink. Once you eat dinner there isn't a ton to do. And the bars on the river walk don't strike me as bars where you can just hang out and pass the time but instead like bar and restaurants. But it is a very beautiful and unique space that makes San Antonio worth a visit.

reviews.author: Lee D.
reviews.description: 10/27/21  This was suppose be the #1 attraction in Texas??? I envisioned this place cleaner, and more popping. Maybe I need to come back during the summer?  Quality/Quantity - Plenty of shops but most were closed, maybe due to the time of day..." The emptiness made this a better walking area with the minimum pedestrian traffic.  Atmosphere - Did not seem clean, the water looked dirty. They did have boats giving tours. But I believed the boat "shuttle" service was closed I recommend checking this website before going: https://www.visitsanantonio.com/category/attractions/ We enjoyed the Japanese/Chinese Tea Gardens more (separate 5 Star Yelp Review) The Alamo (separate 5 Star Yelp Review) The Market Square (separate 4 Star Yelp Review) Also check out the following while you are here: Murals and public art pieces San Fernando Cathedral  Service - N/A  Price -Â N/A, Free  Owner Suggestion - Cool place/city, will have to try again in the Summer because I want to experience the hype.

reviews.author: JJ J.
reviews.description: This is one of the coolest and neatest places I've ever been too. I honestly had no idea this existed when I came here for an event.  I honestly was just looking for a place to eat lunch. But as I walked outside, I first noticed the Alamo. Then, I heard some water fountains across the street and so I preceded to go downstairs only to find there to be more fountains and more water, leading me to the Hyatt hotel, and then this magnificent place that reminded me of a place called Venice that I saw pictures of before with restaurants, shops, hotels, condos or apartments surrounding this long path of water -- It was remarkably beautiful! Needless to say, I forgot about lunch... So after an hour walking along this path, I then realized there was a mall / shopping center here, which I decided to stop into and wander around for awhile. I then finally got lunch. But man, am I glad I got to come here, it was really cool; and I'll have to come again here some time.

reviews.author: Chrissy C.
reviews.description: The River Walk is amazing! Not sure about parking as we parked at a meter close to the Alamo and walked over.  You need to experience the River Walk at different times. It's much less busy during the day. It was such a nice walk and we really enjoyed walking along the water while checking out all the restaurant options and shops. We got pretzels and had a nice rest at a German bar with seating outside.  You can take a River boat cruise that run up and down the River Walk. We didn't do the tour, but it was interesting hearing some of the stories as the boats passed us by throughout the day.  Later we came back at night and it was packed, but you could still walk around. All the outdoor seating was full of people eating and enjoying themselves. We made reservations and had a nice dinner near the Wedding tree.   I recommend making reservations.  There seemed to be a lot of seating up and down the River Walk. It's nice just to sit and people watch. We even saw the place Miss Congeniality was filmed, which we gleaned from a passing tour.  I love our canal in Indy, but the River Walk in San Antonio is amazing! I think it would be fun to stay at one of the many hotels on the River Walk for easy access.

reviews.author: Lauren L.
reviews.description: We decided on something new to start 2022, let's travel more so we started off with an impromptu visit to San Antonio because we've heard so many great things about the San Antonio Riverwalk...we were greatly impressed because we were in walking distance for our entire visit and though busy at the Riverwalk due to many events in addition to holiday weekend we were able to maintain our distance with the exception of our Riverboat ride which we kept our masks on and was able to sit in a way that kept us not in direct contact facing others on the boat. That was an great experience and we loved walking around the riverwalk and going to nearby Hemisfair park

reviews.author: Harish V.
reviews.description: Sightseeing, shopping, food and fun. All on a world-renowned 15-mile urban waterway. The River Walk, or Paseo del Rio, is a San Antonio treasure and the largest urban ecosystem in the nation. Tucked quietly below street level and only steps from the Alamo, it provides a serene and pleasant way to navigate the city. Explore by foot along the river's walking path or jump aboard a river barge for a ride and guided tour.  Just grab dinner in one of the restaurants on the river walk and enjoy the Vibe.   Pros: ----------- Best Attraction in the city Crowdy yet Peaceful in its own way Boat Rides( $13.50 Per Person) Lots of Restaurants Good place for a Date night Good spot for Photoshoots Boat ride covers a lot of spots

reviews.author: PatrickJ T.
reviews.description: While in San Antonio, a visit to the River Walk is a "Must Do"  We spent most of the afternoon walking along the River Walk.  It was cool because we got in some much needed exercise.  There are many shops and restaurants along the River Walk.  So there is a lot to explore on your own if you wish to do that.  I recommend taking the River Cruise if you want to learn a little more about San Antonio and the River Walk.  We did that too.  Not only was it informative, but we saw more sights compared to just walking.  Hey, we had limited time so it helped a lot!  Enjoy your time at San Antonio River Walk and drink responsibly!

reviews.author: Saundra J.
reviews.description: Just a ton of fun, we actually went on a cooler day with Christmas season. Everything was delightful, cheery and so pretty! A very nice walk and super peaceful

reviews.author: Jeremy J.
reviews.description: When we visited San Antonio we definitely did the wonderful Riverwalk I heard a lot of great things and I was not disappointed. It's a very funny eventually you're very fun time in excellent experience for sure. It's very visually beautiful and has many stores in the river is wonderful to look at we had a great time

reviews.author: Art D.
reviews.description: We had a great time. Everything was open, people were out and about and everyone was having  great time. We walked around on the river walk and on the streets above. It was a great time. No one was wearing a mask as a side note. For eye candy. Yes there is plenty of eye candy for the young and the seasoned folks.

reviews.author: Flora B.
reviews.description: Truly a magnificent experience during Christmas with lights from the top of the trees dropping down to the lower level. The Riverwalk is below street level, and we accessed it via the stairs next to Hard Rock Cafe. The architectural feel is a blend of Venice and Barcelona, yet very Texan with the spirited lights and friendly Southern hospitality.  It was a bit difficult to find parking, and we found a lot across the street from the Hard Rock for $25. Suggest you plan the evening to start at sunset. This venue reminded me so much of California's Disneyland ride "It's a Small World". Truly magical if you have younger aged children.

reviews.author: J E.
reviews.description: While visiting San Antonio for the first time I came here one day, as I heard a lot about the Riverwalk. The vibe is relaxed and the view is historic in a way. The river is cute and looks great as it meanders through this walking path lined area. Lots of interesting and fun places to eat and drink along the way. There are, unfortunately, a lot typical, touristy places too (like Bubba Gumps, Dick's Last Resort, etc).  Â  They have boats that'll take you on a river cruise up and down the river. Even though it seems a little touristy overall, it's something everyone should experience!

reviews.author: Nycole R.
reviews.description: When I was planning a trip to San Antonio, everyone I talked to mentioned the River Walk-I knew this was a destination not to be missed. The 20-something mile winding river is surrounded by fun local restaurants as well as shopping. It is well maintained with plants, trees and flowers-I noticed several maintenance boats floating the river early in the morning carrying gardening supplies. This may be a future career aspiration of mine.  If you don't prefer crowds, morning is the best time to visit. I noticed that the attendance started picking up around lunch time and got busier as the day went on. But 9:30 in the morning? Very few people in sight.  The food options are great-lots to choose from, and every place we went had patio dining available. What's more romantic than eating on the water? Well, taking the boat tour would be, although we skipped that due to other plans.  If you're in town, it's well worth a visit to a least walk a few blocks down below the hustle and bustle of the main streets to the beautiful river walk area.

reviews.author: Phil H.
reviews.description: I love walking the Riverwalk, especially at night.  Been here a bunch of times either on biz trips or when visiting family who live here.   Always a fun walk with so many bars and places to eat. From cheap joints to upscale spots. One of my faves to dine at is Beaudro's which has terrific guacamole. A fun spot to drink is Durty Nellie's for its piano bar atmosphere.  You can also charter a dinner cruise down the river. See live entertainment. Shop. Lots to see and do. Or just enjoy a stroll at night when it's all lit up. Can get pretty crowded and touristy.

reviews.author: Jim W.
reviews.description: The only down-side of this tourist area is that it is designed to be a tourist area...  If you do not come to the River Walk expecting it to be something else, you will likely enjoy your visit.  The layout is basically a large loop, with pedestrian walkways along both banks of the river.  High- or medium-rise buildings flank it most of the way as well.  If you venture away from the core 'loop', there are quieter areas without much in the way of businesses.  These areas are good for a quiet, leisurely walk.    The loop itself is largely given over to bars, restaurants, tourist shops, and hotels. There are a number of national chain restaurants along here, like you might see ringing a large suburban mall or at a Disney park.  There are also some non-chain local places sprinkled throughout. Weekends, especially Friday / Saturday nights, are super-crowded.  Restaurants will likely have long wait-times and the walkways will be hard to navigate due to the press of people. We enjoyed Sunday evening much more than Saturday evening.  The Alamo is only a block or so away from the River Walk.   If you are considering staying in downtown San Antonio, it is worth staying near here just to be able to go out, take a walk, and people-watch. Accept it for what it is, and you'll likely have a pretty good time.

reviews.author: Patrick S.
reviews.description: Stayed in SA over the holidays and we were right on the Riverwalk...having been to SA for conference in the past I always looked at the Riverwalk as pedestrian chaos. This time however, was different.  Although still busy, we were able to just relax and enjoy. Take in the architecture, enjoy the colors that come with Christmas lights and boats running up and down the water.  We had dinner numerous times off the riverwalk and used it as the launching path for our morning runs south out of downtown. Its such a well-developed system of paths with a great history, its hard not to love it.  We stayed at the Hilton with a Riverwalk side room.   Its definitely an integral part of any visit to the San Antonio area.

reviews.author: Hanna A.
reviews.description: I definitely underestimated how cool this spot is in SA! We were visiting for a 21st birthday celebration and this is the best spot to hit lots of different bars/restaurants.   It's got a romantic vibe as well after dark, so I'd come for a date night as well!!

name: The Lion and Rose British Restaurant and Pub
accommodations: Garage Parking, Street Parking, Valet Parking

reviews.author: Hawk S.
reviews.description: Steak was really good and the burger my girl friend got was the juiciest burger I've ever had. It amazes me this place only has 3 stars. We ordered another order of queso  for the fries because the cheese was so good. I'd definitely recommend this place for a try out.

reviews.author: Kimberley C.
reviews.description: -French Onion Soup 3/10 not the right flavor. Was not pleased with it. -Mac and Cheese 8/10 very cheesy!! It doesn't just taste like a baked wet noodle.  -Beer Battered Mushrooms 10/10 can't go wrong with fried anything. Mushrooms in the dipping sauces was great. -CrÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e cheesecake 10/10 crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e flavor and cheesecake texture. Caramelizad sugar on the outsides made it amazing. Went back to get another slice a few days later! -My bf got a sampler platter with fish fry and bangers and mash. He really enjoyed the tartar sauce. They made it homemade and is not your typical tartar sauce.

reviews.author: Lacey V.
reviews.description: My husband and I went here for drinks tonight for the first time.   We arrived between 7:30 and 8:00 on a Saturday which can be busy. There was a bartender and a bar-back working plus a few other employees in the bar area.   We found a couple seats at the bar and a friendly manager greeted us, and got us waters and menus. A little while later another manager took our drink orders and prepared them. We decided to order an appetizer to share and a waitress took our order. She was friendly and knowledgeable. That was the only time I saw her behind the bar so I don't believe she was a bartender tonight.   After a while it seemed like a long time to wait for fries, so we asked the same manager who made our drinks if she could check on them. Shortly afterwards she brought them out, they weren't exactly how we had ordered them but they tasted good.   My husband finished his drink and set it toward the inner edge of the bar with his straw wrapper in it. The bar back and bartender passed us many times without acknowledging his empty drink or even making eye contact.   Finally when the manager walked through again she made my husband another drink.   We decided to get the check because and had to flag down the bar back. He told us our total and ran our card. I asked to see our receipt because the total seemed off. Apparently getting a printed check is difficult because he had to ask the bartender and she had to ask the manager. The total was off because they comped our appetizer since it had never been rung in.   During our entire experience, the bartender and bar back never spoke to us, made eye contact, or acknowledged us in any way until we had to request our check. We could see them talking and chatting with other guests though. They served guests to our right and left but just walked past us every time. They didn't seem to be in the weeds or overwhelmed.   I appreciated the service from the managers and that they comped the appetizer without us saying anything about it.   Next time we go out at the Rim, we'll head to a different bar.

reviews.author: Derrick S.
reviews.description: My girlfriend and I went to the Lion and Rose this week on her recommendation. The service was excellent and the staff should be commended. We split some chips and beer cheese, which tasted off and lacked in flavor. We also split a Shepard's Pie, which was unremarkable, but fine.  The one star review is because we both got food poisoning from our meal. Needless to say, this was not the same Lion and Rose she remembered.

reviews.author: Carin S.
reviews.description: I just adore this place. Service is wonderful, beer flights, with a great selection.  Food is delicious, fish's and chips are the bomb.

reviews.author: Jonathan C.
reviews.description: Had a great time as always. "Amy" was my waitress and she was very down to earth and genuine. It has been awhile so I needed some help with making some selections and decisions, and Amy helped out a lot and made the visit very enjoyable. She looked very good in the uniform. I ordered the "Sliders" and they were delish. I also found out that they have a poker league on Monday nights. I cannot wait to give it a try. Keep in mind this place can be alil pricey...but worth it.

reviews.author: Brian D.
reviews.description: Service this evening was abhorrent. It was as if they didn't want our business. We took a table in the back room and no wait staff ever arrived. We went to the bar to get drinks where we were ignored by 5+ bartenders for over 10 minutes. The music was way too loud to even converse and no one was dancing, so what's the point? We then moved out to the patio where we were ignored by 3 waitresses in cowboy attire. I wouldn't go back there again if they paid me.

reviews.author: JaDee W.
reviews.description: We were really excited to check this place out since we heard such good things about it, but we're highly disappointed. The fish was flavorless, oily, and pretty much crumbled when we went to eat it. It was also incredibly overpriced for 16.99 and you barely got any "chips". At first glance, you wouldn't even realize that there were any in the bottom of the container. The coleslaw had no dressing/ flavoring on it and the sauce it came with ended up just being ketchup.  The shepherds pie was the saving grace, it was hot and flavorful to say the least. The green beans were also okay, they were cold and had zero flavor.  The staff was friendly though so that's great. Maybe we just went on an off day, hopefully it will be better next time we decide to try in the future.

reviews.author: Keith K.
reviews.description: Great oasis in a dry land! This is code for a great place to hide from the dedicated shopper who dragged you shopping with them. Seriously, this is a fun place to relax and have a cold drink. I could spend a lot of time in this place. I am sure I will the next time I'm in the area. Cheers!

reviews.author: Edward O.
reviews.description: I'm pleasantly surprised. I arrived and asked for a seat at the bar. While here their newly hired waitress/bar tender Mary was very professional and continued to check on me. The bar tender"Larry" made me an old fashioned without a cherry or orange but it was a nice flavored old fashioned! I ordered two of them. Then ordered the vegetable curry. Loved the spice and smooth flavors that combined with the old fashioned.  TVs were silent and music played a nice mix of pop and rock. I'll be bacj!

reviews.author: Paulina S.
reviews.description: I love coming to Lion and the rose! I literally sometimes come just to have dinner. I'm really disappointed tho because I came again for dinner tonight and the french fries changed and I'm not liking the new ones. Please keep the chicken diablo bites and the fried mushrooms!!! They are beyond my favorite and what I come to dinner for. I would also love it if they added the fried mushrooms to the late night menu please!!! Please bring back the other fries and we will be golden. I also love that they added Truly wild berry on tap! WOW!!! and the manager Omar is so awesome and friendly.

reviews.author: Adrian G.
reviews.description: This place is a must stop! The staff has great hospitality all the round. Sarah is a great manager that has it all together. Definitely will come back. I'm from LA and it feels like home

reviews.author: Justin F.
reviews.description: Absolutely not the same place I came to years ago. Bartender doesn't know how to bartend and has the worst attitude. You probably shouldn't talk about a customer to another waitress when that customer is right by you.

reviews.author: Cassandra S.
reviews.description: We took a chance at this bar, and I am SO glad we did! This bar took me back to my college years!! The crowd was a great mixture of ages and races and I LOVED every bit about that! I am ALL about diversity. We went on a Friday night and they had a live DJ. They even have a small space to dance (which we totally did) and people eagerly followed because the music was awesome. Despite the amount of people (it was totally packed), the service was great. The staff was friendly and very attentive. We ordered the fish and chips, tuna melt, and ham and cheese sandwich. The plates are huge and can definitely be shared. The ham and cheese comes with mayonnaise and it wasn't advertised on the description, so I would just make sure to ask what sauces are on each plate before ordering. The food was better than the average pub food. We also found ourselves here during the day. The scene was completely different. It was very calm, they had no DJ, and there were way less people. They had all the TVs showing March Madness, and tennis, and the service again was great. The only issue I had was they ran out of a lot of things. One friend tried to order three different ciders on our Friday night visit, and they had run out of all of them. On our day time visit, they also were out of several liquors. I still recommend this place. If you're looking for a fun night with great music, but don't want to get overly dressed up, this is your spot! If you want a daytime chill place to watch sports, this is your place also.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: I had the Black and Bleu Cheese Burger with their great onion rings. Elizabeth andElizabeth made our dining experience

reviews.author: Ibeth A.
reviews.description: I have never been to this restaurant before and what I really loved was how the two managers addressed customers. Sarah and Omar interacted with customers made sure everything was okay and had a small conversation with you. It is very rare nowadays to see managers do this so I was very impressed. Will most definitely be returning. Great customer service is what makes a restaurant!!

reviews.author: Tyler H.
reviews.description: Worst place ever, just makes me miss the old lion and roses around town, granted all the servers are fairly new and being trained but if you wanna get told your breathe smells bad by the hostess then go here, timing, food and service is trash. Mainly the service. So unless you're some executive or divorce attorney that has money to throw at the girls, and you'd just like a beer and fish n chips? Don't go, save your time and money. Hated this place.

reviews.author: Cassity L.
reviews.description: We came in person to eat. They stop serving food at 11. We came in around 10:20 and told them we wanted to eat. It's as if the host told our waitress not to help us, so the kitchen wouldn't be upset. A manager came and spoke with us and another server to say they'd get us help and stilly en minutes later, NOTHING. No one helped us until 10:50 and then they said it was too late to order food. What kinda general manager walks by a table that hasn't been helped and never returns?????? The girls are cute, if they're lazy, okay whatever at least their cute, but this 40 Something year old man brings nothing to the company, but service and problem solving, AND FAILED. It seemed like he was drinking with a guest as well! They really failed!

reviews.author: Nikkie S.
