reviews.description: I came for the Scotch egg and it was very good.  The sausage had a lot of flavor and the breading was cooked to a nice golden brown. I also enjoyed the sauces provided on the side.  We also had the Shepherds Pie, which had a nice flavor.  The Bangers and Mash was okay with the best part being the mashed potatoes.  For dessert we had the toffee pudding.  That was a huge disappointment.  It was far too sweet and could have used nuts or something to break up the sweetness.  The worst part is my husband and I were sharing it, so you can imagine my surprise when I am about to complain how cold it is he says it's burning his mouth.  Sure enough his side was scorching hot.  I guess they microwaved it unevenly.  I don't ever order dessert, so I was disappointed.  A lot of the beers we wanted were out.  I ordered a flight and it sits on a circular carrier, so the girl didn't know which was which.  She was pleasant enough, so I wasn't too put out.   My real issue with this place was the ambiance.  It was late evening, but very bright inside.  Everything felt sticky and the staff uniforms were tacky.  We felt this place seemed more like a chain restaurant (which we avoid) than a hip place at the Rim.  There are better choices.

reviews.author: Vivian M.
reviews.description: The WORST restaurant experience of my life. We sat outside and got a waiter who said "I'll take one for the team and serve you guys" after we waited for 30 minutes and had to ask someone to serve us. We got no waters and so I went to the bar to get my group of eight all waters and asked for four and got the first round no problem, then went back to ask for another four and no one waited on me for five minutes then when someone was available she went up to our assigned waiter and made her do it. None of our mixed drinks tasted like they had alcohol although they were priced like they should've. The only thing that was fast and good was the food. SEVERAL waiters passed by our group and were unhelpful and even to a point where one waiter looked at my friend right in the face after she tried to flag her down and walked back inside.   They were severely unstaffed and need to figure out a better system because the waiters suffer on behalf of a bad leader...

reviews.author: Veronica PagÃ¡n B.
reviews.description: What can I say. What other words can I utter from my mouth that would surpass absolute perfection, nearly divinity, taste bud tantalizing, maddening obsession for more . . . I CAN-NOT get enough of Dough. It's too much for me. I obsess over my next visit. I have eaten here many many times over the past few years and they never disappoint. They never strike out. The day they do I'm going to cry!  This last time we tried many new menu items and they were all delicious! The warm creamy ricotta smeared on crostini was the fluffy little cheese spread you never knew you needed so much in your life! And with honey?? OMG! My mouth waters every time I think of it!  And the oak roasted olives made no sense. I never knew I was missing the experience of eating super hot, oily olives. They do have the pit so don't just jump into it, but if you have any sense you will put it in your mouth, remove the pit, and when all you have is olive, pair it with a bite of crostini with the warm ricotta spread and you will experience something amazing.  The B.T.B. Pizza (Black Truffle Burrata) was exceptional. Take a pice, spread the burrata all over it, drizzle some of that hot oil from the olives, then pass out. When you awake, repeat until full. I can't even look at these pictures without experiencing it all over again!  Our bucatini came out undercooked the first time, but we informed our waiter (who was fabulous, by the way) and he had them make us a whole new plateful. It was perfect the second time around. The noodles needed to be cooked a few minutes longer and they were. The sauce was delicious, and for the mishap, they took it off our bill. Absolute excellent service. We were so happy with the meal we didn't even care. But it was a very kind gesture.   So visit Dough, they will not disappoint! In all the years I've been eating here I have yet to have a bad experience. I just wish they still had the maple cake with pumpkin seeds! And the panna cotta! PLEASE???!!!

reviews.author: Nanda K.
reviews.description: Me and my wife to this joint to celebrate one of our days. We tried a lot of things which was new and expensive.  Burrata Tre Colore - it was nice and good. My wife did not enjoy it much but I liked it. I would rate 4/5  Calabrian Wings - 1.5/5 I don't recommend this to anyone. Not that great and tasty  12" Small Margherita Pizza - we enjoyed this the most. Almost 4.5/5 would be our rating.  12" Small Fontina Pizza - 2/5 The pizza was not that great . I didn't like the taste of the pizza it felt sweeter in taste.  Tiramisu - 1/5 Not all good. It has more baileys in it than it is suppose to.   We don't mind spending money when we get good Food but we felt like we have overspend here with only 1 good pizza and burratas.

reviews.author: Eric D.
reviews.description: One of the worst pizzas I have ever had. Purchased a large pizza for $30 tonight. A third of the pizza had nothing on it - only crust. The rest had barely any toppings which was sausage on ours. Cheese was sparse and didn't cover the majority of the pie. I can't believe they'd put such a pathetic pizza in a box.  I'd give zero stars if I could.   My son and his GF just moved to San Antonio and wanted to try it since it was near their apartment. I am moving their also. I won't be going there ever again. I was just fleeced out of $30 and it pisses me off.  You want a real pizza with a load of toppings - check out Flying Pie Pizza in the Pacific NW. Hell, my homemade pizza kicks ass on this pathetic place.  Skip this place a go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Olga B.
reviews.description: We were showing my Mom the downtown area and wanted pizza, so I did some research and came across this place. Apparently they were featured on Food Network! It was around 2:30 pm on a Tuesday and we had a short 15 minute wait drinking wine at the bar. The place is super cute and swanky. We got the burrata with prosciutto and salami for an appetizer, then their prosciutto crudo pizza and pizza with its house-made sausage. Everything was super fresh and delicious along with great service! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: shamrock B.
reviews.description: Came for pizza told us 45 - 1hr min wait no prob. Asked for bottle wine since it was half off.  Was told manger was too busy and NO with basic a hole attitude.  Just left. What can I say treated liked crap went elsewhere thank you Grimaldi's (Nicole a Sweetheart).    Management get a clue, get organized and teach your staff (hostess) how to speak to customers who are just trying to spend money.

reviews.author: Sheila E.
reviews.description: Came to dinner for Mother's Day date night.  Our waitress Juliette and another waiter (shadowing) were very attentive and answered questions we had and made recommendations.   The wings, pizza and desert were so good and we will be back.

reviews.author: Morgan G.
reviews.description: My partner and I were really looking forward to getting a pizza here after we received many recommendations. We were soooooo disappointed to get this pizza, which is mainly tomato sauce and crust. We would not have spent $25 if we had any idea. After asking for more cheese we mentioned that other customers may become frustrated about this so it might be a good idea to describe the pizza before anyone else orders it. We received a thumbs up from the server and continued to have an extremely awkward experience after that. At one point in the meal my boyfriend even shook his hands towards the sky and cried "Why are you doing this to me". It was our one day to have a cheat meal after weeks of strict meal prep and all was wanted was some delicious cheesy pizza.

reviews.author: Erica W.
reviews.description: The best pizza I've ever had! Perfect sauce, crust, toppings... I don't think it would've been possible for it to be any better. Came to San Antonio excited about the Mexican food, but THIS pizza was the winner of the trip. I can't wait to find a reason to visit S.A. again JUST for this pizza.  The Italian soda was also great! Also I have to give a shout-out to our great waiter, Michael. He educated us on the menu, ingredients and why this Pizzeria was so special. Overall experience was 100/10

reviews.author: Allison S.
reviews.description: I first learned about Dough from watching either Triple D or Triple G on Food Network and when I learned it was in San Antonio, I knew I had to go. I turned in my final portfolio of graduate school, so I decided to celebrate with some post-portfolio pizza.   The restaurant location is very inviting and has indoor and outdoor seating. I got there around 6pm on a Wednesday and many larger parties had to wait some, so plan accordingly. Additionally, I am not sure if this is every Wednesday, but there were half off certain wines and spirits.   As for my dinner, I appreciated that the virtual menu indicated which dishes had been featured on Food Network, which made my search all the more easy. I decided on a small (12 inch) Pork Love. It was DELICIOUS and the perfect amount for one person. The mozzarella cheese was the ooey-gooey you hope and dream for, while the plethora of pork added the perfect amount of savory and salty. The soppressata salami and speck elevated the dish to *chef's kiss* level and the spicy pork sausage rounded out the dish with a little amount of heat.    I will say my crust had a little more char than I care for and the plethora of pork weighed the slice down some, so I had to break out my trusty fork for assistance. However, these were easily overlooked issues because the taste was well worth it. Lastly, leftovers ate well.   Can't wait to visit again!

reviews.author: Christi J.
reviews.description: Overall, this place wasn't the best pizza spot I've been but also not the worst. Our server, Daniel, was great and attentive. We ordered the Margherita Pizza with  prosciutto and pepperoni pizza (both were size small which were roughly six slices each). Pizza wasn't as flavorful as I thought it would be (slightly soggy towards the end). I also ordered a peach Bellini which was pretty good. There's plenty of seating inside and out so there was no wait (we went Saturday evening) but not much social distancing. The price for the pizzas are slightly pricer than other places I've been to.

reviews.author: Carl L.
reviews.description: First time trying Dough after my wife raved about their gluten free dough. I got the Pork Lover (regular crust) and it was good; pretty salty. I should have tried to identify which pork topping was putting it over the top then I could try it again without it. Crust is the chewy variety. I definitely want to try some other menu options.

reviews.author: Kristin M.
reviews.description: I have to start this with review with commenting on how awesome Robert was! He provided the most excellent service anyone could ask for. He was incredibly polite and always a step ahead with his service.   We started with the Calabrian chicken wings and they were cooked perfectly. They are baked and not fried and just as crispy as a fried wing. The Gorgonzola dipping sauce is mouth watering good!! I don't even like stuff like that and I couldn't get enough. The hot sauce served on the side has a kick but nothing crazy.   We ordered a small BTB and a large pepperoni. The crust is awesome! We absolutely loved both pizzas and honestly can't say that one was better than the other. I will say for those that are not a fan of truffle, you barely taste it in some of the bites and not at all in others so don't let the truffle scare you from trying this pizza.   It was a beautiful day and we sat outside. Had a couple of local craft beers to go with our pizza and wings. I highly recommend this restaurant!

reviews.author: Joy L.
reviews.description: I love everything about Dough! It's delicious, their service is always great, and they change their selections on certain items by season. You can't go wrong with a pizza and salad - or really anything. Love the hemisfair location to visit w the kids! The only downside is that they're not always open for lunch. Check the times. But go!

reviews.author: Samantha S.
reviews.description: Dough is a staple for me. I've been here many times and each visit has been nothing short of enjoyable. Unfortunately, they don't take reservations so to avoid a long wait, this is more of a weekday spot for me. They have a nice outdoor seating area (with heating lamps available if needed) as well as a standard indoor dining area. Perfect for a date night or a girls dinner.   My standard 5-star meal at Dough includes a bottle of red wine, the signature truffle burratta, and their arugula and prosciutto pizza. I'm drooling at the thought. And as I type this review, I ask myself, why do I try to fix something that's not broken? *Sigh.*  During my most recent visit, I decided to be be spontaneous and try something new: the prosciutto sugo pizza. I strayed from my tried and true arugula prosciutto and immediately regretted it upon my first bite. The prosciutto sugo tasted like a sausage and pepper sandwich which, while may be tasty in other circumstances, isn't what I ordered. I was really hoping that the fontina, prosciutto, and mushrooms would compliment the sausage and peppers nicely. Alas, the overload of sausage and peppers steamrolled the itty bitty amount of prosciutto and mushrooms that were provided. My friend and I didn't finish the pizza, and she insisted I keep the leftovers... that's how you know. Minus one star for Dough, but minus 5 stars for myself for straying from my usual. Lesson learned.

reviews.author: Lawana G.
reviews.description: This place was great, albeit a little pricey but not above any other place we have eaten at in SA. My son had the pepperoni pizza and ate it all ..even the crust which he never eats. I had the spaghetti with shrimp and it was divine. Our waiter was entertaining and knew the menu. It is truly a great place to go.

reviews.author: Eva H.
reviews.description: Devontae was our server on 11/13/21 around 8:30 pm. What a breath of fresh air to get such an excellent employee. Devontae was efficient, pleasant, not overbearing or intrusive at all. He brought out our drinks quickly, our appetizers were hot and delicious and he even gave my dog treats and water! The pizza came out and was superb. I am sure this  gentleman was one of the best servers we have ever had!!! Devontae would be great as a team leader to others on how to be an excellent server. Keep up the excellent service!!! Thank you once again!

reviews.author: Taylor C.
reviews.description: Very very amazed! We had excellent fast service, Deo was AMAZING and very quick. Definitely made out experience great! Pizza was so delicious. We will definitely be back!!!

reviews.author: John K.
reviews.description: Literally, my favorite part of the whole experience is the Dough.  The wait made me anxious to eat at this place and my expectation rose every minute that passed. Lines of people, rows of vehicles with people inside, etc so when it was our turn it was just a rush of adrenaline, coming from NYC and excited about trying different pizzas.  Needless to say, the ingredients were very fresh that I felt good after I ate the food. It digested quickly and I had no greasy yucky feeling afterwards. We started off with the fresh mozerella appetizer that was to die for. The tomatoes and the bread served with that dish was the perfect sweet and salty.   A must try and we will return next week to try a different pizza for sure. Thanks for the experience!

reviews.author: Sejal L.
reviews.description: Dough is a nice place to get fancy pizza in San Antonio. During COVID, they have been really great about having food ready for easy pick up. Their antipasto platter is cute and can allow you to make a nice charcuterie board. The tuscan salad was nice for a side of greens but nothing amazing. Their Burrata Tre Colore, which I've gotten a few times, is incredible and absolutely worth trying out. The pizza we got recently was the Sausage and Heirloom Cherry Tomato Pizza. It has a good flavor profile with the right amount of meat. As someone who has been to Naples before do I feel like it is authentic? Maybe not. But it is definitely tasty!   Positives: Cute atmosphere, during non-COVID times can watch the chefs at work, great burrata, nice food for a fancy evening  Negatives: Expensive for what you get

reviews.author: Kyim M.
reviews.description: This place was pretty good! Not bad. But a little overrated. The service was impeccable, but the food was maybe a 7/10...hence my 4 out of 5 stars. But I'd def come here again haha

name: Yard House
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Jackie N.
reviews.description: Been here 3 times in the last 2 weeks because it's just that good! Also, the service is 5 stars!  Since my partner and i started going, we've been treated with the best service especially from our recent waitress, Jackie!  She was very attentive, gave us refills throughout the service, and went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of.  Recently, I had their new avocado chicken sandwich which was amazing! It's a little messy, but has so much flavor. My partner always orders the boneless wings with a side of their truffle fries (which are also amazing!). We've also had their house margarita which is mixed with a very nice balance. Not too strong but also not too light, it's just right. Lastly, one of my favorite sides is the mac and cheese. It's so fresh, and full of flavor.   Overall, the establishment is very clean, and we haven't had to wait the times we've there. We always get seated very quickly! 10/10 recommend.

reviews.author: Tammy-Sue K.
reviews.description: It was a bit of a slow start but their recovery was spot on. Yard House is one of those places you can usually count on for a solid experience. After a few stumbles, the wings were crispy and hot and at the end of the day that's all I wanted.  I don't come to this location often anymore. The service is unapologetically and consistently slow and honestly unfriendly at the bar. That bothers me. Everyone's allowed an off day but there was a span in 2021 where they just couldn't get it together. I walk in every restaurant making my vibe clear "I'm happy, I'm hungry and I'm ready to go with the flow" but they just aren't very personable so I just quit going. I'll probably give them another try one day soon. Hopefully I can upgrade this review because it's bumming me out. Ironically, that's why I stopped going to this Yardhouse ....... they were too.

reviews.author: Mark D.
reviews.description: After having an extensive tour of UTSA for my daughter the senior, we opted to have a casual meal at the Rim! The restaurant was packed, but we were seated by the bar in a reasonable time. The dining room was loud but was filled with patrons enjoying the music and the games on TV.        Our party of 6 ordered club sandwiches, salads and edamame. My daughter's double decker BLT was savory. My wife's salad was filled with various vegetables and was very good. My turkey club was flavorful but had soggy bread. The bread should have been toasted to help keep the integrity of the sandwich.  Otherwise, the meal was appropriate for the atmosphere and was quite filling and flavorful.       Ultimately, this establishment is casual, fun and worthy of a visit when you are by UTSA!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: STILL a great place for a Friday when wanting or needing to wind down. Great ambiance, sports enthusiast, perfect for watching the game and being able to order drinks or food from a touch on the screen is very convenient!

reviews.author: Alkisha R.
reviews.description: Last night was a 5-star experience. It was a slower weeknight so we got seated right away outside. The weather was a bit rainy but we enjoyed sitting outside on the patio where there is an amazing view to people watch and look at the game on tv.  There is something for everyone here and I mean everyone: pescatarian, meat eaters, pizza lovers, vegetarians, vegans, beer lovers... the menu is huge!  I ordered the blackened tuna sashimi and the garlic noodle appetizers as dinner. My husband ordered the fish sandwich. What was advertised vs what was presented was spot on. Presentation, taste, wait time all perfect.   Check out the salted watermelon margarita watermelon  and the smoky old fashioned! Delicious and unique.  Great weekday dinner experience.

reviews.author: Anna W.
reviews.description: My friends and I often come here to grab drinks and appetizers. Lately the service has not been up to our expectations but multiple servers have told us that they are understaffed and overworked so please be kind to the staff! They're doing their best to keep up.

reviews.author: Victor R.
reviews.description: It was an amazing experience at Yardhouse! We  opted for outdoor seating and the view and the warm heaters made it very much worth it. We tried the Nashville Hot Chicken and the new Korean Sandwich. These are a MUST try. The Nashville chicken is crispy, well prepared, and not overwhelmingly hot. The korean sandwich had an amazing tasting bread and some pretty good beef. I enjoyed every bit. The chicken lettuce wrap appetizer is a must try also, although I felt it was kind of on my small side for the price.

reviews.author: Alex P.
reviews.description: Came here on a Monday night and sat at the bar. It was super busy for a Monday, but understandable during the holidays. Service was wonderful even though the bar staff were slammed. Everyone was super attentive and working hard so I really hope their management recognizes that work ethic. They also really know their beers. Super informative and helpful with the suggestions. We ordered the House IPA, Liquid Compass and Belgian White - all delicious! We also ordered the Firecracker Shrimp which came on this deep fried rice cake and it was soooo damn good. Like way better than I expected. It was like bang bang shrimp but with a cajun flavor but not too much cajun, idk, just order it. For entrees we got the Poke Nachos (over rice, per our server's suggestion) with the chips on the side and Spicy Jambalaya. Both were so, so good! The Poke Nachos were spicier than the Jambalaya, to me. It's probably the Serrano peppers but either way, delicious.

reviews.author: Zana K.
reviews.description: Yard house never fails!! Our group of 6 got seated right away and our server was very friendly and had great energy.   I ordered the magic margarita and Hawaiian mule. That margarita was indeed "magical" as it changes colors!   We ordered the onion tower for an appetizer and it was hot and crunchy and came with 2 sauces. Everything was delicious! I got a BBQ chicken pizza and my friends got wings. We came for happy hour so select appetizers and pizzas were half off and drinks were $2 off!   We had a great time and i would definitely recommend coming here for a night out with friends or a lil date!

reviews.author: Milli M.
reviews.description: We just started coming here...and all bc it was close to our hotel room in Houston and we fell in love with the pokÃ¨ nachos... we came to the yard house in SA and I was a lil disappointed at the portion of poke that is on the nachos, nothing like Houston. The taste is still great, the Korean beef appetizer is enough for a full meal, it's so good! The Korean tacos with vampire cheese tortilla was pretty tasty.. I enjoy the flavors of everything and the ambiance is real chill and we will definitely continue coming... I'll just ask for extra pokÃ¨ on the side for my nachos

reviews.author: Jacqueline J.
reviews.description: Last weekend, my sister, nieces and I decided to stroll the streets of La Cantera and met up with a friend at the Yard House.  We were longing for a cheesecake from the Cheesecake Factory, but refused to wait 2 hours for it.  My sister added our names to the Yard House waiting list and I snuck past the hostess and a line at the Cheesecake and walked my nieces to the dessert window.    We eyed the glass window and peeped at the colorful, fruity, Chocolate and Carmel renditions and lime creations of cheesecake, but eventually choose the 1650 calorie Oreo Cheesecake... Yep that's right I said 1650 (YOLO). The girls were excited with our selection and we strolled past the long line of Cheesecake Goers and were called into the Yard House within 10 minutes.   Paul (AKA Pablo) was our waiter. He explained the menu and brought the nieces some crayons and kiddie menus.  Once the little ones were taken care of, he focused his attention on taking care of us.  Within minutes our table had strawberry lemonade and water and orders into the kitchen. The place was packed, but the staff had Social Distancing in mind. Servers wore mask and I saw sanitary actions between guests. For our dining experience, we ordered the Fish and Chips, the Mac and cheese for the kiddos and the Hot Chicken with sweet potato pancakes.   The atmosphere was festive and the foodies seemed to be enjoying a beautiful day out at the mall. The managers at the Hostess station had on their game faces and kept the flow of foodies orderly and expedited. Or food was amazing and Paul kept the dishes cleared and the glasses full.  He didn't mind when the girls cracked open the cheesecake and kept us as his first concern. I would highly recommend the Fish and Chips as the Cod was fried to perfection. Everyone seemed to enjoy their food and the cheesecake was a perfect end to our meal.  Even with COVID-19 still an issue, I felt safe, enjoyed my meal and appreciated the outing with the family.  Highly recommended ~ Ms. Foodie Aka Da Islandgal29412

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: Yard House was not as busy as we expected it to be for a Thursday night but we still opted to grab a couple of seats at the bar. I just ordered the Magic Margarita and not that it came out wrong, but it's just not my cup of tea. I'm going through a bourbon cocktail mood right now so that was just a bad call on my part.   Our bar snacks came out warm and delicious. The pretzel was warm and soft, so we didn't have to fight it. The calamari was a little over cooked but still good to munch on.

reviews.author: Jessica R.
reviews.description: We love this place for a date night or family dinner.  It's usually very busy, but we have been lucky to have great service!  I love the hot chicken and fries.  They give you two huge pieces of chicken.  The half yards hit the spot.  I recommend the cheese curds and truffle fries.  Food comes out freshly prepared and how requested.

reviews.author: Jenny F.
reviews.description: Place: It's a big restaurant with outside and indoor sitting. The outdoor sitting seems like more popular for group of people (more than 5) The interior design it's like retro with lots of arts.   Service: The service was fine, our waiter was nice and helpful but the food service, I think we waited so much like almost an hour. The plate is warm but not much of the food. We felt they forgot that the plate was sitting there getting warm.   Food: We ordered a lot of good food that some of it didn't had time to take a pic. For appetizer we had their, firecracker shrimp, four cheese spinach dip and fried calamari. For the main course we had spicy jambalaya, 20 oz Bone-in rib eye and mac + cheese.   We didn't really go wrong with our food everything was so tasty. The Spicy Jambalaya was not really spicy but it was full of seafood!   The experience was great and for sure we would love to go back.

reviews.author: Gina W.
reviews.description: It was a beautiful day so we sat outside. Our waitress, Brittney was awesome. We ordered the spinach dip because she told us it was really good and boy was it!  The Cobb salad was huge and delicious. The grilled cheese and tomato bisque soup was outstanding and the grilled chicken was scrumptious. The truffle fries are yummy too.

reviews.author: Beatriz B.
reviews.description: Clean, great customer service, and yummy food. Couldn't make up my mind and ended up ordering the Poke Nachos. Loved it. My favorite stop at the mall now.

reviews.author: Victoria P.
reviews.description: Beer! Beer! Beer!  Went for happy hour and had a great time.  My only gripe is they don't have enough local beers. I knooooow Yard House is a chain...BUT...maybe they can make a deal with the locals breweries and sell the local stuff rather than a bunch of beer from CA and CO. Just a suggestion!  Great place to drink and dine! Love the outside patio.

reviews.author: Raymond S.
reviews.description: Maybe 3.5 but that's not an option. Great tap, has to be 50+ beers. I had the jambalaya and it pales in comparison to the last place I had that(two days ago-love that sh....stuff).  Beer is cold and that does count-especially in Texas. Cool look in the inside service is ok, not great but ok.

reviews.author: Doug M.
reviews.description: Great happy hour specials are awesome great place to chill and munch, the drinks and very tasty staff is fantastic too

reviews.author: Jerry R.
reviews.description: If your significant other gives you that "I don't know wherever is fine." Line. Give up and head to yard house. This place has it all. Food, drinks and if you finish eating around 9. The fireworks at Fiesta Texas are icing on the cake. I really recommend the French dip sandwich. If you want a healthier option the tuna crunch salad is amazing. Their cheese curds and garlic truffle fries are great sides to compliment your meals. The kids love them as well. If you are into drinking beer they have more than enough. The selection isa huge. I get one but have to get in the half yard. You know to feel like a BOSS. But service has always been great. Like I said this is the place to be. So don't waste time on places to eat and head their way. You won't be disappointed.

name: The Sandbox
accommodations: Best nights on Wednesday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Brianna D.
reviews.description: I've gone a couple times. Aside from long lines in the cold and the expected, slightly bothersome drunks, it's pretty lit.

reviews.author: Krystal C.
reviews.description: I have been wanting to stop in the Sandbox for awhile now. It was my friend's birthday and we stopped by to see what they had to offer. When walking in the door guy rushed to the door to welcome us in. (Don't know where he came from.) The seating was very spread out which was great. However, the only place we were recommended to sit, because no other seating was available inside, was by the corner of the DJ booth. The place seemed geared towards a young demographic (not that I'm ancient), it wasn't what I was expecting.   The service was great! The guy that took are order was very friendly, and attentive to what we wanted. The music was good but I could not hear my friend who was sitting right next to me. I had to lean into her ear so we could "talk." The beer on draft was good. The chips and queso order wasn't great- the c was very watery. Again, not what I was expecting.  If you are looking for a place to listen to music and not the company you're with this is the spot for you. Definitely, not what we were looking for.

reviews.author: Riki C.
reviews.description: Welp, the guy behind the bar instantly got onto one of us for not having my mask on and as we explained One had a medical condition.... he rudely said I don't care. You need a mask.  The bar is completely blocked off to seating by rope... but I guess "regulars" come in and they will open the rope to let them sit ...    Bad taste in your mouth instantly. But then we sit there and he wears his mask on his chin and starts making drinks. ...

reviews.author: R J.
reviews.description: Best place to meet up with friends and have well made drinks and beer on tab. Pizza and other tasting meals available as well. Not to mention bottle vip service.

reviews.author: Ryan A.
reviews.description: I would give this place zero stars if I could. They harassed me and my entire group. The bouncer made the bartenders re-check our IDS and made us verify with our credit cards multiple times. Would not leave us alone and would not stop questioning us. Do not recommend. if you are trying to have a good time, don't go to this place

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Update to a my previous review.   One of their partners/managers/ employees (he didn't identify his position) reached out to me on my FB foodie page and left a defensive and dismissive comment.   They doubled down and called me a liar by stating i left untrue and invalid accounts of my visit and tried to insult me by stating I'm no Anthony Bourdain (there was only one, may he rest in peace).   Had they been cordial, apologized for the less than great experience, and invited me to return (without compensation, I'm not looking for anything free) then I would of praised them for reaching out and considered returning to give them another chance.

reviews.author: Brayden H.
reviews.description: Bar was fine but they add 20% gratuity to the checks. It's in very small print on the receipt so it is not obvious. Check your receipts before you decide if you want to tip extra. The line also took forever because the bouncer was letting everyone in who slipped him cash instead of the people in line.

reviews.author: bianca v.
reviews.description: Management is horrible. My friend got manhandled by a "staff" member that ended up yelling at our faces for no reason. So corrupt all of them lied then proceeded to makeup a story that we were throwing cups off the balcony when we hadn't even been upstairs. Manager stated "this will not get resolved". This place is known to let in minors I learned all this after the fact of going there. Manager also said he was getting all facts together? What more facts do you need when a vulnerable girl is crying in ur face saying her arms are bruised from ur staff member?

reviews.author: Patrick E.
reviews.description: This place looks like it could be a really cool place...but it's not!  The ratchet waitresses/bartenders that completely ignore you are rude and just gross.  The drinks we got were made so badly!  They definitely didn't know how to make a good mixed drink.  Waited 30 min for a calzone and wings and there were 3 customers...none of which had ordered food.  Kitchen staff was dirty and just standing around the whole time, music was so loud I couldn't hear someone right in front of me.  Just an all around bad experience.

reviews.author: Ellie G.
reviews.description: stupid ass door guys drink all night and cause so many problems, get a better door staff.

reviews.author: Emily W.
reviews.description: This bar has gone to shit since it's opened. Advertised to have a cool rooftop bar. The rooftop has been closed way more than it's been opened and now appears that it is no longer going to be a thing anymore. The side bars are always closed and are just covered in trash and extra supplies. Looks messy. Overall, the place has just become ghetto and doesn't look like they are trying anymore.

reviews.author: Jenny S.
reviews.description: My best friend and I were looking for a place to relax and talk. Place is clean, cozy and cool. We got there very early at the evening but later on the place was packed. The 1st floor looks like any sports bar, the rooftop has another bar and cozy sofas, tables and bathrooms as well. They have a good selection of beers. Didn't had the opportunity taste their delicious menu, maybe next time. I will definitely go back.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: After the bouncer checks your ID, they check your temperature which is great.  You can sit wherever and order your drinks at the bar.  There was no wait for ordering. The music is a bit loud depending where you are sitting, so choose accordingly.  There is also an outdoor seating area where you can sit as well.  The restrooms were very clean and we did not have any issues. So we will definitely return.

reviews.author: Adrianna G.
reviews.description: The workers(bouncers) suck and hella fucking rudeee  Music okkk  They hella charged my card Definitely overcrowded

reviews.author: Christian C.
reviews.description: 1 star cause the bouncer doesn't allow people wearing shorts? Imagine a sports bar with a dress code - what a complete joke

reviews.author: Robert O.
reviews.description: This place has turned to crap. They changed it up and added some type of VIP looking area on the floor? Idk  it looks cheaply done. The second bar is a cluttered mess and unsightly with a cheap Home Depot water cooler on it and the patio looks like a dumping area for crap that no longer works or broken furniture. Ghetto doesn't capture what this place has become since opening. It can't decide what it wants to be! Are you a pizza spot? A bar? A dance club? What happened to the second floor? It's never open. Skip it. They aren't even trying anymore. Head to The Block down the road or Chicken n Pickle 10 minutes away. In case you were wondering the food isn't great either. At least the staff is friendly... seemingly oblivious to how bad the place has gotten.

reviews.author: Avery G.
reviews.description: If you have to option to go somewhere else do it, so many other bars around that won't over charge your card. The bartenders really tried to add an extra $70 to my tab like I wouldn't know. To add on the bouncers will extort you for more money or they'll tell you they're all gonna beat your ass and throw you out. Worst UTSA bar there is. Rather go to the box and wait an hour for a drink than here again. DJ sucks too.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: This place has a promising veneer, but beneath the surface there is a total lack of professionalism. I have given it plenty of chances, because the drinks were priced fair enough and the atmosphere was generally clean with some unique qualities like lots of TVs and a rooftop patio, but every time I've gone to Sandbox the customer service has only gone downhill. Saturday (16 Nov 2019) I sat at a table to join friends. When I arrived my table was already visibly frustrated. Not sure as to why, I shrugged it off while I waited to order a drink. But I waited and waited and WAITED until I had to flag down our server. And I had to do this EVERY time I needed something. Apparently this total lack of attention was happening before I got there, and to make it worse our server seemed annoyed when we kept asking to order stuff. So, when we couldn't get good help from her, we went to the bar: Behind the rounded tile bar there are plenty of bartenders, enough to take care of every approaching patron, but not so shocking at this point, the staff had this bad habit of focusing on each other and not so much on us, the customers. I had to wait multiple times for bar and staff members to finish their conversations before they acknowledged me (or anyone else trying to give them money in exchange for goods or service). And to make it worse: no shame, no sorry, just a "oh hey bro, whats up?" All that being said, they could have still got 2 or 3 stars out of me, I'm always generous and forgiving on Yelp. I'm aware this is a college bar with college staff, but one incident Saturday proved they do not care nearly enough: While sitting at my table (surely waiting on our disappearing server), WATER STARTED FALLING ON MY BACK. Now things happen, and I understand this couldn't be predicted, but when we alerted staff that the ceileing was leaking, NO ONE REACTED beyond "oh, ok." My friends and I had to move our table. I had to find a new chair to replace my drenched chair. NO APOLOGIES. NOTHING. Only a yellow sign appeared followed by more bad service. I had to wait AT LEAST twice as long as is typically acceptable for service. I left AT LEAST twice as early as I normally do when attending a bar on a Saturday night. I would guess that Sandbox missed out on AT LEAST half of what I could have added to their revenue stream. I don't see myself going back anytime soon.

reviews.author: Andrew B.
reviews.description: First impression, no social distancing in the line. Waited 35 minutes in the line, while I was waiting in line I counted over 20 people that were able to cut the line and get into the bar while there we about 25 to 30 people waiting in line. Then the security guard says, we are over the limit but we going to get you in and then no one else will be able to. Definitely won't come back here.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Really liked this place! The outside doesn't give you the right perspective of the inside. Seems small and sparse since it's in a small strip center but seems spacious and inviting inside.   While it's not a big space, the white subway tile, the white button tile bar and the height make it feel big. All this plus the intoxicating smell of the wood burning oven.  Wide selection of draft beer, decent sized menu, ample liquor selection and the obligatory frozen mixed concoctions for the college folks. We asked about happy hour and were fine with the answer but not blown away by the offering. Just ok.   We ordered some beer and nachos and were very pleased with the size, flavor, and variety of items on the nachos. Really good chili and jalapeÃ±o. No complaints here!  Again, while not a big space, the TVs were everywhere and tuned in to the group.  Understand there is a roof top bar to enjoy and have viewed the pictures although today was a little cool to enjoy.   Overall- a GREAT experience! We will return!

name: Joe Blue's
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Aaleen C.
reviews.description: While a seemingly popular destination, I've never actually stepped foot into this bar. I walk by often. I notice the neon blue signage when I wait for an Uber. I have had many fleeting conversations with the legends of Southtown on the patio space. Sadly, I cannot tell you about the drinks, the service, or if they are pet-friendly. I can guess that it's packed on First Friday with art enthusiasts, and despite other reviews, I'm sure the bartender has flair.  Joe's is significant to me all the same.   -  I'm moving to New York City, and "Review Joe's" is scribbled on my to-do list among selling all my shit and squeezing in a breakfast taco tour.  Almost a year ago, I met this man through a good friend. Tall, charismatic, polyglot, likeable, a real man of the people. He has this swoopy politician hair that hides beneath an obnoxious hat he's collected somewhere along the way. He speaks in excessive idioms and with conviction like it's written in the damn Constitution. He's worldly - it shows. His everyday canvas footwear has seen better days, but his two cell phones suggest importance and a stacked calendar. He's overflowing with ideas and vision and has the most contagious smile I've ever seen; the kind that makes you completely weak in the knees.  We were friends, who became more than friends, stemming from a shared love for drive-thru cuisine.  His sense of humor is a remix of dry British humour and run of the mill mean girl. Strong notes of sarcasm and self-deprecation with a deadpan delivery. I'd love to meet his childhood English tutor.  One of his first jokes I danced with was "the review." In the spirit of open and honest communication, he chuckled about installing a sexy touchscreen on the wall of his loft to include an emoji survey for data collection, similar to those you find outside airport restrooms. How was your overall experience, Aaleen? Smile, Neutral, Frown.  A handful of tangents later, it evolved to a rideshare innuendo. "Do I get five stars?" As a seasoned critic in my thirties, I must consider the stunning orange explosion beating through your windows each morning. However, no signs of coffee. Surely, that will influence my lover's rating.  In an attempt to poke fun at the absurdity of life and dating culture as we know it, he claimed his previous romantic encounters wrote their reviews hidden in plain sight on the Yelp page for the bar downstairs; he lived above Joe's. As such, I was mildly disappointed to find that no one has taken the time to submit their review - trust me, I looked.  Well, here we are: 5 Stars. I don't know what the future holds for this establishment, but I can confidently say my experience has been otherworldly. You are my favorite reminder that life should be lived vibrantly, and to me you are magic. I hope you always feel loved.

reviews.author: Gina P.
reviews.description: If your looking for funand high energy, you will want to skip this place. The atmosphere was like sitting in a cold dark library at night drinking with nothing to look at or listen to. There was only one other person in there aside from my husband, and this was on a Saturday night. We each had one drink then left. I would have had fun if we would have gone to a library.

reviews.author: Melissa B.
reviews.description: Such a wonderful place to find. After finding an uninviting and pretentious atmosphere downstairs, we came in to see if it was quieter and more comfortable. The bartender was wonderful. He was friendly and knowledgeable to make create drinks for me based simply on the description of "herbal" which were delicious. It was so easy going and quiet. It wasn't quite a surprise to see a bartender from the bar we had just left come up to confer with the bartender here about how to make a drink because the downstairs establishment didn't have anyone "versed" in that drink. Clearly, the bartender here is a more experienced and knowledgeable bartender.   Not to mention the affordability. That's always a bonus.

reviews.author: Daniela C.
reviews.description: What a sad sad little place.... We came in because it looked cool from the outside, with the starry walls and such. As soon as we walked in, I felt depressed. No music at all, tvs on mute, only 3 other people in the whole place. One woman was working on something/studying.... It was a Friday night at 8! Plus, as others have said, what a douche bartender....   Just go downstairs to bar 1919 for an actual good time.

reviews.author: Samuel G.
reviews.description: I'd give it ZERO stars based on last visit(which was tonight). Been here a TON of times-so sorry that we interrupted the bartender's quiet and easy SAT night. The four of us made our way in, and were not greeted(!). Found bartender on a on his phone, watching Discovery Channel filler and nothing else on, nor were there anyone else in bar. We asked for drinks, which he made but when we asked to have the Copa America Game put on, he begrudgingly and immediately asked if there was a English broadcast... When there wasn't, he muted the Spanish broadcast in the entire bar. (I even offered to look for English broadcast, like an apologetic idiot...) We, being the only other patrons, felt awkward, and played music on the juke box... Very sure we will NOT be here again...$ spends the same regardless...

reviews.author: N D.
reviews.description: I do not have a problem with the environment, the drinks or the pricing. It's the bartender.   He clearly doesn't enjoy his job or his life. Maybe he got spanked too much as a kid or is just a fucking asshole because he likes to be.   The bartender makes the bar and this guy certainly sets a foul mood.   I will never go back to joes blue bar until he is fired.  Go down to bar 1919 right below it for a better experience, anything is better than having to deal with this little Gollum.

reviews.author: Thomas R.
reviews.description: Heard a lot of great things about this place as I am new to San Antonio, in love with the Southtown district so I expected a lot from this bar but my most recent visit to this bar proved otherwise. Walked in and wasn't greeted by the bartender as he appeared to be taking his lunch break behind the bar. I approached to order with a "hello" and he responded with, "Yeah what do you want?" I didn't even order a drink. Walked straight out. Observed from the outside and the tender seemed unphased by the situation. He proceeded to eat and mind you could hear every crunch because apparently this place doesn't play music or have sound on their tvs? Maybe I caught them on a bad..Saturday..night...?

reviews.author: Kim P.
reviews.description: I do not recommend this bar! A group of us did a pub crawl this past weekend and this the starting point. They were clearly not ready because they were very unorganized and the beer was hot! The short male bartender was less than friendly and needs a lesson in customer service. He kept looking away when we were standing right in front of him. I have a feeling it's the same bartender others are writing about. I guess the owners don't care.....

reviews.author: Augie R.
reviews.description: I came to Joe Blue's with high expectations, but the place isn't very impressive. It reminds me more of a strip mall bar than a lounge in a historic arts complex (which is what it is.)    When we were there basketball was on the TV and audio system. It was far more sports bar than lounge.  The bartender was standing outside smoking when we arrived and gave us the kind of look that said "Damn, guess I have to go to work."  I'm not sure I'd call him rude, but he was indifferent--no smile, no chatting, just efficiency.  I asked him a question about food delivered from the brewpub next door and got a grunted answer, which pretty much summed up the bartender's demeanor.  The thing that really turned me off is that at one point he sneezed and he didn't even try to cover his nose and mouth--just sneezed right at the glasses and bottles on the back bar.  With many better options in King William and downtown San Antonio, Joe Blue's will not be on my list for a return visit.

reviews.author: Gloria C.
reviews.description: I don't know. Joe Blue's is alright, I guess.   I was recently there on a dead Tuesday night and received less than lackluster service from the bartender. It couldn't have been because he was slammed, more like he just didn't want to be there.   Besides that, it's definitely a beer-drinkers haven with quite a selection. I wish they had at least one cider to go along with all the beers they offer.   With friendlier service and better drink options at La Tuna, 1919, Stella, and Halcyon all in walking distance, it's not my first choice. Unless I have friends playing there, then I'm all in.

reviews.author: Brandon R.
reviews.description: I've never been to a place like this. The batender acted like he was annoyed that we were there yet nobody was there on a Friday night. We wanted to hear the jukebox but he told us no, we wanted to change one TV to a different game, he told us no.    The beer was warm, awful environment. Wait for this place to go out of business and hopefully something better moves in.   Oh the bartender was a dick.

reviews.author: Kay T.
reviews.description: I like to think of Joe Blues as my little secret.  Though it gets pretty crowded pretty quick on weekend night by those who know its whereabouts, this is a fairly intimate bar tucked unassumingly away behind Blue Star Brewery in the Blue Star Arts Complex.    The bar serves a full lineup of specialty martinis and cocktails. They keep a few beers on tap, including Stella Artois (a favorite of mine) and its always frigid; and a full selection of bottles and cans are available as well as a small but delicious selection of wines.   Patrons of Joe Blues are as varied as the alcohol on tap.  A young hipster crowd mingles with a more swanky uptown crowd and everyone in between seem to roll in and out seamlessly.  I like spots like this were people are just cool and respect each other and bask in their differences.   The last time I was in, Joe Blues had installed a jukebox.  The selections are a bit pricey in my opinion, but there were lots of songs to choose from and everyone in the bar seemed to enjoy taking turns making picks.  It was a good ice breaker.   The bar is small and gets smokey quick so if you're not into secondhand smoke inhalation venture out and sit on the patio and people watch everyone around Blue Star.  Tons of fun had when you venture off the beaten bath!

reviews.author: Robert P.
reviews.description: Ummmm, this place was "ok". Even though there were THREE guys behind the bar, it was still hard to get a drink. Yeah, the beer is gonna be a bit pricey (for the area), so I had no major complaints there. The restroom was kinda hard to find (you would know what I was talking about if you've been there). I guess the thing I didn't like was the parking situation. it was really hard to find decent parking.

reviews.author: Kent E.
reviews.description: Arrived about 10:00 on a Saturday night in May and this place was dead. No live music, no DJ, no piped in music. The place was empty. We walked in, were unimpressed, and walked out. Headed downstairs to Bar 1919.

reviews.author: April G.
reviews.description: Thought it was a jazz bar.  No music so we asked the bartender where the blues were. He pointed at the juke box where you have to put quarters in.  Ordered a Chardonnay and it was warm. :(. Don't do it

reviews.author: Kelly S.
reviews.description: Before we get into anything else... what a jukebox!! We spent half an hour putting money in the machine and just picking gorgeous songs (Mumford and sons FTW). Small, or intimate as you prefer, with nice clean lines and enough move around space for folks to belly up or sit at a table as they like.  Though there was only one bartender on staff, he was incredibly nice. Knowledgeable about the beer selection, which is fabulous and even trying to make the karaoke machine work on the big screen so we could fulfill all of our Celine Dion dreams. Being more of a liquor girl myself, I absolutely appreciated the heavy handed pours. El Rufuso especially liked the white Christmas tree, judging by his romp through the branches.   It was too cold but there's a sweet patio as well. If you're in the area and down for a brew, Blue Star is a great stop... but Joe Blues is where you should end your night.

reviews.author: Kevin N.
reviews.description: I feel like I should probably spend most of this review covering the nuances of the jukebox, or about how bright the light is in the hallway on en route to the rest room after you've been in here awhile. But I won't do that. What would be the point, really.   Besides, it's much more fun to talk about what Joe Blue's is - a typically late night stopover for the gang from Blue Star (and whoever else may be chatting each other up that day) - there's a solid brew selection present, even a little quirk in that regard, and they remember you (well, they often remember me, but that's probably 'cause I tend to make my way in when Krys directs, and when you're with folks in the know, that doesn't hurt).   You'll occasionally find live music, but you'll often find good cheer. And that's worth a little something, too, I'd say.

reviews.author: Kane T.
reviews.description: Perfect for those wishing to experience the price, atmosphere, and alcohol selection of a north side strip mall bar without actually having to drive all the way up there.

reviews.author: Mark W.
reviews.description: Taps and a wall of all the booze your little heart desires! Staff is friendly and knowledgable of the shaker tin and what's poured from a tap. A bit small but ample seating as the space was utilized nicely! Nice that they have a few tables out front for the fair weatherers. Drive, walk or cycle over for a cold one!

reviews.author: Eugene L.
reviews.description: Jukebox is amazing.  They got lots of good beers.  They don't specialize much in mixed drinks.  This is more of a beer joint.  Place is very hard to find if you're not familiar with the neighborhood.  Bartender is kinda stuck up as well as most of the regulars.

reviews.author: Joseph E.
reviews.description: Driving home after some business in the downtown area I hit some construction on Broadway that had detours that led me to Alamo Street and area I had never noticed before. I saw a couple of beer joints and then I noticed La Roca Cantina so I decided to wait out traffic and stop in for happy hour.  The place wasn't packed and so I got a spot at the bar. The inside has a U-shaped long bar you can post up at or several tables and sofas you can sit at in a separate room across the bar. It has more of a cocktail bar vibe than a beer joint and that is what I was looking for.  The bartender, Roel, asked what I would like so I started off with my go to, a Bulleit Rye Old fashion.  I watched Roel make it and he made it just the way I like it, test one passed.  As a follow-up, I asked if he could make a Sazerac, and he said yes, then asked what type of Rye I would prefer. I like when I'm given the option so after looking at their selection I went with a Rittenhouse Rye.  When it was served, it looked the part then after a sip, it tasted the part; test two passed.  Roel came over to ask if I liked the drinks and I gave him a thumbs up. He chatted with us for a while and made sure we were taken care of so he gets a thumbs up as well.  Overall, this is a nice off the beaten path cocktail bar that I want to come check out one weekend, Covid permitting.

reviews.author: Fabiola L.
reviews.description: The DJ SUCKSSSSSSS!!!!!! At least leave a song halfway. No mames ni me dejas cantar agusto -.-

reviews.author: Adrian A.
reviews.description: Terrible place , the bartenders are rude . The drinks are nothing exciting . Seems like the staff there thinks they are paying you . Better places in San Antonio .

reviews.author: Dennis S.
reviews.description: Fantastic Happy Hour at La Roca Cantina!   Sibling location of The Green Latern cocktail bar in Stone Oak, LRC served nicely made cocktails and in-house infused shots.  Strawberry serrano tequila and pineapple-coconut rum were tried on this visit (complimentary shot! from the awesome bartender for my first visit) and both were very smooth and flavorful.   The cucumber martini with a Tajin rim was a great change from my usual bourbon cocktail.   Refreshing and smooth, it makes a great anytime drink.

reviews.author: joseph b.
reviews.description: Awesome place TONY.  Great see you again . What a good feeling being there. Drinks, service ambiance all first class. Even if I did stay up past my bedtime

reviews.author: Tiara F.
reviews.description: The bartender Toni was amazing and went above and beyond when I requested drinks with egg whites. She made such good drinks that weren't on the menu and that was appreciated.I give Antonia 5 stars but the establishment and the experience at the end gets an overall 2.   I came here on a Thursday night with a few friends and enjoyed some drinks. Its a 360 bar which is nice because there are lots of seats around the bar. Beyond that they have some couches around that you are able to sit at if you'd like. When I'm at a cocktail bar I like to watch the drinks made so I prefer to sit at the bar when there's availability. I love cocktails with egg whites in them so I requested that from the bartender and she made me a few after asking the types of flavors I like. The music was cool and the vibe was low key except for some loud patrons across the bar.   Towards the end of the night it was getting close to closing and a short man who came out of nowhere. We hadn't seen him once all night.He told us that we had 3 minutes to drink your drinks. Then he repeatedly told us every 30 seconds how much time we had left.This was extremely obnoxious and ridiculous to say the very least. He was only doing this to myself and my group of friends, there were a total of three of us.  The bar was still full of about 10 other people not including the staff.So this was uncalled for to say the very least. I understand last call but there are ways to do that and you should treat everybody with respect.   We were paying customers who had spent a decent amount of money and tip very well. I don't appreciate being treated this way. When we were leaving and the bar was STILL full of people this guy changed his tune and was trying to shake our hands and thank us for coming.   My review would have been more starts if it wasn't for this guy. I'm not sure what this mans role was in the bar but he should learn how to treat people with respect and not be rude. The next time I'm in San Antonio I will not be coming back here.

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Not Covid safe, medium sized building, inside bar with only 1 station for drinks (bar) and poor service and rude bartenders. They have a decent happy hour but the cons outweigh the pros easily.

reviews.author: Manny A.
reviews.description: The "guard" let my  girl friend get in who had an expired ID because of COVID but soon as I tired he said no. Because I looked "suspicious".

reviews.author: Cynthia P.
reviews.description: Got there around 12:45 Friday night, (yesterday) there was no line so my bf and I are there to meet with my friend and another couple because he was celebrating his celebrating their birthday.  The security at the door said they were at capacity and it was gonna be about a 10-15 wait. We said it's okay we can wait. While we were waiting a group of 6 people arrive and the security tell them to wait behind us, another group of 7 people come and he tells him the same.  A waiter comes outside and says I can take in 6 people, I'm ready to go inside but the people behind my boyfriend and I yell we are 6. And the security let's them in. I tell the security why he did that and he said sorry I have no control over who goes in. At this point I'm upset. So I call my friends inside and tell them what happened, they said they have to get their waiter and give them money so they can let us in. I said okay so we wait, 20 min have gone by and the same waiter comes outside and lets his friend come in with a group of 7 people, skipping us again. This time around I'm LIVID! The security at the door makes a comment saying" if it gets to 1:30 am I would just leave if I was y'all" that made me even more upset. I called my friends inside and told them I was leaving, my friends said we were next but there was nobody else in the line.  They have VERY VERY POOR MANAGEMENT as well as a CLOWN as their security. How are you gonna tell me your at capacity when you just let 13 people in before me?!?! I should have called SAPD to check their establishment if that was the case because they were VIOLATING COVID restrictions.   If you don't know the security, a waiter, or a bartender, SONT BORHER TO GO TO THIS PLACE.

reviews.author: Gabriel E.
reviews.description: This bar plays great music but poor management in regard to security has really killed the vibe of the place. A middle aged (50s) caucasian security guard ranted for 20 minutes about how they were breaking TABC law by letting 80 people into the bar over capacity limits.   This middle aged (mid 50s) caucasian security guard proceeded to let two large groups of 10+ people into the club through the side door.... after a little persuading (a cash tip).  Three guys got fed up of waiting as this middle aged caucasian security guard let in the large groups beyond capacity ahead of the line. When the bar closed this middle aged security guard started handing out life time bans. Apparently the middle aged security guard has an ownership stake in the bar and is able to make business decisions.  Ultimately I give this bar 2 huge thumbs down . When security is taking cash tips and breaking TABC capacity regulations... but handing out lifetime bans to patrons who wait in line but get cut because they are unable to profit the security... something business wise needs to be re-evaluated.

reviews.author: Dean R.
reviews.description: Nice place good music, huge oval bar with sitting area behind it. Here on a Sunday busy for a Sunday. Decor very nice. Miguel bartender is nice.

reviews.author: Sara R.
reviews.description: I don't understand how this place can be enjoyable without a functioning AC. You will literally stand in line to step into a sauna and be surrounded with nothing but sweaty people.   It would be understandable if this was a one time thing and their was an issue but this is recurring. We live in Texas, and at the end of the day this is a business. A business that should provide AC to it's customers. â€

reviews.author: Ariel R.
reviews.description: This place is horrible and wouldn't recommend for anyone to go. Drink prices are over priced and they security at the door is a joke!!! They allow people To cut in front of you while I was waiting outside in the cold people from inside grabbing people from the end of the line to just walk right in with no id or anything. It was a BADDD experience.

reviews.author: Pam M.
reviews.description: This is a great little Cantina between the Riverwalk and Pearl Brewery area....a few blocks off of Broadway on 8th Street.   Great laid back environment with a huge bar that you can sit all the way around. They've also got regular table and chair setups along with some lounge style areas that are super comfortable...so no matter what style you are looking for, you are sure to be happy here. They've got some great happy hour prices that include $5 cucumber martinis and old fashioned options on there. You can't beat those prices and the drinks are good! Happy hour is typically open until 9. These are the 2 drinks my husband and I prefer and they were good enough we'd definitely come back.   They've also got live music on Friday and Saturday nights...I believe that starts at 10.

reviews.author: Mike M.
reviews.description: What?! A Sister bar to my favorite bar located downtown?! Woot Woot!! This is located right in the downtown area off of Broadway serving up delicious cocktails, that is a well decorated and spacious venue.  Don''t worry parking isn't an issue in this part of downtown.  Looking for that awesome date night? This is the place to be, its dim settings, fireplace, love seating, and drinks make it all the right settings for that excellent night ;)  The drinks, my my, isn't this what you were looking for? These fine artistic mixologist will make you that perfect cocktail.  Not sure what to order? Go ahead ask, For you shy folks, I would recommend a Cucumber or Strawberry Martini for those seeking out something sweeter.  It's a favorite and well known concoction by many who are fans of this bar.    Somewhere this cool isn't quite what I consider a dive bar, in fact, Friday and Saturday nights, you might even find many whom come up dressed up! It's a place where many professionals come to meet and loosen up.  So don't be shy to come in dressed nicely. I would recommend it, as I come in dressed to impress all the time!  Lastly, the drink prices themselves. Don't worry, its quite affordable compared to nearby cocktail lounges.  As I said, its a place where you and your date can enjoy yourselves without having to worry about cost, venue, or drinks. See you there!

reviews.author: Meg T.
reviews.description: This was our first UYE of YSB2017! And I loved this bar!  I really wish we'd had more of a crowd here since the seating in the back is straight up boss, but those of us who were in town early chilled at the bar and ended up Uberrushing some Tuckers (omg, so delicious) while I sipped on my old fashioned.  Now again, I almost wish this had been a night event because my drink was hard poured like a motha and that early in a YSB and after flying so many hours I just have not yet built up my tolerance to drink it that stiff. Light weight problems, amiright?  I'm so thankful Mike introduced us to this bar! The bartenders and their play list were awesome and we had a great time! A big thank you to La Roca for having us! Viva la YSB!

reviews.author: Spiceyweiner Y.
reviews.description: Hmm...bartenders need to be more efficient...drinks were good dj was on point...my thing is this if the Bartender gonna have 'friends' over...pay equal if not more attention to the other patrons i saw other people annoyed too...hope this place makes it..will come back it was laid back an comfy...

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: Badass happy hour menu. Colorful vibrant atmosphere with amazing bartenders who know how to make the best drinks. Happy hour menu carries variety of drinks from Moscow Mules to house shots that are guaranteed to get you throwed.

reviews.author: Tiffany G.
reviews.description: So, let me tell you how amazing the bartenders here are.   I came here on Saturday night. It was still lively with tons of people, and the bartender, Antonia,  rocked the crap out of that shift. She's how you would hope every bartender could give service on a busy Saturday night.   Then, I stopped in here on a Tuesday night, and I was privileged to see this place truly shine. Antonia makes beautiful drinks. She made the refreshingly sweet "Walk of Shame" and Cucumber Martini, which has a slight pucker yet smoothe finish.  Then, the uber talented and passionate Keith walks in and makes this beautiful pineapple tiki drink that (literally) transports you to a tropical paradise with one sip. We, then, took daiquiri shots in honor of San Antonio legend bartender Sasha Petraski.  Needless to say I had to take an uber home, but the passion, talent, and friendliness of both Antonia and Keith will definitely bring me back.   If you're looking for delicious craft cocktails and friendly-chill environment, I highly recommend La Rocca Cantina.

reviews.author: Shawn G.
reviews.description: I was blown away just walking in the door.  This place is beautiful! Great bartenders, awesome prices, a super cool atmosphere. This place is just a win all the way around. I wasn't 100% sure what La Roca was going to be like walking in. I saw an article in The Current talking about a Mexican style lounge, but what is that? Apparently it is a gorgeous bar, a huge space with sofas and lounge chairs, TVs, and probably a lot more stuff that I haven't found yet. Stop in for Happy Hour, it runs til 9pm most nights. Kick back on a sofa or sit at the bar and chat with whoever is working, you can't go wrong either way.

reviews.author: Elizabeth E.
reviews.description: The best coffee you'll find at the Pearl. Friendly staff, beautiful space.

reviews.author: Jackie K.
reviews.description: Larder is a great coffee shop located in the Hotel Emma and located right off of the Pearl brewery complex main square--Larder has entrances both through the hotel and outside in the complex.    Larder had a great selection of hot teas and pastries--I particularly liked the cinnamon roll (with cream cheese frosting!) and bananas foster muffins.  Service was excellent--the staff was so cheerful and seemed happy to be there.

reviews.author: Misty S.
reviews.description: Convenient place to pick up a snack or beverage, including beer and wine.  They have a large selection of canned beer in the back of the back of the shop.  There is also a coffee bar inside offering pastries and food.  You can take alcoholic beverages outside the 4 blocks area surrounding Hotel Emma as they have an open container policy.  .|\---/| | o_o | .\_^_/..2021

reviews.author: Haleigh J.
reviews.description: I love this place and the people! They have the best staff and always give great recommendations. Everyone is very friendly, prompt and remembers you when you come in. I'm grateful to be a regular to the this place. Highly recommend the kolaches and any of the pastries - even better paired with a coffee! A must try in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Arianne Victoria A.
reviews.description: Been to the Pearl countless times and I finally stepped foot inside this grocery store connected to Hotel Emma. During these times only 10 customers allowed at a time and mask is required.   They sell toilet paper here and some produce. They have some cheeses and wines as well. This is a fine grocery place so the goods are pricey and boujee. They have outside seating which is nice and it was not crowded at all. We took some lunch and bought coffee from here and ate in their patio pavilion.

reviews.author: Sabrina L.
reviews.description: My friend and I were walking around the Pearl on Sunday and stopped in to get a quick bite.  I had the bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich. It was so delicious.  It's almost like a Starbuck environment and we stood in line and got our food.  The staff was great and friendly.  The bread was light and fluffy, not sure if it was pretzel or what but it was really good and I am NOT a bread person.  The eggs and cheese were, well eggs and cheese not much you can do with that, but the bacon was the thicker bacon and was super yummy; 9 dollars, not bad for the Pearl.

reviews.author: Fabien J.
reviews.description: Just stepped in the Larder for a quick bite and while contemplating the beer and wine selection I was greeted by Kendra ,her selections is truly amazing,not to geeky and not to generics . The prices are spot on and there s a lot of gems to be discovered    I will surely be back to enjoy a great selection of wine in their quite Patio

reviews.author: Brie G.
reviews.description: Go here. Ask for a brown butter s'mores rice krispie treat.  Swoon. Pay for it. Enjoy every bite of it.   This shop has a nice selection of treats, snacks, lunch items, grocery items, drinks, etc.  The staff was friendly and helpful as we tried to figure out what to eat.    I would also stop by here if you were looking for a gift for a foodie as they had a nice selection of different olive oils, hot sauces, etc.    It's a nice addition to The Pearl!

reviews.author: Theresa C.
reviews.description: This was a truly cute place for a cheap can of beer in a hipster atmosphere. They serve all sorts of coffee as well, and you can pick up high-end culinary creations ( different types of quinoa salads or vegetable medley in different seasonings and sauces). I really wish they would pretty on their menu a charcuterie board, as they have a plethora of cheese and meat options for purchase separately. I ended up buying a container of artichoke hearts and olives in a olive oil dressing to enjoy with some beverages. Had my companion been hungrier, I would have also purchased some brie or other soft cheese and crackers , and possibly salami.  I was very happy with their hours of operation as they were open before most anything in the Pearl Brewery plaza. Terrific place!

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: Good coffee, slightly unfortunate name.  I've been to Larder a couple of times--once for a cup of coffee, and another for a tasty lunch. The staff is pretty friendly and it also doubles as a small convenience store (albeit more expensive than your local Valero).  Their lemonade is perfect for a hot day, and the sandwich was super filling. I only managed to eat half before taking the rest home. And the thing I was most excited to eat later? This MASSIVE fudgy brownie. It was one of those perfect brownies that reminded me of a gourmet Little Debbie brownie. Dense. Fudgy. In need of a cigarette and a nap afterward.  Coffee shops are not a revolutionary idea, especially when you're traipsing about at The Pearl. But out of towners (or even staycationers) staying at Hotel Emma can't go wrong picking up a fine brew and treat at Larder.

reviews.author: Diana G.
reviews.description: If you want a snack or a drink while staying at the hotel, this is your place. The beer is the same price as in the hotel Ice box, so don't go out of your way to try to save money. $3 per can of pearl beer.   The store has a combination of dry goods and deli/ pastry items. They sell coffee too. The staff is great.   The big plus is that it is easily accessed through hotel Emma.

reviews.author: Leah D.
reviews.description: I just love hotel Emma and the pearl. Everything about it is gorgeous! I came by here with a friend to grab a matcha latte. Lovvvvve this place. The service is super friendly and just great!  The matcha latte comes with honey and cinnamon and your choice of milk! Love it. I frequent this place for a reason.

reviews.author: Brittany S.
reviews.description: I'm a sucker for beautiful gourmet markets. Larder at Hotel Emma is no exception. The cozy space offers two narrow stories of wines, Texas honeys, desserts, pre-made salads, fresh local juices and more.   Fun fact: this is the first hotel in Texas to boast an in-house journey market (they even sell pre-made picnics!). The fun thing about this location is that it's wedged equidistant between several of the key San Antonio attractions like the Japanese Gardens, Grotto, Alamo and Breckinridge Park. One more note about the in-house market-- it's the old fermenting cellar of Pearl Brewery. DO NOT leave Larder without popping your head into the Hotel Emma lobby. Bring your camera and enjoy.

reviews.author: Michael F.
reviews.description: Just had a burger delivered from Larder. Looks like someone ate part of the patty before it was delivered. I feel like the little old lady that would say "where's the beef" I just weighed the patty. 71 grams!!! That's absurd! $13 for a 71 gram burger!

reviews.author: Stephen M.
reviews.description: Wow. Where have you been all my life. I don't think I have ever seen anything like this place. The cortado was absolutely adequate. Not the best Cortado ever. But nothing, and I mean nothing, has ever matched the vibes of this place. I'm pretty much planning on making Larder my new go-to meeting place for coffee with folks. I can't even do it justice with words. So I just took a bunch of pictures. Wow.

reviews.author: Inga C.
reviews.description: You're having fun at the Pearl--maybe you and your family have been splashing in Gustav's Geysers or playing on the lawn at Pearl Park--and you start to feel hungry. If you didn't pack a picnic and don't have the time or cash for a table service meal, then go to Larder and get a snack. They have grab-and-go juice, yogurt, nuts, crackers, etc. They also brew coffee and prepare food to order. Most restaurants at the Pearl have a higher price point, but you can get a taste-stimulating treat at Larder without too much wallet damage. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Rebeca A.
reviews.description: Best lunch in San Antonio! Service, food, and ambiance is excellent.  My recommendation is a hot sandwich or their granola bar.

reviews.author: Natalie T.
reviews.description: Staff have gone above and beyond and consistently provide exceptional customer service! Today they took my order/payment/etc from outside because I had my dog with me and was nervous to bring him in (I just adopted him a week ago). They were pretty busy because of the storm and businesses closed everywhere, yet still were unfrazzled and helped me get some food and bev (which I was picking up for my husband who has been on a really long stretch of working nights at the hospital). Anyhow, great staff! Their food is also good! Have ordered several of their breakfast, lunch, and premade deli options. Some things are a little pricey, but comparable to everywhere else nearby.

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: Nice little shop with very welcoming and attentive employees. I bought a spinach quiche, some biscuits with aged cheddar, and a mixed greens salad. I was just roaming around looking after buying some ice cream at Lick.
