The employee saw that I was carrying the ice cream and generously offered to bag all of my items in a nice bag with handles, she even double bagged it to make sure it was sturdy enough to carry my stuff.

reviews.author: Abby W.
reviews.description: Grabbed a premade sandwich out of the case. Just an FYI- these are dry sandwiches and in need of some sort of dressing. Just not a great sandwich. My husband ordered one off the menu and he said it was okay. It was warmed and came with housemade chips and a good pickle. We each grabbed a Pearl beer (When in Rome) and went to the pool. Looks better than it tasted.

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: It's about time we got one of these! My husband and I used to frequent them in San Antonio. We love the large amount of drafts from all over. Greg was so awesome and fun to talk to while we were there. They have growlers and crowlers you can get filled, as well as bring in your own growler for a fill. The inside is dog-friendly.  My only meh about this place is that there are 3-4 taps with Guadalupe Brewing's beer. Don't get my wrong, I love them, but they are right down the road, so to me it doesn't make sense to have that many of theirs on tap, especially since my husband and I frequent local breweries.  Can't wait to see what else they bring in and are excited to go back!

reviews.author: Chad L.
reviews.description: Had the opportunity to hit up Big Hops here in New Braunfels yesterday and had a great time. The young lady behind the bar was awesome and you could tell she loved working there. Nice selection of beer and a fun environment definitely says I'll return for more visits. If you are in New Braunfels definitely stop by and check them out. First Beer is Melted Snowman Winter Ale by @whitestone_brewery and second beer is Battle of Hops by @viva_brewery

reviews.author: Diana C.
reviews.description: Great atmosphere! Sparkling new and fun family games! Plus, great beer options -- especially IPAs! :-)

name: Blue Box
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Ruthie W.
reviews.description: It's been a while since I've heard of the Blue Box Bar. We were in the Pearl area for dinner so we thought to check it out after. Sundays and Mondays are all-day happy hours! Awesome!  I tried the Daiquiri from the happy hour menu and my husband tried the King Ghidorah. The bartender happened to be the one who invited the drink, King Ghidorah. We both enjoyed our drinks.  Definitely a good stop, now that I know where it's located.

reviews.author: Zack H.
reviews.description: I think they read my review my old review!... The interior is newer and bluer  Shinier. A fresh coat of teal paint and some mod formica bartops go a long way

reviews.author: Anna K.
reviews.description: You must hit the pearl when you're visiting San Antonio! We came out here for drinks and was told this place is great for cocktails - keep in mind there is no kitchen, no food!  They do have a house cocktail menu - two were a miss but two were big hits! There's also a classic cocktail menu with happy hour prices depending on time.   House cocktails were only $10 each which is a steal for their location!

reviews.author: Melanie O.
reviews.description: We started the night here, went elsewhere in the Pearl for dinner, and came back because we enjoyed it so much! They have happy hour deals ($6 cocktails) until 8pm, even on Saturdays! That's a steal compared to the other restaurants nearby, which makes this a great place for a pre or post dinner drink. The bartenders were all really nice and checked in regularly, even when it was busy. Will definitely come back!

reviews.author: Zoie C.
reviews.description: Great happy hour! The drink are delicious and affordable, especially for the atmosphere.

reviews.author: Alisha W.
reviews.description: Came here just to start the night and never left. Good music, good people, great liquor selection, and an abundance of bartenders. Definitely worth a stop. Not a lot of bars you can find Blanton's in but you can get it here. My friend was having an issue with a guy hitting on her and getting handsy. She went to the restroom and while she was gone they escorted him out of the bar. Way cool. 5 stars for sure!

reviews.author: Gianna N.
reviews.description: We came to this place as visitors from out of state, unfortunately the staff was not very friendly. Drinks are okay but staff is just a little dismissive and unhelpful.

reviews.author: Desiree V.
reviews.description: Very loud atmosphere inside; music all over the place. Bartenders are very courteous and make great craft cocktails. Love they variety of spirits they have.

reviews.author: Alex D.
reviews.description: Crowded and noisy but the bartenders are attentive and good at their craft. You cannot expect much here but the cocktails are reliable.

reviews.author: Angela P.
reviews.description: While walking around the Pearl Brewery district, we stopped here to relax and have drinks. The bar is trendy with a nice ambiance. Everyone in the bar seemed to be enjoying themselves. I had a glass of wine while my friends sipped cocktails. The bar is upscale and offers a variety of wine, beer, spirits, and cocktails. It reminded me of trendy bars I've visited in New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, and San Francisco.  To me, they are all very similar. Nice place. Good time.

reviews.author: Aly W.
reviews.description: Wait: No wait, we went right in. It was day time during the week.  Server: Rude, really rude. Definitely was not a fan and would not go back. We actually met our group elsewhere because we were not at all fans of the vibe  Food Qualityand Order: I ordered a RosÃ©, nothing special, just something light for the afternoon.   Atmosphereand Decor: I loved their decor and how bright yet moody this place was.

reviews.author: Yin H.
reviews.description: They have an amazing HH that goes til 8 pm!! We stopped in for pre-dinner drinks. Beautiful bar, friendly service, nice outdoor seating area for people watching :)  We ordered a drink that was supposed to be jalapeno driven but didn't taste it at all, which was a bit curious. By mistake, they had also made us a jalapeno tequila drink, which they gave us as a courtesy. As we finished our cocktail, we tried the shot and this tasted exactly as I had hoped our drink would. For our 2nd round, I went to the bartender who had made our shots and asked him to re-create this in the form of a cocktail. Success!! HH drinks are very reasonably priced $6-9. Not quite sure what happened with our 1st round?? Normally, I'd expect the establishment to rectify the situation but they had given us free shots.

reviews.author: Del C.
reviews.description: I've got some fond memories here. Two Super Bowls and many other evenings with friends.  Unfortunately, those great memories are fading with every visit.  This last visit will probably be my last. Came in to watch the Cowboys game and while the drinks were good and the bartender made some attempt at service I felt like I was in a bar in the hood. Blaring gangster rap was all they played....all night!   I'm not anti rap and love hip hop  but  I really don't want to listen to non-stop fuck this and fuck that bitch while I'm trying to enjoy the game. I thought there would be a drive by shooting!

reviews.author: Lauren F.
reviews.description: Going to blue box is always a great time. Staff is exactly the right amount of friendly and attentive, (Chris was absolutely wonderful), and the atmosphere is classy but not up tight. Pro tip: they make a mean gin fizz.

reviews.author: Dean R.
reviews.description: Bar is really nice! Bartender Cruze is awesome. Very nice decor modern look. Kraft drinks. Valet at hotel Emma 20:00 to Vaket literally a 100yards from bar.

reviews.author: Brigid P.
reviews.description: How did I seriously walk past this place for 6 years and not notice it existed?  F in observation for me. I really liked the setup and happy hour all day Sunday and Monday is legit. The drinks were ok, but not awesome. I'd stop by end if I was there and wanted a cheap drink during happy hour but the quality wouldn't send me out of my way. I liked the atmosphere though!

reviews.author: Katie N.
reviews.description: Cool bar! Directly across from Hotel Emma, this spacious bar offers craft cocktails and craft beer on tap. They have happy hour until 8p, which is great since most in the Pearl areas end at 6p.  The bartender is very knowledgeable about the brews and drinks and very friendly and attentive.  The bar is large with a huge (and clear) projector that was playing MLB when we went. There seems to be an upstairs with another bar, most likely for the crowded weekends.  There is a large patio outside with shade and nice lighting. A plus- the women's restroom is very clean and smells very nice! Win!

reviews.author: Olivia G.
reviews.description: Pretty sure this place is laundering money. I asked the bartender how much a well drink was...he said $4. I get a tab and have a $6 tab... I asked the bartender why did they charge extra? Well, she (the manager) came out and took our drinks for "questioning" the extra $2/drink. Guess they are either hurting for money so much they need to steal dollar on dollar or are running a bigger scheme...who knows. Anyway, 2 minutes later the manager tried to say we were "somewhere before there" and kicked us out (lol) for asking why we were charged $1 more per drink!!! LOL!!!! This place is so cheap, steals, and thinks their clients can't do simple math.

reviews.author: Stephanie S.
reviews.description: My 1st visit to Blue Box was so much fun! I had the opportunity to muddle some berries, taste test a shot, and sip an awesome cocktail!!  In all the fun I forgot the name of the refreshing cocktail I drank but it had vodka and rosemary in it!  The staff/bartender were super cool and friendly! They were so helpful and made conversation with us! I will def return!

reviews.author: Andrew D.
reviews.description: 1st and last time coming here, a few of us were looking to grab a drink after dinner on a Saturday night so as we walked out of Emma we see a line so we figured we'd give it a try, at first we are standing in line to what appears to be a eternity only to realize the people walking towards the other entrance are getting inside a lot faster while the line never moved so we decided to try our luck with the front door...  This is where it gets good....as we walk up to the door the bouncer a huge African American man proceeds to tell us that it's not a entrance and points to the line...my friend rebuttals that she's noticing people walk in through this entrance if we can be let in as it's cold outside. His response....wait for it...$80 gets you in through this door. I was at a loss for words we say no thank you and as we walk away he yells $50! I'm sorry but Blue Box has lost our business. I believe as guest we should not be extorted to pay such a egregious price to be let in.....maybe management should consider increasing the bouncer pay where they won't feel the need to extort guest to give them money to step inside the establishment.

name: Lucy Cooper's Ice House
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Kay J.
reviews.description: If you want to hang out at a bar for drinks, Lucy Coopers is great! It's loud, hoppin, and has multiple TV's for sports, fights, etc. Outside, there are interactive games, big fans for hot days, and warming fires/heaters for cool nights.   We decided to bring our son here to celebrate a week after his 21st birthday. We understand that the place is strictly 21 and up but it seemed overkill that he was carded when we entered the building, carded by two employees while we were looking for a table, and carded by two more servers as we sat at a table. We laughed about it but it seemed a bit unorganized.  The drinks were great! We ordered a few different mixed drinks followed by beer and seltzers. The food, however was disappointing. We heard great things about some appetizers they have on the menu so we ordered a few. The Clothesline Bacon, the fried Mac-N-Cheese, and the pretzel with queso (and some sort of marmalade but I'm not sure the flavor). Honestly, we didn't really like any of the food :( The bacon was chewy, thick, and had a strange taste and the Mac-N-Cheese bites were extremely greasy and flavorless. The pretzel was okay but a bit dry. We loved all the drinks and the fun atmosphere so we'll definitely be back -but we'll eat before we come next time.

reviews.author: Will D.
reviews.description: I was super impressed with the food. The burgers and Mac and cheese sticks were great. My friend and I thought the fried pickles were a bit salty,  ur overall we were very helpful. Plenty of tvs and beer to select from. They also had a fun little dart machine if you're looking for that.   There's more food I want to try here.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: So very very disappointed in our visit today. We have always enjoyed our service (and food) until today.   13 groups of people in 50+ group setting. 5 servers standing around laughing and huddling. Our server Ali was MIA most all of our visit. Ask for Tabasco 3 times before in was provided with no apologies. Ali left with no information about who would take over. Saw her leave to the parking lot and left wondering.  This didn't appear to be an urgent need to leave as her and 3-4 other servicers reviewed tabs etc before she disappeared. A simple ' I'm leaving and this is who will be taking over' would have sufficed.  I'm frustrated with the experience. The food today is terrific as always. Service today is subpar. Very sad.

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: I came here for the Nashville hot chicken sandwich. I heard good things. I also ordered the basket of onion rings. The rings were bulky and fresh and very tasty and crunchy. The Nashville chicken sandwich was excellent. Just the right blend of sweetness and heat. My advice is ask for the cole slaw on the side. The Texas toast gets soaked on one side with the juice from the cole slaw. The drinks are served in unconventional bar ware but it works. For example my old fashioned was in the glass pictured below. Stay away from the house margarita drinks as they are tiny in size. I also advise avoiding during Cowboys football games. That is unless you're one of the fans of Cowboys.  Bartender seemed overworked so bring your patience. She'll eventually get to taking your order.

reviews.author: Priscilla T.
reviews.description: Cool little hang out spot! They do ID so bring it with you! They had trash can nachos which is pretty cool just basically nachos in a tin then they remove the tin from the nachos! The beer was good too! We came during St. Patty's day and it wasn't too packed and they had green beer!

reviews.author: Tim E.
reviews.description: Love the bar but not sure why they play funniest home videos during Cowboys games. Just bad business. Going somewhere else for playoff and future games.

reviews.author: Rita M.
reviews.description: I was in town for a family emergency and wanted to get away for a little while to have dinner and cocktails. My sister suggested Lucy Cooper's because she loves their food and outdoor patio is a bonus to her.  We shared the Boss Hogg, Krack fries, Mac and cheese, and I had the Honey Suckle Sangria Popsicle Margarita. Everything was so delicious! The Boss Hogg was loaded with pulled pork, smoked ham, applewood bacon, and smokey sausage, and smothered with Coca-Cola bbq sauce. Yum! We split it because it was too big for one person and we wanted to try a couple of sides. The fries were delicious. I looked on their menu and couldn't find their Mac and cheese but it was so, so good. I hope they didn't take it off the menu.   They have a great drink menu and I decided to try the Suckle Sangria Popsicle Margarita, I'm always down to try new drinks. It was great. We ate out on the patio which has a cool vibe with it's fire pits and chilled vibe. The service was great and the food and drinks were brought out in a timely manner.  All in all it is a great place and I will definitely be back to try more of their unique menu items. I love me some Cajun/Southern food and this place did not disappoint!

reviews.author: Jesus C.
reviews.description: Third time coming to Lucy Coopers.  Drinks are cold and good, apps are good. I would give a five if drinks were served faster and there were more options for food. Seems like every time I've come drink service is very slow. I would also order more food if there were more traditional bar foods. It gets a four because of the fun times I've had here. Great place to chill and don't miss out on the naught bingo on Wednesday's.

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: I give Lucy Cooper's a 5 out of 5 for everything from service to food and everything in between.  I came in for happy hour on a Friday and it was packed (COVID rules applying of course and thank you  for that).  We met the manager Alex that evening and he was great!  Helped us out a lot and made our visit wonderful.  He was on top of the seating for customers and meeting with others while he was back and forth.    Destiny was our waitress and she was fabulous and fun.  We Joked with her and she was a good sport with a great attitude.  Friday night happy hour is the best.  I suggest the shrimp boil and bacon clothesline.

reviews.author: Jessie A.
reviews.description: This is an ice house; lots of fried foods. There are some interesting items on the menu, twists on Cajun/bar food. I got the Nola barbecue shrimp and my husband got the prime rib. The shrimp was a little too sauced for my taste, and it comes with a biscuit sitting on top. I got the blood Orange cider, tall. I didn't realize how tall that is! The one rib sandwich was good, very generous with the meat, it came with au jus, really good. They have a free stouts on tap, which we appreciate. The service was fast and friendly. There is outdoor seating with misters, but you are on the access road, so, I imagine it's noisy. Cute decor, and several tv screens.

reviews.author: Saunya O.
reviews.description: This Ice House has become one of my top favorite places to dine in San Antonio. I have dined there three times already and never disappointed with the quality of the food or service. The chef is a genuinely sweet soul you can just tell cares about the food.  So much so, that I decided to order their Thanksgiving dinner package and boy was I NOT disappointed!  The package could easily feed a family of 8 or more and had a choice of ham or turkey; we got the ham. It was a large package that included homemade-style baked macaroni and cheese, green bean casserole, mash potatoes and gravy, dressing with cranberry sauce, rolls, sweet potatoes, and a dessert. Y'all I am Southern, from the backwoods of Mississippi and this meal touched my soul!  I am beyond impressed with the quality and seasoning of the food. The dressing was so moist but not in a mushy way; it was cooked the old fashion way like I had growing up in MS. The mac and cheese was cooked by somebody's grandma I'm sure of it cause it was too good. The rolls are out of this world and I hope I can order them anytime.   I am new here in San Antonio and I don't know if this is something they do every year, but it should and everyone should order at least once; you will not be disappointed.   Thank You Lucy Cooper for making my Thanksgiving amazing, The Patrick and Saunya ODwyer

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: My favorite place to hang for so many. Lucy comes out and visits with folks. The servers are all so friendly. The establishment is always clean. There is plenty of space outside to sit (important for folks who are a bit Covid nervous). There are firepits outside for ambiance and warmth. They have music on the weekends. Great location.  All the food is awesome - my favorites are probably the tin can nachos, clothesline bacon, Friday $10 shrimp boil. There are always events on the calendar.

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: The food was very good.  We started out with the Fried Green Tomatoes which were delicious (so good that I forgot to take a picture).  The drinks were great.  And the food and service was spot on.

reviews.author: Melinda P.
reviews.description: I love this place! Our waitress, Isabella, was amazing! She took great care of us and those in our party! We will be back again!!

reviews.author: Sage A.
reviews.description: Don't waste your time here - Horrible Management   My brother came into town from out of state, and we had to come to Lucy Coopers due to the amount of people we had. So coming here was not by choice - strictly the only option we had.   I forgot my ID at home and was not aware that you had to be 21 to be on the premises. Not only am I 25 years old, I am with my entire family and PARENTS that are validating my age.   The management told me I had to prove my age and if I had a photo of my ID that would work. Sure enough I had a photo and guess what, they said "it could be fake" so no it didn't work. SO WHY EVEN STATE THAT?  I'll admit I don't look my age, but still this is ridiculous. Then they stated if I had a photo of my birth certificate that would work and guess what again? Nope - could be fake even though I had a photo it.   These people are freaking ridiculous - not worth my money. If a cop accepts a photo copy of my ID and insurance a damn bar can too.

reviews.author: Rachel S.
reviews.description: Still such a fan! I have been coming throughout COVID, with the larger patio, its nice that sitting outside is an option. Friday night is $10 Shrimp Boil night, but expect a crowd, especially on the patio, not for the shrimp, just for the atmosphere. COVID precautions are set in place, and they do implement the rules. If you are even just standing near your table, they will ask you put your mask on. Oh, and the shrimp boil is offered daily, its just on special on Friday nights. And they have changed up their seasoning a little bit. YUM!  We stopped in on a Wednesday night to meet some friends for dinner on the patio, not realizing it was Naughty Bingo Night. What fun we had! OMG! The host is hilarious. It is $2 for the bingo dauber, since COVID, you keep your own, but you can bring it back the next Wednesday, and play for free! The prizes are novelty prizes. None of us won, but we had a great time playing along.   Husband and I shared the Hawaiian flat bread pizza, topped with a coca cola bbq sauce, which was a nice added touch of flavor. The Clothesline Bacon is one of my absolute favorite things on the menu here. Who doesn't love bacon... and this bacon is out of the world!!   And if you haven't ordered the Tin Can Nachos... do so. Its fun just watching them remove the can and seeing the glorious nacho pile that awaits you!

reviews.author: Tami S.
reviews.description: first visit here, we'll be back for friday night happy hour!   we were looking for somewhere new to try and landed on lucy coopers.   upon arrival, we were a bit perplexed as to whether or not to seat ourselves. the place was packed, we looked outside, didnt see a host stand or a place to sit. wandered back inside as a couple was leaving, so we took their spot. --- NOTE: we did not see anyone standing waiting for a table.  the music was just starting up - we were pretty close to the "stage" area - and it did make convo hard. would prolly choose outdoor seating next time if music is scheduled.   we had seen the shrimp boil on their facebook page, so decided to split that. debated between apps, but decided on fried green tomatoes.  while we were waiting an app was delivered to a table next to us. it was bacon - and it was clipped to a miniature clothesline! we had read something about a clothesline in the bacon app description but had assumed it was figurative! lol!   the glazed bacon comes with a peach marmalade and it looked DELICIOUS! we will get it next time.  the fried green tomatoes were very tasty, and the crispy batter held up even after they cooled off.  the shrimp boil was very good; i liked the seasoning, and shrimp were large and "easy peel". we had debated on whether to get 1 or 2, but with an app, i thought 1 pound of shrimp was enough to split.  the surprise came when we got our bill, we were expecting to pay $20 for the boil, but it was only TEN! we asked and were told the shrimp boil was $10 as part of the happy hour every friday!

reviews.author: Krista C.
reviews.description: Was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked this place! The space is fairly large with indoor and outdoor patio seating (with misters to keep you cool!). Great bar food for sharing with friends but also good entrees. Ordered the fried green tomato BLT and it was delicious!

reviews.author: Esmeralda E.
reviews.description: 10/16/ 2021 Service sucks, I'd really hate to see this place on a busy day. We sat outside because it was a nice day. I had to wave down my waitress to take my order and to order two additional drinks after that. I asked a pregnant waitress to wave down my waitress and she was also clueless. My waitress named Lauren was clueless as well. I ordered items on your menu and she was clueless on what your restaurant had to offer. I will never return and will make sure everyone knows why, regretfully the food was actually good. If your restaurant plans to succeed, I suggest hire employee that respect their patronage.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I have visited a few times and have always had a great experience. They have ample outdoor seating and plenty of heating lamps and fire pits. Our waitress was very knowledgeable regarding the menu and polite. They also have drink specials so be sure to ask. I also like the Tin Can Nachos. It is entertaining to watch them remove the can with pliers and seeing all the gooey cheese and nachos spill out.

reviews.author: Chau N.
reviews.description: First time here. They gave us a samples of all the soups so we can try out before ordering. We got shrimp pasta, crab bisque, jalapeno bisque(?), cat fish blackened. They all taste good. The waiter Jenn is super nice and friendly. I would recommend the restaurant to other people

reviews.author: Jake C.
reviews.description: Great food and very good and upbeat service! Kayla P.F. Was our server and definitely made my first experience here a great one due to her extensive knowledge and kind service.

reviews.author: Ivan R.
reviews.description: First of all EXCELLENT SERVICE !!!  Love this place, our food was served in just a few minutes; the fried calamari was delicious as well as the red beans and rice.  I had fish n chips and my babies had the chicken sandwich, everything was good.

reviews.author: Tammi B.
reviews.description: THE PLACE ALWAYS PUTS A SMILE ON OUR FACES!!!  When we moved here 6 years ago, we stumbled onto this amazing restaurant while down in San Antonio for an appointment.  They have the freshest seafood west of the Gulf.  The place has a feel of a neighborhood hangout where everyone knows your name.  The staff is friendly and very attentive.  Today when we stopped for dinner, we were celebrating a birthday.  Sarah, our server, was fast, friendly, and fun.  Will probably ask for her next time we stop in.  They have daily "chalkboard specials" along with a menu with something for everyone.  I had the scallops and bacon wrapped shrimp. Mom had the bbq salmon tacos.  Both were delicious.  Got the peel and eat shrimp for our appetizer, which come served on crushed ice on a silver platter.   Give it a try!  Well worth the trip.

reviews.author: Ashley L.
reviews.description: I'm actually not a big fish person, but my dad was in town and wanted some seafood!  Staff was friendly, location was nice! I ordered the BBQ salmon tacos and my dad had the fish and chips.  I'm not a huge fish person and can tolerate salmon from time to time and I have to say that the salmon tacos were very good! I could have done for some smaller bite portions as on two of the tacos it felt like there was a whole filet in the tortilla, but overall with the BBQ sauces and slaw, it was great!

reviews.author: Dana L.
reviews.description: Way overpriced for what you get. My family enjoyed their food, but $3 for a small cup of white rice? Ridiculous. Add to that I got my foot a full 10 minutes after my family and the "grilled" chicken was blacked, charred, and tough. The "iced" tea was lukewarm with maybe 2 or 3 ice cubes. Tonight was pretty pathetic.

reviews.author: Jeremiah G.
reviews.description: If fried fish is on the menu, I'm trying it out. Being from NOLA I have a very high standard when trying fried catfish. Of course I had my doubts because how you going to have Alabama catfish rather than something local but never the less. The catfish was good. The fries were also a nice grease fried crisp.   The real reason for the 5 star is for the margaritas. Get them. My mother picked it up and expecting a basic marg I was hit was this amazing sweetness with just a hint of tang. Get the margarita.   The gf went with the fish tacos which were. Your basic taco but what really made it nice was the soft tortilla they used to WRAP the taco. I know weird but since the tortilla was so good the fish was just a filler.

reviews.author: Nanette H.
reviews.description: Jamie was terrific! She anticipated our needs before we asked. We ate at the Northwoods location. The food was delicious. I think they have the best seafood anywhere!

reviews.author: M. E G.
reviews.description: This the answer to the coast but in your own backyard . Do not miss the oyster nachos or the daily specials ! This chef treats you to amazing fresh seafood flavors !

reviews.author: Janet P.
reviews.description: Good service and food!  Fish tacos are good and so iis the salad with pecans. I forgot the name but it's amazing.  This is a must try restaurant

reviews.author: Sandra S.
reviews.description: They tried.  My rating is based on the COVID-19 conditions.  I placed an online order.  Told them I was waiting and they gave my order to another person.  It gets better, the girl came back in and they gave it to me.  At this point, I'm hungry.  I'm done waiting and the kitchen staff was amazing.  The hostess was nice and attentive.  I only took it because I saw the person who walked back in and the containers are see through.  Not sure what caused the mix up and I left a tip online when I placed my order.  Food sanitation rules mean they throw out the food but I'm rambling and disappointed.  I'll try them out again if this food tastes good.

reviews.author: Melissa E.
reviews.description: Good food. Even better service!   I had the shrimp and shroom linguine. It has such a nice kick to it. Everyone I was with basically wiped their plate clean!

reviews.author: Diane C.
reviews.description: We ordered to-go last night and my husbands shrimp salad still had the poop sacks in the shrimp

reviews.author: Jim L.
reviews.description: A great place to go if you are looking for seafood! Everything is very well done there. The servers and staff are nice. They also have a quaint outside seating area. It is very cozy in my opinion. In the restaurant, a few of the walls are decorated beautifully in the nautical theme. And then you have another wall that makes it feel like you are on an old ship eating seafood. I enjoy everthing there so far. May daughter orders off menu because she mainly likes butter pasta and grilled shrimp. I am not sure why they do not make that dish there, it is super delish! The fish and chips are awesome there. The fish and batter makes it light and not heavy at all. I have had a few of their house special entrees but I am curious about their specials. It was too late at the time when I ordered, that I saw the mussels dish that looked super interesting!  This place is tucked away near the HEB and across from Zios. If you haven't been, I highly suggest you go.

reviews.author: Jean G.
reviews.description: This has been one of our favorites for a while. I just never sat down and wrote a review for them. Reasons we like it: great place, good atmosphere, excellent drinks, awesome food.  It's pretty small on the inside, but they just set up tables and chairs on the outside too which is great. Not sure whether they did that for the pandemic or not, but I really liked that change. This last time we were there, it looked like they were running at 100% occupancy which is good for them. My husband really enjoyed the music which was an 80's metal band feel.   We usually have to wait for a while before we are seated, so we were pleasantly surprised to only have to wait a couple minutes. And it was a Saturday night around 6:30, so prime time.   We ordered our usual drinks and appetizers. My husband likes the jalapeÃ±o margarita, and I like the Tito's lemonade. Mine wasn't as good this time. Didn't seem like there was any alcohol in it. We always order the oyster nachos WHICH IS A MUST! They are literally the best thing there. We even had to order two because my husband wanted more. We also ordered a cup of crab bisque which is also very good.  So this is one of the reasons I did not give 5 stars. The whole reason I went there was to get the crab legs, but they didn't have them! Sooo bummed, you have no idea! So I ended up ordering the scallops that were on the specials board, and my husband got the shrimp tacos. Both pictured and both excellent. One other dish that I didn't see but if they still have it you must try is the cheesy grits. So good too!  At the end, we ordered the bread pudding to go. For some reason I remember reading or hearing that it was the best dessert there. I was wrong. This was the other reason for the 4 stars instead of 5. We did order it to go, so that might have had something to do with it. Maybe if you stay and eat it in the restaurant, it would taste better. I don't know. It was just dry and the sauce wasn't good.  Again, one of our go to's as far as dining out goes. I guess I need to call next time before we decide to make the drive over there to make sure they have the crab legs.

reviews.author: Terri B.
reviews.description: Food and service here are always excellent! I've never been disappointed in 5 years of coming here. Skylar came through for us again today with super service! See you again soon!

reviews.author: Nina M.
reviews.description: Our go to place always for fresh seafood. The blackened salmon salmon is hands down amazing. And of course you can never go wrong with their oysters.

reviews.author: Christi J.
reviews.description: Might I say, the food, service, and ambience of this place is top notch! Social distancing isn't really enforced here but everything else is great. My family and I came here a week ago and were seated immediately. Our server was amazing! She was very attentive to our needs and provided recommendations from the menu. I don't think we had a single complaint about your food; it was delicious and we didn't have to wait too long to get it. Since it's crawfish season, my husband ordered a pound and it was bomb. We finished the whole thing within minutes. Fish and chips were delicious and flavorful. Calamari was also delicious; the two sauces that accompanied it were excellent. Truthfully speaking, I don't have any complaints about this place. It was that good!

reviews.author: Erin K.
reviews.description: I am in town on business and wanted something small and reasonably healthy.  This was my second choice, as the first turned out to be closed on Mondays.  This was my good fortune, as I had a wonderful meal of the scallops and bacon wrapped shrimp served on a bed of mashed potatoes and wilted spinach.  It was perfect in all ways;preparation, taste and size.  I have brought a slice of the key lime pie back to my hotel room for later.  My server was sweet.  The restaurant is casual but charming.  My guess is they do a pretty noisy business on Fridays and Saturdays.  All in all a nice surprise!

reviews.author: Yvette S.
reviews.description: We have been repeated guests for the past 4 years and it's about time we share why we keep returning.  Drinks are fun and tasty. Service has always been friendly, quality of food has met my standards for this laid back seafood grill restaurant.  We moved here 5 years ago from Louisiana and I have to say, this place makes me feel at home.  Food is what you would expect. I love their fishandchips. I honestly crave it once in a while.   I miss their crawfish ettouffe. My husband and I have ate almost all their specialty entrees. Delicious   Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.  It's the kind place you can kick back and feel at home.  I've been coming back and will continue.  Honestly, I think it's the one restaurant we've returned more than any other restaurant in San Antonio.

name: Phoenix Saloon
accommodations: Good for Lunch, Dinner, Late Night
Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Jena C.
reviews.description: This place is awesome!! I love old bars though I don't drink anymore but I would definitely have a beer here! This time however was just for lunch on a wonderful rainy afternoon! The hubs went with the chili and cornbread and I went with the chili fries to go!! It was so damn good!! We didn't talk to each other the whole time hahaha I say if you like sour cream get an extra one. Other than that I can't wait to eat there again!!! Love this place!!

reviews.author: Sabine F.
reviews.description: Neat historic place to eat and have a beer or mixed drink. We are the angus burger with fried green tomatoes and potato wedges. The burger was dry, but that may have been due to the lean meat. The tomatoes and potatoes wedges were absolutely delicious. Have to add that we sat outside on the patio on a sunny day. The table was filthy and sticky. The staff should check outside ones in a while, or leave cleaning wipes for the guests.

reviews.author: Jason S.
reviews.description: Stopped in with my parents after walking around to a few other places. It was nice, cool, and the beer was cold! Bar tender was friendly and served us quickly, really glad we found this place. Looks like it could be a bit more lively at night, but for us at this moment it was perfect!

reviews.author: Kris F.
reviews.description: I loved the band! They were so fun and amazing but the bar staff was incredibly rude. Took forever to get waited on and then was told we were yelling at the bartenders which was completely untrue. If I owned this bar they would all be fired. I guess it's slim pickings with Biden as president!

reviews.author: Britney G.
reviews.description: Cool spot. I love it when owners come in and re-purpose historical buildings like this one. They have live-bands on the weekends and a decent drink list to choose from. I see a lot of people have posted about the bar food, and unfortunately, we didn't get to try it. But if we are in town again, I am eating here next time!

reviews.author: Jaclyn P.
reviews.description: They have a chili burger that will make you cry it's so good. Their menu is small but everything is so full of unique and amazing flavors! Not a huge selection on tap but we love what they do have and will be going a couple times a month now that we have found it.  Side note, their cobbler is the ish. They make it to order so it's so fresh and hot.

reviews.author: Mark O.
reviews.description: A must visit bar and restaurant in downtown New Braunfels. The Phoenix Saloon has a rich history being registered as a Texas Landmark as well as being on a tour of haunted places! They've kept up that 1800's saloon feel, very cool!  That aside, their menu is delicious. Top shelf "bar food". But the must have is their homemade chili and cornbread. It's to freaking die for! But be warned, it comes in three levels of heat. The hottest would tear up the toughest of Texas cowpokes! They also have a full bar with a multitude of craft and domestic beers on draught.  The Phoenix is also well known for their showcase of local music talent. From a laidback guy strumming a guitar on the small stage during the afternoon, to full on rock and country bands on the big stage at night on the weekend. That said, the ONLY drawback is the music (during the afternoon) can be too loud at times. Still, add the Phoenix Saloon to your list to visit (or comeback for another visit!) you won't be disappointed.

reviews.author: Diron K.
reviews.description: Great place great food. We took the whole family and all liked their food and drink. The grandkids loved playing the two arcade machines. We put alot of quarters in those machines, but it was worth it with the fun they had.

reviews.author: Tania C.
reviews.description: I never give any food/drink place five stars regardless of how good they are.  Also, four stars because it's a little dark in there.  Otherwise a great place to go and be seen without getting talked about, unlike at The Faust.  Nice to visit during the day for lunch and a beverage.  Definitely has a nighttime music vibe.  Very loud, be warned, but you can take your drink outside and sit on the patio and people watch.  I'm not a beer drinker, but I'll order a screwdriver.  I go so rarely and am always amazed that the barkeep knows what I drink!  I'll grab a stool and she'll ask if I want "the usual."  Uncanny!  They could add some modern conveniences like purse hooks by the bar stools, but it's no big deal for me.  It actually keeps me from forgetting my purse if it perches on the bar counter.  I love this place so much that I have the urge to go tomorrow!

reviews.author: Dana J.
reviews.description: Visited here on a Friday night after wedding rehearsal dinner. I feel sure the staff thought they were being attacked by a busload of senior citizens, LOL! We filled up the place - what a fun and neat venue! A cover band was playing, they were lots of fun and even inspired us old folks to get up and dance! They treated us well, took great care of us, and it made for a really fun evening.  Next trip down we plan to stop in and try some of the food that we heard was great!! Thanks Phoenix, y'all did good!!!

reviews.author: Michele Z.
reviews.description: The atmosphere was great and they had a full bar but they were known for the chili but they were out. The burger was good and so was the fried pickles but who runs out of their signature dish.

reviews.author: Carol I.
reviews.description: The Phoenix Saloon is conveniently located just off the main square on the corner of  San Antonio and Casteel with huge windows to look out to the street. I've been here several times over the years since they have opened. It's always a stop on the pub crawls!   What's not to love...  Long bar along the way for all those bar flies to hold up Lots of seating which is also great for groups Huge band stand for those night with live music Food!... how about that history of chili???  The history according to their website: "Since 1871, our building has been home to various bars and saloons, most famously the original Phoenix Saloon. It was here in 1894 that William Gebhardt, proprietor of the back room cafe, invented chili powder! Prior to this, chilis had only ever been used fresh, but Gebhardt devised a process for crushing and drying them. Gebhardt brand chili products are still widely available today. The original Phoenix Saloon was reputedly the first bar in Texas to offer service to women. No lady who valued her reputation would dare be seen in a saloon, so the proprietor set up a ladies beer garden with bells in the trees for service. There was a deer pen too, and an alligator pit and badger fights. There was even a parrot on a perch just inside the front door that was taught to say, "Have you paid your bill!?" in German! Prohibition put an end to the good times at the Phoenix, which closed its doors on June 26, 1918. The Ludwig Building, as it was then known, was expanded and turned into a department store in 1922. In 1935, by now renamed the Schmidt Building, it was remodeled again. The building was home to a number of retail and service businesses until the Phoenix rose from the ashes, so to speak, on March 5, 2010. Like its mythical namesake, the Phoenix Saloon has been reborn! The new owners relish the building's flavorful past. In bringing the new incarnation to life, they've exposed the original 1871 brick wall, salvaged the old Phoenix Saloon beadboard paneling and re-used various old shutters, sinks and lights. Trying to celebrate all aspects of the building, they also constructed the 40-foot-long bar from the old department store cabinetry, flipped a mirror from the old shoe department upside down behind the bar and relocated a three-way dressing room mirror in the ladies restroom."  The Phoenix is also to be reported as being haunted... with such history, this shouldn't be a surprise.... Boo!   So go grab a local beer and some Texas Red with Fritos and a burger on the side... it's time to have a good 'ol time in downtown NB!

reviews.author: Patti W.
reviews.description: Horrible customer service.  We came to Phoenix to have a beer and a burger.  It was 6:45 pm on New Years Eve and there were only 18 people seated in the restaurant.  All the tables rest of the tables were labeled with a reserved sign for 7:30.  We were not acknowledged or offered any explanation why there was no seating available.  We felt as if the employees were staring at us waiting for us to leave. And that's what we did.  We walked across the street to KRAUSE's where we were welcomed.

reviews.author: Tache W.
reviews.description: Loved the vegan chili nice historic place for booze and food. I prefer my chili spicy! Didn't try other things as i was going vegan.

reviews.author: David B.
reviews.description: My wife and stopped in for a late Lunch today.  The restaurant is located near the traffic circle in down town New Braunfels. You can even park on the street for free.  The tables were dirty, so we brushed it off with a napkin. I had to fight the flies during the entire meal.  You can't order at the table. You can see the lady behind the bar. You order at the bar, then go sit at a table.  Our food came. My burger was on a cold, stale bun. The burger was ordered well done, but it came medium well.  The fries were cold. My wife's burger was the same. Her fries were the same.  Sad, because this place could be so much more.

reviews.author: Lonnie R.
reviews.description: 4 stars for being a bar. Great band playing the night I was there. Reasonably priced beers. No table service but that was OK. They needed to pick up more of the empty bottles and glasses a bit more regularly.

reviews.author: St C.
reviews.description: Went here after eating at McAdoo's on a Tuesday afternoon.  Enjoyed the South African bartender who let us try a couple of the drafts before picking out the right one.  There are a number of choices but I ended up with the Scotch Ale that was perfect.  We then wondered over and played a couple games of checkers.  Perfect afternoon!

reviews.author: Itsabout T.
reviews.description: Came for the chili and history.  They have 4 heat level chilis. They all start from the same base chili and then peppers are added ranging from jalepenos to ghost chilis. I stopped at habanero. Not blazing but good heat.  The toppings are pricy at $0.75 each for small amounts of onion, cheese, sour cream, etc. it adds up quickly.  The chili flavor is tasty. Large chunks or as they say hunks of browned sirloin (seemed like chuck) are widely dispersed in a thickened chili sauce. I prefer 80% meat with just enough reduced chili stock, theirs is more like 50:50.  Moved on to the blue burger. Menu says stuffed with blue cheese but it is actually mixed in the meat. It was well prepared and tasty.  The atmosphere is super chill and the Night Owls were on stage tonight, I'm impressed! Service is mostly order at the bar.  I'm pretty much a chili snob, I only like my own creation but theirs is pretty good if someone else is making it for you.

reviews.author: Patti B.
reviews.description: Not a huge fan.  I get that it's not really a restaurant. It's a bar that serves food. I really get it, but if an establishment is going to serve food it might be a good idea to have food servers. Our nephew brought us here for the chili.  If you are hungry for chili this is the place. The chili coke rated in degrees of heat. I understand the draw for the chili. The burger, sandwiches and other items are just standard nothing special. People have to go to the bar to order food and to get drinks. There is no table served except to bring food from the kitchen and someone cleans off the table when people leave.  The live music was....just background noise. I guess it was just open mic night or something. Great selection of beer on tap. Three solid bartenders who seemed to keep the place going. If you are out to drink beer on tap and maybe grab a bite this is okay.  Chili is good.

reviews.author: Rose N.
reviews.description: My boyfriend asked me to write this review.  Eeks! Me thinks not. We came here for chili one night. 8/9 or 8/10. When we arrived the blonde bartender was assisting another customer for a hot 5 minutes. When she came over to us we asked to order food and she said the kitchen closed ONE MINUTE BEFORE. But ma'am, we have been standing here for a while... If someone took our order when we arrived, we wouldn't've been in this pickle. The place was not busy (2-3 3 tops max). I understand the kitchen is closed but I'm sure, positive even, that they don't throw out the chili as soon as the second hand hits 12. You could've asked the kitchen to scoop one bowl of chili out in exchange for money, and I bet $100 they would've done it. Why? Because I ask my kitchen guys all the time.   We will not be coming back and my boyfriend would like to speak to management/owners. Thanks.

name: Rosario's - North
accommodations: Best nights on Tuesday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Margarita G.
reviews.description: 3.5 would have been more accurate of an overall rating.  I give it a 4 for ambulance and atmosphere. More contemporary decor, cool looking bar, and well-spaced for social distancing.  Our server was very friendly but service was unreasonably slow. We were almost finished with our chips, salsa and queso by the time our bar drinks made it to the table.  My son really liked his Coco Rita and I really enjoyed the sangria.  However I was almost ready to cancel the drink order due to slow service.  Our table would not recommend the fish tacos. I had the Lisa's special which was great and my daughter liked her puffy tacos.  Clearly the labor shortages is real which impacted our service. That' said I would like to return  because it seems like it might be a better place for happy hour and cocktails.

reviews.author: Jando S.
reviews.description: It's not exactly the same animal as the original Rosario's in Southtown, but Rosario's of the north still has a lot to offer. Despite many Tex-Mex eateries in the vicinity, the name here still carries a lot of weight for lunch-goers, tourists, and folks who simply can't resist their queso. (#1) I would probably consider them somewhere around a 3.5 star wise, but rounding up for potential.  This location is pretty convenient for the many locals who don't (ever) feel like venturing toward downtown. One thing that stands out immediately is just how spacious and modern it is compared to its sister location. The decor is on point, with a very free flowing interior, natural lighting all throughout, and excellent ambience. There is also an excellent outdoor space, which makes this venue a versatile one for just about any occasion.  Overall, the food is decent but I've yet to be impressed in the same way as the other location. After multiple visits, I've found the food to be saltier or simply lacking compared to the original spot. That's not to say that there aren't some good choices to be had. The margaritas are definitely killer and they go wonderfully with the griselda's tacos. I still think their fire roasted salsa is some of the best out there and I've enjoyed the pozole from time to time. Their signature queso is still quite good, but I find myself longing for Southtown Rosario's over this one, at least food wise.  The bar / lounge area seems like an ideal spot for happy hour, which I'm pleased to say is excellent for the prices. Even the bathrooms are in tip top shape. Service could probably step it up a bit, but their friendliness outweighs their tendency to be really slow. Whether it's for a date, casual lunch, or a special group outing, Rosario's North is still worth a look.  ________________ (#1) I know I can't be the only one.

reviews.author: Susan C.
reviews.description: We purposely chose Rosario's for a networking function a week ago for a dozen people, several from out of town.  We love the food/environment of the downtown location and were super excited to have an option on the North side!  Despite the restaurant being empty when we arrived at 5:00, they would not seat us until all twelve people arrived so those of us who were there had to sit at individual tables.  The hostess was rude and unaccommodating; we couldn't move tables together, sit together, etc.    Once our group was seated together, we asked for one bill and were billed separately and not only were there separate bills, we were overbilled by double the amount we charged.  We called to complain when we received our credit card notices and again, disappointing outcome with lame excuses and "well that's our policy."    Not worth it!!!  Embarrassing for my colleague and I who set up the meeting for them to experience San Antonio hospitality which was obviously lacking at this restaurant!!!  Super disappointing.

reviews.author: Nikki A.
reviews.description: This was the perfect place for our anniversary dinner. The studio came together to celebrate and I needed a place that took reservations, felt comfortable and offered vegan options.  The staff was friendly and checked in several times. Everything we ate was delicious. I got the ceviche which was 'cooked' perfectly.

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: Enjoyed my recent lunch at Rosario's. Ordered the Lisa Special with two cheese enchiladas, chicken fajita meat and guacamole. Service was good and quick and lunch was tasty.

reviews.author: Frank R.
reviews.description: This is my favorite place for Margaritas and dinner.  The atmosphere is Beautiful and the service is outstanding.  The bartenders will acknowledge by your first name.  If you want the best Margaritas in town this is the place.  These are the best bartenders in town.  Be sure and stay for dinner!

reviews.author: Jasmine L.
reviews.description: I really wanted to love this place since its so popular in Texas. I think we had a bad experience due to our service more than the actual food. Its a great atmosphere and great food. If the service was better I'd go back to try again, maybe at a different location.

reviews.author: Kassie O.
reviews.description: Sadly, food was just average. The Queso Flameado. Was "floating, in Grease. My crispy tacos scantily clad by way of chicken. They came w/no sides whatsoever. And the "side," charro beans were sparingly served. My husband's Flautas were ok, not bad not great. Pretty disappointing. Don't know that we'll go back. The Service was probably the biggest asset.

reviews.author: Alex G.
reviews.description: Rosario's is a super adorable Mexican restaurant near the airport with ample parking. The margaritas - not the best, not the worst - glad they were only $6 thanks to Happy Hour (4-7pm Sat). The queso - flavor wise, possibly the blandest queso I've ever had, although the hidden pico helped step it up a bit. That being said, it paired flawlessly with the chicken flautas I ordered, so I have no regrets tacking on an order of Queso Rosario's. My one true fault - I came here with two friends who both ordered the flautas especiales and both of them received food that was visibly burnt. While my food was great, they did not have the same impression. I will also add that our waitress was fabulous! I wish I could remember her name.

reviews.author: Joseph E.
reviews.description: Having to take a traffic detour I find myself getting hungry so I look over and see the Northern cousin of one of my favorite South Town locations....serendipity! After a quick look over the menu, I decide on something a little out of my norm but it sounded so delicious based on the menu description (Chiles guajillos and pasillas are the foundation of the delicious sauce that tops 3 queso fresco-filled enchiladas. Served with avocado, cabbage lime slaw, and grilled jalapeno pepper. Topped with fried potatoes, carrots, cilantro, and drizzled with crema Fresca) that I had to try it along with a side of island white rice and boracho beans. When the plate comes out you can see this dark, thick sauce covering the enchiladas and smell the spices rising from the dish. As I take my first bite, the sauce and cheese blend so well together and pack a flavor punch to the palette....pow! I dip all the grilled side veggies provided into the sauce and down they go......bye bye! The side of rice and beans just compliment the meal and also blend well with the "mole" type sauce.  Overall, this was a pleasant surprise and I look forward to trying more of the menu.

reviews.author: David G.
reviews.description: Rosario's has two locations, I went to their North restaurant for dinner based on a Google search. While, this has the appearance of an upscale Mexican restaurant, the ambiance is not what I would have expected. The dining experience is very loud due to hard surfaces everywhere. Seating is not any better either with hard metal chairs. There were no booths I could see even though the dining area could certainly handle it. We were sat next to a table with a toddler who would let out a piercing scream occasionally.   Here's what's good about Rosario's. The food is very good. I shared the Fiesta Special (for 2, $28.95) with Beef and Shrimp. The food arrived quickly and sizzling hot. For the price I expected a bit larger platter but, it was still enough to share.   I also ordered a Cadillac Margarita which was very good. All total, the bill came to $52.44, making Rosario's moderately priced.  Our server was very nice, walked us through all the Margarita options but, honestly, some of the versions just didn't sound very appealing.  Who puts Sangria in a Margarita or, Coconut for that matter?  I liked Rosario's North for the food and service, just not for the loud environment and uncomfortable seats.

reviews.author: Vern G.
reviews.description: They have the best margaritas in SA!! And their chicken chipotle is the best in town! I always have these two! Their chips and salsa are also delicious.

reviews.author: Miriam T.
reviews.description: Horrible service! When you watch your waitress stand and talk to other waiters for 20 minutes before taking your drink order. Then you request for a straw for your drink and passes by you 3 times with no straw.  Walked out! No thank you!

reviews.author: Cindy G.
reviews.description: Brought my 5 other friends to my favorite happy hour and beautiful Rosarios... regret .. The service and food was 1 star.. we need employees and great service back .

reviews.author: Cindie O.
reviews.description: This restaurant is the WORST place to visit! The hostess was rude and unaccommodating, unwilling to seat us and could care less that it was the first place that my husband and myself met 29 years ago!  We ended up leaving when clearly there were SEVERAL other tables open to sit at. We basically waited for nothing! Do not waste your time here!

reviews.author: Sean Ryan M.
reviews.description: This place is FANTASTIC! We walked in and were immediately greeted by the friendly hostess. She sat us within 1 minute. The high ceilings, dim lighting and bright colors make for a nice atmosphere. The server, Marissa, was taking our drink order within 2 minutes. This place has amazing salsa; don't skip it. I had shrimp nachos. They were gorgeous and full of flavor, and there must've been a shrimp on every single chip! My colleague had the fish tacos. From the looks of his empty plate, they were also delicious. This is a must visit in San Antonio! Ask for Marissa!

reviews.author: Marcy F.
reviews.description: We went here on a recommendation from a friend that lives here. She was right and it did not disappoint. Good drinks and good service. I had a pina colada while we waited for a table. My friend ordered a watermelon margarita. It was so good she talked about it the rest of the trip. And kept trying to find somewhere that had a good as margarita as she did there. I ordered nachos and she had shrimp tacos. Both really good tasting. It was busy for a Friday night and I can see why.

reviews.author: Jennifer D.
reviews.description: So excited for this place to open back up and what a disappointment it was.   The hostess was very friendly,  she seated us right away.  We were just a party of two .   We sat there for about 10 minutes without our waiter saying anything to us.  Another staff member walked over and asked me if I ordered a beer? I said no but, if you could find my waiter I'd love a glass of water.   A gentleman comes over with two glasses and says he's our waiter.  We finally have drinks. We know exactly what we want so we place our order.  My daughter ordered the Lengua and I ordered the griselda tacos.   Our waiter heads off after taking our order not to be seen again.  When we finally do get our food I noticed that we were given only two tortillas.   I looked at my plate and could tell immediately that something wasn't right.  I thought maybe the recipe had changed? Maybe tweaked a little? So I took a bite just to see.   The Griselda tacos have refried beans in them this is why I love that taco.  I flag someone over and told them that this taco should have beans in it. They tell me,  "no it doesn't".  I pull out my phone and pull up the menu and I have to show the gentleman exactly what the menu says he then realizes they made a mistake and ordered me the wrong taco. Again, I still haven't seen my waiter.  He pulled a vanishing act.   Such a shame this is always been one of my favorite places to go.   After waiting for 10 minutes to get more tortillas and my meal was replaced, all was good.   My tacos were terrible . It's like they were thrown together. I have to flag someone down to get my check. My waiter finally shows up.   I paid and left. I won't be going back.

reviews.author: Erin L.
reviews.description: They now charge for chips and salsa. No other Mexican restaurant in town does that  VERY PATHETIC AND TACKY.

reviews.author: Jodi E.
reviews.description: Saturday night 7:15ish we checked in online, to our surprise it was only a 7-17 minute wait!  What a great treat, since a couple weeks ago we attempted to eat downtown around 6pm when friends came into town and EVERYWHERE was a 3hr wait! NO THANKS.. After checking in with hostess upon our arrival, we decided to get a drink at the bar until our table was ready, to our delight the table was ready the minute our drinks arrived!  This place exudes a cozy date night feel, but also very accommodating for families or friend gatherings.  Our drinks were spot on, a frozen house margarita and a frozen mango margarita with a chili rim, both equally delicious.  After being seated, our waitress quickly brought us waters since we already had a cocktail and inquired if we would like any chips and salsa (those are extra).  After perusing the menu from the QR code we had to scan on the table, I asked the waitress her opinion from 3 choices I couldn't decide on (so she suggested the Pollo a la Maria) and my boyfriend ordered the Shrimp Tacos.  After a short while our food came out.  My grilled Chicken (and plate) was piping hot and coated in a beautiful cilantro and pumpkin seed pesto and served with rice and frijoles a la charra.  The entire plate was a party in your mouth.  This is definitely not Tex Mex food, but more the flavors of inner Mexico.  The rice was super fluffy and flavorful as were the beans, although, I wished they had a little spice/heat, but none the less, they were delicious!  My boyfriend's Shrimp Tacos were served on a homemade corn tortillas topped with pickled onion, queso fresco and avocado (he chose to omit the cabbage lime slaw topping) and frijoles a la charra.  Let me say, the tacos were filled with plump juicy shrimp, not small little ones and fresh avocado slices completely on top not a little dab.  I was very impressed with the quantity and quality of the taco fillings.  You definitely got what you paid for!  We ended the night with a To-Go order of churros served with whipped cream and chocolate sauce to dunk them in!  This is definitely be a place to meet friends and enjoy a great meal!... I can't wait to come back and try one of the other meals I contemplated.  The food was delicious, service spot on and drinks were top notch too!  I don't have one negative thing to say.  Although, I only debated between the 4 and 5 stars due to the parking lot was kind of a mess finding a spot the way it's laid out so we ended up having to park way out back in a parking lot for another building...so ok, that was my only issue, but other than that...you be the judge, I'm sure you'll be as pleasantly surprised too!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: When I go to a place for the first time I can become nervous and anxious. I would be best served if I just allowed myself to surrender to the moment. A place like Bar Ludivine has a very specific patron in mind. The decor is very simply stated but elegant. The antique velour sofa with pillows with cats. The high tables candle lit. The choice of 90's and an early 2000's mixtape playlist as background music.  Yes it is shabby chic but with a modern flair. This is not a "Happy Hour at Taco Cabana" type of bar. Its intended audience is a sophisticated and more mature demographic. A bar certainly meant for date night or someone rummaging through a Schopenhauer book.  But to the mechanics of this bar. It is located in Southtown a few doors down from Taco Haven. The place is really small, intimate and charming. On the drink end they have spirits, wines and beer. The mixologist, who happens to be the principle owner serves up drinks and will take your order from your table. Although they have a small paper menu with signature cocktails he can make you just about anything. Here is where I must interject. If you're expecting a bartender from your corner cantina this is not that place. He serves you and then let's you carry on a conversation with your company. Maybe patrons will confuse that with inattentiveness. I interpreted that as being the utmost professional as a person who takes their craft very seriously.  Two or three things I must implore to you. Since it is on a strip of South Presa that has finite parking I can already forsee this as an issue in the future. Secondly they don't serve any food, which would automatically bump this review to a four and a half stars. And lastly this place is not cheap. I'm a beer drinker and seven dollars even for craft beer not in a restaurant setting is a little pricey. Then again a date night, an opportunity to see live music or even an after dinner cocktail are not casual affairs. Not to say that a suit with matching ascot is the preferred attire here. I might turn my head twice if I saw someone wearing a "King Diamond" tshirt and dangling earrings at a table though.  Ludivine, which is a French name that means "Friend of the people." At that capacity it does share those sensibilities. The choice of antiques, the shabby chic decor and the elegant chandelier all say I'm here for a sophisticated experience. From the glassware to the presentation of drinks the cultured, mature patron is definitely kept in mind. Southtown is filled with unique experiences both big and small. If you happen to be in this area and were on a date night, left a Broadway play or had a Hemingway book on hand I would recommend it. The service is excellent, the drinks are made by someone who takes his craft seriously and the ambiance is otherworldly. It is pricey but on a beautiful Friday night you are totally worth it.

reviews.author: Janet g.
reviews.description: Cozy wine bar with great selections!! I don't normally review "bars" because for me a bar, is a bar, is a bar but when they get the ambiance, drinks and service right well you have to let them know!!  Working in healthcare can be a little stressful so an occasional drink to wind down before heading home is just what the doctor ordered!! And this place delivers!! Love the wine, love the beer, service is great, and was easy to find! Definitely a Southtown Gem!! Looking forward to coming back for Live Music Nights!

reviews.author: Christine M.
reviews.description: One of my favourite - likely THE fave - coffee shops in town. LOVE!  Perfect house-roasted beans. They even make syrups, sauces, and caramels in house. Delish!  Doesn't hurt that they added beer (nice selection!) and wine, then went all next-level and actually brought a full-on brewery (Vista) into the gorgeous brick building.  Nice long hours if operation too - I'm not by *any* stretch of the imagination what you would call a "morning person", so it's great to have awesome coffee available beyond 3 p.m.  Chefs kiss!

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: An absolute hidden gem! Very artsy vibe. Came in on a cold evening for warm tea and coffee with an amazing friend who showed me this spot! Such a wonderful ambiance. We ordered the House-made Chai and an herb tea. Definitely recommend and will be visiting again!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Super trendy coffee spot! It's like in an abandoned warehouse or so it seems! But it really is true it's not always as it seems. We weren't sure what to expect from the outside but the inside was dope. Cool, comfortable seating, chill vibes and good coffee. Priced fairly and good treats if you are in the mood for something sweet to go with your coffee.   Pro tip: get a stroop waffle and place it on top of your coffee cup and it makes it nice and warm

reviews.author: Nick B.
reviews.description: If I could give 10 stars I would! Major shoutout to this place, it is by far the best coffee shop / roaster I've been too. We were in town visiting family and me being the coffee geek I am started looking up coffee shops / roasters in the area and Shotgun coffee roasters came up and I couldn't be happier for checking them out! We were immediately greeted by the smell of fresh coffee being roasted as we walked in. Super cool to check out the whole process from roast to cup. The Ethiopian V60 my fiance ordered and the cappuccino I ordered were done PERFECTLY! No joke, the barista who made our drinks is a true artist in his craft for sure. I like to consider myself somewhat knowledgeable of the coffee scene but this place reminded me of the amateur I still am, and I still have a LOT of learning to do lol. All the fruity, floral notes of the Ethiopian shined in a way only someone with the right experience in brewing could make happen. And the shots pulled for my cappuccino had absolutely no bitter / sour notes whatsoever. They were all done perfectly! From the woman roasting the coffee when we walked in to the awesome barista who prepared our drinks, seriously Kuddos to you guys! This will be our new go to spot when we land in SA from now on!

reviews.author: Cayla G.
reviews.description: I enjoyed the coffee at Shotgun House, but I found the food offerings could have been better.  They only had a few baked goods when I arrived and most of the seating was occupied.  We only stayed for a short while before packing up to find another coffee shop with more seating and food options.

reviews.author: Mack P.
reviews.description: Just aaight. Cool building, master roaster was fine/attentive? Mocha came out barely warm which was extremely disappointing. Tasted good. Would not go out of my way to return based on initial experience. Meh  Additionally, the roasting process left visible smoke which smelled not great and left stank on clothes/hair.

reviews.author: Ana A.
reviews.description: Loved, loved, loved the aesthetics of this place!  It was a little hard to locate. You just see a warehouse and have to do a double take to see if you're at the right place. You are!   I parked along side of the building. You walk along the side till you see the drink fresh coffee wall sign. Go up the stairs there to the big metal door. Something else I had to figure out.   Inside is spacious with a modern/rustic vibe. So inviting. There were plenty of tables and some couches to sit. Some wall art, plants and merch. They also have an outside area as well.   I ordered an iced vanilla latte. It was a little stronger than what I usually get from coffee shops but that's by preference. I was in and out due to it being near their closing time but vibes alone I will definitely be going back.

reviews.author: Thao P.
reviews.description: Cute coffee house inside a warehouse. An unexpected place but inside is modern and chic. Wonderful customer service and the coffee is spot on.

reviews.author: Ron K.
reviews.description: Sometimes I amaze myself when I land in a place like San Antonio and you would think I would go straight to one of the fancy tourist destinations to get myself a foo foo $6 coffee drink. No I decide to drive through rain and construction crews through back alleys to an unknown warehouse district that looks to have no life going on but cars wizzing by..  That's what it felt like when I'm walking in the back of this warehouse with an old wooden staircase and rusty industrial metal speakeasy looking entry.  Talk about getting local at the get go...  Once you exit the craziness of SA and enter this place,  immediate things begin to calm to a welcoming environment here.  The welcoming smell of fresh beans roasting, a dude mixing up batches of liquid Chai extract, and a a lady making things tidy  the fear of thinking Yelp let you down start to dissipate.    The baristas here know their coffee and although the menu seemed a bit limiting on first glance, they do have the basics down, with a few items that are unique like having vegan horchata and steamed rice milk. On the other hand they seem to not have a vegan chocolate option so that was a bit of a disappointment.  Their chai also is pre-made with sugar so there is no option to modify that one either so not super Keto friendly unfortunately. But they do make a matcha latte that is made unsweetened and with the rice milk option I was intrigued so went with that.  They also offer almond and oat as alternatives. Note they only do 12 oz latte drinks and they are not cheap when you figure in an alternative milk is going to drive up your drink cost in the 5 plus range.    The drink itself was well executed. They do nice latte art and normally green tea matcha can be a hit or miss if you are adverse to the grass aspect of the matcha powder. Here it's smooth and I really think rice milk works great together with matcha.    Love the atmosphere here.  They play 80's and 90's music in the background which is fun and it's not too loud so you can study and get things done. Also like that they had plenty of indoor spots open as there was rain and so the outside patio was pretty much not useable.  Also like the funky bathroom with the "shotgun" theme San Antonio style.  Only in Texas.  Oh and I forgot to mention that you can come here and have a beer too.  I didn't see any taps but they had a cooler of local beers.  Maybe next time will partake.   Glad I ventured off the beaten tracks. Always enjoy the local experiences.  If you to do so too this might be a fun option.  Check it out.

reviews.author: Desiree B.
reviews.description: YES YES YES! I love this place! I'll drop in during the week for an hour or 2 to get a couple things done from my computer and it's such a vibe! The workers are always super friendly and the atmosphere is great. I was a little confused the first time I came. It looks like an abandoned building and not showy signs. Entrance is to the right of the building with an iron(?) door. Great place to take cute photos.

reviews.author: Dillon T.
reviews.description: Super cool spot with great vibes and coffee. Definitely recommend to hang out here on a Saturday morning and read a book or just enjoy some great coffee

reviews.author: d h.
reviews.description: Good strong variety of latte and mocha's they however Discontinue Papa new Guinea. Didn't ask if they had stuff like Ethiopia gora or anything. PLUS I love the back patio area, I grew up on the West side and always wondered if anybody would ever buy and renovate the place. Also look around the place..they have artists, barbers, etc.

reviews.author: Yadhira L.
reviews.description: This place is hard to find. There's one sign that says "drinks and coffee" on the street level. The entrance does not have a sign, just instructions on how to open the door with the latch.   Staff was really nice and attentive and the inside is a pleasant, wide, open space. My main issue is the roasting process. Before I walked over to the entrance there was a ton of smoke covering the stairs leading up to the door. When I finally walked in I asked if this was the main entrance and it was. Once seated inside I could feel the smoke all around despite the heavy use of fans. I went early morning and now my hair smells like burnt coffee all day long.   Leaving the place also requires instructions and two hands. Not very user friendly when you're walking out with a cup of coffee.

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: Cool spot to grab a coffee and do some work' I got the maple coffee that's seasonal and I loved it. Overall the atmosphere was cool/ industrial. The service was great and there's a lot of seating.

reviews.author: Drew C.
reviews.description: Today was my second visit ever since the first. And the service was still the same as last which was great. Service was quick as well which I appreciate. I got a basic iced vanilla latte and it was good especially when the vanilla doesn't over power the coffee which some coffee shop does. Great experience again and would come back if i'm ever on the side of the town.

reviews.author: Deborah B.
reviews.description: Hard to find, as it's hidden in the corner of an old warehouse, but worth the effort. Having just moved to SATX from Portland, Oregon, I would offer my perspective as a pretty savvy coffee connoisseur, and this place could easily have been lifted and shifted from the streets of pretty much anywhere in PDX and dropped in San Antonio. It definitely had the same vibe, both good and bad ... Portland java jockeys can be by turns snooty and chatty, and today we got the more chilly shoulder than has been our SATX experience, but no worries! The java was delicious, and I very much enjoyed the decor. There is clearly talent behind the bar; we'll be back.

reviews.author: Len S.
reviews.description: This is a cool hidden coffee shop in SA.  When I first walked in I could smell the coffee being roasted.  The staff is super friendly and it has a great vibe.  You can get coffee, beer or wine!  Highly recommend

reviews.author: Bridgette R.
reviews.description: Great craft beer in a warehouse with some funky chandeliers on the west side.
