I didn't try the coffee while I was there b/c we happened to go on the night of the launch party for the brewery. I had the Destination IPA and it was quite yummy. Shotgun is urban, grungy, industrial and family friendly. Go there to have coffee and play a board game with the family or friends or go and have a brew with a mate. It has a great vibe.

reviews.author: Madeline M.
reviews.description: 8/10 - a PHENOMENAL oat milk latte. However, kind of hard to find lol. Times on Google and Yelp did not match up and realized the hard way that they weren't open. And when we went back to find them, we embarrassingly had to drive around the block a couple of times. As a non local, it was frustrating but I'm sure if I was a local, it would be a different experience having something so secluded!

reviews.author: Callie K.
reviews.description: Light and airy coffee shop nearly hidden from plain sight that delivers an outstanding drink. While the front door itself was a challenge to find, the latte itself was well worth the effort. The atmosphere is open and inviting, perfect for maintaining socially appropriate distance during our current times. I could easily see myself returning to get work done given the free wifi and pleasant background noise. I was greeted not only by the friendly barista but also by the lovely aroma of coffee beans roasting. My drink, the maple-bourbon caramel latte with oat milk, was perfection. Not too sweet and full of fall-friendly flavor. I couldn't resist bringing home a bag of their Burundi coffee beans which continues to be the highlight of my morning. I can't wait to return and try more of their offerings!

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: I'd like to think I've done my fair share of indulging in beer tastings, festivals, tours and what not. But I've never, ever done a pub crawl. My point of reference has always been the one I have seen during First Friday. You know the one, the one with women in tutus and dudes in, tutus  running down St. Mary's Street. I imagine with all the barhopping from checkpoint to checkpoint sooner or later someone is gonna ralph all over a sidewalk.    However, I was talked into doing the one St. Arnold Brewery had put on recently as a promotional event. Five check in points for a pint glass created specifically for this event. You are given five locations to choose in any order: Stella Public House, Frank's, BandD's, The Friendly Spot and your final destination Alamo Street; a punchout card and roughly three hours to have it all filled. Pretty straightforward, right? Well.  A couple of things happened along the way while checking into places. One issue the flow of pub crawlers was not congruent with stay time. For example the Stella Public House was maxed out to capacity, due to the traffic of participants. I did skip it opting for Frank's a few yards down but nonetheless the results were the same. The thinking is that you had to have a drink at each point, which some people did. I must reiterate you don't have to drink anything at any of the locations to participate, you just have to have your card punched by a rep.  Moving from the direction of the Blue Star Complex towards the area of the Friendly Spot the crowds either tapered off or dissipated. For example BandD's was hours away from the mad rush. And The Friendly Spot had plenty of seating. In my opinion I think the event would've benefited from having locations  spread across Southtown, thus alleviating traffic and creating urgency. Another minor critique is I would've actually liked to have seen St. Arnold's booths of some sort offering their beers on tap or in a can at destinations.  Still in it's totality I enjoyed the experience despite some of its shortcomings. Seeing participants go from spot to to spot with their magic punchout card, as though it were an Olympic Event; was kinda inspiring. And the rad pint glass, my Major Award at the end was a sight to behold. I definitely would like to do one again at some point, I just need to begin training.  ps. I saw some people stumbling at the tail end. Lucky we didn't have to pass some torch or baton of some sort...

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Cheers!  St. Arnold's Pub Crawl is so much fun!  The Houston brewery puts these on every year, or more often if you're lucky. Basically, you get a punch card at one of five local bars that are all close to each other. At each pub, you get your St. Arnold's card punched. Get them all punched, and collect a free special edition pint glass! Score! Prost!  St. Arnold's is the oldest independent brewery in Houston, the city's first real microbrewery. They've since moved to a bigger and classier location to churn out the beer! They offer a bunch of favorites, and usually some cool seaonals. Be sure to check out a different St. Arnold's beer at each stop!  You'll be sure to know where the crawl ends- you'll find St. Arnold's Art Car, plastered with St. Arnold's art, in the style of the Houston tradition and infamous Art Car Parade.  Did you know that Saint Arnold is the patron saint of brewers? In order to become a saint, you have to perform some miracles. St. Arnold's was that he and some thirsty worshipers were going on a pilgrimage, and came across an empty house, where they found a single beer, and a mug. They poured the beer into the mug, and started passing the beer around to the thirsty monks- but as they passed it around, it never went empty! The beer kept providing sustenance and booze to the monks until they could drink no more. It was a beer miracle! St. Arnold was canonized, as this beer obviously came straight from Heaven. When I went on the Pub Crawl, it was through Southtown, ending up in the Blue Star area.

name: San Antonio Party Bus Rental Services

reviews.author: Ginger G.
reviews.description: I had not been to BJ's for quite some time. I arrived around 5:15pm and the place was rather empty. Good for us as we were able to order and get our food rather quick.   There menu is huge and there is definitely something for everyone. It took me back to the days of my children being picky eaters and having to try and find each one something the would eat. Here there is everything from salad, pasta, pizza, sandwiches, soups, chicken, to other amazing dishes.   I was not starving so I went with the Enlightened Asian Chopped Salad. The dressing was tangy but good. I loved the mandarin oranges the really set off your tastebuds! I wound up only eating half and taking the rest home.    I ordered their Honey Sriracha Brussels Sprouts as an appetizer and they were amazing. I had some of those left over I took home as well.   The restaurant was clean and the staff was friendly from the hostess to the waiter.   By the time we were leaving which was 6:15pm the place was jam packed. This place fills up quick!

reviews.author: Abby O.
reviews.description: Tonight was an adventure for sure. To start off, the managers were great. Now for the rest of the experience... For safety and security of the staff, names will be changed. While I was running late, my buddy had her paw caressed by the waiter (HAROLD) as he was handing her a mijito of sorts. She didn't appreciate this one bit. I arrived to the table and saw that it was happy hour! Those mozzarella sticks looks amazing and just had to have some. We ordered two orders, expecting them to come at happy hour price, only to be fooled, duped, and embarrassed. The happy hour menu items only apply to those ordering from the bar area. How the hell can I get a seat over there!? Why were we seated in the extra expensive seating? Anyways... As the food was arriving, we were graced by the presence of CARL. This kid was delivering food to tables. He had no idea what we ordered. He tried to give my friend a bacon burger when she ordered a brisket burger. Not knowing if it was correct, he put his paw ON THE BUN, lifted it up and proceeded to HAND IT BACK and say "Well, enjoy!". The entire table was disgusted and he never looked up to see the obvious error he had made. He couldn't have cared less. One of us got a manager and they offered to fix the situation by getting a new plate and gave my friend a new mojito. Our actual waiter told us that the kid "was an interesting guy.". Our pregnant friend ordered a burger well done and received a raw burger. This was also replaced and also attempted to charge for both! Among the events of the night, the booth seat ate another friend's phone. The managers told us that it happens ALL THE TIME. But they struggled to retrieve it even. We eventually retrieved the phone with a different manager. And then it was time to pay. To our complete surprise, we were charged for everything PLUS ITEMS WE DID NOT ORDER. The managers fixed the tickets but it was a struggle to think that only one section of the entire restaurant gets happy hour. The burger that was contaminated by a incompetent worker was charged to the bill. The entire time, our four member party was having a fun and light hearted time about everything that had happened but being charged for everything was an unexpected insult and unprofessional. Thanks for the memories, BJ's but we won't be back for a while. 2 stars for the laughs, -3 for the staff and bills.

reviews.author: Kirolos F.
reviews.description: Great location with a great food and atmosphere. I would stay away from the pizza (more of a loaf of bread than a pizza) but lived their salmon, a very hard fish to cook right.

reviews.author: Liz F.
reviews.description: I wish I could leave 0 stars - the hostess was so rude and we ended up leaving-- so so bummed- we've never had a negative experience at a bj's so this was shocking.

reviews.author: Mariela O.
reviews.description: Typically we have excellent service at this BJ's  restaurant in north central San Antonio. However, today was horrible. Not sure if they're understaff or the staff that served us had no idea what she was doing. Sadly, the experience was substandard. My salad had old wilted Romaine lettuce. Other ingredients were to be found. Ugh. My husband asked for a second beer that never came. We asked for a meatball on my daughter kid spaghetti that never came either. I hope they get it together quickly, as this is a great place to eat and spend time with family. It was hard not to leave a 20% tip, but barely a 10%.

reviews.author: Yves J S.
reviews.description: Have been to this location several times, tonight was the worst... Service 2/3 stars Food     2/5 stars Accomodation 3/3 stars Overall 63.6%  The server was very attentive, appologetic, and seemed genuine. The 1rst entree I ordered was unavailable, but no hard feelings there considering my F@* @$$ ordered a pack meant to feed 4. We tried the cheese rolls which were meh...  The 2nd entree I tried to order ended up being sold out, which led to the 2nd appetizer order.but the WTFocado eggrolls were so horrible we did not even consider touching them. They came out with no sense of presentation and the sauce was missing. They were squished and looked like they were double dipped in the bat fryer. Perhaps they were served and the cook tried to re-cook a forgotten order and thought that monstrocity of a plate was presentable. (See picture) The guy who brought out the food just dropped the plate at our table like a passive aggressive ex who got called out by a judge during a divorce preceeding.  My 3rd entree request was finally available, but oh I wish it wasn't. I often order the Jambalaya, but this time what came out was a smaller, burnt, less appealing version like ordering airpods on amazon, but getting some pear brand knock off instead. The Pizookie tasted good, just lacked any presentation which literally is just scooping ice cream onto a warm cookie.     The manager apologized for overall poor food, and the waiter for the trouble the night that ensued. Our meal was mostly comped and all I really paid for was my beer and desert, and decent tip for the poor server.

reviews.author: Nate S.
reviews.description: Very slow, need to prepare ahead of time, great food, but still slow. Food is great but does not really deserve the time waiting for it.

reviews.author: Mac J.
reviews.description: COVID-19 protocol is limited to mask wearing. There's no temperature check at the entrance and lots of customers standing and waiting with no physical distance enforcement. Ordered curbside service but there's no parking enforcement. I also learned this BJ's restaurant has dine-in available. This explains the crowd of customers waiting to get seated. I called from the parking lot. The curbside team was overwhelmed and requested I come in. My curbside delivery order became takeout. After waiting 25 minutes past my 5:30pm pickup time, my order arrived.  This was definitely my worst experience at this BJ's restaurant location. IMO, was the best one in the San Antonio area. Overall rating 1 star. Management needs to focus their efforts on takeout and online orders. The limited dine-in capacity due to COVID-19 does not generate enough business.

reviews.author: Frank L.
reviews.description: The food is bland. I order the Fettuccine Alfredo and it tastes like the sauce was water-based. Horrible. Guess I'm going back to Olive Garden.  UPDATE: I just spoke to the manager who seems like an incredible man. Thank you for the kind conversation. The review remains the same though. I told him I'd reorder the same meal in 3 months to see if a change occurred. We'll see.  He agreed, though. THE WAY WE SERVE EACH OTHER IS AN INDICATION OF HOW MUCH WE CARE.  Does BJs Restaurant "care" about its customers? I'll tell you in 3 months.

reviews.author: LaRonda G.
reviews.description: Ordered curbside through their website. They improved it greatly since their last major promotion on Veteran's Day that shut it down. The only problem is it doesn't allow you to make remarks on items on your order. It also didn't let me add my promotion even though it said was added. The service was good and fast, so their curbside service was great this time. The food was pretty good, no major complaints there other than they forgot my sauce for my salmon. Considering they are working through COVID, I think they did a good job and would order food their again.

reviews.author: Gabby S.
reviews.description: Went last weekend and got some great food.we go there almost twice a month.  Usually good. Today we got a to go order. Last week the pizza was AMAZIng! Today not only did it taste nasty. It was NOT the same pizza from last weekend. I ordered same pizza and toppings. They left out the pepperoni and and all I got was a flat tasteless pizza. With wayyyyy too much cheese. The crust wasn't fluffy and light. It was flat and the pizza itself is dense and soggy. We go there for the great chicken wings, wedge salad with the Tri Tip and their yummy homemade sodas. I don't think we'll be frequenting anytime soon. Threw it out. They need to have some consistency with the way it's cooked and prepared. Really disappointed as the rest of the meal was pretty good.

reviews.author: Olga M.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough of how good the food was!!! The delivery driver Victor was so nice but the lady that took the "pazzookie" was Debra!!! I called in after I placed my order because I forgot dessert  which seemed a lot like my day  had been going. In these rough times things can weigh you down but God sends you an Angel that reminds you that he's still here. THANK YOU DEBRA!! For the manager and owner at BJs please recognize her for going above and beyond what a shining example of true customer service!  Xoxox Debra

reviews.author: Patsy B.
reviews.description: Wish I took pictures of the place. There were only about 2-3 tables taken with plenty of empty tables in between. They sat my husband and I in the back room where the staff was having a meeting. I thought it  was weird that they sat right next to their meeting, it was a little uncomfortable cause it felt like we were interrupting there meeting. Then they started to bring more costumers to that same room, I stood up thinking they were packed, but what we realized was that they were seating all Hispanics and blacks in the back. We ordered, ate, paid our bill. As we walked out we scanned the whole restaurant and saw that only whites were seating in the main room. That was unbelievable! I thought discriminating people for their color was over! I guess I was wrong. This needs to stop!

reviews.author: Ethan I.
reviews.description: I've been to this location a couple of times both times the food wasn't good.  I gave them one last chance today and ordered a BJ's special pizza Carrio. He said the order would be ready at 7:30. I waited almost 8 PM before finally getting my pizza, and it was cold and the crust was mushy... three strikes and you're out! We will not be returning to this location ever!

reviews.author: Cheryl T.
reviews.description: Our go-to restaurant to celebrate birthdays but after tonight will plan on driving further to go to location at the Rim. My husband found a curved piece of black plastic in his clam chowder. (Found it in his mouth after taking a spoonful) We told the server who got the manager. The manager came to table to apologize and told us he would compensate us (which was never done!). Said that the vendor probably burned a piece of clam shell and left it in the soup. Took my husband's name and number because he would need to include it with the report to the vendor. Then the manager told us he would come back at the end of our meal to get more information. He never did. No discount. Nothing. You just lost a customer BJ's!!

reviews.author: Chimera K.
reviews.description: Terrible service placed an order to go and took about 15 mins to get to the restaurant. Upon arriving however they did not have the order ready. After waiting another 30 mins the order finally came but everything was cold.   Never again.

reviews.author: Liza J.
reviews.description: TOMATO and mozzarell salad and literally came with ZERO TOMATOES WTF. Hate this place just like I did 6 years ago apparently.

reviews.author: Rozi A.
reviews.description: I have. Been to this location 3 times. N all 3 times have had a bad experience. So this time I had to write a review   This place is so racist and so does the employees have so much attitude.  They are in business as customers like us who give there business.  Will never go back. Waited for food for 45 minutes n the food was cold. The table next to us was serviced quicker.  N the server had lot of attitude with no thank you or please.   We should ban such restaurants who have race issues.  I can go on as they made my evening so bad. But will never recommend this location to anyone.

reviews.author: Scott H.
reviews.description: I was messaged by the General Manager of the restaurant. His message assured me the problem will be addressed. I'm more willing to eat at a restaurant that discovers a problem and addresses it than one where the problem goes unreported and not noticed. I will give them another try and adjust my review accordingly.

reviews.author: Mike V.
reviews.description: Service was so bad. The group that came in 10 minutes behind us were waited on 1st. Our server said he would be with us shortly but spent his time on a laptop at the entrance of the restaurant. The host gave us 1 kids menu for our 4 kids. I don't trust paying for something where people cant count.  We had to walk out and that is something we have never done. I don't recommend this location.

reviews.author: Emily A.
reviews.description: Enjoyed an evening dinner here. We ordered classic burgers with add-ons and ended our night with the Monkey-bread Pizookie. Overall, great.

reviews.author: Felix G.
reviews.description: I don't know why this place is even active in San Antonio. The quality of food is terrible. I've eaten at taco carts in Mexico where the meats were grilled off an old steel auto wheel. That was amazing. BJ's on the other hand is meant to people who can't taste. Well there you go. COVID has taken the taste and smell from the return customers here. That is the only explanation I can come up with. Plus the place was filthy AF. The Mexican taco cart was immaculate in comparison to this restaurant. One one thing that was on point was our server. I'm sure this cat knew how shitty it was to go eat here that he went above and beyond so that we wouldn't complain. Which we never do because I use to work I. The food service industry and the number one rule is don't F with people who Handel your food.   Bathrooms were disgusting as well. I've peed in back alleys at boys town in Mexico what were in better conditions than this bathroom here.

reviews.author: Dylan M.
reviews.description: My wife and I normally enjoy BJs, though usually at the Alamo ranch location with no problems. This location messed us up though. We each had a nutty brewnette to drink then ordered a spicy pig tavern cut pizza and the spicy peanut chicken soba noodles. Both of us had stomach cramps on the way home and found ourselves puking dinner back up 20 minutes later. We both shared the food so no idea which plate caused the problem.   We'll still go to the Alamo ranch location but the rim is out. Really too bad because the service from the bartenders was really great.

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Had a really good lunch today.   The brisket on a bacon hickory hamburger ... he is in love with it. The sweet potato fries were cooked perfect and seasoned well.    I had the potstickers which had the crispy base and a dumpling sides. The sauce was really good.  I love the tomato mozzarella salad ... covered in olive oil and a balsamic glaze on a bed of arugula.    Service was spot on .. we sat at the bar. TV everywhere ... sports for days!

reviews.author: J T.
reviews.description: Overall eating lunch here was a good experience. The kids had many items to choose from and the regular menu is large as well. I really dislike the digital menus, perhaps I should have asked for a regular one.  My club was excellent, however my fries came out after my sandwich. That was strange, I never have had that happen before. My beer was also on the warm side, I'm not sure if it sat on the bar for a while or their coolers are a bit warm.  I would eat here again, but I would probably go for a mixed drink or try a bottled beer.   The other items brought to our table looked excellent too, I tried the tomato-mozzarella salad, and have to say it was incredibly good.

reviews.author: Sarah L.
reviews.description: My boyfriend and I stopped by the other night just to grab a quick bite, we sat up the bar he had the nachos and I had the Aki tuna appetizer both of which were great, the bartender however was incredibly hard to find and was often was not behind the bar. It took 10 minutes to get a Moscow mule with that much else going on at the bar, being that we were just there to relax I wasn't super irritated but let's be honest the bartender was Mia 50% of the time we were at the bar sitting down. We got food to go which we found out when we got home that his order was wrong, asked for jalapeÃ±os on the his pizza and they put olives but jalapeÃ±os was on the ticket so definitely a kitchen error, overall I would order Togo from here again or do pick up.

reviews.author: Maegan B.
reviews.description: Went here for desert and was going to order the trio but the waiter suggested the 4 pan that wasn't on the menu and said he would let us know the price. It came with 12 scoops of ice cream which was overkill and was $27! The trio is half of the price and half the food, not sure why we were t explained the size and price. But over all the cookie was good and we ate about half. We got peanut butter which is good but would be better without the whole peanuts, cookies and cream, white chocolate macadamia and the sugar which was our favorite flavor

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: My apologies up front for not taking any pictures.  I had the Ultimate Patron Margarita, the Tri Tip and Baby Back Ribs with Mashed Potatoes and the Mozzarella and Tomato salad.  I was not disappointed.  The food was excellent, the Margarita smooth and tasty.  Our server Chad did a great job.

reviews.author: Mike O.
reviews.description: Overall service was Slick.  I was there for a birthday party for this fine shorty named Ashley. The server kept us well hydrated and handed out some amazing pazookies. Our server sang beautifully and impressed the whole crowd. He needs a pay raise after that solo on god. It was the sound of angels and lemme just say it was music to my ears. He's literally James Charles.

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: Uber Eats took an hour to deliver because my driver had another order before mine and I could see her little car spinning on the app like she was having a wreck or something.   Anyway, the food arrived and yes it was good.   I love the deep dish veggie pizza. I just wish it was just out of the oven. It was still good if cold  but if I am going to be eating that much bread the carbs have to be worth it.   The queso dip with hatch green chilis and chips, good!  Fish and chips were delish, fish was fresh amd meaty, not just breading.    Ok BJ's you did good tonight but yall need to get a drone to bring me my food but please make sure the drone has one of those thermal containers to keep my food warm. Thank you BJ's.

reviews.author: Rylee B.
reviews.description: Dr.Pepper was really good. If you are really thirsty it's gonna taste really good. The ice is okay if they had nugget ice it would be soo good. But I definitely recommend.

reviews.author: Leslie M.
reviews.description: We enjoyed a delicious lunch today at the BOSTON. Our food was prepared just as we requested.  Our waiter, Joseph McFadden, was most excellent. He was there to get our drink order right when we were seated (and he was tending bar too!). He was quick with drink refills and checked on us very often. We were so impressed with how he tended a full bar (people seated at all of the bar stools) and an area of tables in the bar. He was very pleasant and made our lunch even more enjoyable.  Keep up the great work Joseph!

reviews.author: Jade M.
reviews.description: My partner and I are fans of BJ's Brewhouse and decided to eat here for date night. We requested a table outside but the hostess ignored our request and seated us indoors. Not a big deal, however, with COVID-19, I think it's important to honor a guest's request, especially if outdoor tables are available. She also could have let us know that it would be a wait if there weren't tables available. We saw that they had put in plexiglass between the booths and went ahead and sat down in the booth that was offered to us. Something that I did notice were that the tables were not spaced out 6 feet. If you were sitting at a table, you would be back to back with another party and wouldn't be 6 feet away from them.   Our meal was just okay - we ordered the prime rib that is on special on the weekends and a wings appetizer. The appetizer and main entree came out quickly, however, it took some time for our pizookie to arrive. We normally wouldn't order dessert but it came with the prime rib special, so why not? Our server seemed overwhelmed by the amount of tables he was given, however, we still received drink refills and our check in a timely manner. We noticed on our way out that there was a big crowd waiting to be seated and most patrons were not practicing social distancing. We won't be visiting again anytime soon, but I wanted to share my experience in case you were thinking of eating here.

reviews.author: Alexis A.
reviews.description: I came here after a day of hiking. I'm not going to lie, BJ's wasn't my first choice of restaurant to go to at The Rim but I'm glad I went.  I went with a large group. We came here Sunday at 1, and many of the more popular restaurants at The Rim were over an hour wait time. BJ's was able to sit our party twelve immediately.  I like that BJ's has an extensive menu, so there is a little something for everyone. Since I just did a two hour hike I wanted to treat myself. I ended up getting the Fresh Atlantic Salmon (840 calories) and the BJ's Baked Beignet (630) calories. Both were good.  The service was pretty fast and the waiter did a good job managing a party of our size. There were 40 inch TVs round the restaurant for us to catch the NBA playoffs.

reviews.author: Kathy T.
reviews.description: Located in The Rim shopping mall on I-10. Plenty of parking. Met a group there. We were seated in the back. It was not so loud that we couldn't hear.   I ordered the tri tip sliders.  They were pretty decent. There could have been a bit more meat and I would have liked them better if the buns were warm. The french fries had good seasoning and were served warm, not hot. Our server did a good job keeping up with 9 at our table.

reviews.author: Lance S.
reviews.description: Stopped in for lunch. Had never been for lunch before so was interested in trying their lunch menu. So the daily specials we were used to for dinner on certain days are only for dinner, so don't go for lunch hoping to get the ribs on Thursday.   I decided to try the Meat Lovers Piadina, comes with pepperoni, Italian sausage, meatballs, basil and their cheese blend. The waitress explained it as the topping wrapped up in the thin crust, so in my head I'm thinking like a calzone. It comes and it's literally the crust folded over the toppings like a crispy panini. First thought, this is different. Comes with a ramekin of marinara sauce to tip into. First bite, wow. The crispness of the crust and the seasoning of the marinara inside with the toppings, just wow. Loved it! Was torn between this one and the chicken bacon ranch, and I bet that would've been just a great!  Wife got the half California club flatbread and a house salad. Crust was just a amazing and the toppings were fresh! Avocado on top was the perfect green and the tomatoes were just right!

reviews.author: Lyndsi P.
reviews.description: I can not recommend this BJ's enough! Josh LaBlanc was our waiter and he was OUTSTANDING! He took his time with us even though we had two kiddos! The people upfront were kind, even there was a different waiter that gave us our food and he was super kind! The manager was available for me to be able to tell him how great of an experience we had!

reviews.author: Chelsea S.
reviews.description: We had a miscommunication with a reservation/ wait time and they managed to squeeze in a very large party very quickly. Chaz was an excellent server, very attentive and charismatic. The food was great, the drinks were good, and we appreciated the staffs willingness to make things right. We already come here often so we just won't stop!

reviews.author: Tess H.
reviews.description: If you hypothetically were required to plan out a last meal several of those items would be found on the menu of this restaurant. You can't go wrong with what has been labeled as a restaurant favorite; deep dish pizza. I suggest requesting it arrive well-done for extra crispiness.   The menu is large so if you're indecisive I suggest checking out the menu online prior to arrival.  It should be noted that a 5-star rating does not mean there isn't room for improvement. The calamari, while good, should include rings instead of just the body and tentacles. There was not enough meat to include the parts served and therefore I was left wanting for meaty, ring shaped servings.

reviews.author: Cecelia P.
reviews.description: This was my first visit to BJ's.  I ordered a snack of roasted cauliflower with lentils.  The cauliflower was not roasted, it was just cold raw cauliflower.  For my entree I ordered enlightened thyme chicken with brussel sprouts and brown rice, etc.  The chicken was hot, but rice and vegetables were lukewarm.  I asked the waiter to heat it up in the microwave. He didn't.  He had them remake it and still was lukewarm.  Brussel sprouts were not fresh. Tasted spoiled, to be honest.  Keep your expectations low.

name: North Italia
accommodations: Best nights on Friday, Saturday, Sunday

reviews.author: Bert M.
reviews.description: Since we've moved here to San Antonio, finding good Italian places to eat at has been a struggle.   Well, no more! We have found "our place "! We did have reservations (highly recommend you have reservations as well) and were seated promptly. The young girls that greeted us were very cheerful and welcoming. Definitely the right people at the door!  Our waiter (forgot his name) was great, since it was our first visit, we went with his recommendations and he was spot on from the appetizer to main entrees. Honestly, I wish I could've sampled everything on the menu.   The restaurant was very clean and the kitchen looked very prepared. This place has a very cool outdoor seating area. Definitely a great place for happy hour and meeting up with friends or colleagues after work.   To say the least, this will be our go-to Italian place from now on.   Gray job everyone!

reviews.author: Michelle T.
reviews.description: First time trying out North Italia. I have to say the food came out perfect. 10/10 recommend the spicy rigatoni in vodka sauce, it was soooo delicious. Also got a white pizza. and burrata as appetizer. Would definitely go again. The only reason why I give it four stars is because the server we had was not attentive at all. We did not come at an odd time, but his service to us felt really rushed. He came around only once after the food came out and my water glass was empty majority of the lunch.   Hopefully when we come back, our next server would be better!

reviews.author: Johanna O.
reviews.description: RECOMMENDATION: ask for reduced salt  I've eaten at North Italia several times.  The ambience is lively and upscale, the servers are professional and friendly and the food is excellent. My only reason for rating four stars is because the dishes are notoriously over salted.  On one occasion I sat at the bar for lunch and when I ordered the salmon on my salad, the bartender even suggested I should order with "reduced salt" because he feels everything is too salty as prepared.  I usually forget to mention this when I order though, and feel slightly disappointed; otherwise everything is excellent.  I love the salads and have tried both the salmon and scallops, which are wonderful. For desert, the Caramel Bodoni is divine and not too heavy.

reviews.author: Sara M.
reviews.description: First time visiting North Italia. I had been wanting to go for the longest time, and finally, I had my chance. It is located at the Rim, next to Lick ice cream and Luxor, Mediterranean food. Both added to my list of places to visit in the Rim.  I went to North Italia to meet a friend and we ordered a cesar salad and a pizza to share. Service was pretty good and the food came out fairly quickly. We ordered the Pig Pizza, which has sopressatta, pepperoni and Italian sausage. It was quite good and is a shareable size. I also liked that our waitress separated the salad into two separate bowls.   The pizza prize was $17, which I felt was reasonable, but the cesar salad at $12 was high for the portion. I also felt that the rest of the prices, especially for some of the pasta plates were extremely high. As an example, the Bolognese pasta was $20 dollars!   So, although the service and food pretty tasty, I don't know that I would return due to prices.

reviews.author: Desiree' C.
reviews.description: The service couldn't have gotten any better.   My husband and I decided to try North while running some quick errands and we weren't disappointed. We were quickly welcomed and seated by the hostess and this is just a beautifully aesthetic restaurant and you can really tell the time they put into the details.   We had Monique and 2 trainees serving us today and they were thorough in walking us through the menu and taking our orders. We ordered everything they recommended - crispy calamari, white truffle garlic bread, their daily pizza and a chicken Cesar salad.   The calamari was light and really offset the white truffle garlic bread - which was super tasty and I love how they incorporated the truffle.  The daily pizza was an Italian sausage with red peppers and olives and paired perfectly with their Cesar salad.  There wasn't any room for dessert so we'll definitely be back for drinks and dessert.

reviews.author: Molly M.
reviews.description: Took the kids to dinner before going to look at Christmas lights.  We had a great dinner and great service.  We started with the Zucca Chips, which were gone so fast, I barely got any.  I also had a side salad with pine nuts and blue cheese and it was really good.  My husband had the squid ink pasta with shrimp and really enjoyed it.  My daughter had the spaghetti and meatballs and raved about the meatballs, so I tried them and really liked them.  The spaghetti sauce was a little to sweet for my taste but the pasta noodles were fresh and cooked Al dente.  My son loved his chicken parmesan.  It was definitely the biggest portion, but he ate it all.  I had the Bolognese and was pleasantly surprised.  It was very hearty and comforting.  We have been to North before, but this was definitely a better experience.  We will be back for sure.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: I've been to North Italia in Plano, TX and Austin, TX and the San Antonio location is just as great!! I went for HH on a Friday afternoon around 4pm. My friend and I were seated right away at a high top by the bar. They have a really awesome special where you get a bottle of wine and a pizza for $30!!! The service was great and the ambience is really nice. Not too loud, it was a great place to catch up with my friend over yummy food.   When you go, you MUST get the garlic bread. Probably one of the best garlic breads I've ever had. The zucca chips are also delicious. Would 100% recommend this place to anyone looking for a nicer italian restaurant.

reviews.author: Cecelia L.
reviews.description: Food is fantastic!!!! The pizza was literally kissed by the damn chef  the squid ink was also super great!! Drinks were made perfectly

reviews.author: Tracy M.
reviews.description: I've been wanting to check this place out for sometime but hadn't had an opportunity until my granddaughter's 18th birthday. She picked it so why not?   Nice ambiance, can be romantic or seat a party of 14 like it did for us. There is no dress code but it's a nice place people make it special. It also has a nice patio outside for those of you who like that vibe.   The drinks were really good I tried the old fashion and would order it again. A ginger margarita and a sangria was also ordered - I forgot to take pictures before we started drinks but everyone said they would definitely order again.   For appetizers we tried the calamari and the white truffle garlic bread both were yummy. With the bread, don't forget to spread the butter with garlic truffle on each piece-not everyone at the table knew to do that.  I ordered the glazed short rib cavatelli it was delicious and the meat was really tender.  The spicy rigatoni vodka, chicken pesto, wagu skirt steak tagliata, chicken Parmesan, strozzapreti and the diver scallops were all ordered at our table and not one person was disappointed- I have to say I did try each one and now need to think about what I want to order when I come back because they were all so good!

reviews.author: Traci R.
reviews.description: I tried North Italia in Houston several years ago because it was convenient to the office I was visiting (and I read that Drake had eaten there and I figured if it was good enough for him then it was good enough for me, haha). I'd eaten there twice because I thought the food was great so I was glad to hear that one was opening in SA. I'm not sure if I visited on an off night or the quality just isn't the same at The Rim. The staff was friendly but didn't seem to be very experienced. I ordered the Italian Clover cocktail and it tasted medicinal, which tends to happen if the maker shakes it too many times. The Caesar was very good but I would have preferred if it had been more authentic with anchovies and I wasn't a fan of the radicchio, which did add color but also a bitter taste. I did appreciate that our waiter asked if I would like a half order of the salad (that way I could still have room for dessert!). My husband ordered the arugula and avocado salad because we enjoy the salad from another restaurant. Italia's version barely had the lemon taste that makes it so refreshing.  The white truffle garlic bread had a nice presentation stacked in a tiny cast iron pan but I believe it would have tasted better if the bread wasn't cut so thick so that the garlic, cheese and oil could have been more evenly distributed on each bite. I'd eaten the meatballs before and thought they were delicious. I had a bite of my husband's spaghetti dish and the meatballs were just fine, not special. I ordered the branzino and it was good if you like fish that isn't too "fishy" and want a lighter meal.   For dessert our waiter recommended the Salted Caramel Budino. I love the contrast of salty and sweet and this satisfied, especially with a glass of prosecco.  I'm glad I got to try SA's North Italia but I don't plan to return any time soon.  As with any nice restaurant nowadays, I highly recommend a reservation, especially on the weekend. It was packed with lots of Rim shoppers and young people, probably students from UTSA.

reviews.author: Elle G.
reviews.description: We visited this restaurant while visiting San Antonio.  The hostesses were attentive and courteous.  This place is huge!  Plenty of room for large groups. The outdoor patio is just as accommodating.   We were just grabbing a snack and a cold drink but the menu had lots of options. The server was prompt and looked like he liked his job  which is very important for a restaurant. We the calamari.  It was delicious.  We always stay in the RIM area so we will be backward we are back in town.

reviews.author: Emily D.
reviews.description: Great food! Overall restaurant atmosphere is great. Perfect for special occasion. Have been multiple times and north Italia  never disappoints

reviews.author: Greg H.
reviews.description: This one I was on the bubble of giving it four stars. I feel the food quality and menu selection is the best thing they have going for them. It may be partly we arrived for dinner at 430pm and asked if they had any happy hour drink specials. The waitress said that is only for people sitting at the bar or at a high table. Ironically we were the first table closest to the bar. Only a few feet separated getting happy hour drink specials. That kind of turned us off.   The food itself was good and I liked the diverse menu selection. I had the Glazed Short Rib pasta meal. It was super flavorful. Not a fan of horseradish I asked if that could be on the side. When my food arrived it was delivered by a server and not our waitress. I sampled it and could not taste the horseradish. I asked the waitress and she was clueless. Goof news is it was a great tasting dish. So if you are not a fan of horseradish I am guessing it is very mild.  The portion size was just right for a normal sized portion. To be clear it was not your normal oversized restaurant portion.   My wife had the pesto and loved the flavor. This place was good but not confident worth the price to value.   I am sure we will try it again.

reviews.author: Liang T.
reviews.description: Goodness me it took forever for us to get our food, even our water...  After we got seated, our table had to flag down our waitress twice before we finally got our waters (15 minutes). We ordered the Arancini, Margherita Pizza and Heirloom Tomato and Burrata. The food came 40 minutes into our dining experience. Thankfully the food was very tasty.  Arancini - SO. BOMB. Their risotto was perfectly cooked, they seasoned it just enough so that the flavor of the tomato sauce elevated it to perfection. I think the idea of frying it was so smart. The crispiness from frying the risotto balls was a great idea as well. It added much needed texture to the dish.  Margherita Pizza - Great, but not spectacular. Not much to say about this dish honestly.  Heirloom Tomato and Burrata - Delish! The tomatoes tasted very fresh and I loved burrata cheese. Their choice of oil was very fragrant and everything was perfectly seasoned.

reviews.author: Ashley O.
reviews.description: We've been here a handful of times and it's always been yummy! The service is great and the restaurant is so pretty! We've gone with our 3 kids and they gave all of them an etch a sketch to play with while we waited for our food to arrive. Also, You have to save room for dessert! The butter cake, the salted caramel pudding and the affogato are a must have. We recommend this place to everyone that is looking for a great dinner.

reviews.author: Ray R.
reviews.description: I have finally found the restaurant that makes the greatest pizza in town. The restaurant employees are very courteous.

reviews.author: Jessica C.
reviews.description: The first time I had North was in Phoenix and it was not my favorite. Fast forward a few years later and I am living in New Braunfels with just a handful of Italian restaurants nearby. Headed down to San Antonio and gave this a shot for a late lunch.   Started with the prosciutto bruschetta - prosciutto was soft with just enough chew before melting in the mouth. Bread was toasty but did not have a burnt taste. It compares to my favorite bruschetta spot.   Chopped chicken salad - nice and light in the mouth. Veggies were crisp. Pine nuts added a bit of crunch to add to the texture.   Contadina salad - I should start off and say I was really eyeing the squid ink pasta and instead went with this salad. As the dish was presented, our server said he is more of a "steak and potatoes" kind of guy and doesn't like salads but this was his favorite salad going through training because it was so flavorful. I'll have to say this is true as the salad is very flavorful. The rosemary ham swirls have some type of cheese in them that I was not expecting; not bad just would have preferred just ham. I almost ordered this without croutons but I'm glad I left them in because they added a nice texture. Watermelon radish was a nice added crunch and the heirloom tomatoes were a burst of freshness.   This second time at North was a 180 of my first experience and I am looking forward to trying more of the menu (looking at that squid ink pasta)!

reviews.author: Kejian W.
reviews.description: The restaurant in San Antonio just opened a few days ago.  We were extremely excited about it!  We ate at this brand before but in different locations in Austin.  All the pasta here are freshly made daily in the restaurant!!!!!!  Yesterday we came here to give it a shot.   It was super busy during the grand opening, so make sure you go online to reserve a table before showing up.  We reserved a table a week earlier.  Atmosphere:  Excellent!  The restaurant is elegantly designed.  Very trendy and contemporary but casual.  There is a beautiful patio area where so you could enjoy outdoor dinning.    Food:  Very good!  As I said all pasta are freshly made daily in house.  I wish the pasta that we ordered was not over cooked.  It could be a bit firmer to demonstrate the texture.  But that is my personal preference.  Others might like their pasta softer.  The sauce is delicious!  Service:  Excellent!  I could give the restaurant a five star if the pasta were not over cooked a bit.  That could be one isolated incident.  I will definitely come back here to give it another try.  Overall, I recommend this place for all pasta and pizza lovers.

reviews.author: Siobhain M.
reviews.description: LOVE this place! San Antonio for sure needed a new Italian spot to the list. Classy, upscale, and in a perfect location for date night or out for girls night. The wine selection is very nice and the truffle bread is to die for--trust me, just try it....it's worth the carbs and calories! We ate the truffle bread, calamari, braised short rib pasta and the chicken parmesan. Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Sean P.
reviews.description: We came here on a Thursday night, the day after they opened. We had reservations and were seated a few minutes after checking in. There was a hostess out front with an iPad, but I don't know if that is just because they are new.   We started with the grilled bread and olive oil. It was covered in grana padano and balsamic and was delicious. I wanted something else, but my wife insisted on this and I am happy we did.   My wife got the Tuscan half chicken that came with a corn and zucchini salad. It was really salty, but not too much. I got the beef short rib cavatelli, which was also incredible. We split the tiramisu. It was a good portion and had these little coffee beads on top that gave it a little crunch.   Our server had a trainee and they were great. Between them and the rest of the service staff, we didn't have an empty plate or glass on our table for more than a minute.   There is a parking garage across the street and a valet stand nearby, but I'm not sure of their hours or cost. There is also a ton of street parking in the area.

name: The Downtowner
accommodations: Best nights on Thursday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Kristina B.
reviews.description: What a charming place this was! My friends and I decided to come by on a Wednesday evening for happy hour. It wasn't very busy and we were immediately seated in a nice booth that created the illusion of separation. I couldn't see anything behind me! This is a good thing btw!  We ordered some drinks and apps for the table. A couple Old Fashions, Mexican tea, and a drink off the secret menu that was delicious but I can't remember the name. The drinks were beautiful and tasty.  For the table we had the lemony hummus, the charcuterie, the hot Nashville chicken sliders, a cheeseburger, and honey butter chicken biscuit.  The lemony hummus came with fresh, crispy carrots, watermelon radishes, and celery. The hummus was creamy and tangy. It has a lot of dill, but I didn't mind that at all.  The chicken was a tad burned, but it was good the biscuit was soft and yummy, but it could have used a little more honey. I think the cheeseburger was the star. It was perfectly cooked and just hit the spot. The fries were also good. Just what I wanted!  The charcuterie was tiny, but it had some great treats.   And our waiter was phenomenal. He was attentive and super engaging. He gave us lots of information and we had a lot of fun small talk with him too.

reviews.author: Don P.
reviews.description: 1st off. The atmosphere is amazing. The bartenders are fun, energetic, and welcoming. Signature made from scratch drinks to compliment the scratch made food. How can you go wrong?! Meatloaf!!! honey butter chicken biscuit with a fried egg on top with Tallow Fries! Delicious. Housemade lemon and dill hummus. Amazing. You cannot go wrong with anything on the food or drink menu. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.author: Gloria S.
reviews.description: Food took f o r e v e r  to arrive. Server was nice but food took so long at one point she said it would be here but then It didn't come for another 30 minutes, this was around 4 pm  When it arrived, the scallops had enormous amounts of sausage like ham. Not sprinkled but probably a third of the dish. This was NOT in the menu. It was hard to push aside there were so many and we were afraid to send any food back due to the time it took to arrive. We had 2 orders of scallops around $35 each for only 3 scallops.  We also ordered the special meat loaf, that was good.  Bring a sweater, it is freezing in there and certain booths have the air blowing directly at you.  Interesting place, but too pricey for what you get... not much.

reviews.author: Danielle A.
reviews.description: Great spot . Cool bar and menu. Ate here twice in 24 hours. Amazing biscuits!  Had the veggies omlette twice it was so so yummy. Great cocktails, atmosphere and staff.

reviews.author: Jeff H.
reviews.description: Awesome place.  Mostly locals with incredibly friendly staff and super mixed drinks. Well situated in the heart of downtown New Braunfels. Stop by after browsing the farmer's market.  Great place to catch a game and have a snack. Enjoy!

reviews.author: Stephanie A.
reviews.description: The food was incredible.  The shrimp and grits were out of this world.  Everything we ordered was amazing.  The staff was top notch.  Shout out to Taylor and Chad.  You guys made our experience so enjoyable.  Thank You!

reviews.author: Brandon R.
reviews.description: Went by the Downtowner on Saturday to try the new brunch menu. Had the Chilaquiles with pork belly and the meal was absolutely fantastic. Brought my wife home the avocado toast with eggs and bacon and that was also delicious as well. Overall just a wonderful experience!

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: So this place always comes up on my searches so my husband and I decided to give it a try. When I go to a restaurant I like to evaluate it not only on a basis of food, but also the theme. The servers are in character - they are dressed as if they are mechanics with trucker hats. Nice touch to the restaurant given that it has an overall vintage gas station/industrial look.   Space/layout: Definitely a fun place to go to for brunch. They can accommodate large parties and have a bar. The decor around the restaurant are instgrammable, so if you are into that go ahead and cop yourself a pic.  Food: Not gonna lie, the food we order was a little bit more on the saltier side (Dirty Hash and the Shakshuka). Not sure if it was the cook that day or if the cook over shot the salt, but my husband and I had a difficult time finishing our food since it was a tad bit salty. Portion is great, presentation is amazing, but too salty. I am willing to give this place another try. Other than the saltiness, the food here is really good. But come thru and see how the food taste yourself!   P.S. Order a biscuit, it's really, really good here! Homemade and fresh.

reviews.author: Jill B.
reviews.description: Dinner for the first time since they reopened. They did not disappoint!! Scallops were simply amazing.  Best I've ever had!  Son had the meatloaf and it hasn't missed a beat!   Classic Old-fashion was spot on.  Took home the Wagyu burger for husband and lemon Strawberry shortcake for dessert.  Plates are all clean! Thanks Chad and team for a fabulous dinner!!

reviews.author: Louis S.
reviews.description: great food and specialty drinks, great art everywhere, owner was a great guy, showed us around

reviews.author: Mirta F.
reviews.description: Food was ok.. nothing special. â€  mimosas were good and location was GREAT.  Service was pretty good. Not sure it's any place I'd be super anxious to go back to any time soon.

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: Hands down one of our favorite places to eat. The food is outstanding all made fresh and the bartenders are so fun! We love Stephen when we go. They are currently open Thursday and Friday nights and for Saturday and Sunday you got to try their brunch! They can make any drink you want!

reviews.author: Layce H.
reviews.description: Our normal breakfast place was packed so we googled and this hidden gem popped up.  It was a bit pricy but OMG that French Toast is 100% worth it. Service was on point too. Our server was Danni and she is a keeper. Will be back.

reviews.author: Ian S.
reviews.description: We didn't set out to dine at this establishment as we were staying overnight not to far away but it started raining and we tucked ourselves into this restaurant. At first glance the menu was a little too fancy for my wife's and kids palate but the food wowed us. Best meatloaf I have ever had and the fried chicken was great. Well done , definitely check this place out! Well worth a drive.

reviews.author: Lizzette C.
reviews.description: My husband and I love this place for brunch on a Sunday Funday! Service is always great, the staff is friendly. Our very first experience, we sat at the bar and Steven was our bartender. He was great and showed us his take on a mojito, which was delicious! The food is great as well, I honestly can't say a bad thing because we've never had a negative experience here.

reviews.author: Debby J S.
reviews.description: We went to the Downtowner (First Timers) on Saturday evening to have dinner before our show at the Brauntex ... 'Elvis' ... And he did deliver ... He paid a Tribute to the King!!  So, when we walked in, there were two hostesses at the front. They asked if we had reservations, which we did not. I told them it was fine, that we could walk next door to Krause's and next time I would make a reservation.  Well, all I can say is that those two hostesses moved heaven and earth to accommodate us! They perused the seating chart and came up with a 'plan' for us. As long as we could be done by 6:30p they had a table for two. We told them that we had to be at the Brauntex at 6:30p, so all was good.  At first, we thought they were just going to sit us in the back room.  LOL  We didn't realize that the restaurant went that far back.  And our waitress (Can't remember her name!) What a hoot. She was a pleasure to have. Answered all of our questions about the menu, etc. She brought water out in this cool bottle ... She told me I could have it ... And then wrestled it out of my arms when I tried to leave ... Just Kidding!! And then our food came. It was delicious!  And we were walking out of the restaurant at 6:30p.  KUDOS to everyone that took care of us!

reviews.author: Alvin L.
reviews.description: Had breakfast here because Krauses was too crowded. Forget Krauses anymore, we will be eating here from now on for Saturday breakfast. The food was awesome, try the French toast...amazing, service was excellent, and staff were very friendly...priced right as well

reviews.author: Joel G.
reviews.description: First Impression- location and service had a enjoyable lunch at this place. Helen was our server and did a great job. She was pleasant, knowledgeable and had a very pleasant demeanor.  We had the following lunch item - because breakfast was NOT available.   Sandwiches: 1. Meatball - I had grilled jalapeÃ±os- the sandwich was very good.  2. BLT - we were told that it had fried green tomatoes. The sandwich had red fried tomatoes and caused the sandwich to be mushy.  3. Ruben - it was hand cut pieces of corned beef. The sandwich was very fatty and my son could only eat half of the sandwich.   The place was very clean and nice. We will try it again - but make it to Bruch and try the eggs, pancakes and French toast.

reviews.author: Jamie W.
reviews.description: The Downtowner in New Braunfels...  First, if you haven't put downtown New Braunfels on your list of top culture spots, you should.   Downtowner is a GastroCraft hotspot with some great live music evenings. The bar manager and bartenders are excellent and watching them work is great entertainment. Their craft beer selection is excellent and their wine selection is solid. The crafty menu is very good as the pics show but they may want to consider healthier more vegetarian options for that rapidly growing demographic. Their folks are super friendly.   You really should check it out!   Make reservations!

reviews.author: Cindy P.
reviews.description: The pancakes are the BOMB!  Biscuits with honey butter are amazing!  Everything tastes homemade and the draft drinks are awesome !!!

name: Stone Werks Big Rock Grille - The Vineyard
accommodations: Best nights on Monday, Friday, Saturday

reviews.author: Darlene K.
reviews.description: Had good service here. Hilton was our server. The vibe was friendly.  I had oysters and chicken poblano soup. The soup was creamy, which I wasn't expecting. It was good though! The oysters came with horseradish, cocktail sauce, and lemon.   The water here is unfiltered. I highly recommend getting your water with lemon.

reviews.author: Jennifer W.
reviews.description: Sat outside. Lots of fans, so it was pleasant to be out on the patio. There are lots of Servers, so there isn't an unreasonable wait to order.  Our waitress was good. She got to us as soon as we sat down and continued to check on us. The restaurant was busy, but it did not take too long to get our food.  The unsweet tea was good, garlic mashed potatoes were delicious, so were the fries and blueberry cobbler.  The kid cheese pizza was meh. I got the fettucine alfredo and did not like it. The sauce was thick, not creamy and did not have a good flavor. It came with three toasted breads which did not have butter or seasoning, so were flavorless and dry.  I personally did not like it, but my toddler ate some and seemed to like it.   The Big Rock Nachos were good. In the past, I have tried the "Karat" Cake, which is also good.  I would return to this location, but would get something else next time.

reviews.author: Duke T.
reviews.description: I've been going to this Stone Werks for a couple of years now once a week on average. It's my daughter and i's favorite place to go. The atmosphere is great, the food is great and the service is amazing. We always sit in the bar area so we can have Anne wait on us. She's attentive and friendly and a great waitress/bartender.   Everything I've eaten there has been good. The Caesar salad with salmon, the grilled chicken and Poblano mushroom soup are our go to's most of the time. You have to get their Brussel sprouts as an appetizer, amazing!

reviews.author: Norma G.
reviews.description: Server was excellent . Food was good . Prices too high 20 for a sandwich!  Nice to sit outside  Hope prices stabilize.   Good place to eat

reviews.author: Kanela B.
reviews.description: The place was very well decorated for the season. Our server was Hilton and he was very kind and attentive. They were out of the ahi tuna appetizer the night I visited. Otherwise I would have given them 5 stars. Nice place to come for reliable food and service with reasonable prices

reviews.author: Mindi S.
reviews.description: Last week we met friends fir happy hour,  when our waiter Huntington asked how my drink was I said not very good,  he did not offer anything.  I ordered  shrimp tacos,  the shrimp was chopped into such small pieces, there probably wasn't e en 1 shrimp in the 3 tacos! Again , Huntington asked how it was, I told him not good! I asked him to tell the manager! He didn't offer me anything. Manager never came to talk to me. Stone Works should take a lesson from  Cover3! When there was a problem, our waiter immediately did something to make it right and the manager came over, comped our food and offered us dessert.  All restaurants have problems, it's how they  handle them that makes the difference! I won't be returning to Stone Works  anytime  soon!!!

reviews.author: Patsy B.
reviews.description: The food was exquisite. The waiter was a nice gentleman. He was very polite. The place was clean.

reviews.author: Ashley M.
reviews.description: Good food, tasty oysters but a little small.  The shrimp pasta was phenomenal all the way around.

reviews.author: Nicole S.
reviews.description: I have no idea who the chef/cook was tonight, but the food was extra excellent!! Everything we ordered was perfect!  Jonathan the bar tender gave us wonderful customer service and being extra busy on a Monday evening didn't keep him from being attentive to us. Panko crusted red snapper was perfect! Been here a few times and something changed,  it's way better !  Coming back soon!

reviews.author: Gina G.
reviews.description: We have been frequenting this location for a couple years now. Chantell, our favorite server, always takes great care of us. She is very friendly and attentive. I recommend you request her section ;). My favorite things to order are the chicken panini or the big rock chopped salad and you can't go wrong with the cheese curds appetizer.

reviews.author: Heather R.
reviews.description: Hadn't been to Stone Werks in over 10 years.  I had very faint memories of the food being average and overpriced - and with Covid-19 I was worried this place would have a limited menu.   I came here with my grandma and we were looking for some healthy options.  Let me tell you, the food was FANTASTIC.  I ordered the Pan-seared Salmon with a vegetable medley and mashed potatoes.   I am very picky about my salmon because it's very easy to overcook it dry.  The fish was light, moist, seasoned extremely well and it cut like butter!! The potatoes were fluffy and flavorful. The vegetables were crisp and fresh.  Our waiter Josh was very attentive and so polite, even when we asked for extra things.   And one unique thing I have to say is that  the booth seats are SO COMFORTABLE! If I'd brought a blanket and pillow I might never leave- Ha!  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the Blanco/Stone Oak area looking for a nice dinner.  This is the perfect spot for a date night or family outing.   Stone Werks has really stepped up their game as far as food and service. I will definitely be coming back.

reviews.author: Lisa And Len T.
reviews.description: Another great experience last week. We were served by Millie. Millie was super attentive, knowledgeable and friendly. She made our dining experience very enjoyable, a really sweet person!  Great job, Millie!!!

reviews.author: Edward O.
reviews.description: This place is amazing! Amazing staff, outstanding environment, delicious food, connotative pricing, and both high quality indoor and outdoor dining opportunities.

reviews.author: Brandy H.
reviews.description: We love this location! Anne the bartender is ALWAYS hustling.  We get friendly/professional service and great food.  Also, we are usually seated quickly - even during COVID.  Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Jessica G.
reviews.description: Another great experience Friday night. Hostess was delightful and engaging. Our server, Gino, was warm and amazing! Food and drink alway delivers. Our service is always consistent! See y'all next time! (Edit:should be for Alamo Ranch location)

reviews.author: Amber F.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this restaurant! I order curbside for my parents and I, as they are still wary about eating inside. Whenever my dad or I pick up our order, it come out perfect and the hostesses are so friendly, especially Kat and recognize our order now!!!

reviews.author: Christina R.
reviews.description: Stone Werks is always the perfect spot when I'm looking to enjoy a good meal, some boozy beverages and a side of easy listening. Their menu is packed with options for everyone. Across the board from appetizers to desserts, I've yet to be disappointed. My boozy beverage choice of the evening was this beautiful XX! And if you happen to be in on a night with a live band these beauties are sure to keep flowing! Enjoy!

reviews.author: Amber S.
reviews.description: This restaurant used to be on my GO TO list for sure. I have visited numerous times in the past couple years. I will never step foot in this location again. It's a huge inconvenience too as I just live right up the street in Stone Oak...  But I will survive. I have no mercy for businesses that do not value every guest that walks thru their door at a time like this. You are not privileged, and you are the face of your company.   So I go in to check on a to go order and it is taking a bit so I ask how much longer, and I am not in any way rude about it. As a matter of fact I even thanked the young lady and went to have a seat by the hostess stand and got on my phone to mind my own business and wait. Not even 5 minutes pass and this man, who I know to be the manager, comes over and asks what I need. Not, how are you this evening? Or is there something I can do for you? No. Very bluntly just what... so I say I've already been helped and he mumbles something so I asked if there was a problem and he said "I don't know. Is there?"...  so you mean to tell me because I was not a dine in customer and I wasn't dressed to impress, you know, had my tats showing and my sunglasses on my head, and I dared to ask how much longer an order was going to be, I get the stereotypical treatment. This place has me mistaken for someone who will not care where they spend their hard earned money. I always try and give back. I know times are tough and my family and I are very sensitive to that. We tip generously and we treat people with kindness. We very rarely eat at home.  So with that being said I will not patron places where they do not treat each and every individual with kindness and respect. I don't care if you have money and frequent there often or you just got an unexpected bonus and wanted to treat your family to a nice dinner for once, yet you don't really "look like you belong". Everyone deserves to be treated the same and STONE WERKS on Blanco and 1604 has missed the mark on that one. And their managers are the shining example of what it's like to be a boss and NOT a leader.  Such a shame. But there are hundreds of other places in San Antonio that appreciate everyone and all they bring to their business, especially during a time such as this.  Just remember, every person who walks thru your door is a potential guest, or has been one in the past. If you fail to recognize that you have no one to blame but yourself.

reviews.author: Holly S.
reviews.description: A great place to catch bands and drinks. The food has been mostly a hit and only one miss. But the atmosphere on point for what I like. I gravitate towards laid back, classy, chill vibes and this place has got it.  Every drink I have ordered here has been exceptional. This time I got the Skinny Mojito and it along with the sweet potato fries and turkey burger were fantastic.  The lady at the bar was very friendly and helpful. They have a fire place and heat lamps for chillier days. Today it was perfect weather so no need. I recommend trying this place on a nice day. The patio is so inviting, you will never wanna leave.

reviews.author: Ying P.
reviews.description: This place used to be good, but we went last night and the quality of service and food has gone down a lot. Our drink took about 30 mins to come out, and only after we had to remind the waitress about it. Then when the food did come, it was barely warm. The shrimp in my tacos were either chopped up into tiny pieces or they used baby shrimp, but it was skimpy at best. It was a shame as this place used to be really good.

reviews.author: PJ C.
reviews.description: We are huge fans of free walking tours since they rarely disappoint. We have done them all over the world. Since the guides work only for tips the quality of these free walks is very good. This was true with our historical walking tour of San Antonio with David.    He was excellent and his knowledge of history and details was mind-blowing and entertaining.  His stories were engaging and memorable.  We really enjoyed our tour and just wish we would have had time to go on another one of their tours of the area.  Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Dave-Kirsten P.
reviews.description: Truly one of the highlights to our trip to San Antonio. We learned so much about the city--just the right amount to be informed, but not overwhelmed. Brent was funny and engaging, and very aware of the needs of our group. He made sure to find shade when it got a little warm, and to take a couple of breaks during the tour. Highly recommend this tour!

reviews.author: Maria L.
reviews.description: Thank you Katia for introducing us to San Antonio. Thank you for all the tips you shared, we immensely enjoyed our short time in the city.    We followed your advice to drive to Fredericksburg. What a charming town. The weather that Monday couldn't have been better to drive to Texas Hill Country. Thank you also for the mango ice cream tip! We made sure not to leave SA without tasting it.

reviews.author: Irina K.
reviews.description: I rarely leave Yelp reviews but really really enjoyed this tour and so did my whole family (we had 2 teens and a 6 year old with us)! Brent really passed on his love for his city! You could just feel it. He was informational and entertaining! Took great care to keep everyone comfortable in the hot weather. He made sure the kids were included. Not a boring minute! Would recommend without any hesitation.

reviews.author: Dorothy B.
reviews.description: Great history lesson! Before I took this tour, I did the River Walk boat tour, I took a educators class at the Alamo and took my time after the tour to watch the video and read all the info, I went to Mission San Jose and took the tour there and I also took the Pearl Brewery tour. Then I came to this tour....I had my tour with Brent. Wow talk about having an intimate look at San Antonio. He was full of knowledge. He talked about some of San Antonio's not so well known heroes, but made a but impact in the city. Brent was a great tour guide. Be sure to reserve your spot for the tour and wear walking to running shoes.  On the day I went, it rained in the morning. The rain must of scared some people off.  By the time the tour started it was dry. For my group there was just a handful of us.  The weather in SA is weird. But don't let stop you. Just bring an umbrella and light jacket for the colder months.

reviews.author: Anadrew W.
reviews.description: Our tour guide Brent was very entertaining and walked us all around the city. He explained the entire history from the beginning of its foundation, and he answered our many questions along the way. The tour was about 2 hours long, and even after walking all day before that, it was definitely worth it for me. He told us the history of the Alamo even up to the present day about the conflict regarding tearing down buildings to rebuild the outer Alamo walls. I would definitely recommend taking this tour if you have the chance.

reviews.author: Karen D.
reviews.description: Brent was friendly, funny, and knowledgeable. He took time to get to know everyone on the tour and really connected well with each guest. Highly recommend this company and the tour.

reviews.author: Lisa D.
reviews.description: Best tour ever!  I would definitely recommend amigos walking tours.    Brent, our tour guide was very knowledgeable and told the best stories.  He was able to give us so much information about San Antonio while keeping us laughing and interested the whole time.  He genuinely loves giving tours and you can totally tell.   Thank you so much Brent!!

reviews.author: Poonam S.
reviews.description: Highly recommend this tour! It's a little under 2 hours. Starts at 6:30pm. Just shoot a text or call. Our tour started at St Ferndando Cathedral and ended at Hemisfair Park. Lots of breaks, shaded areas and A/C. Great way to be introduced into San Antonio!

reviews.author: Patricia P.
reviews.description: So glad we did this tour with Myra. It was a cold and rainy day, but we learned so much. Would highly recommend to anyone visiting SA.

reviews.author: Ian R.
reviews.description: Our tour guide Myra was knowledgeable in her arts and history of downtown SA! Would recommend for any tourists visiting the area for a quick 2 hour trip exploring the parts of downtown with a tour guide!

reviews.author: S.J. I.
reviews.description: This tour was amazing! I highly recommend these tours for anyone interested in learning about San Antonio history. We did the tour this past Saturday from 6pm-8pm, and our tour guide was Brent. He was by far the best tour guide I've ever encountered. You could tell he was really passionate about San Antonio history, and his energy made the whole tour that much more enjoyable. Even my brother who is is Not a history buff, and was doubtful beforehand enjoyed it very much. Thanks for the amazing walking tour!

reviews.author: John B.
reviews.description: I have taken tours all over the world for many years.  This San Antonio tour with Brent as our Tour Guide was the best ever.  He is an absolute gem.  Very knowledgeable.  Very upbeat and energetic.  He clearly loves giving the tours and telling us about his city.  It was absolutely fun.  I was sad when the tour was over.  I could listen to Brent all day.  I HIGHLY recommend this tour. John B.

reviews.author: PK D.
reviews.description: We met Katia for our FREE walking tour. I think because of the misty morning no one else showed up. It turned out to be a private tour. Katia did an excellent job. Very knowledgeable and personable. We started at the San Fernando Cathedral, strolled along a portion of the River Trail, thru the Rivercenter Mall and ended in the Hemisfair Park. A great tour at a great price. I highly recommend it.

reviews.author: Jerie L.
reviews.description: This walking tour was the best ever!!! Don't miss this gem when in San Antonio. We found this on yelp and it did not disappoint. Even in 85 degree weather I could have done more.  We finished the evening with an excellent dinner at The Esquire. Best vacation evening.

reviews.author: Lisa T.
reviews.description: We took a tour of the King William District with Brent as our guide. This was his first time doing this specific tour. Had he not mentioned that, no one would have known. Brent is  knowledgeable, conversational, and engaging. It was great having a San Antonio native as our guide, because he was able to add personal experiences and stories that added depth and even some humor. My friends and I were disappointed that we were leaving that day, because we would have loved to have taken the Downtown Tour as well. Of the several guided tours we took throughout the city, this was by far our favorite! Highly recommend!

reviews.author: Seth N.
reviews.description: I loved my first tour with Amigo Free Walking Tours this evening! Our tour guide was Brent Salter, and his enthusiasm, humor, and knowledge of San Antonio and its history kept me entertained for the full tour! Today was one of the hottest days of the year, but most of the tour was in the shade, as the sun was setting, or down on the Riverwalk, where the pleasant breeze made it very easy. San Antonio has been my home for almost 30 years, but I learned a lot, and can hardly wait to come back for more!

reviews.author: Sheila W.
reviews.description: This tour guide was simply EXCELLENT! I was worried at first because his tour is advertised as free but went with my gut that he must be good... allowing us to set his wage. I am so glad I did! Our family has enjoyed tours all over Rome, Sorrento, New Orleans, Austin, San Antonio, and Houston, but Brent ranks as one of our favorite so far. He was thorough in his history, organized in his delivery, and stories were flavored with light humor and a bit of fun dramatization. It is clear he is passionate about his city, his country, and his work. (He voiced a sincere thank you to everyone in uniform that passed by)  Brent gave an understandable synopsis of the complicated history of the battle of the Alamo and brought us listeners up to speed with the current city struggle about the rebuilding of the Alamo wall. The 2 hrs of walking was leisure with plenty of spots, even shaded, to rest as he shared the details of each location. This would be totally do-able with strollers and for walking children and adults, though teens and older are who would most enjoy this information.
