The timing of our tour was perfect, 4-6, so we left our tour to enjoy a wonderful dinner on the riverwalk. The tour is free, but let's not take that for granted. He is well worth a generous fair wage donation/tip/income at the end. I am so thankful I was prepared with cash on hand. This is the kind of guide our group would love to have for all trips. This was so good, we are now scheduled to take his King Williams district tour later this month. By the way, we live here~ and still appreciated the new details we learned.

reviews.author: D S.
reviews.description: Great tour - interesting, well paced, lots of new information. Even facts I already knew about Texas history were presented and built on in new ways, with entertaining anecdotes and stories. Questions were answered fully and with charm. I especially enjoyed walking a section of Riverwalk, learning the stories about the people and buildings behind the boutiques and cafes. Reservations recommended, but feel free to text at the last minute if you want to try to catch a tour. Highly recommend.

reviews.author: Christopher M.
reviews.description: Brent gave a fantastic tour filled with humor and great information about the city, both it's past and current sites. Our walk was well paced, plenty of places to stop and rest and learn about a site but we still managed to cover all the scenic areas downtown along the river. I highly recommend this tour, it was the highlight of our stay in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Irene Ortiz D.
reviews.description: The best eclectic , woman owned Liquor Store! Best place to walk from hotels and jobs downtown. Call them in advance if you need something special. Friendly, with a smile.

reviews.author: Alina D.
reviews.description: We were visiting from San Diego, and happen to find this liquor store on Google Maps.   When we walked in the liquor store was small, but had everything we needed.  Very intimate with the sweetest owner. She was very helpful and friendly!  I would 100% recommend this liquor store if you're in San Antonio :)

reviews.author: Omer S.
reviews.description: Annette the owner was super rude an inappropriate. I came 1 min before closing (whihus annoying I understand)  I wake a feqxqueztbs so icanchoosexnetter but she was upset form before an was just super rue from no reason. Plz take your business elsewhere.

reviews.author: Adrian O.
reviews.description: Adorable liquor store with great items at a great price. Downtown area and plenty of parking. Owner was very nice and very concerned with the safety of customers.

reviews.author: Matt H.
reviews.description: We love coming to Pig Liquors! We love it for the location, the neighborhood, the selection, but most of all, we love it for the staff. The people behind the counter are SO friendly and welcoming, and will answer any question you have with patience and kindness. I frequently come in just looking for suggestions and always leave with a quality new experience. Thanks Pig!

reviews.author: Alison D.
reviews.description: My reluctance to pay $15 for a glass of wine at my hotel led me to search Yelp for a local wine shop. It thankfully led me to Pig Liquors. Funny name, serious selection.   It's tucked away on a side street and in an unassuming house. The owner was super friendly and helpful. You can get everything from single-serve cocktails to local brew to a nice vintage of Tattinger.   Happy drinking!

reviews.author: Matthew M.
reviews.description: Absolutely the best customer service in the world. Annette is phenomenal.  Great selection, even though she's not getting support distributors bc she's too small. Support local, support a friend.  I still go the big boxes, but I go to Pig Liquors first!!

reviews.author: Lily F.
reviews.description: I like this place because it's unique.  Tucked away between some unassuming houses is this little place that sells a pretty well stocked liquor store.  They might not have everything but it's a pretty well-balanced selection with both popular items and local stuff.  And because this is the nearest liquor store that doesn't seem shady, I always come here to pick up a bottle of TX whiskey to take home with me.  I will say that being in here 3 times already, the woman who owns the place has both been very friendly and also a little standoffish and borderline rude which I could see some of the negative reviews.

reviews.author: Tammy-Sue K.
reviews.description: I LOVE PIG LIQUORS! There I said it! And I'm not even a big drinker at all. But this place is so cool. They carry all different kinds of alcohol, many you wouldn't expect to find it a small local shop. It's in this quaint little house one block off of St Mary's behind El Mirador Mexican restaurant. Besides just about any kind of alcohol you can imagine, they also sell cute little things. They've got jewelry and there are usually these cute cards that are handmade by local artists. AND they of course have an amazing fiesta medal this year (2018). They love pets and always have a little doggie biscuit for my puppy. And there's a water bowl outside.  So to sum it up, I love this store, support local and buy your booze here, that's what I'm saying!

reviews.author: Steve W.
reviews.description: I was a little leery because of the outside appearance, a house away from the main commercial street.  But the inside was very neat and the people there were so friendly.  Terrific selection too.

reviews.author: Deborahvie R.
reviews.description: This liquor store is right downtown and does have its own parking spaces. It is located in an older home and I did like the vibe even though it is a bit dark and messy. The woman there did offer to help me pick out a decent bourbon. Their prices are comparable to other liquor stores and if I can support my local business I am all for it.

reviews.author: JM M.
reviews.description: I absolutely love this store!  The owner and her team are very friendly and incredibly knowledgeable. The answers to my questions have always been delicious. Please think of the Pig to shop local when needing beverages.

reviews.author: Curt C.
reviews.description: Pearls before swine!  This place is certainly a pearl- a hidden gem in the Southtown area. Have you ever noticed the dearth of liquor stores downtown? I'm always amazed that there aren't more places in the downtown area to grab a bottle to go. You gotta hike across Caesar Chavez to find this place. It has recently moved around the corner from the old location by the Filling Station to a small house on the other side of the La Villita Hotel.  They have a decent selection of spirits, wines and beers. They sell their stuff clearly marked as to the price, so there's no guessing. When I went, the clerk was on the ball, making recommendations, and was quite helpful. They also sell all kinds of other booze paraphernalia, like wine glasses and bottle openers.  The prices are a bit higher than you'd expect to pay at the big places, but the extra assistance and convenient location makes it absolutely worth it.  Parking can be a bit of a challenge, you gotta park on the street, and that can get busy. I'm as happy as a pig in slop in this place! Weee weee  weeeee!

reviews.author: Dr J.
reviews.description: This place is really sad for being listed as the '#1 beer store' on Yelp. It seems to be run by some nice and well-meaning women, but the beer selection is not very different from a 7-eleven...Maybe 20-30 of the most common regional and macros, virtually no bombers, and when I asked if they carry Jester King the reply was 'I think we don't have that IPA'.   To the owners, double your cold beer storage capacity and find someone who can deliver a nicely curated beer list including Jester King and Adelbert's. Given your social media reputation and proximity to downtown, I bet you'd 2x-3x your annual revenue. You have a real opportunity.

reviews.author: Jessica H.
reviews.description: My favorite place to shop downtown! A cute downtown house in the historic southtown with neat rooms and an excellent selection. Good wines for a good price.

reviews.author: Cindy G.
reviews.description: Today I was very disappointed with the owners attitude and customer service. When a friend goes in to purchase liquor and gets flat out refused to be served, because the owner is personally accusing my friend that she talks bad about her.. the only time we commented on the owner is when she refused to serve  anyone who has been drinking prior to purchasing alcohol. We understood the law, and we respected it! BUT now it's because she heard "Chisme".

reviews.author: Jeff C.
reviews.description: This establishment does not accept major credit cards like American Express, which severely curtails my ability to shop here.   In 2018, I am somewhat incredulous that major credit cards like American Express are not accepted.

reviews.author: Yevette H.
reviews.description: Let me first start by saying, love love love your new place Anet.   If everyone doesn't know yet, it's right behind the old one, on Presa.  It's got everything I need. Especially since I'm a vodka kinda gal.  The service is superb. So, go on down there and get ya some.   Plenty of booze to go around

reviews.author: Arthur K.
reviews.description: Visited this place a week ago and was immediately greeted and offered help on what I was looking for, The store has a homely feel to it and they are very friendly. Definitely my new favorite store for Whiskey and Wine! Also they have parking right next to the store, you can't miss it!

reviews.author: Anna J.
reviews.description: This is an awesome little liquor store with just about anything you might be looking for.   Whether in a bottle, can, or knick-knack. Every time I've stopped in for some beer to take home I'm always met with a smile and friendly conversation. My latest visit I discovered that they're carrying BBCo which I'm a huge fan of and can now enjoy without driving all the way out to the brewery. Not that I won't still do just that :) This awesome shop is clean, well stocked and has so many fun finds to discover, whether you need to add to your collection or not. Your best bet here is to stop by for yourself and check it out!

reviews.author: Michelle P.
reviews.description: Pretty good food for a downstairs hotel restaurant. Way over priced as usual but nice to be able to walk downstairs and get food away from the hustle of the river walk. Burgers and fries are great. Omelets in the morning are well stuffed. And a great bar to just chill in the ac.

reviews.author: Stacey P.
reviews.description: Oh Q Kitchen Bar thanks for simply being the best!   I stayed at the Hyatt for 19 days and frequently stopped by the Q Bar because the food was tasty, the drinks delicious, and the service fantastic. On Thursdays, Fridays, and Saturdays live music was played during the evenings which was very pleasant.   They had a menu change while I was there so I'm not sure if everything I ate is still available. I particularly loved the brisket flatbread but the shrimp avocado tacos was where it was at. They were large, flavorful, and quite filling! I found when I wanted a light meal they were absolutely perfect. The avocado caprese salad was good but would have liked more cheese and less avocado. Once the cheese was gone I didn't think the avocado could carry the tomato like the cheese could.   But with any restaurant it was the people working there that made me come back time and time again. Leeza and DJ were super pleasant to talk with - easy going, good listeners, and very responsive. There was another bartender whose name I didn't catch who was also very responsive and noticed when I needed something.   Then there was Ryan who became part of my vacation experience because his knowledge of cocktails and alcohol was astounding. When the evenings were slow he would experiment with ingredients and come up with an array of flavors that were just marvelous. I am quite astounded that a craft cocktail bar hasn't swooped in to steal Ryan away but I am sure the Hyatt realizes how amazing of a bartender there is.   But my shoutout has to go to Isaac. Isaac warmly greeted me when I first came and made me feel like a regular from day one. Not only that - one night when a particular man wouldn't leave me alone despite me telling him I had no interest in what he wanted Isaac stepped in and deftly helped out. I have been in this situation a few times in my life but this is the first that I had someone in the other side of the bar step in and intercede. I don't think if Isaac hadn't that the drunk guy would have left me alone. For that I am especially grateful.

reviews.author: Comyar Z.
reviews.description: Decent food for a hotel restaurant and our waitress, Amy, was great. We ordered the Q trio (chips, queso, guac, salsa), Brisket Sandwich, and the Citrus Winter Salad. The q trio was good, salsa was better than expected. The brisket sandwich is large and was a little too saucy for my tastes but still good. The winter salad was a little too bitter, however. We also ordered a mojito and a margarita, both were strong but good. Overall, decent experience for a hotel restaurant though it's a bit overpriced.

reviews.author: Paulie B.
reviews.description: This is their pasta bowl. At least 1/4 of it was jalapeÃ±os. The serving size was very small. They weren't sure if they should use fettuccini noodles or macaroni noodles so they just used both. Heck, why not. The taste was horribly bland. This tiny little box of pasta cost about 30 bucks after tax. It honestly looked and tasted like they went to random downtown restaurants and asked them to throw any leftover scraps from plates in this box and called it a meal. I don't honestly know how they could possibly serve this.  I wouldn't even serve this to my trash can.

reviews.author: Sampad D.
reviews.description: This is one of the restaurant in the Hyatts hotel by the Riverwalk.  Pretty nice ambiance Food - 3/5

reviews.author: Cliff F.
reviews.description: I'm not one for hotel restaurants but this spot was on point.  Staying at the Hyatt we came back from the NCAA championship game.   The service was great and so was the food.   I had the burger. Wonderful.   My family has the wings and the triple dip nacho plate while my wife had the prosciutto pizza.  Everything was wonderful.

reviews.author: Rex C.
reviews.description: Really wish they didn't change the menu every few months! What lured us here isn't even served anymore! We saw the fried quail with waffles and the mudslide dessert and that's all it took for us to want to try them out. Too bad both items are no longer available. Not cool.   The food: the sausage is extremely good here. Ribs have lots of flavor. The brisket is kind of dry but really different and good. The sides were okay. Cole slaw and beans. The bbq sauce is really spicy.   Also the burbon pecan pie had too much burbon in it. Jesus Christ! Also don't be cheap! Use blue bell vanilla ice cream   Atmosphere: great place to have drinks and eat dinner. Also nice place to catch a game. They also validate your parking.   Management why do you all change the menu so much? I really want to try the fried quail and waffles. Can you all add that back to the menu? Thanks

reviews.author: Elissa P.
reviews.description: This is definitely a solid lunch spot. It is a little on the pricey side for lunch but, it is within a hotel. That's is to be expected. I always get the Pasta Bar option. You can add your own pasta sauce or mix and match. (I mix the marinara and Alfredo) It's $15 and you get unlimited made to order pasta, salads, and a ton of dessert options. The $15 covers all soft drinks and tea as well. It's a nice spread for sure.  The pasta is pretty delicious but sometimes they can make it a little on the oily side. I recommend asking for light oil, with the pasta chef.  The staff is super friendly and knowledgeable about the offerings.   Overall, if you're willing to spend a few extra bucks it's a great option!

reviews.author: Scott H.
reviews.description: Q Kitchen did some things really well and others not so well, so the "A-OK" rating is appropriate.  We had dinner at Q on a Monday evening.  The dining room area was closed, so we had to sit in the bar.  We had my 7 year old son with us, but the server advised us that children were permitted in the bar area until 9 PM.  We were able to sit in a corner booth that was furthest away from the action, but be aware that this is a bar so depending on how crowded it is you may not want to eat here if you have young children with you.  To start, we had the queso and salsa trio.  These were largely misses.  I would say the verde was the best of the dips, but that is not saying much.  The guac was basically mashed up avocado with a hint of seasoning.  Non tomato, onion, cilantro, peppers, etc.  The queso was too thick and made with processed cheese.  I would not order the dips again.  To eat, I went with the salmon sandwich and housemade potato chips.  The potato chips lacked seasoning and in some spots were not very crunchy.  The sandwich, on the other hand, is the reason for the 3 star review instead of 2.  The salmon was cooked very well.  The BBQ glaze was flavorful and a bit sticky.  The veggies were fresh and the aioli was flavorful as well.  There was quite a bit of excess bread due to the size of the bun, but I just ripped that off.  Very good sandwich, I would order this again.  Service was good throughout, our server was quick with water refills and very friendly.  No issues here.  The beer list wasn't great, but it had some Texas favorites on it.  I was certainly not blown away by our meal at Q, but it definitely had its high points and is a decent enough hotel bar/restaurant.

reviews.author: Dan D.
reviews.description: When you stay at the Hyatt, you have to catch drinks and appetizers here.  My last stay we had beers and Diamond Margaritas.  I find that the place goes through furniture identity crisis.  I have seen the place go from semi-comfy sectional furniture, to uncomfortable bar tables and chairs, to oversized chairs with dining tables, to the now deep-seated sofas and very low side chairs with high tables for eating.  I wish they could figure this furniture thing out.  For a bar too, there is harsh bright lighting from the elevator area.

reviews.author: Michelle M.
reviews.description: WOW! had a chance to meet the chef and our group was able to taste some mighty good ribs that was crisp on the outside and tender, Ancho Honey Ribs remember that.  Wine , Queso and Quail and Waffles OMGOOOD! sit back and relax in this nice spot and you will be glad to stopped by. So from the river  you would walk into the Hyatt Hotel and go to the 2nd floor up to the Q Bar Kitchen. Open air bar with large windows you can actually see out to the river. If you are staying at the hotel the lobby check in is on the same floor.   NICE!

reviews.author: Craig M.
reviews.description: This was our favorite place to just go and sit in San Antonio. We ended a few nights here to have a casual drink in their nice bar/lounge area. There's live music on the weekends too. The bar area overlooks a nice indoor river area and you can relax while listening to the water go down the indoor water fall. There's never a wait and it's way less crowded than most of the places on the river walk- although because the all glass facade you still feel like you're dining on the river. The escape from the humidity is an added plus as well.   For our last night in San Antonio, we decided to have dinner here. Great prices and good portion sizes as well. The service (we had Tina several times) was fantastic as well. Certainly recommend this not-your-average hotel bar/restaurant!

reviews.author: Kurt K.
reviews.description: This is a hotel bar that serves food. The burger I got was an average burger but the service from Issac, Ralph and Leeza made up for it. A good selection local beers and samples were provided to make sure I did not venture down a path of disappointment.  The fries that came with he burger wee actually very good. A pretty chill place to hang out and now the Hyatt maybe my go to in San Antonio. I had two local beers and they were pretty good. See the photos for choices on tap. A good place to take a break on a hot afternoon or late dinner. @kodiak_kuisine

reviews.author: Steph B.
reviews.description: Craft beer, appetizers and bigger dishes. All good.   Ryan and Isaac are two excellent bartenders. Ryan displayed a deep knowledge of beers and was free in sharing his favorite dishes.   Steak sandwich is good but stick with the fries. Their potato chips were unfortunate.   Hamburger with fries was a good choice.   Nice setting on the Riverwalk and inside the Hyatt hotel.

reviews.author: Rebecca J.
reviews.description: Don't go here if you are looking to actually drink at a bar. Was told they close at 12pm but arrived at 11:40 to grab a drink before I head to my room. Was rudely told I could only order food even tho the night prior I had asked about drinking/closing hours and was told 12am. Horrible service by the man in the photo who was being too lazy to pour a beer. Spent $40 at the bar outside their loss â€

reviews.author: Julia D.
reviews.description: Hell yeah Buddha bowl for the winnnn!!! Absolutely delicious and healthy. So much flavor, perfect textures so glad they included avocado. Vegan approved. Cauliflower stake was just whatever. There's SO MANY cool things you can do with cauliflower I think they should get rid of the zucchini noodles and focus on the cauliflower. Not enough flavor for that one. Overall great restaurant though!

reviews.author: Monique W.
reviews.description: Best word to describe  this place is awesome.  The set up at this restaurant was great, waiter Louie was great . The manager was extremely helpful and knowledgable about the area and restaurant. Prices are reasonable. I love this restaurant.

reviews.author: Aaron M.
reviews.description: The.menu is minutes, but that means they can perfect what they offer.... and believe me they have. The BBBQ burger has 4 kinds of bacon .... that's 3 son!!!!! These guys aren't messing around.

reviews.author: Elliott B.
reviews.description: A Yelp event here introduced us to a barely hidden gem on the River Walk that I've overlooked for years. SO glad to have discovered this place. Will be back for dates on future S.A. visits for sure!  Most places along the RW are tourist traps, with food typically ranging from mediocre down to hog feed. It's typically not very good and often downright awful, and you always overpay. Q Kitchen Bar had STELLAR food with personable and cool employees, a good vibe, and primo location.  The honey ribs - YES! Like dessert. Sweet and savory with a little crunch. Fantastic. The quail ... wow, amazing. SO good. I think of quail as lacking enough meat to be worth the effort. This was fantastic and left me wanting more. (The problem with quail: not enough!) And the queso fundido... to even call it queso is a stretch. It was a magical dip, to die for - liquid brisket and cheese and other magical ingredients with the perfect mix of seasoning... I ate waaaay too much. Wifey had to roll me out of the place.  Excellent beer selection. Plenty of local and Texas offerings.  Meeting the chef and chatting with her was the icing on the cake. She was awesome and clearly skilled at her craft. Cool lady for sure.  This place was great. Great food, great staff, cool vibe. Highly recommended!

reviews.author: Zahel E.
reviews.description: Really enjoyed dinner here with family, the atmosphere is like a mini sports bar. I mostly stick with pizza or appetizers, they are good, filling and at a reasonable price. The staff is amazing and efficient.

reviews.author: Zachary S.
reviews.description: The great - margaritas and ambiance. This place has excellent drinks as one would expect, including the jalapeno marg! Acenar is right on the River Walk, so it is easy to take a stroll afterwards and see the lights (during holiday times) or just enjoy the area in general.  The appetizers are extremely good at Acenar and I highly recommend getting the guacamole which is freshly made, as it should be.   The menu is consistently very good, though there are some oddities like white rice instead of spanish, but in general this place is solid for dinner when down at the River Walk.

reviews.author: Holli A.
reviews.description: We got a late start on dinner because my son graduated from the Air Force BMT. We were staying at a hotel near by the Riverwalk. This was literally the second place we came across.   We walked in off the Riverwalk it was about 9:15 pm. The hostess greeted us and sent us to dine at the bar level. She never said anything about hours of operation. We went upstairs and sat at a table across from the bar. We had been seated for about 10 minutes, no acknowledgement or greeting... nada.   I decided to go to the bar so the male bartender, with a beard would have to acknowledge me. He's making drinks; not acknowledging my presence.   I finally said "excuse me sir, I was told we should dine here in the bar. Is that correct?" The guy didn't even make eye contact with me. It was like I was an interruption.. bad attitude and customer service. He said yes we could eat there but we'd have to go up to the bar and order from him. The guy didn't even offer us menus.   My daughter was able to get some paper menus off the bar and we sat down to decide what to order. We decided to order the skirt steak for two with some guacamole.   The guacamole was great. The tortilla chips were warm. The skirt steak was some of the worst meat I've had in my life. It wasn't grilled it was more like steamed and gray in color. The meat didn't have much flavor to it. The only seasoning I could taste was pepper, it lacked salt. I was highly disappointed, especially for the price.  We would have to keep getting up and down to ask for drinks and every time it felt like a chore. This guy did not want to deal with us and it showed. He was very happy attending to his customers sitting at the bar. Once we got our bill, on the receipt it said Oba. If I was the business owner I would've fired this guy on the spot.   To make matters worse when we decide to leave we go downstairs to the Riverwalk entry. There are two gentlemen down there one of them an average to shorter height Hispanic man. He asked if we were visiting and if we were enjoying our visit. .. then he started asking where we came from and how long we were staying and it would be coming back to the restaurant or not. In the beginning it seemed hospitable. Then all of a sudden the tone changed... he started following us outside to the patio and chased us to the stairs. He kept saying he hope to see us again. As soon as we got down to the Riverwalk walkway he started making cat calls and telling us how beautiful we were very beautiful.  It was very unprofessional and creepy. The whole time I'm praying this guy would slither away. I have never felt so uncomfortable... He should be fired as well for being inappropriate and unprofessional.   Honestly the highlight of this restaurant was the homemade guacamole... Nothing else the service was awful. The food was over priced and poor quality. I would definitely recommend dining with a male friend or large group....If there was no other place to eat. I probably would've had a better experience at Taco Bell

reviews.author: Carl H.
reviews.description: 9/25/2021  Where to start ??  Our Segway Tour Guide ( Joseph) recommended this place. It is AMAZING!! 2 Margaritas - JalapeÃ±o/ Cucumber  - for me -  CUT the cucumber!! They are delicious. Definitely has a JalapeÃ±o kick. Wife loved the Cucumber in hers.  Next , We ordered Appetizers: Ceviche and Guacamole for 2  -- They make the Guacamole FRESH right before your very eyes !!!! Super Delicious! Then the Ceviche - wife says it's the best she's had in years.  Unfortunately...we were too full for Entree's.  Far and Away the BEST FOOD we've had in SA so far!! A side note, our Waiter was Gomez- Wow !! Ended up being a Great, light, lunch.  Satisfied, but still able to walk the River Walk afterwards.  BTW, there are many delicious sounding Entree's. :-)

reviews.author: Patrick M.
reviews.description: During a recent business trip to San Antonio, I decided to have dinner on the Riverwalk at the popular restaurant, Acenar.. I ordered a glass of sangria, chips and salsa to start. The tower of chips was impressive and I barely made a dent in them before my three enchilada plate came to the table. The three enchiladas included: queso, mole and verde. The enchiladas were all very flavorful and delicious. The restaurant was quite crowded and service was a little bit slow, but understandably with the number of people. The mariachi band started up and entertained some of the larger parties. It's a beautiful setting on the Riverwalk and it was a nice evening for outdoor dining.

reviews.author: Crystal H.
reviews.description: I came in for a light bite and the bartender recommended this appetizer. It was delicious it's a course very festive it's more of a bar or restaurant late night scene. I think if I was here with a group would be a lot more fun. But it's serve the purpose and I'm grateful that the service was so attentive and friendly

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: For me, this restaurant put an upscale twist on Mexican food. The salsa was a smoky flavored brownish flavor and look. Like a chipotle flavor type of salsa. They screwed up on our order by putting the sauce on my wife's shrimp tacos and I got cheese enchiladas instead of ground beef. Everything could have been better in my opinion. However, our services was good and server was polite and took food care of us.

reviews.author: Dave D.
reviews.description: Really cool spot to have good Mexican Food.  I sat outside and enjoyed a great evening and had a table on the patio right next to the Riverwalk.  Great ambiance!  I ordered the 16oz Coconut Margarita which was excellent but not sure it had much Tequila???  I ordered the Seafood Enchiladas for dinner which were great. Little strange to have white rice instead of Spanish Rice but it was good with the sauce on the Enchiladas.    Would love to go back and try some of their other items!

reviews.author: Wally S.
reviews.description: Great experience. So fresh. Lomo de Peurco was AWESOME. Wife had the Acenar Combo. Spicy Mango Margaritas were great. Waiter was very attentive and helpful. Will definitely be back.

reviews.author: Tim M.
reviews.description: If you're coming to San Antonio and staying down on the Riverwalk. Or just visiting the Riverwalk.  Acenar is my choice for Mexican food.  Their hot sauce has a smoky flavor. They use for roasted tomatillos.  Their Chalupa's Compuestas are fantastic. I prefer the chicken.  Everything on the menu is great. There's a La Pina your margarita that is also top notch! And you're sitting right on the river. Same owners as Rosario's in San Antonio. Our favorite place in town.

reviews.author: Madeleine H.
reviews.description: You'd think for the price that you're paying that they would be better able to accommodate modifications. I asked for something with no onions (I'm sensitive to fodmaps), and the server told me that basically every dish had it and everything is premade or premixed by the hour. The server was at least very friendly and attentive.  The food was actually good. The Alambres appetizers are on the chewy, tough side, but they remind me a lot of fajitas. I really liked my molÃ© enchiladas, and I feel like this menu is very faithful to Tex Mex dishes while still being elevated. A lot of upscale Mexican restaurants are more geared towards authentic Mexican food. If you are a tourist wanting to eat something representative of San Antonio cuisine, this is a good spot!

reviews.author: Judson H.
reviews.description: This is an awesome spot in San Ant! Right near River Walk, it's a spot where eating outside is a must if the weather permits! We had a really large group and they were so accommodating and professional.   The food was also absolutely DELICIOUS. I had to get the enchiladas with mole, and it did NOT disappoint. It was everything you'd hope for--nice flavors with the filling, the rice and beans incredible, and the mole a nice, dark, spicy yet sweet sauce that drove the whole dish home. I wished I could've eaten three or four more but I was pretty full after just one, which was nice on my wallet.   I'll definitely be back whenever I'm in the area, even if only for that mole sauce!

reviews.author: D C.
reviews.description: 1.5 hours wait for our meals. Their excuse was that a show at the majestic was playing, but the restaurant was half empty, on a weeknight. Waiter was completely inefficient. Going back and forth for 1 item at a time instead of working smarter. The whole experience pretty much ruined the vibe of our night. 2 stars bc the food was decent.

reviews.author: Astrid M.
reviews.description: Stopped in here today for the first time today and had a great meal! Everything definitely felt healthier and more elevated than your average Mexican restaurant. We had the Oyster appetizer to start which was yummy and a feast for the eyes as well. I got the Chipotle Chicken and my boyfriend the Acenar combo which were both delicious. The sauce on the chipotle chicken was amazing! Our server was Gilbert, who was very attentive  and helpful. Only con is having to pay for chips and salsa, but hey, it was delicious (same as Rosarios salsa which is my all time fave).

reviews.author: Jeffrey M.
reviews.description: Great restaurant on the River walk. I had the tres enchiladas and the mole was incredible. It's removed from the hustle and bustle of the main strip area. Highly recommended.

reviews.author: Lynnet P.
reviews.description: Let's start with good service!  Super friendly, the food however was average and they don't bring chips and salsa unless you have ordered an appetizer.  The drinks ranged from okay to really good.  The best was the habanero margarita.  The star of their menu was supposed to be chipotle chicken but it was over cooked and just so so.I had the oyster tacos and  they were good.

reviews.author: Yohan K.
reviews.description: Tucked away in the River Walk, this Mexican Restaurant has nice food, drinks, and atmosphere. The staff here are friendly and professional. The food, though a little pricey, was hot on arrival and delicious in my mouth! Great place and recommend the drinks and appetizer. A lot of options for drinks, appetizer, and main dishes. Very Covid-pandemic friendly with the outdoor seating. The nice outdoor seating is next to the beautiful river to view while you eat. Service was great as well! Definitely recommend this place. Enjoyed my time and the food!

reviews.author: Shaili B.
reviews.description: As a Houstonian traveling to San Antonio, we wanted to find a romantic restaurant on the river walk for the evening.   After checking on Yelp, we found Acenar which seemed covid friendly and romantic (had outdoor seating, river walk access, and multiple vegetarian options).   We made a reservation beforehand just to make sure we had a spot when we arrived. It did seem that the outdoor seating was busy however indoor seating looked like it had a limited capacity. There was no dress code, people were in t-shirts, shorts, did not seem to dress up.   First thing I noticed was some of the employees had masks under their chin or nose. Second thing- there were no chips and salsa like a typical Tex Mex restaurant. This restaurant seems like it aims to be a fusion, high-end, hipster Mexican restaurant however it fails to do so.   We ordered the classic margarita jumbo size which was around $20. Not worth the price. Jumbo size did not seem much bigger than the regular size. I rather pay less for the regular size.   For food, I ordered the vegetarian enchiladas which came with black beans and white rice. The food came out in a timely manner. The vegetarian enchiladas seemed almost vegan. Inside the enchiladas, there was no cheese and shredded vegetables. The sauce was tomato based. There was nothing unique or special about the black beans. The white rice tasted like there was butter or something creamy in it (was different than what I was used to).   Overall, this is an average place. Because I don't live in San Antoinio, I most likely will not be coming back.

reviews.author: Jacob D.
reviews.description: My native San Antonian friend recommended this place but we just had margaritas, chips, salsa, and queso.  Latter was very good.  Salsa was just ok.  Swrvice was just ok as well.  Would've loved to try the food.

reviews.author: Esty W.
reviews.description: Wonderful! Fast service and food was delicious! Our waiter David was great!! The chips were warm and the salsa was perfect. The view from the restaurant to the river was beautiful.

reviews.author: Vanessa H.
reviews.description: Came to this place as it is not on the main thoroughfare of madness which is the river walk main area. This place is only just around the corner. They have a big outside patio as well as inside.  Guacamole is very tasty and great option for the table. The food is good, a big menu so lots of options.  Friendly staff.  If you're looking for a quieter place then this is it.

reviews.author: Jason O.
reviews.description: The best torta Valencia!!  But y'all need to bring back the BIG RED!!!  They also have an amazing Thai Beef salad.

reviews.author: John M.
reviews.description: So I was "they guy" tonight. Visibly annoyed that my order wasn't ready at exactly the right time and tired from a long week, in general. But Pam's handled my crummy attitude with patience and grace and I've gotta say, that made a difference and snapped me back into the reality that everyone is short staffed these days, and while there are some places that are blaming other, Pam's is just rolling up their sleeves and getting it done!  As for the food, this is hands down our favorite restaurant in San Antonio. The takeout is always amazing and filling and the variety leaves no one unfed (three picky kids), but even with this variety, every menu item is spectacular. When we do dine in, this place is so versatile - it can be a fancy date night, a casual lunch, or an evening out with three loud kids. The food is always fresh, creative, and delicious, the service is always on point, and the beer and wine selection has something for everyone.  Thanks for staying open throughout the pandemic, glad we can be customers!

reviews.author: Royce S.
reviews.description: Okay, for starters I had a cup of their Tortilla soup (my apologies for I forgot to take a picture)  that was very good.  Then for the rest of lunch I had  1/2 order of the Thai Beef Steak and Romain salad which was very good and had a nice spicy taste.  I will be back to try more of their menu

reviews.author: Jay J.
reviews.description: After a recent "Blue Plate Award" and numerous times looking at their Culinaria menu items we decided to try it.  If you are going to try it for lunch during the week, get there around 11:30 or you will be waiting.  The food was definitely worth the wait and the service was good.    It seemed the at there was a little confusion with the staff and assigned tables at first but it actually made for a better situation as they worked in tandem.  The food was delicious and the outside patio was wonderful.  All sandwiches are served with their homemade chips and a small portion of mango avocado salsa that is the perfect blend.

reviews.author: Michael D.
reviews.description: Great spot for lunches.   Fresh food and good location.   Sandwiches and soups.   Their dinner specials are good too but i personally like them better for lunch.

reviews.author: Laura F.
reviews.description: I visited during Happy Hour on a Friday and this place did not disappoint. They have wine bottles for great prices and also if you don't finish you can take your bottle to go. The food was delicious. I had a pasta dish I can't recall but it was scrumptious. All of my friends food was really good. I will definitely return.

reviews.author: Erin P.
reviews.description: Free focaccia bread?? YES PLEASE. The salmon sandwich was UN REAL. Not too heavy but filling and the salmon was seasoned and cooked to perfection. A half was more than enough and the mango salsa had some great spice to it. The blackout bottom cupcake was indulgent but very good. We can't wait to be back. The patio was perfect and not too loud. I can't imagine a better place for a casual spot to meet friends or enjoy a meal solo.

reviews.author: Karin P.
reviews.description: Well spaced, outdoor seating is a must during COVID-19. Reservations are also a good idea...  I showed up at 5 to get a table for 4 adults and 1 kid. I was originally told they were fully booked but then the guy came back and said we could have a table that didn't have a reservation until 7... I was confused as to why it was an issue but not worried about it enough to change places since the rest of our group was driving to meet me.   Like many places, they have replaced menus with small pieces of paper with QR codes on them. It is an easy modification since almost everyone has a smart phone with a camera that can use this kind of technology. There was one for drinks and one for food.   Bread was brought out in a paper bag so it was covered and had minimal hands on it that we could see.   Staff was masked the whole time. And wore the masks correctly (it goes over your nose too).  One waitresses was busy spraying and wiping down surfaces throughout out time there.  There was hand sanitizer by the door inside since you had to go inside for the restroom. Staff were wearing masks inside too.  The food was fantastic and the service was good. Our poor waitresses, we got so caught up in catching up that it took a while to even look at the menus.   Everything was full of flavor and extremely filling. The salsa for the tacos is not for those with faint taste buds.... The Pad Thi looked and smelled amazing. If we get to go back soon, that is what I'm getting...   Tip: want to share a dish? Just ask for an extra plate and divide the food yourself, otherwise there is an up-charge. The transparency from the waitress in regards to this policy was greatly appreciated. The Pad Thi serving is large enough to split this way.

reviews.author: Roel Kristy V.
reviews.description: Always yummy with delicious honest food, served with great attitudes and fast service. Many modifications to accommodate COVID and all to make it easy to get your favorites and support small business.  Outdoor seating right now which is perfect for spring. Pickup window for to go.

reviews.author: Randy B.
reviews.description: Great place. Good food.  Axel is a super server. Pad Thai is good, chicken tika tacos were delicious.

reviews.author: Elizabeth A.
reviews.description: In five words... amazing food, portions, service, ambiance ! Have to come and try it and Linda our waitress along with everybody else was attentive and friendly which now after COVID is hard to find in restaurants ! Come and support this Family owned gem !

reviews.author: Claudia V.
reviews.description: I'm so glad I came back to Pam's Patio Kitchen, we arrive at 7ish pm and it was busy. We were happily greeted by Richard and offered us a drink while we waited. The ambiance was so delightful, it was a very pleasant singer. Linda, our waitress was so nice and helpful.  Let me tell you, the food was absolutely to die for.   Ordered the shrimp cocktail as an appetizer and it was very fresh and tasty. We also ordered the chicken Tinga nachos...wow! Very very tasty. We shared the chicken saltinbocca, and if I would've been so full I would've eaten it all myself. I thought it was going to be heavy and too much, surprisingly it is not. It's a delicious explosion of flavors in your mouth...I couldn't say it more clear than that!  ;)  I totally recommend this place and will be bringing mom next!  Enjoy y'all!!

reviews.author: Jerra P.
reviews.description: That Vietnamese sandwich...omg! I've been here a handful of times and this is all I order. It's so good that I honestly can't try anything else. It comes with the most amazing chips and salsa as well.   The sandwich is super packed with flavor and it's messy! I mean, really messy! Don't order this on a first date unless you're cool with it being the last date.   The desserts are also amazing, you really can't go wrong with any of them.   This month is restaurant month so I might just try what they have on that menu. Right now, it's take out and curbside only. Give it a try! The lunch is only $15 for three courses and I believe the dinner is $45?

reviews.author: Meredith H.
reviews.description: Every time I come here it is amazing!!! The chicken sandwiches are so tasty... The spinach and strawberry salad, SO GOOD! The mango salsa, SENSATIONAL. And OMG, the salmon tacos at dinner are some of the best I've ever had!!!!! Please try this place if you haven't yet!!

reviews.author: Clancy F.
reviews.description: Pams is the best, period!! We've been coming here for 3 years, and I have yet to order a single thing that isn't *so* delicious. The staff is amazing. Rick makes you feel like you're his bestie. It's a family environment, through and through. The patio is amazing! If you're on the fence, DO IT. For lunch, the spicy Hawaiian is my favorite. For dinner, the nachos are amazing. It's all good. Order whatever. It'll be worth it! 10.5/10

reviews.author: Katie G.
reviews.description: Great outdoor patio space with heaters! No vegan options are listed on the menu, but wait staff provided several options when asked. I ordered the spinach and tomato on focaccia and it was good-might have been better with a little seasoning, but so glad they were willing to accommodate a vegan diet. The chips and mango/avocado salsa is so amazing! I hear they have a vegan taco option for dinner and looking forward to coming back to try!!

reviews.author: Margaret L.
reviews.description: First I know restaurants are having a hard time with recovering from the pandemic, they are going to continue to suffer if they don't rethink how to handle food, service and pricing. My husband and I had an early dinner at Pam's  last Friday and while the food was good, not spectacular but good, they have definitely raised their prices. We don't mind paying for good food and can handle slower service but escalating the price for poorer quality food or quantity will not do it. We ordered two desserts to take home because they make great cakes but when we got home we took out two very small slices that costs $7.50 each.!!! RIDICULOUS!!  So raise your prices but serve the same quality and quantity as before. IT DOES MATTER !!WE WONT BE BACK !!!

reviews.author: Paul S.
reviews.description: Our first time back at Pam's since they fully reopened.  They have changed the concept from wait in line cafeteria style to order and then fight for a seat to table service and nd it's all for the better. We are out the patio on a gorgeous September day and the only problem was the presence of large numbers of the Texas state bird (Musca domestica)

reviews.author: Kevin Y.
reviews.description: This really is a great place for outdoor dining! I was there on a beautiful day, but they also had gas heaters and giant fans so they seem to be ready for anything. The food was really good with a variety of interesting menu items. I had the chicken focaccia sandwich which was excellent. Around the table everyone was really happy with their choices. The service was pretty good, but a little slow on the drinks/refills. Otherwise, server was very pleasant.

reviews.author: Samantha R.
reviews.description: The restaurant is hidden in a cozy corner of the shopping center. I like the feeling of being "hidden" away. They have an enjoyable patio with comfortable lighting . The restaurant has a relaxing vibe of casual wine dining. I really wanted to enjoy my experience more, however, the food was not impressive. We started with the chicken tinga nachos, then we ordered the shrimp tacos and pad Thai. Everything was just kind of ok and edible. Our service was disappointing and wait time was a bit much. I can't say that I would go back. If I can suggest improvements ...maybe faster food delivery.  Atmosphere 5 stars  Service 1 Star  Food 2 stars  Cleanliness 5 stars  Overall 2.6 stars

reviews.author: Max V.
reviews.description: Amazing Neapolitan Pizza!  We had the black truffle, sugo and fontina (12 inch each) for a party of 4. Chefs definitely treat their pizza as an art.  We would probably suggest 1 - 12 inch pizza per person if everyone is hungry but 3 was fine.   Service was pretty slow and there was a wait despite tons of open tables. I think they are short staffed and was close to closing time. They also rushed us a tad and started to clean the carpet right next to me as I tried to multitask eating my last slice and paying for the bill they rushed.   Five stars for the food, Three for the service but I'll give the benefit of the doubt there.

reviews.author: Taira H.
reviews.description: Good spot for pizza and wine. They have cute outside seating to enjoy the scenery but I prefer the inside to get more of their atmosphere.  Pizzas were really delicious and tasty! I love their crust and how thin they make it, I love when I can eat more slices without it being a ton of bread.  The middle was a bit soggy with the meat pizza so maybe getting it extra crispy is the trick.  Service was good and food was quick to come out. I'll be back!

reviews.author: James S.
reviews.description: Pros: The staff was very nice. The  service was quick and the pizza was very tasty with quality toppings and  a perfect crust. The price of the food was very reasonable.  Cons: I asked for a glass of house red wine and it cost me $15. Perhaps there were cheaper options that my server did not mention?  A very cozy little place and I would definitely go back but may check out cheaper drink options.

reviews.author: Eric D.
reviews.description: One of the worst pizzas I have ever had. Purchased a large pizza for $30 tonight. A third of the pizza had nothing on it - only crust. The rest had barely any toppings which was sausage on ours. Cheese was sparse and didn't cover the majority of the pie. I can't believe they'd put such a pathetic pizza in a box.    I'd give zero stars if I could.     My son and his GF just moved to San Antonio and wanted to try it since it was near their apartment. I am moving their also. I won't be going there ever again. I was just fleeced out of $30 and it pisses me off.    You want a real pizza with a load of toppings - check out Flying Pie Pizza in the Pacific NW. Hell, my homemade pizza kicks ass on this pathetic place.    Skip this place a go elsewhere.

reviews.author: Robyn H.
reviews.description: Go. Here. If you are in San Antonio. (But not if you're looking for a pepperoni pizza!!) This is authentic Italian and oh, so good. The Salciccia Bianca was phenomenal. And I think it was the Mista (sp?) salad, absolutely perfect! Great local beers on tap. Such friendly service, just an all around great experience. Appropriately named, arguably the best pizza dough we have ever had. As "foodies" from LA we were so glad we ventured off the Riverwalk to find where the real food is at in SA!!

reviews.author: Elizabeth C.
reviews.description: We were roaming around looking for pre-alamo bowl fare and stopped here. The wait was 2 hours (!!!!) but they were doing a good job of pivoting to takeout for people who couldn't wait. We had our pizzas in 20 minutes (they're on the small side - grab an extra if you're unsure). They were absolutely delicious, the crust was amazing, the sausage on the pig love pie was really tasty. We got drinks to go and the sweet girl behind the counter had a great attitude, especially for someone who was absolutely slammed with orders. They did seem to have limited seating, but the park nearby had plenty of tables for our to-go order, and kept the kids occupied while we waited.

reviews.author: Nayri Y.
reviews.description: Hands down the best pizza I've ever had!! Staff were very friendly and polite! I wish you guys had location in Houston!! Wow!

reviews.author: Emily D.
reviews.description: One of my fav places in San Antonio. Pizza is amazing, esp the margherita! Oh and the burrata. Service is always great too. The downtown location has a great vibe!

reviews.author: Austin G.
reviews.description: Great Italian food! So some of the ingredients used here are shipped from Italy which I think is super neat. I didn't go check their shipping receipts to make sure they were from Italy but they tasted very fresh and I honestly believe them. We had the ricotta al forna and the margarita pizza and both were exceptional. Great cheese and hand pressed dough. Highly recommend checking this place out. Prices were also reasonable considering the quality of the food.   Overall: 4.75 stars   Pro tip: ask for the gargonzola dip, it was very solid

reviews.author: Matt J.
reviews.description: Truly delicious and authentic Neapolitan style pizza. For a place named dough, the crust really is the star, just perfect. Get the Margherita and truffle burratta, both are fantastic!

reviews.author: Joe W.
reviews.description: This is the second Dough we've been to in this city, and it's always such a good time. Our food was extremely well done, and the coffee there is actually super good. Be sure to try their freshly made cheese and sausage. This place is an institution.

reviews.author: Steve S.
reviews.description: Excellent..  we ran into this restaurant by accident after an event at the nearby Alamodome. Had the waitress order for us and she recommended Ezzo's cupping pepperoni pizza. Was perfect but for us the dough was the star. Light, fluffy and sweet, not what we were expecting but very good. Salad was excellent and tiramisu was made to perfection. Will definitely visit again.

reviews.author: J P.
reviews.description: This is the benchmark for fresh and delicious pizza. It's not cheap but quality isn't. Their gluten free bread is by far the best gluten free bread I've ever had. It has the chewy gluten taste of regular bread. The burrata is to die for, especially the truffle.

reviews.author: Grace C.
reviews.description: Perfect Italian pizza experience in San Antonio! We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table on a Friday at 6 which I thought was not bad at all. We got the Ricotta al Forno to start and it was so light and creamy on the perfect toasted bread. Then my husband and I shared a large Margherita pizza with half house made sausage. The crust was just how they do it in Italy--so light and perfectly crusted. 5/5 for sure!!  PRO TIP: dip the crust in the ricotta if you have leftover, and ask for a side of the Gorgonzola blue cheese dip (if you're a Ranch dipper!) to dip pizza in but it definitely doesn't need it!!!

reviews.author: sibille p.
reviews.description: Came and wanted to eat outside here in a Friday afternoon at 3:30 pm and were told they would text once a table was ready. There were 3 tables occupied out of the 12 or so that they have. Although outside tables were not visibly soiled, no one seated us after 10 min so we left. It's ok, other restaurants want my money....

reviews.author: Noah J.
reviews.description: Very unique combinations and incredibly delicious crust.  The server was very knowledgeable and gave great recommendations.  Definitely check it out!

reviews.author: Bijou N.
reviews.description: Solid pizza in San Antonio! We got take-out and it does not hold as well as when you eat it there in person (we've been to the other location), but this pizza will be satiating and satisfying. Highly recommend the plate of burrata with bread.   We tried the mushroom pizza as well as a sausage pizza here. Both of them were flavorful and savory, and pretty reasonably priced with generous portions.

reviews.author: Judi A.
reviews.description: We went to Dough with our friends.  The thing I appreciated most was that they only seated a certain number of people because they only had two waiters.   The service was great and the food is always great.  During this particular time, having the restaurant manager think about service and not jam people in, just make money, is well worth the wait.

reviews.author: Kim K.
reviews.description: Omg this place is AMAZING! The pizza and appetizers are so good. We also took advantage of the 1/2 oil rice bottles of wine. We will return next time we are in town.

reviews.author: Richard S.
reviews.description: Been a big follower of Dough since 2008 and now they have a downtown location, which I have had the pleasure to visit a couple of times. The food was delicious, always fresh ingredients, and the service was outstanding and on point. The waitress/server for our table at the time, Bailey I believe was her name, was energetic, humble, and would make us feel right at ease as she provided us with quality service while we were dining in at Dough the downtown location. Thank you Dough and thank you Bailey for making our evening much more pleasant we will return again.

reviews.author: Sandra H.
reviews.description: We have been to this restaurant twice now in the last couple of months. Food and service have been excellent each time. We recommend the fried mushrooms, they are just superb.The Sirloin Steak and pork chops are delicious plus the baked potato was perfect. We also enjoyed the salad bar. Overall it was excellent experience.

reviews.author: Sonia H.
reviews.description: Cora's is my neighborhood spot for burgers, beer party, of course nachos.  Tonight I had the Alamo Burger. The Alamo Burger has the nacho fixins infused into the patty, bacon and spicy ranch dressing all served on homemade sourdough bun. So good! Cora's is a great places, with awesome service and a down home atmosphere.  On Thursdays you can sit outside and listen to live music.

reviews.author: Nate J.
reviews.description: Late post... but after living in the area for over 2 years passing by all the time we finally decided to try this place out! Its nestled on a small farm road out by all the fields, it has a play area for kids outside.   Walk in and greeted right away by the sweet ladies that stand at the desk. We always choose to eat in the dining room since there's AC in there!    Service has been great both times we have been, they have a young lady make you a salad of your choice and they nice about piling toppings on if you want them!  The nachos here are just ridiculous!! So good so tasty with all the toppings, I could go back just for those! But we've have fried fish, burgers, CFS, and steak here! All which were great!  We'll definitely become regulars here at Cora's!

reviews.author: Deborah M.
reviews.description: We tried Cora's for the first time tonight.  I really liked the venue.  The outside patio was relaxed.  The staff was very friendly and super attentive.   We had the nachos.  They were really good.  Chips were crunch and jalapeÃ±os were great.  Cold beers were good.  But that peach cobbler - wow!  It was amazing.  Super sweet but delicious with the ice cream on the side.

reviews.author: Samuel V.
reviews.description: Family and I drove by and thought it be a good place to grab some dinner. I was totally wrong.... It was a GREAT place to have dinner. Friendly and prompt service, food all came out delicious! We had everything from Chicken fried steak, enchiladas, nachos to burgers. Everything was on point. Will definitely be coming back sooner than later!

reviews.author: Ray J.
reviews.description: Wow this place has changed. And for the better.  Great food and large servings, so bring your appetite.  One of our favorites is the chicken fried steak.  Most of the time we have to get a carry out as it covers the plate.   Lots of covered seating as well. Their open hours can be a small challenge, but no more than other places.  They have a small band play on Thursday nights I think.

reviews.author: Terio M.
reviews.description: 8/29/2021 the beer battered mushrooms are top notch! I would definitely return for the mushrooms. I also ordered the homemade chicken tenders..sadly the batter did not have any seasoning whatsoever. I went ahead and let the manager know about the lack of seasoning ...the tenders cooked to perfection and very tender..a good thing. i told her...she seemed very offended by me letting her know about the unseasoned chicken tenders i went ahead and added salt and pepper to them...instead of appreciating me letting her know she said "we haven't had a complaints"..i told her" some people don't like to speak up but I'm doing it because that's what I would want for someone to tell if our food wasent seasoned..she rolled her eyes and continue to deny my issue on the matter. She said "oh our customers let us know" i told her "well not today they didn't"..to top it off she threatened my 75 year old dad and my self that she might have to move us to a smaller table if she had a large group come in which i agreed my did doesn't like boths and all the tables were being used. So we choose to sit in one of the large tables towards the back.... Management was very rude and unprofessional. wasent even asking for them to be remake or a refund the chicken tenders just letting her know..she could have taken the constructive criticism and fixed the issue with there tenders ..simple mistake but she could have handled that a lot better.

reviews.author: Jay B.
reviews.description: Nachos.  Nachos.  Nachos.  If you love nachos that are just awesome chips with thick creamy cheese and jalapeÃ±os and a few onions... to drive for and die for. Make the trip to Cora's.

reviews.author: Shari B.
reviews.description: If you want to be exposed to COVID-19, this is the place for you. The servers don't wear masks much less most of the customers who come in. The salad bar is open to all. And if you ask for condiments and salt/pepper, they don't bring the single-serve items. I'm shocked that the health department is allowing this.

reviews.author: Janee B.
reviews.description: My first time at Cora's for date night left a bit to be desired. Trying something new and different is always exciting for me and I maybe set my expectations too high. I really wanted some tasty Mexican food, I ordered cheese enchiladas. Disappointed when I realized they used American cheese instead of Cheddar and chili sauce instead of red. I will try again and order something more "diner traditional". Their posted hours were 5pm-10pm but they actually closed at 9pm. We were surprised when the lights were off and we were still sitting there!

reviews.author: Cara L.
reviews.description: Best nachos in Texas!?! Lol who are they kidding. Nachos came out on an old cafeteria platter (I'm ok w that- kind of goes w the small town vibe) but honestly this was supposed to serve a bunch of people. I'm not even sure there was a full bag of chips thinly spread across the platter. It was meh at best. Service was not good- unless you know the waitstaff- which we did not. We live trying new local places but won't be back. Another one and done for us.

reviews.author: Adrianna V.
reviews.description: Amazing food! I ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich and my fiancÃ© ordered the cat fish plate. The food tasted like a homemade meal

reviews.author: Clarissa A.
reviews.description: When I went to have lunch there, it was dirty and it had a rat stench in the restaurant. When we got our food, my chicken sandwich was rubbery and freezer burnt tasting. I would never eat there again. Very gross, I would definitely skip this place

reviews.author: Joseph E.
reviews.description: Stopped in on the way to Castroille for a quick bite. We sat outside under the patio to enjoy the nice breeze.  My group ordered the nachos and they were quite tasty.   I had the crispy beef tacos and they were well seasoned and the taco shell was nice and crunchy. My friends had the burgers, fries and onion rings. The burgers were a good size and my friends liked them both. The fries were a miss as they were very greasy but the onion rings were the bomb. Not greasy and very crunchy.  Overall the staff was friendly and the food was good.  I would recommend stopping in if you're on your way into/out of Castroville.

reviews.author: Kelly C.
reviews.description: I'm glad to see people getting on with life. Coras has some awesome nachos. Outside and inside dining. Playground for the kids. Great Buffalo chicken sandwich. We really enjoyed it.

reviews.author: Rocky A.
reviews.description: For the Yankees that don't understand the Medina Valley River style of nachos are not the mile high piled typical bar nachos. These nachos are simple, flavorful and a great APPETIZER. I'm partial because I'm from the area and this is what I grew around. Great place, great food, great beer, great people. Please don't change a thing!

reviews.author: George D.
reviews.description: Great food, great atmosphere. Away from all the annoying hustle and bustle. Friendly service. Did I mention the food!!!

reviews.author: Amy W.
reviews.description: Great place! ambiance, food and service very good. We had cheese nachos(excellent; just American cheese and jalapeÃ±os, broiled to perfection), pepper steak was the best out of the group. Also had chicken fried steak (good, but I wish one of the side options was mashed potatoes; instead I opted for baked potato over fries). Salad bar was crisp and cold. Chili taco was meh, a bit of a mess  because it looked like a casserole instead of a taco.  Peach cobbler was a little doughy and wish we had not gotten ice cream smothering it.  All in all I look forward to going back.

reviews.author: Margaret S.
reviews.description: .. great sandwich but EVERY time you will need to request extra bacon or pay to add more since they only use one strip. Maybe that's normal, but seems very strange to me that's it's always only 1/2 a piece or one strip on a sandwich. If I'm ordering the bacon chicken sandwich I definitely expect more bacon!

reviews.author: Christine L.
reviews.description: Love this place and the food, my only complaint is lack of indoor seating. Salad bar is yummy and has great options! My go to meal is either the super nachos or fried shrimp, both are delicious! Nice place for families

reviews.author: Gary R.
reviews.description: Very tasty authentic Italian without a long wait time. Parking is easy and convenient. Me and my wife actually tried to meet some friends across 1604 at Paesanos  but the wait time was an hour-long and parking was a nightmare so we decided to check out Scuzzi's across the street.   We were definitely satisfied and somewhat impressed. The wine list is good enough for our tastes and everything else was perfect!  Great spot for a busy Saturday

reviews.author: Larry T.
reviews.description: Came here for my birthday. Food was decent and my wife and I said it was worth coming back to try again. As the server was clearing our plates my 5 year old told the waiter I was 44 and the waiter said with a laugh, "I don't care." I looked at him and said are, "Are you kidding me?" He immediately said he was sorry and tried to say he was joking, which he clearly wasn't. I told the manager on the way out what happened and was told he was very sorry about the experience. Never offered to take care of anything. After reading reviews, it is very clear their customer service is lacking and needs to be addressed. Just a suggestion for your first lesson on customer service, How to address kids at the restaurant.

reviews.author: Cherokee W.
reviews.description: Came here to celebrate the boyfriends birthday as we wanted nice food / ambiance but nothing  too fancy or overpriced. Food was good but nothing wowing us enough to come back. Our server Manny was amazing and took great care of us during our visit and is a big reason for the 3 stars.  Drinks: Had a subpar dirty martini and Moscow mules during our visit. Moscow mules won over the martini as it just wasn't tasty or as clean prepped as I've had at other locations. Moscow mules were on the sweet side and could have used more alcohol but it was nice to sip on.  Food: Started with the fried asparagus and while they were good, we have just had better. If you've never had them before, highly recommend but if you're trying to fill a craving, I don't think these are the ones. Birthday boy had veal Parmesan and loved it. Said it was some of the better veal he had had since living in Texas the past 8 years. I had the Scuzzi shrimp dinner. Thought it was good but it needed more salt and sauce. I would have preferred the coating on the shrimp to be a bit crispier but that's just me. While we didn't order or request a dessert on our own, they provided the birthday boy a mini cannoli with a candle. Loved the thought and appreciation but I later found out they charged me for it. I didn't bring it up bc I understand businesses are trying to recover but I would have preferred the option to decline if I had to pay for it. It definitely put a damper on the experience so we probably won't return anytime soon.

reviews.author: Olga B.
reviews.description: Met here with girlfriends for a Saturday lunch. The place looks old and tired, and smells funny. Everyone ordered a few appetizers to share...they were your typical Italian fair like bruschetta, spinach dip, and fried calamari. Everything was pretty average and underwhelming. For my main meal I opted for Scuzzi's California salad with pan seared tuna add-on. The salad was just ok...I did the enjoy the pine nuts on it though. The tuna was a little fishy, but thankfully seared properly, although lacking much flavor. The best part of my meal were the 2 glasses of crisp house white, which made me temporarily forget how much I was spending on this super mediocre meal.  With so many other delicious Italian places in the city, I will not be back here.

reviews.author: Lana P.
reviews.description: It was my first time and I will definitely be returning!  I had the Carbonara, it was amazing! Perfectly creamy and very flavorful. Best carbonara I've had at a restaurant in years!  I also had a French 75 and Tiramisu for dessert.  I loved the decor and how clean it was. Overall zero complaints!

reviews.author: David D.
reviews.description: Went to a large Christmas gathering and unfortunately the place was not equipped for a big group even they were aware of the reservation. Chairs were touching one another cause the restaurant crammed everyone together like sardines in a can...no elbow room. Food was lack-luster, bland, frozen Italian food. One waiter working hard, one with an attitude and a brand new bartender that didn't seem to get help from manager or coworkers. He did his best.  And the worse part of the whole Christmas dinner was eating off of paper plates. Sad. Won't be back again.

reviews.author: April T.
reviews.description: Good food, great dessert! The chocolate mousse dessert was outstanding! Nice Italian atmosphere complimented by Italian music.

reviews.author: Ashli R.
reviews.description: 7 of us (4 adults, 3 kids) eating outdoors. Great view, excellent service (thanks Claudio), great wine, great food. We'll be back!

reviews.author: Peggy W.
reviews.description: This is our favorite Italian restaurant in San Antonio.  The food is delicious with large portions.  Enough to share.  And they will split and give extra sides for only $3.   My favorite is the Gorgonzola chicken.  Then today I ordered a different chicken dish with squash and lemon butter sauce and now I can't decide which was better.  Such a hard decision for next time.   Their patio is beautiful and has a wonderful view of the city.  Also a nice breeze.  Try it out.

reviews.author: Sharon S.
reviews.description: The waitstaff at Scuzzi's was wonderful. They catered to our every need. The Italian dishes were very fresh and very authentic. Extremely pleasant surprise and such a beautiful romantic atmosphere. Great for anniversary or birthday special treat!

reviews.author: Alan J.
reviews.description: Stopped into Scuzzi's today for lunch with a guest.  My guest had the Stracciatella soup and sucked it down.  I had alfredo pasta with grilled scallops and my guest the Rainbow Trout.  We both loved the flavors and the attentive service.  I would have preferred to have the scallops be fresh, but we are land locked in the heart of Texas.  My guest took advantage of the $5 martinis on Thursdays and I had a most excellent old fashion.    I rarely have a bad meal here and I caught myself asking why don't I come here more often?

reviews.author: Allen U.
reviews.description: Visited on a Saturday evening out with family. Upon arrival place wasn't too busy and we were easily accommodated! The service was exceptional, waiter was very attentive and courteous which is why I rate this place at a four star for the most part. The food was moderate, my wife ordered the chicken Parmesan and I order the beef lasagna. The lasagna was soft, cheesy and tomato was ok no too impressed and my wife chicken crusted Parmesan tasted great the noodles and tomato sauce was ok. Overall not too impressed with the food however they do excel at service!

reviews.author: Diana Q.
reviews.description: I have been coming to Scuzzi's for many years and they have never let me down. The food is always delicious and the cocktails are yummy as well. Always get great service! Every waiter/waitress I've ever had have been great! The Shrimp Scuzzi l had on Thurs. was delicious as always! Can't wait to go back

reviews.author: Daniel F.
reviews.description: I have the Trout in a lemon butter sauce with pasta which was great. But the salad had just one slice of tomato, a little piece of red onion. No olives and the caesar dressing was not good. Will I go back?  yes. Just will not get the salad and the bread which they give you had no taste. Always give them a second chance. Sometimes they just have an off night.

reviews.author: Zoey R.
reviews.description: Called about a month in advance to place a reservation for a large party, went very smooth. On the day of, we arrived on time and weren't seated till 20 minutes after. We were celebrating a birthday and decided to bring a cake of our own (typical) we asked if they could keep it in the fridge to stay cold because it had fruit on it, then our waiter proceeded to say we will be charged $1.00 each for serving our cake? Talked to manager who wasn't very friendly and said we were being charged because we are using their plates and forks. Ridiculous! We also noticed our waiter was being rude to other servers continuously. The food was definitely overpriced and for the portions we received! I was expecting flavor for $23.00. If you're planning on coming here just keep in mind this business is all about the money.

reviews.author: Hunter F.
reviews.description: Ordered the veal piccata and chicken parmigiana to go. Was very impressed with both dishes. The veal was cooked perfectly (most places in SA usually overcook the veal), the chicken parmigiana was tender and came with a very flavorful red sauce. The inside appeared clean but we did not dine in.

reviews.author: Tiffany G.
reviews.description: If I could provide this business with a zero star I would because the customer service was the worse service I've ever had. As a foodie great food but I was over charged on my check the manager gave me the hardest time ever. Happy hour was 4-7 we ordered at 620 because our reservation was at 6pm and they rang the check in at 7:04 per what the check stated! He didn't even want to refund me after over charging me. I wish this was a better experience but it wasn't for all my people wanting the best service and food stick to Pompeii! I should have never cheated on my favorite Italian restaurant in San Antonio for this. 4 shrimp for $17.00 ohh hell no!  Please don't ever contact me or any customer for that matter via personal line/text that is just against all ethics to continue to rant about what I said on this site. A customer review is feedback! The thing is I still tipped in cash next time include all the facts!   I really would like to know why wouldn't you offer an opportunity to make it right next time, let the customer know you will always provide superb business. Nope that was not the case! This has now become harassment! It just food people!   Ps I'm not even a food critic! They are much worse!

reviews.author: Renee M.
reviews.description: Nice selection of appetizers and entrees.  Decent bread with olive oil. Prompt service for party of 28. Ok fetticini alfredo, small portion.  Hubby had pork chop with mango sauce that was very good. Highly recommend the fried asparagus with lump crab!  Cozy atmosphere.  Somewhat overpriced for portion size.

reviews.author: Julissa R.
reviews.description: Made reservations to come here for Mother's Day Lunch.  They sat us down in a timely manner.  They were busy though but they maintained their cool during the entire time.  It was our 1st time there and our waitress Illissa was very helpful and patient with my dad's order.  He wanted gravy for his mashed potatoes  Their bread was soft and tasty, could have more olive oil for dipping though.  They have a great wine selection.  Their salads are huge and fresh.  We then decided to get the dessert menu. Saw that they had crÃ¨me brÃ»lÃ©e, I had to order it of course! Illissa reported that they don't do the flame on dessert anymore for show. Which is fine by me, just get me my dessert.   Dessert was brought and it 4 slices of strawberries around the dish, i was expecting an array of different berries.  Then proceeded to break the hardened caramelized sugar..... The custard was runny like pudding,  it was not solidified at all. Don't know if it skipped a step or what happened.  It tasted good but it was not in the form it was supposed to be.  Asked Illissa to please take it cause I couldn't eat that. She apologized and removed it from our tab.  Not her fault at all. However,  I would return for the main entrees, but leery of the dessert menu.

reviews.author: Melissa P.
reviews.description: Held a grad celebration here for group of twelve. Lovely atmosphere, little loud but we had group of twelve so blended in, all apps and entrees were delicious. Would recommend this place for big groups.

reviews.author: Jennifer C.
reviews.description: We stayed at the hotel next door and decided to get room service. This restaurant services the hotel. We ordered the Shrimp Bourbon Street and key lime pie.    Blown away by the shrimp. The best dish we e had in a very long time. The key lime pie was also delicious.   I'm gonna say it'd be worth the drive from Houston to have this meal again.

reviews.author: Nancy N.
reviews.description: The atmosphere and ambiance definitely takes you back to New Orleans and the menu is pretty comprehensive.   The baked oysters were great and their beet salad is a nice touch. The shrimp and lump looked amazing and came in a pool of butter, it's nice but was annoying to run into little shell pieces when you bite down. Was hoping to redeem the meal with a bread pudding as it was the #1 recommended dessert . Not something I would order again. The texture wasn't soft enough for my taste

reviews.author: Ashleey L.
reviews.description: Better than papadeux in my opinion as a person from Louisiana.  Catfish and shrimp fried is my go to with dirty rice.  Best bread oil dip.. never knew that was thing before. It's not the best but it will do.
