reviews.author: Andrea G.
reviews.description: Came here for the first time about 1 week ago. I loved the location, the atmosphere was romantic and cozy. My husband and I thought the place was beautiful, however the food was ok. We started off with some wine, the moscato was great and added to the ambiance. We had the broiled spinach and artichoke dip.  I was expecting a traditional dip, but let me tell you what we got was not average at all. The dip seemed to have a hint of lime in it. My husband loved it, it was not for me. I can more closely describe it to tasting like corn in a cup. They also serve it with bread and chips. For an entre, I had the parmesan breaded chicken breast. It was stuffed with mushroom's, spinach, cheese and  artichoke hearts, served with a side of penne pasta and broccoli. I wish that my chicken was stuffed significantly more. I could hardly taste the filling. The penne pasta was a little bland, but I did not mind it. The broccoli was cooked to perfection and I quite enjoyed it. My hubby got the 2oz mixed grill. He was satisfied, but mentioned it was not for him.   In conclusion, this place is worth a try, the location is beautiful, and they also have cats in their courtyard!

reviews.author: Tere R.
reviews.description: I don't know how to say this nicely, but vegetables served in Texas restaurants suck. I invariably look down at my house salad or side veggies and think, another disappointment. For the first time last night, we tried Huisache Grill. With my first bite of the house salad, I did a double take! Fresh! Beautifully prepared and presented. Delicious salad dressing. What?!  I come from a state where veggies are often served within a day of harvest. This salad tasted like that!  Many Texans might think big deal, gimmie meat! Well, I eat meat too and the meat I ordered was also skillfully prepared and darned near perfect. Factor in a personable, efficient server and despite how busy the restaurant was, my husband and I had a delightful dinner! We will be back and soon!

reviews.author: Gregory G.
reviews.description: I have been a customer for over ten years; generally all good.  Lately though, the service is slow and uncaring.  Yes, I know that restaurants are short staffed, but at least explain that to your customers before they have to wait 20 minutes to be asked for a drink order at the bar or wait while others that came after you got served first.  I have been to a half-dozen restaurants within a 1 mile radius of Huisache in the last two weeks.  They have NO problems with fast, fair, and friendly service.  I may give them another chance, but it will be awhile.  They need to work on it.

reviews.author: Katlyn C.
reviews.description: Huisache was one of the first places I ever ate in New Braunfels, and one I continue to go back to.  They have daily lunch specials that my team and I look forward to, often. My favorite thing they offer for lunch special sometimes is the chopped steak with mashed potatoes. So very delicious!  I've only eaten inside once, I mostly order to go. However, the one time I was inside, it was a nice place. A little smaller, but not too loud and the service was good!

reviews.author: Monica D.
reviews.description: The food was excellent and the atmosphere was outstanding. Our server appeared like she was new, service was slow and had to get a servers attention for tableware (salad was served and nothing to eat them with) had to request additional drinks, etc. outside of this is was good. We will be trying them again due to atmosphere and great food giving them a second chance on service.

reviews.author: Ron D.
reviews.description: Great food at this hometown place. The chicken fried steak and the spinach salad are awesome. Friendly wait staff and reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Roger H.
reviews.description: Great food, you can tell they really care. Great place to go for a quite conversation and a great selection on drinks.

reviews.author: Rene S.
reviews.description: It's been awhile since me and my trophy wife have visited this little place off the main block. I dropped 2 C notes last night. Bottle of wines, steak, and dessert. Not a great fan of their appetizers. The wine selection is on point. The steak which we split was cook to our perfection. The staff could use a better attire when working. Even though everyone wore some sort of black fabric. There was absolutely no consistency in the employees dress code. Thank goodness for the kitchen can cook. Which saves the lack of better dress.

reviews.author: Heather C.
reviews.description: I've been coming here since high school with my parents! I loved it then and I love it now!!! The pecan dusted pork tenderloin with jack daniels butter sauce is PHENOMENAL and my favorite!!!! I love to sit outside by the firepit with a bottle of wine!

reviews.author: M B.
reviews.description: Huisiche is a wonderful restaurant!! There are varied types of places to dine in, you can easily find an area that will enhance your dining experience. The staff is friendly and professional. The food is awesome and extremely varied. Very good wine and beer list.  There's an outdoor (separate venue) that only serve beer/wine that is open Thursday-Saturday. They serve AT the outside tables and you can sit in the  covered area or in a simple garden setting under large pecan trees. You can also wait in the garden while waiting on your table or an inside area. I've throughly enjoyed everything i've eaten at Huisiche.

reviews.author: Mary L.
reviews.description: Stopped in first time today. Great staff. Friendly. Helpful. Beautiful store. I think they have anything you could want in beverages. Will definitely go back.

reviews.author: Natalia G.
reviews.description: I was only in the store for a few minutes and Alda was so helpful! She directed me exactly where to find the mini Peppermint Schnapps and then when she realized there were no more on shelf she offered to go to the back to check. She brought a whole box out and made sure I had as many as I needed. She provided this great customer service for just a couple of mini bottles while also directing the long lines (that were moving pretty fast) and making sure one of the employees took her lunch break by closing the line without ruffling any feathers. Her positive attitude was such an inspiration during the crazy holiday shopping. Thank you, Alda, and merry Christmas!

reviews.author: Jason M.
reviews.description: Thoroughly disappointed in the local San Antonio/Austin craft beer selection especially in the Mix and Match section.  Really wanted 2 good 6pks of local beer to take back home.  Barely scratched out 1 6pk (and one of those was from a Colorado brewery.)  Total Wine in Plano beats this location hands down.

reviews.author: Melissa F.
reviews.description: We ordered curbside pickup and parked outside the store. Didn't receive an email that our order was ready but it was the correct time. We called the store but the automated system just kept reading the list of options. Finally my husband had to go into the store. Great curbside. Next time we'll just go to H-E-B!

reviews.author: Ardie S.
reviews.description: Quick tactical stop to pick up a wine bottle bag. Customary store layout, as I shop the location in Sunset Valley often enough to be familiar. Score on that count.Total Success!  In this Total, the restrooms are at the back of the store instead of as you enter. It's not something one intentionally seeks out at a liquor store, but I've had the need on more than one occasion. Unfortunately, in this case, it's a matter of out-of-sight is out-of-mind, as I found the men's room a bit dirty and ragged around noon on a Friday--far too early in the day to be due to foot traffic alone. That's in stark contrast to the Total near me with its sparkling, nearly spotless restrooms. If that aspect doesn't seem important to you, remember they hold tastings here. Their brand ambassadors can only be as clean as the facilities in which they clean up.  Then again, alcohol kills most germs, so party on! Four stars, and TOTALLY recommended!

reviews.author: Desiree A.
reviews.description: RUDE AND HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!!!! Turned 21 a few days ago and went in with my friend. She had no alcohol in her hand, and they still didn't sell to me. Other alcoholic stores are much better and nicer. They would never treat me with such a rude tone. Embarassing. Shitty service!!!!! I had a bad feeling too. Gonna stick to Specs (way better service and idiots don't work there). If I could give 0 stars I would. So embarrassed of the way I was treated and will tell my friends and family to not waste your time. Then I asked if I could buy just a soda. And they said "I cant sell u anything" what idiots!!!!!! Ruined my day and birthday! U guys are the worst service I've ever experienced in MY 21 YRS OF LIFE!!!!!!

reviews.author: Jason P.
reviews.description: For TW, this is a small store, and the craft beer selection is lacking compared to Austin's two locations (and some of the ones we've been to in Houston).  Honestly it felt like half the beer that TW Cedar Park and South Austin have.  Wines fared much better, but still lacking some of the offerings we typically find elsewhere.  Prices were great, as with all Total Wine stores.  Really wish they'd make all their locations the same size so we could depend on them.  Oh well, still better than most liquor stores right ?

reviews.author: Melissa V.
reviews.description: The variety at Total Wine is fantastic! They always have samples you can try before you buy. John was great during our last visit. He introduced us to a new whiskey, that we loved and bought! He helped us find what we were looking for and was always friendly and fun to talk to. Stephanie Frankie was great too! Admittedly there are definitely people who work here that do NOT make you feel welcome and aren't friendly, the great people make up for the rude ones. You will know who is helpful and who to avoid. K.P. is great too! You can always count on her for help in finding a great wine. Happy New Year!

reviews.author: Mike F.
reviews.description: Let's face it, no one has every selection of wine or beer.  Especially with legislation and rules on how and what brands or alcohol can be imported.  A side desk aimed, I don't buy high end wine and I do. It really see any wine cellar controls in place so I sort of in my mind question how they ship store and control the quality of high dollar bottles so they don't skunk- or have any other issues.   For my purposes and my visit, this store was an unexpected visit but I had been wanting to try it out for awhile.  I was met with friendly staff, and an overwhelming selection of wines and beer.  At about every corner I was met with staff inquiring what I was looking for.  Wine tasting, a huge room for what I assume to be classes and finally a cold and shelf temp beer selection were all cleanly arranged and accompanied with more than adequate signage.    If we speak of selection, I would really like to have seen a better selection of German wine from the Pfalz region.  There is an abundant amount of wine that is from a wine drinking standpoint "must try".  But, I do not see them in any stores around.

reviews.author: Jack L.
reviews.description: Ideal for samples!   Friendly staff, decent pricing.   A lot of times I have been there samples were being offered, which is kind of cool. Not just wines or beers, but whiskey and tequila and such. Once I was offered absinthe and the man giving out the samples was the business owner all the way from Oregon! It was like a reverse Oregon-trail, I told him after the sample.  Selection is not what I expect from Total Wine, I have shopped at their locations across the U.S. and this is the least I have experienced. Some of it might be due to Texas Law, as I asked why other stores (such as in Houston) can't ship to this location, and I was told it was Texas law.   A perfect place to pick up mainstream beers and wines, as well as to try the samples (I think they have a schedule for the tastings).

reviews.author: Josette R.
reviews.description: Wine!  Well why not. Omg!  I had gone to Total  Wine for a, as in one bottle of wine. I left a little tipsy and $100 later. Lmao.   The staff was great, hell they got me to spend $90 more than I expected.   Saturday's are the beat days to go. There's sampling stations EVERYWHERE!  Leave your credit cards at home.

reviews.author: Lopez J.
reviews.description: Yesterday the manager for second time don't want to sell the quantity that I was looking for and I thing she was doing king of discrimination because im Latin ,. I'm reward member and I just to buy same quantities in others days and the other's manager never make question or problems whit my purchases

reviews.author: Wajih O.
reviews.description: John is very helpful and Informative. I like coming to this location because they always have a variety of beer(s) however, I have found other venues that offer much more than I find here. They do have the beer cooler that can magically turn a room temperature beer into a nice and ready to drink one in 5 minutes! Cheers!

reviews.author: Eric C.
reviews.description: I love this place!  OK, Normally I start off my reviews a little but I just had to say it!  This is more than a wine or liquor store.  It is located in the Forum, at the North end near Hobby Lobby.  It is an expansive store with a huge selection of beer, wine, liquor, and so much more.  They have a selection of wines that I have not been able to find anywhere.

reviews.author: Jacob M.
reviews.description: Stopped by this place at the Forum after doing a service call at Chili's and WOW! This place has everything what every whisky,tequila,Vodka,Wine drinker and much much more and don't forget the accessories but they got your back on that too. Friendly service and even tho I was just walking around drooling over all the stuff they have I didn't feel out of place I felt welcome. I am closer to the Rim location and hopefully that one is just as good or even better. Next time when I looking for a particular sprit or something that's associated with alcohol I will defiantly come here.

reviews.author: Belinda L.
reviews.description: My parties have benefited from all the tasting events I've attended I've learned so much about the wines, champagne, whiskey, vodka and rum I've loved for so long. If you haven't attended any, you'll be surprised what you don't know.

reviews.author: Andrea M.
reviews.description: I love that there is an undeniably HUGE selection of booze.   I hate that the employees have to push certain items.   We were visiting from out of town and wanted to purchase some wine. They were sold out of our favorite brand (obviously-Cooper and Thief) so we were recommended some other wine that was supposed to be similar and purchased 3 bottles.   When we got it home they were all horrible. We tried this brand and it's 3 varietals and didn't care for any. THANK GOODNESS they offered a refund even though the bottle was opened. We ended up getting bottles we knew to avoid anymore waste.

reviews.author: Kassie K.
reviews.description: Went in today to find some gifts for Christmas and after searching through the singles section for beer, I found beer that was not only out of season, but most importantly, out of date! I found beer that was best by 2017, 2018 and January of 2019, it's December 2019 guys!!! When bringing the out of date beer to managements attention, my husband and I were pretty much scoffed at and they tried to educate us on the fact that beer can age. Well yes, that may be true, but not for most beer and brewers put best by dates for a reason. Will not be back!

reviews.author: Iron T.
reviews.description: I went here and across the interstate to Spec's to see who had a selection of Shinner beer. Total wine not only had more Shinner varieties they also had a bigger and better beer selection. I think they had a better selection of everything period. The staff interaction was pleasant but they didn't have a lot of people on the floor to help you while you were shopping. The other issue I had was actually getting out of the store. They have the doors blocked off to force you to go through a checkout line. This is an issue if you don't need to check out but have to squeeze through people just to leave. Other than that go here over Spec's.

reviews.author: Tin T.
reviews.description: Love this place a lot. They carry huge collections and brands. Never been upset when I'm there. Their prices was impressed me. So much cheaper than regular stores. Found this one at their check out counter and I love it

reviews.author: Raychel R.
reviews.description: I always look for bus or walking tours when visiting new places. It's always a great way to learn about the city. This bus tour was really great. I recommend you do one full loop before trying the hop-on/hop-off option, so you can see which locations you want to see.  Our tour guide, BC, was hilarious and really made the tour fun. There was a lot to see in San Antonio and the bus route made sure to stop at all the popular tourist areas!  Note: Wear comfortable shoes and bring dollar bills to tip your tour guides.

reviews.author: Amanda M.
reviews.description: Meh.   Pretty expensive for meh.   The vehicles could be better maintained. They are pretty filthy.   Was with three different tour guides today. None of which particularly really wowed me. Some tidbits I did learn...Didn't know LBJ got married down there or Johnny Cash met his first wife at a HS down there.    They do have water for you at stop 19, but no popcorn like website says (stopped after covid).   Bathrooms are in the fudge shop next door. Not the cleanest, but you do have the sugar aroma.

reviews.author: Shelia S.
reviews.description: This is a pretty good way to explore San Antonio's downtown and find out what is available. We bought the two day pass with the hop-on-hop-off feature. Our first trip we rode the entire route to see what was available. They driver, Jack, did an amazing job of giving us some history and pointing out extra elements. He had a small bit of the tour recorded, but it was mostly live.  After we decided what we wanted to go back to we rode 3 other times. The other drivers were nice, but none compared to Jack.   Even though they say the buses are air conditioned, it doesn't hold up to Texas summer heat. Sitting on the lower level gave a little relief, but not much. The upper level is a neat experience, but I would definitely recommend spring or fall to give it a try.

reviews.author: Nycole R.
reviews.description: One of our favorite things to do when we visit a new town is to take a tour bus that will acquaint us with some fun locations and introduce us to the city. So we scheduled the hop-on-hop off bus tour for early in our stay.  We found the stops to be a little underwhelming. Some of them take you to touristy places that you'd expect (The Alamo, Pearl, La Villita, etc.) and other stops felt a little forced. Random streets or restaurants that appear to have no real attraction other than perhaps a deal that a business made with the bus company to put a stop there.  The experience also varies depending on which driver you get. Over the course of our three days, we rode on several busses and found that Kat was by far the most entertaining and engaging. She sang along with the songs, cracked jokes and interacted with the guests. Other drivers hit a pre-recorded track and just drove. I do appreciate that each driver was able to modify the script a bit to match their personality, but some really could have done more to liven it up.  Overall, I'd give this tour three stars due to the inconsistency of the drivers and the strange stops. But Kat was so fun that she earned the company an extra star. She really went out of her way to make our trip fun and memorable.

reviews.author: Wendi W.
reviews.description: We enjoyed the hop on hop off bus tour of San Antonio. We took my 80 year old mother for her birthday and she enjoyed it. We took a wheelchair as she can't walk far distances. It took you to all of the good places to see. The top of the bus had much better views and you could tell what the narrative was talking about. No air up top but they had a cover and it wasn't bad for July. Of course my Mom couldn't climb the stairs so her and my sister stayed down below in the mild air conditioning.

reviews.author: Raymond S.
reviews.description: So sad I can't give zero stars. The company is very UN-environmentally friendly as the print thousands of schedules they don't follow. We were on the north side of town and the bus was 20 minutes late, or so we thought. Next thing we knew the driver turned off the mapped route and didn't reappear for another 20 minutes (I assume a coffee stop). Bus number 903. As we had walked to the corner to see if he was coming we weren't at the sign, although we waved to flag him down as soon as he turned the corner and saw no one at the stop he hit the gas. We had to walk almost a mile into town to see if we could get a refund-not looking good. Much better to give you money to the numerous vagabond milling about than this company.

reviews.author: Timothy G.
reviews.description: JP was a great guide. We had a ball and learned a lot about San Antonio. We did the whole ride today and we'll use it as a cheap taxi tomorrow.

reviews.author: Mark Y.
reviews.description: Not an awful way to get a sample of the city and learn some things about it.   Just don't sit in the back of the bus.   You won't hear much.  We only wanted to see one thing off of the bus so we rode to it and got off.   When we first got on at stop 1, Jesel was on the bus, I guess as a hostess or something.  She was super nice.   The driver for our first leg was BC.   He mixed up recordings and live speaking and was very clear on the stops.   His narration was informative and entertaining.    Our second leg was 180 degrees.  We could not hear the driver very well at all from the back of the bus.  I was following along on the map and planned to get off the bus at #18.   He stopped at #17 and was talking but we could not hear him.  he then drove right by #18.   He tried to say that #17 was #18 but I'm not buying it.  We got on at #13 and there's no way he made 5 stops before the final stop at #19(aka #1) plus I was looking at the map and knew where we were.  I think he was just taking short cuts.  Your experience will vary wildly depending on where you sit and who your driver is.

reviews.author: Jason P.
reviews.description: This was an expensive disappointment. In every major city that I visit for the first time, I like to take an open bus tour. This is typically an excellent way to see and learn about the city. Nothing about this tour met my expectation. I would have been better off taking an Uber and asking the driver for anything he or she could tell me about the area.  Hard pass

reviews.author: Shanea H.
reviews.description: River cruise and bus tour adequate for price. Customer service and instructions are the reason for the low stars. We made the mistake of pre-buying the combo tour and river boat tickets online. We tried to do the river cruise first. Nope. Had to go to the main office to get the Boat tickets. Ended up buying them from the boat company directly as we had already been in line for 45 minutes when we found this out so the online combo is no bargain.  At the bus boarding spot the online voucher wasn't good. We have to go across the street to get tickets printed. Tried to get on the bus and we were given the wrong tickets. Had to go back, missed a bus and had to wait another 30 minutes. Overall poor communication and instructions.

reviews.author: Alex S.
reviews.description: Busses don't run on schedule, they don't stop at the scheduled stops, the information they tell you during the presentation isn't able to be heard/understood......spend your money elsewhere.  This tour was awful.

reviews.author: Donna K.
reviews.description: Buses were dirty and no USB ports as promised. They promoted more restaurants and bars than told us about sites.

reviews.author: Matt K.
reviews.description: During my visit to SA, we took the sightseeing bus around the city to check out the different sites. We bought our tickets and boarded near the Alamo. After waiting about 15 minutes, we boarded the bus and went on our tour. There were both pro and cons.  The cons:   Since the bus was crowded, I had no choice but to sit in the back of the bus while the driver drove us around talking about the different sites. I wasn't happy at first since it was difficult seeing out the frosty windows which was from the see through advertisement that covered the window. In addition to not being able to see, I was next to the motor which was very loud and made it very difficult for me to hear what the driver was saying. There wasn't much air circulation and got a little stuffy.   The pros:   We bought the all day pass so we were able to get on and off the bus at their designated pick up/drop off locations. This gave us the flexibility to get on and off at our leisure without having to drive around the city to look for and pay for parking. It was nice being able to see the different spots around town and it gave us ideas on where to eat and what we wanted to see more of. When we had gotten back on, we were able to find a spot on the second floor of the bus since less people are riding the further it gets away from the starting location.   Overall, it was a nice experience but thought it was a little pricey for just seeing a handful of sites throughout the city. If you're not a big walker and want to see the city, then I think this experience is an ideal one.

reviews.author: Shaun R.
reviews.description: I don't usually like to drag a business but it was definitely misleading about the timing between buses. We waited at least 40 minutes to catch another bus. You can really get hurt by the low lying branches that seem to jump out of nowhere and smack you in the face. Driver did mention it after previously passing about three trees. However, there is no signage so be careful. The "stops" were ok and lead to some pretty trendy places. Overpriced for a 24 hour pass on a bus that runs only until 5:30. â€  Great views of the river can be seen from atop the bus.

reviews.author: Ed M.
reviews.description: The hop on - hop of bus was OK! The girl on the first part of the trip didn't do all that well or know all that much. The gentleman on our second half way home was very good and informative. His line of"Ladies, watch your step, I'm married and I don't want you falling for me" was great. Good stuff!

reviews.author: Terry L.
reviews.description: Really overpriced for what they offered. Bus was dirty, a/c did not work. While not their fault, road construction made it impossible to stay on route although there really weren't any great points of interests. We were most interested in going to the Tower of America's as the last stop. However, the bus dropped us so far away it would have been better for us to walk to the tower from our hotel.

reviews.author: Jaclyn B.
reviews.description: We spent $80 each the 5 of us and rode the bus 2 times for a 3 day pass because the bus never was on time. We would wait 40minutes and the bus was never there. Waste of money! The Pearl is nothing worth seeing either

reviews.author: John W.
reviews.description: We always try to find these tours when visiting a new city, they are a great way to learn some quick history. We had a lot of fun on this tour during our short stay in San Antonio. Our tour guide was Kat and she was very good at what she does and made our trip special. I highly recommend this tour if you want to get the most out of your trip to San Antonio and see more than just the Alamo and Riverwalk.

reviews.author: Michael B.
reviews.description: I'm usually fine with 'tourist trap' exhibits, restaurants, and tours, but this one was decidedly 'meh'.  This is only a slightly upgraded city bus route with not a lot for your money unless you really enjoy upper-deck views of downtown San Antonio.  Nothing wrong with that, but the choicest views can be glimpsed either from the Tower of the Americas or down on the River Walk.   The 'tour' part is just a recorded tape that plays as the bus reaches each stop.  Given that there's more music than speech, the speech isn't that informative, and it's hard to hear over the grind of the diesel engine, I'd give it a miss.  Since I experienced a 40-minute wait at a stop between buses, I recommend that you just walk, cab, water-taxi, or uber it between your destinations.    Tip: If you insist on having this sub-par experience, at least don't do it for full price.  This outfit typically has a sale on Groupon, or discount tickets on their website. Failing that, grab any of the free maps/guides in the Rivercenter or tourist info booths around the city.  There's usually a coupon lurking in there somewhere.

reviews.author: Tim C.
reviews.description: The bus driver kept us entertained and we enjoyed most of the tour, the day we went we had to dodge a few intermittent rain showers, but it was still fun.  I would recommend going during the week and early, and after school starts back up.  We liked riding on the top deck, better view.  Buy a ticket,  stay on for the whole ride, than get on and off as many times as you want, a one day pass is good for 24 hours, you can do 2 and 3 day passes too.

reviews.author: Alfredo A.
reviews.description: Pretty good onion rings, good burger, and great beer specials! Not too bad for a quick bite and very friendly staff.

reviews.author: Julie F.
reviews.description: Hamburgers here are good. Freshly made with all the trimmings. Comes with a toasted black sesame bun. The sweet tea is good. They don't have combos. You pay separately for each item which is costly. If I have one thing to say that would like to see changed is either the size of the bread or the patty. The patty is not thick enough to accommodate the size of the bread. Too much bun for me!

reviews.author: Eddie T.
reviews.description: The company logo was like a throwback to Happy Days reruns, so I was very happy to walk in to an ambience of jukebox style 50's music. Yay! I was born in the late 70's, but who doesn't enjoy being transported to an era where we can imagine life was a little slower, a little more private and moments were meant to be embraced in the present and not social media.  Ordered the double cheeseburger - I asked for it well done and it was still juicy. After I ordered, I realized it was probably a bit too big for my appetite but I sure did eat it all - it was too juicy not to. :-) I really liked the buns they used for burger too. I'll admit, I'm not sure if it was poppy seeds on top or something else, but whatever it was, the buns were fresh, soft and tasty. Complemented the burger well. I'll find out next time what the bun is.  Who doesn't love freshly cut fires with the skin on? Salted and fried to perfection. Crunchy and soft at the same time. The regular size was a prefect portion.  Oh, this place also has a great peppermint malt shake. Yum! I can do peppermint all year long, so glad they had it well into the new year. They should have it all year - why not?   Location also has several TVs in great spots so you don't miss your favorite team while enjoying a good-old-fashioned burger, fries and malt.

reviews.author: Madeleine H.
reviews.description: I came here during the COVID-19 pandemic, when the dining room was closed. They seem a bit under-equipped to do take-out orders. I ordered a cheeseburger and hamburger patties a la carte, medium rare. After picking up my order and driving for a few minutes, I noticed the paper bag was leaking and the grease was getting all over my car. I later realized this was because they packed the hamburger patties *swimming* in pan sauce, with nothing in the foam container to keep it from dripping everywhere. I understand that medium rare meats release juices after cooking, but they should have used an air-tight container or put something in the container to absorb the juices.  To make matters worse, I called them to let them know about this issue with their to-go orders. The lady who answered was rude and disinterested in speaking with me. No apology was issued for how the order was packaged and no thank you for notifying them.  I just cannot see myself coming here again during the pandemic. The food was decent but not worth the customer service or the messy packaging.

reviews.author: Lucy G.
reviews.description: My husband and I were eating a Chester's's yesterday when an employee came in at about 530. The manager I believe her name is Rose, was very rude and very degrading to one of her  employees. Maybe she should take some customer service training and learn to talk to customers and employees. It was very embarrassed for the employee and for the Customer to listen to someone be so rude.

reviews.author: Lane B.
reviews.description: This place definitely didn't live up to what I thought. From the first sight of the menu and the website to the smells as I entered I thought it was going to be Amazing! Worst thing about this place is the staff. Very rude, didn't even welcome us, barly spoke to us, we got snipped at twice, two other people just while we were there got basically Yelled at for masks. Things that could of been handled so differently were not handled well. The burgers and onion rings were darn good but the patty size thickness is very underwhelming. Could of just been a bad day they were having who knows but I prob won't be going back.

reviews.author: Vanessa V.
reviews.description: Not bad! I've been on the hunt for a good burger lately and this one hit the spot ! I liked the traditional ordering, makes you feel like you're ordering from a small country town restaurant. The burger was pretty good, it did lack a taaaaadddd bit of flavor buuuut!!! It did hit the spot! Fries looked homemade and crispy, needed a bit of salt or spice but overall pretty good. Little sister got the kids chicken basket, it came with the same crispy homemade fries and a free kids ice cream. The chicken nuggets were little dinosaurs kinda cute but also looked store bought. Overall it was reasonably priced, I'm looking for a place that will really hit the spot and I can brag about to all my reviews about .

reviews.author: David L.
reviews.description: Group of 9 of us went there, all thought the Burgers were good, we can't say the same for the dry fries and onion rings. We all thought they were either overcooked  and not crispy and fresh.

reviews.author: Alexandria P.
reviews.description: Can here during quarantine, tablea are spaced out. Every one was wearing gloves. Place was clean. Food was delicious. So over all good experience

reviews.author: Irma I.
reviews.description: Chester's is our go to local burger joint. It was one of our first local burger places in the big city of San Antonio. Years later, it still fills my craving.   We often order double cheeseburger and split it, this way we get a "whole" burger patty w/o the additional bread. Definitely my hubby's favorite onion rings are from Chesters. Their fries are fresh cut, sometimes they can be a little soggy but its just one of the things that you get used to. Sometimes the burgers are a little greasy, but when they are perfect- they make my heart happy.   The do also have good hot dog- who would have known(?).   They have an incredible selection of bottled/canned beer, some wine (upset that they stopped selling sangria in a bottle).   You order at the counter, they call out your name and you pick up your delish food. On a beautiful day/night, they will roll up the windows. They usually have whatever game is playing that day.   They also have shakes and malts made to order.   You either love it or not, but they must be doing something right since they several locations and have been around a long time now.

reviews.author: Dale W.
reviews.description: Stopped by at 2PM today, disappointed that a takeout order of a single cheeseburger would take 45+ minutes.

reviews.author: Ari D.
reviews.description: really tasty burgers.. just bought the double burger.. very oily tho.. well cooked through as i wanted it. $8.22 just very oily will be back.. the staff is very nice

reviews.author: Angelita T.
reviews.description: I've been coming here for many years and today I was extremely disappointed with the service. While dining, we needed more drinks to finish our meal. Manager in charge told us to get in line. Well the line was long and I had an unfinished meal at the table. I enjoy my Chester's experience but I definitely won't return to this location!!

reviews.author: Henry C.
reviews.description: Over priced Didn't care for your racist sign in front of your establishment "Don't eat Chinese Eat American" McDonald's and In n Out burger far better  Chester's response states that eating Chinese food cooked in San Antonio is equivalent to "made in China". They are so stupid someone should slap your mama for giving birth to your inbreed hill billy ass

reviews.author: Charlynne A.
reviews.description: I went here with some of my coworkers during lunch, and I must say that their service was quick, efficient, and wonderful! Staff is attentive and friendly. If you are looking for a good burger place, would high suggest! I will say it - for me, the burgers here are much better tasting than Whataburger and In-n-Out. The portions of the burger is filling, delicious, and full of flavor. I would say however, because the burger is larger in size, the price is a tad bit higher. I ordered a cheeseburger, salad, and tea and it was about $15. But it was worth it!  Also, for you newcomers, this is the type of restaurant that you place your order first and seat yourself. I like the decor of the place and the authentic feel. I will definitely come here again!

reviews.author: Bill R.
reviews.description: Your diatribe does not acknowledge the following: I called at 11:00 when you just opened; I ordered 2 well done burgers and was told by "Krystal", the order would be ready on 15 minutes; and the burgers were not ready until 11:30.  If you want to leave customers hanging for 15 minutes, that is a serious flaw in your customer service. If it takes you 30 minutes to prepare burgers at 11am, when you just opened, you need to inform your customers it's a 30 minutes wait, not 15 minutes!!!  Your continued excuse for the delay is freshness is unacceptable. Man up and accept responsibility. And by the way, there are numerous other establishments that serve hot, fresh food products, and do not misrepresent the time for preparedness. I will take your advise and go elsewhere for better burgers; I value my time.

reviews.author: J ..
reviews.description: Burger was pretty good. I took my own Lysol Wipes to clean table where we sit. The cloth was dirty after I was done. They are clearly not cleaning the tables well. Oh well wipe this one off the list of places where it fells safe to go. :(

reviews.author: Dave D.
reviews.description: Wouldnt let me call an order in for take out and said I must order there and the wait is about 45 mins after I place the order.  Why not take my order over the phone instead make me wait there for 45 minutes?

reviews.author: Cynthia T.
reviews.description: Pretty good, I will admit. Convenience is the primary aspect for this spot, being just off I-10 and thus joins one of the many restaurants you can pick from for a filling meal if you work around the area.  I had a meal with a former coworker here recently and the food was delicious. My chief complaint was they didn't have a kids burger as part of their kids menu. Uhm. You have Hamburgers in the name. How can you not have some sort of Jr Burger on your menu?  Regardless, I ordered a simple cheeseburger with no onion and it tasted great. They ask how you like your beef cooked, and I think my favorite thing is the bun. It's perfectly buttered and toasted and the poppy seeds and a nice touch.  I'll keep rolling in here as potential meet up spots with buddies. You're able to have conversation in here and eat a good burger, what more can you ask for? (Well . . . a Jr Burger would be nice. . . .)

reviews.author: B H.
reviews.description: I have always been a fan of  their burgers until yesterday. I had a take out order and while I was waiting I witnessed one of the servers wiping his sweat with his wrist with a bun on his hand! I asked that he put gloves and the manager through a fit. He finally put gloves on. Needless to say because of my complaint they took 45 min to give me my order. I called Home office today and spoke with Renata. She said they are not required to wear gloves so I said I probably would not be going back, she said ok and hung up.

reviews.author: Rose D.
reviews.description: Hands down the best place for a salad!  I know wild! But the Apple Gorgonzola salad with chicken added! Amazing! The added crunch from the pecans and dried cranberries *chefs kiss*  Some special dressing comes with it too! I'm in love.   I always get a slice of cheese pizza! Can't go wrong there! Amazing  I've tried their many of appetizer and I ain't mad.   Meatballs are amazing!!   Made myself hungry for this salad talking about it!

reviews.author: Nikki A.
reviews.description: If you're looking for a homemade pizza place with a LOT of amazing beer choices, this is your place! My husband and I have come here for years.  This most recent time, we got the Margherita pizza. It wasn't my favorite pizza I've had here, but it was decent. It was done a little differently than this type of pizza I've had in the past. Instead of slices of mozzarella, it covered the entire pizza.  I do love their ranch dressing. I'm not sure if it's made in house, but it does taste like it is. Their salads are tasty every time. We always get one. And the beer selection!!! They have an amazing beer selection. Something for everyone.

reviews.author: Kristina H.
reviews.description: Let me start by saying that I've eaten here several times before and enjoyed the food every time. However, this evening, Pizza Italia missed the mark. I've never placed an order To Go until tonight. Honestly, I expected great food since my dine in experience had been good but cold pizza and burnt wings and limp veggie sticks...not okay. For having spent 60+ dollars, my whole family and I are/were disappointed.

reviews.author: Misty M.
reviews.description: They don't have basil but besides that, every time I've been here, I've been happy with the experience and I've been here several times. I've only had pizza and wings but I've never been disappointed. The service has always been good and the wait for a pizza to-go has never been 45+ minutes like other pizza places.

reviews.author: Ed V.
reviews.description: I decided to give Pizza Italia a second chance. Mistake of the day!  I have ordered from PI for a few years and was initially satisfied.   Then something went "sideways"!  Last summer we received a "blonde bottomed, cold pizza courtesy of "Hunger, no such thing as a Rush".   Looking to see if things had been fixed and a non marinara based pizza, we decided to give them another try.   70 minutes later, we received a Luke warm pizza and the insult of a receipt with an "extra" tip blank and puppy dog eyes of the driver!  I am now officially done with PI and Hunger whatever!

reviews.author: Elise W.
reviews.description: Great neighborhood pizza! I love to get the margarita pizza and then order a flight of beers. The beer menu is always changing so it's fun to try new things! My friends have mixed feelings about the crust and onions (sometimes they smell weird) but I happen to LOVE the crust and my pizza doesn't come with onions lol.   The set-up of the establishment is a little odd and the staff sometimes are just not friendly- hence the 4 stars instead of 5.

reviews.author: Morgan M.
reviews.description: I'd give it zero stars if I could.   Why is this place busy?  The pizza taste like cardboard.   Ingredients are not fresh pizza is Overcooked and bland.  I covered my slice in parm and red pepper to give it some decent flavor.   I couldn't even finish my slice.  Don't waste your time.  Plenty of other great spots in SA for pizza.   Pizza Italia is awful.

reviews.author: Matt G.
reviews.description: Lots of pizza places in SA to choose from. But in my opinion this one stands out from the rest. Not only will the do individual slices of their featured pizzas. Their pizza is amazing. Crust is just right. The sauce stands apart from other sauces at other pizza places. Nice appetizer options and they are super friendly and humble group of people. Thanks pizza italia. If you havent been. Go give them a visit and support them.

reviews.author: James G.
reviews.description: Regular ole run of the mill pizza nothing special it's busying Monday when they have their spec

reviews.author: Megan J.
reviews.description: The wings here are fantastic. The staff are always really friendly and nice. The pizza comes by the slice which lets me try all the new flavors. Also the beer selection is HUGE. Give it a try and enjoy some pizza and wings! :)

reviews.author: Steve T.
reviews.description: This is undoubtedly the worst pizza I have received fro Pizza Italia! It is burnt from the bottom of the crust to the top of the toppings. When speaking to the manager on the condition of said pizza, their reply is "well you accepted it, so there is nothing I can do". I have ordered pizza from Pizza Italia for more than 5 years and never been treated like this nor had this bad of pizza. Proves that the bigger you get the quality goes to s**t. We will be happy to take our business elsewhere. At over $25 plus tip per pizza you would think that quality control would be part of the service. Guess I was mistaken.

reviews.author: Brayden H.
reviews.description: I've been going to Pizza Italia since I was a kid and the quality of the food and the service is amazing. Thanks Larry for always taking great care of our family! Hands down the best pizza place in town.

reviews.author: Kenneth G.
reviews.description: Jerry always make the eating experience exceptional. Highly recommend this restaurant. Oops forgot to take a pic of our meal, but it was to good to wait

reviews.author: Anthony F.
reviews.description: AVOID at all cost! Sub par pizza, disgusting and cold mozzarella sticks and even worse wings.  To top it off the back staff is the slowest I have seen at a pizza place. Over an hour and a half wait to get food. I have no idea how this place stays in business.

reviews.author: Lillian D.
reviews.description: First time having Pizza Italia.  Won't be the last. Ordered 2 strombolis.  Nothing skimpy about them.  Generously filled, perfectly baked, and large side of sauce.  The marinara sauce is absolutely devine.  The 2 of us almost couldn't finish ONE.  Fine by us lol...now have dinner for tomorrow.

reviews.author: Ryan M.
reviews.description: Excellent customer service. Very good I ordered a beer n got it for 5 sec It was really good and I'm coming back

reviews.author: R St John P.
reviews.description: The one star is simply due to their absolutely atrocious customer service and their severe attitude problem. I've eaten here about 8 times. Three of those were pick up and I have no complaints about that whatsoever since I wasn't eating at the location the food is always good (not outstanding) but in the five occasions that I eat at the restaurant itself, no matter who was attending to us or who was ringing us up, they always seem to give is the worst attitude. It's not specific to one person it's simply everybody there. The vibe is not beneficial to sustaining regular repeat biz.

reviews.author: Lauren H.
reviews.description: This place has ALWAYS been our go too! The spinach salad and Hawaiian pizza are, are all time faves! But the last 2 orders we've gotten were awful! The Pizza's we ordered were burnt, the salad was half ass and they left out all dressing, even those we paid for!! Unfortunately we won't be coming back or recommending anymore. :(

reviews.author: Mary B.
reviews.description: Normally my absolute favorite pizza place. I took my daughter there this evening and it wasn't busy at all. We placed our order and sat ourselves. I received my meal - a salad.  A table with 3 guys who arrived after us received their food... my daughter's 2 slices of cheese pizza took another 43 minutes and that's after I got up and asked what the delay was.  Since when is it OK to serve one person in a party and not the other?  The salad WAS my meal and we both sat there staring at it for 43 minutes waiting for hers. Not a happy customer today.

reviews.author: Jorge G.
reviews.description: Food WAS great, until one day it wasn't. Then their customer service really showed.  We had people visiting and we raved about the awesome pizza shop down the street (Pizza Italia). We order 30 wings, a large pizza and a drink. We go get it, get home and give the kids their pizza and then we sit down to enjoy their awesome wings... Look at the picture and see what we saw.  I called them and they proceeded to act like assholes saying the wings were right. We gathered up all the food, pizza and drink included and went down to the pizza shop. They then argue the wings are perfectly fine. I press them for a bit then they admit the wings were different then they have always been due to an issue with the supply order.  I tell them I understand that but it'd be nice to know up front maybe? They say yeah maybe, but you already ate some of the pizza and drank some of the soda so we're only refunding you the wings... even though they're good, "I mean, did you even try them", they said. I ordered extra wet buffalo hot and lemon pepper and they were all exactly the same. No sauce, no seasoning. Look at the picture.  So they ruin your dinner, give you a good ol' bait and switch, argue with you about it even though they know the wings aren't the same as always, then they decide what to refund or not. Very interesting approach to business.  Look at the picture and judge for yourself. Not even wingstop serves wings like that.

reviews.author: Daniel E.
reviews.description: Oh my God our experience at Chili's was phenomenal. Our waiter was the best I've ever experienced and I go to the most expensive restaurants I know of in the area. I consider myself a food connoisseur and honestly the waitress, Jennifer, made "Me feel God in that Chili's tonight!"

reviews.author: Doretta W.
reviews.description: Where do I start. Started with the appetizer and went no further. Tried the triple bites with onion petals, southwest egg rolls and original chicken crispers.   The onion petals were burnt.  The southwest eggs were filled with only beans.  The chicken crispers used to be large chunks of chicken tenders ... these were sliced and pounded, barely breaded, and soggy from oil.  This was a very bad experience.

reviews.author: Megan J.
reviews.description: Not a great experience. It was my daughters birthday and Chilis is her favorite restaurant. We went to see Santa at the mall and this was a close convenient location for the chain. We were set right away, but then didn't get greeted for about 10 minutes. Our waitress was nice but pretty aloof. She got our drink order (and chips and salsa) then vanished. We watched our frozen drinks melt at the bar. Finally I just got up myself and asked the bartender if they were ours (they were) and served them to us myself. The fajitas I ordered were sizzling, but way over cooked. My husbands sandwich had frozen turkey. My daughters sliders were good. Not the service we are used to at the forum location so we will not return here again.

reviews.author: Jocelyn F.
reviews.description: Definitely the service is ok , the food is good just poor quality of service. I sometimes like coming here on occasion but the service has gone down.

reviews.author: Gus M.
reviews.description: Chili's is a good Nieghbor place come chill have some beers and cocktails. The weeknight bartender is the bomb the servers in bar area are great . Ron is the man!

reviews.author: Jay R.
reviews.description: DISAPPOINTED!! ordered a burger on the app to go. Get home, bite into the burger and it's completely burned!! That's for a horrible experience

reviews.author: S J.
reviews.description: Placed my order online at 7:20P for curbside pick up. I was notified that my order will be ready at 7:42-7:47P. I checked in at 7:38P via the link provided in my email. At 7:43P I called them just to make sure they were aware I was there and was told that my order will be out in 5 mins. It's now 8:15P (almost an hour after placing my order) and still no food. I will not come back here for mediocre food and SERVICE is not worth it

reviews.author: Nancy E.
reviews.description: We arrived to this location and it started off horrible. The restaurant is FILTHY! There were Dead cockroaches in the waiting area and it was just over all horrible. Won't be going back.

reviews.author: Erica O.
reviews.description: 09/11/20 ordered my family dinner from Chili's online a kids chicken strip meal, rib dinner, and a burger with a side salad. Side salad was missing, the burger was RAW! We called and spoke to a manager and they were very apologetic and said they would credit us for the burger and side salad. Fast forward to today 10/09/20 called in the order and explained what happened 09/11/20, the employee over the phone stated Chili's will not honor this! We don't give away free food. Free food? We are not asking for free food! I wasnt even able to eat the meal purchased on 9/11/20. The employee said there is nothing he will do about it. When asked to speak to a manager, he stated he was the manager. How unprofessional and rude! This location has lost our business, I DO NOT and WILL NOt recommend eating at this location!

reviews.author: M F.
reviews.description: I cannot say enough GREAT things about my lunch today.  Great lunch prices and fantastic food.  The margarita grilled chicken with black beans and rice was AMAZING! Our server was so nice and great!  A must place to go for fantastic food and fantastic lunch prices/meals.  WTG CHILI'S!!!!

reviews.author: Tabitha C.
reviews.description: Visited for lunch with some coworkers! We received amazing customer service from the time we walked in to the time we walked out.   I ordered the lunch chicken fajitas, and they tasted really good! I look forward to eating here again.

reviews.author: Robert V.
reviews.description: Sad hostess is rude and no knowledge of being in the customer service business. Restaurant is empty but there is a 45 minute wait for empty tables. This is probably the worse chili's in San Antonio.

reviews.author: Lisa M.
reviews.description: Food was good.  Service was bad. I left my phone at home and the other two in my party were Senior Citizens so we asked for hard copies of the menu.  Our second waitress brought us one menu and said the manager said we could only have one per table.  The menu was in Spanish and when we told the waitress, she said it just looked that way!!! We told her to get us a different one anyway. So we got a third waiter instead. He greeted us and was ready to take our order.  We said we need menus.  He brought us ONE and said the manager said only one per table. After we had to ask for utensils, the rest of the meal went fine. The manager came out and listened to our complaints and said the one menu per table was from higher up.  I've had other issues with the service at this location and I don't think I will return. Even if I liked the food, this disregard for those without technology abilities left a bad taste in my mouth.

reviews.author: Cat H.
reviews.description: Congealed blue cheese dip, and half full soup. This location is TERRIBLE! I'd give -2 stars if I could. Had food delivered via DoorDash and it was just gross when it arrived. Definitely never ordering from this location again!

reviews.author: Paul P.
reviews.description: The employees were all so nice and welcoming.    But the food is terrrrrible.  OMG  The commercials make the fajitas look so delicious but the reality is something else.   My chicken fajitas didn't taste "grilled," they were just a sloppy mound of wet chicken flesh. The corn tortillas were torn. The taste was terrible, didn't even finish the food.

reviews.author: Chris G.
reviews.description: Twice now my wife and I have called this Chili's off 410 at Broadway on the near north side of San Antonio as we are getting off the freeway.  We ask what the wait is for a party of two and are told there is no wait.  We turn under the Loop and pull into their parking lot.  We enter the restaurant where we then find out it's a thirty minute wait.  What the !?  I don't believe in the less than two minutes it takes us to reach them they filled up that fast.  I guess they just say whatever to get you in thinking you'll stay and wait.  Hey, I like Chili's but we are not returning.  For options try the newly reopened Mama's - where we went tonight - which is nearby or the even closer La Fonda.  Nuts!  I'm not going to play their games.

reviews.author: Patricia L.
reviews.description: Chili's is gonna be Chili's no matter where you go. The only different may be the service. This Chili's is one of their more consistent places and I can appreciate that. The service was good, we were seated quickly and our server was very attentive.   My vegetarian self loves to order the guacamole burger with a black bean patty. I really adore this burger. The only thing that messes it up is when they over cook the patty. It's kind of like a coin toss of if it's cooked right or not but most times I'd bet that it's cooked right. For my one side I will order a side a broccoli when I'm feeling health conscious but I do get fries from time to time and they are great as well.   With this meal I ordered dessert and OHHHHH MY GOSH I was super happy I did!! I got the salted caramel molten cake and this is some last meal type ish! Like if I had to plan a last meal the salted caramel molten cake would be the dessert.  It was amazing and worth every calorie and the extra running time I put in for it.

reviews.author: Chenita H.
reviews.description: Customer service wasn't the best. We were seated at a dirty table. I had to ask for straws multiple times. Received appetizers with no plates. Waiter not attentive at all. This place could really use training as far as service goes.

reviews.author: Kymberly M.
reviews.description: Chili's you all sold us raw sliders never ordering from you again and I do have pictures

reviews.author: Gabby D.
reviews.description: We got to sit right away which was okay but it's Monday night and barley anyone was there and no one waited on us for 20 minutes. Very sad cause this was my favorite chili's but lately their service has been declining :(

name: Spec's Wines, Spirits and Finer Foods

reviews.author: Stacy E.
reviews.description: First time I see the clearance right at the front! Always have to ask major liquor stores where it is at. So props. Props also to the samples everywhere of beer and tequila makes looking for booze that much easier.  This place has an epic deli as well and they sell fresh pickles which is always legit. The beer section was small in comparison to other specs but they make up for it with the deli.   Things I would do: promote the October beers in a certain section. Had to go looking for them and that took some work, other than that great place!

reviews.author: Brent L.
reviews.description: Have you ever been the one tasked with bringing wine to a dinner party, even though you don't know jack about wine?  Well if you have (or if you ever are), this is the place for you.  I was told to bring a "moscato," but when I arrived at Spec's, I realized there were half a dozen types of it.  d'Asti, pink, black, dessert, bubbly, etc.  I was like WTH do I do? Fortunately, Spec's has plenty of wine experts on staff and they bailed me out.  Then, my next question was "should it be served chilled or at room temp?"  They said "it depends."  I decided on chilled, and they directed me to this barrel full of water that magically chills the bottle in seven minutes.  It's pure witchcraft folks, but it's free, so check it out.  I'm still in total awe of this magical barrel full of water.  P.S. don't forget that this Spec's location has a deli in the back that's good for lunch.  See my previous review for a few details.  The food is really good.  Why four stars instead of five?  Because they charge a penalty for using credit cards.  They try to convince you that it's a "discount" if you pay with cash, debit, or check, but I see it more as a penalty.

reviews.author: Kathy H.
reviews.description: A unique Texas liquor store. Good for somethings and nah on others. Nice craft beer assortment, wine has lots to choose from, Whiskey/bourbon unique items, cordials good selection, rum is ok and lots to choose from in vodka category.  Tequila assortment is hodgepodge and not to great.  They have a great deli to visit in the back.  The thorn that bugs me is they ask if you want a bag for your purchase. Really? It a tad tacky if you ask me. My previous visit started this little irritation as I purchased a very expensive whiskey for my husband and was asked this question. On this visit as I was checking out I mentioned this past experience. Right after told the cashier what happened and paid for my purchase...what did he ask me? (Yup!) Did I want a bag? I straight up asked him why they ask. His answer was "we don't really want to give them out if we don't have to."  Really? Ok if it's a recycle thing then take the route of encouraging people to bring their own bag like Sprouts. If it's a being cheap thing then find another way to save a buck - your bag with the Spec's name and logo  is important advertising that walks out the door with every customer that spends their money in the store. It's a missed advertising opportunity if I don't walk out with a bag.  My suggestion is to stop having your cashiers ask people this question.

reviews.author: Nanda K.
reviews.description: We made a trip to this place yesterday. I have been here a few times. Alfredo helped us out through out our visit. He helped us in selecting various kinds of liquors and explaining the difference. He took his time to go through everything we needed. Actually their was one other gentlemen who helped us in the wine section as well, I don't remember his man though. Please, start stocking the Rumquila. Specs on the stone oak area has it and it too far for me to drive all the way over there to grab it.

reviews.author: Erica G.
reviews.description: Everyone here is so nice and helpful. I was asked twice by employees if they could recommend anything or if I had any questions. I've had recommendations from an employee before and it's very helpful..especially when you're so indecisive like myself.

reviews.author: Andrea A.
reviews.description: I went in Wednesday night after work to get margarita ingredients. I'm embarrassed to admit that I'm 10+ years over the legal drinking age and I just got around to trying a margarita. As such, I'm a total novice and didn't know what to get. I hastily Google searched "best tequila for margaritas" and was hit with a million results. Thankfully, I found a super helpful employee to assist rather than Google. I wish I would have gotten his name but he was a middle aged gentlemen with short graying hair and he was so kind and thoughtful as I bumbled my way through the store. He didn't make me feel stupid for my lack of knowledge when it comes to alcohol and was just really non-judgmental and had such a calm vibe. I can't even begin tell you how much I appreciated his suggestions. And he was spot on because the margaritas I've been making at home are delicious! I will definitely go here again when I need more.

reviews.author: Shawn W.
reviews.description: Anything that you need to make any type of alcoholic concoction can be found here.  Any liquor you are looking to find it is here.......but wait there is more.  In this Specs there is a small deli in the back offering various sandwiches.  Not only do they have a generous selection of sandwiches they also have those back there which will help you choose perfect pairing to go with their adult libations.  These suggestions range from various cheeses to meats.  If you are the cigar smoker, there is a large selection of cigars inside to choose from.  There are various Specs in the San Antonio but thus far this one seems to be one of the larger ones offering a greater selection.  Any bar supplies you are looking for can be found here.  If you are like me, you will walk around the store to see the myriad of drinks they have.  I actually found some various flavors of soju and managed to find a bottle of Brazilian rum (cachaÃ§a).  The prices are good and they offer a military discount.  There is also a rewards program.  I know what you are thinking.  If you in there that much that you need a reward card, then you (fill in your judging thoughts). A good place to get lost and find your favorite drink at very reasonable prices.

reviews.author: Joey P.
reviews.description: WOW, this place is great!  Just got my Spec's card today :D I can't wait to start using the crap out of it this weekend!  Up to this point I have always been pretty loyal to Gabriel's, and no disrespect but this place is way cooler!  The deli foods look really good, I was wondering why we didn't come here for lunch instead!  The alcohol prices look great, I always try to compare prices at each liquor store that I visit.  Just like the Gabriel's on 1604, Spec's has two separate prices, one being lower than the other, and all you need is your Spec's card for the additional discount, which is absolutely free to sign up for.  The lady who signed me up also told me that they have special promotions for card holders as well.  I loved the truffles; love the variety of gift-sets; love that they have a HUGE selection of beer, wine, spirits, and ales; love that they've got coffee beans for sale a-la-carte style; love the friendliness of all of the staff members.  LOVE this place!  Highly recommended to anyone, even if you are not a drinker, you are guaranteed to find something you like.

reviews.author: Caitlyn S.
reviews.description: This place is HUGE! It has everything you could ever want or need (at least as far as alcohol goes).   There are so many craft beers here, and I've seen most of the local beers here as well. The prices are great, and even better if you use cash or debit. They offer a rewards program, and they also have wine tastings one Wednesday a month. The tastings offer small bites from the deli, and it's all FREE!  Spec's also has coffee beans - a large selection - and many of them are quite great. Beware though, they are not self service, so it can take some time to get them.   I haven't tried any of the food (except for the small tasting at the wine event), but it always looks good!

reviews.author: Danny G.
reviews.description: Ive been to other specs and this location employees doesnt seem like their happy at all.

reviews.author: Catherine T.
reviews.description: Gathered items on shopping list for holidays and birthdays at this location. Friendly service no complaints!

reviews.author: Stephanie N.
reviews.description: First time here! Love their variety of Japanese whiskey :) And i saved 5% paying with CASH!!

reviews.author: Tandy G.
reviews.description: Spec's is one of my favorite go-to lunch places during the work week. The cheese alone makes it worth the trip. Pricing and portions are adequate. The jalapeÃ±o cheese bread is a must. You must pay up front before you can get the food at the deli, but that gives you time to browse the candy selection up front.   Downsides can be they change up the menu, not all items are available consistently. As of June 2017, Peppered BLT is gone. :/  Oh well, maybe I'll find something new.

reviews.author: Daniel C.
reviews.description: The Northside has been the happening spot as of late. With the addition of The Big Hops Growler on Huebner Road, the influence of the craft brews, wines and spirits on our lives is growing more intense and popular with each day. And while the HEB on DeZavala Road has a pretty decent array of beers and wines to quench the most discerning palate, SPEC'S is the way to go.       This SPEC'S location always reminds me of the one I went to in Austin. It has a pretty diverse selection of beers, wines and spirits alongside elegantly displayed chocolates and cheeses. Unlike the one at Rector, this one is more vast. The lanes open with shelves and shelves of products. There are fancy tequilas, Hennessey, whiskeys, rums etc. with prices to match. They have the customary two buck chuck. Or you can splurge on a high end vodka meant for that special office party to impress your boss and coworkers.   Throughout the store each section is manned by workers who specialize in that particular department.  I'm a beer person myself, so I tend to gravitate toward that location of the store. They have a quite impressive selection of craft beers veering towards Texas, foreign, regional, national and hard to find stuff. On hand they have Trappist Ales, Barleywine, Stouts, IPA's by breweries like Rogue, Southern -Tier, Karbach, Ranger Creek, Mikkeller, Stone, Prairie etc. It is quite a stellar selection of kind brews.    The service is good here and the employees are knowledgeable. And of course you get a deal when you pay with cash or debit. Which is pretty cool right about now. While I do like this place, the sheer volume of items is worth the drive, I do like the one on Rector. It has a more personable touch than this one. Sometimes I have noticed at this location it can suffer from that whole frat boy vibe ala UTSA (I'm not hating, I myself graduated from there!) and they can clog up the aisles. Still when I look and see the selection the other patrons are deliberating on, I have come to the realization that we are all here on the same mission: to find good drink at good prices.   I like SPEC'S, particularly this location. Good products, good service and good prices for all. Total Wine and More. Gabriel's Superstore. Pig Liquors. Many locations of SPEC'S and more to come. Our city is no longer the Heavy Metal Capital of Texas, but now more readily and quickly being recognized as the drinking capital as well...\m/

reviews.author: Jhosselin A.
reviews.description: I went to Spec's with my wife yesterday. We went to look for some of texas finest wine. Luckily we found it. On our way to the check out an employee tries flirting with my wife and gets in front of her and she's trying to walk around him and he tries to talk to her. I'm behind her watching this unfold. I look at him and I ask him "what are you doing?" My wife is already uncomfortable. He responds with "I'm just messing with her" his professionalism was no where to be found. And his action was completely unappreciated

reviews.author: Krista L.
reviews.description: Great prices! Great selection! Knowledgeable staff! Save 5% off all purchases when you pay with cash, debit, or check. Get a Spec's savings card (just a rewards card, not a credit thing) and save on items that are on sale!  Tastings of select wine and liquor usually every Friday's and Saturday's.    Downside I've noticed about this location...not real great about maintaining their shelves appearance. Maybe they are understaffed? I don't know but last night I saw 2 guys working in liquor area but the shelves were a mess!! Nobody fronting or filling empty spots on the shelves. Nobody available to help customers in beer section and Lots of people wandering that area. However, right before leaving beer section with our selection, we noticed someone inside the beer cooler. He was working hard to stock the empty spots in the cooler windows!! So, GOOD FOR YOU, DUDE, FOR TAKING CARE OF BUSINESS!!  Just wish someone else was outside the cooler helping customers, but at least YOU were doing what you were supposed to do!!  Spec's management, you need to work on having your shelves maintained and fully staffed to help customers!

reviews.author: Austin F.
reviews.description: Cashier Marisa needs a attitude adjustment. Won't ever shop here again, total wine has better prices and friendlier staff.

reviews.author: Amy R.
reviews.description: SPECS, I LOVE YOU.  I have to admit, I have never stepped a foot inside of Spec's. I've heard fantastic things from friends and co-workers about the one over in The Forum so when I saw one was being built by my house, I was pretty excited to be one of those people who bragged about how awesome Specs is! ;)  My first trip here was actually before it even opened. The sign was up, there were minimal cars out front so I wasn't actually sure if it was open or closed. When I walked up to the door, the guy said they were having a soft opening and they actually didn't have any alcohol yet, just food. I passed on going in because I originally wanted a bottle of wine and didn't want to buy anything unnecessary, didn't realize at that time that they have SO MUCH MORE then just alcohol.  When I went back, I probably spent about an hour just browsing the different aisles and all the fine foods they had in the back. It was pretty shocking to me! I'm from England and it's pretty hard to find British food, especially at British restaurants (which there's only one or two in San Antonio anyways) and most of the time, the price is marked up ridiculously. Specs had an awesome selection of foreign foods, including chocolates and frozen meals. It was just fantastic.   Employees are so helpful. I was just here yesterday trying to pick out a Riesling and the man helping me was asking a bunch of different questions about what I'm looking for, he picked out a really yummy one, gave me two different options, a $20 or $10 so wasn't just trying to get me to pay an arm and a leg for a bottle of wine, which made me happy.  Also, if you have kiddos - they have a shopping cart with a miniature car attached in the front, total bonus and another reason why I love Specs. Keeps my 2 year old happy while I browse for wine!! ;) One of my favorite places in SA and would advise anyone to check it out.

reviews.author: Jai C.
reviews.description: I'm perhaps the only non-drinker who loves to shop at Spec's.  Go friggin' figure.  Alright, so I'm not a total non-drinker; however, I did notice that the past couple of times I've been here I bought Sprecher's cherry coke and bar nuts.  Seriously????    Even the cashier asked me right before she started checking me out, "Do you know about our rewards card?"   Me: "No.  I didn't know you had one."   Nice cashier lady: "Yeah.  It's actually pretty good."   Pause.  **Looks over my purchases** Pause.  **Still scans**  Pause.  **One final look-through**  Nice cashier lady: "So uhm.... yeah, you don't have any items here that are eligible for discounts SOOooooooo...  yeah, we have one."    **Quickly checks me out of her line**

reviews.author: Mark H.
reviews.description: It is time to start to enjoy your visits to the wine, spirits, and finer foods store.  Spec's has now arrived inside of the 1604 loop and not a day too soon.    If you are persnickety about, well, your wine, spirits, and finer foods, then you're in luck.  Not only does Spec's offer an expansive variety in each of these categories, the staff is incredibly helpful.  And knowledgeable.    Fitting that they opened on the 4th of July.  We are freed from the other San Antonio standards and now have some variety.  During today's impromptu and unanticipated visit, I was asked very politely by no less than two staff whether I needed any help.  I was pleasantly surprised that the service was consistent with the excellent help I have received at other Spec's and they had only been open for four hours!  Now that is something to toast to!  Salud!
